title: Did Trump Tweet 'My Blood IS the Vaccine'?
subtitle: There's a tweet for everything, especially when you include the fake ones.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump posted a message on Twitter that read, "My blood IS the vaccine."

title: Did Lincoln Refuse to Fill a Supreme Court Vacancy Before an Election?
subtitle: Lincoln was not above using the enticement of a Supreme Court seat to encourage campaigning on his behalf.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Abraham Lincoln declined to make a Supreme Court nomination just before the 1864 election because he felt the "American people deserve to make the decision."

title: Did Trump Say Doctors Had 'Never Seen a Body Kill Coronavirus Like My Body'?
subtitle: President Trump did say that he felt great after leaving Walter Reed Military Medical Center- but not this great.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said: "The doctors said they've never seen a body kill the Coronavirus like my body. They tested my DNA and it wasn't DNA. It was USA."

title: Did Biden Call Trump Supporters the 'Dregs of Society'?
subtitle: The Trump campaign seemed keen to recreate Hillary Clinton's infamous "deplorables" moment, but what did Biden actually say?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a September 2018 speech, Joe Biden called Donald Trump's supporters "the dregs of society."

title: No, Kamala Harris Didn't Tweet, 'We Need to Focus on Defunding the Police'
subtitle: The tweet boosted a false claim about the 2020 Democratic vice presidential nominee.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democratic 2020 vice presidential candidate Kamala Harris tweeted, "We need to focus on defunding the police rather than supporting them."

title: Does Trump Weigh 322 Pounds?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump's weight and general health were a concern after he tested positive for COVID-19 in the fall of 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Medical records released after U.S. President Donald Trump tested positive for COVID-19 showed that he weighed 322 pounds.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Donate $700,000 to the Campaign of FBI Director's Wife?
subtitle: Andrew McCabe did not have any oversight of the investigation into Secretary Clinton's email server while his wife was running for political office.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton illegally donated $700,000 to the political campaign of the wife of the FBI director who was supervising the investigation into her use of a private email server.

title: Was Trump Carrying a Concealed Oxygen Concentrator When He Boarded Marine One?
subtitle: The timeline of Trump's diagnosis and treatment for COVID-19 as provided by officials has been inconsistent, giving rise to conspiracy theories.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was carrying a concealed oxygen cylinder or concentrator when he boarded Marine One for a trip to Walter Reed Medical Center after testing positive for COVID-19.

title: Is This 'Avoiding the Future Plague' Video a Real PSA From the 1950s?
subtitle: This public service announcement doesn't provide much of a public service.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a genuine public service announcement from 1956 about how people can avoid a future plague.

title: Did Trump Campaign Use COVID Diagnosis to Fundraise $421 Million?
subtitle: The requested dollar amount is a little suspicious.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Trump campaign sent out a fundraiser email asking supporters to raise $421 million to help the president recover from COVID-19.

title: Is Amy Coney Barrett a Rhodes Scholar?
subtitle: A "Rhodes Scholar" is someone who received a prestigious scholarship, not someone who attended Rhodes College.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Judge Amy Coney Barrett is a Rhodes Scholar.

title: Did McConnell Refuse To Participate in Debate With Female Moderators?
subtitle: The Senate majority leader and his Democratic challenger Amy McGrath have sparred over details of debates in Kentucky's 2020 Senate race.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. Sen. Mitch McConnell said he would not participate in 2020 election debates that include female moderators.

title: No, Biden Didn't Wear a 'Wire' or 'Smart' Contact Lenses During 1st Debate
subtitle: Conspiracy theories about high-tech devices rocketed across social media after the first presidential debate of 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democratic 2020 presidential candidate Joe Biden wore a "wire" and high-tech contact lenses that allowed him to receive talking points from an unseen third party during the first presidential debate.

title: Has Biden Failed to Condemn Antifa?
subtitle: "The problem is on the Left. And Biden refuses to talk about it," President Trump claimed in September 2020. Was he right?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of Sept. 29, 2020, Joe Biden had not condemned antifa.

title: Did 'Portland Sheriff' Endorse Trump?
subtitle: The Multnomah County sheriff tweeted his own fact check of this claim during the September 2020 presidential debate.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The "sheriff of Portland" on Sept. 29, 2020, stated, "I support President Trump."

title: Does Joe Biden Support 'Defunding' Police?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump has made the claim about his political opponent on numerous occasions.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden supports "defunding" police agencies.

title: Does This Video Show a Drone Delivering Instant Noodles?
subtitle: Drone technology and its possibilities are no longer strange - but are the robots taking delivery orders yet?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video clip shows a drone delivering a box of instant noodles to a household, then collecting a debit card payment before flying off.

title: Did Jared Kushner Delete Tweets After News Surfaced About Trump's Taxes?
subtitle: It's decidedly difficult to remove something that never existed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: White House senior adviser Jared Kushner deleted all of his tweets in the wake of a New York Times report on U.S. President Donald Trump's income taxes.

title: Is Kentucky AG Daniel Cameron Married to Mitch McConnell's Granddaughter?
subtitle: Cameron and McConnell are both prominent politicians in Kentucky and have previously worked together.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kentucky Attorney General Daniel Cameron is married to U.S. Sen. Mitch McConnell's granddaughter.

title: Did Joe Biden 'Botch' the Pledge of Allegiance?
subtitle: The U. S. Democratic presidential nominee quoted part of the pledge during a campaign speech in September 2020.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joe Biden 'botched' his recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance during a September 2020 campaign speech.

title: Did Dr. Fauci Criticize Trump's China Travel Restrictions?
subtitle: The president was initially skeptical of imposing travel restrictions, though he would later claim that everyone around him had been against the idea.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: NIAID Director Dr. Anthony Fauci criticized the Trump administration's decision to impose travel restrictions on China to stem the spread of COVID-19.

title: Is US COVID-19 Case Total Highest Globally Due to 'Great Testing'?
subtitle: If the virus was not spreading, the rate of positive COVID-19 test results would not increase. But, unfortunately, the rate did increase.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The reason the U.S. documented the most COVID-19 cases in the world in 2020 was because it had tested more residents at a faster rate than any other country.

title: Was Biden Caught Using a Teleprompter During an Interview?
subtitle: An out-of-context video clip was widely circulated on social media, along with false claims about the Democratic presidential candidate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden was "caught red-handed" using a teleprompter during an interview with Telemundo.

title: Did Trump Say Mexicans Call Him a 'Peachy Cool Arrow'?
subtitle: This joke does not stem from an actual quotation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said Mexicans love him, and refer to him as a "peachy cool arrow."

title: Did Kamala Harris Prosecute Journalists Who Exposed Planned Parenthood?
subtitle: Two people associated with the Center for Medical Progress entered several meetings with Planned Parenthood and the National Abortion Federation under the false company name Biomax.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Kamala Harris declined to prosecute Planned Parenthood for selling aborted baby parts, but prosecuted the journalists who exposed that crime.

title: Did Trump Win Michigan's 'Man of the Year' Award?
subtitle: A mysterious award has been mentioned in numerous speeches by the president since 2016.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was honored with a Man of the Year award at an event in Michigan five or six years before he
for president.

title: Did Fire Caused by Gender Reveal Party Damage More Property Than 2020 Protests?
subtitle: The viral claim seemed to be an attempt to counter U.S. President Donald Trump's framing of Black Lives Matter protests.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In 2020, a California wildfire caused by a pyrotechnic device at a baby's gender reveal party caused more property damage than all U.S. Black Lives Matter protests that year combined.

title: Did Joe Biden Wave to an Empty Field?
subtitle: Fox News host Sean Hannity helped spread this rumor to millions of viewers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden waving to an empty field after exiting a plane in Tampa, Florida.

title: Did McDonald's Remove American Flags Nationwide?
subtitle: Repeating a lie ad nauseam does not make it any more true.
author: Dan Evon
statement: McDonald's removed American flags from its restaurants nationwide in order to support antifa and the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Did Netflix CEO 'Kim Martin Morrow' Get Arrested for Child Pornography?
subtitle: Another day, another step further away from reality.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix CEO Kim Martin Morrow was arrested on child pornography charges.

title: Was CBS 'Caught' Passing Off 'Latinos for Trump' as Biden Supporters?
subtitle: Beware of still images taken from television news reports.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2020, CBS Evening News dishonestly presented a group of "Latinos for Trump" as Biden supporters.

title: Do North American Wildfires Stop at National Borders?
subtitle: This question has a simple answer.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: While the western U.S. was plagued by wildfires in September 2020, maps showed western Canada was experiencing no such fires.

title: Is the Age of Consent Being Lowered to 4?
subtitle: The age of consent in the U.S. varies by state, ranging between 16 and 18. No one seriously wants to lower that to age 4.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An effort is underway to lower the minimum age of consent for sexual activity to age 4.

title: Was the Netflix CEO Arrested on Child Pornography Charges?
subtitle: False rumors were spread on social media in order to capitalize on heightened panic about pedophilia.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings was arrested on suspicion of possessing child pornography.

title: Did Kroger Tell Employees They Can Wear BLM Masks, But Not Flag Masks?
subtitle: Adding a color background to a baseless statement doesn't make it any more factual.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kroger banned its employees from wearing American flag masks, but allowed them to wear BLM masks.

title: Did Dozens of Countries Order COVID-19 Tests in 2018?
subtitle: A friendly reminder that COVID-19 is named so, in part, because the disease was first observed in humans in 2019.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Data displayed on the World Bank's World Integrated Trade Solution (WITS) website in September 2020 proved that dozens of nations imported or exported items labeled "COVID-19 Test Kits" in 2018 - more than a year before the pandemic occurred and before COVID-19 even had a name.

title: Is 'Antifa' Setting Wildfires in Oregon?
subtitle: Law enforcement pleaded with social media users to stop spreading such hoaxes.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: "Antifa" arsonists have been setting wildfires raging on the West Coast in September 2020.

title: Did Biden Tweet 'Fewer Black People' in Kenosha Resulted in Less Looting?
subtitle: Creating a fake tweet is surprisingly easy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden tweeted that there was less looting in Kenosha, Wisconsin, because the area had "fewer Black people."

title: Did a 'Trump Train' Truck Get Stuck Under a Bridge?
subtitle: The truth was even stranger than the fiction.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a truck bearing the words "Trump Train" stuck underneath a bridge.

title: Is This a Real Backdrop of a Boris Johnson Interview?
subtitle: Letters arranged on a school wall appeared to insult the U.K. prime minister during a televised appearance in August 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: The backdrop to an interview with U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson in August 2020 showed a "Periodic Table of Maths," the letters of which were arranged to spell out

title: Did Trump Call US Sen. Duckworth 'Lieutenant No Legs'?
subtitle: Credible reports that Trump called fallen soldiers "losers" and "suckers" were followed by incredible reports that he called a senator and veteran "Lieutenant Nolegs."
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump called U.S. Sen. Tammy Duckworth "Lieutenant No Legs" on social media in 2018.

title: Did the Trump Boat Parade Result in This Sunken Ship Photo?
subtitle: Several boats did sink during a parade for U.S. President Donald Trump in September 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a boat that sank during a parade for U.S. President Donald Trump in September 2020.

title: Did Jacob Blake's Ex-Girlfriend's Aunt Denounce Him on Twitter?
subtitle: The Twitter account @lifeisasoph briefly trended in August 2020, before it was suspended.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The person behind the Twitter account @lifeisasoph was the aunt of Jacob Blake's ex-girlfriend.

title: Did an Antifa Flyer Tell 'Comrades' To Pose as Trump Supporters and Riot After Election Day?
subtitle: These supposed plans appear to have been circulating online for years.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A flyer created by antifa called on

to disguise themselves as supporters of U.S. President Donald Trump and riot on Nov. 4, 2020, a day after U.S. elections, so that the media and the police would blame Trump supporters for the violence.

title: Did Nick Saban Endorse Joe Biden?
subtitle: As far as we can tell, the University of Alabama football coach has not officially endorsed either candidate for U.S. president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Democratic U.S. presidential nominee Joe Biden touted University of Alabama football coach Nick Saban's endorsement on Facebook.

title: Did CDC 'Quietly Update' COVID-19 Deaths To Say Only 6% Are Legitimate?
subtitle: A rumor downplaying the seriousness of the deadly virus was promoted by a group of people that included U.S. President Donald Trump
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The CDC "quietly updated" its COVID-19 mortality statistics in summer 2020 to show only 6% of previously reported deaths were actually due to the coronavirus, while the remaining 94% died from preexisting health conditions.

title: Did Soros Decide That Harris Should be Biden's Vice President?
subtitle: Repeating a lie ad nauseam does not make it any more true.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Alexander Soros said he made the ultimate decision to pick U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris, D-Calif., as 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's running mate.

title: Did Sen. Collins Say This About Trump?
subtitle: We found no evidence that anyone made the statement, let alone U.S. Sen. Susan Collins.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Sen. Susan Collins said, "Yes, I said that I wouldn't endorse him but that doesn't mean I don't fully support him" in regards to U.S. President Donald Trump in 2020.

title: Did a California DA Say Looting Is 'Okay' If Suspects 'Need' What They Steal?
subtitle: Conservative websites and commentators misrepresented internal prosecutorial guidelines leaked in the summer of 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In internal guidelines, Contra Costa, California, District Attorney Diana Becton indicated that looting was acceptable and would not be prosecuted if a suspect "needed" what was stolen.

title: Are These the Parents of Kyle Rittenhouse?
subtitle: The idiom "out of whole cloth" can be traced back to false advertisements from garment sellers in the 1800s.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show the parents of Kyle Rittenhouse, the 17-year-old accused of killing two people and injuring a third at a protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

title: Did Loretta Lynn and Kid Rock Get Married?
subtitle: The 88 year-old country music legend sent readers to Snopes with an Instagram post in August 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2020, Loretta Lynn and Kid Rock married each other.

title: No, Chadwick Boseman Wasn't Poisoned
subtitle: A viral internet rumor had no standing in facts.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An autopsy revealed that the late "Black Panther" star Chadwick Boseman had died from poisoning.

title: No, the White House Rose Garden Doesn't Spell Out 'KKK'
subtitle: A photo shared on Facebook took a rather creative perspective on the newly renovated White House Rose Garden.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hedges at the newly renovated White House Rose Garden spell out "KKK."

title: Does This Video Show Biden Falling Asleep in an Interview?
subtitle: The manipulated clip was shared by President Trump's social media director.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows 2020 U.S. Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden falling asleep during a live television interview.

title: Did Larry Bird Tell NBA Players 'Shut Up and Play the Damn Game'?
subtitle: A supposed quote from the Celtic great criticized NBA players for their pro-racial justice protests.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former NBA star said modern basketball players should stop protesting and just 'Shut up and play the damn game.'

title: Did Pelosi Pass a Bill Allowing Her Husband To Make Millions Selling USPS Property?
subtitle: A meme circulating on Facebook appears to be a rehash of another version from 2013.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi passed a bill that would help her husband profit off the sale of federally owned U.S. Postal Service property.

title: Was Jacob Blake Charged With Raping a Child?
subtitle: Online commentators and social media users sought to undermine protests sparked by the police shooting of Blake in Wisconsin in August 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Jacob Blake, whom a Kenosha, Wisconsin, police officer shot in August 2020, was once charged with raping a child in Wisconsin.

title: Did Arizona Superintendent Kathy Hoffman Push for Sex Ed in Kindergarten?
subtitle: Arizona's superintendent of public instruction was the target of several disparaging claims made in a viral Facebook post.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Arizona Superintendent of Public Instruction Kathy Hoffman advocated teaching students about "masturbation and sexual positions" after she was sworn into office with her hand on a Dr. Seuss book.

title: Did Melania Trump 'Dig Up' the Rose Garden at the White House?
subtitle: Roses don't live forever, but this faux scandal may.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Melania Trump dug up the White House Rose Garden, which was planted by Jackie Kennedy and contained roses planted by every first lady since 1913.

title: Is Victoria's Secret Planting Tracking Devices in Bras?
subtitle: Radio-frequency identification tags are used by several major retailers in order to track inventory, not customers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Victoria's Secret puts radio-frequency identification tags (RFID) chips in its bras so that it can track customers.

title: Are Sex Traffickers Tagging Cars as Potential Targets?
subtitle: Human trafficking is a real problem in the world, but the schemes outlined in many viral rumors like this one are not.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sex traffickers are tagging vehicles as potential targets with codes such as "1f1b."

title: Does Adding a Stamp to Your Ballot 'Force' USPS To Deliver as First-Class?
subtitle: Misinformation surrounded one of the most controversial topics in the 2020 general election - mail-in ballots.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Adding a stamp to a postage-paid ballot "forces" the U.S. Postal Service to treat that ballot as first-class mail.

title: Did Biden Say 'Christians Violate LGBTQ Rights by Simply Existing'?
subtitle: This was not a remotely accurate nor reasonable summary of what the former U.S. vice president actually said.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden said, "Christians violate LGBTQ rights by simply existing."

title: Did Trump Tweet This About Goodyear?
subtitle: Trump's tweet followed a report from a television station in Topeka, Kansas, based on an anonymous Goodyear employee's screenshot.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image shows an angry tweet by U.S. President Donald Trump about Goodyear tires which was full of misspellings.

title: Are These Victims Who Were 'Beat Up by a BLM Hate Group'?
subtitle: Yet another meme sought to denigrate a particular group by using misrepresented photographs.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A collage of photographs shows people who were severely injured in beatings perpetrated by a "BLM hate group."

title: Did Steve Bannon Predict Obama Officials Would End Up in Jail?
subtitle: An old meme was recirculated in August 2020 after Bannon's arrest on fraud charges.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former White House strategist Steve Bannon predicted that multiple members of U.S. President Obama's administration, and possibly Obama himself, would be in federal prison by the end of President Donald Trump's first term.

title: Is This a Picture of Biden and Harris in a Crowd Without Face Masks?
subtitle: Believe it or not, there was a time in the United States when face masks were not required to slow the spread of a deadly disease.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image collage shows former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden and Sen. Kamala Harris without masks in August 2020, suggesting they were flouting public health guidelines during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Does AARP Support the Democratic Party?
subtitle: When individuals support a political party, it does not automatically mean their employer follows suit.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A portion of what members and/or donors pay to AARP (formerly American Association of Retired Persons) goes directly to the U.S. Democratic party.

title: Did Tokyo Set Off Fireworks Meant for 2020 Olympics?
subtitle: The 2020 Olympics were delayed due to the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a large fireworks display that was originally planned for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

title: Could Kids with COVID-19 Symptoms Be Quarantined Without Parental Consent?
subtitle: An erroneous Facebook post swept across various countries in August 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Under the "COVID Act," school officials in the U.S. can quarantine children with COVID-19 symptoms outside their family home without their parents' or guardians' consent.

title: Did Putin's Daughter Die After Taking COVID-19 Vaccine?
subtitle: When tarot card readings are cited as credible evidence, all bets are off.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughter died on Aug. 15, 2020, after taking a second dose of COVID-19 vaccine.

title: Are 'Neck Gaiters' Worse at COVID-19 Transmission Than Foregoing Masks Altogether?
subtitle: Rumors claimed that using neck gaiters instead of a mask may actually increase the transmission of the coronavirus.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: When it comes to protecting against COVID-19 transmission, neck gaiters are worse than wearing no mask at all.

title: Did Trump Tweet This About Kamala Harris?
subtitle: The president was critical of Joe Biden's choice of running mate in 2020, but not in this particular form.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Trump tweeted that "Karmala" Harris' name sounded "like a terrorist" and that she was "not even American."

title: Did the Annabelle Doll Escape from the Warren Museum?
subtitle: Inanimate objects are not known for their mobility.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Annabelle doll escaped from the Warren's Occult Museum in Connecticut.

title: Does Kamala Harris' Press Secretary Decide What Trump Can Say on Twitter?
subtitle: Conservative personalities and websites attacked a Twitter employee over his employment background.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Kamala Harris' press secretary was hired by Twitter to moderate U.S. President Donald Trump's tweets.

title: Does Kamala Harris' Birth Certificate Identify Her as 'Caucasian'?
subtitle: Anything is possible if you ignore the obvious.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image of U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris' birth certificate shows that the document identified her race as "Caucasian."

title: Does Joe Biden Own an Island in the Caribbean?
subtitle: Several details got distorted as this rumor spread online.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden owns an island next to the island that was owned by Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Did Kamala Harris Call Joe Biden a Racist?
subtitle: Following the announcement of Biden's 2020 running mate choice, critics seized on a past exchange between him and the U.S. senator.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris called former Vice President Joe Biden a racist during a presidential debate.

title: Is COVID-19 a Bacterial Infection Easily Cured with Aspirin?
subtitle: An aspirin a day will not keep the COVID-19 away.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: By ignoring a ban on performing COVID-19 autopsies, researchers in Italy discovered that the disease is caused by a bacteria -  not a virus - and can simply be treated with aspirin.

title: Did a Convicted Child Predator Win an Appeal on Discrimination Grounds?
subtitle: Another example of a meme that misled through its failure to provide context.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A sex offender won an appeal of his conviction on the grounds that "pedophiles are a persecuted minority"?

title: Were Will Smith's Teeth Knocked Out by Jason Derulo?
subtitle: To say we're skeptical about this viral video is a bit of an understatement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows actor Will Smith's teeth knocked out by singer Jason Derulo's errant golf swing.

title: Did Trump Call USPS 'Most Corrupt and Anti-American Way of Voting'?
subtitle: The U.S. president has expressed many (and varied) feelings about mail-in voting.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said on "Sean Hannity Radio" that the United States Postal Service is the most "anti-American" way to vote, and that he would try and dismantle it.

title: Did CNN Publish Contradictory Articles on Hydroxychloroquine?
subtitle: Information about hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for COVID-19, published in two CNN articles, was neither contradictory nor inaccurate - despite attempts to make it look that way.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A graphic shows contradictory CNN articles about hydroxychloroquine, published three months apart and co-authored by the same person.

title: Is This a Photo of Alaska's 'Sleeping Lady' Mountain?
subtitle: "The giant woman fell asleep waiting for her beloved to return from battle, unaware that he had been killed."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph taken from a drone shows the 'Sleeping Lady' mountain in Alaska.

title: Did a Black Teen Request to Be Tried As a White Man?
subtitle: An unreliable website with a penchant for publishing clickbait and repackaged satire appeared to have tricked readers in the summer of 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2020, 19-year-old Black man Sean Jackson asked to be tried "as a white man" in a court in Tampa, Florida.

title: Is This Ghislaine Maxwell's Unsealed 'List of Names'?
subtitle: The list of dozens of names posted to Facebook was offered up in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein sex-trafficking case.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A list of public figures posted to Facebook was part of an "unsealed" list of names kept by Ghislaine Maxwell, who has been charged with facilitating the sexual abuse of minors by Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict the Beirut Explosion?
subtitle: According to the internet, "The Simpsons" writers are the world's best prognosticators.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "The Simpsons" predicted the Beirut explosion in August 2020.

title: Was a CV-19 Vaccine That Tracks Citizens Patented in 2012?
subtitle: "Stop getting your news from memes and calling it research!"
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A vaccine known as CV-19 that can track citizens was patented following secret meetings with Joe Biden in 2012.

title: Can You Get Legionnaires' Disease from Face Masks?
subtitle: Rumors about masks are getting more creative, but health experts still recommend wearing cloth face coverings to help slow the spread of COVID-19.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Legionnaires' disease can be contracted from a face mask used repeatedly.

title: Was Beirut Explosion Caused By a Missile?
subtitle: Video of a catastrophic explosion in Beirut was pretty shocking without being manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a missile striking a building in Beirut in early August 2020 and causing a massive explosion.

title: Was Trump 'Campaign Ad' Banned by YouTube and Facebook?
subtitle: Seems odd to describe a video as "banned" while watching it on the platform that supposedly banned it.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A video described as a "campaign ad" promoting U.S. President Donald Trump's 2020 reelection campaign was banned by Facebook and YouTube.

title: Can Drivers in Canada Be Fined $1,500 If a Passenger Uses a Cellphone?
subtitle: A website with a penchant for attention-grabbing headlines about life in Canada struck again in July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of July 2020, a new law in Canada meant motorists could be convicted and fined $1,500 if one of their passengers used a cellphone.

title: Did Spirit Halloween Say It Would Not Open Stores in 2020?
subtitle: Halloween may look a little different in 2020, but not due to a lack of Spirit Halloween stores.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Spirit Halloween announced in August 2020 that it would not open its seasonal stores this year.

title: Does This Video Show an Octopus Walking on the Beach?
subtitle: While some octopuses can temporarily survive on land, the ambulatory abilities of the cephalopod in this video are a bit out of arm's reach.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an octopus walking quickly across a beach.

title: Did Fauci Say in 2005 Virology Journal That Hydroxychloroquine Can Treat SARS?
subtitle: Shockingly, a screenshot of an opinion piece excerpt omitted some important facts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dr. Anthony Fauci wrote in a 2005 paper published in Virology Journal that hydroxychloroquine was effective in treating SARS.

title: Did the White House Alter Trump Rally Photos To Show More Attendees?
subtitle: The viral photos surfaced after Trump's July 31, 2020, tarmac speech in Tampa.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: The White House falsified an image of U.S. President Donald Trump's rally in Tampa, Florida, to make the event appear more widely attended.

title: Does Video Show Pelosi Drunk and Slurring Speech?
subtitle: For at least the second time in recent memory, social media trolls slowed down a video of U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to make it seem like she was slurring her speech.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi drunk and slurring her speech.

title: Is Moderna Tied to Fauci, Gates, Soros, and Epstein?
subtitle: A spoof omnibus conspiracy theory linked a company developing a potential COVID-19 vaccine to several prominent figures.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Viral text accurately outlines how biotechnology company Moderna is linked to Dr. Anthony Fauci, Bill Gates, George Soros, and Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Did Alexander Vindman 'Quit' the Army After Admitting to Falsely Testifying at Impeachment?
subtitle: Vindman was the target of smear campaigns after serving as a key witness during impeachment hearings against U.S. President Donald Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Alexander Vindman "quit" the Army "after admitting he falsely testified at President Trump's impeachment inquiry."

title: Is Pedophilia Considered a Disability in Greece?
subtitle: Outrage over a proposed change in 2012 - that never came to fruition - continued to percolate into 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pedophilia is considered a disability in Greece.

title: Is FEMA Offering Hazard Pay Due to COVID-19?
subtitle: Hyperlinks are often included to provide additional information ... or, in this case, punchlines.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Federal Emergency Management Agency is providing $4,800 in hazard pay to those who have been working during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Was Trump Caught on Hot Mic Insulting His Supporters?
subtitle: Hot mic videos are always popular, but not always accurate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows U.S. President Donald Trump calling his supporters "animals" who shoot "Mountain Dew in their veins" while watching "'Tiger King' for the 45th time," among other insults.

title: Does Farting Negate the Use of Masks to Prevent COVID-19?
subtitle: It's natural to pass gas, but please don't pass along this meme.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Wearing a mask to prevent the spread of COVID-19 is unnecessary because the disease can also be spread via farts.

title: Did Rutgers University Declare Grammar 'Racist'?
subtitle: Several articles rushed to condemn the New Jersey university's English department in response to an open letter published in June 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Rutgers University or Rutgers' English Department Chair Rebecca Walkowitz wrote in June 2020 that "grammar is racist" or words to that effect.

title: Did USPS Tell Americans to Send Mail-In Ballots 2 Weeks in Advance?
subtitle: The USPS does recommend requesting ballots at least 15 days in advance and mailing them at least a week before the election.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The U.S. Postal Service is telling voters to send mail-in ballots 14 days before the Nov. 3, 2020, general election.

title: Was Tom Hanks Arrested in Australia and Fitted with an Ankle Bracelet?
subtitle: The actor is one of several celebrities who have become the target of bizarre conspiracy theories about "elite pedophile sex trafficking rings."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Tom Hanks was arrested for "pedophilia" in Australia, and fitted with an ankle bracelet to monitor his movements.

title: Is Seasonal Flu More Deadly Than COVID-19?
subtitle: The real point is: Both diseases can kill. And experts warn we may be dealing with them simultaneously this fall.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: The seasonal flu kills more people every year in the U.S. than COVID-19 has to date.

title: Were Diamond and Silk, Ted Nugent Announced as GOP Convention Speakers?
subtitle: A satirical tweet was mistaken as genuine on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Trump campaign announced in July 2020 that Diamond and Silk, Ted Nugent, Scott Baio, and Antonio Sabato Jr. would be speaking via Zoom at the Republican National Convention.

title: Did Target End Its 'Shop with a Cop' Program?
subtitle: Pointing out a rumor exists is not the same as proving that the rumor is true.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Target canceled its annual "Heroes & Helpers" program that pairs children with local police officers for holiday shopping trips.

title: Does Image Show Police Officer in 'Trump's America'?
subtitle: Police tactics at 2020 protests sparked outrage, controversy, debate, and, of course, rumors.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a heavily armored officer patrolling "Trump's America."

title: Are Pedophiles Claiming to be 'Age Fluid'?
subtitle: A scaremongering piece of propaganda was created to smear the LGBTQ community.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A concerted effort exists to normalize "age fluidity" to allow pedophiles to legally engage in physical relationships with children.

title: Did Kroger Receipt Include a Charge for Black Lives Matter?
subtitle: An altered receipt misled some viewers on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Kroger receipt shows the grocery chain is adding a charge to customer transactions in order to raise funds for Black Lives Matter.

title: Is SpongeBob's Home Address on Epstein's 'Pedo Island'?
subtitle: This is a type of bizarre viral claim that pains us to even have to address.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The address used for the home of the SpongeBob SquarePants character corresponds to a location on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's privately owned island.

title: Does Googling Any 3-Digit Number Followed by 'New Cases' Reveal COVID-19 Conspiracy?
subtitle: On the contrary, testing this conspiracy theory actually proves the opposite of what it imagines.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Searching for any three-digit number followed by "new cases" on Google provides evidence that the COVID-19 pandemic was manufactured.

title: Is This Millionaire Brandon Torrent Urinating on a Homeless Person?
subtitle: "Somehow it never occurred to me that this concept - a guy pissing on another guy - was not going to make me rich."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A millionaire named Brandon Torrent allowed himself to be photographed urinating on a homeless person.

title: Did Hitler Invent the Inflatable Sex Doll?
subtitle: Nothing attracts curiosity like a lurid combination of Nazis and sex.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Adolf Hitler was behind the invention of the first inflatable sex dolls.

title: Did Christopher Harrington Patent a 'CV19-N95' Mask in 2015?
subtitle: Jokes and conspiracy theories often get mistaken from one another on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A government employee named Christopher Harrington filed a patent for a "CV19-N95" mask in 2015.

title: Is This Photo of Trump Kissing Epstein Real?
subtitle: President Donald Trump has been photographed with Jeffrey Epstein on several occasions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. President Trump kissing convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Was the COVID-19 Pandemic Planned in Rockefeller's 'Operation Lockstep'?
subtitle: Diabolical plans for world domination aren't normally posted as readily available PDFs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The COVID-19 pandemic was planned by the Rockefeller Foundation in "Operation Lockstep."

title: Is the 'Chad Cop' Photo Real?
subtitle: We reached out to Johnny Bravo for comment but have yet to receive a response.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a police officer who resembles the "Chad" internet meme.

title: Does a Photo Show Sen. Chuck Schumer Kissing a Young Girl?
subtitle: This is far from the first time a wild accusation has been lobbed at a politician because an internet user thought he looked like someone else.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. Sen. Chuck Schumer, D-NY, kissing a young girl on the mouth.

title: Did Toronto Ban Catholic Churches from Administering Holy Communion?
subtitle: Laura Ingraham and other right-wing media sources characterized COVID-19 measures as outright bans on religious freedom.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In June 2020, the city of Toronto banned Catholic churches from carrying out the sacrament of Holy Communion because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Ronald Reagan Say 'Keep Voting Democrat' If You Want Freedoms Restricted?
subtitle: If you can't find a political icon expressing the opinion you want, make up the opinion and share it as a quote.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ronald Reagan said that people should "keep voting Democrat" if they want to have their freedoms restricted.

title: Did Trump Tweet That the Confederate Flag Is a 'Symbol of Love'?
subtitle: Confederate flags, monuments and military base names have become a national flashpoint since the death of George Floyd.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump tweeted that the Confederate flag is a 'symbol of love.'

title: Must All U.S. Businesses Accept Legal Tender as Payment?
subtitle: Nearly everyone likes cash, except perhaps in times of a pandemic.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: All businesses in the U.S. are required to accept coins and/or currency as payment.

title: Will the WhatsApp Message 'Argentina Is Doing It' Hack My Phone?
subtitle: A viral warning message urged people against opening a video file about the country's response to COVID-19.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: A WhatsApp video message known as "Argentina Is Doing It" spreads malware that irreparably hacks viewers' cell phones.

title: Does Burning Sage Eliminate Airborne Bacteria?
subtitle: Some claim that smudging with sage can purify air in confined spaces.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A 2007 study showed burning sage kills 94% of bacteria.

title: Did Melania Trump Post a Photo of Herself Wearing a Soviet Army Hat?
subtitle: Digital manipulation gave the appearance that the first lady of the U.S. was photographed wearing Soviet insignia on a traditional Russian ushanka.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Melania Trump once posted a photo of herself wearing a Russian hat featuring a Soviet army badge, and Facebook removed the image.

title: No, Joe Biden Didn't Introduce Man in Blackface at 1985 Fundraiser
subtitle: A racially charged rumor involved an edited video featuring a Black singer.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden participated in a "blackface skit" at a 1985 fundraiser.

title: Did Starbucks Support Calls To 'Defund the Police'?
subtitle: Outraged supporters of law enforcement officers called for a boycott after an evidence-free meme appeared in July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Starbucks has supported or promoted the campaign known by shorthand as "defund the police."

title: Did Golfer Bubba Watson Write an Anti-BLM Facebook Post?
subtitle: The two-time Masters winner is usually quiet on political controversies.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Bubba Watson composed a widely shared message that criticized Black Lives Matter and included various conservative talking points.

title: Did Joe Biden Say He's 'Going to Beat Joe Biden'?
subtitle: In political punditry, why go with a straightforward explanation when a nonsensical one will do?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said during a May 2020 interview with CNBC that "I'm going to beat Joe Biden."

title: Did Mary Trump's Book Describe Finding Her Uncle in Bed with His Daughter?
subtitle: Mary Trump said her book "is the story of the most visible and powerful family in the world, and I am the only Trump who is willing to tell it."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Mary Trump's tell-all book describes her walking in on her uncle Donald in bed with his daughter Ivanka.

title: Will COVID-19 No Longer Be Classified as an Epidemic?
subtitle: Report citing the CDC claimed coronavirus death rates in the U.S. were plummeting.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: COVID-19 could lose its epidemic status in the United States because of declining coronavirus death rates according to CDC data.

title: Did Facebook Allow a Pro-Pedophilia Ad to Run?
subtitle: A fabricated image shared in social media posts was created to look like an ad campaign supported by TED and other groups.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Facebook allowed a pro-pedophilia ad to run on their social media network.

title: No, the NAACP Didn't Warn About Violent White Supremacist Initiations 'This Weekend'
subtitle: A "copypasta" hoax circulating in early July 2020 caused anxiety.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The NAACP warned of violent white supremacist initiations planned for "this weekend."

title: Did Betsy DeVos Say COVID-19 Will 'Only' Kill .02% of US Students?
subtitle: Per the claim, which circulated widely among U.S. teachers and parents, that would mean 14,740 children and teens would die.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In July 2020, U.S. Education Secretary Betsy DeVos said "only" .02% of the country's K-12 school students - totaling 14,740 children and teens - are likely to die from COVID-19 when and if schools fully reopen.

title: Did Trump's Tweet About Saving 'Heritage' Echo a Hitler Speech?
subtitle: How to appropriately protect and preserve cultural property is an old conundrum.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A tweet by President Trump about preserving American heritage and history echoed a speech given by Adolf Hitler in 1939.

title: Is Wayfair Trafficking Children Via Overpriced Items?
subtitle: The claim that Wayfair is trafficking children is based almost entirely on one person's confusion over an expensive cabinet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The furniture store Wayfair is trafficking children via overpriced items.

title: Can Benadryl Treat Rattlesnake Bites?
subtitle: Some people in
claim antihistamines can treat venomous snakebites.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: The common allergy drug Benadryl can be used to treat rattlesnake bites.

title: Has Ford Motor Co. Donated Millions to 'Defund the Police'?
subtitle: Reports linking the American auto company to groups who propose defunding or abolishing police forces relied on a basic error.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ford Motor Co. has donated millions of dollars to groups and initiatives that support defunding or abolishing police forces.

title: Did Trump Tweet That South Dakota Should Close Its Border with California?
subtitle: A fake tweet fooled some.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted that South Dakota should close its border with California.

title: Did Ivanka Trump Say, 'Let's Ask What We Can Do for My Dad'?
subtitle: The U.S. president's daughter drew harsh criticism in India after tweeting support for an impoverished girl who cycled her wounded father 750 miles.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Ivanka Trump said, "Let's not ask what my dad can do for us, let's ask what we can do for my dad."

title: Did Trump Tweet This About Puerto Rico?
subtitle: President Donald Trump has called the U.S. territory
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Donald Trump disparaged the Puerto Rican governor and statehood movement, tweeting that Puerto Rico was "a small island filled with savages."

title: No, Ilhan Omar Didn't Call for Dismantling the US Economy and Political System
subtitle: The Minnesota congresswoman is one of the first Muslim women to serve in Congress and is the frequent target of smears.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar called for the dismantling of the entire U.S. economy and political system.

title: Were Weis Markets Employees Banned From Displaying the American Flag?
subtitle: A chain of grocery stores on the east coast became the subject of internet rumors in June 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In June 2020, Weis Markets banned its employees from wearing any representation of the American flag because it was considered controversial amidst the political climate. They also banned the flag from being displayed on merchandise.

title: Is This Meme About Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccinations Accurate?
subtitle: It's difficult to make a nonexistent vaccine mandatory.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: COVID-19 vaccinations, which have already killed several youngsters, will be required before children will be allowed to return to school.

title: Is Dr. Fauci Married to Ghislaine Maxwell's Sister?
subtitle: Sharing a first name is not the same as sharing an identity.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dr. Anthony Fauci is married to Ghislaine Maxwell's sister.

title: No, Dr. Denis Mukwege Didn't Say Coronavirus Cases Are Being Falsified
subtitle: Mukwege, a renowned gynecologist, did resign from his position with the task force responding to COVID-19 in the Congo, but not for the reason stated in a meme.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Dr. Denis Mukwege said he resigned from the coronavirus task force in the Democratic Republic of the Congo because he was being offered money to falsify COVID-19 cases.

title: Is Beyonce an Italian Woman Named Ann Marie Lastrassi?
subtitle: This conspiracy theory makes absolutely no sense.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Music artist Beyonce is really an Italian woman named Ann Marie Lastrassi.

title: Did Trump's Tulsa Rally Result in 100% Positive COVID-19 Test Rates in Oklahoma?
subtitle: An MSNBC analysis of incomplete data resulted in misunderstandings.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump's June 20, 2020, election rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, during the coronavirus pandemic could be connected to two days of 100% positive COVID-19 tests reported in the state more than a week later.

title: Does Facebook Prohibit Posting of the Lord's Prayer?
subtitle: If it were banned, you wouldn't be seeing this message ...
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Facebook has a policy against users' posting the text of the Lord's Prayer.

title: Did Samuel Pepys Write 'The Taverns Are Full of Gadabouts' in 1665?
subtitle: And what in the world is a gadabout?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Samuel Pepys wrote about taverns being full of gadabouts during a plague in 1665.

title: Is 'James Maxwell Trump' the Son of Ghislaine Maxwell and Donald Trump?
subtitle: We're going to need to see the long-form birth certificate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A birth certificate for "James Maxwell Trump" shows that he is the biological son of Ghislaine Maxwell and Donald Trump.

title: Is This Queen Elizabeth Wearing a Yellow Face Mask?
subtitle: Numerous celebrities reminded their followers to mask up amid the coronavirus pandemic.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Queen Elizabeth wearing a yellow face mask during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.

title: Did Trump Say Operation Desert Storm Took Place in Vietnam?
subtitle: The president's 2020 Independence Day address wasn't the smoothest of speeches, but neither was it as historically challenged as claimed by some critics.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: During an Independence Day speech, U.S. President Donald Trump declared that Operation Desert Storm took place in Vietnam.

title: Did Taylor Swift Say 'We Should Remove the Statue of Liberty'?
subtitle: No, but there was definitely bad blood between the pop singer and a different monument.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Taylor Swift said "We should remove the Statue of Liberty."

title: Were 9/11 and WWII Memorials Vandalized During Protests?
subtitle: Social media rumors that two memorials in New York were vandalized proved misleading.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The 9/11 Memorial & Museum and the World War II Memorial, both in New York state, were vandalized during Black Lives Matter protests in the spring of 2020.

title: No, President Trump Wasn't 'Pronounced Dead'
subtitle: Turns out presidents aren't exempt from celebrity death hoaxes.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was "pronounced dead" on June 27, 2020, and the media is covering it up.

title: No, Antifa and Muslim Groups Aren't Policing Minneapolis Under 'Muslim Rule'
subtitle: The claim appears to have originated with a state representative who does not live in Minneapolis.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Antifa and Muslim organizations in summer of 2020 were planning to police the streets of Minneapolis under Muslim rule.

title: Are Black Lives Matter Members Poisoning Fast Food?
subtitle: Can you smell the copypasta rumors?
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Black Lives Matter "members and supporters" are tampering with or poisoning the orders of white patrons at fast food restaurants.

title: Did Joe Biden's Great-Grandfather Own Slaves?
subtitle: Rumors began to circulate in June 2020 that the Democratic U.S. presidential candidate's great-grandfather owned slaves.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Joe Biden's great-grandfather, Joseph J. Biden, a Confederate soldier who owned slaves in the 1800s.

title: Did Trump Hold the Bible Upside Down?
subtitle: All eyes were on the president as he appeared for a photo opp amid widespread anti-police-brutality protests in June 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was photographed holding the Bible upside down outside St John's Episcopal church on June 1, 2020.

title: Did Facebook Allow a Post Calling for the Hanging of White People?
subtitle: A meme attempted to show Facebook's bias when it comes to blocking racist content on its platform.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Facebook said that a message posted by the user "Adam Butsch" calling for the genocide of white people didn't violate its community standards.

title: Did Tennis Star Serena Williams Write the Viral 'I'm Sick of COVID-19' Post?
subtitle: A person by that name definitely posted the message.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tennis star Serena Williams posted a message on social media that began, "I'm sick of COVID-19. I'm sick of black vs. white. I'm sick of Republicans vs. Democrats."

title: Did NASCAR Say a Serpentine Belt, Not a Noose, Was Found in Bubba Wallace's Garage?
subtitle: Rumor and confusion abounded in the wake of a disturbing discovery in a NASCAR garage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NASCAR announced that Black driver Bubba Wallace mistook a serpentine belt for a noose in his stall.

title: Did AOC Tweet That Businesses Should Be Shut Down Until the Election?
subtitle: The New York representative did not advocate that governors keep businesses shut down to blunt Trump's reelection chances.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted that businesses should be kept closed until after the 2020 presidential election.

title: Did Trump Say FDR Hid in a Bunker During Vietnam Protests?
subtitle: AG William Barr said.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump tweeted that FDR "hid in a bunker during the protest of the Vietnam War."

title: Did Trump Say People Who Didn't Attend His Rally Should Be Arrested?
subtitle: TikTok users and K-pop music fans claimed to have registered hundreds of thousands of tickets for Trump's campaign rally as a prank.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted that,  "Anyone who ordered a ticket to my rally and didn't attend should be arrested and face very powerful charges."

title: Did the Woman Behind Aunt Jemima Die a Millionaire?
subtitle: one historian told us.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nancy Green died a millionaire from the money she earned portraying the fictional Aunt Jemima in promotional settings.

title: Is This the NFL's New COVID-19 Helmet?
subtitle: The 2020 NFL season will certainly be unique in some ways.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows the official COVID-19 series of NFL helmets.

title: Did Merriam-Webster Update Its Definition of 'Racism' To Say Only White People Are Racist?
subtitle: The American dictionary announced it would revise its entry on racism in June 2020 after receiving a request from a young Black woman.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In June 2020, Merriam-Webster said it planned to change its entry on "racism" in its dictionary to show only white people are racist.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Recently 'On Trial' for Benghazi?
subtitle: The former U.S. secretary of state's lawyers were in court in June 2020 for a hearing about a public records request, not for a Benghazi trial.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton was "'on trial' for Benghazi" in June 2020, but the news of it was obscured by other events.

title: Is NASCAR Doing Away with Traditions Such as the National Anthem?
subtitle: In June 2020, NASCAR announced that it was banning the display of the Confederate flag, prompting rumors that other game day traditions were being eliminated, too.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NASCAR announced in June 2020 that it was doing away with the national anthem, pre-race prayers, and military flyovers.

title: Did CNN 'Lighten' Photo of Man Who Drove Into Protesters?
subtitle: Falsely accusing CNN of altering the racial identity of crime suspects in news photographs has become a distinct subclass of misinformation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: CNN lightened the skin tone in a picture of a man accused of driving a car into Seattle protesters.

title: Are Hells Angels Heading to Seattle To Fight Antifa?
subtitle: This incendiary rumor was supported by little more than unfounded claims and unrelated videos.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Hells Angels Motorcycle Club was headed to Seattle in June 2020 to fight antifa.

title: Does a BLM Flyer Label White People the 'Enemy'?
subtitle: A piece of racist propaganda was circulated in an attempt to smear the Black Lives Matter movement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An official Black Lives Matter flyer labels white men, women, and children as "the enemy."

title: Is Walmart Playing In-Store Audio Supporting BLM?
subtitle: A controversial Facebook post about an Oklahoma Walmart store and Black Lives Matter was quickly refuted and deleted.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Walmart store played audio supporting the Black Lives Matter movement and acknowledging the existence of "white privilege."

title: Did a West Point Grad Sport Anti-Trump Shirt?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke to 1,107 cadets at West Point's 2020 graduation ceremonies.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a graduating West Point cadet displaying a crude anti-Trump message on his shirt.

title: Did Hitler Defund and Eliminate Police Departments?
subtitle: Adolf Hitler posed as a champion of law and order, claiming he would uphold traditional German values.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Upon assuming power in Germany, Hitler ordered the defunding and elimination of police departments.

title: Did John Barnes Appear on TV With Porn DVDs Behind Him?
subtitle: A supposed embarrassing accident led to some online mockery of the former soccer player.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pornographic DVDs could be seen behind former soccer player John Barnes during an appearance on Sky News television.

title: Did 'Captain America' Movie Predict the Coronavirus Pandemic?
subtitle: Even in a movie involving time travel, calling this a "prediction" takes more than a small stretch of the imagination.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The 2011 movie "Captain America" predicted the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Was the Kids' TV Show 'Paw Patrol' Canceled?
subtitle: Tongue-in-cheek social media posts led to rumors about the popular Nickelodeon show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The kids' TV show "Paw Patrol" was canceled in June 2020 due to its portrayal of police.

title: Did 'Antifa' Recruit Protesters on Craigslist in Nebraska?
subtitle: one ad allegedly said.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: posted an ad on the Lincoln, Nebraska, Craigslist website offering to pay protesters

title: Did a Panda Fake Pregnancy to Get Special Treatment?
subtitle: Pandas that staff believe to be expecting are given a single, air-conditioned room, as well as more buns, fruit, and bamboo than non-pregnant pandas.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A captive panda deliberately faked symptoms of pregnancy in order to obtain special treatment from her keepers.

title: Did Trump Tweet That He Talked to Putin From His Bunker?
subtitle: A parody tweet made to look like the U.S. president wrote it created some confusion online.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: In a tweet, U.S. President Donald Trump thanked Vladimir Putin from a White House bunker for his "concern."

title: Is Gov. Whitmer the Niece of George Soros?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists continually add branches to the Soros family tree.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer is the niece of billionaire George Soros.

title: Did Obama Foundation Share Pic of George Floyd 9 Days Before He Died?
subtitle: A May 2020 Obama Foundation tweet became the focus of a new conspiracy theory.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: The Obama Foundation mysteriously tweeted an image of a protest sign with George Floyd's face on it on May 16 and 17, 2020, more than a week before his death.

title: Was Razor Wire Placed Around the White House?
subtitle: More than a mile of fencing was put up around the White House amid protests against police brutality in the spring of 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows razor wire atop a newly constructed security fence outside the White House.

title: Did the White House's Address Change to 1600 Black Lives Matter Plaza?
subtitle: A street that underwent a change in honor of civil rights protests is near the White House.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The address to the White House changed from 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue to 1600 Black Lives Matter Plaza.

title: Is This a Photo of the Lincoln Memorial After Being Defaced by Protesters?
subtitle: The Lincoln Memorial is one of a few national landmarks that some say were graffitied recently.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the Lincoln Memorial after it was defaced by Black Lives Matter (BLM) protesters.

title: Do 52 Thoroughbred Horses Need New Homes Due to COVID-19?
subtitle: A plea that dozens of horses are destined for slaughter if adopters are not found for them soon is inaccurate and long out-of-date.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 52 thoroughbred horses whose owner died from COVID-19 are destined for slaughter if adopters are not found for them soon.

title: Are These America's Favorite Fast Food Restaurants?
subtitle: Looks like someone's pranking.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A map shows America's Favorite Fast Food restaurants.

title: Did Wendy's CEO Donate to Trump's Re-Election Campaign?
subtitle: #WendysIsOverParty trended on social media following rumors that the fast food chain's CEO donated to U.S. President Donald Trump's re-election campaign.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: The CEO of Wendy's donated about $400,000 to President Trump's re-election campaign.

title: Were 6 Cops Killed in 10 Days at Protests in June 2020?
subtitle: The officers listed in this article died from a variety of causes, including brain cancer, a heart attack, pneumonia, and car crashes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Six police officers were killed in 10 days while working during protests against police violence and racial injustice in the spring of 2020.

title: Did 'Sailor Moon' Anime Series Call Cops 'Dirty Pigs'?
subtitle: Editing or adding captions to imagery is a part of a meme culture ... and also one way misinformation spreads.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A clip from the animated series "Sailor Moon" features the heroes calling police officers "dirty pigs," "fascists," and "class traitors."

title: Did Beyonce Endorse President Trump in 2020?
subtitle: In 2016 she supported Donald Trump's opponent, Hillary Clinton.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Beyonce has endorsed U.S. President Donald Trump for reelection in 2020.

title: Did Reps. Pelosi and Waters Pose with 'Trump 2020' Sign?
subtitle: This has all the signs of a manipulated image.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Rep. Maxine Waters posing beneath a Trump 2020 campaign sign.

title: Did LEGO Pull Police Playsets from Stores?
subtitle: A rumor led some to believe that LEGO stopped selling police- and White House-themed toys.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: LEGO pulled police- and White House-themed toys in response to nationwide protests following the death of George Floyd.

title: Did Trump Give Mattis the Nickname 'Mad Dog'?
subtitle: The general reportedly hates this nickname.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump coined the nickname "Mad Dog" for retired Marine Corps General James Mattis.

title: Can Trump Designate Antifa as a 'Terrorist Organization'?
subtitle: Trump's tweet reacting to protests against the killing of George Floyd appears to blame anti-fascist organizations for the agitation.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump (or his administration) has the legal authority to designate antifa as a terrorist organization.

title: No, Black Lives Matter Didn't Threaten To 'Assassinate White Families'
subtitle: Screenshots of an inflammatory Facebook post started circulating during the George Floyd protests of 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Black Lives Matter activists threatened in social media posts to assassinate white families.

title: Did 'Antifa America' Threaten to 'Take What's Ours' from the Suburbs?
subtitle: A tweet posted amid nationwide protests and riots over the in-custody death of George Floyd caused panic. But it was a hoax.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A group calling itself "Antifa America" threatened to "take what's ours" from the suburbs in May 2020 after rioting in the nation's major cities in protest of the death of a black man in police custody.

title: Did Trump Complain About the State of the White House Bunker in a Tweet?
subtitle: The tweet allegedly took issue with the bunker's "extremely dirty" conditions.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump complained about his experience in the White House bunker on Twitter, saying that President Barack Obama left it in a bad shape, with no food or supplies.

title: Did MSNBC Use 'World War Z' Footage in News Coverage?
subtitle: the video's creator said after it went viral.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: MSNBC used footage from the zombie apocalypse film "World War Z" as if it were live footage of the 2020 George Floyd protests.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict George Floyd's Death?
subtitle: Predictions are typically made prior to the event they are predicting.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The TV show "The Simpsons" predicted the death of George Floyd.

title: Did the Internet Go Dark in D.C. During White House Protests?
subtitle: The origin of the rumor - that internet and cell service went dark during police brutality protests near the White House - can be traced to a single Twitter account.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Internet and cell service for people protesting police brutality in Washington, D.C., turned off for a temporary "blackout" on June 1.

title: Does This Picture Show Hitler Holding a Bible?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump's use of force to clear an area in front of a church occupied by protesters drew comparisons to world dictators.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Adolf Hitler holding a bible in a crowd.

title: Is ProtestJobs.com a Real Service for Hiring Protesters?
subtitle: "Most in the FAKE NEWS media will claim there's no such thing as a paid liberal protester."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Professional protesters can be hired through the website ProtestJobs.com.

title: Is This an Instruction Manual for George Floyd Protesters?
subtitle: Democrats, antifa, and George Soros are the usual bogeymen claimed to be behind liberal political protests.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Images show a "riot" manual for protesters issued by Democrats.

title: Did Derek Chauvin Commit Suicide in Prison?
subtitle: Junk news in, junk news out.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin committed suicide in his prison cell.

title: Is This a Real Anarchist Recruitment Flyer?
subtitle: "We condemn those who would undermine our democracy by spreading lies to our fellow citizens"
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image shows a recruitment flyer for a group seeking to hire "professional anarchists."

title: Did Trump Tweet George Floyd's Family Was 'Honored to Hear from Me'?
subtitle: Controversy over the Minnesota man's death was stoked in a fake tweet attributed to President Donald Trump.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump tweeted that George Floyd's family was "honored to hear from me."

title: Does This Video Show 'Child Militia' Deployed in Atlanta?
subtitle: A short, sketchy social media video created a misleading impression of forces called out to deal with protests in Atlanta.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows 'child militia' members deployed during protests in Atlanta.

title: Did Barron Trump Wear an 'I Miss Obama' Shirt in This Photo?
subtitle: Plain T-shirts are a common target of photo-editing pranksters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. President Donald Trump's son Barron wearing an "I Miss Obama" shirt.

title: Did Trump Praise Then-Minneapolis Cop Derek Chauvin at Rally?
subtitle: Chauvin has been blamed for the death of George Floyd, who died after the Minneapolis police officer kneeled on his neck, choking him.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Derek Chauvin, whom news reports identified as the cop who kneeled on the neck of George Floyd before he died, was honored for his service by U.S. President Donald Trump at a 2019 rally.

title: No, Trump Didn't Murder a Woman Named Carolyn Gombell
subtitle: It's amazing (and kind of terrifying) how easy it is to spread baseless rumors.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump murdered a woman named Carolyn Gombell in 2000.

title: Is This a Sand-Covered Highway to Dubai During the COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: It's definitely difficult to photograph a place that doesn't exist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a vacant, sand-covered highway to Dubai during COVID-19 stay-at-home orders.

title: Did 59 People Die After Pastor Gave Them Dettol To Drink To Prevent Coronavirus?
subtitle: An old story was given a coronavirus twist and recirculated on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Some 59 people died after a pastor gave them Dettol to drink to supposedly prevent coronavirus.

title: Did CBS News Use a 2016 Ukraine Photo in COVID-19 Coverage?
subtitle: Unverified, random tweets are not regarded as reliable sources by real journalists.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: CBS News tried to pass off a photograph taken in Ukraine in 2016 as a picture of a U.S. child afflicted with a coronavirus-related disease in 2020.

title: Did Trump Tweet That He 'Sacrificed a Lot To Be Your President'?
subtitle: Memorial Day is for honoring and mourning the military personnel who have died while serving in the U.S. armed forces.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump tweeted over the 2020 Memorial Day weekend that he 'sacrificed a lot to be your president.'

title: Will Hand Sanitizer Combust If Left in a Hot Car?
subtitle: Hand sanitizer is definitely flammable ... but enough to start a car fire?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A bottle of hand sanitizer will spontaneously combust if left in a hot car.

title: Did CNN 'Put a Black Guy's Head on a White Dude' in Arrest Video?
subtitle: The video recorded outside a shopping mall after a knife attack in 2019 shows officers using a Taser on a suspect.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: CNN altered the appearance of a white suspect under arrest to make him appear to be black in a video clip.

title: Is Facebook Charging a User Fee?
subtitle: Some rumors never die - they just grow new heads.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: Facebook will soon begin charging users per message unless they forward a text to 10 contacts to prove they are "avid" users.

title: Is This Obama's Official White House Portrait?
subtitle: This wasn't the first time the painting was mistaken as an official White House portrait.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former U.S. President Barack Obama's official White House portrait was circulated online in May 2020.

title: Did Bill Gates Brief the CIA in 2005 About a Mind-Altering Vaccine?
subtitle: A years-old hoax recirculated in 2020 - this time with Gates' name attached to it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Microsoft Co-Founder Bill Gates briefing the CIA in 2005 about a mind-altering vaccine.

title: Are Non-Respirator Masks Ineffective at Protecting Against COVID-19?
subtitle: The CDC recommends that members of the public use simple cloth face coverings in public settings to help slow the spread of the virus.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph of non-respirator ear loop mask packaging demonstrates that such masks are ineffective at protecting against the spread of COVID-19.

title: Did Teen Activist Greta Thunberg Tell China to Stop Using Chopsticks?
subtitle: Some activists have noted the adverse impact disposable chopsticks have on the environment.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Environmental activist Greta Thunberg urged China to ban the use of chopsticks.

title: Is 'COV-19' Inscribed on This Piece of 5G Equipment?
subtitle: An old piece of television equipment was used to further a conspiracy theory about 5G and COVID-19.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a piece of 5G equipment with "COV-19" inscribed on it.

title: Did COVID-19 Kill Chuck Norris?
subtitle: Norris, now 80, has been a frequent subject of hoaxes over the years.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Martial arts movie star Chuck Norris has died from the COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Is This a Real Time Magazine Cover: 'Time to Go'?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump has appeared on the cover of Time magazine dozens of times.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image shows a Time magazine cover playing on the magazine's name by appending "... to go" to the word "Time" and showing U.S. President Donald Trump exiting through a doorway.

title: Did Pelosi Promise to Resign If Trump Is Re-Elected?
subtitle: This story originated on a website that calls its content satire but has since been reproduced as straight news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she would resign if President Donald Trump were re-elected in 2020.

title: Are the Unvaccinated Being Forcibly Rounded up in Oklahoma?
subtitle: An outdated conspiracy video about FEMA camps and vaccines gained new life amid 2020 pandemic worries.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The government in Oklahoma is planning to detain people unless they can show proof of vaccination.

title: Are Democratic Legislators 'Giddy' Over COVID-19 Economic Fallout?
subtitle: A classic example of what's called "copypasta" spreading unfounded rumors on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An anonymous person witnessed Democratic legislators in Washington, D.C., "giddy" over the economic fallout during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.

title: Are Vegetarians Safe from COVID-19?
subtitle: A claim alleges the World Health Organization found that vegetarians are unaffected by COVID-19 because the virus survives in animal fat.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Vegetarians are unaffected by COVID-19 because the virus is passed on through eating meat.

title: Did AOC Say 'It's Okay to Eat Pets' if Food Runs Scarce?
subtitle: Inflammatory, fabricated quotes have been making their way around social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said it's "okay to eat pets" if food runs scarce.

title: Do Flu Vaccines Increase Your Risk of Testing Positive for COVID-19?
subtitle: Anti-vaccine advocates, including Dr. Rashid Buttar, have seized on the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic to spread misinformation.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: People vaccinated for seasonal influenza face higher chances of catching SARS-COV-2, which causes COVID-19, or testing positive for the virus when they do not actually have it.

title: Is This a Photo of Trump with Osama bin Laden?
subtitle: It's difficult to believe that bin Laden took time to pop over to New York to attend black tie affairs.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump posing with terrorist Osama bin Laden.

title: Did Pelosi Tell Seniors, 'You Are Not Entitled to Social Security! It's Gone!'?
subtitle: The U.S. House Speaker is the frequent target of inflammatory fake quotes.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi told senior citizens, "You're not entitled to social security! It's gone!"

title: Did Trump Tweet That Obama 'Had 8 Years to Prepair the Next President for a Pandemic'?
subtitle: A false Republican talking point was encapsulated in a fake tweet attributed to President Donald Trump.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted that Barack Obama "had 8 years to prepair the next president for a pandemic and he failed."

title: Are Democrats Trying To Remove the National Anthem from Sporting Events?
subtitle: Another fake headline apparently designed to generate real outrage.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: House Democrats are voting to bar the playing of the U.S. national anthem prior to sporting events.

title: Did the Obama Administration Fail to Prepare a Pandemic 'Game Plan'?
subtitle: Tactics and key policy decisions were laid out in a 69-page National Security Council playbook on fighting pandemics put together in 2016.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Obama administration left behind no playbook for dealing with pandemics for the next administration.

title: Is California Separating Children from Parents Who Have COVID-19?
subtitle: Someone apparently was hell-bent on scaring families with false rumors during the already stressful coronavirus pandemic.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A letter from California authorities warns that residents who receive state assistance benefits will no longer be eligible for them if they don't get tested for COVID-19; further, if parents test positive, children in their household who test negative will be placed in temporary foster care until their parents/guardians recover.

title: Does H.R. 6666 Authorize Removing COVID-19 Patients from Their Homes?
subtitle: Viral posts claimed that proposed legislation by U.S. Rep. Bobby Rush would supersede constitutional rights during the coronavirus disease pandemic.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The COVID-19 Testing, Reaching, And Contacting Everyone (TRACE) Act, or H.R. 6666, would authorize federally administered COVID-19 testing groups to enter American homes and force testing against residents' will, and then "take" those who test positive to quarantine sites.

title: Can You Defy Pandemic Shutdown Orders and Collect Damages?
subtitle: Involuntary measures to control disease have a long history in North America.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pandemic-related shutdown orders are unconstitutional, and persons arrested for violating them can collect damages.

title: 'Plandemic': Was Judy Mikovits Arrested Without a Warrant and Jailed Without Charges?
subtitle: The factually-challenged film
is a social media hit with groups such as anti-vaxxers and QAnon conspiracy theorists.
author: David Mikkelson
