statement: Researcher Judy Mikovits was arrested without a warrant and jailed without charges for making a controversial scientific discovery.

title: Did Pence Deliver Empty PPE Boxes to a Rehabilitation Center?
subtitle: The vice president had made a joke about carrying an empty box for the news cameras.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Vice President Mike Pence was filmed delivering empty boxes that were supposed to be filled with personal protective equipment to a rehabilitation center in Virginia.

title: Did Costco Post This Sarcastic Reply to a Customer on Facebook?
subtitle: Costco's requiring customers to wear face masks in its stores during the coronavirus pandemic has raised hackles - and questions about one brazen Facebook comment.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The official Costco Facebook page sarcastically told "Sharon" that her opposition to wearing a mask in its stores would someday be the subject of a documentary.

title: Is This Microsoft Logo/Coronavirus Crop Circle Real?
subtitle: You don't need a field to create a crop circle hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a genuine crop circle resembling a logo for Microsoft Windows and the "crown" shape associated with coronaviruses.

title: Did Trump Say COVID-19 Deaths Wouldn't Hurt Anyone as Much as Himself?
subtitle: During an ABC News interview, the president spoke about reopening the U.S. and what he'd say to those who lost loved ones to the coronavirus disease.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: When U.S. President Donald Trump was asked what he'd say to people who lost family members to COVID-19, he replied, "I would say this didn't hurt anyone as much as it hurt me."

title: Is This a Large Flock of Flamingos in a Venice Canal?
subtitle: A massive flamboyance of flamingos was spotted during the COVID-19 pandemic, but this isn't it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a flock of flamingos crowding the Grand Canal in Venice, Italy.

title: Was a Baseball Game Won by a Score of 21/2-2?
subtitle: Just how much faith do you place in an unbelievable anecdote told by a wag known as "Wild Bill"?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A baseball player using an axe as a bat cut the ball in two with his swing and knocked half of it over the fence, scoring half a run and winning the game.

title: Is Kansas City Ordering Churchgoers To Register with the Government?
subtitle: Sensational headlines suggested the city was singling out churches for heavy-handed surveillance during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Churches are required by the local government to record and register lists of attendees for tracking purposes in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Is a Global Conspiracy Promoting Remdesivir Over Hydroxychloroquine for Treating COVID-19?
subtitle: A sprawling conspiracy theory holds that numerous individuals and organizations schemed to promote Remdesivir over a drug that the U.S. president has touted.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A sprawling conspiracy theory proves numerous individuals and organizations schemed to promote the drug Remdesivir as a COVID-19 treatment over the purportedly highly effective Hydroxychloroquine.

title: Was This Letter Written by F. Scott Fitzgerald in Quarantine?
subtitle: Apparently all jokes need disclaimers.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A letter was written by F. Scott Fitzgerald in 1920 while the author was quarantined in France during the "Spanish influenza" pandemic.

title: Is Canine Coronavirus Vaccine Proof that COVID-19 Vaccine Should Exist?
subtitle: The misunderstanding seems to stem from the word "coronavirus" and how it pertains to a family of viruses.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: A viral photograph showing a canine coronavirus vaccine demonstrates that there should already exist a human vaccine for COVID-19.

title: Did the CDC Significantly 'Readjust COVID-19 Death Numbers'?
subtitle: The COVID-19 "death rate" reported by the CDC goes up with the passage of time, and it has not been substantially revised downwards.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The CDC readjusted the COVID-19 death toll from 60,000 down to 37,000.

title: Is This a Photograph of Biden with Tara Reade?
subtitle: Tara Reade, who worked as an assistant helping manage interns for Biden's Senate office in 1993, has made an allegation of sexual assault against the former vice president.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Joe Biden with Tara Reade, a woman Biden claims he "never met" who has accused him of sexual assault.

title: Is 'Center for Global Human Population Reduction' Inscribed on a Gates Foundation Building?
subtitle: A doctored image was used to promulgate an old conspiracy theory about Bill Gates.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the words "Center for Global Human Population Reduction" inscribed on a Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation building.

title: Did CNN Remove 'Larry King Live' Episode Featuring Tara Reade's Mother from Google Play?
subtitle: How many assumptions can one draw from a single screenshot?
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN removed a "Larry King Live" episode featuring Tara Reade's mother from the Google Play service.

title: Does an 1866 Court Case Bar States from Enforcing Social-Distancing Regulations?
subtitle: States may in fact use police powers to protect the health, safety, and welfare of persons within their borders.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The 1866 "Ex parte Milligan" precludes states from enforcing regulations that prevent residents from freely traveling or earning a living.

title: Did Elisa Granato Die from COVID-19 Trial Vaccination?
subtitle: The scientist was one of the first people in the U.K. to be administered a trial vaccine for the coronavirus disease.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Elisa Granato died shortly after being administered a trial vaccine for COVID-19.

title: Did Nobel Laureate Tasuku Honjo Say COVID-19 Was 'Man-Made'?
subtitle: Unlike new viruses, quotes can be manufactured with ease.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nobel laureate Dr. Tasuku Honjo said that COVID-19 was "man-made" at a lab in Wuhan, China.

title: Is This 'Barack + Hussein + Obama = COVID-19' Protest Sign Real?
subtitle: The math in this image isn't the only thing that's off.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a person holding a protest sign claiming that the number of characters in "Barack Hussein Obama" add up to the "19" in COVID-19.

title: Did Nancy Pelosi Visit Wuhan in November 2019?
subtitle: Pelosi did take part in a Congressional delegation to China in November -- but in 2015, not 2019.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Nancy Pelosi visited Wuhan, China, in November 2019, just a month before the COVID-19 outbreak there.

title: Are These Real Signs Carried by COVID-19 Anti-Lockdown Protesters?
subtitle: Demonstrators in many different U.S. cities protested that COVID-19 social-distancing restrictions were unnecessary or had continued for too long.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows protest signs carried by demonstrators calling for the loosening of COVID-19 social-distancing restrictions.

title: Did Trump Say 'Hundreds' of Governors Are Calling Him Amid COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: The USA has only 50 governors.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said "hundreds" of governors are calling him amid the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.

title: Are Bill Gates and the ID2020 Coalition Using COVID-19 To Build Global Surveillance State?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists misrepresent Bill Gates' funding of vaccination and digital-identity research as evidence of a nefarious global surveillance plan foretold in the Book of Revelation.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Bill Gates -  along with a coalition dubbed "ID 2020" - seeks to "microchip" the world population using a COVID-19 vaccine.

title: Did Country Singer Joe Diffie Die from Lung Cancer?
subtitle: The country music star passed away on March 29, 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The cause of country music star Joe Diffie's death was lung cancer.

title: Did the News Media Fake Photos of Jacksonville Beaches?
subtitle: Jacksonville-area journalists were accused of lying to the public about photographs of the Jacksonville Beach partial re-opening during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: News reports used photographs taken in a different time or place to illustrate articles about the opening of Jacksonville beaches in April 2020.

title: Are CDC Guidelines for Reporting COVID-19 Deaths Artificially Inflating Numbers?
subtitle: An opinion issued by a doctor serving in Minnesota's Legislature gained traction with right-wing news outlets.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's guidelines for listing COVID-19 on death certificates in the absence of a test are resulting in a case overcount.

title: Did Trump Tweet in 2009 That He Would 'Never Let Thousands of Americans Die From a Pandemic'?
subtitle: Seems like there's a tweet for everything ... but that doesn't make it real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted in November 2009 that "Obama's handling of this whole pandemic has been terrible!" and that he "would never let thousands of Americans die from a pandemic while in office."

title: Did the Same Person 'Die Twice' from COVID-19?
subtitle: Many people do more than one thing, in different places, during their lifetimes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Newspaper accounts reported two different deaths from COVID-19 for the same person.

title: Did Pelosi Say Trump Can't Hold Power Because He's One of the 'Common People'?
subtitle: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is the frequent target of hoaxes and misleading memes.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said that the political class wouldn't accept U.S. President Donald Trump among its ranks because he isn't a "vetted politician" and is among the "common people."

title: Did Michigan's Governor Ban the Sale of American Flags?
subtitle: This outrage isn't going to stir itself.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer banned the sale or purchase of American flags during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did 7 Children Die in Senegal from COVID-19 Vaccine?
subtitle: This is the false rumor you get when you mix a door-to-door salesman, a health ministry T-shirt, and growing concern over the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Seven children in Senegal died after being administered a COVID-19 coronavirus disease vaccine in April 2020.

title: Should Fabric Masks Be Sanitized in a Microwave?
subtitle: Experts do not recommend heating up your personal protective gear like leftovers.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Microwaving fabric masks is a good way to sanitize them for reuse.

title: Is Mike Pence Waving a Confederate Flag in This Photo?
subtitle: No, but the original version of the photograph stirred up its own controversy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. Vice President Mike Pence waving a Confederate flag.

title: Is Bill Gates Being Sued by India Over Vaccination Deaths?
subtitle: A fresh meme resurrected and combined some stale claims that we had already investigated at length.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bill Gates is being sued by India over the deaths of girls resulting from vaccinations.

title: Did the New York Jets Sign Colin Kaepernick?
subtitle: Parody news sometimes looks just like real news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The New York Jets have signed quarterback Colin Kaepernick to a one-year, $9 million contract.

title: Did Walmart Introduce a Staggered Shopping Schedule?
subtitle: No, but Walmart and other stores have set aside dedicated shopping hours for senior citizens.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A meme details a "staggered shopping schedule" implemented by Walmart during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Will Your Coronavirus Stimulus Check Count Against Your 2020 Tax Refund?
subtitle: While the stimulus payment is technically a tax credit, its categorization as such was made only so the government could disburse payments using the IRS' existing infrastructure.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Coronavirus stimulus payments, termed "Economic Impact Payments," are taxable and could reduce your 2020 tax refund.

title: Did AOC Commit a Felony by Making a False Accusation Against Trump?
subtitle: One cannot break laws that do not exist.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez committed a felony by making a false accusation against President Trump.

title: No, This Is Not a Phone Number for Tracking Your Coronavirus Stimulus Payments
subtitle: The IRS has not announced if Americans will be able to track the status of their stimulus payments as they do federal income tax refunds.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An 800 phone number can be used for tracking the status of coronavirus economic stimulus payments.

title: Are Thieves Handing Out Masks With Chemicals That Make You Pass Out?
subtitle: Memes exploiting fear over the ongoing coronavirus pandemic have been widespread on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Thieves are exploiting the coronavirus pandemic by dousing masks in chemicals that render people unconscious and then robbing them.

title: Did the TV Show 'My Secret Terrius' Predict Coronavirus?
subtitle: COVID-19 is caused by a coronavirus, but not all coronaviruses cause COVID-19.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The television show "My Secret Terrius" predicted the 2020 COVID-19 outbreak.

title: Is This a Text from an NHS Worker?
subtitle: A viral hoax warned against going out to buy bread, of all things, during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A National Health Service worker warned against going out to buy necessities, even bread, when COVID-19's infection "peak" hits "tomorrow."

title: Does George Soros Own a Lab That 'Developed' COVID-19?
subtitle: Somehow, some way, business magnate George Soros gets accused of being involved in almost every politically contentious event.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Financier George Soros owns the lab in Wuhan, China, where the COVID-19 coronavirus disease was "developed."

title: Are Danske Bank Customers Being Specifically Targeted Via Text?
subtitle: A circulating text message warning about a scam was itself fraudulent.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Law enforcement officials and Danske Bank are cautioning that a "smishing" scam is taking money directly out of people's bank accounts.

title: Did the House Give Itself a $25M Raise in Coronavirus Aid Bill?
subtitle: Rumors claimed that U.S. representatives were using coronavirus aid legislation to give themselves a pay raise.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act included a $25 million raise for members of the U.S. House of Representatives.

title: Were Ventilators Found 'Stashed' in a Warehouse in New York?
subtitle: Social media posts painted a misleading picture about the plan for distributing ventilators amid the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democrats in New York stashed ventilators in a warehouse in an effort to make the COVID-19 pandemic worse.

title: Do 38 Million People Live in Seoul, South Korea?
subtitle: Seoul is home to more people than any U.S. city, but not nearly as many as President Trump claimed during a press briefing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The population of Seoul, South Korea, is about 38 million people.

title: Does This List Show 'The News System is Rigged'?
subtitle: Adding multiple false entries to an old list doesn't make it any more credible.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Additional entries to a "You Had a Hunch the News System Was Rigged?" list document several familial relationships between prominent U.S. political figures.

title: Did Schumer Delete a Tweet Criticizing Trump for Banning Air Travel from China 'Prematurely'?
subtitle: Pranksters no longer need spend time with Photoshop to create convincing fake tweets.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Sen. Chuck Schumer tweeted a criticism of President Trump for the latter's 'premature' ban of air travel from China.

title: Does This Video Show Mass Graves in Italy?
subtitle: So far as we can tell, actress Tiffani Thiessen was not working for the CDC during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows mass graves in Italy as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Can a Cattle Vaccine Be Used To Fight COVID-19?
subtitle: The confusion seems to stem from the overuse of the word "coronavirus."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A vaccine meant for cattle can be used to fight COVID-19.

title: Will Lemons and Hot Water Cure or Prevent COVID-19?
subtitle: As cures go, these ones are lemons.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Drinking hot water with lemons will cure or prevent COVID-19; drinking hot water with lemons and sodium bicarbonate will
and cure or prevent COVID-19.

title: Does COVID Stand for 'Chinese-Originated Viral Infectious Disease'?
subtitle: There are different processes and purposes for naming diseases.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: "COVID-19" is named so because it is the 19th "Chinese-Originated Viral Infectious Disease."

title: Was COVID-19 Created to Distract Us from a Doomsday Asteroid?
subtitle: Please stop.
author: Dan Evon
statement: After discovering a doomsday asteroid was approaching Earth, world leaders created the COVID-19 pandemic in an effort to distract the world population and force everyone to spend time with their families during Earth's final days.

title: Is This Mansion One of Bernie Sanders' Homes?
subtitle: Half a million bucks just doesn't buy lavish digs like this anymore.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows an opulent Vermont mansion owned by U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders.

title: Is Corona the Patron Saint of Plagues?
subtitle: St. Corona was likely martyred sometime in the 170s, but it's doubtful she was the saint of pandemics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: St. Corona is the patron saint of plagues.

title: Is This Trump's 'Congressional Reform Act of 2017'?
subtitle: This is one of those ideas that really shouldn't be passed around.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump is asking supporters to forward a message about the 'Congressional Reform Act of 2017.'

title: Did Russia Release 500 Lions To Enforce COVID-19 Lockdown?
subtitle: No, but we don't doubt the effectiveness of such a strategy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Russia released more than 500 lions to make sure that people stay inside during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Will Eating Bananas Prevent Coronavirus Infection?
subtitle: Bananas are a good source of various nutrients, but eating them doesn't offer solid protection against COVID-19.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Eating bananas is a preventative against the COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Is Teens Coughing on Produce a 'Disturbing Trend' in the US?
subtitle: A reported instance of "teens doing dumb things on social media" may be something less than a national craze.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Youngsters deliberately coughing on produce in grocery stores during the COVID-19 pandemic is a nationwide trend in the U.S.

title: Did Nostradamus Predict the COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: If only people recognized "predictions" before the calamitous events they supposedly anticipate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme replicates a Nostradamus prophecy foretelling the 2020 COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.

title: Did Trump Tweet He'd Deny Stimulus Checks to Any Who Used #NotMyPresident?
subtitle: Fake Trump tweets were just the tip of the iceberg as misinformation swirled during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted that economic stimulus checks would only go to those who have not made negative social media comments about him.

title: Did President Trump Say 'People Are Dying Today That Have Never Died Before'?
subtitle: A number of hoaxes have circulated amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Referring to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, U.S. President Donald Trump said, "People are dying today that have never died before."

title: Was Oprah's Home Raided in a Sex-Trafficking Sting?
subtitle: This rumor about Oprah Winfrey was a sliver of a much larger conspiracy theory spreading dangerous lies about the coronavirus.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Oprah Winfrey's home was raided as part of a sex-trafficking sting.

title: No, a Hair Dryer Won't Stop Coronavirus
subtitle: A viral video that claims breathing hot air from a hair dryer could cure COVID-19 demonstrates a basic and dangerous lack of understanding about science.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Using a hair dryer to breathe in hot air can cure COVID-19 and stop its spread.

title: Does Using Hand Sanitizer Pose a Danger to Pets?
subtitle: Ethylene glycol, used in antifreeze, is indeed extremely poisonous to animals. But does hand sanitizer actually contain this chemical?
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Hand sanitizer is a threat to pets because it contains an ingredient also found in antifreeze.

title: Can You Get Free Baby Formula During COVID-19 Crisis by Calling the Company?
subtitle: You can't conjure up a giveaway out of thin air.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Parents can receive a case of baby formula during the COVID-19 pandemic by calling the number on the back of the company's product.

title: Did MSNBC Reporter Say 'I Hope Coronavirus Kills People and Hurts Trump's Reelection'?
subtitle: This false rumor demonstrates how one subtle video edit can achieve a huge deception.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An MSNBC reporter said on air: "I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump's reelection."

title: Is White House Invoking the Stafford Act to Impose a Quarantine and Mobilize the National Guard?
subtitle: Announcements of a "national lockdown" or "mandatory quarantine" would not be made via viral text messages.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The White House sent out text messages in mid-March 2020 informing people that a "mandatory quarantine" in U.S. would start within 48 hours.

title: Will Gargling with Salt Water or Vinegar 'Eliminate' the COVID-19 Coronavirus?
subtitle: What works for colds is unlikely to help an already-infected person stave off the COVID-19 coronavirus disease.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Gargling with salt water or Vinegar 'eliminate' the COVID-19 coronavirus from the throat of an infected person's system.

title: Did Costco Issue a Recall Notice for Toilet Paper?
subtitle: Even if COVID-19 hasn't infected the entire population, a mania for buying bathroom tissue apparently has.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Costco has issued a recall for their Kirkland Signature brand of bath tissue.

title: Is This Train Car Carrying 'COVID-19'?
subtitle: It's puzzling why more conspirators aren't caught when they operate so brazenly.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a railroad tank car identified as carrying 'COVID-19.'

title: Was Tom Hanks Given a Wilson Volleyball in Coronavirus Quarantine?
subtitle: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson truly did announce they had tested positive for the new coronavirus in March 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Staff at Gold Coast Hospital in Australia rolled in a Wilson volleyball to keep Tom Hanks company in quarantine after he was diagnosed with the coronavirus.

title: Does Trump Own Stock in a Company CDC Uses for COVID-19 Tests?
subtitle: The U.S. president's finances are complex, but does Donald Trump actually benefit from the CDC's testing procedures for the new coronavirus?
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Donald Trump owned stock in Thermo-Fisher Scientific at a time when his presidential administration was advocating for a COVID-19 test that uses Thermo-Fisher equipment.

title: Did US House Speaker Pelosi 'Hold Back' Coronavirus Funding?
subtitle: The blame game for coronavirus response is on, but some claims aren't always accurate.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi held up a coronavirus funding package so that Democrats could run negative ads about Republicans that made the latter look bad.

title: Will Sipping Water Every 15 Minutes Prevent a Coronavirus Infection?
subtitle: This "serious excellent advice by Japanese doctors treating COVID-19 cases" is not all that excellent.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Taking a few sips of water every 15 mins will prevent the new coronavirus from entering your windpipe and lungs.

title: No, Holding Your Breath is Not a 'Simple Self-Check' for Coronavirus
subtitle: Take a deep breath and consult the CDC or WHO's latest guidance before following any coronavirus "advice" from random sources on social media.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: If you can hold your breath without coughing, discomfort, stiffness, or tightness, your lungs do not suffer from fibrosis and therefore you have no COVID-19 infection.

title: Was COVID-19 Found in Packages of Toilet Paper?
subtitle: The last thing readers needed amid the 2020 coronavirus pandemic was fiction disguised as "news."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) announced that COVID-19, a disease caused by the coronavirus, had been found in toilet paper, and that people should use wet cloths instead.

title: Will Garlic Water Cure Coronavirus?
subtitle: On the plus side, this "treatment" might help keep away others who could potentially infect you.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Drinking boiled garlic water will cure COVID-19.

title: Does Daniel Radcliffe Have Coronavirus?
subtitle: An imposter Twitter account spread misinformation amid a 2020 outbreak of the new coronavirus.
author: Dan Evon
statement: BBC News reported that actor Daniel Radcliffe was the "first famous person" to contract the coronavirus.

title: No, Joe Biden Didn't Bury a Dog on Stage at a Campaign Rally
subtitle: Purveyors of misinformation often present ruses as if they originated from credible outlets.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden buried a dog after it wandered on stage during a campaign rally.

title: Was Bold Drugstore Shoplifting Incident in SF Due to 'No Arrest' Policy?
subtitle: Video of a brazen crime in the Bay Area wasn't what some people on social media claimed it to be.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A brazen drugstore shoplifting incident in San Francisco was the result of some kind of "no arrest" policy or state Proposition 47.

title: Could Bloomberg Give Each American $1M with Money He Spent on Ads?
subtitle: A bogus tweet was uncritically amplified on MSNBC.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg could have given each American $1 million for the amount of money he spent on political ads during his 2020 U.S. presidential campaign.

title: Can a Homemade Tito's Vodka Hand Sanitizer Help Stem Coronavirus?
subtitle: As the coronavirus spread in 2020, a fierce outbreak of bad advice took hold online.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A homemade hand sanitizer made with Tito's Vodka can be used to fight the new coronavirus.

title: Will an Asteroid Hit Earth in April 2020?
subtitle: Clickbait headlines continue to stoke fears about "doomsday asteroids."
author: Dan Evon
statement: NASA warned that Asteroid 52768 (1998 OR2) could hit Earth in April 2020 and cause catastrophic danger.

title: Did the Vatican Confirm Pope Francis Had Coronavirus?
subtitle: An unreliable website furthered rumors about the pontiff's health in early 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In February 2020 the Vatican said that Pope Francis and two aides had tested positive for COVID-19, a disease caused by a new coronavirus.

title: Does 'Every Election Year' Have a Coinciding Disease?
subtitle: A conspiratorial meme about disease outbreaks got a number of key facts wrong.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A major disease outbreak occurred in "every election year" since 2004.

title: Did Obama Declare Swine Flu an Emergency Only After 'Millions' Were Infected?
subtitle: Not all "fact checks" are created equal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Barack Obama waited until millions were infected and thousands were dead before declaring a public health emergency concerning swine flu, the H1N1 virus.

title: Did US Sen. Graham Say Trump Knows More Than CDC About Medicine?
subtitle: The senator defended President Donald Trump's handling of the new coronavirus outbreak, but he didn't go this far.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham said, "President Trump probably knows more about medicine and specifically viruses than any of the so-called scientists at the NIH and CDC."

title: Did Corona Beer Sales Drop Sharply Due to Fear About the Coronavirus?
subtitle: A trope that suggests people are so dumb they think the beer and virus are related played out in some news reports.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Sales of Corona beer dropped sharply in early 2020 because consumers mistakenly associated the brand name with the new coronavirus.

title: No, Quaden Bayles Did Not Commit Suicide
subtitle: Hoax social media posts attempted to lure clicks from unsuspecting users with yet another false report about a bullied boy.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The BBC reported in February 2020 that Quaden Bayles had committed suicide.

title: Does This Photo Show a Real Storm Over Paris?
subtitle: Brent Shavnore is a digital artist who often combines two or more photographs to create remarkable images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a large storm looming over Paris, France.

title: Was the TV Show 'Blue Bloods' Canceled?
subtitle: Questions about the status of the popular crime procedural circulated on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The TV drama "Blue Bloods" was canceled in February 2020.

title: Was Joe Biden Arrested in South Africa in the 1970s?
subtitle: The former vice president has repeatedly claimed to have been arrested while attempting to visit the incarcerated Nelson Mandela. The facts show otherwise.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: During a visit to South Africa in the 1970s, then-U.S. Sen. Joe Biden was arrested while attempting to visit Nelson Mandela in prison.

title: Did US Senate Fail to Acquit Trump Because There Wasn't a 'Real' Trial?
subtitle: Trump's impeachment trial in the U.S. Senate was a source of controversy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Trump wasn't really acquitted of articles of impeachment brought by the U.S. House because he didn't have a "real" trial with new witnesses and documents in the U.S. Senate.

title: Do Sulfur Emissions from Wuhan, China, Point to Mass Cremation of Coronavirus Victims?
subtitle: A data map that appeared in a popular Twitter thread did not show what some people claimed.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Satellite data show a large release of sulfur dioxide gas from the outskirts of Wuhan, China, and could be viewed as evidence of the mass cremation of new coronavirus victims.

title: Did Sanders Propose Raising Taxes to 52% on Incomes Over $29,000?
subtitle: A popular meme appears to have conflated two different tax proposals from the 2020 Democratic presidential candidate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders' health care plan proposes to raise the tax rate to 52% on incomes over $29,000.

title: Is Quaden Bayles 18 Years Old?
subtitle: After receiving financial support from a wide range of celebrities, a bullied boy with dwarfism was accused of lying about his age.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Quaden Bayles is an 18-year-old man who lied about being a 9-year-old boy with dwarfism to scam the internet for money.

title: Did a Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveal the 'Truth About the Coronavirus Outbreak'?
subtitle: A piece of horror fiction was a little too believable for some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Chinese intelligence officer revealed that a new coronavirus was developed in a lab as a bioweapon.

title: Natalia Bryant Death Hoax: Kobe's Daughter Didn't Die By Suicide
subtitle: Fraudsters continue to capitalize on the sudden death of Kobe Bryant by publishing misinformation about his family.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kobe Bryant's daughter Natalia Bryant died by suicide in February 2020.

title: Did Chinese Doctors Confirm African People Are Genetically Resistant to Coronavirus?
subtitle: Misinformation about the coronavirus outbreak seems to have traveled farther than the virus itself.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Chinese doctors confirmed that African people are "genetically resistant" to new coronavirus.

title: Is Trojan Selling Pre-Owned Condoms?
subtitle: While many companies are trying to be more green by recycling and reusing materials, there doesn't appear to be much of a market for used condoms.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Trojan's latest product: pre-owned condoms.

title: Does This Photo Show Trump's and Bloomberg's Height Disparity?
subtitle: The measure of a man can be deceptive in photographs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph highlights the height disparity between U.S. President Donald Trump and 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg.

title: Is an Asteroid Expected to Hit the Day After Valentine's Day 2020?
subtitle: A number of doomsday warnings have come and gone over the years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An asteroid is expected to hit earth in mid-February 2020.

title: Does 'Gravitational Pull' Allow Brooms to Stand on End on Certain Days?
subtitle: Whether it's an egg or a #broomtrick, the real explanation is far less exciting.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A special astronomical property allows brooms to be stood on end during particular days of the year.

title: Was a Teenaged Pete Buttigieg Arrested for Killing Dogs?
subtitle: Let's hope the next presidential campaign cycle leaves our canine companions out of it entirely.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 16-year-old Pete Buttigieg was arrested for killing several dogs.

title: Did the White House Delete an Unflattering 'Orange Face' Photo of Trump?
subtitle: A photograph posted to an unverified Twitter account sparked claims that the White House had engaged in an attempted cover-up.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The White House posted and then deleted an unflattering photograph of President Trump that displayed marked facial coloration.

title: Did Uncle Don Call Kids 'Little Bastards' on the Air?
subtitle: Unpacking an old school urban legend about an alleged "hot mic" moment in the early days of radio.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Children's radio host Uncle Don inadvertently uttered a shockingly derogatory remark about youngsters that was caught on an open mic.

title: Was Eminem Diagnosed with Coronavirus?
subtitle: Will the real author of this viral joke please stand up?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rapper Eminem was the first celebrity to be diagnosed with new coronavirus in February 2020.

title: Is China Seeking Approval to Kill 20,000 Coronavirus Patients?
subtitle: A disreputable website spread unfounded claims in the wake of a new coronavirus outbreak.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chinese officials are seeking approval to start the mass killing of 20,000 people in order to stop the spread of new coronavirus.

title: Did Bernie Sanders Express Support for Iran During '79 Hostage Crisis?
subtitle: A widely shared meme contained several key falsehoods about the independent Vermont senator's former association with the Socialist Workers Party.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: During the Iran hostage crisis, U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders expressed support for the Iranian regime of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

title: Did Biden's Campaign Demand an American Flag Be Removed from a Library?
subtitle: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden's 2020 presidential campaign was the target of a common election season smear.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden's 2020 presidential campaign forced the staff of an Iowa public library to remove an American flag.

title: Did the 'Obamacare' Website Cost $5 Billion?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump resurfaced a stale myth in the lead-up to the 2020 election.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: HealthCare.gov, otherwise known as the "Obamacare" website, cost $5 billion.

title: Is the Trump Whistleblower Dating Rep. Adam Schiff's Daughter?
subtitle: It seems unlikely that a congressman would use his own social media accounts to identify the confidential whistleblower.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Rep. Adam Schiff's daughter is dating the alleged whistleblower at the center of the impeachment hearings against President Donald Trump.

title: No, Vanessa Bryant Did Not Kill Herself After Kobe's Death
subtitle: Rumors that spread in February 2020 about the death of Kobe Bryant's widow were junk news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Vanessa Bryant died by suicide in February 2020.

title: Was Trump Turned Away from a Kansas City BBQ Restaurant?
subtitle: Three inside jokes do not make a truth.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted about being turned away by Arthur Bryant's barbecue restaurant in Kansas City.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict the Coronavirus Outbreak?
subtitle: It might be time to raise our standards for "predictions."
author: Dan Evon
statement: "The Simpsons" TV show predicted the 2020 new coronavirus outbreak in a 1993 episode.

title: Did ABC, CBS, and NBC Black Out Pam Bondi's Legal Defense of Trump?
subtitle: Although the claim that the media "blacked out" coverage of a given topic is common, it can often be misleading.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The "Big Three" networks of ABC, CBS, and NBC "blacked out" coverage of Pam Bondi's legal defense of U.S. President Donald Trump during his impeachment trial.

title: Was This 'Health Bulletin' an Accurate Coronavirus Warning?
subtitle: A viral social media post erroneously advised the public to "keep your throat moist" in order to avoid contracting the respiratory infection.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral social media post in January 2020 represented an authentic, accurate "health bulletin" about the new coronavirus outbreak from an official public health authority.

title: Did Health Experts 'Predict' New Coronavirus Could Kill 65 Million People?
subtitle: Some details from a mock health exercise were confused with real-world reports.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Health experts predicted the new coronavirus could kill 65 million people.

title: Is the 'Umbrella Corporation' Logo Oddly Similar to a Wuhan Biotech Lab's?
subtitle: Some concern arose over apparent connections between the video game "Resident Evil" and a new coronavirus outbreak.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The fictional "Umbrella Corporation" from the game "Resident Evil" shares a logo with a biotech lab in Wuhan, Hubei Province in China, where a new coronavirus is believed to have originated.

title: Did a Coronavirus Bulletin Warn Against Unprotected Sex with Farm Animals?
subtitle: You can take the virus out of the farm, but you can't ...
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A coronavirus-related health advisory graphic issued by the World Health Organization warned against unprotected sex with farm animals.

title: Is Virginia Criminalizing Dissent Against State Leaders?
subtitle: Some stories don't say what the headlines claim they do.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Virginia legislators are trying to make criticizing state leaders a criminal offense.

title: Does a So-Called 'HPCD' Cause Your Car to Use More Fuel?
subtitle: You might need reins on horses ... but a "horse power control device" on your car?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a "horse power control device" (HPCD), which is installed in automobiles to make them use more fuel than necessary.

title: Is Al Roker Leaving the 'Today' Show?
subtitle: "Today" show fans have been anxious that the popular co-host is leaving.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Al Roker is leaving the "Today" show.

title: Does This Video Show the White Island Volcano Eruption?
subtitle: Despite an abundance of eyewitness videos, misinformation found a way to capture attention.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video documents the volcanic eruption on New Zealand's White Island in December 2019.

title: Were GOP Senators Overheard Saying 'We're Up Shit's Creek' About Impeachment?
subtitle: A tweet prompted some conversation about fake conversations.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Republican senators were overheard saying they were "up shit's creek" in regards to impeachment proceedings.

title: Did Prince Charles Ignore Mike Pence at a Holocaust Commemoration?
subtitle: They really have got to stop meeting like this.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Prince Charles refused to shake hands with U.S. Vice President Mike Pence, thereby "snubbing" or expressing a negative comportment towards Pence, at an event in January 2020.

title: Did President Trump 'Return Prayer' to Public Schools?
subtitle: You can't return it if it was never gone.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump "returned prayer" to public schools.

title: Did Extinction Rebellion Post 'Drive a Car? You're a Nazi' Stickers?
subtitle: A sticker bearing the environmentalist group's logo appears to be part of a smear campaign against it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an official Extinction Rebellion sticker reading, "Driving a car? You're a Nazi."

title: Did Stephen King Place a Billboard Outside His Maine Home Targeting US Sen. Susan Collins?
subtitle: Billboards targeting the Republican senator were definitely seen near a property owned by Stephen King.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Author Stephen King placed billboards targeting U.S. Sen. Susan Collins outside his home in Bangor, Maine.

title: Did Joe Biden Say He Eats the Sticks of Corn Dogs?
subtitle: Beware of jokes disguised in realistic-looking screenshots.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Joe Biden said he eats the sticks in corn dogs.

title: Did Prince Harry and Meghan Markle Buy an RV Camper?
subtitle: Can Buckingham Palace and Windsor Castle really compete with a mobile home?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Prince Harry and Megan Markle in front of their new RV camper.

title: Did Antifa Plan to Infiltrate Virginia's Pro-Gun Rally to Stage Violence?
subtitle: Solid evidence was hard to come by.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Busloads of "antifa" infiltrators plotted to commit acts of violence at the Richmond, Virginia, pro-gun rally on MLK Day 2020.

title: Did Pelosi Use $15,000 Worth of Pens to Sign Articles of Impeachment?
subtitle: The tradition of using multiple pens to sign important legislation, and then giving those pens to the people involved, has been practiced by politicians for decades.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi used $15,000 worth of pens to sign the articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump.

title: Has Poland Banned the Building of Mosques?
subtitle: What politicians want and what the law says are not necessarily congruent.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Poland has refused to allow mosques to be constructed in that country until churches can be built in Saudi Arabia.

title: Is This Video of a 'Globular Bolt' Real?
subtitle: Scientists are still trying to figure out so-called "ball lightning."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video documents a rare "globular bolt," or "sphere lightning," as it crosses a train track.

title: Did FBI Say It Illegally Wiretapped Donald Trump and Apologize For It?
subtitle: A right-wing network grossly distorted the contents of a statement written by agency director Christopher Wray.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2020, FBI Director Christopher Wray said that the bureau had illegally wiretapped Donald Trump and apologized for it.

title: Did a Mom Beat Her Son to Death for Refusing to Dress Like a Girl?
subtitle: The tragic story of a young boy in Mexico was spread with misinformation about his death.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A young boy was beaten to death by his mother for refusing to wear girl's clothes.

title: Was Qassem Soleimani One of the American Embassy Hostage-Takers?
subtitle: The Iranian major general assassinated by the U.S. in early 2020 joined the military in 1979.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Iranian Maj. Gen. Qassem Soleimani was part of the group that stormed the American embassy in Tehran in 1979 and took 52 hostages.

title: Did the KKK March With a Trump-Pence Sign?
subtitle: This photograph is not all you need to know before you vote in 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows members of the KKK marching with a Trump-Pence presidential campaign sign.

title: No, U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar Didn't Give 'Treasonous' Military Advice to Iran
subtitle: An article by the anti-Muslim activist Robert Spencer prompted threats and incitements of violence and murder against the Minnesota congresswoman in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2020, U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar advised Iran to attack Trump-branded hotels in the world, thus committing treason.

title: Did Fox News Change Its Accreditation from 'News' to 'Entertainment'?
subtitle: There's a lot to unfold in this meme, including the fact that Fox News (and CNN and MSNBC) are not "accredited news stations" to begin with.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News changed its accreditation from "news" to "entertainment."

title: Was This Popcorn Popped With a Blowtorch and a Hairdryer?
subtitle: Most popcorn-related innovations focus on convenience.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a piece of popcorn being cooked by a blowtorch and levitated by a hairdryer before consumption.

title: Did a U.S. Navy Ship Display This Crude Message Overhead to Iran?
subtitle: An old fake photo found a new target.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: A photograph shows the words "FUCK IRAN" spelled out on the deck of a U.S. aircraft carrier.

title: Is US Army Sending Texts About a Military Draft?
subtitle: The military has been an all-volunteer force since 1973.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The U.S. Army is sending text messages informing people they've been selected for the military draft.

title: Were 'Nearly 200' People Arrested for Deliberately Starting Australia Bushfires?
subtitle: Misinformation spread wildly as bushfires devastated Australia in late 2019 and early 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: "Nearly 200" Australians were arrested in late 2019 and early 2020 for deliberately setting bushfires.

title: Does This Video Show the Drone Strike That Killed Soleimani?
subtitle: Iran Gen. Qassem Soleimani was killed by a U.S. drone strike in Baghdad on Jan. 3, 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the U.S.-ordered drone strike that killed Iran Gen. Qassem Soleimani.

title: Is This a Real Photo of Obama Shaking Hands with Iranian President Rouhani?
subtitle: Arizona U.S. Rep. Paul Gosar tweeted a fake image of a meeting between former President Barack Obama and Iran President Hassan Rouhani.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows former U.S. President Barack Obama shaking hands with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani.

title: Did Pat Robertson Say 'Nobody Is Shooting Up Churches'?
subtitle: A meme claims the televangelist once remarked that Jews could avoid slaughter if they became Christians.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pat Robertson said Jews should become Christians because "nobody is shooting up churches."

title: Did Eric Trump Tweet About Iran Strike Before It Was Made Public?
subtitle: The claim suggests the U.S. president's son was privy to information about the drone attack that killed an Iran general in January 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Eric Trump tweeted about the airstrike that killed Iran Gen. Qassem Soleimani in early 2020 before the military operation took place.

title: Is Minecraft Shutting Down?
subtitle: Internet pranks are not confined to April Fools' Day.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The popular video game Minecraft is shutting down in 2020.

title: Will Fine Steel Wool Ignite From an Incoming iPhone Call?
subtitle: There may be a few tricks up these steel wool sleeves.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an incoming call on an iPhone igniting a ring of fine steel wool placed around the cell.

title: Is Ozzy Osbourne on His Deathbed?
subtitle: His family has responded to reports about the singer's health.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Heavy metal singer Ozzy Osbourne was on his "death bed" at the start of 2020.

title: Do 4 Impossible Whoppers Daily Provide 'Enough Estrogen to Grow Boobs on a Male'?
subtitle: Beef industry publication Tri-State Livestock News does not appear to be a fan of soy-based beef substitutes.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Four Impossible Whoppers provide

title: Did Sex Traffickers in Florida Trick Motorists By Lying in the Road?
subtitle: Yet another sex trafficking scare was promoted on social media in late 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In late 2019, a pattern of incidents existed whereby motorists were tricked into stopping their cars by a person lying in the road, as part of a prevalent sex-trafficking tactic in Tampa, Florida.

title: Did US Supreme Court 'End Pelosi's Reign of Terror' with Impeachment Ruling?
subtitle: Some headlines don't quite deliver the story they say they do.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The U.S. Supreme Court has ruled against House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on impeachment.

title: Is Tom Cruise Running for President?
subtitle: Actor Tom Cruise is still running, just not for the nation's highest office.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Tom Cruise released a video announcing that he was running for U.S. president in 2020.

title: Did Virginia Governor Say He Would Cut Power, 'Have You Killed' for Not Turning Over Guns?
subtitle: Virginia state lawmakers did say they would enforce new laws around gun use.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam said the National Guard would cut power and communications before killing anyone who didn't comply with new gun legislation.

title: Were 10,150 Americans Killed by 'Illegal Immigrants' in 2018?
subtitle: Beware of bogus statistics that inflate such numbers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "Illegal immigrants" killed 10,150 Americans in 2018.

title: Does This Photo Show a Real Zebra with Menorah Stripes?
subtitle: Zebra stripes are cool ... question is whether they're THIS cool.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A viral image shows a real zebra that has stripes in the shape of a menorah.

title: Does Billionaire George Soros Fund Christianity Today Publication?
subtitle: In response to Christianity Today's blistering criticism of U.S. President Donald Trump, some readers used every weapon they could find to attack the evangelical publication.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of December 2019, Christianity Today was backed or funded by George Soros or was a "front organization" for the philanthropist.

title: Did Dozens of People Die During the Production of 'Cats' Movie?
