title: Can Asylum-Seekers Apply at U.S. Embassies Abroad?
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Non-U.S. citizens can apply for asylum from abroad at a U.S. embassy or consulate office.

title: Was the Canadian Flag Displayed Across Niagara Falls?
subtitle: A patriotic display could be seen at Niagara Falls on Canada Day 2019, but it wasn't THAT elaborate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Canadian flag displayed across Niagara Falls for Canada Day, July 1, in 2019.

title: Was 'Trump' Uttered 1,326 Times During the Democratic Debates?
subtitle: If numbers matter, this meme was only off by a thousand-plus.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The name "Trump" was spoken 1,326 times during the first 2020 Democratic Party presidential debates.

title: Did a Plane Disappear and Land 37 Years Later?
subtitle: Armed with facts, we find that the mystery of Pan Am Flight 914 isn't much of a mystery.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pan Am Flight 914 disappeared in 1955 but reappeared 37 years later and landed without incident.

title: Joe Biden Campaign Trolled with Parody Biden2020 Website
subtitle: A Republican political operative established mockingly fake websites for several Democratic presidential contenders.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The website joebiden.info is Joe Biden's official 2020 presidential campaign site.

title: Did Kamala Harris 'Lie' About Being in the Second Integrated Class in Berkeley?
subtitle: Harris claimed she was part of only the second class to integrate the Berkeley public schools.  And she was right.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Sen. Kamala Harris lied about being in the second racially integrated class at Berkeley Public Schools.

title: Does an Image Show Ocasio-Cortez Fake-Crying at a Migrant Camp?
subtitle: A picture taken in 2018 captured Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, before she was elected to the U.S. House, protesting a migrant-detention camp in Texas.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A "newly uncovered" photograph reveals Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez was crying over an empty parking lot, not detained migrant children, at a protest in Texas.

title: Is This Lobster Really Writing Numbers with a Pen?
subtitle: We'll say this much for certain ... something's fishy about this footage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a lobster writing a series of numbers with a pen.

title: Was Pelosi Escorted Out of White House After Showing Up 'Too Drunk to Speak'?
subtitle: An image from a funeral service was re-purposed for a "satire" article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi was escorted out of the White House after showing up too drunk to speak.

title: Did Kellogg's Release Ranch-Flavored Pop-Tarts?
subtitle: Pop-Tarts: "This is just disrespectful."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kellogg's released a "Ranch Pop-Tart."

title: No, Seattle Doesn't Refuse to Hose Poop from Sidewalks Because It's 'Racially Insensitive'
subtitle: A minor Seattle street-cleaning issue from mid-2017 was played up by partisan websites as if it were a major racial controversy.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The city of Seattle does not hose down sidewalks to remove human waste because the practice would be 'racially insensitive.'

title: Did a Man Named Scott Chance Disappear After Making a 911 Call?
subtitle: A mysterious 911 call isn't exactly what it seems.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Audio of a 911 call documents the final moments before the disappearance of a man named Scott Chance.

title: Is This Really a Fish With a Human Face?
subtitle: We seriously hope we're not bursting anyone's bubble with our answer.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a fish with a human face.

title: Did Gene Hackman Say Trump 'Could Easily Turn Out to Be One of the Best Presidents'?
subtitle: "As they say, time will tell."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Gene Hackman said Donald Trump 'could easily turn out to be one of the best presidents America has ever seen.'

title: Is This 'Pedosexual' Pride Sign Real?
subtitle: This is not the first bad-faith attempt to connect the LGBTQ community to pedophilia.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The new "Acceptance Street" road sign in New York City includes "pedosexual" among other sexual orientations.

title: Does a Meme Show Starving Citizens in Venezuela Eating Garbage?
subtitle: A Turning Point USA meme that claimed to showcase poverty in Venezuela co-opted an unrelated image from another time and place to do so.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A meme image shows starving citizens in Venezuela eating garbage.

title: Did Stormy Daniels Die and Leave a 'Suicide Note' with a Stunning Admission?
subtitle: That might be difficult ... the adult film actress and vocal critic of Donald Trump is alive and well.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Stormy Daniels wrote a "suicide note" admitting she lied about having an affair with Donald Trump before she committed suicide.

title: Did Denzel Washington Leave the Democratic Party Because He 'Had It with the Lies'?
subtitle: A false theme that has been online since the 2016 was given new life by junk news.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. actor Denzel Washington left the Democratic party because he "had it with the lies."

title: Did U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris Say 'White Lab Coats Are a Sign of Doctors' Racism'?
subtitle: Perhaps not surprisingly, Harris' 2020 presidential campaign is not focused on the color of lab coats.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris said that "White lab coats are a sign of doctors' racism."

title: Do Seniors on Social Security Have to Pay for Medicare While 'Illegal Immigrants' Get It Free?
subtitle: It's a familiar trope on the internet but remains factually challenged.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Senior Citizens on Social Security in the U.S. have to pay for Medicare while "illegal immigrants" get it for free.

title: Is This Couple Viewing the Apollo 8 Spacecraft Launch?
subtitle: This cheeky image is a composite of at least two different photographs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a couple watching the Apollo 8 spacecraft launch in 1968.

title: Did Police Shut Down a Nightclub for Fostering Cannibalism?
subtitle: An unreliable website shared a scare story with a xenophobic twist in June 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Police in Oregon, Singapore, Australia, and/or Trinidad and Tobago arrested a nightclub owner for killing patrons and selling them as meat.

title: What's Stephanopoulos' Height Compared to President Trump's?
subtitle: The measure of a man cannot exactly be gleaned ... from this photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the height disparity between political reporter George Stephanopoulos and U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Is Disney Making a Live-Action 'Hercules'?
subtitle: Anonymous, unverified accounts on Twitter typically aren't the best sources for reliable news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Disney is set to announce a live-action remake of the film "Hercules" at D23.

title: Is Canada About to Crack Down on Cannabis Use, Public Drinking?
subtitle: A blog with a penchant for misinformation about life in Canada published another misleading post in June 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: New prohibitions on public drinking and cannabis use "in every province of Canada" were scheduled to come into force in July 2019.

title: Is This Video of a 'Gyro Drop' Amusement Park Ride Real?
subtitle: The "Gyro Drop" is a real amusement park ride, but a popular video of it relies on some imagination.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the actual movements of a "Gyro Drop" amusement park ride.

title: Is Canada Banning Straight Marriage During Pride Month?
subtitle: This just in ... straight couples can still marry in June (or any other month) in Canada.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced that straight marriage would be banned during Pride Month.

title: Was a U.S. Tourist Arrested for Refusing to Trade His Wife to a Saudi Prince?
subtitle: The report appeared on a website whose masthead reads, 'Where facts don't matter.'
author: David Emery
statement: A U.S. tourist in Saudi Arabia was arrested for refusing to trade his wife to a prince for 45 camels.

title: Is This a Real Vintage Ad for 'Arden Weenus Meat Softener'?
subtitle: "It's scary to see something I did purely to entertain friends become someone else's reality."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A vintage ad shows a product for Arden Weenus' Cadmium-Enriched Meat Softener.

title: Did U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar Say
subtitle: Not only is the quote made up, it runs counter to several public statements Omar has made on the topic of being both Muslim and American.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar once said: "We are not here to be part of America. We are here to take over America."

title: Is This the 'Sonic' Character's New Redesign?
subtitle: Graphic artists "gotta go fast" to get Sonic the Hedgehog redesigned in time for the movie's 2020 release.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a redesign of the character "Sonic" for an upcoming movie.

title: Did Taylor Swift Humiliate a Fan for Wearing a Trump Shirt to Her Show?
subtitle: Taylor Swift isn't telling fans to spend their money on drugs rather than clothing with political messages.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Taylor Swift humiliated a fan for wearing a Trump shirt to one of her shows.

title: Was Linda Collins-Smith About to Testify Against Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: Every sudden death of an Arkansan or a politician is not somehow tied to the Clintons.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Linda Collins-Smith, a former Arkansas politician who was shot to death in June 2019, was about to testify against Hillary Clinton.

title: Does This Cat Look Like Marvel's 'Punisher' Character?
subtitle: Either version of Frank Castle -- human or feline -- is still one of our favorite Marvel characters.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a black-and-white cat with skull-like markings on its chest fur.

title: Did Authorities Discover 700 Bodies Buried in a Florida Millionaire's Yard?
subtitle: That's enough dead people to stock a whole new set of Major League baseball teams.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Authorities discovered over 700 bodies buried in the backyard of Florida millionaire Jerry Richards.

title: Was Malia Obama 'Arrested Again' Amid a Media Blackout?
subtitle: Junk news websites continue to be obsessed with the Obama family.
author: David Emery
statement: Malia Obama was arrested by campus security at Harvard for using a "white, powdery substance" in a women's restroom.

title: Does the U.S. Have the 'Cleanest Air in the World'?
subtitle: President Donald Trump raised eyebrows with a bold claim during a visit to Ireland in June 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of June 2019, the United States was ranked as having the cleanest air in the world.

title: Did the Queen Call President Trump an 'Amazing Person' with a 'Good Heart'?
subtitle: Buckingham Palace has confirmed Elizabeth II did not give a June 2019 interview which was subsequently suppressed by politically motivated journalists.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Queen Elizabeth II called U.S. President Donald Trump an "amazing person" with a "good heart" in a controversially suppressed interview in June 2019.

title: Did the Virginia Shooter Wear a MAGA Hat and Have a 'Trump 2020' Bumper Sticker?
subtitle: Motivations for the attack are still unclear.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The June 2019 Virginia Beach shooter wore a MAGA hat and had a "Trump 2020" bumper sticker on his car.

title: Did Dutch Teen Noa Pothoven Die by Euthanasia?
subtitle: A sensational error was repeated widely in English-language news reports.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Dutch teen author Noa Pothoven was voluntarily euthanized.

title: Did Albert Einstein Say 'We Are Slowed-Down Sound and Light Waves'?
subtitle: Einstein, who died in 1955, would probably be chagrined to read the many fake quotes attributed to him on the internet.
author: David Emery
statement: Albert Einstein said: "We are slowed down sound and light waves, a walking bundle of frequencies tuned into the cosmos. We are souls dressed up in sacred biochemical garments and our bodies are the instruments through which our souls play their music."

title: Did Hillary Clinton Say That If Trump Won, 'We're All Going to Hang from Nooses'?
subtitle: The supposed quote eventually became immortalized in meme form and then REALLY took off.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton said that If Donald Trump won the 2016 presidential election, 'We're all going to hang from nooses'?

title: Is This a Picture of Bill Clinton with Convicted Sex Offender George Nader?
subtitle: Two different people sharing a name does not make them the same person.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows former President Bill Clinton with convicted sex offender George Nader.

title: Was the 'Star Wars' Imperial March Played for President Trump During UK Visit?
subtitle: The Band of the Grenadier Guards played several songs during the president's visit to Buckingham Palace in spring 2019.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Band of the Grenadier Guards played the "Imperial March" from "Star Wars" during U.S. President Donald Trump's visit to Buckingham Palace.

title: Did Prince Philip Refer to Melania Trump as 'Stormy'?
subtitle: Sometimes spoof is stranger than fiction ... or it's the same thing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Prince Philip mistakenly referred to Melania Trump as 'Stormy' during the U.S. First Couple's state visit to the UK.

title: Will Woody Be Openly Bisexual in 'Toy Story 4?'
subtitle: A niche genre of 'satire' gives animated characters sexuality.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Disney has announced that the cowboy character Woody will be openly bisexual in the movie 'Toy Story 4.'

title: Did a Woman Give Birth to 17 Children at Once?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An Indianapolis woman give birth to 17 children at once.

title: Will Immersing an Egg in Soda for 24 Hours Dissolve Its Shell?
subtitle: This eggcellent eggsperiment has clearly been eggsagerated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video captures an experiment in which immersing an egg in soda for 24 hours dissolved its shell and turned the egg into a rubbery, squeezable substance.

title: Did a Politician Say 'Canadians Have to Get Used to the Fact That We Moslems Are Now in Government?'
subtitle: A fabricated quote was added to a still frame from a video of a Canadian politician's wishing the community a happy holiday.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Canadian politician said that 'Moslems' only sought leadership positions to make changes to laws that benefit the Muslim community.

title: Did Kirsten Gillibrand Call for Taxpayer-Funded Social Security for Undocumented Immigrants?
subtitle: The senator actually proposed rectifying a system that doesn't allow immigrants to pay or receive their fair share.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. senator Kirsten Gillibrand called for taxpayers to fund Social Security benefits for undocumented immigrants.

title: Did Pres. Trump Say Kim Jong Un 'Is Smarter and Would Make a Better President' Than Joe Biden?
subtitle: The president took verbal potshots at his potential 2020 Democratic rival during a May 2019 state visit to Japan.
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said: "Kim Jong Un is smarter and would make a better President than Sleepy Joe Biden."

title: Can You Tell If a Banana Is
by Looking at It?
subtitle: If the banana you are looking at came from a supermarket, it's almost certain to have been ethylene treated anyway.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The combination of green stalks and brown spots in a bunch of bananas is indicative of chemical ripening; black stalks indicate a naturally ripened banana.

title: Did the U.S. Government Warn About Bananas Contaminated with Zika?
subtitle: A junk news website produced yet another scaremongering story intended to provoke well-intentioned sharing on social media.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2017, 2018 or 2019, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned the public about a shipment of Zika-contaminated bananas.

title: Did Houston Police Arrest a Man Who Killed, Ate 30-Plus People?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news and hoax articles churned out yet another hoax, this time about the fictional "Ivan Fedorovitch Yanukovych."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Houston police arrested a man who confessed to killing and eating almost 40 people.

title: Did State Governors 'Vote to Impeach' U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news churned out yet another hoax.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In May 2019, a conference of U.S. governors voted to impeach U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, setting the table for her removal from office.

title: Did U.S. Rep. Omar Say She 'Hates Living in America,' Was 'Better Off' in Refugee Camp?
subtitle: Principled criticism of aspects of one's life in a country is not the same as expressing hatred of it.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar once said she hated living in the United States and was better off in a refugee camp in Kenya (or words to that effect).

title: Does This Video Show Nancy Pelosi Drunk and Slurring Her Speech?
subtitle: Internet propagandists manipulated a clip of the U.S. House Speaker to make it appear as though she were drunk and slurring her speech.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Nancy Pelosi drunkenly slurring her speech during an event in May 2019.

title: Are These the Youngest Parents in the World?
subtitle: An image of two young siblings holding their new baby brother or sister was attached to an unfounded claim and used as clickbait.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the youngest parents in the world.

title: Do Studies Show That Tattooed Parents Are More Likely to Neglect Their Children?
subtitle: A troll's website from 2015 named
produced dubious memes that remained alive and well years later.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Studies show that tattooed parents are more likely to abuse, neglect, and starve their children.

title: Did Actor Drew Carey Appear on TV in a MAGA Hat?
subtitle: A Fox News guest bore a striking resemblance to the host of "The Price Is Right."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Drew Carey appeared on Fox News wearing a MAGA hat and an "Off The Wall" suit.

title: Did President Trump 'Go Ballistic' on 'Fox and Friends'?
subtitle: "The Trump quote going around today is a poorly done Photoshop."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump declared on 'Fox & Friends' that 'I am in charge, this is my country, and I will do as I please.'

title: Is This a Photograph of a Young Donald Trump?
subtitle: Sometimes distorting visual reality is as easy as pushing a button.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young Donald Trump in 1952.

title: Was Canada Under an E. Coli-Related Boil Water Notice in the Spring of 2019?
subtitle: An inaccurate, partially plagiarized post on an obscure blog caused widespread concern in April and May 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Canada was placed under a nationwide boil-water notice in the spring of 2019.

title: Is an Incurable
Creating a Health Crisis at the Southern Border?
subtitle: Claims of a virulent outbreak at the U.S.-Mexico border mix inaccurate assertions from politicians with the claims of a supplement-peddling conspiracy publisher.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A form of tuberculosis dubbed
is being brought into the U.S. by immigrants crossing the Southern border.

title: Was WWE Wrestler Ric Flair Declared Brain Dead?
subtitle: Various rumors about Flair's health circulated in May 2019 after the retired wrestler was hospitalized.
author: Dan Evon
statement: WWE wrestler Ric Flair was declared brain dead on 16 May 2019.

title: Are Hazmat Suits Needed to Install 5G Cellphone Towers?
subtitle: Blurry photographs of faraway objects rarely constitute credible evidence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: People working with 5G equipment are required to use hazmat suits to protect themselves against radiation.

title: Did New Mexico Make Ramadan a State Holiday?
subtitle: Most state workers would likely welcome an extra four weeks off per year.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: New Mexico has made the Muslim observance of Ramadan a state holiday.

title: Did Joel Osteen Implement 'Prayer Request Accounts' for Parishioners?
subtitle: "God wants us to prosper financially, to have plenty of money, to fulfill the destiny He has laid out for us."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joel Osteen Ministries implemented "Prayer Request Accounts" for parishioners seeking prayers.

title: Was the 'Crocodile Hunter' Really Friends with Tupac Shakur?
subtitle: It's safe to say both men lived pretty large.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows rapper Tupac with wildlife expert Steve Irwin.

title: Did Thomas Jefferson Say 'The Government Will One Day Be Corrupt and Filled With Liars'?
subtitle: Finally, something on which the political left and right agree!
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. President Thomas Jefferson said: "The government will one day be corrupt and filled with liars, and the people will flock to the one that tells the truth."

title: Did Joe Biden Publicly Reveal the Identity of the Special-Ops Unit That Killed Bin Laden?
subtitle: In question are statements the former U.S. vice president made following the raid that killed the mastermind of the 9/11 attacks in the U.S.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Then-Vice President Joe Biden publicly revealed the identity of the special-operations unit responsible for Osama bin Laden's killing during a 3 May 2011 speech at the Atlantic Council Awards Dinner.

title: Did President Trump Say Suicide Bombers Should Get the Death Penalty?
subtitle: Maybe this news should be delivered with a wink.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said that suicide bombers should get the death penalty.

title: Did U.S. Rep. Elijah Cummings Write a Bill to Keep All of Barack Obama's Records Sealed?
subtitle: H.R. 1233 was intended to improve public access to all presidential records, not to "keep Obama's records sealed."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Rep. Elijah Cummings sponsored a bill intended to "keep all of Barack Obama's records sealed."

title: Did Bernie Sanders Say 'Christianity Is an Insult to Muslims'?
subtitle: In 2017, the U.S. senator from Vermont attacked the views of a Trump appointee who said Muslims 'do not know God' and 'stand condemned.'
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders said "Christianity is an insult to Muslims."

title: Will the Animated Character of Sonic the Hedgehog Be Transgender in a New Film?
subtitle: Sonic may have looked human in trailers for an upcoming 2019 movie, but don't expect the video game-based film to focus much on issues of gender identity.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The video game character Sonic the Hedgehog will be transgender in a new 2019 movie.

title: Was Donald Trump's IQ Measured at 73?
subtitle: Trump's IQ test results were supposedly discovered in a former New York Military Academy employee's closet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A document discovered in May 2019 reveals that Donald Trump's IQ was measured at 73 during his high school years.

title: Did the Japanese Government Ban Microwave Ovens?
subtitle: No matter what language you hear it in, this rumor is shady.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The government of Japan announced that it was banning microwave ovens' use in the country by 2020.

title: Did Actor Sean Penn Say He Was Moving to Venezuela Because Pres. Maduro Was 'Way Better Than Trump'?
subtitle: It's probably safe to say the actor would be displeased if U.S. President Donald Trump wins re-election in 2020, but would Penn leave the country?
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. actor Sean Penn said "[Venezuela President Nicolas] Maduro is way better than Trump, any day, no question about it ... If Trump wins again, I'm moving my family to Venzuela where they'll be safe!"

title: Do Women Meet With Doctors to Determine Whether to 'Execute' Newborn Babies?
subtitle: Medical professionals are reacting to an incendiary remark made by U.S. President Donald Trump in spring 2019.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Women and doctors meet to determine whether to "execute" newborn babies.

title: Were Democrats Absent from a U.S. Senate Hearing on Border Security?
subtitle: A photograph shows a bunch of empty Senate chairs during the hearing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Not a single Democrat was present during a U.S. Senate hearing on border security in April 2019.

title: Did the City of Atlanta Ask Residents Not to 'Dump Trash on White Supremacist Leaders' Properties'?
subtitle: A mysterious flyer was distributed around the Lakewood Heights neighborhood in late April 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A poster asking residents to "not dump trash on white supremacists' properties" was produced and distributed by city officials in Atlanta, Ga.

title: Did Kamala Harris Say She'd Sign an Executive Order to Confiscate Guns?
subtitle: The 2020 U.S. Democratic candidate is definitely on the record saying she wants stronger gun-control laws, but what exactly did she say?
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris said, "If elected [president] and you don't surrender your guns, I will sign an executive order and the police will show up at your door."

title: Are 'Illegal Immigrants' to Blame for Measles Outbreaks Across the U.S.?
subtitle: Some dubious websites have suggested the outbreaks are the result of immigrants who illegally crossed into the U.S. via the Southern border.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Immigrants who illegally crossed into the U.S. at the Mexico border are the cause of measles outbreaks in 2019 in the U.S.

title: Is This an 'Endangered Starry Butterfly'?
subtitle: Are we getting better at making fake creatures, or worse at recognizing real ones?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an 'endangered starry butterfly.'

title: Is This a Real Image of President Trump's Holding a 'Jesus Is King' T-Shirt?
subtitle: Shirts may rival signs as among the most photoshopped objects around.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows U.S. President Donald Trump's holding a "Jesus is King" T-shirt.

title: Is This a Real Video of the Coachella Ferris Wheel 'Dancing'?
subtitle: The ferris wheel at Coachella is definitely an engineering marvel.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the Coachella ferris wheel "dancing" as it rotates.

title: Did a California Public School District 'Teach Pedophilia as a Sexual Orientation'?
subtitle: A Christian conservative website and a group of activists in California responded with outrage to a classroom presentation's reference to the Ancient Greek custom of pederasty.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2018 or 2019, Brea Olinda Unified School District in California "taught pedophilia as a sexual orientation."

title: Did George Washington Say 'Firearms Stand Next in Importance to the Constitution Itself'?
subtitle: Always good to do some research before attributing quotes to famous historical figures.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: George Washington said, "Firearms stand next in importance to the Constitution itself."

title: Is a Sex-Trafficking Ring Adding Girls on Snapchat to Easily Locate, Kidnap Them?
subtitle: Although real cases of human trafficking are plentiful, the topic is the frequent focus of viral scarelore.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A sex-trafficking ring is using Snapchat to locate and kidnap unwitting girls into sex-trafficking operations in Lawrence, Mass.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' TV Show Predict the Fire at Notre Dame?
subtitle: "Simpsons" prediction hoaxes appear to be more common than actual Simpsons predictions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "The Simpsons" television show predicted the fire at Notre Dame Cathedral in France in April 2019.

title: Did President Trump Issue an 'Immediate Pardon' for the Arrested Border Militia Leader in NM?
subtitle: Always be on the lookout for websites that attempt to impersonate legitimate news organizations.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump issued a pardon for the leader of the armed group that held migrants at gunpoint in New Mexico.

title: Did Nancy Pelosi Remove a 150-Year-Old 'In God We Trust' Sign from the House Chamber Entrance?
subtitle: Curiously, the phrase "In God We Trust" wasn't even on paper currency in the United States 150 years ago.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nancy Pelosi removed a 150-year-old sign reading "In God We Trust" from the entrance to the U.S. House of Representatives Chamber.

title: Were Oak Trees Planted at Versailles for the Purpose of Repairing Notre Dame?
subtitle: The claim has its origins in a thinly sourced Twitter thread that provided no verification for the information it presented as fact.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Following the French Revolution, the French planted a forest of oak trees at Versailles to be used should repairs to Notre Dame ever be needed again.

title: Did Actor Keanu Reeves Save Dozens of Cats from Euthanasia?
subtitle: He may well be one of the most beloved celebrities on the internet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Keanu Reeves and dozens of cats he saved from euthanasia.

title: Did U.S. Reps. Ocasio-Cortez and Ilhan Omar Praise the Destruction of Notre Dame?
subtitle: The newly elected members of the U.S. House of Representatives are frequent targets of partisan misinformation.
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. Congresswomen Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Ilhan Omar praised the destruction of Notre Dame cathedral in a fire that broke out in April 2019.

title: Did Pat Robertson Say the Notre Dame Fire Was the Result of 'Hell Bubbling over with Homosexuals'?
subtitle: Pat Robertson definitely has a history of controversial statements.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pat Robertson said that the Notre Dame fire was the result of "hell bubbling over with homosexuals."

title: Did Donald Trump Say 'Mein Kampf' Had a 'Profound Effect' on Him?
subtitle: The same internet meme quoted Trump as saying he has 'tremendous respect' for Adolf Hitler.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump said reading "Mein Kampf" in college had a profound effect on him and he has tremendous respect for Adolf Hitler as a leader.

title: Did Nostradamus Predict the 'Descent of Man' After the Notre Dame Fire?
subtitle: A statement can only qualify as a "prediction" if it exists prior to the event it foretells.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nostradamus wrote that "when the great cathedral glows red, so will begin the descent of man."

title: Is this Santorini Holidays Vacation Giveaway in Greece Legit?
subtitle: If a free vacation offer seems too good to be true, it probably is.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Facebook page "Santorini Holidays" is giving away a free vacation on a Greek island.

title: Are These Images from the Live Action 'Lilo & Stitch' Remake?
subtitle: This concept art could earn "Lilo & Stitch" a not-so-Disney G-rating.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A set of images shows Disney's upcoming live-action remake of the movie "Lilo and Stitch."

title: Was Rapper XXXTentacion Found Alive?
subtitle: Is a reverse death hoax even more callous than a death hoax?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician XXXTentacion staged his death and was found alive on 15 April 2019.

title: Did Henry Kissinger Advocate 'Forcible Vaccinations'?
subtitle: The former U.S. secretary of state is often portrayed as a villain in online conspiracy theories.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Henry Kissinger spoke to a "eugenics council" on controlling populations through forcible vaccinations.

to death.

subtitle: "The illegal alien mother 'fleeing' from the border wall was all a lie. It was a setup."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph of a migrant mother and her children fleeing a tear gas attack near a border crossing was staged.

title: Will Simba Be a Vegan in the 'Lion King' Remake?
subtitle: Sounds like the updated version of the Disney classic will need to be a catered affair.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The character Simba will be a vegan in the 2019 remake of the Disney film "The Lion King."

title: Did Astronaut Chris Hadfield Test the Effects of Marijuana in Space?
subtitle: A photograph shows astronaut Chris Hadfield holding what looks like a bag of marijuana aboard the International Space Station.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows astronaut Chris Hadfield holding a bag of marijuana aboard the International Space Station.

title: Will Pressing 'Cancel' Twice on an ATM Prevent Your PIN from Being Stolen?
subtitle: Everyone wants to believe that following some simple piece of advice will protect them from harm.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pressing the 'CANCEL' button twice at an ATM will prevent thieves from stealing your PIN.

title: Does This Video Show a Crazily Busy Intersection?
subtitle: Perhaps bunches of vacationers other than Death are what's causing the near-problem here.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows a busy intersection with numerous pedestrians and cyclists safely weaving through a stream of vehicular traffic.

title: Does This Picture Show the Blue Angels Performing 'The Hand of God?'
subtitle: An estimated 11 million spectators view the squadron during air shows each full year.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A picture shows the Navy's Blue Angels flight demonstration squadron performing an aerial stunt called "The Hand of God."

title: Walmart Thanksgiving/Black Friday Coupon Scams
subtitle: Walmart stores are not distributing free coupons via Facebook as part of Thanksgiving or Black Friday promotions.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Walmart stores are distributing free coupons via Facebook as part of Thanksgiving or Black Friday promotions.

title: Was HHS Drug Pricing Czar Daniel Best's Death Ruled a Suicide Despite Evidence of Foul Play?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists pointed to a medical examiner's report saying Best died of 'multiple blunt force injuries.'
author: David Emery
statement: A medical examiner's conclusion that Health and Human Services drug pricing adviser Daniel Best died of multiple blunt force injuries contradicts the official ruling that he committed suicide.

title: Is This a Selfie Jimi Hendrix Took with Jim Morrison and Bruce Lee?
subtitle: You'll never be as cool as Bruce Lee and Jim Morrison chilling while Jimi Hendrix did anything.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph captures a selfie Jimi Hendrix took with Jim Morrison and Bruce Lee.

title: Did Rep. Ilhan Omar Say 'White Men Should Be Put in Chains'?
subtitle: A widely-shared meme offered a malicious quotation attributed to the Minnesota Democrat.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ilhan Omar once called for white men to be enslaved and put in chains due to their reluctance to convert to Islam.

title: Is Rain That Falls in Smoky Areas After a Wildfire Likely to Be
subtitle: The one-two combination of wildfire and rain can produce some risks, but toxic rain is not one of them.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Precipitation in smoky areas following a wildfire is likely to be extremely toxic.

title: Were 53,000 Dead People Found on Florida's Voter Rolls?
subtitle: Zombie voters, or zombie claims?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Some 53,000 dead people were found to be included in Florida's voter rolls in November 2018.

title: Was Donald Trump the First President in 56 Years Not to Visit Arlington National Cemetery on Veterans Day?
subtitle: Presidents sometimes express support for U.S. troops on Veterans Day at places other than Arlington National Cemetery.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: November 2018 marked the first Veterans Day in 56 years upon which the sitting U.S. president did not attend a wreath-laying ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Was the 'Intern' Who Took Acosta's Microphone Actually the Deputy Press Secretary?
subtitle: Who's in charge of the White House press microphone?  Internet sleuths muddied the waters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The intern who took away Jim Acosta's microphone at a White House Press Conference was actually Deputy Press Secretary Lindsay Walters.

title: Do Recent Wildfires Match Up 'Exactly' with California's Proposed High Speed Railway?
subtitle: A conspiracy theory suggests the deliberate burning of populated areas to make way for a high-speed rail system.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The November 2018 California wildfires matched up
with the route of California's proposed high speed railway.

title: Is Facebook Deleting an Image of a Cross Carved to Honor Fallen Firefighters?
subtitle: Clickbait social media posts claim Facebook has an anti-religion bias.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Facebook is deleting an image of a cross carved in honor fallen firefighters.

title: Did Donald Trump Jr. Say 'Let California Burn' Because They Voted for Democrats?
subtitle: President Trump's son purportedly proclaimed that California deserves wildfires over their political choices.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump Jr. said "let California burn" during an appearance on 'Tucker Carlson Tonight.'

title: Did 'The Grinch' Pistachio Ad Make a Crude Reference?
subtitle: A cross promotion between the new movie "The Grinch" and "Wonderful Pistachios" is genuine, but the character never stated that pistachios are "green and salty just like my nuts"
author: Dan Evon
statement: A
ad featured The Grinch touting the slogan

title: Did a 5G Cellular Network Test Cause Hundreds of Birds to Die?
subtitle: The theory that a 5G network test caused the unexplained death of birds in The Hague relies on such a test's actually having taken place.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The test of a 5G cellular network is the cause of unexplained bird deaths occurring in a park in The Hague, Netherlands.

title: Were Ewok-Like Creatures Called 'Chay Na Men' Found Near a Cave in Thailand?
subtitle: Ewoks, for the time being, can still only be found on the fictional forest moon of Endor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an alien-like creature known as the 'Chay Na' near a cave in Thailand.

title: Were Democrats Allowed to Vote Twice in Maryland's Midterm Election?
subtitle: A caller on conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' Internet talk show claimed he overheard poll workers encouraging voters to vote a second time.
author: David Emery
statement: During the November 2018 midterm elections, Democrats were allowed to vote more than once at a polling place in Hagerstown, Maryland.

title: Did Obama Have Journalist Brenda Lee Forcibly Removed from Air Force One?
subtitle: Barack Obama has possibly set a record for being the target of the most false political equivalencies.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Brenda Lee was forcibly removed from Air Force One by order of President Obama due to her pro-life views.

title: Did Broward County Record More Votes Than Registered Voters in November 2018?
subtitle: A viral meme used wildly inaccurate figures as part of a conspiracy theory about electoral fraud.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The number of ballots cast in Broward County in the 2018 general election was greater than the number of voters registered there.

title: Did the Same 'Crisis Actor' Play the Mother and Victim in Three Different Mass Shootings?
subtitle: Three women who have suffered grievously deserve more respect than to be made the subject of japes or ridiculous conspiracy musings.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The same woman appeared on television as the victim or mother of children killed in three different mass shootings.

title: Did 71 Percent of Trump's Endorsements Lose in the 2018 Midterms?
subtitle: This figure may be accurate if limited to people Trump has supported via his Twitter account, but it is not an accurate representation of how his overall list of endorsements fared.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Some 71% of Trump-endorsed candidates lost their elections in the 2018 midterms.

title: Did Senate Candidate Kyrsten Sinema Vote to 'Allow Abortions Up to Birth'?
subtitle: A pro-life web site misrepresented the pro-choice Arizona Democrat's voting record on partial-birth and late-term abortions.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. Representative Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona voted to "allow abortions up to birth."

title: Did George Soros Demand That Failed Democratic Candidates 'Pay Him Back'?
subtitle: A right-wing Facebook "fan page" riled its users up with nothing more than a picture of the liberal billionaire and an unfounded claim.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: George Soros is demanding that Democrats repay him for donations made to campaigns that were ultimately unsuccessful in 2018.

title: Did Every Candidate Barack Obama Campaigned for in 2018 Lose?
subtitle: It probably took less time to debunk this meme than it did to create it.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Every candidate Barack Obama campaigned for in 2018 lost.

title: Did the News Media Ignore a Black Conservative Event at the White House?
subtitle: A Facebook post claiming that news outlets ignored the Young Black Leadership Summit ignored several reports of attendees' encounter with President Donald Trump.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The news media ignored the Young Black Leadership Summit event held in Washington, D.C., in October 2018.

title: Was the Borderline Bar Shooter Identified as a Middle Eastern Man Named Abu Al-Hom Kreuzi?
subtitle: As a community reeled in the aftermath of a mass shooting that left 13 people dead, a baseless, Islamophobic, fear-mongering rumor about the identity of the shooter was floated online.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The shooter who killed a dozen people at a bar in California in November 2018 was identified as Abu Al-Hom Kreuzi.

title: Does This Photograph Show Barack Obama with Prince Al-Waleed bin Talal?
subtitle: Pick a photograph, create a conspiracy theory.  Repeat.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young Barack Obama with Saudi Arabian prince Al-Waleed bin Talal.

title: Was Cesar Sayoc a Lifelong Democrat Who
Covered His Van in Trump Stickers?
subtitle: The mail bombing suspect had never been a registered Democrat, and his van had been home to pro-Trump material for years.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Cesar Sayoc was a lifelong Democrat who
plastered his van with pro-Trump stickers before sending bombs to Democrats and media figures.

title: Did the Carnival Cruise Ship 'Triumph' Overturn and Sink?
subtitle: "Jokes are created by users."  But not necessarily good jokes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Carnival cruise ship 'Triumph' overturned and sank off the coast of Mexico in November 2018.

title: Did the Stickers on the Pipe-Bombing Suspect's Van Inexplicably Change After His Arrest?
subtitle: Social media users speculated that something nefarious was behind apparent changes in the displays of pro-Trump stickers on Cesar Sayoc's confiscated van.
author: David Emery
statement: Photographs and video of pipe-bombing suspect Cesar Sayoc's van taken during and after its confiscation by the FBI reveal that some of the political stickers on its windows mysteriously changed in the process.

title: Did a Starbucks Executive Say That 'White Men Are the Root of All Evil'?
subtitle: A notorious junk news web site grossly distorted comments made by Starbucks COO Rosalind Brewer.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Starbucks COO Rosalind Brewer once expressed the viewpoint that "white men are the root of all evil."

title: Is George Soros Funding U.N.-Distributed Debit Cards to Refugees?
subtitle: Conspiracy-pushing blogs seized on a  Slovenian "report" and conflated separate refugee aid programs.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: George Soros is funding the distribution of prepaid MasterCard debit cards to refugees through the U.N.

title: Was Barack Obama the First Ex-President to 'Publicly Speak Against' His Successor?
subtitle: Is there truly anything that has never been done before in U.S. politics?
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In criticizing Donald Trump, Barack Obama became the first former U.S. president to publicly "speak against" his successor.

title: Did CNN's Don Lemon Celebrate 'Blue Wave' Flag Burners?
subtitle: This is no laughing matter, literally.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Don Lemon of CNN laughed in celebration as Democrats burned American flags in support of a "blue wave."

title: Does This Photograph Show Stacey Abrams Touting the Support of Communists and the Muslim Brotherhood?
subtitle: Candidates' political positions and affiliations are not determined by digital editing skills.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams touting the support of communists and the Muslim Brotherhood.

title: Did Kurt Russell Say President Trump Was 'Relentless,' 'Dedicated' and 'Determined?'
subtitle: A quote from a Twitter account using Kurt Russell's face for its profile picture has become attributed to the actor himself.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Kurt Russell said that he has never seen a man as dedicated and determined as President Trump.

title: Does This Photograph Show Democrats Campaigning in the Nude?
subtitle: This is neither a typical nor an established way of getting more party supporters to the polls.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows three naked women campaigning for Democrats during the 2018 midterm elections.

title: Did Barron Trump Benefit from Birthright Citizenship?
subtitle: President Trump's children would still be U.S. citizens even if birthright citizenship were revoked, regardless of when or where they were born.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's son Barron became a U.S. citizen thanks to birthright citizenship.

title: Will Voting in North Dakota Result in the Loss of Hunting Licenses from Other States?
subtitle: An ad promoted by the North Dakota Democratic Party made a dubious claim about voters' losing out-of-state hunting licenses.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: By voting in North Dakota, residents risk losing hunting licenses issued to them by other states.

title: Did the UN Declare War on America and Order Trump to Let the Migrant Caravan In?
subtitle: Junk news and mendacious memes falsely reported the United Nations had declared "war" on the United States.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The U.N. declared war on the U.S. over President Trump's vow to refuse entry to migrants traveling with a caravan.

title: Did the Media Ignore President Trump's Signing of a Bill to Clean Up the Oceans?
subtitle: Despite what was claimed in a Facebook meme, the enactment of the 'Save Our Oceans Act' in October 2018 received more national press coverage than Obama's signing of an almost identical bill in 2012.
author: David Emery
statement: President Trump signed legislation in October 2018 to clean up tons of trash from oceans and lakes, but the mainstream news media did not report on it.

title: Did the USGS 'Increase' Yellowstone's Volcanic Threat Level?
subtitle: Viral reports mischaracterized the intent of an updated USGS volcanic threat assessment while also falsely stating that Yellowstone's classification has changed in that assessment.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A 2018 update to a USGS report reclassified the risk of a supereruption from the Yellowstone caldera as being higher than previous assessments.

title: Is Monster Energy Selling Caffeinated Ham?
subtitle: Maybe some foods do go better with caffeine, and we'll never know until we try.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a new "Energy Ham" product from Monster Energy.

title: Does a Star of David on a Vehicle Traveling with the Migrant Caravan Prove Soros Is Behind It?
subtitle: Junk sites pushed a white supremacist conspiracy theory in the days leading up to the Pittsburgh synagogue massacre.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Star of David on a vehicle traveling with the migrant caravan proves George Soros is behind it.

title: Was Cesar Sayoc's Van 'Staged' as Part of a 'False Flag' Operation?
subtitle: As always, conspiracy theorists aren't dissuaded from their false flag claims by trivialities such as 'evidence' and 'proof.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A van belonging to the suspect arrested in the October 2018 series of mail bombings was created as part of a "false flag" plot.

title: Did Patrick Henry Say the Constitution Is 'For the People to Restrain the Government?'
subtitle: Despite repeated debunkings, social media users continue to share a quote falsely attributed to one of the founding fathers of the United States.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Patrick Henry once said, "The Constitution is not a document for the government to restrain the people: it is an instrument for the people to restrain the government."

title: Was Amy Schumer Photographed Ripping Up a Fetus?
subtitle: Amy Schumer's face was digitally added to a horror-themed photograph and shared online with a fake quote from the actress.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Amy Schumer posed for a magazine spread depicting her ripping apart a fetus.

title: Does This Photograph Show Pipe-Bombing Suspect Cesar Sayoc With a 'Known Democrat,' Proving a Hoax Conspiracy?
subtitle: Eager conspiracy theorists wrenched a photograph of two former soccer teammates out of context, and without factual basis.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A photograph of Cesar Sayoc and Israel "Izzy" Hernandez is evidence of a Democrat-orchestrated "false flag" operation.

title: Was Mail Bombing Suspect Cesar Sayoc a Registered Democrat?
subtitle: A listing for the mail bomb suspect on MyLife.com underwent a series of edits after his arrest in October 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A screenshot from MyLife.com confirms that mail bomb suspect Cesar Sayoc was registered as a Democrat.

title: Was Pittsburgh Synagogue Shooting Victim Rose Mallinger a Holocaust Survivor?
subtitle: A mass shooting by a man who reputedly said he 'wanted all Jews to die' led some to place additional layers of tragedy onto the calamity.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 97-year-old victim of an October 2018 synagogue shooting in Pittsburgh was a Holocaust survivor.

title: Do Uncancelled Stamps Prove Mail Bombs Were Not Sent Through the USPS?
subtitle: Not every standard procedure is an absolute, especially when it comes to the U.S. Postal Service.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The lack of postmarks on explosive devices mailed to Democratic officials proves those items were not sent through the USPS.

title: Did an Ad Offer to Pay for Participation in the Central American Migrant Caravan?
subtitle: A misleading use of search terms creates amusing and sometimes alarming impressions among internet users.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An advertisement sought paid participants to take part in the Central American caravan to the U.S.

title: Does This Photograph Show 66,000 People Outside a Trump Rally?
subtitle: Crowd sizing isn't an exact science, but detecting gross exaggerations is often not a difficult feat.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows 66,000 people who watched, listened, and cheered President Trump outside a rally.

title: Do Democrats Want to Give Free Cars to Undocumented Immigrants?
subtitle: Undocumented immigrants can obtain driver's licenses in some states, but Democrats haven't advocated giving them free cars.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democrats want to give free cars to undocumented immigrants.

title: Did the 'Shawshank Husband' Dig a Tunnel from His Bedroom to a Pub?
subtitle: An old satire article about a man's digging a tunnel to a pub has been fooling unsuspecting readers for years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man in Ireland earned the nickname "Shawshank Husband" after he dug a tunnel from his bedroom to a local pub over the span of 15 years.

title: Is This a German Village Shaped Like a Fingerprint?
subtitle: If this village is ever found at the scene of a crime, the culprit won't be difficult to catch.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a village in Germany that resembles a fingerprint in contour.

title: Did the FBI Confirm George Soros Was Funding the Migrant Caravan?
subtitle: An echo chamber consisting of dozens of Twitter and Facebook accounts pushed an unfounded conspiracy theory about George Soros.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The FBI confirmed in October 2018 that billionaire Goerge Soros was funding a migrant caravan.

title: Did Canadians Face a Major Donut Shortage After the First Day of Cannabis Legalization?
subtitle: "Tim Hortons in seven different provinces were forced to close earlier than usual for lack of staff and the shortage of donuts and pastries."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Canada suffered a major donut shortage shortly after the country legalized recreational marijuana use.

title: Did Canada Pay Off Entire Federal Debt One Day After Marijuana Legalization?
subtitle: "You're crippled with debt one day, and the next it's all vanished into thin air."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Canada paid off their entire federal debt one day after legalizing marijuana.

title: Are Pigs Unhealthy to Eat Because They Don't Sweat?
subtitle: The notion that a pig's lack of functional sweat glands has anything to do with its risk of transmitting disease is without scientific basis.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Pigs don't sweat and are therefore more likely to harbor parasites or other toxins, making them unhealthy to eat.

title: Does This Photograph of a Marine Saluting the U.S. Flag Violate Twitter's Rules?
subtitle: Despite claims that an image of a marine saluting an American flag was deemed offensive by Twitter, we found no evidence that it violated the company's rules.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of a marine saluting a U.S. flag violates Twitter's rules and policies.

title: Why Is It 'Cancelled' in the UK, But 'Canceled' in America?
subtitle: Is it true that extraneous letters were dropped from certain words in American English because newspapers charged by the letter for advertising?
author: David Emery
statement: Americans eliminated unnecessary letters from the British spellings of words such as "cancelled" and "colour" because U.S. newspapers charged by the letter for advertising.

title: Are Kim Kardashian and Kanye West Divorcing?
subtitle: We invite readers to vote in our poll and express how they feel about this important piece of news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kanye West and Kim Kardashian announced that they were divorcing in October 2018.

title: Did All Democrats Vote Against a 2.8 Percent Social Security COLA Increase?
subtitle: Social Security cost of living allowances are established by formula and don't require Congressional approval.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: All the Congressional Democrats voted against a 2.8 percent Social Security cost of living allowance.

title: Is Gladys Baker Morris the Daughter of JFK and Marilyn Monroe?
subtitle: An article about a secret child supposedly born to JFK and Marilyn Monroe resurfaced online years after its original publication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Gladys Baker Morris presented a paternity action lawsuit claiming that she was the biological daughter of Marilyn Monroe and President John F. Kennedy.

title: Is Barron Trump a Chess Grandmaster?
subtitle: Barron Trump was once photographed with a chess set, but that doesn't make him a Grandmaster.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Barron Trump has earned the title of Chess Grandmaster.

title: Did Sarah Jeong Tweet That She Hopes 'Bald White Kids' Have Leukemia?
subtitle: A series of fake tweets have been created and circulated in order to denigrate New York Times journalist Sarah Jeong.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Journalist Sarah Jeong once tweeted that every time she sees a "bald white kid" she secretly hopes "he had leukemia."

title: Does the Antifa Flag Resemble a Nazi Flag?
subtitle: A political group without an official flag has nonetheless been represented by many photoshopped ones.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image documents the striking similarities between the Antifa flag and a Nazi flag.

title: Are Michigan Police Worried About a 'Vigilante' Serial Killer of Pedophiles?
subtitle: Fake local news sites spread junk news about a supposed serial killer targeting pedophiles.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Macomb County Police Department held a press conference about a potential "vigilante" serial killer after three pedophiles were murdered in one week.

title: Did Joe Biden Say Vladimir Putin Wants to 'Destroy the New World Order'?
subtitle: The former American VP opined that the Russian president seeks to undermine NATO and the EU, not 'destroy the New World Order.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: During a foreign policy speech in London, former U.S. vice president Joe Biden said Russian president Vladimir Putin wants to 'destroy the new world order.'

title: Machine Gun Kelly Death Hoax
subtitle: Rumors swirled on Twitter that Rapper Machine Gun Kelly (MGK) had died from a 'ligma overdose.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Rapper Machine Gun Kelly has died from a 'ligma overdose.'

title: Did a Craigslist Ad Solicit Paid Attendees to Donald Trump's Rally in Erie, Pennsylvania?
subtitle: Some said the Craigslist ad proved Trump has to pay people to attend his rallies, while others dismissed it as a hoax meant to embarrass him.  Neither claim was correct.
author: David Emery
statement: An October 2018 Craigslist ad solicited paid attendees to President Trump's rally in Erie, Pennsylvania.

title: Did a 'Pro-Choice Activist' Set a World Record by Getting Her 27th Abortion?
subtitle: A long-running junk news site used a legitimate stock photo for another one of its "satirical" stories.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A California "pro-choice activist" set a world record by going through her 27th abortion.

title: Is Senator Susan Collins' Husband a 'Lobbyist for Russian Interests'?
subtitle: Conspiracy mongers attempted to draw a line between two unrelated things by linking them to more unrelated things.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Thomas Daffron, Sen. Susan Collins' husband, is "a lobbyist for a firm that has numerous connections to Russia and Russian oligarchs."

title: Is NASA Planning to Geoengineer Yellowstone's Supervolcano Threat Away?
subtitle: A theoretical NASA paper written in 2015 was misconstrued in 2018 to suggest an urgent need to geoengineer a solution to Yellowstone's eruptive potential.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Despite repeatedly claiming that the Yellowstone caldera does not pose a super-eruption risk in our lifetimes, NASA has admitted the threat is real and is working to geoengineer a solution to negate that risk.

title: Was Taylor Swift 'Busted' on a Date with Colin Kaepernick?
subtitle: Junk news sites published a spurious report saying Swift was photographed with the controversial former NFL quarterback at a San Francisco nightclub.
author: David Emery
statement: Taylor Swift was photographed in the company of former NFL quarterback and "take a knee" protester Colin Kaepernick at a San Francisco nightclub.

title: Is This a Photograph of Tom Hanks Wearing an Anti-Trump T-Shirt?
subtitle: Buy a fact check scorecard, because you can't always tell celebrities apart by the shirts they wear.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Did This Protest Sign Suggest the Mass Killing of White People in Order to End White Supremacy?
subtitle: Social media users express vehement distaste for fake protest signs -- without realizing they're fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a woman holding a protest sign which reads "Ending White Supremacy Starts with Killing All White People."

title: Does This Grocery Store Have an Aisle for Lonely Single People?
subtitle: An image of a grocery store aisle sign is often shared with jokes about single and lonely people.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a grocery store aisle sign listing cat food, cat toys, wine, and meals for one.

title: Is This a Photograph of a 'Rainbow Butterfly'?
subtitle: If this were a new brand of candy, we'd definitely give it a try.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a multi-colored 'rainbow butterfly.'

title: 'Got Another Friend Request from You' Facebook Warning
subtitle: A warning about a Facebook user's supposedly having received a second friend request from you is mostly useless.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A warning about "another friend request" alerts Facebook users about potential account "cloning."

title: Is This a 'Lava Moon' Melting Into a Waterfall?
subtitle: A photograph of the moon and a waterfall seemingly align just right to create a "lava moon" melting into the water.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 'lava moon' melting into a waterfall.

title: Does Adding Your Age to Your Birth Year Equal 2,018 for 'One Day Only'?
subtitle: Simple mathematics, rather than a mysterious once-a-millennium event, explains a popular meme.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Adding your age to your birth year equals 2,018 on one particular day that occurs once every thousand years.

title: Did Hyatt Hotels Ban Conservatives from Their Properties?
subtitle: An anti-Muslim group painted themselves as victims of anti-conservatism after the hotel chain announced a ban on hate groups.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Hyatt hotel chain stated they will no longer host conservative guests or gatherings.

title: Do Presidential Alerts Give the Government Total Access to Your Phone?
subtitle: Software engineer and cryptocurrency advocate John McAfee claimed the presidential alert system gives the government access to your phone. We found no evidence to support that claim.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: are capable of accessing the E911 chip in your phones, which provides the government full access to your location, microphone, camera and every function of your phone.

title: Is Rep. Maxine Waters Facing Ethics Violations Charges?
subtitle: Disreputable web sites and YouTube channels tried to turn a 2010 story into a current "scandal" about the Democratic lawmaker.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Rep. Maxine Waters is facing ethics violations charges for improperly setting up a meeting between officials from the Treasury and OneUnited bank.

title: Does This Photograph Show Barack Obama Holding a 'Michelle Obama 2020' Shirt?
subtitle: Wording displayed on t-shirts is one of the easiest and most common targets for digital image manipulators.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Barack Obama holding a t-shirt bearing the slogan "Michelle Obama 2020."

title: Have 260 Out of 535 Members of Congress Settled Sexual Assault Charges?
subtitle: A popular Facebook message claiming that 260 members of congress had settled sexual assault charges seriously misread the data.
author: Dan Evon
statement: At least 260 members of the U.S. Congress have settled sexual assault charges.

title: Is Christine Blasey Ford 'Deeply Tied' to the Central Intelligence Agency?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists outdid themselves in attempting to create connections between the CIA and Brett Kavanaugh's principal accuser.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Christine Blasey Ford is closely linked to the CIA, and her sexual assault allegations against Brett Kavanaugh are part of a CIA plot.

title: Did Protesters Vandalize Brett Kavanaugh's House?
subtitle: Junk news websites used an unrelated image from 2016 to illustrate a story falsely claiming that the Supreme Court nominee's home had been vandalized.
author: David Emery
statement: Left-wing protesters vandalized the home of Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.

title: Did Brett Kavanaugh Rule That Employers Can Accept Polygraph Tests as 'Gospel'?
subtitle: A 2016 appeal for which Kavanaugh wrote the decision has no bearing on the use of polygraph tests by employers.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Judge Brett Kavanaugh once ruled in a case that 'polygraphs can be accepted as gospel by employers.'

title: Did Christine Blasey Ford Commit Perjury by Identifying Herself as a Research Psychologist?
subtitle: The notion that Dr. Ford's stating her job title while under oath constituted a "lie" or "perjury" is rather far-fetched.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Christine Blasey Ford committed perjury by identifying herself as a 'research psychologist' in her Senate committee testimony.

title: Did Christine Blasey Ford Claim She Called a Friend on a Cellphone in 1982?
subtitle: Internet trolls manufactured a fake story in an attempt to discredit Dr. Christine Blasey Ford's testimony.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Christine Blasey Ford claimed that she called a friend on her cellphone after she was assaulted by Brett Kavanaugh in 1982, despite the fact that cell phones weren't invented yet.

title: Did Christine Blasey Ford's Brother Work with a Close Relative of Peter Strzok's?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists claim they've found 'three degrees of separation' between fired FBI agent Peter Strzok and Brett Kavanaugh's sexual assault accuser Christine Blasey Ford.
author: David Emery
statement: Christine Blasey Ford's brother, Tom Blasey, worked in the same company as a close relative (wife, sister, or sister-in-law) of former FBI agent Peter Strzok.

title: Is This a Photograph of Donald Trump with Tupac Shakur?
subtitle: Two legends, one photo -- but not necessarily a photograph that showed them in the same place at the same time.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph captures Donald Trump hanging out with musician Tupac Shakur.

title: Are Dragon Soop Beverages Contaminated with HIV?
subtitle: A variant of a years-old rumor about a worker adding HIV-infected blood to foods or beverages takes aim at a caffeinated alcoholic cocktail.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A brewery worker contaminated Dragon Soop products with HIV-infected blood.

title: Is This a Photograph of a Wasted Brett Kavanaugh?
subtitle: The only similarity between the men in these two pictures is what appears to be a shared love of beer.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a young Brett Kavanaugh passed out from too much alcohol.

title: Did a Woman Accuse Country Music Star George Strait of Stalking and Sexual Harassment?
subtitle: A Facebook page that calls itself "the Alt-right Onion" posted a fake story based on the lyrics of one of George Strait's songs.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A woman accused musician George Strait of stalking and sexually harassing her when they were in grade school.

title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford's Lawyer with Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: More purported evidence that all of Brett Kavanaugh's accusers can somehow be linked to every prominent liberal political figure.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Christine Blasey Ford's lawyer, Debra Katz ,walking out of a house with Hillary Clinton.

title: Does Kavanaugh Accuser Deborah Ramirez Have 'Ties to George Soros'?
subtitle: The identity of a woman who accused Brett Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct has been confused with another person bearing the same name.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Kavanaugh accuser Deborah Ramirez has "ties" to billionaire philanthropist George Soros.

title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford with Bill Clinton?
subtitle: Dr. Christine Blasey Ford is apparently a Zelig-like figure who has met and posed with every prominent American liberal.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show Dr. Christine Blasey Ford with George Soros, Harvey Weinstein, and Bill Clinton.

title: Are 99% of Rape Allegations
subtitle: The only thing that appears to be
here is that statistic.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: About 99% of rape allegations are fabricated.

title: Did Christine Blasey Ford Make a Sexual Assault Accusation Against Neil Gorsuch?
subtitle: Believing this claim also requires believing that someone who tweets #Pizzagate and #Qanon conspiracy theories is a credible source of breaking news.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Dr. Christine Blasey Ford made a sexual assault accusation against Justice Neil Gorsuch during his Supreme Court nomination process.

title: Did a Woman Sue Samsung After Her Cellphone Got Stuck in Her Vagina?
subtitle: People sue over the oddest things, but this scenario is probably not actionable.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman filed a lawsuit against Samsung after her cellphone became stuck in her vagina.

title: Did John Elway Fire Denver Broncos Players for Kneeling During the National Anthem?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news attempted to make hay during Week 3 of the 2018 NFL season.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Denver Broncos general manager John Elway fired three players for kneeling during the national anthem.

title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford Partying?
subtitle: Apparently any photograph of a woman semi-clothed and drinking can be used to smear the credibility of someone who reported a sexual assault.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph of a topless, drinking woman pictures a young Christine Blasey Ford.

title: Was the Mayor of San Juan Arrested for Misuse of Disaster Funds?
subtitle: Junk news sites reported that a "Puerto Rico mayor" was arrested on fraud charges and misleadingly used images of San Juan mayor Carmen Yulin Cruz, who has not been charged with a crime.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: San Juan mayor Carmen Yulin Cruz was arrested for misusing federal disaster relief funds.

title: Did Vince Foster Shoot Himself 'Three Times in the Back of the Head' to Avoid Testifying Against Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: An old conspiracy theory about the 1993 suicide of Clinton associate Vincent Foster, whose death was investigated by Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh, was dredged up again in September 2018.
author: David Emery
statement: Clinton associate Vince Foster shot himself three times in the back of the head to avoid testifying against Hillary Clinton.

title: Did Jennifer Lawrence Blame 9/11 on President Trump's Stealing the Election?
subtitle: A fabricated and nonsensical quote about the September 11th terrorist attacks and President Trump was falsely attributed to actress Jennifer Lawrence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Jennifer Lawrence said that the terrorist attacks on 9/11 wouldn't have happened if Donald Trump hadn't stolen the election.

title: Does This Video Show School Lemonade Spiked with Laxatives?
subtitle: A video appears to capture the disturbing and messy aftermath of a school prank.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the aftermath of a school prank in which a student spiked lemonade with laxatives.

title: Does This Video Show a Lemon-Pomegranate Hybrid Plant?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing the creation of a lemon-pomegranate hybrid fruit was created as a joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A videos shows the step-by-step process of making a lemon-pomegranate hybrid fruit.

title: Is This a Photograph of an Elephant Carrying a Lion Cub?
subtitle: A photograph of an elephant carrying a lion cub should need to be real to be considered the "best photo of this century."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an elephant carrying a lion cub.

title: Did Judge Martha Kavanaugh 'Rule Against' the Parents of Her Son's Accuser, Christine Blasey-Ford?
subtitle: Right-wing websites concocted a cynical (and grossly inaccurate) conspiracy theory about a woman who has accused Brett Kavanaugh of sexual assault.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a 1996 foreclosure case, Judge Martha Kavanaugh ruled against Ralph and Paula Blasey, thus providing motive for revenge for their daughter Christine against Judge Kavanaugh's son Brett, a Supreme Court nominee in 2018.

title: Does This Video Show a DragonAir 737 Caught in a Typhoon?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing an airplane being spun around by typhoon-force winds is actually a computer animation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows DragonAir 737 being spun around in strong winds from a typhoon.

title: Was the Appointment of Dr. Jerome Adams as Surgeon General Ignored by the Press?
subtitle: This meme is not only false, but it seemingly undermines the very point it's trying to make.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The appointment of Dr. Jerome Adams as Surgeon General was ignored by the press because he's African-American.

title: Was President Trump's 9/11 'Fist Pump' a Greeting to a Cancer Victim?
subtitle: Deceptive memes purport to correct misinformation offered by other supposedly deceptive memes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump's notorious 'fist pump' at a Pennsylvania airport on 9/11 was offered as a greeting to a cancer victim.

title: Did a Man Die from Shooting a Gun at Hurricane Florence?
subtitle: A report that a Facebook event encouraging people to "shoot guns at Hurricane Florence" had caused the storm's first fatality was junk news.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2018, a 33-year-old man in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, died after the bullet he shot at Hurricane Florence rebounded and hit him in the head.

title: Was the Georgia State Line 'Blocked Off' Because of Hurricane Florence?
subtitle: A Facebook user's bogus claim about hurricane escape routes was spread online even by people who proclaimed to know it was false.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Georgia state troopers blocked off entrance to their state days before Hurricane Florence made landfall.

title: Did a Clerk Refuse to Sell Gas to a Man Fleeing a Hurricane Over a Trump Bumper Sticker?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man was refused fuel at a gas station in North Carolina due to his Trump bumper sticker.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Large Spiral Cloud Forming at Sunset?
subtitle: An image of a large spiral cloud forming at sunset was created with the help of digital editing tools.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows a large spiral cloud forming over water at sunset.

title: Did Donald Trump Proclaim That 'Dogs Are Disgusting'?
subtitle: A bogus quotation added to the widely-held, and possibly mistaken, belief that the 45th president has an aversion to canine creatures.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Donald Trump once said "I never understood why people like dogs. Dogs are disgusting."

title: Does Nike Own Chevrolet?
subtitle: People looking to boycott Nike-owned companies may want to avoid Converse and Hurley products, but no need to trade-in your Chevrolet vehicle.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Nike sports apparel company owns the Chevrolet automobile brand.

title: Will Drinking a Young Person's Blood Provide Anti-Aging Health Benefits?
subtitle: Sensationalized headlines mischaracterized a controversial area of science that is in no way related to vampirism.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A scientific study has concluded that
provides health and longevity benefits.

title: Did Ford Make Colin Kaepernick the Face of Their New Ad Campaign?
subtitle: A joke posted to the political humor section of Reddit was mistaken as genuine news by a number of social media users.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ford USA announced in September 2018 that Colin Kaepernick would star in their new "Built Ford Tough" advertisements.

title: Did Nike Fire Colin Kaepernick After an Arrest?
subtitle: Junk news sites reported that the currently unsigned NFL quarterback lost his endorsement deal after being arrested for trespassing on a football field.
author: David Emery
statement: Nike, Inc. canceled their endorsement contract with former NFL player Colin Kaepernick after he was arrested for trespassing on a football field.

title: Did Madonna Say She Would Vote for President Trump in 2020?
subtitle: A widely-shared meme fabricated a statement by the singer and actor, who is a fervent opponent of the 45th president.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In an interview with Fox News in September 2018, Madonna said she regretted not voting for Donald Trump in 2016 and would support him in 2020.

title: Danny Trejo Death Hoax
subtitle: The popular Los Angeles-born actor did not suddenly pass away at age 74 in September 2018.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Danny Trejo has passed away at age 74.

title: Is The Great Pyramid of Giza's Location Related to the Speed of Light?
subtitle: The latitude of the pyramid in decimal degrees can match a sequence of numbers expressing the speed of light if you look hard enough for it, but that phenomenon is nothing more than coincidence.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Great Pyramid of Giza's location is linked to the speed of light.

title: Did Growers in Colorado Crossbreed Marijuana with a Venus Flytrap?
subtitle: A video purportedly documenting a new strain of marijuana that was crossbred with a Venus flytrap actually shows a barnacle.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a new species of plant created by crossbreeding marijuana with a Venus flytrap.

title: Did Nike Urge Disgruntled Consumers to Donate Their Unwanted Shoes to Veterans?
subtitle: A purported statement from the company asked critics to "respect our troops" and donate clothing rather than burn it.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Nike released a statement urging disgruntled consumers to donate clothing to veterans rather than burning it.

title: Is This Nike 'Make America Great Again' Hat Real?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing the Nike 'swoosh' symbol on the tag of a 'Make America Great Again' hat is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Nike-manufactured "Make America Great Again" hat.

title: Did Nike Offer 'People of Color' a 75 Percent Off Coupon?
subtitle: Users of the controversial online forum 4Chan produced racially-charged and potentially dangerous fake coupons, in the aftermath of Nike's endorsement deal with Colin Kaepernick.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Nike offered 'people of color' several coupons for discounts on the company's products.

title: Was Sasha Obama Expelled from School After Going on an Anti-White Rant?
subtitle: Claims that Sasha Obama was expelled from school after going on a racist anti-white rant originated with a piece of fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sasha Obama was expelled from school after she went on a racist anti-white rant.

title: Did a Man High on Bath Salts Cut Off His Genitals and Microwave Them?
subtitle: Junk news has gotten even junkier by simply recycling and republishing previous fabrications.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A man high on bath salts cut off his genitals and microwaved them.

title: Did a Man Accidentally Burn His Home Down After Lighting Nike Shoes on Fire?
subtitle: Junk news sites cashed in on the supposed craze for burning Nike apparel as a protest over the company's ties with Colin Kaepernick.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A man accidentally burned down his home while attempting to set his Nike shoes on fire in protest over the company's ties with Colin Kaepernick.

title: Does Oscar Mayer Offer Pumpkin Spice Bologna?
subtitle: Pumpkin spice flavorings have found their way into a number of products, but not yet Oscar Mayer bologna.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a pumpkin spice bologna product from Oscar Mayer.

title: Did Michael Jordan Resign from the Board at Nike and Take 'Air Jordans' with Him?
