subtitle: The former NBA superstar has not taken umbrage with the company's decision to use Colin Kaepernick in an ad campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Jordan resigned from the board at Nike and took his Air Jordan line of apparel with him.

title: Did a New Book Reveal President Trump's Fear of Oval Office Ghosts?
subtitle: The new book 'Fear' is full of salacious details about President Trump's administration, but a supposed excerpt documenting the president's fear of ghosts is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An excerpt from Bob Woodward's book 'Fear' states that President Trump believes that the ghosts of past presidents are haunting the Oval Office.

title: Did the University of Alabama Cut Ties with Nike Over the Colin Kaepernick Endorsement Deal?
subtitle: A false viral Facebook rumor was fabricated using an online "fake news generator."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2018, the University of Alabama football program ended its uniform contract with Nike, in response to Nike's endorsement deal with Colin Kaepernick.

title: Did the Federal Government Cancel an $80 Million Nike Contract?
subtitle: A junk news website reported that the government canceled a nonexistent contract with Nike because the company "has decided it hates America."
author: David Emery
statement: The United States government canceled an $80 million contract with sports apparel manufacture Nike, Inc. because the company "hates America" and "disrespects dead veterans."

title: Is $1 Donated for a Girl's Kidney Transplant Every Time Her Photo Is Shared on Social Media?
subtitle: Nobody is paying for ailing children's organ transplants or life-saving surgeries based on how often a social media post is shared.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A girl in need of a kidney transplant receives a $1 donation for that purpose every time her photo is shared on Facebook.

title: Did Colin Kaepernick Immediately Lose a Nike Endorsement After an Anti-White Rant?
subtitle: Reports that Nike rescinded their offer to make Kaepernick one of the faces of their 'Just Do It' campaign were junk news.
author: David Emery
statement: Former San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick lost an endorsement deal with sports apparel manufacturer Nike for going on "an anti-white rant."

title: Did a Man Injure Himself by Setting the Nike Shoes He Was Wearing on Fire?
subtitle: An internet hoax involving Nike shoes, an internet protest, and an unrelated photograph of a burn victim fooled a number of viewers in September 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph captured the injuries a man received when he set fire to the Nike shoes he was wearing.

title: Does This Image  Show Heath Ledger's Joker Doing a Skateboard Kickflip Over Batman?
subtitle: A doctored image purportedly showing Heath Ledger's Joker doing a kickflip over Batman has been fooling internet users for years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Heath Ledger's Joker doing a skateboard kickflip over Batman.

title: Did Google Fail to Promote President Trump's State of the Union Address?
subtitle: President Trump attempted to show Google's alleged bias by falsely claiming that search engine failed to promote his State of the Union address.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Google failed to promote President Trump's State of the Union address on their homepage despite having done so for the previous administration.

title: Did Musician Sean Combs Fail to Buy a Twitter Handle from Comb-Seller 'Sean's Combs'?
subtitle: Screenshots purportedly documenting Puff Daddy's futile attempt to buy a Twitter handle from comb-seller 'Sean's Combs' was created for a humor web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Screenshots document musician Sean P. Diddy Combs' futile attempts to secure a Twitter handle from comb-seller 'Sean's Combs.'

title: Is This a Picture of an Unusually Short Giraffe?
subtitle: Not every member of a species exhibits what is considered a 'standard' appearance.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph captures an unusually short, stocky giraffe.

title: Is This a Picture of a Snake Found in a Milk Jug?
subtitle: We've heard of "milking snakes," but not usually in this context.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a snake found in a plastic milk jug.

title: Did a Scientific Study Prove That
Are
subtitle: A conspiracy theory website drew a series of baseless or incorrect conclusions from a study that looked at the online comments of 9/11 truthers.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A scientific study demonstrated that conspiracy theorists are generally more sane than other people.

title: Are Texts Saying 'A Friend Has Complimented You in IRL' Linked to Sex Trafficking?
subtitle: Not every unsolicited communication is an attempt to target victims for sex trafficking rings.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Text messages from a social app called "IRL" have been linked to sex trafficking.

title: Were Gatorade Bottles Designed with a Cap Holder on the Bottom?
subtitle: An image shows a cap neatly nestled into the bottom of a Gatorade bottle, but this is not an intentional design feature.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Gatorade bottles were designed with a built-in cap holder in the bottom.

title: Did a Google Exec Admit to Rigging Search Results Against Donald Trump?
subtitle: A satirical web site published a fictitious article claiming that an exec at Google admitted to rigging search results against President Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Google CFO "Martin Brailey" admitted that the online giant was rigging search results against President Trump.

title: Is Sheriff Joe Arpaio Taking Over John McCain's Seat in the Senate?
subtitle: Online reports that the controversial former Maricopa County Sheriff was nominated to replace the late Senator John McCain originated on a junk news website.
author: David Emery
statement: Arizona's governor has appointed Sheriff Joe Arpaio to fill the late John McCain's U.S. Senate seat.

title: Did John McCain Launch a Foul-Mouthed Attack on President Trump with His Last Words?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news capitalized on the death of the Arizona senator with a crude and fake piece of "sharebait."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Senator John McCain's final words consisted of a foul-mouthed attack on President Donald Trump.

title: Does This Photograph Show John McCain with Osama bin Laden?
subtitle: A doctored photograph purportedly showing John McCain posing with terrorist Osama Bin Laden was widely circulated in the wake of the Arizona senator's death in August 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows senators John McCain and Lindsey Graham posing with Osama bin Laden.

title: Is California Gov. Jerry Brown Moving a Veterans Cemetery to Make Way for Low-Income Housing?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news posted a fabricated meme about the relocation of a military cemetery in California.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: California governor Jerry Brown is moving a veterans cemetery from San Francisco to Modesto to make way for low-income housing.

title: Is Colin Kaepernick on the Cover of Time Magazine as the 2018 'Person of the Year?'
subtitle: An image purportedly showing Colin Kaepernick as the "Person of the Year" on the cover of Time Magazine is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a 'Time' cover featuring Colin Kaepernick as the magazine's 'Person of the Year' for 2018.

title: Is a 'Large-Scale Killing' of White Farmers Underway in South Africa?
subtitle: Isolated and believed to be wealthy, South African farmers have historically been the targets of attacks in South Africa.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A "large-scale killing" of white farmers is taking place in South Africa.

title: Did MSNBC Use a 'Trump Worried About Pecker Leaking' Chyron?
subtitle: The chyron 'Trump Worried About Pecker Leaking' was created by an internet prankster, not the graphics team at MSNBC.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A screenshot from an MSNBC broadcast captures a chyron reading "Trump Worried About Pecker Leaking."

title: Did 'Liberals' Set Up a GoFundMe Campaign for Murder Suspect Cristhian Rivera?
subtitle: A hyperpartisan Facebook page spread a fake and inflammatory meme after the death of Iowa college student Mollie Tibbetts.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2018, "liberals" started a GoFundMe campaign to raise murder suspect Cristhian Rivera's $5,000,000 bail.

title: Did Bloomington Police Discover Over 200 Penises During Raid at a Mortician's Home?
subtitle: The fabricated report of a grisly discovery in Illinois originated on a spoofed Fox News Channel website.
author: David Emery
statement: Police executing a search warrant at the home of a Bloomington, Illinois, mortician discovered 218 embalmed human penises.

title: Did the Mayor of Minneapolis Cancel 4th of July Fireworks But Allow a Muslim Animal Sacrifice at Vikings Stadium?
subtitle: A pinch of fake news, a smidgen of flawed reading comprehension, and a dash of Islamophobic fear-mongering resulted in overblown accusations against the mayor of Minneapolis.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Mayor of Minneapolis didn't allow fireworks on the 4th of July, but he did allow a "Muslim animal sacrifice" at Vikings Stadium.

title: Did Fox News Discuss the 'War on Christmas' While Other Networks Covered Michael Cohen's Guilty Pleas?
subtitle: Liberals and Fox News have ruined Festivus for everyone!
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral screenshot shows a Fox News contributor debating the 'War on Christmas' while other news networks reported on Michael Cohen's guilty pleas.

title: Does Chelsea Clinton Wear an Upside-Down 'Satanic' Cross?
subtitle: Low-resolution viral images appear to show Clinton wearing an inverted cross, which some say is a symbol of Satanism.
author: David Emery
statement: Chelsea Clinton wears an upside-down (inverted) cross that is symbolic of Satan worship.

title: Is This an Aerial View of an Airplane Abandoned in a Forest?
subtitle: And under what unusual circumstances might an airliner end up in such a position?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an aerial view of an airplane abandoned in a forest.

title: Did Vladimir Putin Rescue an Injured Donald Trump from the Viet Cong During the Vietnam War?
subtitle: An example of how no meme can be so over-the-top ridiculous that it won't at least prompt some questions.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump was wounded and taken prisoner by the Viet Cong in 1963, only to be rescued by Vladimir Putin.

title: Did a 'New Deadly Spider' Species Kill Several People in the U.S. in the Summer of 2018?
subtitle: A viral, scare-mongering Facebook post fabricated a series of fatal spider bites and used photographs of the relatively harmless woodlouse spider.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A species of spider new to the U.S. has a lethal bite which killed five people in the summer of 2018.

title: Is This 'Trump Made America the Best Country in the Nation' Sign Real?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a logically challenged sign in support of President Trump is actually a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a sign reading "Trump Made America the Best Country in the Nation."

title: Were 'Winnie-the-Pooh' Characters Created to Represent Different Mental Disorders?
subtitle: A popular theory holds that the characters in 'Winnie-the-Pooh' stories each represents a different mental disorder.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A.A. Milne created the animal characters in 'Winnie-the-Pooh' to represent various mental disorders.

title: Does This Video Show a Real Human-Like Robot?
subtitle: A video showing an amazingly human-like robot walking up a driveway actually features a computer generated image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an amazingly human-like robot walking up a driveway.

title: Does the McCarran-Walter Act of 1952 Bar Muslims from Holding Public Office?
subtitle: Such an interpretation of the 1952 law would not only be incorrect, it would betray an egregious ignorance of the U.S. Constitution.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The McCarran-Walter Act of 1952 bans Muslims from holding public office in the United States.

title: Was a Giant Blue Whale Spotted Near Jennette's Pier?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a giant blue whale sighted near Jennette's Pier in North Carolina is actually a composite of at least two different images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a giant blue whale spotted near Jennette's Pier in North Carolina.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Man Wearing a 'Make 45 Becomes 46 Again' T-Shirt?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a man wearing a ridiculous pro-Trump shirt was a digital manipulation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a man wearing a pro-Trump "Make 45 Becomes 46 Again" t-shirt.

title: Is This Video of a Man Falling Down a Flight of Stairs Real?
subtitle: A video showing a man falling down a flight of stairs features computer animated graphics and was likely created for a 2008 commercial for Levi's Jeans.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a man surviving a tumble down a long flight of stairs, only to be hit by a car in the street.

title: Was Mount Rushmore Defaced with Political Graffiti?
subtitle: A meme showing political graffiti scrawled on Mount Rushmore originated with a Facebook trolling page.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Someone defaced Mount Rushmore with graffiti reading "Obama Was Here" and "F*ck Trump."

title: Did 600 Murders Take Place in Chicago Last Weekend?
subtitle: Omarosa Manigault said that 600 murders took place in Chicago during the second weekend of August 2018, but the actual number was one.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Some 600 murders took place in Chicago during the second weekend of August 2018.

title: Did Fired FBI Agent Peter Strzok Tweet That President Trump is a 'Dictator,' a 'Russian Asset,' and an 'Unhinged Madman?'
subtitle: A parody account in Strzok's name issued the combative tweet in the wake of the FBI agent's firing for sending text messages critical of President Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: Former FBI agent Peter Strzok issued a tweet calling President Trump a "dictator," a "Russian asset," and an "unhinged madman."

title: Did a Little Leaguer List a Porn Star as His Favorite Actor?
subtitle: This was one of the more unusual "amusing" factoids associated with the young players of the Little League World Series.
author: Dan Evon
statement: ESPN aired a graphic listing porn star Johnny Sins as a Little League baseball player's favorite actor.

title: Did Uninsured Medal of Honor Recipient 'Duane Devane' Die After Being Refused Treatment?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news posted a fake meme about veterans with a reference to a video game character.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Duane Devane, a Medal of Honor recipient, died after being turned away from a hospital in Atlanta on the basis that he had no health insurance.

title: Was the Father of the Man Accused of Training School Shooters the Keynote Speaker at Obama's Democratic National Convention?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan websites published false reports that Imam Siraj Wahhaj, who is the father of New Mexico child abuse suspect Siraj Ibn Wahhaj, was keynote speaker at the 2012 Democratic convention.
author: David Emery
statement: Imam Siraj Wahhaj, the father of a suspect accused of training children to be school shooters at a compound in New Mexico, was the keynote speaker at the 2012 Democratic National Convention.

title: Has a Michigan 'Sharia Zone' Banned Bacon and Required the Wearing of Burqas in Public?
subtitle: More false claims about Islamic sharia law taking over in the state of Michigan originated with a so-called "satirical" web site.
author: David Emery
statement: A "sharia zone" in Michigan's 109th congressional district has issued edicts banning bacon and requiring the wearing of burqas in public.

title: Did JFK Jr. Write in 1999 That Trump 'Would Be an Unstoppable Force for Ultimate Justice'?
subtitle: Whatever John F. Kennedy, Jr. might have thought about Donald Trump, he likely wouldn't have described anyone as "an unstoppable force for ultimate justice."
author: Dan Evon
statement: John F. Kennedy, Jr. wrote in 1999 that Donald Trump would be "would be an unstoppable force for ultimate justice.'

title: Did Thomas Jefferson Say 'When the Speech Condemns a Free Press, You Are Hearing the Words of a Tyrant'?
subtitle: One of the most famous of America's Founding Fathers might have agreed with this sentiment, but we found no evidence that he wrote it.
author: David Emery
statement: Thomas Jefferson said "When the speech condemns a free press, you are hearing the words of a tyrant."

title: Did Winston Churchill Say 'The Fascists of the Future Will Call Themselves Anti-Fascists?'
subtitle: A quote incorrectly attributed to the former British prime minister was spread on social media by Texas Governor Greg Abbott.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Winston Churchill once said that the "fascists of the future will call themselves anti-fascists."

title: Did Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Say There's No Difference Between Billions and Trillions?
subtitle: The young congressional candidate has already become the focus of satire and parody, not always in an obvious way.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Congressional candidate Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said the difference between billions and trillions of dollars is negligible because it just involves more zeros.

title: Is This a 1950s Women's Magazine Ad for a Handgun to Shoot 'Depraved Creeps'?
subtitle: A vintage women's magazine advertisement for a Colt Cobra revolver for use against 'that strange, depraved creep who won't leave you alone' is a recent fabrication.
author: David Emery
statement: A magazine advertisement from the 1950s promoted a handgun for women's use with the slogan "for that strange, depraved creep who won't leave you alone."

title: Did Nancy Pelosi Say the 'Plastic Straw Ban Is Important for Gun Control?'
subtitle: The House Minority Leader did not argue that the plastic straw ban would prevent "gateway guns" such as pea shooters and spitballers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nancy Pelosi said "the plastic straw ban is important for gun control. It stops pea shooting and spitballing which are gateway guns."

title: Michael J. Fox Death Hoax
subtitle: The popular actor has not passed away at 57 from complications related to Parkinson's disease.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Michael J. Fox died at age 57 in August 2018 from complications related to Parkinson's disease.

title: Did President Donald Trump Donate His Entire $400,000 Salary to Rebuild Military Cemeteries?
subtitle: Prominent conservative commentators boosted a false, mathematically impossible rumor about the president's salary donations, taking aim at the news media along the way.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the summer of 2018, President Donald Trump donated his entire $400,000 annual salary to the Department of the Interior for the purpose of rebuilding military cemeteries.

title: Was a 'Large Cat' Spotted at Lake of the Ozarks?
subtitle: A report about a tiger lurking near the shores of the Lake of the Ozarks originated with a prank website.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a tiger that was spotted near the Lake of the Ozarks.

title: Did Barack Obama Mock President Trump's 'IDs for Groceries' Speech on Twitter?
subtitle: A seeming tweet circulated online was designed to mimic the former president's social media account.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Barack Obama poked fun at President Trump on Twitter for saying that grocery shoppers required ID,

title: Is Facebook Taking Down a Photograph Showing the Burial of Korean War Remains?
subtitle: Facebook is not taking down a picture of the interment of Korean War dead in order to minimize an achievement of President Trump's.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Facebook is taking down a photograph showing the interment of the remains of U.S. war dead returned by North Korea.

title: Are 5 Million Bikers Heading to D.C. to Demand an End to the Russia Investigation?
subtitle: A video of a group of motorcyclists has been repeatedly shared over the years with unfounded claims about what it depicts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows 5 million bikers on their way to Washington D.C. to demand an end to the Russia investigation.

title: Demi Lovato Death Hoax
subtitle: The pop singer is still being treated after an overdose but is alive and expected to leave the hospital soon.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Singer and actress Demi Lovato passed away in August 2018.

title: Is Fatima Hemminger the First Female Muslim Commander of the 12th Air Force?
subtitle: Fatima Hemminger is actually a fictional character who resides solely in realm of manipulated images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows Fatima Hemminger, the first Muslim Major General in the United States Air Force.

title: Does This Photograph Show Che Guevara Executing Two Women?
subtitle: Claims that a photograph shows Che Guevara executing two women appear to be based solely on the fact that the pictured man is wearing a military beret.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Cuban revolutionary Che Guevara executing two women.

title: Is Starbucks Replacing Plastic Straws with Paper Straws Wrapped in Plastic?
subtitle: A meme criticizing Starbucks' use of paper straws wrapped in plastic packaging employed an image of an unrelated product.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Starbucks is replacing single-use plastic straws with paper straws wrapped in single-use plastic packaging.

title: Did Outback Steakhouse Announce They Are Banning Supporters of President Donald Trump?
subtitle: A notorious producer of junk news posted a fabricated meme about the popular restaurant chain.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Outback Steakhouse announced that supporters of President Donald Trump are barred from their restaurants.

title: Is a Stone Mountain Implosion Event Being Planned by the City of Atlanta?
subtitle: A Facebook event inviting viewers to watch the implosion of Stone Mountain was created by a parody account.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The City of Atlanta has invited residents to watch the implosion of Stone Mountain on 5 August 2018.

title: Does This Image Show a Peaceful Meeting of a Lion and a Zebra at a Watering Hole?
subtitle: Food and drink, all in the same place!
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a lion and a zebra peacefully drinking together at a watering hole.

title: Will Eating an Egg and a Banana Kill You?
subtitle: A viral warning seems to ignore the obvious truth that eggs and bananas are commonly and deliciously mixed together with no harmful effect on consumers.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Eating bananas and eggs together can poison you, causing instant death.

title: Did Principal Mamasai Mamakusa Expel Two Children for Wearing Crucifixes?
subtitle: A junk news site invented a story about a school principal expelling two children over their religious views.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A school principal in Richmond expelled two children for wearing crucifixes to school.

title: Did 'Baracco Clintez' Smash Donald Trump's Walk of Fame Star?
subtitle: Donald Trump's Walk of Fame Star was vandalized in July 2018, but the man responsible for it wasn't "Baracco Clintez."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man named Baracco Clintez was responsible for vandalizing Donald Trump's star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

title: Did Buzz Aldrin Admit That He Never Went to the Moon?
subtitle: Apollo 11 astronaut Buzz Aldrin's answer to a question posed by a child was misrepresented as an admission that he didn't set foot on the moon.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Buzz Aldrin admitted in an exchange captured on video that he never went to the moon.

title: Is This Image of a Lenticular Cloud Over the Giza Pyramids Real?
subtitle: The Giza Pyramids and lenticular clouds are spectacular photographic subjects individually, but did someone manage to capture both in one shot?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a large lenticular cloud over the pyramids in Giza, Egypt.

title: Did All Christian Churches in Dearborn, Michigan, Close in April 2018?
subtitle: A notorious producer of fake news attempted to provoke outrage with yet another fabricated memetic claim.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: All Christian churches in Dearborn, Michigan, have closed as 18 April 2018.

title: Did Whoopi Goldberg Call Judge Jeanine  Pirro a 'Sand N***er?'
subtitle: An unsubstantiated accusation that Whoopi Goldberg used a racial slur in reference to Judge Jeanine  Pirro originated with a disreputable source.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Whoopi Goldberg called Judge Jeanine  Pirro a "sand n***er" after the latter's appearance on 'The View.'

title: Was an FBI Agent Who Exposed Hillary Clinton's Corruption Found Dead?
subtitle: A murder-suicide involving an FBI agent and his estranged wife was not related to a probe into Hillary Clinton and the "Fast and Furious" scandal.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An FBI agent who exposed Hillary Clinton's corruption has been found dead.

title: Does Marijuana Contain
from Outside Our Solar System?
subtitle: An article's factually ridiculous headline attempted to demonstrate people's proclivity to share articles without reading them.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: NASA has confirmed that marijuana contains
from outside of our solar system.

title: Is This 'Keke Challenge Gone Wrong' Video Real?
subtitle: A video purportedly captures a young woman being struck by an automobile while performing the "Keke Challenge."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video captures a young woman being struck by an automobile while performing the "Keke Challenge."

title: Did the Obamas Wear Che Guevara Shirts During a Cuban Trip?
subtitle: A poorly edited image supposedly showing the Obama family wearing Che Guevara shirts in Cuba has been shared tens of thousands of times on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the Obama family in Cuba wearing Che Guevara shirts.

title: Is California Governor Jerry Brown Mandating That Schools Show Students 'Gay Sex'?
subtitle: Nobody other than junk news sites is saying that California should use "gay pornography" in elementary schools to teach children about LGBT sex.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: California Governor Jerry Brown has mandated the use of gay pornography in elementary schools in order to teach children about LGBT sex.

title: Was a Man Freed After Outliving a 99-Year Prison Sentence for Horse Theft?
subtitle: We're still waiting for someone to live out the entirety of a 99-year prison sentence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man was released from jail in Texas after outliving his 99-year prison sentence for horse theft.

title: Do These Photographs Show the Croatian President in a Bikini?
subtitle: A set of images purportedly showing Croatian President Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic in a bikini actually show model Coco Austin.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A set of images show Croatian President Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic in a bikini.

title: Etymology of 'Tag'
subtitle: How factual is the claim that the name of the children's game 'tag' originated as the acronym of 'touch and go'?
author: David Emery
statement: The name of the children's game "tag" originated as the acronym of "touch and go."

title: Did Queen Elizabeth Wear a Brooch Gifted by President Obama While Meeting President Trump?
subtitle: Theories about the symbolism behind the monarch's fashion choices are founded on assumptions that collapse when tested.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: When meeting President Donald Trump in July 2018, Queen Elizabeth wore a brooch given to her by former president Barack Obama.

title: Does the Cancer Act of 1939 Make It Illegal to Cure Cancer?
subtitle: The act, which has had all but one of its provisions replaced or repealed, prevents anyone from advertising a cure for cancer to the general public in the UK.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Cancer Act of 1939 makes it illegal to cure cancer.

title: Did a Serial Killer Babysitter Place Barbed Wire Around a Baby Crib?
subtitle: An odd video purportedly showing a babysitter placing barbed wire around a crib was staged for a "creepypasta" video channel.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows serial killer and babysitter Nancy James, hired by the Peerc family, placing barbed wire around a baby crib.

title: Did Sarah Palin Bash NATO Allies for Not Helping During World War II?
subtitle: An entertainment web site published a fictitious article containing a fake quote ostensibly uttered by Sarah Palin.
author: Dan Evon
statement: During an interview Sarah Palin asked, "What has NATO ever done for us? Where were they in World War II, when America defeated the Nazis.

title: Does This Photograph Show Putin Pulling President Obama's Tie?
subtitle: A popular image seemingly shows Russian president Vladimir Putin aggressively pulling President Obama's tie.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Russian president Vladimir Putin aggressively pulling on U.S. president Barack Obama's tie.

title: Dollar General $150 Coupon
subtitle: Businesses do not celebrate their anniversaries by giving away hefty coupons to Facebook users who share and like posts. Those offers are a form of online scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Facebook users can receive a $150 coupon for Dollar General by liking and sharing a post.

title: Is George Soros Facing Prison Over $1.8 Billion in 'Intercepted' Campaign Contributions?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan web sites promulgated false claims about the billionaire's contributions to candidates in local district attorney races in 2018.
author: David Emery
statement: Billionaire political activist George Soros could go to prison for years because of $1.8 billion in "intercepted" campaign contributions to candidates in local district attorney elections.

title: Was a Nevada Morgue Employee Arrested for Pimping Out Corpses for Sex?
subtitle: A bizarre story posited that a Nevada morgue employee found an inventive way to combine two prominent business areas: death and sex.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Nevada morgue employee was arrested for operating a cadaver brothel.

title: Did a Teenage Daughter Dressed in Dad's 'Stay Clear Boys' Shirt Get Pregnant?
subtitle: A young woman dressed in a "Stay Clear Boys" shirt supposedly exacted revenge on her overprotective father by getting pregnant.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph showing a teenager in a "stay clear boys" shirt and a second image of a pregnant woman feature the same person.

title: If the President Is Impeached for Treason, Is Everyone Else Removed from Office as Well?
subtitle: Some confusion over the meaning and process of impeachment resulted in the spread of false information about the potential results of treason charges against a U.S. president.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: If the President of the United States were impeached for treason, the Vice President and all other officers would automatically be removed from office as well.

title: Was Accused Russian Spy Mariia Butina Photographed in the Oval Office?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing accused Russian spy Mariia Butina in the Oval Office with President Trump is a case of misidentification.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows accused Russian spy Mariia Butina in an Oval Office meeting with President Trump.

title: Did Rescued Thai Boys Opt to Return to Cave Rather Than Meet with Trump?
subtitle: Caught between a rock and a hard place ... literally?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Boys rescued after being trapped in a cave for weeks preferred to return there rather than meet with President Trump.

title: Did a Babysitter Tie a One-Month-Old to a Ceiling Fan for 26 Hours?
subtitle: A flippant and fabricated article about a genuinely horrific subject is an example of the worst of junk news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Babysitter Nora Jackson was arrested in Florida for tying a baby to a ceiling fan for 26 hours.

title: Is This How German News Covered President Trump at the NATO Summit?
subtitle: Years-old footage of a newscaster laughing was repurposed and shared as if it showed a reporter mocking President Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a German newscaster laughing at President Trump's statements at a NATO summit.

title: 'Trump Suffering from a Stroke' Virus Warning
subtitle: Pictures of President Trump's suffering a stroke and a supposed virus attached to them are both non-existent entities.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pictures of President Trump suffering a stroke are being used to spread a virus that wipes computers and cellphones.

title: Does This Image Represent a 'MAPs Pride Flag'?
subtitle: Rumors holding that MAPs (Minor Attracted Persons) created a pride flag in an attempt to join the LGBTQ community originated with a troll experiment on Tumblr.
author: Dan Evon
statement: MAPs (Minor Attracted Persons) created a pride flag

title: Did Comedian George Lopez Urinate on Donald Trump's Hollywood Star?
subtitle: The mischievous use of pixellation gave some viewers the false impression that a video showed Lopez relieving himself on the president's piece of pavement.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral video shows George Lopez urinating on President Donald Trump's star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in July 2018.

title: Was This Photograph Taken Moments Before a Bear Attack?
subtitle: An image showing a bear dangerously close to an oblivious fisherman was created for a Photoshop contest.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph documents a scary moment when a bear got dangerously close to an oblivious fisherman.

title: Is This an Image of a 'Cow Crusher' Device Designed to Crush Cows?
subtitle: A photograph of a common piece of farm equipment was shared with false accusations concerning animal torture.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a "cow crusher," a device designed to literally crush cows.

title: Is This a Real Trailer for 'Forrest Gump 2'?
subtitle: Some viewers mistook a spoof trailer for a sequel to the movie "Forrest Gump" as genuine in June 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Paramount, Amblin, and the Bubba Gump Shrimp Company released a trailer for "Forrest Gump 2: Forever Jenny."

title: Was a New Jersey Couple Killed in an Explosion 'Set to Testify' Against Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: Conspiracy-peddling web sites seized on a fatal explosion as a means to push more dubious stories.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: John and Carole Paladino were slated to testify before a grand jury as part of an investigation against HIllary Clinton before they died in an explosion in July 2018.

title: Did Congresswoman Ateesha Nubbins Put an Upper-Age Limit on Voting?
subtitle: A meme created by a satirical Facebook page convinced some viewers that a fictional congresswoman was attempting to pass a non-existent law.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Congresswoman Ateesha Nubbins pushed for a bill that would establish an upper-age voting limit.

title: Did an Outbreak of a Deadly 'HR3211 Virus' Occur in Louisville, Kentucky?
subtitle: Reports of a viral epidemic that supposedly killed 16 people in Louisville originated on a prank news generator web site.
author: David Emery
statement: The University of Louisville Hospital confirmed the deaths of 16 people from a rare strain of the "HR3211 virus."

title: Does This Image Show How Four Different Presidents Celebrated the 4th of July?
subtitle: An image graphic purportedly comparing how Obama, Clinton, Bush and Trump celebrated the 4th of July consists of cherry-picked photographs, none taken on Independence Day.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A viral image proves that former presidents Obama, Bush, and Clinton celebrated the 4th of July by visiting U.S. soldiers, while President Trump spent the holiday golfing.

title: Does This Video Show 8 Supernatural Car Crashes?
subtitle: Footage purporting to show 8 traffic accidents involving invisible ghost cars was the product of some creative digital editing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a series of supernatural car accidents in which the vehicles can be seen crashing into nothing.

title: Did Disney Announce It Was to Open a Theme Park in Escanaba, Michigan?
subtitle: An obscure satirical web site managed to trick many readers with a fabricated story in the summer of 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In July 2018, a Disney spokesperson indicated that the company was planning to open a theme park in Escanaba, Michigan.

title: Did Gareth Southgate Wear an 'It's Coming Home' Waistcoat?'
subtitle: The sartorial aspects of Gareth Southgate, manager of England's national football team, have drawn considerable media scrutiny.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Gareth Southgate wearing a waistcoat with the words "It's Coming Home" repeatedly written on it.

title: Are 43 Percent of All Food Stamps 'Given to Illegals'?
subtitle: This claim, in circulation since at least 2012, is mathematically impossible and factually deficient.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: At least 43% of all food stamp beneficiaries are undocumented immigrants.

title: Does This Photograph Show an Octopus Falling from the Sky in China?
subtitle: Strong winds did hit a Chinese city, but the objects they displaced didn't include a whole octopus.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an octopus that fell from the sky in China during a storm.

title: Will Cars with Full Gas Tanks Explode on Hot Days?
subtitle: A common rumor holds that a car bearing a full tank of gas on an exceptionally hot day may explode due to increased pressure and heat. This claim makes no sense.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: On hot summer days, you should avoid filling your car's gas tank completely due to a risk of explosion.

title: Is This 'Sugar-Free Sugar' Bag Real?
subtitle: Exactly what would a bag of sugarless sugar hold?   And how would it taste?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a bag of sugar bearing a "sugar free" label.

title: Is Clint Eastwood Leaving Hollywood?
subtitle: A spurious quote supposedly uttered by actor Clint Eastwood about how he was "leaving Hollywood" was fabricated by a disreputable web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Clint Eastwood said that he was leaving Hollywood because it was full of "Amerikan" traitors.

title: Did Betsy DeVos Tweet 'It's Is My Favorite Country' About America?
subtitle: In response to a hashtag asking Twitter users to describe the United States in three words, a parody account for the Secretary of Education described it in five.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Betsy DeVos miscounted the number of words in a poorly-worded "#AmericaIn3Words" tweet.

title: Did Maxine Waters Call for an 'Illegal Immigrant' to Be the Next Supreme Court Justice?
subtitle: A hyperpartisan Facebook page shared an edited image from a real interview by the California congresswoman.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Congresswoman Maxine Waters called for the next U.S. Supreme Court Justice to be an "illegal immigrant."

title: Did Barack Obama Say 'If We Don't Do Something About This President, I Will?'
subtitle: A quote attributed to former president Barack Obama has him vowing to "do something" about President Trump if no one else does.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama said "If we don't do something about this president, I will" at a Democratic fundraiser in June 2018.

title: Did Mark Twain Say 'Fear the Media, for They Will Steal Your Honor'?
subtitle: The anachronistic use of the word "media" is just one reason to be skeptical of a quote often attributed to American author Mark Twain.
author: David Emery
statement: Mark Twain said, "Do not fear the enemy, for your enemy can only take your life. It is far better that you fear the media, for they will steal your HONOR."

title: Did Trump Tap Giorgio A. Tsoukalos for Secretary of the Space Force?
subtitle: A satirical article jokingly claimed that the television personality and producer best known as "the Ancient Aliens guy" was going to lead President Donald Trump's Space Force.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump nominated Giorgio A. Tsoukalos, best known for his appearances on the television series "Ancient Aliens," to lead the Space Force.

title: Did Melania Trump Wear an 'Exterminate' T-Shirt to a Holocaust Memorial?
subtitle: A satirical web site left some readers unsure about a fake article that followed a real controversy over the First Lady's fashion choices.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: On a visit to the Holocaust Memorial in Berlin in June 2018, First Lady Melania Trump wore a Doctor Who-themed T-shirt bearing the word "Exterminate."

title: Did President Obama Oversee the Separation of 89,000 Children from Their Parents?
subtitle: A right-wing Facebook page published a grossly misleading meme that compared the immigration policies of the 44th and 45th presidents.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Under President Barack Obama, 89,000 children were separated from their immigrant parents at the United States border.

title: Is This a Photograph of Women 'Screaming Through Their Vaginas' to Protest the President?
subtitle: A long-circulating image from an art project became attached to an unrelated backstory about purportedly disgruntled anti-Trump protesters in June 2018.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph shows women who gathered to "scream" at President Donald Trump "through their vaginas."

title: Was 'The Electric Slide' Written About Vibrators?
subtitle: Rumors that the pop song is about vibrators are based solely on one interpretation of the song's lyrics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The song "Electric Boogie (The Electric Slide)" was written about a vibrator.

title: Is the Red Hen Located at 666 E. Washington?
subtitle: Hacked Google Reviews and manufactured Yelp pages led some to believe that the Red Hen restaurant in Lexington, Virginia had a "Satanic" address.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Red Hen restaurant in Lexington, Virginia is located at 666 E. Washington.

title: Did Harley Davidson's CEO Call President Trump 'a Moron'?
subtitle: Matthew Levatich was accused of calling Donald Trump a "moron" after the president objected to the company moving some operations to Thailand.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Harley-Davidson's chief executive officer Matthew Levatich called President Trump "a moron."

title: Is the Bluegill One of the Most Dangerous Fish in North America?
subtitle: According to a Facebook meme, a school of bluegills can completely dismantle a human body in less than fifteen minutes.
author: David Emery
statement: The bluegill fish is related to the piranha and is one of the most dangerous fish in North America, responsible for more than 500 deaths in the United States every summer.

title: Did Anti-Trump Protesters Call for Republicans to Be Assassinated?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan web sites used shoddy image editing to spread inflammatory disinformation.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: "Liberal" protesters carried a banner calling for Republicans to be assassinated.

title: Did FEMA Use Barges to Incarcerate People Fleeing a Volcano in Hawaii?
subtitle: A conspiracy theorist web site once again published groundless, scaremongering claims about the federal government's disaster management agency.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, FEMA deployed barges to Hawaii, to transport victims of the Kilauea volcano to an "internment camp."

title: Joe Jackson Death Hoax
subtitle: Fake news articles peddling the false claim that the Jackson family patriarch was dead followed in the wake of media reports that he is suffering from pancreatic cancer.
author: David Emery
statement: Joe Jackson - patriarch of the entertainment family that includes singers Janet Jackson and the late Michael Jackson - has died of cancer.

title: Was a Child Expelled From School for Wearing a Donald Trump Costume?
subtitle: A story about a six-year-old getting in trouble for his choice in superhero attire came from a site that only publishes satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A child was expelled from elementary school for wearing a Donald Trump costume on "Superhero Day."

title: Is L.L. Bean Refusing to Hire Registered Gun Owners?
subtitle: A "satirical" blog used a fake meme to gin up outrage by attempting to link the company to Michelle Obama.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: L.L. Bean enacted a ban on hiring gun owners because former First Lady Michelle Obama is its main stockholder.

title: Are These Women 'Democrat Party Supporters' Protesting Trump?
subtitle: A photograph showing a protest against extreme violence toward women in Argentina was re-captioned "Democrat party supporters."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of "Democrat party supporters" protesting in the United States.

title: Have Undocumented Immigrants Killed 63,000 American Citizens Since 9/11?
subtitle: The figure would mean undocumented immigrants, who account for roughly 3 percent of the population, would have to commit about one quarter of the nation's homicides.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Undocumented immigrants have killed 63,000 U.S. citizens since 11 September 2001.

title: Did Fracking Cause Volcanic Activity on Hawaii's Big Island?
subtitle: Fracking does not take place on Hawaii's Big Island, but that is far from the only problem with this absurd conspiracy theory.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Scientific data has linked the surge in volcanic activity in Hawaii to increased fracking activity from a nearby geothermal energy plant.

title: Did the King of the Netherlands Tell Donald Trump That The Hague Is Waiting for Him?
subtitle: A parody account posing as Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands tweeted that the International Court of Justice was waiting for the United States president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The king of the Netherlands tweeted that the International Court of Justice in the Hague is ready and waiting for Donald Trump.

title: Did Canada's Prime Minister Say Canadians Don't Need American Farmers Because 'We Have Grocery Stores'?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan social media pages and bots used yet another fake quote in order to attempt to drum up criticism against Canada's leader.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Justin Trudeau said that Canada didn't need produce from American farmers because they have their own grocery stores.

title: Did a Study Find That Almost All Politicians Are 'Actual Psychopaths'?
subtitle: A disreputable web site grossly misrepresented the finding of a May 2018 study about the geographic distribution of psychopaths.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A May 2018 study found that 99.9 percent of politicians throughout the United States are "actual psychopaths."

title: Did Henry Kissinger Say Donald Trump Is the 'One True Leader'?
subtitle: Nixon's former Secretary of State once said Trump could go down in history as "a very considerable president," but he never praised him as the "one true leader."
author: David Emery
statement: Speaking of Donald Trump's presidency, former Secretary of State Henry Kissinger referred to him as the "one true leader."

title: Does a Specific Law Mandate Family Separation and Detention of Minors?
subtitle: As public debate over the policy of separating families at the border continued, rumors appeared blaming the practice on Public Law 107-296.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The widely debated practice of separating families at the border is mandated by Public Law 107-296, which was passed by Democrats in 2002.

title: Did a New Hampshire Congressman Deface Donald Trump's Limousine?
subtitle: A prolific producer of fake news publishes yet another false meme about an 'Arnim Zola'.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2018, a New Hampshire Congressman named Arnim Zola was arrested for defacing President Donald Trump's limousine.

title: Did Eva Braun Say She 'Hated Seeing Children Separated from Their Parents' But Not to Blame Hitler?
subtitle: A satirical quote attempting to draw a comparison between Melania Trump and Adolf Hitler's mistress was mistaken for real by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Eva Braun, Adolf Hitler's mistress turned wife, said that she hated seeing children separated from their parents but that people shouldn't blame the Fuhrer.

title: Were Gun-Toting Children Photographed on the United States Border?
subtitle: The Drudge Report used a years-old photograph of children in Syria holding toy guns without credit, a description, or attribution to illustrate a story about immigration to the United States.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows children holding guns on the US-Mexico border.

title: Are Children Being Assigned Numbers in Detention Centers?
subtitle: Viral posts on social media contain claims that immigrant children are receiving numbers like Holocaust victims.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image shows numbers on shirts worn by children taken into custody on the U.S.-Mexico border, a practice reminiscent of numbers tattooed on Holocaust victims.

title: Was the 'Law to Separate Families' Passed in 1997 or 'by Democrats'?
subtitle: There is no federal law mandating children and parents be separated at the border; a policy resulting in that outcome was enacted in May 2018.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A "law to separate families" was enacted prior to April 2018, and the federal government is powerless not to enforce it.

title: Did a Man Sue McDonald's Because He Was Depressed After Eating a Happy Meal?
subtitle: Despite what a hoax news article says, Happy Meals from McDonald's do not actually guarantee happiness.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man sued McDonald's because he was still depressed after eating a Happy Meal.

title: Did a Trump Tower Open in Pyongyang?
subtitle: The claim that a Trump-branded hotel opened in North Korea's capital less than 24 hours after the historic Trump-Kim summit originated on a satirical web site.
author: David Emery
statement: A Trump Tower hotel opened in Pyongyang, North Korea within a day of the historic summit between President Trump and Kim Jong-Un.

title: Did Jeff Sessions Say 'If We Inflict Fear and Pain on Children, Adults Won't Want to Come Here'?
subtitle: A quote widely attributed to the Attorney General appeared to stem from a viral video shared by Sen. Jeff Merkley's visit to a detention center.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Attorney General Jeff Sessions said "if we inflict fear and pain on children, adults won't want to come here."

title: Is This Japan's Lake Kawaguchi?
subtitle: Japan's Lake Kawaguchi truly does sit within eyesight of Mount Fuji.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Lake Kawaguchi near Mount Fuji in Japan.

title: Are Meghan Markle and Prince Harry Robots?
subtitle: An odd video purportedly showing the royal couple at an event actually features two "live figures" created by the Madame Tussauds wax museum.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Meghan Markle and Prince Harry behaving oddly in an 'Britain's Got Talent' audience.

title: Are These Penguins Living on an Island of Plastic?
subtitle: A digitally manipulated video showing a group of penguins living on a plastic island was created by a conservation group in order to raise awareness of the extent of pollution in the ocean.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of penguins living on an island of plastic.

title: Was Anthony Bourdain Killed by Clinton Operatives?
subtitle: Spurious claims linking the celebrity chef's death to Hillary Clinton were published on a web site notorious for spreading fake news and conspiracy theories.
author: David Emery
statement: An investigation determined that celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain was killed by Hillary Clinton operatives.

title: Did Chelsea Clinton Tweet That 'Pizzagate Is Real'?
subtitle: Neither Pizzagate nor a "child trafficking bunker" in Tucson is real or connected to illegal activities supposedly directed by Hillary Clinton.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton's daughter Chelsea "admitted" in a tweet that the Pizzagate conspiracy is "real."

title: Did Snopes.com Ignore a Huge Child Trafficking Bust in Arizona?
subtitle: Disreputable web sites conflated a homeless camp in Arizona with a carefully orchestrated multi-agency sting on the other side of the country.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Snopes.com ignored reports of a large child trafficking ring bust in Arizona.

title: Was 'Back to the Future IV' Confirmed by Michael J. Fox?
subtitle: A Facebook page posing as the actor posted a hoax message about a new movie in the popular time-traveling series.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael J. Fox announced in June 2018 that he was making 'Back to the Future IV.'

title: Are These Immigrant Children in Orange Jumpsuits?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post falsely implied a photograph of youngsters in orange jumpsuits shows detained immigrant children.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph of children in orange jumpsuits depicts detained immigrant children.

title: Was Anthony Bourdain About to Expose an Elite Pedophile Ring?
subtitle: Some fake news sites just can't get over their obsessions with pederasty, likely because it makes for effective clickbait material.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: TV celebrity and food writer Anthony Bourdain was planning to run an expose of an pedophile ring at the time of his death.

title: Was a Child's Skull Found at an Alleged Sex-Trafficking Bunker Area in Tucson?
subtitle: Authorities have determined a skull found roughly 20 miles from an abandoned homeless camp belonged to an adult.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A child's skull was found near a sex trafficking site.

title: Was Pope Francis 'Found Guilty' of Child Trafficking and Murder?
subtitle: A blog devoted to the roundly-debunked "Pizzagate" story reprinted an equally false post from 2014 about the leader of the Catholic Church.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Pope Francis was part of a group condemned in an international court of killing and trafficking children.

title: Is 'Courage the Cowardly Dog' Getting Rebooted?
subtitle: Yet another spurious rumor about an old show returning to the small screen appeared on Facebook in June 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Cartoon Network announced that new episodes of 'Courage the Cowardly Dog' would premiere on 30 February 2019.

title: Did Roseanne Adopt an African Child After a Racism Kerfuffle?
subtitle: A fake news site capitalized on controversy involving the comedian, claiming she adopted a black child from Africa to prove she wasn't racist.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Roseanne Barr adopted a black child from Africa to prove she isn't racist.

title: Is Story Land Closing?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post falsely claimed that the New Hampshire amusement park Story Land was permanently closing its doors.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New Hampshire amusement park Story Land announced in June 2018 that it is closing.

title: Did a Veteran Group Discover a 'Disturbing Child Trafficking Bunker' in Tucson?
subtitle: Police investigated and concluded the site is actually an abandoned homeless camp.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A veteran group patrolling in Tucson, Arizona, found a child trafficking site.

title: Are Gasoline Prices Over $6.00 per Gallon in California?
subtitle: A photograph shared widely online made it look as if the prices for gasoline in Los Angeles had skyrocketed.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Gas stations in Los Angeles are charging in excess of $6 for regular gasoline and $9 for higher-quality options.

title: Did Pope Francis Order White Women to 'Breed' with Muslims?
subtitle: Statements from the pontiff about European assimilation of migrants were absurdly characterized by a fake news site.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Pope Francis declared that "white women" must "breed with Muslims."

title: Did the National Cancer Institute 'Finally Admit' That Marijuana Kills Cancer?
subtitle: Viral stories falsely suggest that a NIH fact sheet was
amended to state that cannabis kills cancer cells.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The National Cancer Institute has "admitted" that "cannabis kills cancer."

title: Did Tom Brady Say the NBA Finals Were Rigged?
subtitle: A startling quote from the football player actually originated on a sports satire page.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tom Brady said that the NBA finals were rigged, and that the referees were taking bribes.

title: Did Starbucks Announce 'Patrons of Color' Can Go to the Head of the Line?
subtitle: A spoof of the Starbucks race controversy and anti-bias training featured an apocryphal quote from the chain's CEO.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson announced a new policy under which "Patrons of color will be allowed to move to the head of the line at all of our locations."

title: Did Martha Stewart Say She'd Refuse to Accept a Pardon from President Trump?
subtitle: A satirical Twitter account added its own "update" to a report saying that President Trump was considering a pardon for Martha Stewart.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Martha Stewart said she'd refuse to accept a pardon from President Donald Trump.

title: Did Melania Trump Spell 'HELP' in a Tweet?
subtitle: An artist's satirical post about the First Lady circulated online, eventually spreading without his name attached to the joke.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: First Lady Melania Trump posted a tweet that was arranged in a way that the first letters of each line spelled out the word "HELP."

title: Did a Sign for Starbucks Racial Bias Training Single Out White People?
subtitle: A sign informing Starbucks customers that stores would be closed in order to "educate white people about their racism" was not created by the coffee chain.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An official sign for Starbucks racial bias training explained that stores were closed to "educate white people about their racism."

title: Did a Man from Zimbabwe Invent an Electric Car That Requires No Charging?
subtitle: The Internet is full of dubious claims regarding a genius Zimbabwean inventor, but nobody has ever actually seen his technology work.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A Zimbabwean inventor named Sangulani Maxwell Chikumbutso invented an electric car that requires no charging.

title: Did ABC's Senior Vice President of Programming Mutafa Ka'Plese Decide to Cancel 'Roseanne'?
subtitle: ABC Senior Vice President of Programming Mutafa Ka'Plese did not cancel the rebooted sitcom because ABC Senior Vice President of Programming Mutafa Ka'Plese does not exist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The decision to cancel the show 'Roseanne' was made by ABC Senior Vice President of Programming Mutafa Ka'Plese.

title: Did Sarah Sanders Offer Roseanne Barr a White House Job?
subtitle: A widely shared Facebook post from the press secretary appeared to offer an official White House position to the controversial comedian.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Trump's press secretary Sarah Sanders offered Roseanne Barr a White House position.

title: Is the Trump Administration Set to Legalize Medical Marijuana 'in All 50 States'?
subtitle: The "Right to Try" act is aimed at experimental treatments for terminally ill patients, not ending marijuana prohibition on the federal level.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump is signing a law legalizing marijuana across the United States.

title: Is This Amazing Bouquet Catch Real?
subtitle: The clip purportedly showing a bridesmaid making an athletic bouquet catch originated with a clever commercial.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a bridesmaid making an athletic move to catch a bouquet of flowers.

title: Was a Far-Right Activist Jailed for Breaching a Court Order Designed to 'Protect Muslim Pedophiles'?
subtitle: Tommy Robinson was sentenced in May 2018 for violating reporting restrictions and potentially risking the collapse of a child sex abuse trial.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Tommy Robinson was jailed in order to silence his reporting on a sex abuse trial in England, and to "protect Muslim pedophiles."

title: Was a New Zealand Farmer Arrested for Selling Sheep as Sex Slaves to the Islamic State?
subtitle: A "satirical" article that manages to malign Islam, New Zealanders, and sheep all in the same breath has been making the rounds since 2017.
author: David Emery
statement: A New Zealand farmer was arrested for selling sheep for use as sex slaves by members of the Islamic State.

title: Is This an Image of Subtropical Storm Alberto Approaching Pensacola Beach?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a huge, ominous storm approaching a Florida beach town is actually a digital composite of several images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Subtropical Storm Alberto approaching Pensacola Beach in Florida.

title: Did Fox News Contributor Tomi Lahren Compare Her 'Real Hair' to Beyonce's?
subtitle: Although Lahren has a track record of making racialized comments, she didn't compare her hair to that of the pop superstar.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Conservative commentator Tomi Lahren compared her "real hair" to Beyonce's hair.

title: Is Starbucks Installing 'Shatter-Proof Windows'?
subtitle: An image circulating online falsely promised "free coffee for a year" to anyone who could damage the company's new windows.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Starbucks is giving away free coffee for a year to anyone who can damage their new "shatter-proof" windows.

title: Did Grocery Stores Once Sell 'Boned Rolled Pig'?
subtitle: An advertisement promotes a rather off-putting mid-century meat product.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows an advertisement for a "legally edible" meat product called "boned rolled pig."

title: Thank You for Sharing, Fox News
subtitle: What seemed like a barb directed at Fox News and its fans by a Home Depot customer service rep was actually the work of a trolling comedian.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Home Depot representative posted a caustic social media comment in response to a Fox News article.

title: Did Melania Trump Plagiarize a Memorial Day Tweet From Michelle Obama?
subtitle: A meme falsely claims Melania Trump plagiarized a Memorial Day statement made by Michelle Obama in 2014.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In 2018, Melania Trump plagiarized Michelle Obama's 2014 Memorial Day statement.

title: Did Tim Tebow Kneel During the National Anthem in Protest of Abortion?
subtitle: Tim Tebow and Colin Kaepernick are both famous for kneeling during football games, but in dramatically different contexts.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former NFL quarterback Tim Tebow knelt on the field during the national anthem as a protest against abortion.

title: Did a Gay Baboon Terrorize an African Village?
subtitle: Rumors about a gay baboon's "terrorizing" a village and raping five men can be traced back to a homophobic fake news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A gay baboon terrorized a South African village and raped several men.

title: Did California's Governor Sign a Law Requiring All Students to Learn Spanish?
subtitle: A notorious producer of fake news provokes yet more outrage with another fabricated meme.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In May 2018, California Governor Jerry Brown signed a law requiring all students in the state to learn Spanish.

title: Was a Muslim Educator Named Superintendent of Atlanta's Schools?
subtitle: A "satirical" blog's Facebook page used an actual news outlet's photograph to make a stinker of an Islamophobic "joke."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A Muslim man named "Mike Alig-Juzfahrted" was appointed superintendent of Atlanta Public Schools.

title: Is the Navy Naming a Ship 'USS Tig Ol Bitties' After an Online Vote?
subtitle: A article joked that an online naming contest resulted in the Navy naming a ship the "USS Tig Ol Bitties," but it was just satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The United States Navy announced that it was christening a ship the "USS Tig Ol Bitties" after an online vote.

title: Was an 'Ed, Edd n Eddy' Reboot Announced by Cartoon Network?
subtitle: Rumors about a return of the popular, long-running comedy cartoon have been repeatedly shot down by people involved with the show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Cartoon Network announced in May 2018 that they were rebooting the comedy series "Ed, Edd n Eddy."

title: Was CNN Raided by the FCC for 'Deceiving the American Public'?
subtitle: A tired old trope of fake news purveyors is to claim that legitimate news organizations are the ones propagating fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The FCC raided CNN's head offices on the grounds that the TV news network was "violating press guidelines."

title: Was a Black Woman Who Won a Georgia Primary Arrested for Election Fraud?
subtitle: Unfortunate fake news plays on the accomplishment of Stacey Abrams, who could become the nation's first black woman governor.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Democratic gubernatorial candidate in Georgia illegally paid for tens of thousands of votes.

title: Did Al Capone Demand an Inquiry Into Whether the Justice Department Surveilled His Gang?
subtitle: The fake Chicago Tribune headline is a play on a real one involving President Donald Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Notorious mobster Al Capone demanded an inquiry into whether his gang was surveilled or infiltrated by the Department of Justice.

title: Does Getting a Restaurant Logo Tattoo Guarantee Free Meals There for Life?
subtitle: It's not a judgment call to say that a lifetime supply of free food isn't a good reason to get a tattoo of a restaurant's logo - it's just that it won't work.
author: Dan Evon
statement: People who get tattoos of logos from one of a variety of chain restaurants - such as McDonald's, Taco Bell, and Chipotle - are guaranteed free food there for life.

title: Did Meghan Markle's Dog Accompany Queen Elizabeth to the Royal Wedding?
subtitle: Despite rumors, the queen did not escort Meghan Markle's rescued beagle Guy to the royal wedding.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video shows Queen Elizabeth riding with Meghan Markle's rescued beagle Guy to the royal wedding.

title: Has the CEO of Wonder Bread Cut Ties with the NRA and Other Conservative Companies?
subtitle: A meme about Wonder Bread's supposedly cutting ties with the NRA is just a bit of political trolling.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The CEO of Wonder Bread has cut that company's ties with the NRA and other conservative companies.

title: Is CNN Permanently Closing Their Doors After a Ratings Plunge of 30 Percent?
subtitle: A notoriously unreliable web site spread the unsubstantiated claim that the cable news network was on the verge of shutting down because of a decline in viewership.
author: David Emery
statement: Due to a year-over-year decline in overall viewership during the second week of May 2018, CNN is on the verge of permanently closing its doors.

title: Did President Trump Tell Belgium to 'Withdraw from the Climate Agreement'?
subtitle: A Belgian political party lampooned the president's view on climate change using 'deep fake' technology.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump sent a video message to Belgian citizens criticizing their government for being part of the Paris Climate Change Agreement.

title: Were Palestinian Martyrs Caught on Video Faking Their Deaths?
subtitle: A video of a 2013 protest in Egypt is often shared with erroneous claims about false flag attacks and people faking their deaths.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Palestinians were caught faking the deaths of several martyrs when one of the 'corpses' was filmed moving.

title: Is Capriccio Sangria Spreading HIV?
subtitle: One of many hoaxes involving the claim that a common food product has somehow become contaminated with HIV.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Capriccio Bubbly Sangria beverages are contaminated with HIV.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Say 'Trump Deplorables' Were the 'Biggest Threats to America'?
subtitle: A notorious producer of hoax news stories turns a fabricated quote into a Facebook meme.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Speaking at the University of California Berkeley in May 2018, Hillary Clinton warned about "Trump deplorables," calling them "the biggest threats to America."

title: Eddie Murphy Death Hoax
subtitle: An old false report about actor Eddie Murphy's dying in a car crash recirculated in May 2018.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Actor/comedia Eddie Murphy died in a car crash in 2018.

title: Do Rocks Falling Into the Ocean Contribute to Global Sea Level Rise?
subtitle: On human timescales, sediment and rocks flowing into the ocean do not appreciably contribute to observed sea level rise; on larger timescales, the question is irrelevant.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: "Rocks falling into the ocean" is a factor that contributes to observable sea level rise on human time scales.

title: Did Facebook Executive Jeff Rothschild Say 'We Need a Third World War'?
subtitle: The former Facebook vice president supposedly advocates solving global problems by exterminating 90 percent of the human population.
author: David Emery
statement: Facebook vice president Jeff Rothschild said "In order to finalize the New World Order process we need a 3rd world war to exterminate 90% of the world's population."

title: Is This the Aftermath of a 2018 Plane Crash in Havana?
subtitle: Old, unrelated images were passed around social media just after news broke about a plane that crashed in Cuba.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Images show the aftermath of a plane crash in Havana, Cuba, in May 2018.

title: Are These Skiing Ostriches Real?
subtitle: Digital effects, professional skiers, and ostrich costumes were used in an advertising campaign promoting tourism in Japan.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of ostriches skiing down a mountain.

title: Have Leaked Documents Been Published Showing Donald Trump's 'True' Weight?
subtitle: The "Girther" conspiracy theory is based on false assumptions about how the human body can vary from person to person.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The "Wall Street Journal" (or another large news outlet) has published documents leaked from Walter Reed Medical Center which show President Donald Trump's "true" weight and prove a conspiracy to mislead the public.

title: Did President Donald Trump Tweet That There Should Be a Mother's Day for Fathers?
subtitle: A tweet attributed to Trump about the "liberal media" prohibiting a Mother's Day for fathers is a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump tweeted that there should be a Mother's Day for fathers, but "the liberal media won't let that happen."

title: Did the Ku Klux Klan March at the 1924 Democratic National Convention?
subtitle: An Internet meme holds that the KKK touted its political power by marching en masse outside the convention, which allegedly became known thereafter as the "Klanbake."
author: David Emery
statement: The Ku Klux Klan held a march and rally at the 1924 Democratic National Convention, which was thereafter popularly known as the "Klanbake."

title: Can Coconut Water Be Used as a Substitute for Blood Plasma?
subtitle: Anecdotal stories about the liquid's alleged medical benefits have circulated for decades.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Coconut water can be used as an intravenous substitute for blood plasma.

title: Did Maxine Waters Say She Would Impeach Trump If She Became President?
subtitle: A quote supposedly from the California Congresswoman about impeaching President Trump was digitally added into an old still from a CNN broadcast.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Maxine Waters told CNN that her first act if elected president would be to impeach Donald Trump.

title: Did Fisher-Price Release a 'Tiny Toker' Toy?
subtitle: The "Tiny Toker" toyset, featuring kid-sized marijuana paraphernalia, is a not a real product from Fisher-Price.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fisher-Price manufactured a "Tiny Toker" toyset featuring a toy bong and other marijuana paraphernalia.

title: Was a Lottery Winner Arrested for Dumping $200,000 of Manure on the Lawn of His Former Boss?
subtitle: When asked by organizers what he would do with the money, he had simply answered:
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A lottery winner was arrested after he spent $200,000 to dump manure on his ex-boss's lawn.

title: Is the 'Blue Bow' Trout Real?
subtitle: Is an image of a new type of trout genuine, or is it just another fish story?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the first "blue bow trout" caught in Pennsylvania.

title: Is Rep. Debbie Dingell Introducing a 'Gun Confiscation' Bill?
subtitle: Right-wing blogs once again tried to present "red flag" bills as a sign of widespread seizing of firearms.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Rep. Debbie Dingell is introducing a bill that would lead to widespread gun confiscations.

title: Are People Adopting Pit Bull Terriers for the Sole Purpose of Euthanizing Them?
subtitle: The #PitbullDropOff hashtag and related claims of mass dog killing stem from a sophomoric troll attempt with origins in 4chan.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: People are adopting pit bulls with the express goal of euthanizing them, and then bragging about it on the Internet with the hashtag #PitbullDropOff.

title: Was Palestine Granted Permission to Compete in Eurovision 2019?
subtitle: A satire site poked fun at the victory of an Israeli singer in the annual competition.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Palestine will compete in Eurovision 2019.

title: Are 'Illegals' Lining Up to Vote in Battsville, Arizona?
subtitle: An image circulating on Facebook was taken in Mexico, not Battsville, Arizona - a city that does not exist.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph captures undocumented immigrants lining up to vote in Battsville, Arizona.

title: Was a Zambian Man Arrested After Boasting He Lost 280 Pounds on a 'Cannibal Diet'?
subtitle: Not a realistic way of losing weight, nor a method that's actually been tried.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A man in Zambia was arrested after proclaiming he had employed a 'cannibal diet' to lose weight.

title: Was Sen. John McCain a 'Hanoi Hilton Songbird'?
subtitle: A Fox News analyst was fired from the network after attempting to revive an old, debunked smear against the late lawmaker and former prisoner of war.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. John McCain was referred to as "Songbird John" following his imprisonment during the Vietnam War.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Couple Kissing During the 1971 May Day Protests?
subtitle: When advertisements imitate scenes from the past, modern commercial creations often become mistaken for history.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph captures a couple kissing amidst the 1971 May Day protests.

title: Did Heineken Advertise Beer to Babies?
subtitle: Nearly every company wants to capture potential customers as early as possible, but how far will they go?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A vintage Heineken advertisement showed a toddler drinking a beer and boasted about having the youngest customers in the business.

title: Did London's Mayor Encourage Muslims to Riot During Trump's UK Visit?
subtitle: A prime example of why considering the context and content of video information is so important in discerning fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The mayor of London encouraged muslims to riot during President Donald Trump's visit to the U.K

title: Is Sarah Huckabee Sanders Being Replaced?
subtitle: This move is possibly fated to happen someday, but for now it's fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Sarah Huckabee Sanders has lost the confidence of the President and will be replaced.

title: Did an Oakland A's Shortstop Wear a Shirt Reading 'Kill the NRA'?
subtitle: Protests by professional athletes have not yet reached this extreme, outside the world of fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An Oakland A's shortstop laid on his back during the playing of the national anthem, while wearing a shirt reading "Kill the NRA."

title: Did a Spider in a Tampon Result in a Disturbing Medical Emergency?
subtitle: A fictional horror story about a spider, a tampon, and a trip to the emergency room was mistaken as a genuine confessional by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Doctors concluded that a large spider made its way into a woman's uterus after it got stuck inside her tampon.

title: Did Melania Hit Donald Trump with a 'Shocking Announcement He Never Saw Coming'?
subtitle: Nobody else saw this coming, either.  In fact, nobody has seen it yet at all.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: First Lady Melania Trump recent "hit" her husband with a "shocking announcement."

title: Is Flying J Taking Down U.S. Flags Because They 'Offend Foreigners'?
subtitle: A Facebook user claimed that a truck stop in Texas took down a flag because it offended "foreigners," but Flying J saids in reality the flagpole was broken.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pilot Flying J is removing American flags from their truck stop flagpoles because the flags "offend foreigners."

title: Did McDonald's Announce They're Permanently Removing the Big Mac from Their Menu?
subtitle: McDonald's is always tinkering with their menu, but this would be a monumental change.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The McDonald's fast food chain announced they will be phasing out the Big Mac by July 1.

title: Did President Obama Bow to Ayatollah Khamenei?
subtitle: This questionable image was posted in an attempt to stir up outrage and sell hats.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Barack Obama bowing to Iran's supreme leader Ali Khamenei.

title: Did the Parkland Shooting Suspect Have a 'Connection' to Barack Obama?
subtitle: Conspiracy-minded web sites perform impressive mental gymnastics in an effort to tie the 44th president to Nikolas Cruz.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Parkland school shooting suspect Nikolas Cruz has a "connection" to former president Barack Obama and his administration.

title: Does Legalizing Marijuana Necessitate Euthanizing Pot-Sniffing Dogs?
subtitle: Arguments made by one sheriff opposed to legalized marijuana are dubious and disputed by police departments that have dealt with legal weed.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The legalization of marijuana will force police departments to euthanize their drug sniffing dogs.

title: Did Rosie O'Donnell 'Plead Insanity' Over Illegal Campaign Donations?
subtitle: Right-leaning web sites falsely accused the actress and comedian of trying to set up a "Trump Derangement Syndrome" defense.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Rosie O'Donnell "pled insanity" after being caught violating individual election campaign contribution regulations.

title: Did North Korea Agree to 'Open Its Doors' to Christianity?
subtitle: A bogus story in a notorious fake news web site claimed without evidence that the country is now allowing open practice of Christianity.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: North Korea is now allowing the open practice of Christianity.

title: Does a 'Welcome to Kansas City' Sign Contain an Unfortunate Typo?
subtitle: An image of a welcome sign featuring the word "anally" instead of "annually" is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
