statement: A "Welcome to Kansas City" sign features an amusing, but unfortunate typo welcoming 25 million visitors "anally," not "annually."

title: Did Congress Eliminate All Senior and Veterans Discounts?
subtitle: An Oregon senator has not passed a bill deeming such discounts to be "exclusionary and biased."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Democratic U.S. senator from Oregon "pushed through" a bill to eliminate all senior and veterans discounts.

title: Is 'I Took an Arrow in the Knee' Slang for Getting Married?
subtitle: The origins of many marriage-related rituals are arcane, but we can safely rule out this explanation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The phrase 'I took an arrow in the knee' is old Norse slang for getting married.

title: Does Stepping on a Rusty Nail Cause Tetanus?
subtitle: Although puncturing one's skin with a nail that has been in contact with the soil is a risk factor for tetanus, rust has nothing to do with the disease.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Rust causes tetanus.

title: Is This a Purple Horned Winged Lizard?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a "purple horned winged lizard" is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a purple horned winged lizard.

title: Is Willie Nelson Seriously Ill?
subtitle: A sketchy Facebook page claimed Willie Nelson was seriously ill, sharing video content known as "engagement bait."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Willie Nelson fell seriously ill in May 2018.

title: Did Nelson Mandela Praise President Trump?
subtitle: The famed South African anti-apartheid figure's 100th birthday anniversary will be celebrated in July 2018.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Nelson Mandela praised President Trump ahead of a South African visit by Barack Obama.

title: Michelle Obama Never Placed Her Hand Over Her Heart During the National Anthem?
subtitle: A right-wing, pro-Trump Facebook page uses a photograph of Melania Trump to attack her predecessor - and gets the facts badly wrong in the process.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Michelle Obama, as First Lady, never placed her hand on her heart during the national anthem.

title: Did President Trump Scrap Plans for a Border Wall in Favor of a Dome?
subtitle: Initial estimates put the cost of our new dome in the area of seven-and-a-half quintillion dollars.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump has scrapped plans for constructing a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border in favor of a proposal for a dome.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Die Unexpectedly of a Rare Disease?
subtitle: Unimaginative political trolling turns monotonous.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton died suddenly of a previously unknown medical condition.

title: Has Donald Trump Won the Nobel Peace Prize?
subtitle: It might happen someday, but it hasn't happened yet.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump has been awarded the 2018 Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Did Netflix Announce a 'God of War' Series in April 2018?
subtitle: A piece of fan art hopefully touting a would-be Netflix series was mistaken for a genuine promotion.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix announced in April 2018 that they are creating a new series based on the video game "God of War."

title: Was Hillary Clinton Killed During a Hunting Expedition?
subtitle: Hillary Clinton continues to die at an alarming rate, having been killed at least four times in the course of three days.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton was killed while on a hunting expedition with 'some of Washington's elite.'

title: Did Samuel L. Jackson Tweet About Overpaid 'Modern Mumble Rappers' and Teachers' Pay?
subtitle: A poorly-formatted purported Twitter quote attributed to the actor is just a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Actor Samuel L. Jackson tweeted a lament about overpaid "modern mumble" rap artists and underpaid teachers.

title: Did a Study Show That Aluminum from Vaccines Killed Alfie Evans?
subtitle: A notorious fake news web site cynically exploited the death of an English toddler with a false clickbait headline calculated for maximum outrage.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A scientific study shows the death of Alfie Evans was caused by aluminum additives in vaccines.

title: Are People Dying From Exposure to Sarah Jessica Parker's Perfume?
subtitle: A variant on a long-running online hoax accused the actress's "Lovely" fragrance line of being used by terrorists.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: People who smell the perfume "Lovely" are killed either instantly or within three days.

title: Is This Sign at the United States-Mexico Border Real?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a U.S. border sign saying "lots of free stuff ahead" is - you guessed it - nothing more than a poorly-done digital edit.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A sign at the United States border and sponsored by the Democratic party informs travelers from Mexico that there's "lots of free stuff ahead."

title: Is This the First Caravan Member to Be Granted Asylum in the United States?
subtitle: A cynical attempt to smear asylum seekers in the 2018
of immigrants is actually a 2009 photo from a pornographic website.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A meme purporting to include an image of a Honduran asylum seeker and
member named Susana Gonzalez shows the first woman to be granted asylum in the United States in that group.

title: Did Michele Bachmann Say 'Kanye is Right' and Slavery was 'a Choice'?
subtitle: A phony quote from the former U.S. representative circulated after the musician made controversial remarks about slavery.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Congresswoman turned pundit Michele Bachmann said "Kanye is right ... slavery was a choice."

title: Was Hillary Clinton Killed in a Monster Truck Mishap?
subtitle: Hillary Clinton continues to die at an alarming rate, having been killed at least three times in the course of two days.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton was killed when she was hit by an out-of-control truck.

title: Do 'Liberals' at the University of Texas Want to Designate Masculinity a Mental Illness?
subtitle: Conservative web sites grossly misrepresented the provisions of an initiative by UT's Counselling and Mental Health Center.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Liberals at the University of Texas called for masculinity to be designated a mental illness

title: Were Over 500 'Migrant Caravaners' Arrested with Suicide Vests?
subtitle: "ISIS soldiers" armed with suicide vests and disguised as caravaning asylum seekers are the product of a clickbaiter's invention.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Over 500 members of a caravan of asylum seekers traveling through Mexico to the U.S. border at San Diego were arrested in possession of suicide belts.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Killed Filming a Documentary in Missouri?
subtitle: Hillary Clinton is being killed at an alarming rate, by many different means in a variety of locations.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton was accidentally killed during the filming of a documentary about her.

title: Was a Hearse Towed Away During the Middle of a Funeral?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a depressing event actually shows a group of actors filming a scene for a television show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a hearse being towed away in the middle of a funeral procession.

title: Did Israel Drop a Tactical Nuclear Bomb on Syria?
subtitle: Fake news sites claimed an air strike on a base in Syria involved a "tactical nuke." It did not.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Israel fired a tactical nuclear weapon at an Iranian base in Syria in late April 2018.

title: Did a Dead Reporter Mail Her Lawyer an 'Open If Something Happens to Me' Recording of Bill Clinton?
subtitle: Bill Clinton did not 'admit to raping and murdering a woman in Arkansas in 1987.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A reporter who was found dead mailed her lawyer a recording

title: Did Sarah Huckabee Sanders Say She Was 'Proud' to be Compared to Aunt Lydia From 'The Handmaid's Tale'?
subtitle: A parody Facebook account tricked some readers into believing that the White House Press Secretary had embraced an unflattering comparison made by comedian Michelle Wolf.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: On Facebook, White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders proudly embraced an unflattering comparison to Aunt Lydia from the Handmaid's Tale.

title: Did Barack Obama and George W. Bush Tweet Criticisms of Kanye West?
subtitle: Doctored images appear to show the 43rd and 44th U.S. presidents leading a Twitter backlash against the controversial rapper.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In April 2018, Barack Obama and George W. Bush criticized rapper Kanye West on Twitter.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Killed During an FBI Raid?
subtitle: The FBI hasn't raided the Clintons' New York home, much less killed anyone in the process.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton was killed during an FBI raid on the Clintons' New York home.

title: Is This 'Apocalyptic Sunset Over Moscow' Real?
subtitle: A striking "photograph" is actually a composite of at least two different images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a remarkable sunset over Moscow.

title: Does The Human Body Replace Itself Every Seven Years?
subtitle: While the vast majority of cells would be replaced every seven to ten years, some cellular outliers make such a statement pointedly false.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Every cell in the human body is replaced every seven years.

title: Did Allison Mack Confess She Sold Children to Rothschilds and Clintons?
subtitle: A real case of sex trafficking charges involving a "Smallville" actress was mixed with fabrication and exaggeration to produce guaranteed clickbait.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actress Allison Mack confessed that she sold children to the Rothschilds and Clintons.

title: Was Comedian Michelle Wolf Once Arrested for Bestiality?
subtitle: An image of a doctored newspaper article contained the false claim that comedian Michelle Wolf was arrested for bestiality in 2015.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A newspaper article from 2015 reported that comedian Michelle Wolf had been arrested for bestiality

title: Did Comedy Central Fire Michelle Wolf and Apologize to Sarah Sanders?
subtitle: The 'Daily Show' correspondent's appearance at an annual Washington press event left much of the nation abuzz.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Comedy Central fired Michelle Wolf and issued an apology after the comedian's appearance at the 2018 White House Correspondents Dinner.

title: Did Hulu Cancel Michelle Wolf's Standup Special?
subtitle: The 'Daily Show' correspondent's appearance at an annual Washington press event left much of the nation abuzz.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hulu cancelled plans to stream comedian Michelle Wolf's standup special after her appearance at the 2018 White House Correspondents Dinner.

title: Fascism, Corporations, and Merriam-Webster
subtitle: A popular meme repeated confused and inaccurate claims about the purported links between fascism and modern corporations.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Merriam-Webster changed their dictionary definition of "fascism" in 1987 to censor links between its new corporate owner and fascists.

title: Did a New Study Show That Marijuana Leads to a Complete Remission of Crohn's Disease?
subtitle: The results of a 22-person pilot study have been misrepresented through years of viral reporting and celebrity promotion.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A "new" study has demonstrated that marijuana leads to a "complete remission" of Crohn's disease.

title: Did Maine House Democrats Vote to Allow Female Genital Mutilation?
subtitle: Legislators in Maine did not pass a bill or any legislation permitting female genital mutilation, an act that is already restricted at the federal level.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Maine's House Democrats voted to allow female genital mutilation.

title: Was Trump Labeled 'Best President' or 'Worst President' on a 'Time' Cover?
subtitle: Two images purportedly showing President Trump on the cover of "Time" magazine under the headlines "Best President Ever" and "Worst President Ever" are both hoaxes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump was labeled as either the best or the worst president ever on the cover of "Time" magazine.

title: Does a 'Plastic' Layer Cover Romaine Lettuce?
subtitle: A viral video purporting to show a woman peeling plastic off lettuce leaves is misleading.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A viral video shows a woman peeling a layer of plastic off romaine lettuce leaves.

title: Did DJ Avicii Try to Expose a Pedophile Ring Before He Died?
subtitle: Yet another specious "report" from a fake news site that seems to have a fascination with pedophilia.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Swedish-born producer DJ Avicii died under suspicious circumstances while he was trying to use music videos to expose a pedophile ring

title: Did an Orca Eat an Ice Fisherman on Camera?
subtitle: One of several ways to spoil a perfectly good day of peaceful ice fishing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an ice fisherman getting eaten by an orca.

title: Did Attorney Michael Cohen Advertise His Services as 'The Fixer?'
subtitle: An anonymous New York prankster put up satirical posters for President Trump's lawyer on the city's subway system.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Michael Cohen, personal attorney for President Donald Trump, advertised his services as "The Fixer" in New York City subway ads in April 2018.

title: Is a Mysterious Creature Terrorizing Argentina?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a mysterious 7-foot creature is actually a digitally manipulated image based on concept art for a 'Harry Potter' werewolf.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a mysterious 7-foot creature that has been terrorizing a village in Argentina.

title: Did a Florida Sheriff's Deputy Die 'Suspiciously' After Criticizing David Hogg?
subtitle: Several dubious web sites complained about a "media blackout" surrounding Jason Fitzsimons' death after he criticized a Parkland shooting survivor.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Broward County Sheriff's Deputy Jason Fitzsimons died suspiciously after posting a photograph criticizing Parkland shooting survivor David Hogg.

title: Did the BBC Report on a Nuclear War Between NATO and Russia?
subtitle: A video simulation of a BBC report about a nuclear war between NATO and Russia was edited and presented as if it were genuine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video report from the BBC stated that a nuclear war had started between NATO and Russia.

title: Would a Proposed Law 'Ban the Bible' in California?
subtitle: A Republican politician and a right-wing television station grossly misrepresented California legislation that would amplify restrictions on "gay conversion therapy."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Assembly Bill 2943 would prohibit the sale of Bibles in California.

title: Did Kawhi Leonard Refuse to Play Because His Coach Made Anti-Trump Comments?
subtitle: A quote attributed to the San Antonio Spurs small forward about Gregg Popovich's criticism of the president is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kawhi Leonard said that he refused to play for the San Antonio Spurs because of coach Gregg Popovich's anti-Trump comments.

title: Proof the White Helmets 'Staged' a Chemical Attack in Syria?
subtitle: Images purportedly proving that the White Helmets staged a chemical attack in Syria are actually stills from a movie set.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of images "prove" that the White Helmets "staged" a chemical attack in Syria.

title: Did Malia Obama Found an Anti-Trump Website?
subtitle: The art of using memetic fake news to publicize fake web sites.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former first daughter Malia Obama founded a website intended to discredit President Donald Trump.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Found an Anti-Trump Website with Taxpayer Dollars?
subtitle: No, no, no ... don't blame your own fakey fake websites on other people!
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton used taxpayer dollars to found a website intended to discredit President Donald Trump.

title: Is Starbucks Offering Coupons for Black Customers Only?
subtitle: A Starbucks coupon for customers of "African-American heritage" only was a piece of divisive propaganda pushed by a popular internet forum.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Starbucks offered coupons exclusively to customers of "African-American heritage."

title: Suge Knight Death Hoax
subtitle: A disreputable web site managed to trick thousands of internet users with false claims that the former rap producer was murdered in prison.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In April 2018, Suge Knight was stabbed to death in prison.

title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Announce That He's Closing Facebook?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing Mark Zuckerberg announcing that closure of Facebook is a digitally altered hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mark Zuckerberg announced in a video that he was shutting down Facebook.

title: Is a Popular Teen YouTuber Planning 'Live On-Camera Abortion' for Bitcoin Donations?
subtitle: Several popular trolling elements - YouTube, Abortion, Bitcoin, Planned Parenthood - rolled up into one fake news piece.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A popular teen YouTuber planning a
to raise Bitcoin donations for Planned Parenthood.

title: WhatsApp 'Martinelli' Phone Virus Warning
subtitle: One of several similar WhatsApp malware hoaxes warns that a "Martinelli" video could "hack" your phone.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A WhatsApp video known as "Martinelli" spreads malware that irreparably hacks your cell phone.

title: Was a Statue Guarding the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier Knocked Over by Vandals?
subtitle: A photograph of a toppled statue is real; but the incident took place in Texas, not the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Virginia, and is no longer being investigated as vandalism.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a statue guarding the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier that was knocked over by vandals.

title: Barbara Bush Death Hoax
subtitle: The former First Lady was the subject of two stories reporting her death not long after announcements appeared that she was in failing health; one was a mistake, the other deliberate.
author: Arturo Garcia

title: Did Bill Nye Say We're Made of 'Copper, Nitrogen, Terbium and Silver'?
subtitle: Most good jokes are funny enough in their own right without the need for them to be attributed to a celebrity.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bill Nye tweeted to ask if a person was "made of copper, nitrogen, terbium, and silver."

title: Is a Hillary Clinton 'Snuff Film' Circulating on the Dark Web?
subtitle: Conspiracy theory web sites reported that Clinton could be seen mutilating a child during a Satanic ritual in an online video code-named "Frazzledrip."
author: David Emery
statement: An "extreme snuff film" in which Hillary Clinton and aide Huma Abedin are seen raping and mutilating a prepubescent girl is circulating on the dark web under the code name "Frazzledrip."

title: Was a Vermont State Trooper Attacked by 'Hooligans'?
subtitle: A clip from the movie "Super Troopers" was shared as if it showed a genuine incident of a Vermont State Trooper's being attacked by a group of children on a school bus.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a Vermont State Trooper's being attacked by a group of children on a school bus.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Say 'We Must Destroy Syria for Israel' in a Leaked E-Mail?
subtitle: Controversy around military action in Syria led to the recirculation of an inaccurate claim about Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In a leaked e-mail, Hillary Clinton said "we must destroy Syria for Israel."

title: Did a Shadowy Conspiracy Involve 'Purging' the Internet of Records Relating to Lisa Barsoomian?
subtitle: A conspiracy theory fomented by Roger Stone gets even basic facts wrong.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Authorities have deleted court records and online references to former United States Attorney Lisa Barsoomian, as part of a "deep state" conspiracy.

title: Is Article 54 of Obamacare Taking Effect in May 2018?
subtitle: A meme proclaims that "Article 54 of Obamacare" will take 30 percent of seniors' social security payments to cover insurance for undocumented immigrants.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Article 54 of Obamacare stipulates 30 percent of seniors' social security payments will be "diverted" to pay for insurance for undocumented immigrants as of 1 May 2018.

title: Was Mike Pence at the White House During the U.S. Strike Against Syria?
subtitle: After she was criticized online, White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders said a photograph which included the traveling Vice President was not misleading.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Vice President Mike Pence was in the White House Situation Room while the U.S. carried out a strike against Syria.

title: Did a Woman Survive the Titanic, Hindenburg, Pearl Harbor, and 9/11?
subtitle: The life story of Anna Mae Dickinson, dubbed the "luckiest woman alive," is amazing - and fictional.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Anna Mae Dickinson survived a variety of infamous tragedies, including the sinking of the Titanic, the Hindenburg explosion, and the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

title: Did a New Study Officially Declare That Fluoride Is a Neurotoxin?
subtitle: A controversial paper from 2014 continues to be shared as evidence that fluoride has "officially" been declared a neurotoxin; that's not how it works.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A new study published in the Lancet has officially declared that fluoride is a neurotoxin.

title: Did Conor McGregor and Floyd Mayweather Sign for a Rematch?
subtitle: A journalist's tweet inflamed discussion about a potential second bout between the boxing and UFC stars.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Floyd Mayweather and Conor McGregor have agreed to fight a rematch, to be fought under modified mixed martial arts rules.

title: Is 'Fortnite: Battle Royale' Ending?
subtitle: Rumors that a popular game was ending due to a copyright infringement lawsuit were based on a single fake tweet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fortnite Games announced on Twitter that it is ending "Battle Royale" due to a copyright infringement lawsuit from a competitor.

title: Is Jerry Brown Preparing to Release '10,000 Pedophiles and Rapists' From Prison?
subtitle: A conspiracy theory blog published an alarmist story after a judge's ruling on the effects of a new California law on sex offenders.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: California governor Jerry Brown will release 10,000 convicted sex offenders following a judge's ruling.

title: Is Facebook Removing the Share Button from Pro-Trump Posts?
subtitle: Rumors about Facebook's suppression of content (in this case posts supportive of President Trump) resurfaced after Sen. Ted Cruz referenced them.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook is removing the share button from "pro-Trump posts."

title: Is This a Photograph of 'Liberals' Protesting Against Donald Trump?
subtitle: An image from a 2010 gay pride parade in Germany was shared as if it showed liberals protesting against Donald Trump in the United States.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a group of liberals in the U.S. protesting Donald Trump.

title: Can This Stone Dissolve Iron?
subtitle: A viral video claims to document a mysterious and unexplained phenomenon, but in reality it shows a neat science experiment.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A video shows a stone capable of dissolving iron.

title: Did Elementary School Principal Muhammad Al-Salad Forcibly Implement a Halal Menu?
subtitle: A satirical Facebook page used a food-based pun to spread fake news about a fictional school principal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Principal Muhammad Al-Salad implemented a Halal menu at an elementary school in West Virginia.

title: Was the Body of a CDC Doctor Who 'Exposed' the Flu Shot Found Floating in a River?
subtitle: A missing Centers for Disease Control and Prevention doctor was found dead, but he was not a "whistleblower" who had warned the public about flu shots.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A CDC doctor who swarned the public that flu shots had caused a "deadly flu epidemic" was found dead:

title: Did Buzz Aldrin 'Reveal the Truth About Aliens' in a Lie Detector Test?
subtitle: A British tabloid published an "exclusive" based around an alleged analysis of a statement already refuted by Aldrin.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Voice analysis of Buzz Aldrin and other former astronauts revealed the existence of extraterrestrials.

title: Did Pope Francis Cancel the Bible and Propose a New Holy Book?
subtitle: A shocking story about the Pontiff's upending thousands of years of tradition originated on, you guessed it, a hoax site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pope Francis cancelled the Bible and proposed the creation of a new holy book.

title: Did Joy Behar Publish a Crude Tweet About a Fire at Trump Tower?
subtitle: Shortly after a fatal fire at Trump Tower, a fake tweet attributed to Joy Behar of 'The View' began circulating on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Joy Behar of "The View" sent a crass tweet about a fatal fire in Trump Tower.

title: Did Malia Obama Say White People Will Be 'Blended Out'?
subtitle: The former first daughter did not posit a huge demographic shift occurring in the space of a mere ten years.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former first daughter Malia Obama said white people will be 'blended out' of the population by the time she turns 30.

title: Did a Young Woman Deliberately Infect 324 Men With HIV?
subtitle: A dubious story is based on a baseless, unverified, and anonymous Facebook post.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 19-year-old college student in Kenya purposefully infected 324 men with human immunodeficiency virus in an act of revenge.

title: Did Donald Trump Say Community College Is '13th Grade' for 'Dummys'?
subtitle: An image suggesting that the president called community college "13th grade ... for dummies" is fabricated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Donald Trump insulted community colleges in a tweet, calling them "13th grade" and for "dummys" [sic].

title: Is the EPA Banning Manmade Snow Due to High Concentrations of Dihydrogen Monoxide?
subtitle: An apparent April Fool's prank had some readers worried.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Environmental Protection Agency will ban manmade snow after dihydrogen monoxide was found.

title: Did William Shakespeare Say He Was Always Happy Because He Didn't 'Expect Anything From Anyone?'
subtitle: A popular quote attributed to Shakespeare about his reason for happiness wasn't actually written by the famous playwright.
author: Dan Evon
statement: William Shakespeare wrote that he "always felt happy" because he didn't "expect anything from anyone."

title: Is Amazon Bankrupting the United States Postal Service?
subtitle: President Donald Trump has claimed the giant online retailing company is jeopardizing USPS's financial health.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Amazon's use of the USPS for package delivery services has resulted in a severe financial loss to the Postal Service.

title: Did Donald Trump Scare a Group of Schoolchildren?
subtitle: A video showing terrified reactions of a group of children as the president enters a classroom is actually two different clips that were edited together.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of children frightened by President Donald Trump.

title: Toni Braxton Death Hoax
subtitle: A site known for spreading fake news about the deaths of prominent musicians is at it again.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Singer Toni Braxton has passed away at age 50 of unknown causes.

title: Is Disney Building a Massive $6.5 Billion Resort in Toronto Islands?
subtitle: An April Fool's Day joke was the source of a rumor about a new Disney location.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Disney is opening a new resort and park in the Toronto Islands.

title: Was the 'March for Our Lives' Permit Application Made Months Before the Parkland Shooting?
subtitle: A viral story based entirely on a misunderstanding falsely insinuates that the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting was staged.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The permit for the "March for Our Lives" rally was submitted several months before the Valentine's Day school shooting.

title: Is Daniel Radcliffe Starring in 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'?
subtitle: An April Fool's Day prank featuring a fan-made movie poster left some aficionados of the Harry Potter universe disappointed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: In April 2018, Daniel Radcliffe announced that he would reprise his role as Harry Potter in a new movie called "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child."

title: Did a Parkland Shooting Survivor Say 'Generations Before Us Don't Know What It's Like to Be Shot at by AR-15s?'
subtitle: A number of outlets used a hoax quote to paint David Hogg as hopelessly ignorant of history.
author: Dan Evon
statement: David Hogg said that generations that came before his don't know what it's like to get shot at by AR-15s.

title: Were These Monstrous Paws Photographed in Alabama?
subtitle: We're not certain where a photograph of a pair of monstrous claws comes from, but it certainly wasn't taken in Alabama in 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A trail cam in Alabama snapped a photograph of an unknown creature's horrifying feet in March 2018.

title: Is President Trump Planning a Monument to the War on Christmas?
subtitle: A humorous article was just a seasonal jape, but not quite in the way that many readers recognized.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Trump administration has unveiled plans to construct a monument hailing the end of the War on Christmas.

title: Is a 'Stop Killing Alligators to Make Gatorade' Protest Sign Real?
subtitle: A photograph from a 2011 labor strike in London was repurposed to spread a goofy meme about Gatorade being made from real alligators.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a protest sign reading "stop killing aligators to make Gatoraid" [sic].

title: Was the NRA Founded to Protect Black People from the Ku Klux Klan?
subtitle: Revisionist accounts of the origin of the National Rifle Association say it was formed to help freed slaves defend themselves against racist attacks after the Civil War.
author: David Emery
statement: The National Rifle Association was formed for the express purpose of driving out the Ku Klux Klan and helping freed slaves defend themselves against racist attacks.

title: Did Emma Gonzalez 'Admit' to Bullying the Parkland School Shooter?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists tried to discredit the mass shooting survivor (again) by ignoring the suspect's history of disturbing behavior.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Parkland mass shooting survivor Emma Gonzalez admitted to bullying a former student who later killed seventeen people.

title: Did Russia Erect a Monument to Native Americans in Front of the United States Embassy in Moscow?
subtitle: There was a well-publicized petition to construct such a monument, but it has not been realized and was likely driven by Russian-American tensions.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Russia built a monument to memorialize the genocide of indigenous peoples on the American continent outside the United States Embassy in Russia.

title: Did David Hogg Give a Nazi Salute?
subtitle: A Parkland school shooting survivor was accused - falsely - of giving a Nazi salute at the end of his "March for Our Lives" speech.
author: Dan Evon
statement: David Hogg gave a Nazi salute at the end of his "March for Our Lives" speech.

title: Was Emma Gonzalez Photographed Swinging an Umbrella at a Truck?
subtitle: A famous 2007 photograph of singer Britney Spears is being used to spread a false accusation against the mass shooting survivor turned gun safety advocate.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Emma Gonzalez was photographed attacking a truck belonging to a "Second Amendment supporter" during a March for Our Lives event in March 2018.

title: Was a Scuba Diver Hospitalized After Getting His Penis Stuck in a Giant Clam?
subtitle: A sexually adventurous scuba diver was supposedly brought down by a shellfish allergy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A scuba diver was hospitalized due to an allergic reaction after his penis got stuck in a giant clam.

title: Did David Hogg Lie About Being on Campus During Mass Shooting?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists used an out-of-context clip to raise "questions" about a statement made by a Parkland, Florida mass shooting survivor turned gun-control advocate.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Marjory Stoneman Douglas student David Hogg was caught lying about being on campus during a February 2018 school shooting when he told CBS that he had to get on his bicycle and ride to school.

title: Did George Soros Pay 'March for Our Lives' Protesters $300 Each?
subtitle: As hundreds of thousands of students and supporters took to the streets to protest gun violence, conspiracy theorists blamed a familiar bogeyman.
author: David Emery
statement: Organizers working for billionaire George Soros ran Craigslist ads offering $300 each to individuals participating in the 24 March 2018 "March for Our Lives" protests.

title: Did David Hogg Attend a California High School?
subtitle: The Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting survivor turned gun-control activist has been the target of relentless online hoaxes and attempted smears.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting survivor David Hogg went to high school in California, not Florida, and is an actor.

title: Was Emma Gonzalez Filmed Ripping Up the U.S. Constitution?
subtitle: The outspoken survivor of the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School mass shooting has been campaigning against gun violence, but not in the fashion seen here.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Emma Gonzalez, a survivor of the Parkland school shooting, was filmed ripping up a copy of the U.S. Constitution.

title: Will There Be a Sequel to 'Napoleon Dynamite'?
subtitle: Rumors that there would be a follow-up to the 2004 cult classic actually grew out of a fan-made poster and years-old rumors.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A sequel to the movie 'Napoleon Dynamite' is in the works.

title: Did Florida Pass a Bill Legalizing Recreational Use of Marijuana?
subtitle: A fake news item falsely led social media users to believe that Florida became one of the states in which recreational marijuana is now legal.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new law in Florida legalized recreational use of marijuana.

title: Did the Obama Campaign Employ the Same Tactics as Cambridge Analytica?
subtitle: Attempts at "whataboutism" with a scandal involving social media and psychographics fail to acknowledge that Cambridge Analytica obtained data by misleading people.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Barack Obama's 2008 and 2012 presidential campaigns used the same tactics and techniques for which Cambridge Analytica and the Trump campaign criticized in 2018.

title: Did NASA Warn of an Impending Earthquake in India?
subtitle: A viral hoax managed to trick some people.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In March 2018, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration "predicted" a major earthquake for Delhi, India, several weeks in advance.

title: Does Facebook's Green 'BFF' Prove Your Account Is Secure?
subtitle: A Facebook status update meme claims that a green "BFF" in typed comments is an indicator of account security; it isn't.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can determine whether your Facebook account is secure by typing "BFF" to see if it turns green.

title: Did This Camel Lose Half Its Body?
subtitle: Is half a camel better than none? We may never know.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a camel that lost half its body after surviving a landmine explosion.

title: Did People Start Licking Toilets as a Protest Against Donald Trump?
subtitle: A grotesque hoax involving doctored images of people in bathrooms managed to trick some Internet users.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: People have begun licking toilets as a form of protest against United States President Donald Trump.

title: Donald Trump, Melania Trump, and Stormy Daniels?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing the United States president with his wife and alleged mistress has been digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Donald Trump with his wife Melania Trump and his alleged mistress Stormy Daniels.

title: Have Officials Warned That Someone Is Injecting Poison into Plastic Water Bottles?
subtitle: A Facebook video alleging that pinholes were found in bottled water caps morphed into rumors that people died after ingesting poisoned water.
author: David Emery
statement: Law enforcement officials alerted the public to check the tops of commercially sold bottles of water for tampering because someone is injecting poison into them.

title: Did 'Muslim Migrants' Attack a Catholic Church During Mass in France?
subtitle: A video of pro-migrant protesters being removed from the Basilica of Saint-Denis in France was shared with the inflammatory and incorrect claim that it shows Muslim immigrants attacking a church.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of Muslim immigrants attacking a Catholic church during mass.

title: Did President Donald Trump Appoint the Man Who Killed Cecil the Lion to a Wildlife Conservation Council?
subtitle: Vague headlines and a tenuous connection led to rumors that American dentist and trophy hunter Walter Palmer was named to a newly-formed wildlife conservation council.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Trump administration appointed Walter Palmer, famed for killing Cecil the Lion in 2015, to a newly-formed wildlife conservation council.

title: Did Ditching Common Core Cause a Florida School's Test Results to Improve?
subtitle: Articles criticizing the Common Core curriculum draw causal connections where none exist.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Abandoning the Common Core set of standards for English and mathematics caused a Florida charter school's test results to go from mediocre to outstanding.

title: Was Flight MH370 Found with an Eerie Black Box Recording Saying:
subtitle: An Internet hoax links missing Malaysian Airlines Flight MH370 with - what else? - aliens.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A black box recording has surfaced featuring an eerie message that suggests the disappearance of Malaysia Flight MH370 involved extraterrestrials.

title: Is There a Warrant for CIA Director Nominee Gina Haspel's Arrest?
subtitle: Activists have called on German prosecutors to move against Haspel, but no warrant has been issued.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: CIA Deputy Director Gina Haspel has a warrant for her arrest in Germany.

title: Was an All-Female Construction Company Responsible for the FIU-Sweetwater Bridge Collapse?
subtitle: Reports that an all-female construction company built a bridge that collapsed at Florida International University are based on incomplete, inaccurate, and misleading information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Munilla Construction Management, the construction firm that built the bridge at Florida International University that collapsed in March 2018, is an all-female company.

title: Did British Police Find Putin's Passport at the Scene of the Salisbury Poison Attack?
subtitle: A satirical web site took accusations of Putin's involvement in the March 2018 poisoning of a former Russian spy on British soil to extremes.
author: David Emery
statement: British police found Russian president Vladimir Putin's passport at the scene of a chemical attack on former Russian spy Sergei Skripal in Salisbury, England.

title: Did Stephen Hawking Become a Christian After a Blessing from Pope Francis?
subtitle: A disreputable Facebook page engaged in a time-honored ritual - the phony deathbed conversion of a prominent unbeliever.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Before his death, physicist Stephen Hawking declared his Christian faith after a visit with Pope Francis.

title: Does Christina Hagan's Campaign Ad Show the Mexico-United States Border?
subtitle: An Ohio Republican candidate recycles a misrepresentation of the border used by President Donald Trump.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Christina Hagan's campaign ad contains footage depicting the U.S.-Mexico border.

title: Pamela Anderson Death Hoax
subtitle: A fake news web site posing as ABC News reported that the former Baywatch star passed away at 50, but it's just another celebrity death hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pamela Anderson passed away in March 2018.

title: Is Matt Damon Moving to Australia to Escape the Trump Administration?
subtitle: A series of unconfirmed and anonymous reports about Matt Damon moving to Australia were almost immediately debunked by the actor's representative.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Matt Damon announced in March 2018 that he was moving his family to "a safe place" in Australia because he was fed up with President Donald Trump and his policies.

title: Did 'Trucks Full of Illegals' Cast Fake Votes in Pennsylvania Race?
subtitle: Recycling a ubiquitous rumor from every election in recent memory makes for poor political trolling.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: "Multiple trucks full of illegals" were spotted at "six polling locations across Pennsylvania" during a special House election.

title: Did a Federal Judge Nullify PA Election Results for 'Wide-Scale Voter Fraud'?
subtitle: A Democrat apparently won the special House election in southwestern Pennsylvania, with no judicial action nullifying the results.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A federal judge threw out the election results in a Pennsylvania special congressional election due to voter fraud.

title: Is California's Governor Requiring Students Use Arabic Numbers in Schools?
subtitle: A "satirical" blog posted a story seizing on readers getting angry about a nonexistent California law.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: California Gov. Jerry Brown signed a new "culture" bill requiring that Arabic, not "American," numbers be taught in schools.

title: Did a Tennessee School District Ban the American Flag?
subtitle: An outdated and exaggerated claim that a Tennessee school district banned the American flag reappeared years after the fact.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Tennessee school district banned the American flag on campus.

title: Did Disney Announce a Remake of 'Bedknobs and Broomsticks' with Kate Winslet?
subtitle: A fan-made movie poster tricked some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Disney announced in March 2018 that it was remaking 'Bedknobs and Broomsticks' with Kate Winslet.

title: Is Julia Stiles Transgender?
subtitle: Rumors about the actress are not based on medical records, personal confessions, or credible information of any sort.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Julia Stiles is transgender, and a photograph shows her before gender reassignment surgery.

title: Did a Captured Islamic State Leader Have Barack Obama On Speed Dial?
subtitle: A "satirical" site claimed that the unlocked iPhone of an Islamic State operative contained the contacts of several prominent world leaders, including the former United States president.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A captured Islamic State leader's cell phone contained the phone numbers of world leaders, including former President Barack Obama.

title: Was a Roanoke City Department of Social Services Worker Fired Over a Gun Permit?
subtitle: Storm Durham's claim that she was fired over possessing a concealed carry permit is not supported by city policy.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Former Roanoke City Department of Social Services worker Storm Durham was fired from her job because she possessed a concealed carry permit.

title: Did a Court Order Obama to Pay $400 Million in Restitution?
subtitle: No huge sum of money was "lost," or is being personally repaid, by former President Obama.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A federal appeals court has ordered that Barack Obama repay $400 million to the American people.

title: Has 'JUULing' Caused Cancer in High School and College Students?
subtitle: Use of a JUUL e-cigarette is rumored to have caused cancer in four students.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: JUULing, or use of a JUUL e-cigarette, has caused cancer in four students.

title: Is the United States' Global Trade Deficit Really $800 Billion?
subtitle: President Donald Trump's statements on the subject leave out the country's $244 billion services surplus.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The U.S. has a global trade deficit of $800 billion.

title: Did London Close 500 Churches and Open 423 New Mosques?
subtitle: A fear-mongering article was based on misleading and cherry-picked data about the number of churches and mosques in London.
author: Dan Evon
statement: London closed 500 churches and opened 423 new mosques.

title: Did Michele Bachmann Say That 'Jesus Created Assault Rifles'?
subtitle: A meme featuring a quote from the former Minnesota congresswoman is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michele Bachmann said during an appearance on "Fox & Friends" that Jesus created assault rifles.

title: Did the Kray Twins Use an Elephant to Rob a London Tram?
subtitle: An image of an elephant standing near a tram in London is frequently shared with a fictional backstory about English twin gangsters Ronnie and Reggie Kray.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows the Kray twins starting their organized crime "reign of terror" in London by robbing a tram with the help of an elephant.

title: Did Seattle Police Confiscate a Man's Guns Without a Warrant?
subtitle: Dubious right-wing blogs misrepresented an encounter prompted by Washington state's "red flag" law.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Police in Seattle took a man's gun away from him without a warrant.

title: Did a Little Girl Have a 'Joker Smile' Carved Into Her Face in South Africa?
subtitle: A gory image of a child who had been attacked by a dog was stolen and used by propagandists to spread fear about "white genocide" in South Africa.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young girl in South Africa who had a "Joker smile" carved into her face.

title: Are Nestle and Coca-Cola Trying to Privatize a South American Aquifer?
subtitle: Some fringe blogs in North America picked up a claim about the Guarani Aquifer that has already been debunked by Brazilian journalists.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Coca-Cola and Nestle are negotiating with the Brazilian government to privatize the Guarani Aquifier in South America.

title: Did Pope Francis Forgive 4,444 Pedophile Priests in Australia?
subtitle: A recent fake news item sought to distort the results of an inquiry into sexual abuse in the Catholic Church in Australia.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pope Francis forgave 4,444 "pedophile priests" in Australia and participated in a coverup of their crimes.

title: Is This a Jumping Baby Elephant?
subtitle: An image that appeared to be a luckily timed photograph was actually created with digital manipulation software.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a jumping baby elephant.

title: Did Melania Trump Plagiarize Michelle Obama's Statement on Women's History Month?
subtitle: A meme suggesting that Melania Trump plagiarized her Women's History Month statement from Michelle Obama is based on paraphrased and inaccurate quotes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump plagiarized her statement on Women's History Month from Michelle Obama.

title: Did ABC Fire Joy Behar from 'The View'?
subtitle: A constellation of fake news sites claimed Joy Behar was fired from "The View," but the headlines and content don't match.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: ABC fired Joy Behar from her job co-hosting "The View" after she made comments about Vice President Mike Pence's religious beliefs.

title: Does President Donald Trump Plan to End School Shootings - By Banning Schools?
subtitle: An article appearing to report that the president has an unorthodox idea for ending mass shootings at schools appeared on a page that only publishes satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump decided to ban schools in an effort to curb school shootings.

title: Did a First Responder Say He Was Told to 'Stand Down' in Parkland?
subtitle: A headline on the conspiracy blog Infowars.com mischaracterizes a tweet by a legitimate news reporter.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An emergency medical responder said he was given a "stand down" order during the mass shooting in Parkland, Florida.

title: Did a Parkland Survivor Tweet a Homophobic Slur?
subtitle: A fake tweet was spread in an attempt to smear the reputation of David Hogg, who survived a mass shooting at his high school that left seventeen people dead.
author: Dan Evon
statement: David Hogg posted a homophobic slur on Twitter in June 2016.

title: Is a Vibrant Bra Promotion a Criminal Scam?
subtitle: A Vibrant Body Company bra promotion has been linked to rumors of a human trafficking scheme.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Vibrant Body Company staged an online bra promotion as a front for human trafficking.

title: Does Delta Airlines Give Planned Parenthood Members Discounted Rates?
subtitle: A Georgia senator has claimed - without any supporting evidence - that Delta offers discounts on air travel to Planned Parenthood members.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Delta Air Lines gives members of Planned Parenthood discounted rates on air travel.

title: Did Harvey Weinstein Commit Suicide in Arizona?
subtitle: A fabricated article about the movie mogul's supposed self-inflicted death appeared on an irksome fake news web site.
author: David Emery
statement: Hollywood film producer and alleged sexual predator Harvey Weinstein shot and killed himself in a Scottsdale, Arizona, hotel room.

title: Did Pfizer's Vice President 'Blow the Whistle' on Gardasil?
subtitle: A disreputable web site falsely claimed that the "vice president of Pfizer" said a vaccine for human papillomavirus is "deadly."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The vice president of Pfizer said human papillomavirus vaccine Gardasil is "deadly."

title: Is Anchor Butter Contaminated with HIV?
subtitle: A new variant of a years-old rumor about a worker adding HIV-infected blood to foods or beverages takes aim at a popular brand of butter.
author: David Emery
statement: A worker at a British dairy that produces Anchor Butter contaminated the company's products with HIV-infected blood.

title: Was Ivanka Trump Fired from the White House?
subtitle: The comings and goings of the Trump administration's White House staff may seem like a revolving door, but First Daughter Ivanka Trump hasn't yet been shown the exit.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump's daughter Ivanka has been fired from her position at the White House.

title: Does Chuck Schumer Have an Unrestricted Concealed Carry Permit?
subtitle: The claim that the Senate Minority Leader has a concealed weapons permit is based on one single unsourced article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator Chuck Schumer has a concealed weapons permit.

title: Are Hackers Stealing Private Information via 'What Would You Look Like Bald' Facebook Apps?
subtitle: Viral warnings about "extreme hackers" stealing information via popular entertainment apps on Facebook are false and misleading.
author: David Emery
statement: Extreme hackers are gaining control of people's personal information via links to web sites offering Facebook users the opportunity to see what they look like bald, or as a member of the opposite sex, etc.

title: Does Chicago's Identification Card Program Allow Undocumented Immigrants to Vote?
subtitle: Election officials rejected the possibility that CityKey cards could cause an upswing in voter fraud.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A local identification card program in Chicago would allow undocumented immigrants to vote in United States elections.

title: Does Marco Rubio Want to Give Felons Right to Own Guns, But Not to Vote?
subtitle: Two fake quotes ostensibly uttered by the Florida senator resurfaced in the aftermath of the February 2018 mass school shooting in his state.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator Marco Rubio said both that felons should not be allowed to vote and that they should be allowed to own guns.

title: Did a Gay Man 'Turn Heterosexual' After a Near-Death Experience?
subtitle: A fake news web site used a photograph of a white nationalist to spruce up another of their fabricated stories.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A gay man renounced homosexuality after a near-death experience.

title: Did a Muslim Scholar Advocate 'Colonizing' U.S. and Canada with Sharia Law?
subtitle: A fabricated quote attributed to Tariq Ramadan has once again gained attention on the internet after the academic was arrested on rape charges.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Oxford professor of Islamic studies Tariq Ramadan said "we are here to colonize the U.S. and Canada" with Sharia law.

title: Is This Carl Sagan Holding a 'No Billboards in Space' Sign?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing famed astronomer Carl Sagan holding a sign reading "No Billboards in Space" is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Carl Sagan holding a sign reading "No Billboards in Space."

title: Did Ruth Bader Ginsburg Say that Pedophilia Was Good for Children?
subtitle: A 1974 report co-authored by Ruth Bader Ginsburg about sex bias in U.S. law has been grossly misinterpreted.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ruth Bader Ginsburg said that pedophilia was good for children.

title: Is the Military Drawing Up Plans for Nationwide Gun Confiscations?
subtitle: As usual. satire is mistaken for reality when it reflects something the reading audience fears will be happening.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The military has secretly drawn up plans to round up large numbers of privately-owned firearms from American gun owners.

title: Are Cadbury Products Contaminated with HIV?
subtitle: Rumors that a worker at Cadbury plant was arrested for contaminating the company's products with HIV-infected blood are a variant of an old and false rumor.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A worker at Cadbury plant was arrested for contaminating the company's products with HIV-infected blood.

title: Did Barack Obama Announce a Bid to Become UN Secretary General?
subtitle: President Obama hasn't announced he's seeking an international position he likely couldn't obtain in any case.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former U.S. president Barack Obama has announced a bid to become Secretary General of the United Nations.

title: Was a Student Suspended for Pretending to be Transgender to Use the Girls' Locker Room?
subtitle: A story about a high school student talking his way into showering with girls after gym class is a work of fiction.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A high school student pretended to be transgender so that he could take showers in the girls' locker room during gym class.

title: Did Melania Trump Hire an Exorcist to Cleanse the White House of Obama 'Demons'?
subtitle: According to the First Lady's spokesperson, widely shared reports that she demanded a White House exorcism are "not true in any way."
author: David Emery
statement: First Lady Melania Trump demanded that the White House be exorcised of "demonic idols and images" allegedly left there by the Obamas before she would enter it.

title: Did CNN Give a Parkland Shooting Survivor Scripted Questions?
subtitle: The network denied Colton Haab's allegation that it asked him to write a speech for a town hall meeting about gun safety.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: CNN asked a survivor of the 14 February 2018 mass shooting in Parkland, Florida to deliver scripted remarks during a televised town hall.

title: Is Laura Phelps a Crisis Actor Who Lost a Child at Both Sandy Hook and Marjory Stoneman Douglas?
subtitle: A conspiracy theory accusing Nick and Laura Phelps of being "crisis actors" received a new (and false) twist in the aftermath of the Parkland, Florida school shooting.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Laura Phelps is a crisis actor who lost children during school shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary in 2012 and Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in 2018.

title: Was The Cast of 'Black Panther' Added to FBI Watch List?
subtitle: A satirical web site played on allegations of racial profiling by the bureau for a humorous story about the hit Marvel movie.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The cast of the film "Black Panther" was placed on an FBI watch list.

title: Were News Stories About the Florida Mass Shooting Posted Days Before It Happened?
subtitle: A glitch that affects the time stamps on Google searches has led to bogus "false flag" conspiracy theories - again.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: News stories about a mass shooting at a Florida high school were timestamped days earlier than 14 February 2018, which prove that the mass shooting was actually a "false flag" hoax.

title: Did Tomi Lahren Say That Victims of Mass Shootings Don't 'Believe in God Enough'?
subtitle: A meme used a fabricated quote based on Lahren's comments about politicians' offering thoughts and prayers to mass shooting victims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News personality Tomi Lahren said that people who die during mass shootings don't believe in God enough.

title: Is This Maxine Waters #GunControlNow Tweet Real?
subtitle: An impostor Twitter account posing as Rep. Maxine Waters posted an inflammatory remark with the hashtag #guncontrolnow.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Congresswoman Maxine Waters tweeted that there was no reason for anyone to own a gun because she has an armed security detail.

title: Eyewitness Testimony Confirms a Second Parkland Shooter?
subtitle: Dubious web sites have used students' purportedly conflicting accounts of a Florida mass shooting to suggest a nefarious conspiracy.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Eyewitness testimony confirms that there was a second shooter during the Parkland, Florida school shooting on 14 February 2018.

title: Is This James Hetfield Standing Near a Bear He Killed?
subtitle: The Metallica vocalist was falsely identified in a photograph amid 2014 protests over his involvement with a History Channel show.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Metallica lead singer James Hetfield was photographed near a brown bear he shot and killed.

title: Did a Huge Shark Wash Up on a North Carolina Beach?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a large shark on a Kitty Hawk beach is a composite of at least two different photographs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a twenty-foot-long shark that washed up on a beach in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.

title: Did Make-a-Wish Apologize for Sending the Wrong Drake to Visit a Terminally Ill Boy?
subtitle: A parody account tricked Twitter users with a darkly comic video about a fictional mix-up.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Make-a-Wish Foundation apologized for sending

title: Does a Viral Video Show Prince George Reciting the Alphabet in Bible Verses?
subtitle: Despite the clickbait caption, the video comes from East Texas, not Kensington Palace.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral Facebook video shows Prince George of Cambridge reciting the alphabet through Biblical verses.

title: Was Parkland Student Chris Williams Shot While Saving Classmates?
subtitle: A student did get shot while locking a door during a school shooting -- but his name is not Chris Williams, and he's not the person depicted in a viral Facebook post.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts high school senior Chris Williams, shot nine times while protecting fellow students, leaving him in critical condition.

title: Was Snopes.com 'BUSTED' for Our CEO's Ties to George Soros?
subtitle: A meme about Snopes.com has been debunked by the very source it cites.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Snopes.com is an extremely liberal site with an agenda to discredit conservatives, paid for either by George Soros or the Clintons, or maybe Facebook.

title: Are White People Being Assaulted at Showings of 'Black Panther'?
subtitle: Online trolls tried to push claims of violence, but they were quickly foiled by others on social media.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: White people have been attacked by black filmgoers at showings of "Black Panther."

title: Did Rapper DMX Die?
subtitle: A prank Facebook post, and old reports about a drug overdose, fueled unfounded rumors about the rapper's demise.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The rapper DMX (Earl Simmons) died in February 2018.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict a Mass Shooting at a 'Black Panther' Movie Screening?
subtitle: Rumors holding that the show 'The Simpsons' predicted that there would be a mass shooting at a screening of the movie "Black Panther" were based on a doctored image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "The Simpsons" predicted that there would be a mass shooting at a screening of the movie "Black Panther."

title: Was the Florida School Shooter a Registered Democrat?
subtitle: Rumors that Nikolas Cruz was a registered Democrat were based on the voter registration of a different individual with a similar name and birth year.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The gunman suspected of killing at least seventeen people at a school in Florida in February 2018 was a registered Democrat.

title: Did BuzzFeed Advocate for Taking Away White People's Guns?
subtitle: A fake image suggested that Buzzfeed had published a story headlined "Why We Need To Take Away White People's Guns Now, More Than Ever. "
author: Bethania Palma
statement: BuzzFeed News published a story calling for guns to be taken away from white people.

title: Was the Suspected Florida High School Shooter Affiliated with the Islamic State?
subtitle: Despite conspiracy theorist speculation, no evidence supports a link between Nikolas Cruz and Islamic extremism.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Accused school shooter Nikolas Cruz has ties to the Islamic State or other Islamic extremist groups.

title: Did an Australian Archbishop Call Pedophilia a 'Spiritual Encounter With God'?
subtitle: Junk news websites gave a blatantly manufactured account of a statement by Archbishop Denis Hart.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Archbishop of Melbourne, Australia, called child sexual abuse a "spiritual encounter with God, through the priest."

title: Is This the Florida Shooter in an Antifa Shirt?
subtitle: In the wake of a school shooting that left 17 people dead in Florida, trolls attempted to stir up division by falsely claiming that the shooter had been photographed wearing a pro-Communist t-shirt.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Florida school shooter Nikolas Cruz wearing an antifa t-shirt.

title: Is the Florida High School Shooter a 'Dreamer'?
subtitle: In the immediate aftermath of a mass shooting on Valentine's Day, social media users began speculating the suspect was undocumented.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The accused school shooter in Florida is a Dreamer, a DACA recipient, or undocumented.

title: Is Tamiflu Causing Increased Deaths from Flu?
subtitle: Tamiflu is not responsible for the high number of flu season deaths, even if its potential rare side effects are scary.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Tamiflu is responsible for the increased number of deaths this flu season.

title: Did the Flu Shot Cause This Year's Flu Epidemic?
subtitle: This claim is based on the incorrect interpretation of single quote from one nurse in Wisconsin who, for the record, recommends getting the shot.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Production of the flu shot caused the influenza virus to mutate into a more virulent strain, driving the deadly 2017-2018 flu season.

title: Did Migrants Destroy a Car in Italy?
subtitle: Anti-Muslim blogger Pamela Geller posted an obvious fake and claimed it was an example of "migrant crime" in Europe.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A video shows Muslim migrants destroying a car in Italy.

title: Does Barack Obama's Official Portrait Contain Secret Images of Sperm?
subtitle: Far-right pundits went off the deep end after African-American artist Kehinde Wiley's portrait of Barack Obama was unveiled.
author: David Emery
statement: The official portrait of former President Barack Obama contains secretly-placed images of sperm cells, including one on his forehead.

title: Is a Murderous Taxi Driver Killing People in His Cab?
subtitle: Social media users from Nigeria to New York City accused an unidentified man of being a taxi driver moonlighting as a serial killer.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A taxi driver in Nigeria (or Zambia, or New York City, among other places) is using his cab to pick up victims.

title: Did President Donald Trump Block Jennie Willoughby on Twitter?
subtitle: An account posing as an ex-wife of former White House staff secretary Rob Porter, who resigned amid a domestic violence scandal, made the claim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump blocked Jennie Willoughby, one of the ex-wives of former White House staff secretary Rob Porter, on Twitter.

title: Did Mike Pence Defend Rob Porter's Domestic Abuse with a Bible Verse?
subtitle: Shortly after a Trump senior aide resigned amid domestic abuse allegations, a false rumor was spread that the Vice President had defended his behavior.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Vice President Mike Pence said that White House aide Rob Porter's purported domestic abuse was supported by the Bible.

title: Was a Russian Nuclear Executive Killed in a Plane Crash to Cover Up Clinton Corruption?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists falsely linked a deadly Moscow plane crash to Uranium One, a debunked Hillary Clinton "scandal."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Vyacheslav Ivanov, a former executive at Rosatom, was killed in a February 2018 plane crash as part of a "deep state" plot to cover up corruption by the Clintons.

title: Did Sen. Cory Booker Put Undocumented People 'Before Seniors and Veterans'?
subtitle: A graphic disseminated dismissive (and entirely fabricated) statements from the New Jersey Democrat.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. Cory Booker released a statement showing a preference for enrollees in the DACA program over military veterans.

title: Is This a Wall Around Nancy Pelosi's Home?
subtitle: Web sites attempted to paint the Congresswoman as a hypocrite after she came out in support of DACA recipients.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows Nancy Pelosi's mansion in San Francisco and the large wall that protects the estate.

title: Did an American Teenager Who Killed a 'Muslim Refugee' for Raping His Sister Get 30 Years in Prison?
subtitle: A anti-Islam, anti-refugee video widely shared on Facebook was blatant fake news.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An American teenager got 30 years in prison for killing a "Muslim refugee" who raped his sister.

title: Did a Judge Cut a Pedophile's Prison Term Because He Claimed a 3-Year-Old 'Asked' to Be Raped?
subtitle: A scurrilous fake news site took a controversial court case and added a fabricated element to it in order to produce clickbait.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A judge cut fifteen years off the sentence of a man convicted of lewd acts with a 3-year-old girl because the perpetrator claimed the child had 'asked to be raped.'

title: Is This 'Beware of Billionaire' Hunters Sign Real?
subtitle: An image was digitally created after a construction tycoon was arrested for hunting in a protected sanctuary.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a "Beware of Billionaire" hunters sign in Thailand.

title: Did Elon Musk Call Donald Trump a 'Dumbass'?
subtitle: Contrary to a fabricated tweet, the SpaceX CEO responded graciously to Trump's congratulations on the "American ingenuity" of the Falcon Heavy rocket.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In response to Donald Trump's congratulations on the Falcon Heavy launch, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk called the president a "dumbass."

title: Is This a Hermit Crab Using a Skull for a Shell?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a hermit crab using a human skull is actually a lifelike sculpture.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a hermit crab using a human skull as a shell.

title: Does this Frozen River Resemble the 'Scream' Mask?
subtitle: Internet users passed around an image that appeared to show river ice frozen in the shape of the mask worn by the Ghostface character in "Scream."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The ice in a photograph of a frozen river resembles the mask from the movie

title: Did Keanu Reeves Help Pay for a Stranger's Kidney Transplant With an Envelope of Cash?
subtitle: Two unrelated photographs were circulated on social media along with the a fictional story about actor Keanu Reeves' paying for stranger's kidney transplant.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Keanu Reeves gave an envelope of cash to a stranger in order to help pay for a kidney transplant.

title: Did a Black Lives Matter Leader Get Sued for Embezzling Donations?
subtitle: Right-wing web sites republished a fabricated story posted by a notorious purveyor of fake news.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Black Lives Matter leader Marquesha Johnson was sued for embezzling millions of dollars in donations.

title: Did an Explosion at Al Franken's Montana Ranch Kill 6 People?
subtitle: The fake news article misuses an image of a New York City building fire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An explosion at Al Franken's Montana ranch killed six people.

title: Did Jeff Sessions Praise Marijuana in a College Rock Band?
subtitle: A spoof video about the notoriously anti-pot Attorney General was produced by a comedy group and managed to trick some viewers.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: While in college, Attorney General Jeff Sessions was in a rock band whose lyrics and album titles championed the use of marijuana.

title: Does a New Facebook Algorithm Only Show You 26 Friends?
subtitle: Facebook hasn't limited your feed to only a certain number of people, and sharing a post saying otherwise won't make any difference.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new Facebook algorithm only shows posts from about two dozen friends in your newsfeed.

title: Was Adam Schiff's Sister Married to George Soros's Son?
subtitle: Rep. Adam Schiff, who authored a rebuttal to Devin Nunes's memo about the Trump-Russia investigation, became the target of conspiracy theories and fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Adam Schiff's sister Melissa was married to George Soros's son, Robert.

title: Is This 'Goliath Skeleton' Real?
subtitle: Some of the images in a collage purporting to show the discovery of a "Goliath skeleton" date back to a 1993 tabloid article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of photograph show the skeletal remains of the biblical giant Goliath.

title: Did Trump Tweet That If 'Dow Joans' Tanked, the President Should Be Shot Out of a Cannon?
subtitle: It's remarkably easy to create fake tweets.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump tweeted in 2015 that the president should be shot out of a cannon if the "Dow Joans" dropped more than 1,000 points.

title: Did Denzel Washington Say Trump's Election Saved Us From an 'Orwellian Police State'?
subtitle: The quote attributed to the famed actor was fabricated by a disreputable web site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Actor Denzel Washington said electing President Trump saved the U.S. from becoming an "Orwellian police state."

title: Did an Eagles Fan Steal an Ostrich from the Zoo During Super Bowl Chaos?
subtitle: As Philadelphians destroyed their city in celebration, a ridiculous rumor took hold on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Philadelphia Eagles fan stole an ostrich from the zoo and rode it through the streets in celebration of the team's Super Bowl victory.

title: Did the Eagles Respond to Trump's Congratulatory Tweet With a Vulgarity?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing the official Twitter account for the Philadelphia Eagles telling President Trump to "go f*ck himself" is not real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Philadelphia Eagles responded to a tweet from President Trump congratulating the team on winning the Super Bowl by telling the Commander-in-Chief to go f*ck himself.

title: Did George Soros Say His Life's Mission Is to Destroy the United States?
subtitle: There is no evidence that the billionaire supporter of progressive causes ever uttered such a remark, or anything resembling it.
author: David Emery
statement: George Soros said "I've made my life's mission to destroy the United States. I hate this country and I hate all of the people in it."

title: Did Palestinians Dance at the UN After Nikki Haley Threatened to Cut Aid?
subtitle: In the wake of the decision to move the U.S. embassy in Israel to Jerusalem, a viral video has spread with a false claim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Palestinian lawmakers dancing in response to Nikki Haley's threat to cut aid to the country in the wake of a controversial decision to move the U.S. embassy to Jerusalem.

title: Did a Greenpeace Activist Get His Arm Bitten Off After Hugging a Shark?
subtitle: An article claiming that a great white shark attacked a Greenpeace activist originated on a well-known fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Greenpeace activist had his arm bitten off when he tried to hug a shark.

title: Does Joe Kennedy's Palm Beach House Have a Security Wall?
subtitle: Rumors that there is a security wall outside the representative's Palm Beach House are inaccurate on several fronts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a security wall outside Joe Kennedy's Palm Beach house.

title: Was Jay-Z Filmed Punching a 12-Year-Old Female Fan?
subtitle: A decades-old video purportedly showing the rapper hitting a young fan is often shared without context.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video captures Jay-Z punching a 12-year-old girl after she tried to take his picture.

title: Did Nikki Haley 'Accidentally Confess' to an Affair with Donald Trump?
subtitle: U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley only inadvertently 'confessed' to being romantically involved with President Trump in clickbait headlines, not in her own words.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley "accidentally confessed" to being romantically involved with President Trump.

title: Did the ACLU Complain That Trump Said 'America' Too Many Times in State of the Union?
subtitle: Unreliable web sites misrepresented the substance of the American Civil Liberties Union's critical response to President Trump's address.
author: David Emery
statement: The American Civil Liberties Union issued a response to President Trump's 2018 State of the Union address complaining that he used the word "America" more than 80 times.

title: Did Julia Roberts Tell Celine Dion 'Go Back in Your Country' If She Didn't like Trump?
subtitle: A "celebrity feud" was actually a particularly lazy attempt at "outrage" clickbait.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Julia Roberts warned Celine Dion that President Donald Trump would "make Obama's destroyed America great again" and to leave the U.S. if she didn't like him.

title: Are All Homeopathic Drugs Now Illegal?
subtitle: The Food and Drug Administration has issued a draft guidance document suggesting a new legal interpretation of the controversial remedies, but they remain legal.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The FDA has ruled that homeopathic drugs are now illegal.

title: Will a Cooking, Cleaning Sex Robot Be Available by 2019?
subtitle: Nope - a "satirical" web site just thinks misogyny is funny.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2018, technology companies revealed plans to sell a sex robot that can cook and clean by 2019.

title: Did a Train Carrying GOP Congressmen Crash Due to a 'Deep State' Plot?
subtitle: No evidence validates claims of foul play in a train crash involving Republican members of Congress.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The train carrying GOP members of Congress to a West Virginia retreat crashed due to a Deep State plot.

title: Did Justin Timberlake Say 'Mandatory Vaccination Schedules Are Un-American'?
subtitle: Some people actually believe in the medical misinformation they peddle; others shamelessly risk the public health by publishing erroneous medical info just for clicks and kicks.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Justin Timberlake said that

title: Did a Woman Sue a Paris Zoo After an Escaped Hippo Tried to Rape Her?
subtitle: A tasteless, body-shaming fake news article claimed that a hippopotamus attempted to rape a 400-pound woman after escaping from a Paris zoo.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 400-pound woman sued a Paris zoo after an escaped hippo tried to rape her.

title: Does a 'Multicultural Beach' Sign in Melbourne Prohibit Pork and Alcohol?
subtitle: The city of Melbourne tweeted that they do not endorse the sign, noting in a droll aside that they have no beaches in their municipality.
author: David Emery
statement: A sign posted on a public beach by the city of Melbourne, Australia tells visitors to refrain from consuming of pork and alcohol and to be respectful during Islamic prayer times.

title: Did a Plane Fly a 'Where's My Damn Dinner?' Banner Over the Women's March?
subtitle: The "alpha" who purportedly flew the plane over the Women's March is entirely fictional -  but that didn't stop a legitimate news outlet from posting the image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a plane with banner reading "Where's my damn dinner?" flying over the Women's March.

title: Did Trump Tell George Soros to 'Go to Hell' at Davos?
subtitle: A well-known purveyor of fake news spread the fabricated claim that President Trump called out George Soros at the 2018 World Economic Forum.
author: David Emery
statement: At the 2018 World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump told billionaire George Soros to "go to hell."

title: Was an NFL Lawyer Who Claimed the Super Bowl Is 'Rigged' Found Dead?
subtitle: In 2018 the hoaxes and fake news about a "rigged" Super Bowl started even before the game was played.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An NFL "entertainment lawyer" was found dead hours after telling reporters that the upcoming Super Bowl was

title: Did NFL Decide Not to Televise National Anthem Before Super Bowl?
subtitle: An inaccurate meme claims the national anthem won't be televised before the Super Bowl.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The NFL announced that it will not be televising the national anthem before the Super Bowl in February 2018.

title: Did a Woman Pretending to Be a Sex Robot File for Child Support?
subtitle: A new legal frontier in human-robot sexual interactions has not yet been reached as described.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A woman posing as a "sex robot" became pregnant and filed a child support claim against her unsuspecting customer.

title: Is This Mountain Cliff Shaped Like an Elephant?
subtitle: A digitally edited photograph appears to show a natural wonder: a cliff that looks just like an elephant with a mountain on its back.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a mountain that closely resembles a frozen elephant.

title: Has Pluto Been Officially Reclassified as a Planet?
