subtitle: The decade-long debate over Pluto's planetary status has provided fodder for April Fool's Day jokes and fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The International Astronomical Union (IAU) issued a press release stating that Pluto has been reclassified as a planet.

title: Was a Pedophile Priest with HIV Who Raped Children Crucified?
subtitle: The viral tale of Father Jose Garcia Ataulfo, already questionable to begin with, has been embellished with fabricated fictional elements.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A priest with HIV who raped children was exonerated by the Catholic Church and then crucified.

title: Were $4 Million and Two Dead Bodies Found in a Democratic Mayor's Storage Unit?
subtitle: Presumably, being the fictional mayor of a non-existent town shields one from prosecution for crimes that didn't occur.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The FBI found $4 million in cash and two bodies in a storage unit belonging to the Democratic mayor of a Missouri town.

title: Was Fox News Banned as 'Propaganda' in Australia and New Zealand?
subtitle: Rumors of a ban on the Fox News Channel in Australia and New Zealand seem to have materialized on Facebook and Twitter out of thin air.
author: David Emery
statement: Fox News Channel was banned in Australia and New Zealand after being deemed "propaganda."

title: Did Dolly Parton Say: 'Trump In One Year Is Already Better Than 16 Years of Bush, Obama Put Together'?
subtitle: Celebrities say the most outrageous things, especially when it comes to politics! Or do they?  Sometimes they do, and sometimes they don't.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Singer Dolly Parton (or actress Michelle Pfeiffer) said that "Trump in one year is already better than 16 years of Bush and Obama put together"

title: Do People in Sweden Have to Sign a 'Consent Form' Before Having Sex?
subtitle: A right-wing Facebook page used a prank photograph to misrepresent a Swedish government proposal to change the country's consent laws.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A forthcoming law means people in Sweden will have to carry a signed "sex consent card" to avoid allegations of rape.

title: Is This Pope Francis Dancing Merengue?
subtitle: A viral video purportedly showing Pope Francis dancing merengue actually shows a lookalike at a Halloween party.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Pope Francis dancing merengue.

title: Do FBI Agents Have an Anti-Trump 'Secret Society'?
subtitle: Claims that FBI agents had formed a "secret society" to oppose President Donald Trump are unfounded and appear to have been based on a joke.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: FBI agents formed a secret society to oppose President Donald Trump.

title: Is Australia Using Chemtrails to Forcibly Vaccinate its Residents?
subtitle: A disreputable web site recycled an already-spurious claim by an anti-vaccine publisher.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Australian officials are deploying a genetically-modified vaccine aerially without consent from residents.

title: Is Trey Gowdy Replacing Mike Pence on the 2020 GOP Ticket?
subtitle: Curious political rumor holds that Vice President Mike Pence will be stepping down from the Republican ticket in 2020 to run for a U.S. Senate seat in Indiana.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Vice President Mike Pence will be stepping down from the GOP ticket in 2020 to run for a U.S. Senate seat in Indiana.

title: Will Robert Mueller Be Forced to Resign Over an Affair with Nancy Pelosi?
subtitle: The man heading an investigation that may implicate President Trump will not be stepping down over salacious revelations.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Robert Mueller will soon be resigning due to the disclosure of his long-term affair with House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi:

title: Was Ivanka Trump Critically Injured After Being Shot by a Sniper?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site run by a prolific purveyor of fake news published yet another distasteful and false story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2018, Ivanka Trump was shot and critically wounded in Washington, D.C.

title: Does a New Law Allow Atheist Doctors to Refuse Care to Religious Patients?
subtitle: A satirical article caused confusion by playing off a recent policy change at the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new law in Mississippi makes it legal for atheist doctors and nurses to refuse care to religious patients.

title: Has an Indictment Been Issued in the Uranium One Investigation?
subtitle: There's no credible evidence linking a January 2018 indictment with a persistent Clinton conspiracy theory.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Maryland man has been indicted in connection with the Uranium One investigation.

title: Were Democrats 'Up All Night Doing Blow' with Obama to Celebrate Shutdown?
subtitle: Fake news crosses the line from the barely plausible to the ludicrously ridiculous.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Prominent Democrats took part in a
which included copious amounts of both Dom Perignon champagne and cocaine:

title: Did Trump Order Pizza with 'Tiny Pizzas' on Top During Tryst with Stormy Daniels?
subtitle: A faux transcript of the porn star's interview suggests that the ultimate sign of wealth is demanding "tiny pizzas" as a topping.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Stormy Daniels said in an interview that Donald Trump ordered little pizzas as toppings on a regular-sized pizza.

title: Did Senator Tom Cotton Call for Drug Testing for Social Security Recipients?
subtitle: The Arkansas Republican has supported drug screening for welfare programs, but never for Social Security.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2018, Senator Tom Cotton called for drug testing for Social Security recipients.

title: Is a 'Crocodile Dundee' Sequel Being Released in 2018?
subtitle: Teasers posted online are actually promoting an Australian travel campaign.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A sequel to the film "Crocodile Dundee" will be released in June 2018.

title: Was the Body of the Clintons' Former Housekeeper Found in Arkansas?
subtitle: The woman had supposedly disappeared after being abruptly dismissed in 1985 and was reportedly pregnant at the time of her death.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The body of the Clintons' former housekeeper was found by Arkansas police.

title: Did the NFL Admit to Rigging Games?
subtitle: A deceptive video about rigged football games created by a "satire" Facebook page spread quickly on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The NFL admitted to rigging games in a style similar to professional wrestling.

title: Did Obama, Soros, and Democrats Order a Government Shutdown to Stage a Coup?
subtitle: Some fake news is so fake that it doesn't even make coherent sense.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Barack Obama, George Soros, and other Democrats were involved in a plot to stage a military coup in conjunction with a government shutdown.

title: Did Newsweek Report That Trump Will Be Impeached and Replaced by Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: The news magazine offered a law professor's hypothetical musings, not a report about President Trump's being removed and replaced by his opponent.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Newsweek magazine reported that President Trump would be impeached and replaced by Hillary Clinton.

title: Are Stores Locking Up Tide PODS So People Won't Eat Them?
subtitle: Although stores are securing Tide detergent PODS in locked cases, retailers confirmed the measure was not related to any social media challenge.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Major retailers have begun keeping Tide brand laundry detergent PODS under lock and key to prevent people from eating them.

title: Does the 'Bar' in 'Bar Exam' Denote a Secret Lawyers' Conspiracy?
subtitle: A "sovereign citizen" conspiracy theory about the licensing of lawyers is riddled with bad logic and historical inaccuracies.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the United States, the lawyers' "bar" stands for "British Accredited Registry" and is part of a property-grabbing conspiracy.

title: Did Nancy Pelosi Say Building a Wall Will Violate the Rights of 'Millions of Illegals'?
subtitle: A quote from the House Minority Leader about how building a wall on the Mexican border would violate the rights of undocumented people is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nancy Pelosi said that building a wall will violate the rights of "millions of 'illegals.'"

title: Did Melania Trump Ban White House Staff from Taking Flu Shots?
subtitle: the First Lady supposedly said.
author: David Emery
statement: First Lady Melania Trump banned the White House staff from receiving flu shots.

title: Did Sylvester Stallone Say Obama Is a 'Closet Homosexual Living a Lie'?
subtitle: The 'Rocky' star supposedly decried the former president for having 'lived his whole pathetic life as a lie.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Sylvester Stallone said Barack Obama is a  'closet homosexual living a lie.'

title: Was a U.S. Pilot Shot Down After Destroying a North Korean Missile?
subtitle: A United States Air Force pilot is not MIA after shooting a North Korean missile down.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Pentagon has disavowed knowledge of a stranded Air Force pilot after he successfully intercepted a missile near North Korea.

title: Did an Irish Woman Legally Marry the Ghost of a Pirate From the 1700s?
subtitle: Despite the claims of tabloid newspapers, Amanda Teague's marriage to her "spiritual husband" does not have any legal status.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In July 2016, Amanda Teague legally married the spirit of a Haitian pirate who died in the 1700s.

title: Is This 'Friends' Movie Trailer Real?
subtitle: Several viewers were fooled by a well-made "concept trailer" for a nonexistent "Friends" movie in January 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A teaser trailer was released for a "Friends" movie.

title: Will Eating Alligator Meat Help Save the Louisiana Wetlands?
subtitle: A factually dubious story about wetland degradation published the opinions of an alligator chef - without first verifying his claims.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Eating alligator in New Orleans will help save the wetlands of Louisiana.

title: Was This White Fox Skinned Alive for Lady Gaga's Fur Coat?
subtitle: Unrelated images of Lady Gaga in a (possibly fake) fur and a baby fox were circulated with messages claiming that this animal was skinned alive for the singer's wardrobe.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a 7-month-old white fox that was skinned alive to make a fur coat for musician Lady Gaga.

title: Can This Machine Automatically Sort Balls by Color?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a "Galton board" apparently sorting balls by color perplexed many viewers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a device automatically sorting hundreds of small balls by color.

title: Did George Soros Pay Three Democrats Millions to Vote for Government Shutdown?
subtitle: Of the many causes behind the January 2018 U.S. federal government shutdown, bribes to senators from George Soros was not among them.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hungarian-American billionaire George Soros bribed three Democratic senators to vote for a shutdown of the U.S. federal government.

title: Was Malia Obama Busted While Streaking at Harvard?
subtitle: Reports that Malia Obama was arrested after being caught drinking while underage and running naked across the Harvard campus are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Malia Obama was arrested after being caught drinking while underage and running naked across the Harvard campus.

title: Did Chuck Schumer Receive $500K Donation from 'Pro-Illegal Alien' Group Just Before Vote?
subtitle: Reports that the New York senator accepted a campaign donation from pro-immigration groups just prior to a crucial Congressional vote are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: New York senator Chuck Schumer accepted a campaign donation of half a million dollars from pro-immigration groups just prior to a crucial Congressional vote.

title: Is Tide Discontinuing Their PODS Product Because Consumers Eat Them?
subtitle: A viral fake tweet caused some social media users to question whether the Tide Challenge spelled the end of the Tide PODS product.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Tide Challenge has caused the company to discontinue the sale of their PODs laundry product.

title: Did Demi Moore Say 'I Do Not Want Trump Supporters for Fans'?
subtitle: Clickbait web sites generate traffic by putting controversial political statements into the mouths of celebrities who never uttered them.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actress Demi Moore proclaimed that she doesn't want Trump supporters for fans.

title: Is a
Ad Airing During the Super Bowl?
subtitle: A dog bite attorney's anti-pitbull video will not be airing during Super Bowl LII.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A "Do Not Adopt a Pitbull" ad will be airing during Super Bowl LII in February 2018.

title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Buy a $150 Million Yacht?
subtitle: A Turkish web site published, then deleted, a quickly-debunked story about Facebook's chief executive officer.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg bought a "super-yacht" for $150 million.

title: Are Women Using Their Menstrual Blood as Face Masks?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post is no more than a hoax that plays off the blood-like appearance of a popular skincare product.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2018, some women began using their menstrual blood as a face mask skin treatment.

title: Did Marine Corps Leaders Warn Marines to Stop Eating Tide Pods?
subtitle: News of the nonexistent warning from the Marine Corps' top brass originated on a satirical blog.
author: David Emery
statement: Alarmed by instances of Marines imperiling their health by eating liquid laundry detergent, top Marine Corps leaders issued a warning to all junior troops to stop participating in the Tide Pod Challenge.

title: Did Macaulay Culkin Say Satanic Hollywood Executives Wear Shoes Made From Dead Children?
subtitle: Fake news sites reported that the former child star says Hollywood is run by Satanic pedophiles who ritually murder children.
author: David Emery
statement: Former child star Macaulay Culkin said Hollywood is run by Satanic pedophiles, one of whom boasted that his shoes were made from the skin of deceased child actress Heather O'Rourke.

title: Did a 'Direct Energy Weapon' Strike Michigan?
subtitle: A series of images purportedly showing a strike on a Michigan garage actually show a combination of a meteor, a fire, and a cold-weather phenomenon.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of images show a "direct energy weapon" striking a city in Michigan.

title: Did Katy Perry Say Praying to Satan Should Be On Your Bucket List?
subtitle: A disreputable web site with a penchant for inventing celebrity quotes said the singer had called Satan worship "a real trip."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Singer Katy Perry advised her fans to

title: Did Melania Trump Copy Michelle Obama's MLK Day Message?
subtitle: Rumors holding that Melania Trump plagiarized her Martin Luther King Day tweet from former First Lady Michelle Obama were not rooted in reality.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump plagiarized a portion of a speech delivered by Michelle Obama in 2016 for her tweet commemorating Martin Luther King Day in 2018.

title: Are New Army 'Holistic Medics' Treating Gunshot Wounds with Crystals and Essential Oils?
subtitle: U.S. Army medics will not be treating battlefield injuries with homeopathic dilutions and prayer beads.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: New U.S. Army medics will be treating battlefield injuries with "alternative medicine" such as homeopathic dilutions and prayer beads.

title: Did a Congresswoman Tweet that Trump Wanted War with 'North Japan'?
subtitle: A fake tweet-generator was used to create the appearance that Sheila Jackson Lee had authored a tweet riddled with historical inaccuracies.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rep. Sheila Jackson Lee (D-Tx.) tweeted that President Trump was determined to start a war with 'North Japan'.

title: Did a Tourist Get Diarrhea on a Roller Coaster and Splash 14 People?
subtitle: Reports of a tourist's unfortunate bout of stomach upset on a Spanish roller coaster are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A tourist's unfortunate bout of stomach upset on a Spanish roller coaster splashed liquid fecal matter on other customers.

title: Did an Engineer Contract an STD After Having Sex with a Sex Robot?
subtitle: Reports that a Chinese engineer contracted an STD after having sexual intercourse with a sex robot prototype are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Chinese engineer contracted an STD after having sexual intercourse with a sex robot prototype.

title: Did a CDC Doctor Say the Flu Shot Is Causing a Deadly Outbreak?
subtitle: A disreputable web site used an unsourced and fabricated quote to link deaths from the flu epidemic to the flu shot.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention doctor said the flu vaccine is causing the deadly flu epidemic.

title: Is Gabapentin the Newest Prescription Drug Killer?
subtitle: Gabapentin's potential for abuse, especially in combination with opioids, may have been misjudged - but the drug remains safe for approved uses.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Gabapentin is now considered the most dangerous drug in America and will surpass opioids as the largest prescription drug killer.

title: Did Beyonce Say That She Is a Descendant of the 'Illuminati'?
subtitle: Reports that the singer boasted about the results of a "DNA test kit" are just more fake news.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Beyonce revealed that according to a DNA test, she is related to the Rockefellers and the British royal family.

title: Did the German Government Use a Soap Opera to 'Brainwash' Children to Become Muslim?
subtitle: Right-wing web sites grossly misrepresented the significance and meaning of one scene from one 2006 episode.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A scene from a 2006 episode of the soap opera 'Lindenstrasse' is evidence of a German government effort to convince Germans to accept Muslims or become Muslim.

title: Is O.J. Simpson Back in Custody?
subtitle: Reports that former NFL star O.J. Simpson was rearrested while attempting to slip across the U.S.-Canada border are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former NFL star O.J. Simpson was rearrested while attempting to slip across the U.S.-Canada border.

title: Were Cruise Ship Passengers Warned Not to Have Sex with Pizza?
subtitle: A crude letter warning passengers on a cruise ship not to "engage in sexual acts" with pizzas was posted as a prank and not as an official message from the cruise line.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Norwegian Cruise Line posted a message on one of their ships explaining that the open pizza bar was for consumption only and asked passengers to refrain from having sex with their lunches.

title: Is Mohammed the Most Popular Name for Newborn Boys in the Netherlands?
subtitle: No, it's not.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mohammed is now the most popular name for newborn boys in the Netherlands thanks to immigration.

title: Are Feminists Complaining About 'Telepathic Rape'?
subtitle: An Infowars editor highlighted an excerpt from a post from a site that he was apparently unaware was intended to be read as "satire."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A feminist wrote in an op-ed that men commit "telepathic rape" by masturbating to women they don't know.

title: Lottery Winner Shane Missler Giving Away Money for Retweets?
subtitle: A Twitter account promising $5000 for retweets doesn't actually belong to the 20-year-old Mega Millions winner.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Lottery winner Shane Missler is giving away $5000 to the first 50,000 followers that retweet his post.

title: Did Trump's Older Sister Say 'Donnie's Acting Like a Nutjob'?
subtitle: A satirical article fabricates federal judge Maryanne Trump Barry's statements about her brother's mental fitness.
author: David Emery
statement: President Trump's older sister, federal judge Maryanne Trump Barry, said Trump was called "Donnie Dimwit" as a child, and is now "acting like a nutjob."

title: Less Effective Flu Shots 'Prove' You Shouldn't Get Them at All?
subtitle: Dubious websites are attempting to use a season in which the influenza vaccine is less effective than normal as evidence that getting inoculated is worthless.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The death from influenza of eight mostly vaccinated people over 65 in California's Santa Barbara County during the 2017-2018 flu season proves that you shouldn't get the flu shot.

title: Do Democrats Want to Add Martin Luther King to Mount Rushmore?
subtitle: The non-thinking person's way to generate faux political outrage is to suggest any addition to America's cherished monument.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Ten Democratic Congressmen demanded that Mount Rushmore be altered to accommodate the likeness of Martin Luther King, Jr.

title: Norway Renames Itself 'Shithole' in Solidarity With Countries Trump Insulted?
subtitle: A satirical article responded to a recent controversy over the U.S. President's reported comments on immigration.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Norway announced that it was changing its name to "shithole."

title: Does the Psychiatrist Who 'Diagnosed' President Trump Lack a License?
subtitle: A number of far-right web sites have posted misleading stories casting doubt on whether Dr. Bandy Lee holds a current  medical license.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Dr. Bandy Lee, who has warned the United States that Donald Trump is dangerously impaired, lacks a medical license.

title: Dolly Parton Said California's 'Biblical Disasters' Were Punishment For 'Embracing Satan?'
subtitle: A fake news web site attempted to ride a wave of Parton-related controversy in January 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dolly Parton said that the people of California were being punished with droughts, fires, mudslides and other natural disasters as punishment for embracing Satan.

title: H&M to Release 'Equally Racist' Collection as Apology to Black People?
subtitle: Social media users began posting images of children wearing "Equally Racist" shirts after a satire web site created them.
author: Dan Evon
statement: H&M created an "Equally Racist" collection featuring children of various ethnicities in offensive clothing.

title: Does 'Raw Water' Provide Probiotic Health Benefits?
subtitle: Not only can the latest health craze put you in danger of contracting dangerous diseases, the purported benefits have no basis in science.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Drinking untreated spring water, marketed as "raw water," provides health benefits because they are "probiotic."

title: 'Harry Potter' Show Coming to Netflix?
subtitle: Rumors that a "Harry Potter" show was coming to Netflix were sparked by an April Fool's joke and a piece of fan art.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix announced in April 2017 that it was creating a new 'Harry Potter' television series.

title: Did Federal Agents Raid a Mosque in Michigan?
subtitle: A prolific purveyor of "satire" publishes yet another false article that plays on fear and hatred.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Federal agents raided a mosque near Dearborn, MIchigan and arrested several ISIS combatants planning suicide attacks.

title: Do Cell Phones Cause Brain Damage and Create 'Snowflakes and Crybullies'?
subtitle: A story in an "alternative health site" falsely states mobile phones are causing people to go insane.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The "radiation" from cell phones is causing mass insanity resulting in "snowflake" people.

title: Does Donald Trump Not Know the Words to the National Anthem?
subtitle: A viral video shows the president apparently fumbling for the words as he sings along with the national anthem at a football game.
author: David Emery
statement: A video of President Donald Trump apparently struggling to get the words right while singing along with the national anthem proves that he doesn't know what they are.

title: Do Celebrities Dine at a Cannibal Restaurant in Los Angeles?
subtitle: A more-creative-than-usual junk news piece claimed that Katy Perry, Meryl Streep, and Chelsea Clinton have dined on human flesh.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Katy Perry, Meryl Streep, and Chelsea Clinton are members at an elite cannibal restaurant in Los Angeles.

title: Did a Black Alabama Running Back Lose His Scholarship Over Anti-Trump Comments?
subtitle: Reports that University of Alabama running back Bo Scarbrough's scholarship was revoked over an anti-Trump outburst are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: University of Alabama running back Bo Scarbrough lost his scholarship over an anti-Trump outburst.

title: Were Three Democratic Senators Busted for Running an Underage Prostitution Ring?
subtitle: Reports that New Jersey state senators were arrested in connection with a child prostitution ring are just more fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Three New Jersey state senators were arrested in connection with a child prostitution ring.

title: Were Blood, Dog Feces Hidden Inside Starbucks Products?
subtitle: Although an Atlanta Starbucks briefly closed after complaints of contamination, these rumors stemmed from a Facebook post, not real world evidence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman named Shanell Rivers put blood and dog feces into various products at a Starbucks in Atlanta.

title: Police Don't Find Fake Democratic Congressman's Non-Existent Meth Lab
subtitle: The problem here is that our legal system doesn't really provide for the prosecution of fictional characters.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A police raid on a Tennessee congressman's property turned up a meth lab and fourteen pounds of methamphetamine.

title: Did Oprah Winfrey Say She Brought Young Women to Harvey Weinstein's House?
subtitle: A quote purportedly from the entertainment mogul appears to have been completely fabricated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Oprah Winfrey brushed off accusations against Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein, saying "this is just how it is" for people who want to get ahead in the media industry.

title: Three Former Presidents Mocked Trump on Twitter?
subtitle: A satire site published doctored images that appeared to show former presidents Obama, Bush, and Clinton mocking President Trump's tweet about winning the election on his "first try."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former Presidents Barack Obama, Bill Clinton, and George W. Bush mocked President Trump on Twitter about his tweet bragging about winning the election on his first try.

title: Aquafina Bottled Water Does Not Freeze?
subtitle: Dubious YouTube videos aside, there is nothing unique about Aquafina bottled water that prevents it from freezing.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Aquafina bottled water doesn't freeze.

title: Did the Obama Foundation 'Just Break Its First Federal Law'?
subtitle: Reports that the former president's foundation is being investigated for racketeering are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former president Barack Obama's foundation is being investigated for racketeering.

title: Was President Trump 'Feared Dead' After a Fire at Trump Tower?
subtitle: A dubious web site overstated the danger posed by the small blaze in New York City in order to push conspiracy theories.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump was "feared dead" after a small fire broke out at his New York City building.

title: Were 22 Clinton Foundation Employees Arrested on First Day of FBI Investigation?
subtitle: Unreliable partisan web sites reposted a work of satire reporting that an FBI investigation into the Clinton Foundation had yielded 22 criminal arrests.
author: David Emery
statement: The FBI arrested 22 employees of the Clinton Foundation on the first day of an investigation into alleged illegal activities.

title: Was an Alien Spotted Boarding a UFO in Romania?
subtitle: This isn't a real UFO and a real alien, wherever in the world this clip wasn't actually filmed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video showed an alien boarding a spaceship in Romania in January 2018.

title: Did the Suicide Rate Drop Following YouTube Star Logan Paul's 'Suicide Forest' Video?
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that the world suicide rate plummeted after Logan Paul's "Suicide Forest" video.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The world suicide rate plummeted following Logan Paul's "suicide forest" video.

title: Did a Muslim Doctor Refuse to Treat a Dying Christian On Board a Flight?
subtitle: The story is no more than a satirical but inflammatory fabrication.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Dr. Jaleel Kohmeni refused to treat a dying man on a flight from New York to Las Vegas, on the basis of the man's Christian faith.

title: Did Taylor Swift Say 'We Should FORGIVE' YouTube's Logan Paul?
subtitle: A Twitter account posing as the E! cable network fabricated "forgiveness" statements by both Swift and Mariah Carey.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Taylor Swift said "We should FORGIVE" YouTube personality Logan Paul following his videos chronicling his visit to Tokyo.

title: Is This Kim Jong-Un Reading 'Fire and Fury'?
subtitle: A doctored image purportedly shows the North Korean leader reading a book that portrays U.S. President Donald Trump and his staff in an unflattering light.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows North Korea leader Kim Jong-un laughing as he reads the book

title: Was Michelle Obama Arrested for Domestic Violence?
subtitle: Reports that the former First Lady was arrested after acting
during a domestic squabble were fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former First Lady Michelle Obama was arrested after acting
during a domestic dispute.

title: Did a Federal Judge Rule Three Items of Sharia Law Are Now Legal in Texas?
subtitle: Reports that a federal judge overturned a Syrian immigrant's conviction and made aspects of Sharia law legal in Texas are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A federal judge ruled that three items of Sharia law are now deemed to be legal in the state of Texas.

title: Did a Muslim Waitress Refuse to Seat a Church Group Because of 'Religious Freedom'?
subtitle: Reports that a Waffle House waitress told church choir members she
are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Muslim waitress refused to seat a church group at a restaurant, claiming "religious freedom" allowed her to do so.

title: Will Hillary Clinton Read the Audiobook Version of
subtitle: Reports that President Trump's political rival would narrate a tell-all book about his presidency originated as satire.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton will narrate the audio version of the book  'Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House.'

title: Does Donald Trump Watch 'The Gorilla Channel'?
subtitle: An excerpt purportedly from the book "Fire and Fury" convinced more than a few readers that the president spends much of his days watching a channel created to placate him.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Wolff wrote in his book "Fire and Fury" that White House aides created a fake "Gorilla Channel" to placate President Donald Trump.

title: Did Oregon's Anti-Gay Cake Bakers Win the Lottery?
subtitle: A story about two bakers who won a big lottery payout just after being slapped with a fine came from a site that only publishes satire and fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Christian owners of a bakery in Oregon won the lottery shortly after they were fined $135,000 for declining to make a cake for a same-sex wedding.

title: Was a Room Full of Servers and Hard Drives Destroyed in a Clinton House Fire?
subtitle: A fire at a property owned by Bill and Hillary Clinton in New York state sparked a veritable inferno of fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The FBI was on its way to a residence owned by the Clintons when a fire destroyed a room full of servers and hard drives.

title: Did Trump Change the Name of the 'Obama Highway' Back to the 'Old Dixie Highway?'
subtitle: Reports that President Donald Trump had ordered the name to revert are just barely-sourced opinion pieces disguised as news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump ordered that the name of Florida's "Obama Highway" be changed back to the "Old Dixie Highway."

title: Did Queen Elizabeth Suspend the Wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle?
subtitle: Sources reported that the queen issued a royal ultimatum for a prenuptial agreement.
author: David Emery
statement: Queen Elizabeth is so upset at public comments made by royal bride-to-be Meghan Markle that she has suspended or threatened to suspend Prince Harry's wedding.

title: Were DACA Recipients Photographed Burning an American Flag?
subtitle: A photograph of a protest was shared with unfounded claims and an inaccurate and misleading description.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of DACA recipients dressed in Mexican flags burning an American flag.

title: Was a Man Arrested for Playing the 'Finger Circle Game' With Law Enforcement?
subtitle: Hoax reports held that a man was arrested after he tricked an officer into playing the "circle game" when he was asked for his license and registration.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man was arrested for showing an officer an "A-OK" hand sign during a traffic stop in an attempt to get the officer to play the "finger circle" game.

title: Is Chocolate 'On Track to Go Extinct' in 40 Years?
subtitle: Clickbait headlines suggesting a future without chocolate were based on a distorted reading of established science about cocoa in a warmer world.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Chocolate is on track to go extinct in 40 years.

title: Did Donald Trump Tweet About Daughter Tiffany's 'Skintight' Dress?
subtitle: A parody account - not the president himself - tweeted a suggestive remark about Tiffany Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump posted a suggestive comment on Twitter about his daughter's "skintight" dress.

title: Is the United States Returning Puerto Rico to Spain?
subtitle: A report in El Nuevo Dia that the United States plans to return Puerto Rico to Spain was a Day of the Holy Innocents prank.
author: David Emery
statement: The United States government has secretly negotiated a deal to return the U.S. territory of Puerto Rico to Spain.

title: Did Melania Trump Wear Shower Curtains?
subtitle: Images purportedly showing the First Lady in a dress bearing the same pattern as a shower curtain have been manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The pattern on Melania Trump's New Year's Eve 2017 dress closely resembled the design on a shower curtain.

title: Did Delta Force Operators Raid an 'Obama Stronghold' in Thailand?
subtitle: Reports of a Christmas Day raid originated with a conspiracy theory web site and are not based on factual information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Delta Force operators raided President Barack Obama's stronghold in Thailand on Christmas Day 2017.

title: Did Bono Say 'Donald Trump Is Destroying America, We Must Stop Him'?
subtitle: Reports that the U2 frontman proclaimed during an interview that "Donald Trump is destroying America, [and] we must stop him" are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: During a 'Rolling Stone' interview, U2 singer Bono proclaimed that "Donald Trump is destroying America, [and] we must stop him."

title: Did Nancy Pelosi Tweet That She Is 'Disgusted' with 'President' Trump?
subtitle: The long-time House member supposedly didn't like the President Trump's 'allowing people to keep more of the money they earn.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi tweeted that she was disgusted with "President" Trump after the passage of a tax reform bill.

title: Is the Song 'Over the Rainbow' About the Holocaust?
subtitle: According to rumor, the "Wizard of Oz" classic was written about the pogroms in Europe before and during World War II.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The song "Over the Rainbow" was written about the Jewish experience during the Holocaust.

title: Did Sasha Obama Crash Her Expensive New Car Into a Lake?
subtitle: A fake news article wants you to hate former First Daughter Sasha Obama.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sasha Obama crashed a Bugatti Veyron into a lake in December 2017.

title: 'Animal Brothels' Open in Germany as Migrant Population Hits 22 Percent?
subtitle: A report connecting "animal brothels" to a surge in immigration attempted to link two misreported events in order to foment racial prejudice.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Animal brothels opened in Germany amidst a surge of immigration.

title: Did Trump Sign an Executive Order to Seize the Assets of Clinton and Obama?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump issued an order authorizing the United States Treasury to freeze the assets of two former First Families are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump issued an order authorizing the U.S. Treasury to freeze the assets of two former First Families, the Obamas and Clintons.

title: Did Michele Bachmann Say Banning Mexican Food Would 'End Illegal Border Crossings'?
subtitle: A parody Facebook page comes up with yet another fake quote attributed to the former lawmaker.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2014, Michele Bachmann told Fox News that banning Mexican food in the United States would stop Mexicans from entering the country without documentation.

title: Did Police Discover a Meth Lab in a Back Room of an Alabama Walmart?
subtitle: Rumors that a facility for making methamphetamines was found at a store in Decatur originated with nothing more than a fake news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Police discovered a drug lab in the back room of a Walmart in Decatur, Alabama.

title: Did WikiLeaks Release a Trove of 'Deep State Files'?
subtitle: A fake news site appeared to report that WikiLeaks released a cache of so-called "Deep State Files" in late December 2017, but no such document dump took place.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Wikileaks released a trove of "deep state files" in late December 2017.

title: Did Donald Trump Say 'Police Officers and Firefighters Make Too Much Money'?
subtitle: A misleading headline suggested that the president used first responders' salaries to justify increasing their tax burden.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump said police and firefighters make too much money in order to justify eliminating some of their tax deductions.

title: Did George Soros Suffer a 'Massive Heart Attack' on Christmas Eve?
subtitle: Reports that the Hungarian-American billionaire experienced a life-threatening cardiac condition just before Christmas 2017 are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: George Soros experienced a life-threatening cardiac condition just before Christmas 2017.

title: 2018's 'Amazing' Calendar
subtitle: A social media image highlighting a supposedly "amazing" aspect to the 2018 calendar is neither amazing nor accurate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In the year 2018, all twelve days on which the month and day share common ordinal values falls on a Sunday.

title: Is a Washington Youth Sports League Playing Soccer Without the Ball?
subtitle: A spoof CBC report on how competition impacts youth was mistaken by many viewers for a genuine news story.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Washington State youth sports league is now playing soccer without the ball in order to minimize the negative effects of competition.

title: Was a Vigilante Arrested for Killing 30 Pedophiles in Mass Murder Spree?
subtitle: Reports that an arrested Nebraska man confessed to murdering more than 30 sex offenders in a 15-year vigilante killing spree are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An arrested Nebraska man confessed to murdering more than 30 sex offenders in a 15-year vigilante killing spree.

title: Did Alabama Election Officials Find Thousands of Dead People Who Voted for Doug Jones?
subtitle: Reports that Democrat Doug Jones received votes from over 12,000 dead people in a special Senate election are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Election officials in Alabama discovered thousands of ballots for Doug Jones that were seemingly cast by dead voters.

title: Was Rosie O'Donnell Arrested for Trying to Bribe Lawmakers?
subtitle: Reports that the comedian was taken into custody by federal authorities over a controversial political tweet are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Comedian Rosie O'Donnell was taken into custody by federal authorities over a controversial political tweet.

title: Did Alabama State Police Arrest 3 Poll Workers in Birmingham?
subtitle: Reports that poll workers in Birmingham were arrested for voter fraud in connection with the special Alabama Senate election are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Three poll workers in Birmingham were arrested for voter fraud in connection with the special Alabama Senate election.

title: Did the FBI Identify a 'Muslim Terrorist' Who Derailed an Amtrak Train?
subtitle: Reports that a Muslim man deliberately caused the crash of an Amtrak train in Washington by sabotaging the tracks are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 'Muslim terrorist' deliberately caused the crash of an Amtrak train in Washington by sabotaging the tracks.

title: Were Scientists Caught Tampering with Raw Data to Exaggerate Sea Level Rise?
subtitle: Breitbart pushed an extremely flawed study as evidence of a widespread conspiracy to inflate sea level rise.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: New research shows that scientists are manipulating sea level data to inflate predictions of future sea level rise.

title: Did a Cow Really Sit on the Hood of this Car?
subtitle: Check your wheel wells for critters -- but you don't need to check your car hood for cows.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a cow sitting on the hood of a car to stay warm during the winter.

title: Did a Man Sell Chuck E. Cheese Tokens as 'Bitcoins'?
subtitle: A story claiming that a man had scammed people by selling "Bitcoins" was just fake news from a repeat offender.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A New York City man made a million dollars selling altered Chuck E. Cheese tokens as "Bitcoins".

title: Will UN Peacekeepers Be Deployed on the Streets of Chicago?
subtitle: There are no plans to put UN Peacekeeper boots on the ground in Chicago.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: UN Peacekeepers will be sent to quell violence in Chicago.

title: Was a Real Mermaid Found in India?
subtitle: Images purportedly showing a real mermaid are based on an animatronic sculpture.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A real mermaid was discovered in the Oman Gulf in December 2017.

title: Muslim Mayor Just Banned the Word 'Christmas?'
subtitle: Hoboken mayor-elect Ravi Bhalla is Sikh, not Muslim, and he didn't ban the word "Christmas."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Muslim mayor of Hoboken, New Jersey, banned the word "Christmas."

title: Did Julia Roberts Say Michelle Obama 'Isn't Fit to Clean Melania Trump's Toilet?'
subtitle: "A president who would all but call Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand a whore is not fit to clean the toilets in the Barack Obama Presidential Library or to shine the shoes of George W. Bush."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Julia Roberts said that former First Lady Michelle Obama was not fit to clean Melania Trump's toilet.

title: Did Mia Khalifa 'Expose' Ajit Pai After He 'Slid Into Her DMs'?
subtitle: Rumors that the former adult actress confronted the Federal Communications Commission chairman on Instagram after he tried to send her flirty direct messages originated in a hoax article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Social media personality Mia Khalifa insulted Federal Communications Commission chairman Ajit Pai after he messaged her on Instagram.

title: Did Alabama State Police Arrest Three Poll Workers in Birmingham?
subtitle: Reports that poll workers had been detained in connection with voter fraud during Alabama's December 2017 special election are just fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Three poll workers were arrested for voter fraud during Alabama's special election in December 2017.

title: Did Nick Saban Finish Third in the 2017 Alabama Senate Race?
subtitle: A satirical sports site vastly overstated the University of Alabama football coach's "performance" in the December 2017 vote.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: University of Alabama football coach Nick Saban finished third in a special Senate election in December 2017.

title: Did Roy Moore Receive 953 Votes to Doug Jones' 5,327 in a Town of 1,867 Registered Voters?
subtitle: A popular Facebook rumor contends that Alabama's December 2017 election showed major voting irregularities - but the claim is "satire."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Roy Moore received 953 votes and Doug Jones 5,327 - in a town with just 1,867 registered voters.

title: Did Sexual Assault Allegations Against Donald Trump Only Start With the 2016 Election?
subtitle: Although many women accused then-candidate Trump of sexual assault during the 2016 election, that wasn't the first time that he faced these sorts of allegations.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump was not accused of sexual assault until he ran for President in 2016.

title: Rogue Amazon Drone Delivers Bomb to White House?
subtitle: Sensational claims of President Donald Trump receiving a bomb via Amazon drone have their origins on a satire website.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A rogue Amazon drone attempted to deliver a bomb to the White House.

title: Did a Surgeon Who Exposed 'Clinton Foundation Corruption in Haiti' Die a Suspicious Death?
subtitle: Paranoid reports twisted the details of a tragic suicide to further a false narrative about the Clinton family.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A U.S. surgeon who exposed
was found dead in his home under suspicious circumstances.

title: Did Washington D.C.'s Football Team Change Its Name To 'Redhawks'?
subtitle: Native American activists published several elaborate fake web sites as a "satirical action" against the Redskins franchise.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The National Football League team in Washington D.C. changed its name to Redhawks.

title: Did a Dog Defecate on the Steps of 10 Downing Street?
subtitle: Brits often post a photograph of a dog purportedly defecating on the steps British government headquarters to express frustration with the government.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a dog defecating on the steps of 10 Downing Street.

title: Were 'Black People in Birmingham' Caught Voting Multiple Times With Fake IDs?
subtitle: A so-called "satire" site published a story falsely claiming black voters committed fraud in Alabama's special election.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Black voters in Birmingham were caught voting multiple times in thousands of cases during Alabama's special election on 12 December 2017.

title: Was Bullying Victim Keaton Jones Beaten and Robbed of GoFundMe Money?
subtitle: Fake news sites took advantage of a controversy about a bullied middle schooler whose mother posted photographs of the Confederate flag to her Facebook page.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Keaton Jones, known for a viral video about bullying, was beaten and robbed of luxury items purchased with money raised via GoFundMe.

title: Did C-SPAN Insult Mitch McConnell?
subtitle: A caption appearing to insult the Senate Majority Leader never aired, despite a claim that a screenshot purporting to show it was "not Photoshopped."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A chyron on a network news channel contained a vulgar insult against Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.

title: Is George Soros 'Grooming' a Pro-Muslim Brotherhood Gubernatorial Candidate in Michigan?
subtitle: Abdul El-Sayed's platform actually puts him in opposition to the beliefs espoused by the Muslim Brotherhood.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Billionaire philanthropist George Soros is "grooming" Abdul El-Sayed, who is "sympathetic" to the Muslim Brotherhood, to be president of the United States.

title: Is This 'Invisibility Cloak' Video Real?
subtitle: "Quantum cloak is composed of quantum stealth material made into clothing."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a man demonstrating an invisibility cloak.

title: Was an Elderly Man Sentenced to Death for Killing a Muslim in Self-Defense?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site publishes yet another cynical and provocative story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: 82-year-old William DeLisle was sentenced to death in California for shooting dead a Muslim man who was attacking him.

title: Was One of Roy Moore's Accusers Arrested and Charged With 'Falsification'?
subtitle: Reports of the arrest of one of Roy Moore's accusers of sexual abuse over "falsification" charges are completely invented and have their roots in a self-described satire website.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Roy Moore's accuser was arrested and charged with falsification of a yearbook entry attributed to Moore.

title: Is a New Hand Sign Being Used by Teens to Acquire Drugs?
subtitle: A Facebook post suggesting that teenagers are using a common hand sign to show they wish to buy drugs was intended to be humorous.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a "new hand sign" that is being used by teenagers to signal that they wish to buy or sell drugs.

title: Should You Lay 'Buckets of Water' Out For Wildlife Escaping Wildfires?
subtitle: While people naturally want to help animals, experts advise that "it's just better not to have an intervention."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The "forestry department" urges you to lay buckets of water out for wildlife that may cross your yard while escaping a wildfire.

title: Were 50 Dead Bodies Found on a Beach in Cancun?
subtitle: A disreputable web site devoted to "viral" stories turned two Spanish journalists' work into a scare-mongering story.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: 50 dead bodies were found off the coast of Cancun in Mexico.

title: OUTDATED: Kirk Douglas Death Hoax
subtitle: Actor Kirk Douglas passed away in February 2020, not in December 2017 when an old death hoax circulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Kirk Douglas passed away four days before his 101st birthday in December 2017.

title: Was a Zookeeper Arrested for Molesting a Gorilla?
subtitle: A story claimed a San Diego Zoo employee was accused of sexually assaulting a 500-pound male gorilla.
author: David Emery
statement: A 29-year-old San Diego Zoo intern was arrested and charged with attempting sexually assault a gorilla.

title: Is 'LGBT' Adding a 'P' for Pedosexuals?
subtitle: Claims that the LGBT community is adding a "P" to represent "pedosexuals" originated with a homophobic smear campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The group LGBT is adding a "P" to their name in order to represent pedosexuals.

title: Did Queen Elizabeth Remove the Obamas from Royal Wedding Guest List?
subtitle: Fake news web sites reported that Michelle Obama desperately wanted to attend Prince Harry's wedding but received a "brutal beatdown" from the queen.
author: David Emery
statement: Queen Elizabeth removed the Obamas from the guest list for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding after she learned that Michelle Obama tried to "sneak a spot."

title: Did a Funeral Home Owner's Son Build a 'Sex Doll' Out of Body Parts?
subtitle: A "news site" impersonating ABC News published a fake story about a grisly police investigation.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The son of a Milwaukee funeral home owner constructed a "sex doll" out of parts taken from the bodies taken to his parents' business.

title: Did Denzel Washington Once Call Obama the 'Criminal-In-Chief?'
subtitle: An article reporting that the actor had insulted former President Barack Obama by calling him a "criminal" is just fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Denzel Washington referred to former United States President Barack Obama as the "criminal-in-chief."

title: Does Turmeric Prevent Dementia?
subtitle: Myriad studies have suggested that turmeric can treat or prevent dementia, but evidence of its efficacy is problematic.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Turmeric can prevent dementia; as a result, India, whose food contains a large amount of the spice, has the lowest rates of dementia worldwide.

title: First NFL Team Declares Bankruptcy Over 'Take a Knee' Protests?
subtitle: A fake news article seemingly reporting that the Jacksonville Jaguars had filed for bankruptcy was mistaken as real news by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Jacksonville Jaguars filed for bankruptcy in December 2017 after NFL fans boycotted the league due to player protests.

title: Is a Protester Holding an 'All Holidays Matter' Sign?
subtitle: An image purporting to show two men with signs - one reading "We must stop the war on Christmas" and another that says "All holidays matter" - is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a protester holding a sign that says "We must stop the war on Christmas" next to another man with a sign that reads "All holidays matter."

title: Are 'Perfect Petzzz' Toys Made With Real Dog Fur?
subtitle: The allegation that Perfect Petzzz toys use real animal fur is based on the hunch of a single social media user.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The company Perfect Petzzz uses real dog fur to make their products.

title: Does the 2017 Tax Reform Bill Eliminate Small Business Deductions?
subtitle: Contrary to rumor, the tax bill does not eliminate deductions for small business expenses, though it would axe those for unreimbursed employee business expenses.
author: David Emery
statement: Under the 2017 tax overhaul legislation currently making its way through Congress, all deductions for business-related expenses incurred by small business owners and the self-employed would be eliminated.

title: Did the World's Most-Pierced Person Die Going Through Airport Metal Detectors?
subtitle: An "entertainment" web site publishes an unpleasant and fabricated article about the gruesome death of a fictional person.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The world's most-pierced person, Gerard Rogers, was killed while passing through a metal detector at LAX airport.

title: Did a CIA Agent Confess to Killing Bob Marley?
subtitle: A disreputable web site capitalized on an old conspiracy theory about the death of the reggae icon to spin fake news clickbait.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A former CIA agent named "Bill Oxley" confessed on his death bed to killing Bob Marley.

title: Did Tokyo Open the First Human Meat Restaurant?
subtitle: Reports that a new restaurant recently opened in Japan is the first in the world to legally offer human meat to diners are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A new restaurant recently opened in Japan is the first in the world to legally offer human meat to diners.

title: Did an Iranian Woman Undergo 50 Plastic Surgeries to Resemble Angelina Jolie?
subtitle: Reports about Sahar Tabar failed to provide proof that she based her appearance on the "Tomb Raider" star, or to what extent she underwent surgery to achieve her look.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sahar Tabar has undergone 50 physical surgeries to make her face resemble that of Angelina Jolie.

title: Did Jay Z Say 'Satan Is Our True Lord' and 'Only Idiots Believe in Jesus'?
subtitle: It helps to pay attention to what song lyrics actually say.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Jay-Z said that "satan is our true lord" and that "only idiots believe in Jesus" during a backstage tirade in November 2017.

title: Did Congress Use a 'Slush Fund' to Pay $17 Million to Women They Sexually Harassed?
subtitle: Although the term "slush fund" signals secret money stashed for illicit purposes, Congress has authorized public money in a fund set aside to pay settlements.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Congress has a "slush fund" from which it has paid $17 million to women who accused members of sexual harassment or abuse.

title: Is this a Time-Traveling Hula Hooper?
subtitle: The woman hula-hooping in this photograph did not time-travel to the 1930s.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A time-traveler using a hula hoop appears in the background of a 1939 photograph.

title: Are People Getting Threatening 'Robocalls' for Criticizing President Trump Online?
subtitle: Messages from the "Trump for Office Foundation" were actually designed by a company that allows users to send prerecorded "prank calls" to people they know.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A group supporting President Donald Trump is making "robocalls" threatening people who criticize him online.

title: Would the Republican Tax Plan Make Employee Discounts Taxable?
subtitle: As of November 2017, the tax reform bill would make changes to some employee benefits, but not employee discounts.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Tax reform plans proposed by House and Senate Republicans in November 2017 would remove the deduction for employee discounts.

title: Were Hate Crime Charges Against 'BLM Kidnappers' Dropped?
subtitle: Hate crime charges were not dropped, and there is no evidence any of the suspects are associated with Black Lives Matter.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hate crime charges against four black people accused of beating a white teen were dropped.

title: Did a 'Muslim Migrant' Beat Up a Dutch Boy on Crutches?
subtitle: A video of a teenager beating up a person on crutches was shared by President Donald Trump along with the claim that the antagonist was a "Muslim migrant."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A "Muslim migrant" beats up a boy on crutches in a video posted to a site in the Netherlands.

title: Was Putin Pictured Taking a Lollipop from a Child?
subtitle: Photographs of Russian President Vladimir Putin at a Christmas ceremony were doctored to make it appear as if he was stealing a sucker from a child.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show Russian President Vladimir Putin taking a lollipop from a child.

title: Is There a 'New Outbreak' of HPV That 'Kills Faster than AIDS'?
subtitle: A fabricated health scare that originated in Africa got a new lease on life in November 2017.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Authorities in Kenya warned of a new outbreak of HPV that spreads through kissing and is deadlier than HIV/Aids.

title: Does This Trump-Loving Celebrity Want Critics to Move Out of the United States?
subtitle: A made-up news story wrongly proclaims Bruce Willis as the latest entry in a line of Hollywood A-listers who have mobilized behind the president.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A famous actor defended President Donald Trump and said that people who criticize the chief executive should leave the United States.

title: Did Canada Legalize Euthanasia So Parents Can Kill Children With Disabilities?
subtitle: Misleading articles citing an opinion piece falsely claim that Canada has given a "green light" for parents to "kill disabled children".
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Canada has legalized euthanasia, enabling parents to "kill disabled children."

title: Did a Bulldog Bite Off a Pedophile's Penis as He Tried to Rape Sleeping Children?
subtitle: A family dog supposedly saved sleeping young children from sexual abuse by biting off an intruder's genitals.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A family dog saved sleeping young children from sexual abuse by biting off an intruder's genitals.

title: Do Photographs Show a Child Forced to Shoot His Dog?
subtitle: A Facebook post purportedly depicting a small child who had to shoot the family dog over barking complaints is a fabrication.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a small child forced to put down his dog with a handgun.

title: Are Flamingo Egg Yolks Pink?
subtitle: A popular 'fun fact' holds that flamingo egg yolks are bright pink, but flamingo experts are perplexed by the claim.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The yolks of flamingo eggs are a bright pink color.

title: Did Keanu Reeves Say Hollywood Elites Use the 'Blood of Babies' to Get High?
subtitle: Reports that the actor stated Hollywood elites engage in the ritual abuse of children and the practice of drinking their blood are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Keanu Reeves stated that Hollywood elites engage in the ritual abuse of children and the practice of drinking their blood.

title: Were U.S. Marine Corps Helicopters Spotted Over CIA Headquarters?
subtitle: A radio host with a history of pushing misinformation claimed that the Marine Corps "sent a message" to the intelligence agency.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A large contingent of U.S. Marine Corps helicopters were seen circling CIA headquarters.

title: Are Motorists Finding HIV-Infected Needles on Gas Pump Handles?
subtitle: Rumors that service station customers are getting stuck by HIV-loaded syringes affixed to gas pump handles are a hoax.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Service station customers are getting stuck by HIV-loaded syringes affixed to gas pump handles.

title: Did President Trump Reverse President Obama's Turkey Pardons?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump "revoke[d] all sixteen Thanksgiving Day turkey pardons," ordering the birds executed by firing squad, were satirical.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump ordered the execution of several turkeys pardoned by President Obama.

title: Did Mexico Seize 800 Pounds of U.S. Government Cocaine?
subtitle: Reports that authorities in Mexico confiscated a massive shipment of cocaine headed towards a U.S. government facility are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Authorities in Mexico have seized a massive shipment of cocaine headed towards a U.S. government facility.

title: Is This Ryan Zinke Posing with a Dead Elephant?
subtitle: The Secretary of the Interior is not the man in a widely-circulated photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Ryan Zinke posing with a dead elephant.

title: Is Jennifer Aniston Starting a 'Celebrities for Trump' Group?
subtitle: A particularly brazen attempt at "clickbait" scraped together two unrelated stories under a random headline.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Jennifer Aniston and other actors are starting a "Celebrities For Trump" advocacy group.

title: Did a Colorado Infant Become the 'First Pot Overdose Death'?
subtitle: the co-author of a recently misread case study told a reporter.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A new study reporting on the 2015 death of a Colorado infant claims the event was the world's first documented pot overdose.

title: Does This Photograph Show Obama Riding the Subway Next to an Open-Mouthed Sleeping Man?
subtitle: Most of us who ride the subway have shared this experience at one time or another.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph showing President Obama with a man sleeping on the subway is genuine.

title: Did Franken Photog Say Groping Image Was Staged?
subtitle: A fake quote ostensibly uttered by the photographer who took the infamous image of Senator Al Franken and Leeann Tweeden was circulated in November 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The photographer of the infamous Al Franken image said that the moment was staged, that Leeann Tweeden "was playing dead," and that "she wanted him to 'revive' her."

title: Is This a 'Flaming Tire' Rocketing Past a Car?
subtitle: Out-of-control fires and tires are dangerous enough individually, never mind in combination.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a flaming tire rocketing past a car.

title: Did California Legislators Vote to Exempt Themselves from State's Gun Laws?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan web sites persist in recycling false reports about California legislators' exempting themselves from the state's gun control regulations.
author: David Emery
statement: The California Senate voted 28-8 in favor of exempting lawmakers from the state's gun control regulations.

title: Does an Image Depict the Texas Church Shooter at a Bernie Sanders Rally?
subtitle: An image circulating on Facebook purporting to depict the Texas church shooter in Bernie Sanders regalia in fact does not.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts Texas church shooting suspect Devin Patrick Kelley at a Bernie Sanders rally.

title: Did Muslims March in Favor of Sharia Law in England?
subtitle: A video showing a religious procession in Bradford, England, was misrepresented as a protest by those with an anti-Muslim agenda.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Muslims "marching for Sharia law" in England.

title: Edward Mordrake, the Man with Two Faces
subtitle: Was a nineteenth-century Englishman named Edward Mordake (or Mordrake) born with a malevolent "second face" on the back of his head?
author: David Emery
statement: A nineteenth-century British man named Edward Mordrake (also spelled "Mordake") was born with a rare medical condition in the form of a extra face on the back of his head.

title: Is This a Marijuana Grower Hiding From Law Enforcement?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a marijuana grower hiding from police is not genuine footage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a marijuana grower hiding from law enforcement officers in a corner.

title: Did a Woman Say the Washington Post Offered Her $1,000 to Accuse Roy Moore of Sexual Abuse?
subtitle: A conspiratorial web site shared a story based solely on unsourced tweets claiming the venerable newspaper paid off sources.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An Alabama woman claimed the Washington Post tried to pay her to come forward and make accusations of sexual abuse against Roy Moore.

title: Will Eating Too Many Bananas Kill You?
subtitle: Eating six or seven bananas at once will not expose you to death from a lethal potassium overdose.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Eating six or seven bananas at once can result in death from a lethal potassium overdose.

title: Did Saudi Arabia Behead Its First Robot Citizen?
subtitle: A satirical web site fooled some readers with a fabrication based on a recent international news story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: An angry mob in Saudi Arabia beheaded "Sophia," a robot recently awarded citizenship.

title: Actor Harry Shearer Leaving 'The Simpsons?'
subtitle: A rumor holding that actor Harry Shearer had announced his departure from "The Simpsons" in November 2017 were unfounded.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Harry Shearer announced in November 2017 that he was leaving 'The Simpsons.'

title: Was Stephen Hawking Accused of Sexual Misconduct?
subtitle: Reports that the famous theoretical physicist had been accused of sexual impropriety originated from a hoax article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Famed theoretical physicist Stephen Hawking was accused of sexual misconduct by a former student.

title: Has Facebook Launched a 'No Swearing' Campaign?
subtitle: Reports that Facebook has instituted a 'no swearing' campaign and threatened to lock the accounts of violators are a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook has instituted a 'no swearing' campaign and threatened to lock the accounts of users who employ profanity.

title: Was an Aquarium Employee Emasculated After a Sexual Assault on an Octopus?
subtitle: A lurid report about an aquatic animal encounter gone wrong was fake news.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A San Diego Zoo employee was hospitalized after trying to have sex with an octopus and sustaining heavy damage to his genitalia.

title: Is Ravioli a Traditional Veterans Day Meal?
subtitle: A spurious Wikipedia edit led to the rumor that a tradition of celebrating Veterans Day with ravioli dinners was initiated by President Woodrow Wilson in 1919.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A tradition of celebrating Veterans Day with ravioli dinners was initiated by President Woodrow Wilson in 1919.

title: Did an Elderly Woman Train 65 Cats to Steal from Her Neighbors?
subtitle: A "news" article reported that an elderly woman had succeeded in herding cats.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An elderly woman trained her 65 cats to steal items, such as jewelry, from her neighbors.

title: Did Hoboken Mayor Ravi Bhalla 'Vow to Glorify Islam In Every Decision'?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site regurgitated Islamophobic stereotypes in a post following Bhalla's November 2017 election.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Hoboken Mayor Ravi Bhalla promised to "glorify Islam" after being elected.

title: Did President Donald Trump Call Senator Antonio Trillanes IV Trillanes a 'Little Narco?'
subtitle: Rumors that Trump implied a legislator from the Philippines was a drug smuggler originated with a poorly sourced column.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump called Philippines lawmaker Antonio Trillanes IV a "little narco".

title: Were Baseball Players Photographed Kneeling to Protest Lynchings in the 1950s?
subtitle: A prank web site user used a photograph from 1936 to gin up a "story" spoofing modern player protests.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Baseball players in the 1950s were caught on camera kneeling to protest lynchings in the United States.

title: Is Danica Roem the First Transgender State Legislator in the U.S.?
subtitle: Roem's victory in Virginia came 25 years after Althea Garrison was elected to state office in Massachusetts.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Danica Roem is the first trans state legislator in the U.S.

title: Was a Planned Parenthood Employee Charged with Using Aborted Babies as Halloween Props?
subtitle: Claims that a reproductive health care worked used aborted fetuses as Halloween decor are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Planned Parenthood employee was arrested for using tissue from aborted fetuses as Halloween decorations.

title: Has Tony Podesta Been Arrested in the Mueller Investigation?
subtitle: Notorious fake news sites falsely reported the Democratic lobbyist had been taken into custody.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Lobbyist Tony Podesta has been arrested by United States Marshals in relation to Special Counsel Bob Mueller's Russia probe.

title: Police Chief Warns of Fentanyl Overdose Risk from Residue on Shopping Carts?
subtitle: The likelihood of such a scenario is scientifically dubious and the law enforcement agency that made the claim has walked it back.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Law enforcement agencies recommend that people wash the handle on shopping carts before using them to avoid potential exposure to fentanyl.

title: Did Michael Lombardi Kill a Hibernating Bear in New Jersey?
subtitle: A photograph showing a hunter with a recently killed bear is frequently shared with a erroneous backstory.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A New Jersey man named Michael Lombardi killed a hibernating bear.

title: Was a Grand Juror in a Clinton Probe Found Dead?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site published an unpleasant and entirely fabricated story about a fictional murder associated with Robert Mueller's Russia investigation.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A Baltimore woman who leaked the imminent indictment of Roger Clinton, Jr. was found murdered.

title: Was the Texas Church Shooter an Atheist on the DNC Payroll?
subtitle: Reports that the Texas church shooter was an atheist who was also on the DNC's payroll are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Texas church shooter was an atheist and was also on the payroll of the Democratic National Committee.

title: Is Snapchat Shutting Down by the End of 2017?
subtitle: A rumor that the popular messaging site was about to be taken off line originated on a prank news site.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Snapchat, a popular messaging service, announced in November 2017 that it is being closed down by the end of the year.

title: Devastating Snowfall Predicted For NW Montana In Early 2018?
subtitle: Claims about a "devastating snowfall" predicted for Montana in 2018 originated with a prank generator site and had no basis in fact.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Meteorologists predicted a "devastating snowfall" for parts of Montana in early 2018.

title: Did Amazon Choose San Diego For Its 'HQ2'?
subtitle: A short-lived fake story about the giant tech company illustrated the dangers of sharing posts blindly.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Amazon chose San Diego as the site for its second headquarters, a.k.a. "HQ2."

title: Was Malia Obama Arrested in an 'Antifa Attack' on an Elderly Woman?
subtitle: Members of anti-fascist groups (popularly called "antifa") did not attack an elderly woman, and Malia Obama was not arrested in connection with the imaginary altercation.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Members of antifa groups attacked an elderly woman and Malia Obama was arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Was the Texas Church Shooter a Muslim Convert Named 'Samir Al-Hajeed'?
subtitle: False reports revive a long-running hoax about the comedian Sam Hyde.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The gunman in a November 2017 mass shooting in Sutherland Springs, Texas was identified as a Muslim convert named "Samir Al-Hajeed."

title: 'Time-Traveler' Busted for Insider Trading?
subtitle: Reports that a man arrested for insider trading attributed his financial success to time travel are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A man arrested for insider trading attributed his financial success to time travel.

title: Was the Texas Church Shooter an Antifa Member Who Vowed to Start Civil War?
subtitle: Reports that the perpetrator carried an Antifa flag and told churchgoers
are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The perpetrator of the Sutherland Springs shooting carried an Antifa flag and told churchgoers

title: Did Seven 'Key Witnesses' to Las Vegas Shooting Die Under 'Suspicious Circumstances'?
subtitle: A conspiratorial web site is falsely insinuating the deaths of several Las Vegas shooting witnesses are linked.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Seven "key witnesses" to the 1 October 2017 mass shooting in Las Vegas have suspiciously died in a cover-up.

title: Was Tiger Woods Ordered to Take 137 Paternity Tests?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site published a fabricated story that plays on an old, debunked allegation against the golfer.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the autumn of 2017, a Florida judge ordered golfer Tiger Woods to undergo 137 paternity tests.

title: Katy Perry Reveals Penchant for Cannibalism?
subtitle: A disreputable web site added to its archive of distasteful and entirely fabricated stories with a piece about the pop singer.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In an interview with a French radio station, Katy Perry revealed a preference for eating human meat.

title: Is This Time Magazine Cover About 'Global Cooling'?
subtitle: Despite all their bluster, climate denial blogs still do not appear to understand the difference between weather and climate.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A Time magazine cover from 1977 with the title
is an example of media fearmongering over
in the 1970s.

title: Iceland Mandates Mental Health Warnings on All Bibles?
subtitle: A satirical article about Iceland, Bibles, and mental health was mistaken as genuine news by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Iceland has passed a law requiring mental health warnings to be placed on all Bibles.

title: Did a Young Girl Disconnect her Grandfather's Life Support to Plug in her Phone's Charger?
subtitle: An article reporting that a young girl unplugged a life-support machine to charge her mobile phone was just an international hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A young girl disconnected her grandfather's life support in order to charge her mobile phone.

title: Two Clinton Employees Arrested For Destroying Evidence As Uranium Probe Begins?
subtitle: A fake news article claiming that two Clinton employees were arrested for destroying evidence related to a Uranium Probe was circulated in November 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Two of Hillary Clinton employees were arrested for destroying evidence related to a uranium probe.

title: Did Virginia's Governor Legalize Marijuana?
subtitle: A prank news article led to widespread rumors that Governor Terry McAuliffe had passed a law legalizing marijuana across Virginia.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Virginia governor Terry McAuliffe legalized recreational and medicinal marijuana across the state as of 1 November 2017.

title: Did Jared Kushner Go to Saudi Arabia Because it Doesn't Have an Extradition Treaty With the US?
subtitle: Kushner departed for a surprise trip to Saudi Arabia as Special Counsel Robert Mueller's team was about to release indictments causing unfounded speculation.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Jared Kushner took a sudden trip to Saudi Arabia to avoid arrest amid Mueller's probe.

title: Did a National Football League Coach Reverse a Decision to Sign Colin Kaepernick After a Presidential Call?
subtitle: Rumors that the Patriots' Bill Belichick reversed a decision to sign the player after a call from Trump originated from a spoof account posing as reporter Adam Schefter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NFL coach Bill Belichick reversed his decision to sign quarterback Colin Kaepernick after a phone call with President Trump.

title: Is the Department of Defense Planning a Communications Drill to Coincide with 'Antifa' Demonstrations?
subtitle: The Army Military Auxiliary Radio System sids conspiracy theory-related fears about a drill were unwarranted.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Department of Defense planned communications drills to coincide with "antifa protests" on 4 November 2017.

title: Did Morgan Freeman Say 'Jailing Hillary' Is the Best Way to 'Restore Public Faith' in Government?
subtitle: An article appearing to report that the actor had urged President Donald Trump to imprison Hillary Clinton did not contain even a shred of truth.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Morgan Freeman said that jailing former presidential candidate Hillary Clinton is the best way to restore public faith in the United States government.

title: Did Jared Kushner Scrub His Twitter Account After Manafort Indictment?
subtitle: A baseless rumor that Jared Kushner had scrubbed his Twitter account was circulated in the wake of Paul Manafort's indictment.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jared Kushner scrubbed his Twitter account shortly after Special Counsel Robert S. Mueller III revealed charges against three former Trump campaign officials in October 2017.

title: Did Fox News Ignore News of Paul Manafort's Indictment and Cover a Cheeseburger Emoji Controversy Instead?
subtitle: A joke about Fox News' coverage of Paul Manafort's indictment morphed into claims that the network failed to cover the political news at all.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Fox News didn't report breaking political news about the indictment of Paul Manafort and instead ran coverage of controversy involving a cheeseburger emoji.

title: Lincoln and Kennedy Coincidences
subtitle: Numerous 'coincidences' between the Lincoln and Kennedy assassinations are not really so amazing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: List describes a number of amazing coincidences that can be found between the assassinations of Abraham Lincoln and John F. Kennedy.

title: Is This Woman Playing Ping-Pong with Her Face as a Paddle?
subtitle: "I don't want to face such an opponent!"
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a woman using her face as a paddle during a game of table tennis.

title: Poisoned Halloween Candy
