subtitle: Police have never documented actual cases of people randomly distributing poisoned goodies to children on Halloween.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Police have documented cases of people randomly distributing poisoned goodies to children on Halloween.

title: Was the Revolving Door Invented by a Man Who Disliked Holding Open Doors for Women?
subtitle: The claim that Theophilus Van Kannel was motivated by a hatred for chivalry stems from no more than a humorous blog post published almost a century after his death.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Theophilus Van Kannel, who developed the revolving door, did so because of an aversion to holding open doors for women and other acts of chivalry.

title: Did Joe Biden Grope Stephanie Carter During a Government Ceremony?
subtitle: The former vice president didn't have that much of a thing for the wife of former defense secretary Ash Carter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A picture shows Vice President Joe Biden groping Stephanie Carter, wife of former defense secretary Ash Carter, during a government ceremony.

title: Did Trump-Supporting Sandra Bullock Urge Hillary Clinton to Leave the United States?
subtitle: Several disreputable web sites used a fabricated quote as clickbait and plagiarized a two-year-old article.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In October 2017, Sandra Bullock defended President Donald Trump and urged Hillary Clinton to leave the United States.

title: Was the 'Black Soldier' Killed in Niger a Deserter?
subtitle: A "satire" site posted a fake story appearing to report that Sgt. La David Johnson, who was killed in combat in Niger, was a defector.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Army Sgt. La David Johnson was a "defector."

title: Do Hundreds of Papers Published in 2017 'Prove' That Global Warming is a Myth?
subtitle: An article stakes its claim on a regurgitation of false information from a blogger who rejects mainstream climate science.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Hundreds of papers published in 2017 prove that global warming is a myth.

title: Did a British Pub Chain Ban 'Offensive' Remembrance Poppies?
subtitle: A Twitter account posing as JD Wetherspoon falsely claimed the chain banned the flowers due to "multiculturalism".
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: British pub chain JD Wetherspoon banned remembrance poppies due to "multiculturalism".

title: Is this Unflattering Image of President Trump Real?
subtitle: A doctored image of Trump circulated with a tongue-in-cheek request not to repost it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An unflattering photograph of President Trump is real.

title: Was 425-Pound Teacher Suspended for Sitting on Student and Farting in His Mouth?
subtitle: A gross-out story about an Iowa teacher's inappropriate punishment of a student was completely fabricated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 425-pound Iowa teacher was suspended after pinning a student down and "farting in his mouth."

title: Was a Ghost Caught on Camera in the Hallways of an Irish School?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a ghost haunting a hallway at a school in Cork, Ireland, went viral in October 2017 - just in time for Halloween.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a ghost haunting a hallway at a school in Ireland.

title: Did Cops 'Take a Knee' and Leave the Washington Redskins Stranded Overnight in Their Locker Room?
subtitle: No, police didn't strand the football team in their locker room after a game against the Philadelphia Eagles (or any other team).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Washington Redskins were stranded in their locker rooms overnight by Philadelphia police angry that players "took a knee" during a game against the Eagles on 23 October 2017.

title: Is This Owl Having an Orgasm?
subtitle: "The short answer is that we don't know much about orgasms in other species."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an owl experiencing an orgasm.

title: Are NFL Players Protesting Against Police Brutality Absentee Parents Putting Their Children at Risk?
subtitle: Social media users sought to smear demonstrations against police brutality by insulting the characters of several retired players.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: NFL players protesting police brutality are doing so because they have many children with different women, leading their families into lives of crime.

title: Did John McCain Cause a Fire Aboard the USS Forrestal that Killed 134 People?
subtitle: A fabricated story blames the fluke 1967 aircraft carrier fire on the negligence of then-Navy bomber pilot and future United States Senator John McCain.
author: David Emery
statement: A catastrophic fire aboard the aircraft carrier USS Forrestal in 1967 that killed 134 sailors and injured 161 was caused by reckless behavior on the part of then-Navy pilot John McCain.

title: Did a Tattooed Jimi Hendrix Ride a Dune Buggy?
subtitle: A doctored image featuring Jimi Hendrix covered in tattoos was circulated on social media in October 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows Jimi Hendrix covered in tattoos while riding a dune buggy.

title: Did Black NFL Players 'Demand' that the NFL Force 'White Fans' Into Community Activism?
subtitle: A disreputable web site grossly misrepresented a memo reportedly sent to NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell by four players requesting a "month of unity."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Four black players sent the NFL an "ultimatum" that included demands that the league force "white fans" into community activism.

title: Is PETA Releasing Lone Star Ticks into the Northeastern United States to Create Meat Allergies?
subtitle: Claims that members of People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals are using ticks for the widespread bioengineering of meat allergies stem from an April Fools' Day joke.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: PETA is releasing Lone Star Ticks into the northeastern United States in order to give people meat allergies.

title: Was Michael Moore Accused of Sexual Harassment?
subtitle: A questionable "satire" site fabricated a Fox News report about the progressive filmmaker's harassing a 16-year-old girl.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Director Michael Moore was accused of sexual harassment by a 16-year-old film extra.

title: Has Representative Frederica Wilson Never Supported Pro-Veteran Legislation?
subtitle: A conservative web site offers an incomplete, misleading and false summary of Wilson's legislative record on veterans-related issues.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Representative Frederica Wilson has never supported a bill intended to help military veterans.

title: Was Anibe Alexandra Odoma Kidnapped In Houston?
subtitle: Social media posts falsely stated that the 5-year-old Nigerian abduction victim -- who has since been rescued -- lived in the U.S.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Five-year-old Anibe Alexandra Odoma was taken from her family's home in Houston.

title: Did Sarah Huckabee Sanders Wear a KKK Halloween Costume in 1993?
subtitle: "Coming from five generations of Ku Klux Klan members, 58-year-old 'Ms. Ruth' sews hoods and robes for Klan members seven days a week."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Sarah Huckabee Sanders wearing KKK robes for Halloween in 1993.

title: Harvey Weinstein Gives Names of Hollywood and Washington, D.C. Pedophiles to FBI?
subtitle: Reports that the embattled film producer turned over "names of elite pedophiles" in Hollywood and Washington, D.C. are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Film producer Harvey Weinstein cut a deal with the FBI to turn over "names of elite pedophiles in Hollywood and Washington, D.C."

title: Did Myeshia Johnson Accuse Rep. Frederica Wilson of Using Her Husband 'As a Political Platform'?
subtitle: An alleged Facebook post from the widow about a controversial condolence call was "published" at least an hour before President Donald Trump phoned her.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Gold Star widow Myeshia Johnson criticized Rep. Frederica Wilson on Facebook for misrepresenting the content of a condolence call from President Donald Trump.

title: Was a Black Hockey Player Fired For Raising His Fist During the National Anthem?
subtitle: Disreputable web sites regurgitated a "satirical" story about J.T. Brown's silent protest against extrajudicial killings by police.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Tampa Bay Lightning fired J.T. Brown for raising his fist in protest during the national anthem.

title: 'Boy Shot by Stepfather' Appeal
subtitle: Old hoax holds that a every time a particular message is shared, a company will donate money towards the medical care of a 14-year-old boy shot by his stepfather.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Every time a particular message is shared, a company will donate money towards the medical care of a 14-year-old boy who was shot by his stepfather while he was defending his 2-year-old sister from rape.

title: Were Illegal Immigrants Arrested for Starting California Wildfires?
subtitle: A series of articles fervently blamed immigrants and Muslims for devastating California fires -- falsely, misleadingly, and without evidence.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Illegal immigrants were arrested for starting the October 2017 California wildfires.

title: Was a Half-Human, Half-Lion Hybrid Creature Found in Indonesia?
subtitle: Images purportedly depicting a creepy chimera-like creature actually show a silicone doll.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Images show a baby half-human, half-lion hybrid that was found in Indonesia.

title: Creepy Clowns Plan Halloween Night Purge, Cops Warn 'Stay Inside'?
subtitle: No, the Department of Homeland Security hasn't advised that a Halloween curfew be implemented over a purported creepy clown Halloween purge.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police warned citizens to "stay inside" on Halloween night because of information that "creepy clowns" planned a "purge night."

title: Was the Mandalay Bay Security Guard on the Clinton Foundation Payroll?
subtitle: A satirical web site published fake news reporting that Jesus Campos worked in the non-profit's non-existent Las Vegas office.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mandalay Bay security guard Jesus Campos worked in the Clinton Foundation's Las Vegas office before the mass shooting.

title: Lawmaker's Thong Showed During Swearing-In Ceremony?
subtitle: Italian lawmaker Maria Elena Boschi was targeted for ridicule in a doctored image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a lawmaker's underwear as she leans over a desk.

title: Is This Melania Trump's Body Double?
subtitle: An unfounded online rumor that a Melania-lookalike appeared at an event in the first lady's stead was based on a distorted video.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a "fake" Melania Trump standing next to the president.

title: Buckley Family Halloween Beheading
subtitle: Grisly photograph purportedly shows the Buckley family, whose children beheaded their mother with an axe on Halloween.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Grisly photograph shows the Buckley family, whose children beheaded their mother with an axe on Halloween.

title: Does This Photo Show Trump Getting a Spray Tan?
subtitle: A popular social media image purportedly depicts President Trump getting a spray tan in the Oval Office.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows President Trump getting a spray tan in the Oval Office.

title: Is Ireland Lowering Its Corporate Tax Rate?
subtitle: Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar Called U.S. President Donald Trump's claim "fake news."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of October 2017, Ireland plans to reduce its rate of corporation tax to 8 percent.

title: Was Freddy Krueger from 'Nightmare on Elm Street' Based on a Real Serial Murderer?
subtitle: The explanatory last line of a Halloween joke about a real-life Freddy Krueger was removed in subsequent shares.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: "Nightmare on Elm Street" character Freddy Krueger was based on a real life serial murderer.

title: Is the Mandalay Bay Security Guard 'Missing'?
subtitle: Police told us that despite widespread rumors and speculation, Jesus Campos is not missing.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mandalay Bay security guard Jesus Campos is "missing."

title: Did a Mandalay Bay Hotel Worker 'Vanish' After Giving an Interview?
subtitle: A disreputable web site published an illogical and inaccurate conspiracy theory about a valet worker who reportedly had a brush with the Las Vegas gunman.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Mandalay Bay Hotel worker Chad Nishimura "vanished" after giving a reporter a description of the suspected Las Vegas gunman that clashed with the "official narrative."

title: NASA Confirms Existence of Earth's Second Moon?
subtitle: While a discovery from 2016 did reveal the presence of a small asteroid trapped in Earth's orbit, this object cannot be classified as a moon.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: NASA has recently confirmed the existence of Earth's second moon.

title: Was a Woman Killed by a Frozen Shaft of Urine?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a woman who was pierced by a urine icicle originated on a 1990s-era British television show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a woman who was killed by a frozen shaft of urine that fell from a plane.

title: Creepy Clown Arrested After Haunted House Massacre, 18 People Dead?
subtitle: Reports about a creepy clown massacre involving a haunted house attraction are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A "creepy clown" was arrested after massacring 18 individuals in a haunted house attraction.

title: Obama Explains National Anthem Stance?
subtitle: Reports that Barack Obama said he would replace the U.S. national anthem with the song 'I'd Like to Teach the World to Sing' were fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Barack Obama said he would replace the U.S. national anthem with the song 'I'd Like to Teach the World to Sing.'

title: The Disappearance of Ashley, Kansas
subtitle: The horrific tale of a Kansas town that disappeared, along with its entire population, after an earthquake in 1952.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The town of Ashley, Kansas, and its entire population disappeared after an earthquake in 1952.

title: Did the Phrase 'a Shot of Whiskey' Originate in the Old West?
subtitle: Anecdotal reports say the expression "a shot of whiskey" came into being when cowboys traded bullets for liquor in Old West saloons.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The phrase "a shot of whiskey" originated in the Old West, as a single bullet was worth roughly the same as the drink and often substituted for currency.

title: Is the Mississippi River Going Dry?
subtitle: The Mississippi River is not "going dry" as it drains into a fault line, despite claims made in a YouTube video.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Mississippi River is "going dry" as it drains into a fault line.

title: Is There an 'Epidemic of Child Abduction' in Kansas?
subtitle: A disreputable web site distorted real concerns over children who have gone missing from the state's foster care system.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: As of October 2017, there was an "epidemic of child abduction" in the state of Kansas.

title: Did Trump Mock Trudeau for Celebrating Thanksgiving Six Weeks Early?
subtitle: In the spirit of bipartisanship and good foreign relations, there's always room for two Thanksgivings.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump mocked Prime Minister Trudeau for celebrating Thanksgiving six weeks early.

title: Does Halloween Fall on Friday the 13th for the First Time in 666 Years?
subtitle: An old joke that is recycled yearly makes no calendrical sense, as Halloween never falls on the 13th of the month.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In 2018, Halloween will fall on Friday the 13th for the first time in 666 years.

title: Police Arrest Mandalay Security Guard Jesus Compos As Second Shooter in Las Vegas Massacre?
subtitle: Reports that the Mandalay Bay security guard wounded in the Las Vegas mass shooting has been arrested as an accomplice to that event are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The hotel security guard wounded in the Las Vegas mass shooting has been arrested as an accomplice to that event.

title: New Research Suggests Massive Yellowstone Eruption Could Occur Sooner Than Expected?
subtitle: Research documenting chemical changes in the Yellowstone magma chamber prior to a past eruption does not affect an eruption's future probability.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: New research from Arizona State University suggests that a catastrophic super-eruption from the Yellowstone caldera could occur sooner than previously thought.

title: Does This Image Show a 1930s Housewife Forced into 'Smile Therapy'?
subtitle: A creepy vintage image of dubious provenance purports to illustrate an outdated psychiatric treatment for unhappy housewives.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts "attitude adjustment" and "smile therapy" forced upon American housewives in the 1930s institutionalized for "not taking care of themselves" and acting "depressed."

title: Is Trump International Hotel Handing Out Anti-CNN Petitions?
subtitle: A woman posted an image of a petition that she says an anonymous individual gave her at the hotel bar, prompting a rumor that guests were receiving it upon check-in.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Trump International Hotel in Washington D.C. handed out flyers promoting an anti-CNN petition to guests at check-in.

title: Did Colin Kaepernick Say He Would Stand for the National Anthem If Signed by an NFL Team?
subtitle: News reports were based on false claims made by a CBS reporter, who has since resiled from them.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In October 2017, Colin Kaepernick told a CBS reporter he would stand for the national atnthem if he were signed by an NFL team.

title: Are These Cars Narrowly Missing Each Other at a Busy Intersection?
subtitle: A video uses editing and 3D models to make it appear as if the cars routinely miss each other by inches.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a busy intersection where accidents are narrowly averted.

title: Is 'Antifa' Planning a Civil War?
subtitle: Despite what random people might say in homemade YouTube videos, they offer no proof that any anti-fascist groups are planning even a skirmish.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Law enforcement agents have announced that "antifa" is planning extended violent unrest or civil war beginning on 4 November 2017.

title: Lebron James Wore a 'We March, Y'all Mad' Protest Shirt?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing Lebron James wearing a "We march, y'all mad" shirt was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows Lebron James wearing a "we march, y'all mad" shirt.

title: Upstate New York Murder-Suicide Linked to Las Vegas Mass Shooting?
subtitle: Two disreputable web sites seized on tragic events in upstate New York to further their conspiracy theories about a deadly mass shooting.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The deaths of John Beilman and his daughter were linked to the Las Vegas mass shooting via a device found in Stephen Paddock's hotel room.

title: Democrat Principal Defecates In Front Of Students During Pledge Of Allegiance?
subtitle: A distasteful fake news story got a partisan makeover when it was passed from one disreputable web site to another.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A principal in Springfield, Ohio, was arrested for defecating on his desk during the Pledge of Allegiance.

title: Does 'Cinderella Surgery' Modify Feet to Resemble High Heels?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a foot after "Cinderella Surgery" is actually a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a foot after "Cinderella Surgery."

title: Morgan Freeman Death Hoax
subtitle: Morgan Freeman isn't dead, as reported by a fake news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Acclaimed actor Morgan Freeman died in October 2017 at the age of 80.

title: Does Judi Dench Have a Harvey Weinstein Tattoo?
subtitle: Judi Dench once put a temporary tattoo of Harvey Weinstein's initials on her backside as a joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Judi Dench has Havey Weinstein's initials tattooed on her butt.

title: Was the Security Guard at Mandalay Bay an 'Accomplice' to the Las Vegas Mass Shooter?
subtitle: Dubious and fake news web sites reported, without a shred of evidence, that the security guard hailed as a hero for helping stop the Las Vegas mass shooting was actually an accomplice.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mandalay Bay security guard Jesus Campos was an "accomplice" to Las Vegas Strip mass shooter Stephen Paddock.

title: Did Michele Bachmann Say Vegas Victims Would be Alive If They Observed the Sabbath?
subtitle: A meme with a fabricated quote painted the U.S. Representative as having been shockingly insensitive to the Las Vegas shooting victims.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Michelle Bachmann said of those killed in Las Vegas shootings: "I'm not blaming the victims, but it is their fault."

title: Gun Ownership and Homicides in Honduras vs. Switzerland
subtitle: A contrast of radically different gun laws and homicide rates in Honduras and Switzerland is based on flawed premises.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image contrasts radically different gun laws and homicide rates in Honduras and Switzerland.

title: Does an 'Increase' in Arctic and Greenland Ice Cast Doubt on the Reality of Global Warming?
subtitle: Single data points presented without context do not interfere with the scientific consensus on climate change.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Measurements indicating that 2017 had relatively more sea ice in the Arctic and less melting of glacial ice in Greenland casts scientific doubt on the reality of global warming.

title: Did 'Melbourne Antifa' Claim Responsibility for the Vegas Massacre?
subtitle: A page falsely posing as part of the anti-fascist movement put up a post claiming that "comrades" were responsible for an October 2017 mass shooting in Las Vegas, Nevada.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Antifa group in Melbourne, Australia claimed responsibility for the September 2017 Las Vegas massacre.

title: Las Vegas Shooter Died in 2013?
subtitle: A bizarre conspiracy theory holding that Las Vegas shooter Stephen Paddock died in 2013 was based on a different individual's obituary.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Las Vegas shooter Stephen Paddock died in 2013.

title: Did a Second Gunman Shoot From the Fourth Floor of the Mandalay Bay Hotel?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists spread false information that a second person targeted a country music concert crowd on the Las Vegas Strip during a deadly mass shooting that left scores dead.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A second gunman fired at a crowd from the fourth floor of the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino during the mass shooting in Las Vegas.

title: Did 'Barack Obama's Stylist' Reveal He Is 'a Gay'?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site published an especially crude story about the former president, which was quickly picked up by bottom-feeder aggregators.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Former President Barack Obama's stylist revealed to a conservative web site that he caught Obama in the middle of a gay tryst.

title: Was Las Vegas Shooter Identified at an Anti-Trump Protest?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists attempted to tie the alleged Las Vegas mass shooter to an anti-Trump protest but offered little evidence to back up the claim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The man accused of opening fire on hundreds of people in a Las Vegas casino in October 2017 was spotted at an anti-Trump protest two months earlier.

title: Flight Crew Takes a Knee, Leaving New Orleans Saints Stranded on Runway?
subtitle: There is no truth to a widely-shared claim that the flight crew of the New Orleans Saints' team airplane "took a knee" and refused to perform their duties.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The flight crew of the New Orleans Saints' team plane decided to "take a knee" and refuse to fly the team to their destination in protest of players kneeling during the national anthem.

title: Gordon Ramsay Has Entire Staff Take a Knee, Refuse to Serve Miami Dolphins?
subtitle: A notorious fake news site spread a rumor that Ramsay rudely ejected Miami Dolphins from his restaurant for "taking a knee" during the national anthem.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay directed his entire staff to "take a knee" and refuse service to Miami Dolphins players over national anthem protests against police brutality.

title: Are 871 Convicted Felons Currently Playing for the NFL?
subtitle: A meme circulated in an effort to discredit professional athletes protesting racism contained false information.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: There are currently 871 convicted felons playing for the NFL.

title: Did the Army Football Team Kneel in Protest During the National Anthem?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the Army Black Knights team kneeling in protest actually shows the Navy football team kneeling in prayer.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the Army football team kneeling in protest during the national anthem.

title: Did Puerto Rico's Teamsters Union Go on Strike During Hurricane Maria Relief Efforts?
subtitle: Reports that truck drivers are on strike in Puerto Rico are false -- Teamsters have asked mainland truckers to distribute supplies in the U.S. territory.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2017, truck drivers' unions in Puerto Rico went on strike and refused to take part in relief efforts after a series of hurricanes.

title: Are the Spires on Disney World's Cinderella Castle Removable in Case of Hurricane?
subtitle: An old but still thriving urban legend about Walt Disney World in Florida holds that the theme park's tallest structure, Cinderella Castle, was built such that it can be fully or partially dismantled in the event of a hurricane.
author: David Emery
statement: Cinderella Castle in Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida was constructed such that it can be partially or wholly disassembled in the event of a hurricane.

title: Did Nike Cut Ties with the Dallas Cowboys Over National Anthem Protests?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site published a fake story about the sportswear company, which has in fact expressed support for players' right to protest.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2017, Nike cut ties with the Dallas Cowboys over national anthem protests.

title: Did an NFL Player Burn an American Flag in a Locker Room?
subtitle: A doctored photograph purportedly showed a member of the Seattle Seahawks setting a U.S. flag on fire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Seattle Seahawks player burning an American flag.

title: Did Jared Kushner Register to Vote in New York as a Woman?
subtitle: The New York City Board of Elections has said that their computer system is to blame for a mix-up over Jared Kushner's gender in New York's voter rolls.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Jared Kushner registered to vote as a woman in New York.

title: Did Sarah Sanders Give This Snarky Response About Trump's Tax Returns?
subtitle: Some were fooled by a joke that depicted the press secretary as repeating conspiracy theories about Obama in response to a reporter's question.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Press Secretary Sarah Sanders said that President Trump's tax returns were being kept "underneath President Obama's college records" and "his passport application" where nobody would find them.

title: FBI Seizes Over 3,000 Penises During Raid at Morgue Employee's Home?
subtitle: Rumors holding that a morgue employee was involved in a salacious organ trafficking operation originated with a fake news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The FBI seized over 3,000 penises during a September 2017 raid of a morgue employee's home.

title: Is the Trump Administration Price Gouging Puerto Rico Evacuees and Seizing Passports?
subtitle: The Trump administration did not implement a Department of State policy that was widely rumored as being applicable to Puerto Rican hurricane evacuees.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Trump administration is making Puerto Ricans sign promissory notes and surrender passports before evacuating them or rendering aid.

title: Did the Clinton Foundation Donate $7.1 Million to 'Antifa'?
subtitle: A well-known "satirical" web site published yet another entirely fabricated story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Clinton Foundation donated a total of $7.1 million to anti-fascist groups, including during the 2016 presidential election campaign.

title: Massive Indian Ocean Earthquake and Tsunami Expected by the End of 2017?
subtitle: An Indian man's prediction is based on his purported psychic abilities and carries no scientific weight.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: There is verifiable evidence that a large earthquake will strike the Indian Ocean and cause a deadly tsunami before the end of 2017.

title: Is Fentanyl-Laced Marijuana Use on the Rise?
subtitle: Nearly all reports of fentanyl-laced marijuana use are based on faulty reporting, and no evidence suggests that its occurrence is in any way rooted in reality.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Fentanyl-laced marijuana use is a real and growing concern in the United States.

title: Did Steelers Coach Mike Tomlin 'Rip' Alejandro Villanueva For Not Protesting During the National Anthem?
subtitle: Some web sites published erroneous claims that the coach criticized the U.S. Army veteran for standing during the anthem.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Pittsburgh Steelers coach Mike Tomlin "ripped" one of his players, Alejandro Villanueva, for standing near the sidelines during the playing of the national anthem before an NFL game.

title: Did Budweiser Pull Advertising from the NFL Over National Anthem Protests?
subtitle: A rumor holding that the brewing company had "pulled out of the NFL" over "take a knee" protests against inequality was baseless.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Budweiser stopped advertising with the NFL due to the controversy over players kneeling in protest during the national anthem.

title: Fox Sports Cancels ALL NFL Broadcasts 'Until Players Respect the Flag'?
subtitle: A disreputable web site hyped an ongoing controversy with a false claim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox Sports announced that they would no longer broadcast NFL games until teams and players apologized to President Trump for kneeling during the national anthem.

title: Do 'Sonic Weapons' Adequately Explain 'Health Attacks' on Diplomats in Cuba?
subtitle: Inaudible sonic weapons are an unlikely cause of the mysterious symptoms suffered by American and Canadian diplomats in Cuba.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: An inaudible sonic weapon adequately explains the range of symptoms experienced by diplomats suffering from
in Cuba.

title: Is It Illegal in Florida to Power Your Home With Solar After a Storm Because of Lobbying?
subtitle: For safety reasons, solar panels generally go offline after a crisis downs the power grid - unless homeowners have purchased additional equipment.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Thanks to lobbying, Florida homeowners were unable to use solar panels during Irma to generate electricity.

title: Did an American Actor Take Part in a London Bomb Attack 'Hoax'?
subtitle: A bizarre false flag conspiracy theory falsely links an actor from NBC's 'The Office' to the Parsons Green terrorist attack.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The actor Nora Kirkpatrick "played" a victim as part of a fake terrorist bomb attack at Parsons Green in London.

title: Aaron Rodgers Photographed Holding 'Stand For the Flag, Kneel for the Cross' T-Shirt?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers holding a "Stand for the flag, kneel for the cross" shirt is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers holding a "Stand for the flag, Kneel for the cross" shirt.

title: Cleveland Browns Forced to Issue Refunds to 90 Percent of Season Ticket Holders?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site published a false claim that certain NFL teams issued refunds to a majority of season ticket holders due to the national anthem controversy.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2017, the Cleveland Browns, Dallas Cowboys and Pittsburgh Steelers refunded season tickets in light of protests by players during the National Anthem.

title: NFL Fines Pittsburgh Steelers $1M Each for Skipping National Anthem?
subtitle: Reports that the NFL was fining Pittsburgh Steelers players $1 million each for staying in their locker room during the national anthem are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The NFL has fined Pittsburgh Steelers players $1 million each for staying in their locker room during the national anthem.

title: 'No Mother Should Have to Fear for Her Son's Life Every Time He Robs a Store'
subtitle: An image showing a Ferguson protester holding a controversial sign is a digital fabrication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a protester holding a "No mother should have to fear for her son's life every time he robs a store" sign in front of a fire station in Ferguson, Missouri.

title: Donald Trump Condoned Flag Burning?
subtitle: In response to a controversial 2016 remark made by Donald Trump opposing flag burning, someone faked a 2011 tweet from him expressing the opposite view.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Prior to condemning flag burning in November 2016, Donald Trump endorsed the act in February 2011.

title: Donald Trump Doesn't Salute the Flag?
subtitle: An image of Donald Trump not placing his hand over his heart during the playing of the U.S. national anthem doesn't reflect reality.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump failed to  place his hand over his heart during the playing of the U.S. national anthem at the beginning of a GOP debate.

title: Did Melania Trump Steal Her United Nations Speech from Michelle Obama?
subtitle: A meme claiming that Trump plagiarized a September 2017 speech from a 2014 talk by the former First Lady is false.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump plagiarized her 2017 speech at the United Nations from a speech delivered by Michelle Obama in 2014.

title: Was a Pedophile's Decapitated Corpse Found on a Judge's Doorstep After a Bail Hearing?
subtitle: Some fake news sites just can't get over their obsessions with pederasty, likely because it makes for effective clickbait material.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A pedophile named William Smith was decapitated and left on a judge's doorstep in September 2017.

title: Were UFOs Spotted Over Oklahoma City?
subtitle: Despite claims made in a viral video, purported unidentified flying objects are actually identifiable as United States Navy paratroopers over Salt Lake City, Utah.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of unidentified flying objects over Oklahoma City.

title: Did Ashley Judd Say She Wanted to Live in the Middle East 'Where Women Have More Rights'?
subtitle: Rumors that the actress had announced that she wanted to move were based on the misinterpretation of an old tweet by sites not overly concerned with credibility.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ashley Judd announced that she was moving to the Middle East, "where women have more rights".

title: Iowa to Discontinue Soda and Candy for EBT Recipients on 1 October 2017?
subtitle: A Facebook prank site published a hoax report that soda and candy would no longer be eligible for electronic benefits transfer purchases.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Electronic benefits recipients in Iowa can no longer purchase soda and candy as of 1 October 2017.

title: Are Facebook Users Secretly Following You?
subtitle: Instructions for blocking Facebook users who are supposedly furtively following you are spurious.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Instructions explain how to block Facebook users who are following you without your knowledge.

title: Did Jeff Goldblum 'Trash' Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg?
subtitle: According to rumors, the actor told an interviewer that there is no difference between the two entrepreneurs because both are capitalists.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jeff Goldblum criticized Mark Zuckerberg and Elon Musk for being capitalists during an MTV interview.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Caught on Tape Laughing About Irma's 'Wiping Out All of Those Florida Hillbillies?'
subtitle: A disreputable web site fabricated a story about the Democratic presidential nominee and MSNBC host Rachel Maddow.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Hillary Clinton made fun of hurricane Irma victims and called them "Florida hillbillies."

title: Will All Child Support in the U.S. End on June 11th 2018?
subtitle: Reports claiming President Trump and Congress have abolished child support were completely false but massively popular on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: All child support in the U.S. will end on 11 June 2018.

title: Dollar Tree Closing All Stores?
subtitle: Neither Dollar Tree, Family Dollar, nor Dollar General is closing all their stores, despite a widespread rumor on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dollar General, Family Dollar, or Dollar Tree is closing all stores.

title: Did Ben Carson Tell Hurricane Victims 'Homelessness Is A Gift From Heaven'?
subtitle: An image circulating online attributes an insensitive (and fabricated) quote to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Ben Carson told a hurricane victim that "homelessness is a gift from heaven" and a sign that God wanted them to be homeless.

title: Hurricane Jose Causes 30-Foot Waves At Jennette's Pier?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a 30-foot wave crashing down on Jennette's Pier in North Carolina is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 30-foot wave from Hurricane Jose hitting Jennette's Pier in North Carolina.

title: Is California Governor Jerry Brown Allowing HIV-Positive People to Donate Blood?
subtitle: Web sites misstate what would happen under a bill that was signed into law on 6 October 2017.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: California's governor is allowing people who are HIV-positive donate blood

title: Was Alec Baldwin Arrested at the 2017 Emmys for Threatening President Donald Trump?
subtitle: A satirical web site publishes yet another entirely false story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The United States Secret Service arrested Alec Baldwin for threatening President Donald Trump at the 2017 Emmy Awards.

title: Was a Couple Hospitalized After a Man Got His Head Stuck in His Wife's Vagina?
subtitle: A story about a terrible sexual experience is nothing more than a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A hapless man somehow got his head stuck in his wife's vagina during sex, resulting in the couple's hospitalization.

title: Did Jane Fonda Betray American POWs in North Vietnam?
subtitle: The long-standing claim that Jane Fonda turned smuggled messages from U.S. POWs over to their North Vietnamese captors is false.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: During a trip to North Vietnam, Jane Fonda turned smuggled messages from U.S. POWs over to their captors.

title: Did Daisy the Dog Rescue Hundreds of 9/11 Survivors?
subtitle: The tale of a dog named Daisy who rescued countless souls from World Trade Center towers on 11 September 2001 is inspiring but fabricated.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A dog named Daisy rescued hundreds of people from the damaged World Trade Center towers on 9/11.

title: NASA Warns 'Planet X' Is Headed Straight for Earth?
subtitle: The American space agency has not issued any warnings about the trajectory of another planet intersecting Earth's orbit.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: NASA has warned of imminent disaster due to the trajectory of another planet that will  intersect Earth's orbit.

title: Did National Geographic Purchase Footage of Destructive Tornadoes for $1 Million?
subtitle: A video purporting to show series of destructive tornadoes actually showed computer-generated special effects that originally appeared in a Hollywood movie.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video showing several destructive tornadoes was purchased by National Geographic for $1 million.

title: Is This a Giant Seahorse Fossil?
subtitle: A Photoshop contest entry has resurfaced on social media, where people claim it is evidence of a human-sized seahorse.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a boulder containing remarkably well-preserved, larger-than-human seahorse fossil.

title: Did Planned Parenthood 'Team Up' with Satanists to Promote Abortion Rights in Missouri?
subtitle: The two groups have taken separate court cases in the state, but there has been no collaboration whatsoever between them.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Planned Parenthood and the Satanic Temple have worked together to oppose laws restricting abortion rights in Missouri.

title: U.S. Government Ships Radioactive Milk to Black Communities as Part of a Genocide Plot?
subtitle: A conspiracy theory involving radioactive milk and diabetes fails on both historical and scientific grounds.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: High diabetes rates among African-Americans are caused by a genocidal government plot to ship weaponized radioactive milk to black communities.

title: Female Serial Killer is the Daughter of a United States Senator?
subtitle: A notorious "satirical" news web site has produced yet another entirely fabricated story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: "Anne Marie Scott", daughter of U.S. Senator "James Montgomery", was charged with a series of murders.

title: Permanent Closure at Walt Disney World Due to Hurricane Irma?
subtitle: Rumors holding that Walt Disney World would close the Fort Wilderness Campgrounds due to damage from Hurricane Irma originated on a prank web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Walt Disney announced that they were permanently closing the Fort Wilderness Campgrounds due to damage from Hurricane Irma.

title: Are Reese's Peanut Butter Cups Going to Be Discontinued?
subtitle: A prank-generating website churned out a hoax about the demise of the iconic candy.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2017, the makers of Reese's Peanut Butter Cups announced they were discontinuing the candy and withdrawing it from circulation.

title: Does a Never-Aired 'Ghost Car' Commercial Depict an Unexplained Supernatural  Event?
subtitle: An actual television ad that pranked European viewers with a shock ending in 2005 has since been revived on the internet with a fabricated backstory.
author: David Emery
statement: The makers of a television commercial for a car company were so "freaked out" by an apparent "ghostly" apparition in the raw footage that the ad was never released.

title: Did a Muslim Mayor Outlaw Christmas in 2017?
subtitle: Reports that the Muslim mayor of a Michigan town banned Christmas festivities and decorations are fake news.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Muslim mayor of "Blairsville, Michigan" has outlawed Christmas within the city's limits.

title: Did Crabs Swarm a Florida Road After Irma?
subtitle: A web site falsely claimed to be showing live footage of a mass crab migration in the aftermath of the massive storm.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Crabs swarmed onto a Florida road after Hurricane Irma.

title: Is This Heath Ledger Posing with Cillian Murphy?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing actors Heath Ledger and Cillian Murphy is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows actors Heath Ledger and Cillian Murphy posing together.

title: Were Three Sharks Filmed in Miami Flood Waters After Hurricane Irma?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing sharks swimming in a flooded area of Miami after Irma passed through is just a fish story.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows three sharks in an area of Miami, Florida that was flooded by Hurricane Irma.

title: Woman Dies in Cinema While Watching 'It' Remake?
subtitle: Fake news articles claiming that people died while watching the movie were circulated on social media in September 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman died at a movie theater while watching the movie

title: Did Stan Lee Fire Jennifer Lawrence for Comments About Trump?
subtitle: Stan Lee did not fire Jennifer Lawrence from a film over comments she purportedly made about President Trump.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Stan Lee fired Jennifer Lawrence from an upcoming film due to his belief she disrespected President Trump.

title: Alexandria's Genesis
subtitle: A mutation known as Alexandria's Genesis turns people into 'perfect human beings' who exhibit purple eyes six months after birth.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A mutation known Alexandria's Genesis turns people into 'perfect human beings' who exhibit purple eyes six months after birth.

title: Did Hurricane Irma Create a 'Cloud Face'?
subtitle: A web site passed off a video shot in Canada in 2011 as "live footage" of a storm that lashed Florida six years later.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Hurricane Irma created a cloud formation that resembled an ominous face.

title: Is the 'My First Vape' Children's Toy Real?
subtitle: "'My First Vape' has been specially made to be suitable for children 9 months or over so they don't feel left out in a world full of vapers."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2017, a "leading toy company" produced a toy version of an electronic cigarette, aimed at children.

title: Did Barack Obama Attach an Ominous Message to a Letter He Wrote to Donald Trump?
subtitle: There was no threat in an Inauguration Day letter from former President Barack Obama to his successor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Barack Obama put a threatening message in a letter he left for incoming President Donald Trump.

title: Did Jennifer Lawrence Say Hurricanes Are 'Nature's Wrath' Against Trump?
subtitle: Right-wing web sites misrepresented Lawrence's assertion that climate change is caused by human activity.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Actress Jennifer Lawrence blamed recent hurricanes in the U.S. on President Trump.

title: Lincoln and Lee's Views on Slavery
subtitle: A meme widely circulated in the wake of a controversy over Confederate memorials does not accurately reflect Abraham Lincoln's and Robert E. Lee's views on slavery and the Civil War.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme accurately reflects Abraham Lincoln's and Robert E. Lee's views on slavery.

title: Florida Governor Rick Scott Critically Injured During Hurricane Irma Cleanup?
subtitle: A notorious purveyor of fake news churns out another fabrication.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: On 11 September 2017, Florida Governor Rick Scott was taken to hospital after being injured during a Hurricane Irma cleanup operation.

title: Weather Reporter Hit by a Stop Sign During Storm?
subtitle: A clip from a television sitcom showing a stop sign crashing into a weather reporter during a storm is occasionally mistaken for genuine news footage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An animated GIF shows a wind-blown stop sign hitting a weather reporter.

title: Hurricane Irma Floods Miami International Airport?
subtitle: The White House's social media director mistook a video showing heavy flooding at the Mexico City International Airport for its Miami counterpart.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Hurricane Irma hitting Miami International Airport.

title: Did Physicist Michio Kaku Say HAARP Caused Irma and Harvey?
subtitle: A 2013 CBS video segment about weather modification was dishonestly reframed as a clip about Hurricanes Irma and Harvey.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Professor Michio Kaku said Hurricanes Harvey and Irma were caused by the United States Government modifying the weather.

title: Video Shows Hurricane Irma Hitting Antigua and Barbuda?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing Hurricane Irma destroying buildings in Antigua and Barbuda actually captures a 2016 tornado in Uruguay.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Hurricane Irma destroying buildings in Antigua and Barbuda in September 2017.

title: Did a 2005 Movie Feature Hurricanes Named Harvey and Irma?
subtitle: An online conspiracy theory about government-created hurricanes gets even the most basic facts wrong.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The 2005 movie

title: During a Hurricane, Should You Store Important Items in Your Dishwasher?
subtitle: Appliance experts and flooding victims advise against storing valuables in a dishwasher during a hurricane.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dishwashers are a reliably safe place to store valuable documents and photographs during hurricanes or flooding.

title: Does a Viral Video of Mercury and Aluminum Mixing Suggest That Vaccines Are Unsafe?
subtitle: A science experiment on YouTube was co-opted by anti-vaccine activists to make scientifically illiterate innuendos about vaccine safety.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The reaction between metallic mercury and aluminum, which produces a dramatic chain reaction popular on YouTube science channels, is evidence that vaccines are not safe.

title: Did Celine Dion Say 'I Can't Even Look at an American Flag' Because 'I Hate This Country?'
subtitle: A clickbait news web site invented a controversy involving Celine Dion, Loretta Lynn, Cher, and other female musicians.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer Celine Dion said that she can't even look at an American flag because she hates the country.

title: Did the United States Treasury Announce Plans to Put Robert E. Lee on the New $20 Bill?
subtitle: An article apparently intended as topical satire was mistaken for real news by some readers.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2017, the United States Treasury announced plans to produce a new $20 bill featuring the face of Confederate general Robert E. Lee.

title: Does Hurricane Florence Now Contain Sharks?
subtitle: An image of a news ticker reading "Hurricane Florence now contains sharks" is a recycled fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration reported that Hurricane Florence had airlifted several sharks.

title: Did Hurricane Harvey Reveal Barack Obama's Secret Ammunition Stash?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site fabricated a story linking the fatal storm to the former president and 2015 military exercises at the U.S.-Mexico border.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Flooding caused by Hurricane Harvey exposed a weapons cache hidden by former President Barack Obama.

title: Did 81-Year-Old Arthur Hickenlooper Compete on 'American Ninja Warrior?'
subtitle: A video purportedly showing an 81-year-old named Arthur Hickenlooper on the game show was met with a heavy dose of skepticism.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An 81-year-old man named Arthur Hickenlooper competed on the show "American Ninja Warrior."

title: Does the Zello Phone App Work Without the Internet?
subtitle: The Zello walkie-talkie cellphone app can be useful in an emergency situation, it still requires the internet to function.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Zello walkie-talkie cellphone app can be used without the internet.

title: Did FEMA Deny Aid to Harvey Victims Unless They Received Vaccinations?
subtitle: A false rumor that could discourage hurricane victims from seeking aid spread on social media.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey, FEMA said they would only give aid to victims if they had received (unspecified) vaccinations.

title: Florida Sheriff's Office Will Not Escort Miami Dolphins Until They Stand For National Anthem?
subtitle: An old rumor that a police department said that it would not protect NFL players until they stood for the National Anthem was rehashed in September 2017 by a disreputable web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A sheriff's department in Florida announced that they would not protect the Miami Dolphins during the 2017 season in retaliation to a player boycott of the National Anthem.

title: Are 'Illegal Immigrants' To Blame For a Hepatitis A Outbreak in San Diego?
subtitle: Right-wing web sites tried to link a local health emergency to undocumented immigrants, but without supporting evidence.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A major Hepatitis A outbreak in San Diego has been pinned on undocumented immigrants there.

title: Is Hurricane Irma on Track to Become a 'Category 6' Storm?
subtitle: A rumor that scientists would create a new hurricane category for Irma led people to believe that the storm had already received that designation.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Hurricane Irma is projected to be so big that it may become a "Category 6" hurricane; that a new "Category 6" will be invented specifically for Hurricane Irma

title: Did President Trump Save Two Cats After Hurricane Harvey?
subtitle: Is President Trump enough of a feline lover to go wading out into floodwaters to rescue a pair of cats?
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows President Trump rescuing two cats from a flooded area in Texas after Hurricane Harvey in August 2017.

title: Should You Open Windows During a Hurricane?
subtitle: Storm lore holds that opening a window slightly during a hurricane will equalize the inner pressure of a house with the outside lower pressure accompanying the hurricane.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Leaving a window open slightly during a hurricane will help equalize pressure and prevent damage.

title: Did Louis Farrakhan Renounce Islam and Convert to Christianity?
subtitle: A statement by the Nation of Islam leader declaring Jesus Christ his "redeemer" was widely misinterpreted as a disclosure that he converted to Christianity.
author: David Emery
statement: During a speech in which he declared Jesus Christ his "redeemer," Muslim leader Louis Farrakhan gave indications that he was breaking with Islam in favor of following Christianity.

title: Did a Texas Mosque Refuse to Help Hurricane Harvey Survivors?
subtitle: A "satire" site fabricated a story about a local mosque closing its doors to "infidels" seeking help.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Members of a Houston mosque barricaded themselves inside and refused to help people evacuating Hurricane Harvey.

title: Osteen's Lakewood Church Checking Member's Tithe Records?
subtitle: Reports that the beleaguered pastor of the Houston megachurch provided shelter from the city's floodwaters only to top financial contributors are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joel Osteen's Houston megachurch provided shelter only to the church's top financial contributors

title: Was a Florida Teacher Suspended After a Shocking Sex Ed Demonstration?
subtitle: Reports that a Florida teacher give 6th grade students an explicit sex ed lesson involving a strap-on sex toy to satisfy Common Core requirements are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Florida teacher gave 6th grade students an explicit sex ed lesson involving a strap-on sex toy to satisfy Common Core requirements.

title: Is the Red Cross Charging Victims of Hurricane Harvey for Disaster Relief Services?
subtitle: Rumors that the Red Cross is charging victims of Hurricane Harvey conflate past controversies with current events.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The American Red Cross is charging victims of Hurricane Harvey for their services.

title: Did CNN Stage a Hurricane Harvey Rescue Video?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists accused the news network of faking a dramatic live rescue video during Hurricane Harvey.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN was caught staging a dramatic rescue during Hurricane Harvey.

title: Did CNN Mistake Tim Allen for Joel Osteen?
subtitle: CNN did not mistakenly use a picture of actor Tim Allen for a story about pastor Joel Osteen.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN published a story about pastor Joel Osteen that mistakenly featured an image of actor Tim Allen.

title: Did President Trump Assist Rescuers in Pulling Hurricane Victims from Floodwaters?
subtitle: A photograph appears to show President Trump on a raft in Texas saving a flood victim after Hurricane Harvey.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows President Donald Trump reaching out to rescue a Harvey flooding victim.

title: Only 60 of 1,566 Churches in Houston Opened to Help Hurricane Harvey Victims?
subtitle: A meme claiming that only 4 percent of churches in Houston opened their doors to Hurricane Harvey victims appears to have originated on a satirical Facebook page and was not based on any legitimate statistics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Only 60 of the 1,566 churches in Houston opened to help the victims of Hurricane Harvey.

title: Is There a Link Between Major Hurricanes and 29 August?
subtitle: A viral meme falsely states that four hurricanes hit the United States on 29 August in various years, prompting spurious claims about this "pattern."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Four major hurricanes have hit the United States on 29 August, across 12 years, forming a meaningful pattern.

title: Melania Trump Wore Heels to Visit Texas After a Hurricane?
subtitle: Melania Trump wore high heels while boarding Air Force One, but the First Lady wore sneakers while meeting with officials in Texas.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump wore high heels to visit Texas after Hurricane Harvey.

title: Protests Seek to #EndFathersDay?
subtitle: A photograph that shows two women protesting the observance of Father's Day is a digitally manipulated image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two women holding anti-Father's Day signs in protest of that day's designation.

title: Can Animal Rescuers Be Prosecuted for Theft for Saving Animals from Harvey?
subtitle: A rumor exaggerates the (vanishingly small) likelihood that those who rescue animals in danger during a tropical storm in Texas will be prosecuted.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Anyone who rescues an animal from dangers caused by Tropical Storm Harvey can be prosecuted for theft of an animal in Texas.

title: Was Barack Obama President During Hurricane Katrina?
subtitle: Twitter users tried to pin the blame for Katrina relief issues on Obama, though he wasn't even president when it hit New Orleans.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Barack Obama was president when Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans in 2005.

title: Paul Ryan Endorsed Antifa?
subtitle: A meme featuring a fake Paul Ryan quote originated with a fake antifa Twitter account.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Paul Ryan endorsed "antifa," saying that they stood for the "greater good."

title: Navy Destroyer Collides with Building in Downtown Houston?
subtitle: A satirical article about a Navy Destroyer colliding with a building during Hurricane Harvey was mistaken for real news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Navy Destroyer crashed into a building in downtown Houston after Hurricane Harvey flooded the city in August 2017.

title: Is This James Earl Jones Dressed as Darth Vader?
subtitle: A photograph taken at a UK 'Star Wars' premiere is often circulated with the false claim that it documents racial segregation laws in 1970s London.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows actor James Earl Jones dressed as Darth Vader alongside 'Star Wars' stars Mark Hamill, Anthony Daniels, and Kenny Baker.

title: Floyd Mayweather Jr. Donates a 'Whopping Sum of Money' to Houston After Hurricane?
subtitle: A site posing as the Houston Chronicle claimed Mayweather was giving aid money to Hurricane Harvey victims, then a version about Manny Pacquiao surfaced.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Floyd Mayweather (or Manny Pacquiao) donated a sizable sum of money to Hurricane Harvey relief efforts.

title: Trump Gets a Spray Tan Before Appearing on Television?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing President Donald Trump getting a spray tan before a television appearance actually features a wax replica of him.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Donald Trump receiving a spray-on tan before a television appearance.

title: Shelby Township Meijer 'Human Trafficking' Warning
subtitle: One of many human trafficking warnings spread on Facebook in August 2017 involved a purported kidnapping attempt at a Shelby Township, Michigan Meijer store.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 25-year-old woman was drugged and nearly abducted by sex traffickers in the bathroom of a Shelby Township Meijer in August 2017.

title: Did J.K. Rowling Buy a Twitter User's Home as Revenge for His Criticism?
subtitle: A fake article on a comedy web site managed to fool a number of readers into thinking the author had turned the tables on an online troll.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling exacted revenge on a Twitter critic by monitoring his finances for two years and then buying his home.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Caught on a Hot Mic Trash-Talking Obama?
subtitle: Reports that Hillary Clinton was ejected from an interview with Katie Couric after using a racist slur to describe President Obama are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Katie Couric banished Hillary Clinton from her set in August 2017 after Clinton used a racist word to describe President Obama.

title: Black Lives Matter 'Thugs' Blocked Emergency Crews from Reaching Hurricane Victims?
subtitle: Reports that protesters had blocked emergency crews from reaching people stranded by Hurricane Harvey are - like earlier stories from which they were recycled - completely false.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A group of Black Lives Matter protesters blocked emergency crews from providing aide to those stranded by Hurricane Harvey.

title: Does This Picture Show a Shark Swimming Down a Highway After a Hurricane?
subtitle: A much-repurposed photograph of a shark swimming down a flooded highway after a hurricane is a fake.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a shark swimming down a highway after a hurricane.

title: Is This Barack Obama Laughing with George Soros?
subtitle: And just what do they find so amusing?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Barack Obama and George Soros laughing together.

title: Florida Man Turns Himself in for Murdering Imaginary Friend?
subtitle: Reports that a man turned himself in to police for killing his make-believe companion are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man turned himself in to police for killing his make-believe companion.

title: Did Mariah Carey Cover a Dead Kennedys Song to Support Antifa?
subtitle: A satirical article about Mariah Carey covering the Dead Kennedys in support of anti-fascism was mistaken by some for real entertainment news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mariah Carey recorded a cover of Dead Kennedys song "Nazi Punks Fuck Off," with proceeds going to support Antifa.

title: Were Enormous Pyramids Just Discovered In Antarctica?
subtitle: Viral images attempting to sell pyramid-shaped features as evidence of an ancient civilization in Antarctica show nothing but mountains.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Recently discovered satellite photos from Google Earth show that an ancient civilization built pyramids in Antarctica 100 million years ago.

title: Did Bart Simpson Mock Islam During a Chalkboard Gag?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a
author: Dan Evon
statement: A screenshot from an episode of

title: Mugshots of Antifa Members Arrested at Charlottesville?
subtitle: Multiple mugshots were falsely claimed to show Antifa members who were arrested during a white nationalist rally in Charlottesville.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of mugshots show all of the Antifa members who were arrested at a white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Virginia.

title: Is It Legal in Texas to Use Deadly Force to Protect a Statue from Vandalism?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post suggested it is legal in Texas to use deadly force to stop Confederate statues from being vandalized.
author: Dan Evon
statement: It is legal in Texas to use deadly force to stop a Confederate statue from being vandalized.

title: Did the Green Bay Packers Coach Just 'Piss Off' His 'Racist' Players With What He Put on the Field?
subtitle: Despite a misleading clickbait headline, Green Bay Packer coach Mike McCarthy didn't put anything in the field.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Green Bay Packers coach Mike McCarthy put something on the field that "pissed off" his "racist" players.

title: Ohio Cemetery Begins Exhuming Bodies of Confederate Soldiers?
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that a cemetery in Delaware, Ohio, was exhuming the bodies of confederate soldiers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A cemetery in Delaware, Ohio, is exhuming the bodies of confederate soldiers and relocating them to a nearby dump.

title: Did an 'Anti-Fascist' Stab a Man Over a 'Neo-Nazi' Haircut?
subtitle: Joshua Witt, 26, was arrested for filing a false police report after admitting he accidentally cut himself with a small knife.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An "anti-fascist" stabbed a man in Colorado after mistaking him for a white supremacist because of his haircut.

title: Promoter Found Dead After Exposing Mayweather-McGregor 'Fake Fight?'
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that a boxing promoter was killed for saying that the Mayweather-McGregor fight was fixed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Boxing promoter Barry Gibson was killed after he revealed that the Mayweather-McGregor fight was going to be fixed.

title: Did Sunlight Form a Cross During the Eclipse?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing sunlight forming the shape of a cross during the August 2017 eclipse is not a genuine photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows rays of lights in the shape of a cross during the August 2017 eclipse.

title: Did Antifa Announce a Plan to Protest the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally in 2018?
subtitle: Members of the "alt-right" have dared antifa to protest the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, but no anti-fascist group has announced such a plan.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Antifa activists announced in August 2017 that they would protest the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally in 2018.

title: Solar Eclipse in the South Pacific
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a solar eclipse over the South Pacific is a composite image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph show a solar eclipse over the ocean in the South Pacific.

title: Counter-Demonstrators Didn't Have Permits in Charlottesville?
subtitle: Counter-demonstrators had permits for two parks, while the "alt-right" was granted an injunction allowing them to use Emancipation Park.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Counter-demonstrators in Charlottesville did not have the appropriate permits to protest a white supremacist rally.

title: 'Boy Shot by Stepfather' Appeal
subtitle: Old hoax holds that a every time a particular message is shared, a company will donate money towards the medical care of a 14-year-old boy shot by his stepfather.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Every time a particular message is shared, a company will donate money towards the medical care of a 14-year-old boy who was shot by his stepfather while he was defending his 2-year-old sister from rape.

title: Did a Former BBC Investigative Journalist Die in 'Suspicious Circumstances'?
subtitle: Liz MacKean fought to reveal historical child sexual abuse, but there is no evidence that she died from anything other than natural causes.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The death of former BBC investigative reporter Liz MacKean was "suspicious."

title: Solar Eclipse from Space
subtitle: A supposed photograph of a solar eclipse taken from space was actually a digital creation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph captures a solar eclipse as seen from space.

title: Is This 'Antifa Manual' Real?
subtitle: "Those who can't work will be provided a stipend and unlimited supply of opiates, marijuana, meth and cocaine to occupy their free time."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Images show a genuine Antifa manual created and distributed by the anti-fascist group.

title: Did a Law Professor Assert That a Solar Eclipse Was 'Racist'?
subtitle: Two conservative web sites grossly misrepresented the content of a lyric essay in The Atlantic magazine.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Law professor Alice Ristroph wrote in the Atlantic magazine that the 2017 solar eclipse, its path, or those who viewed it, were "racist."

title: Is Pepsi Contaminated with HIV?
subtitle: Rumors that a worker at a Pepsi or Frooti plant contaminated those beverage products by injecting HIV-infected blood into them are old and  false.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A worker at a Pepsi or Frooti plant has contaminated those beverage products by injecting HIV-infected blood into them.

title: Scientists Miscalculate, Solar Eclipse Actually Next Year?
subtitle: A false article convinced some that NASA scientists miscalculated the solar eclipse date and were off by one year.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: NASA scientists "forgot to carry the one," miscalculating the date of an August 2017 solar eclipse by one year.

title: Maxine Waters Fears a Trump-led War After Nuclear Attack by North Korea?
subtitle: Right-wing Facebook pages created a meme containing a fabricated quote attributed to the Democratic Congresswoman.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Maxine Waters said she fears that Donald Trump would lead the United States into a war, if North Korea launched a nuclear attack.

title: Are These Rainbow Mountains Real?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a rainbow-colored mountain range in California was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a rainbow-colored mountain range in California.

title: Are Refugee Tuberculosis Rates in San Diego 'More Than 100 Times Greater' Than the National Average?
subtitle: A California scientist told us that Breitbart's story on his team's 2013 study was "not an accurate use" of the information.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A study determined that the active tuberculosis incidence rate for refugees in San Diego was more than 100 times higher than it was in the rest of the United States.

title: Were Police Told to 'Stand Down' Amid Violence in Charlottesville?
subtitle: Despite rumors, there was no "stand-down" order issued to police overseeing a white supremacist rally turned deadly in Virginia.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Police in Charlottesville were issued a "stand down" order and told to let violence happen.

title: Is This Steve Bannon with a Bloody Lip?
subtitle: An image of Steve Bannon with a bloody lip was a creatively edited - but convincing - photograph from a satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Steve Bannon with a bloody lip.

title: Is This a Snapshot of Freddie Mercury Putting on Makeup?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Queen singer Freddie Mercury applying intricate maquillage was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Queen singer Freddie Mercury applying intricate face makeup.

title: 'Antifa' Flyers Call For the Murder of White Children?
subtitle: Flyers calling for the murder of white children were not created or distributed by an anti-fascist group.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The anti-fascist group Antifa created and distributed a flyer calling for the murder of white children.

title: Was White Supremacist Who Killed Protester a Democrat Who Visited Obama in Oval Office?
subtitle: Fake news web sites floated an incoherent story alleging that a white supremacist arrested for vehicular attack in Charlottesville, Virginia is a Democrat who met with Obama in the White House.
author: David Emery
statement: A man who was either the organizer of the 2017 white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Virginia or the driver of the car that ran down protesters, killing one, is a Democrat who was photographed meeting President Obama in the Oval Office.

title: Is the Accused Charlottesville Killer an 'Anti-Trump Leftist' Supported by Clinton, Soros?
subtitle: Various right-leaning sources immediately - and inaccurately - identified the driver of the vehicle that plowed through a crowd of counter-protesters in Charlottesville as a "radical leftist."
author: David Emery
statement: The driver of the vehicle that killed one person and injured more than a dozen others at the Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, is a known "radical leftist" supported by Hillary Clinton and George Soros.

title: Tainted Buffet at Jackson Strip Club Blamed After Severe Diarrhea Incident on Stage?
subtitle: A story about a tainted buffet and a "severe diarrhea incident" at a strip club originated as fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A "severe diarrhea incident" struck a strip club, affecting dancers and patrons who consumed tainted buffet food.

title: Trump Photographed with Charlottesville White Supremacist?
subtitle: A doctored photograph appearing to show Trump posing with a white supremacist garnered attention on social media following a neo-Nazi rally that left one woman dead.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Trump with "Millennial Matt," an alt-right figure involved in the white nationalist march in Charlottesville.

title: Did an 'Illegal' Immigrant Brag About Voting Five Times for Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: A conservative web site mischaracterized the case against Rosa Ortega, who voted illegally -- and allegedly for Republican candidates.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: An 'illegal immigrant' was convicted of voter fraud for voting multiple times for Hillary Clinton.

title: Antifa Member Photographed Beating Police Officer?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing an Antifa member hitting a police officer has been digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an Antifa member hitting a police officer.

title: Did Barack Obama Order Harvard to Reverse His Daughter Malia's Suspension?
subtitle: A satirical web site publishes the latest in a series of entirely false stories about Malia Obama.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2017, Harvard University reversed its suspension of Malia Obama, after an intervention by Barack Obama.

title: Does This Photograph Show a KKK Member Treated by Black Hospital Staff?
subtitle: A photograph capturing a KKK member being treated by an all-black emergency room staff was part of an advertising series, not a genuine historical image.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a KKK member being treated by an all-black emergency room staff.

title: Did President Donald Trump Steal His 'Fire and Fury' Line from a Comic Book Villain?
subtitle: Despite rumors to the contrary, Trump's comments about North Korea were not plagiarized from a Captain America comic book character.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump plagiarized his "fire and fury" comment from Captain America comic book villain Red Skull.

title: Did President Donald Trump Target a Democratic State Senator's Family for Deportation?
subtitle: A dubious right-wing web site makes a false claim about the family of California lawmaker Kevin de Leon.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: President Donald Trump has targeted the family of California Senate President Pro Tempore Kevin de Leon for deportation.

title: Has NASA Called the Image of the Virgin of Guadalupe 'Living'?
subtitle: Scientists from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration have not announced that "Our Lady of Guadalupe", a religious artifact, is alive.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In August 2017, NASA scientists declared that Mexico's "Our Lady of Guadalupe" artifact is "living."

title: Is Nancy Pelosi in Critical Condition After a Head-On Drunk Driving Accident?
subtitle: A hoax news article falsely reports that the House Minority Leader was involved in a collision with a bus in Los Angeles.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi was seriously injured in a drunk driving collision.

title: Obama Left Trump a White House Full of Roaches?
subtitle: Various outlets misleadingly quoted a 2013 article to blame President Obama for a 2017 roach infestation that likely never occurred.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump inherited a White House infested with cockroaches due to the careless behavior of his predecessor, Barack Obama.

title: Foreign Call Centers Must Transfer Customers to U.S. Reps?
subtitle: U.S. companies operating overseas telephone service centers do not have to transfer customers to representatives in the U.S. upon request.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. companies operating overseas telephone service centers must transfer customers to U.S.-based representatives upon request.

title: Did Fukushima Officials Warn that Humans Should Never Eat Fish Again?
subtitle: The claim comes from a 2013 blog post about preparing for the collapse of civilization, but it is just as wrong now as it was then.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Fukushima scientists have warned that fish in the Pacific Ocean will never again be safe for human consumption due to radioactive contamination

title: Was Sasha Obama Murdered in a Drive-By Shooting?
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that the daughter of former president Barack Obama had been killed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sasha Obama was killed in a drive-by shooting in July 2017.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Huge Blue Whale Under a Rowboat?
subtitle: An image showing a blue whale dwarfing a rowboat under which it appears to be swimming is actually a piece of digital artwork.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a blue whale swimming beneath a row boat.

title: Mennonite Biker Gangs Clash with Hells Angels at Sturgis?
subtitle: A satirical article about a Mennonite biker gang was mistaken by some for real news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Mennonite biker gang clashed with the Hells Angels at the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally in 2017.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Passes on Crown as She Retires?
subtitle: A fake news story reported that Elizabeth II would be retiring and passing the crown to her grandson, Prince William.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Elizabeth II is abdicating her throne and giving the crown to Prince William

title: Pope Francis Kisses David Rockefeller's Hand?
subtitle: A photograph of Pope Francis greeting Holocaust survivors is part of a meme containing the baseless claim that the spiritual leader is kissing the hand of a purported architect of a New World Order.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Pope Francis kissing the hand of David Rockefeller, Henry Kissinger, or one of many other people targeted by conspiracy theorists as being part of a vast global conspiracy.

title: Did John McCain Accidentally Vote 'No' on Affordable Care Act Repeal?
subtitle: Stories that the Arizona senator admitted that his "no" vote to repeal parts of the ACA was an accident are just fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator John McCain said that he accidentally voted "no" on repealing the Affordable Care Act.

title: Did Russian Scientists Discover a 'Cure' for Homosexuality?
subtitle: Online reports of the discovery by Russian medical researchers of a "cure" or "vaccine" for homosexuality are fake news.
author: David Emery
statement: Researchers at the Russian Institute for Medical Science discovered a new vaccine that may "prevent" or "cure" homosexuality in humans.

title: Malia Obama Busted Buying 6 Pounds of Marijuana in Chicago?
subtitle: A fake news site photoshopped Malia Obama into an image from a 2013 news report about dogfighting to falsely claim she was arrested in Chicago.
author: Kim LaCapria
