statement: Malia Obama was arrested while attempting to purchase marijuana in Chicago.

title: Did Justin Bieber and Katy Perry Say Pedophiles Run the Music Industry?
subtitle: Both pop singers were targeted by fake news stories reporting that they had exposed a pedophile ring in control of the music business.
author: David Emery
statement: Justin Bieber and Katy Perry made public statements warning that the music industry is run by pedophiles.

title: Online Store Selling 'Horse Burkas' for Muslim Customers?
subtitle: A satirical web site poked fun at Islamophobia by claiming fly protection gear for horses was religious clothing.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An online store is offering "horse burkas" so Muslim equestrians can clothe their pets in keeping with religious custom.

title: Did 62 degreesC Temperatures in Kuwait Cause Trees to Burst into Flames?
subtitle: Despite a series of images showing melted street lights and trees on fire, the temperature in Kuwait has not reached 143.6 degreesF.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The temperature hit a record 62 degreesC (143.6 degreesF) in Kuwait in July 2017, causing several trees to burst into flames.

title: Starbucks Dreamer Day
subtitle: Starbucks Dreamer Day was a hoax concocted on 4chan's /pol/ forum as a way to drive a wedge between liberal groups.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Starbucks is giving a discount to undocumented immigrants on 11 August 2017.

title: Extraterrestrial Contact Law
subtitle: No federal law actually prohibits U.S. citizens from having contact with extraterrestrial beings.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A federal law prohibits U.S. citizens from having contact with extraterrestrial beings.

title: Did Starbucks Refuse Free Product to Marines Serving in Iraq?
subtitle: A rumor that Starbucks refused free product to Marines serving in Iraq, saying the company didn't support the war or anyone taking part in it, is both old and false.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Starbucks refused free product to Marines serving in Iraq, saying the company didn't support the war or anyone taking part in it.

title: Did a Man Die After 'Holding in Farts' at His Girlfriend's House?
subtitle: A satirical web site republished in English a fake story that had appeared in both Spanish and Portuguese.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A man in Argentina died from peritonitis after holding in gas during a visit with his girlfriend's mother.

title: Are Charitable NGOs Trafficking People Across the Mediterranean to Europe?
subtitle: A group of white nationalists afloat at sea claims that non-governmental organizations like Doctors Without Borders are involved in human trafficking.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: NGOs like Doctors Without Borders are profiting from human smuggling in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: McGregor vs. Mayweather Fight Called Off After Mayweather's Arrest?
subtitle: An old news report about Floyd Mayweather's 2010 arrest appeared with a misleading title in July 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The August 2017 fight between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Conor McGregor was called off after the former was arrested in July 2017.

title: Does Pepto-Bismol Contain Xylitol, Which is Harmful to Dogs?
subtitle: Xylitol, a sugar substitute, is harmful to dogs, but Pepto-Bismol does not contain it.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2017, the makers of Pepto-Bismol added xylitol, a sugar substitute harmful to dogs, as an ingredient

title: Does This Video Show Lightning Striking a River and Sparking an Explosion?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a bolt of lightning striking a river actually captures a controlled explosion by an engineering company.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a bolt of lightning striking a river, sparking a large explosion.

title: Did Facebook Shut Down an AI Experiment Because Chatbots Developed Their Own Language?
subtitle: Facebook's artificial intelligence scientists were purportedly dismayed when the bots they created began conversing in their own private language.
author: David Emery
statement: Concerned artificial intelligence researchers hurriedly abandoned an experimental chatbot program after they realized that the bots were inventing their own language.

title: Will 2017's Perseid Meteor Shower Be the Brightest in Recorded Human History?
subtitle: The reason the web site that originally made this claim cites zero sources is likely due to the fact that there is a complete lack of factual information to support it.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The 2017 Perseid Meteor shower will be the brightest meteor shower in recorded human history.

title: Rats Per Capita
subtitle: Do major cities harbor rodent populations equivalent to one rat per person?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Major cities harbor rodent populations equivalent to one rat per person.

title: Was a Giant System of Roots Discovered Below the Devil's Tower Rock Formation?
subtitle: A Facebook page reported that Devil's Tower, a large rock formation in Wyoming, was actually the remnants of a giant tree.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A large root system was discovered below Devil's Tower in Wyoming.

title: FBI Warning to 'All Americans' About Poisoned Produce
subtitle: An online article misleadingly suggested that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had warned Americans to be alert of grocery store produce possibly sprayed with poison.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The FBI has warned all Americans to be cautious of produce at grocery stores that might have been sprayed with poison.

title: Did John McCain's Vote Stop the ACA Repeal for the 2017 Fiscal Year?
subtitle: A theory spread online overstated the consequences of the Arizona senator's July 2017 vote to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. John McCain's vote against a "skinny repeal' health care proposal stopped attempts to repeal the Affordable Care Act for FY `17.

title: Does NASA Data Show That Global Warming Isn't Causing a Sea Level Rise?
subtitle: Dubious web sites generously provided the Internet with textbook examples of both cherry-picked data and the shameless conflation of weather with climate.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A recent hiatus in sea level rise conflicts with the scientific consensus regarding global warming.

title: Did Somali Muslims Take Over a Small Tennessee Town?
subtitle: A hyperpartisan web site offered up a patchwork of half-truths and hyperbole to sow fear and hatred of refugees.
author: David Emery
statement: Somali Muslim refugees "took over" the small town of Shelbyville, Tennessee and targeted local Christians with "violent Islamic crimes".

title: Is Former 'Price is Right' Host Bob Barker Dead at Age 94?
subtitle: The former game show host suffered a head injury in June 2017, but he did not die.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 'The Price is Right' host Bob Barker died in July 2017, after falling and hitting his head at his home.

title: Is This a Russian Pilot Flying Under a Bridge in 1965?
subtitle: On June 4, 1965, the military pilot Valentin Privalov flew this plane under the central span of the bridge across the Ob River.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Russian pilot flying under a bridge in 1965.

title: Scaramucci Posts Nude Photos of His Wife as Revenge for Divorce?
subtitle: A satire site used news of disarray at the White House to push a false story about the new communications director.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Anthony Scaramucci posted nude photographs of his wife in order to get revenge for her filing for divorce.

title: German Tank Shot Down UFOs?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing kill markings that indicate flying saucers on a WWII-era anti-aircraft gun has been digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows UFO "kill markings" on the side of a German World War II anti-aircraft gun.

title: Was a Musician Deported for Attacking a Los Angeles Street Vendor?
subtitle: A dubious web site exaggerated the outcome of musician Carlos Hakas' encounter with elote seller Benjamin Ramirez.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A musician was deported to Argentina after he was caught on video knocking over a vendor's cart on a Los Angeles street.

title: Was Rat Meat Sold as Chicken Wings?
subtitle: Reports that a large quantity of rat meat was furtively sold as 'chicken wings' in the U.S. originated as fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 300,000 pounds of rat meat disguised as chicken wings were sold in the U.S.

title: Was Kirk Cameron Diagnosed With a Rare Form of Leprosy?
subtitle: A shocking report about the former child actor was just another hoax from a well-known purveyor of satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Kirk Cameron has contracted an extremely rare form of leprosy.

title: Lion Snuggles With Cat?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a house cat cuddling with a lion was digitally altered for an advertising campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a house cat cuddling with a lion.

title: 'Popcorn Carnival' WhatsApp Hoax
subtitle: Another WhatsApp malware hoax is circulating, this time warning that a "Carnaval de las palomitas" or "Popcorn Carnival" video could "hack" your phone.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A WhatsApp video called "Carnaval de las palomitas" or "Popcorn Carnival" is hacking users' phones.

title: Is this a Kayaker Paddling Through a Pod of Orca Whales?
subtitle: A painting by a Canadian artist is often mistaken for a photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a kayak near a pod of orca whales.

title: John Lennon Played Guitar with Che Guevara?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the English musician and the Argentinian-Cuban revolutionary playing music together was digitally altered.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows John Lennon and Che Guevara playing guitar together.

title: The Kayak and the Whale
subtitle: A photograph showing a kayaker crossing the gaping jaws of a humpback whale is a digital fabrication.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a kayaker paddling across a humpback whale's huge open mouth.

title: Is Snapchat Building a Facial Recognition Database for the Feds?
subtitle: Online conspiracy theorists claim Snapchat's image filter feature called "Lenses" is covertly amassing a database of users' faces to share with law enforcement agencies.
author: David Emery
statement: Snapchat is using its "Lenses" photo and video filtering technology to create a facial recognition database for use by law enforcement agencies.

title: Did The Federal Bureau of Investigation Seize Smashed Hard Drives From Rep. Wasserman-Schultz's Home?
subtitle: A dubious web site contradicted its own source on an alleged seizure concerning the lawmaker's former aide.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: FBI agents raided Rep. Debbie Wasserman-Schultz's home and seized smashed computer hard drives.

title: Is This 'Walking' Protein What Happiness Really Looks Like?
subtitle: A computer-generated visualization of a kinesin protein has been circulating on the internet for years affixed with descriptions that convey varying levels of inaccuracy.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A viral animation shows a myosin molecule transporting endorphins, which can be thought of as a visual representation of the feeling of happiness.

title: If You See This on a Walmart Receipt, Should You Call the Police?
subtitle: Reports that shoppers are falling prey to a Walmart "phantom charge" of $10 that has randomly been appearing on receipts for a decade are untrue.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Walmart has been adding a "phantom charge" of $10 to shoppers' bills for 10 years.

title: Tom Hanks Wears Political T-Shirt?
subtitle: A July 2017 Facebook post is the latest to digitally add political slogans to a photograph of the actor.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A July 2017 Facebook post shows Tom Hanks wearing a t-shirt bearing a number of liberal slogans.

title: Did CNN Bury the Justine Damond Story Because She Was a White Woman Killed By a 'Black Islamic Immigrant From Somalia'?
subtitle: CNN, along with many other major media outlets all across the world, has covered the Damond shooting in great detail.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: CNN (and other news media outlets) buried the Justine Damond shooting story because she was white and the officer who shot her was a black Muslim immigrant.

title: Adam Sandler Death Hoax
subtitle: Adam Sandler did not die at age 52.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Adam Sandler has died at age 52.

title: Did Muslim Federal Judge 'Mahal al Alallaha-Smith' Rule that Two Items of Sharia Law Are Now Legal?
subtitle: An article reporting that a federal judge had implemented "sharia law" in the United States is fake news originally posted on a satire site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Muslim federal judge has implemented "two items" of sharia law in the United States.

title: Did Anthony Scaramucci Post a Sexually Explicit Tweet in 2009?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a missive from White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci posted a sexually explicit tweet in 2009.

title: Did a Student Break Both Arms Jumping Off a Building for a Science Project?
subtitle: A photograph appears to show a student who literally researched the question "jumping off buildings -- how high is too high?"
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a middle school student with two broken arms next to a science fair project about jumping off tall buildings.

title: Burundanga/Scopolamine Warning
subtitle: Criminals in the U.S. are not using burundanga-soaked business cards to incapacitate their victims, despite a recurrent warning.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Criminals in the U.S. are using burundanga-soaked business cards to incapacitate their victims.

title: Was a Holistic Doctor Killed by Police for Working Against 'Big Pharma'?
subtitle: There's no evidence that Justine Damond was targeted for her healing practices.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Justine Damond became one of dozens of holistic doctors fighting "Big Pharma" who suspiciously died.

title: Is This a Whale in a Venice Canal?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a large whale swimming through a canal in Venice was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a large whale swimming through a canal in Venice.

title: Waste Management to Offer Dead Body Pickup Service in Response to Proposed Health Care Changes?
subtitle: Reports that a waste company will be offering curbside dead body pickup service to offset
deaths originated as satire.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A waste company will be offering curbside dead body pickup service to offset

title: NASA Confirms 15 Days of Darkness?
subtitle: Reports that NASA says that the Earth will experience more than two straight weeks of darkness at any point are fake (but recurrent) news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: NASA has confirmed the Earth will experience 15 straight days of darkness.

title: Were Chester Bennington and Chris Cornell Murdered to Cover Up a Pedophile Ring?
subtitle: A disreputable website claimed the deceased singers from Linkin Park and Soundgarden were murdered because they were about to expose a list of pedophiles.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Chester Bennington and Chris Cornell were murdered because they were about to reveal a ring of pedophiles.

title: Is This a 'League of German Girls Inspection' During World War II?
subtitle: A still from the movie
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph taken during World War II shows members of the League of German Girls during a uniform inspection.

title: Miranda Cosgrove Arrested for Prostitution?
subtitle: A parody video used logos and graphics from legitimate news sources to make a story about the actress's arrest seem believable.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Miranda Cosgrove was arrested for prostitution in July 2017.

title: Did John McCain Admit He Was a 'War Criminal'?
subtitle: Rumors that the Arizona senator admitted that he was a 'war criminal' and that was he pardoned by President Nixon for his crimes are not true.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Senator John McCain admitted that he was a 'war criminal' and was pardoned by President Nixon for his crimes.

title: Did President Trump Send Feds to Raid Islamberg, New York?
subtitle: A blog fabricated a story about the tiny hamlet - after a series of threats and demonstrations targeted people living there.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In July 2017, President Trump dispatched federal investigators to the hamlet of Islamberg, New York, where they uncovered "America's worst nightmare".

title: Mother and 3 Kids Found Dead, Dad Arrested
subtitle: The same fake news report of an estranged husband who murdered his wife and three children has been spread via multiple domains to target varying locales throughout the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An estranged husband named Brandon Dugan recently murdered his wife and three children.

title: Did Barack Obama Say 'The Country Owes Me a Debt of Gratitude'?
subtitle: Unreliable web sites stoked partisan rancor by attributing a fake, self-aggrandizing quote to former President Barack Obama.
author: David Emery
statement: Former President Obama said the U.S. owes him a "debt of gratitude" for his leadership.

title: John McCain No Longer a Senator?
subtitle: A 2016 opinion piece was plagiarized in July 2017, complete with a click-bait headline.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: John McCain was no longer a U.S. Senator as of July 2017.

title: Did DJ Khaled Break a Horse's Back By Riding on it?
subtitle: A fabricated story lead to widespread unfounded criticism of the hip-hop producer.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: DJ Khaled broke a horse's back while riding on it, causing the horse to be put down.

title: Can U.S. Birth Certificates Unlock Hidden 'Strawman' Financial Accounts?
subtitle: A specious theory that the U.S. has turned citizens into "collateral" was developed by a convicted forger with ties to white nationalists.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Americans can use their birth certificates to access secret "strawman" funds.

title: Body of a Waitress Pulled from the Clintons' Burned-out Guest House?
subtitle: A satirical web site published yet another fake story linking the Clintons to a fabricated death.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In July 2017, the body of a 26-year-old woman was found in the burned-out remains of a property owned by Bill and Hillary Clinton.

title: Donald Trump Wrote that Being an Atheist Gives Him a Business Edge?
subtitle: A fake Art of the Deal quote was shared as meme in mid-2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Trump's 1987 book

title: Did Chelsea Clinton Say Female Genital Mutilation Has 'Health Benefits'?
subtitle: An April 2017 tweet in which Chelsea Clinton supposedly defended the cultural practice of "genital cutting" was a hoax.
author: David Emery
statement: Chelsea Clinton tweeted that "genital mutilation" is a culturally loaded, racist term, and that the practice of "genital cutting" has many health benefits.

title: Is This President Trump With a Controversial Russian Lawyer?
subtitle: A photograph of the president posing with a brunette woman doesn't depict Kremlin-linked attorney Natalia Veselnitskaya.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows President Trump posing beside Kremlin-linked lawyer Natalia Veselnitskaya.

title: Did George Orwell's '1984' Predict the Power of Smartphones?
subtitle: A widely-shared quotation comes from a 2014 theater adaptation, not the original 1949 novel.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A line from George Orwell's novel 1984 predicts the power of smartphones.

title: Dead Bigfoot Confirmed at Elephant Butte Lake, New Mexico?
subtitle: A "prank" Facebook post claimed that Bigfoot was found dead on a lakeshore.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The corpse of a bigfoot was found at Elephant Butte Lake.

title: Did a Former Haitian Official Commit Suicide Before Clinton Testimony?
subtitle: After Klaus Eberwein's suicide, inevitable links to the "Clinton Body Count" rumor emerged, but without clear merit.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Former Haitian official Klaus Oberwein died in a suspicious suicide days before he was scheduled to testify against either Hillary Clinton or the Clinton Foundation.

title: Margarine vs. Butter: What's Better?
subtitle: We compiled a comparison chart for various brands of margarine as they were then formulated.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Margarine was originally manufactured to fatten turkeys.

title: Clinton/Lynch Pilot Breaks His Silence on What Was Said?
subtitle: Reports that a pilot named Dimitri Noonan broke his silence about a secret meeting between Bill Clinton, Loretta Lynch, and Paul Ryan are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pilot Dimitri Noonan revealed information about a secret meeting between Bill Clinton, Loretta Lynch, and Paul Ryan.

title: Was George Soros an SS Officer or Nazi Collaborator During World War II?
subtitle: Despite politically-motivated rumors to the contrary, billionaire leftist George Soros was neither in the SS nor a Nazi collaborator in the Second World War.
author: David Emery
statement: During World War II, George Soros was a member of the SS (a Nazi paramilitary organization) or a Nazi collaborator who helped confiscate property from Jews.

title: Do You Know the Danger of  Turning on the A/C After Starting the Engine?
subtitle: Contrary to online scarelore, automobile components do not emit dangerous levels of cancer-causing benzene fumes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Automobile components emit dangerous levels of cancer-causing benzene fumes.

title: Is This a Real Photograph of Donald Trump's Older Sons?
subtitle: A cartoonish photograph purportedly showing presidential sons Eric and Donald Trump, Jr. was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Eric and Donald Trump Jr., sons of President Donald Trump.

title: Is Hobby Lobby Closing All Their Stores?
subtitle: The recirculation of a several-year-old, misleadingly headlined news story has spread the mistaken belief that the Hobby Lobby chain is closing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Hobby Lobby chain is closing all its stores in protest over a federal contraceptives mandate.

title: CIA Agent Confesses on Deathbed: 'We Blew Up WTC7 on 9/11'?
subtitle: Reports that a dying CIA agent confessed to blowing up WTC Building 7 on 9/11 through controlled demolition are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A dying CIA agent confessed to blowing up WTC Building 7 on 9/11 through controlled demolition.

title: Peer-Reviewed Study Proves All Recent Global Warming Fabricated by Climatologists?
subtitle: A blog post, even if you like it and it is presented in downloadable PDF form, is not a peer-reviewed study.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A peer-reviewed study has found evidence that nearly all of global warming has been fabricated by climate scientists.

title: Was Malia Obama Fired from an Internship at the Spanish Embassy?
subtitle: Fake news web sites reported that the former President Obama's elder daughter was terminated for smoking pot on the job.
author: David Emery
statement: Malia Obama was fired from an internship at the United States Embassy in Spain (not the Spanish Embassy) after being caught smoking pot on the job.

title: Was James Comey Taken from His Home by Feds at 3 A.M.?
subtitle: Articles reporting that former FBI Director James Comey was handcuffed and taken into custody by federal agents are fake news.
author: David Emery
statement: Former FBI Director James Comey was handcuffed and taken from his home by federal agents.

title: Did a Woman Come Out of Her Grave and Walk After Being Dead for 3 Years?
subtitle: Tall tales of "walking dead" corpses in Indonesia appear to have been inspired by the unusual funerary practices of the Toraja people of Sulawesi.
author: David Emery
statement: Indonesian villagers performed a rite that brought a dead woman back to life after three years in the grave.

title: Were the Georgia Guidestones Stolen and Taken to New Hampshire?
subtitle: A satirical web site reported that the granite monument disappeared - and then unexpectedly reappeared in another state.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Georgia Guidestones were stolen from their site and then re-erected in New Hampshire.

title: Did Donald Trump Assault a Marine Then Rip Off His Cover?
subtitle: A video of the president picking up and returning a hat was reversed to make it appear as though he had pulled it off a Marine and then tossed it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN aired a video showing President Donald Trump assaulting a Marine and then tearing off his hat.

title: Does Lil' Wayne Have One Month to Live?
subtitle: The rapper has been a frequent subject of hoax stories about a supposed fatal cancer diagnosis.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Lil' Wayne announced that he was diagnosed with skin cancer and has one month to live.

title: Did Muslims Demand Pork-Free Menus?
subtitle: Questionable and clickbait web site completely misrepresented objections to a French mayor's purported push against so-called "alternative menus".
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A 'Muslim figure' threatened to leave the U.S. unless they were provided pork-free menus.

title: Is Pastor and Gospel Singer Don Moen Dead After a Short Illness?
subtitle: A dubious web site falsely reported the death of the Christian Contemporary music artist Don Moen.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In July 2017, Don Moen died of "stomach pain".

title: Are 'Hail Satan' License Plates Now Available in Tennessee?
subtitle: Claims that state lawmakers had passed a bill allowing phrase to appear on license plates originated from a satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tennessee lawmakers passed a bill  approving a "Hail Satan" license plate tag.

title: Was Vladimir Putin Surrounded by Other World Leaders at the G20 Summit?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the Russian president surrounded by political counterparts is not real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Russia's president, Vladimir Putin, surrounded by other world leaders.

title: Did CNN Use the Same Girl in Three Different Refugee Crisis Pictures?
subtitle: A variation on the 'crisis actor' conspiracy theory holds that CNN used photographs of the same girl to represent three different refugee crises.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: CNN was caught using photographs of the same girl to represent three different refugee crises.

title: Yellowstone Lava Geyser
subtitle: A report of lava gushing out of geysers at Yellowstone National Park following a string of nearby earthquakes is fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows lava that came gushing out of geysers at Yellowstone National Park following a string of nearby earthquakes.

title: Steelers QB Ben Roethlisberger Loses Multiple Fingers in 4th of July Firework Accident?
subtitle: Reports that Pittsburgh quarterback Ben Roethlisberger lost several fingers in a 4th of July fireworks accident are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger lost several fingers in a fireworks accident on 4 July 2017.

title: Atlanta Lottery Winner Dies After Gold Plating His Testicles?
subtitle: Reports that a lottery winner died after gold-plating his genitals are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A lottery winner died after attempting to gold-plate his testicles.

title: Did Poland's First Lady Refuse to Shake President Trump's Hand?
subtitle: A short viral video clip was cut off before showing that Agata Kornhauser-Duda did indeed greet the United States president.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: At an event in Warsaw on 6 July 2017, Polish First Lady Agata Kornhauser-Duda refused to shake hands with Donald Trump.

title: Nancy Pelosi's Daughters Arrested for Trafficking Cocaine?
subtitle: Fake news sites reported that the House minority leader's daughters were caught attempting to smuggle cocaine across the Mexico border.
author: David Emery
statement: Two of U.S. House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi's daughters were arrested for trafficking drugs, then turned state's evidence against their mother.

title: Cash Back Scam
subtitle: Can store cashiers steal from customers by secretly initiating cash back requests and then pocketing the money?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Store cashiers commonly steal from customers by secretly initiating cash back requests and then pocketing the money.

title: Is This Giant Spider Real?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly shows a 'Giant Hawaiian Cane Spider' on the side of a house.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a Giant Hawaiian Cane Spider on the side of a house.

title: Did Buzz Aldrin Say Not Punching Donald Trump Was His Greatest Achievement?
subtitle: Rumors that the astronaut had to restrain himself from hitting the President of the United States were greatly exaggerated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Buzz Aldrin said that his greatest achievement was successfully restraining himself from punching President Trump.

title: Is This Palm-Sized Bunny Real?
subtitle: A handful of furry fun ... if true.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a palm-sized rabbit.

title: Do Yellowstone Earthquakes Foretell a Coming Cataclysm?
subtitle: Does recent unusual geothermic and seismic activity in Yellowstone Park foretell a coming cataclysmic event in the area?
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Recent seismic activity in Yellowstone Park portends a coming cataclysmic volcanic eruption.

title: Is This Muhammad Ali with a Young Michael Jackson?
subtitle: A photograph purporting to show Ali with Jackson actually shows the boxer with Tiger Smalls.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows boxer Muhammad Ali with musician Michael Jackson.

title: Chumlee Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that the 'Pawn Stars' personality has passed away are a hoax.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Chumlee from 'Pawn Stars' has passed away.

title: President Trump Closed U.S. Airspace for the 4th of July?
subtitle: A fake news article reported that President Trump had shut down American airports on 4 July 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump shut down American airports on 4 July 2017.

title: Kid Rock Death Hoax
subtitle: A Facebook "prank" claimed that musician Kid Rock had passed away in July 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Kid Rock died in July 2017.

title: Investigation Proves Starbucks Beverages Contain Feces?
subtitle: An imprecise test that appeared to show Starbucks drinks were contaminated prompted internet hysteria and widespread baseless claims.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: An investigation has proven the presence of feces in Starbucks beverages.

title: Is This What Police Uniforms in Norway Look Like?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a group of Norwegian police officers in skintight uniforms was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Norwegian police officers in their skintight Summer uniforms.

title: Giant Pythons Discovered in Salt Creek in Brown and Monroe County Indiana?
subtitle: A story claiming that giant pythons were discovered in an Indiana creek originated on a "prank" web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Giant pythons were discovered in a small creek in Indiana.

title: Boeing 797
subtitle: Viral image dating from 2006 purports to show a new Boeing "797" blended-wing airliner.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a new Boeing 797 blended-wing airliner.

title: Mass Grave of Dozens of Tortured Black Men Found in Deceased KKK Leader's Estate?
subtitle: A horrifying tale of racially-motivated violence originated with a fake news site.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The bodies of dozens of black men were found on the estate of a former Ku Klux Klan member.

title: Did Germany's Black Forest Cause 15,000 Missing Person Cases Last Year?
subtitle: An inaccurate meme claimed that 15,000 people went missing in the forest that is thought to be the inspiration for many Grimm Brothers tales.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Germany's Black Forest caused 15,000 missing person cases last year.

title: Did Adolf Hitler Say He Would Start World War III After His Death?
subtitle: A quote attributed to the Nazi dictator about the start of World War III is a hoax perpetuated by people not inclined to check for themselves.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A book about Hitler quotes him as saying that he would start a third world war - after his death.

title: Does a KFC in Dearborn, Michigan Abide by 'Sharia Law'?
subtitle: A photograph purporting to show a fast food restaurant in an American city was actually taken in Saudi Arabia.
author: Dan Evon
statement: KFC in Dearborn uses separate lines for men and women, a menu written in Arabic, and abides by Shariah Law.

title: Whataburger Closing Its Doors?
subtitle: A "prank" Facebook post fooled many into thinking the restaurant chain was closing down.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The restaurant chain Whataburger announced that it was closing its doors.

title: Did Kellyanne Conway Try to Require NBA Champions to Visit the White House?
subtitle: A "news/satire hybrid platform" fabricated an angry statement by Conway about the Golden State Warriors.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Kellyanne Conway said she would 'make sure' that the Golden State Warriors were required to visit the White House after winning the NBA title.

title: Was a Chinese Man Arrested in New York for Selling Hot Dogs Made from Dog Meat?
subtitle: A web site known for bizarre, fake stories has published yet another hoax, this time with a side of racial animus.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2017, police arrested a 57-year-old Chinese immigrant for selling dog meat in New York City.

title: Bull Shark Spotted in Kentucky Lake?
subtitle: A fabricated report concerning a nine-foot-long bull shark allegedly found in Kentucky Lake originated on a do-it-yourself fake news web site.
author: David Emery
statement: A nine-foot-long bull shark was found in Kentucky Lake.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Seal Hugging a Beluga Whale?
subtitle: Are these mortal enemies in the food chain really making nice with each other?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows seal hugging a beluga whale.

title: Did Brad Pitt Say That 'Elite Hollywood Pedophiles Control America'?
subtitle: A hoax article appeared to report that the actor made shocking claims about the nature of show business.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Brad Pitt said that "elite Hollywood pedophiles" control the United States.

title: Do Women Retain DNA From Every Man They Have Ever Slept With?
subtitle: This claim, like the microchimerism the viral article responsible for it purports to describe, is an incongruous mixture of information whose ultimate purpose remains unclear.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Women absorb and retain DNA from every man they have had sex with.

title: Is Netflix Rebooting the 'Addams Family?' Series?
subtitle: An unofficial fan-made trailer was mistaken by some viewers as a genuine teaser for a new Netflix series.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix released a teaser trailer for a reboot of 'The Addams Family' in April 2017.

title: Saltwater Crocodile Captured in Long Island Sound Near Bridgeport?
subtitle: A Facebook "prank" fooled many people into believing that a saltwater crocodile was captured in Connecticut.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 21-foot saltwater crocodile was captured in Connecticut after killing two people.

title: Did Police Find a Baby Alive, 12 Days After a London Tower Block Fire?
subtitle: A cruel hoax fabricated the rescue of a baby from Grenfell Tower in London.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A baby was found alive in Grenfell Tower 12 days after a major fire in June 2017.

title: Johnny Depp to Be Charged and Held Under the Patriot Act?
subtitle: Fake news sites reported that actor Johnny Depp, who publicly joked about assassinating President Trump, will be tried as a terrorist enemy combatant.
author: David Emery
statement: Actor Johnny Depp will be charged with conspiracy to assassinate the president and held as a terrorist enemy combatant after joking about assassinating President Trump.

title: Radiohead Fans Left Red-Faced After Applauding Tuning Session?
subtitle: A flower shop's tweet made the hoax go viral.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A news article was published claiming that Radiohead fans were embarrassed after wildly applauded a tuning session.

title: Is Trump's Health Deteriorating as White House Pressures Mount?
subtitle: Claims that President Donald Trump's health was deteriorating due to the stress of his job originated from a satirical page.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Health officials announced in June 2017 that Donald Trump's health is "deteriorating."

title: Fake Amber Alert: Plate 72B 381
subtitle: A long-circulating report of an Amber Alert issued for three-year-old girl taken by man in a grey car is not valid.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An Amber Alert was issued for three-year-old girl taken by man in a grey car.

title: Did 5.7 Million 'Illegal Immigrants' Vote in the 2008 U.S. Election?
subtitle: A controversial 2014 study used survey data to demonstrate that 38 people might have voted as non-citizens in 2008, and web sites subsequently did a lot of extrapolating.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Credible evidence suggests that 5.7 million illegal immigrants might have voted in the 2008 election.

title: Did Senator Elizabeth Warren Perform Nude Pagan Rituals in College?
subtitle: The claim about the Massachusetts Democrat originated with a fake news web site and an unrelated image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Massachusetts) performing a pagan ritual in the nude.

title: Was a Human-Lamb Hybrid Born in South Africa?
subtitle: Sadly, the photographs just showed a deformed stillborn lamb.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A half-human, half-lamb was born in South Africa.

title: Did the U.S. Government Pay for Mitch McConnell's Polio Care in the 1940s?
subtitle: Partisan web sites misrepresent the source of funding for the Republican senator's care as an infant in Alabama.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The U.S. government funded Mitch McConnell's care and rehabilitation when he had polio as a child.

title: Did a Seagull Rip Offa  Man's Testicle as He Sunbathed Naked?
subtitle: Harrowing stories about hapless male sunbathers attacked by predatory sea birds.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A nude sunbather was injured when a predatory bird ripped away one of his testicles.

title: Were 'Steel Barrel Graves' Uncovered on the Clinton Estate?
subtitle: A satirical web site adds to the archive of distasteful fake stories about Bill and Hillary Clinton's "victims."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: 12 barrels containing human remains were found buried on the property of Bill and Hillary Clinton in June 2017.

title: Is This a Real London Underground Sign?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing an sign in the London Underground asking people to wear deodorant because the tube smelled like an old ham was just a joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A sign posted in the London Underground informed passengers that they all smelled and should wear deodorant.

title: Is Cancer Caused by a Deficiency of 'Vitamin B17'?
subtitle: The fact that there is no such thing as vitamin B17 is among the least problematic elements of the myth that it can help remedy cancer.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Cancer is caused by a deficiency of vitamin
a condition that can be remedied with nutritional supplements.

title: Missouri Babysitter on Crystal Meth Eats Toddler?
subtitle: Reports that a meth-addled Missouri babysitter consumed a small child are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A babysitter in Missouri ate a "three-month-old toddler" while she was high on meth.

title: Did Researchers Find a Mummified, Three-Fingered Alien in Nazca, Peru?
subtitle: The purported discovery is backed by individuals with a history of making false, pseudoscientific claims.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A corpse found in Nazca, Peru, is that of an alien.

title: Is This a Picture of Children Giving a Meerkat a Bath?
subtitle: Sometimes even pets uncomplainingly go along with children's play.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of children in South Africa giving a meerkat a bath.

title: Was the Passage of Obamacare Just as Secretive as GOP Efforts to Repeal It?
subtitle: While both bills could be faulted for periods of closed-door negotiations, experts agreed that the secrecy behind the GOP bill to repeal Obamacare was in a league of its own.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Complaints about the lack of transparency behind the creation of a bill to repeal Obamacare were hypocritical because the Democrats were just as bad when they passed Obamacare.

title: Was Whoopi Goldberg Arrested for Running a 'Puppy Mill'?
subtitle: A self-styled "satirical" web site concocted a story about the talk show host being "humiliated" by an FBI investigation.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Whoopi Goldberg was arrested following an FBI investigation into an alleged dog-breeding operation.

title: 'I Secretly Planted a Giant Sequoia Tree in My Mayor's Front Yard'
subtitle: A Redditor's amusing tale of revenge and giant trees was full of holes - and when we got to the root of it, clearly untrue.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Redditor got revenge for the removal of his beloved tree, Clyde, by planting dozens of giant sequoia trees around Redondo Beach.

title: National Gang Week - Bloody Car Seats
subtitle: Gangs are not using bloody car seats to lure female motorists out of their vehicles as part of a 'National Gang Week' activity.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Gangs are using bloody car seats to lure female motorists out of their vehicles as part of a "National Gang Week" activity.

title: Was Obama Silent on Shooting of Republicans, Reemerging Only to Praise a Drug Dealer?
subtitle: The former president called Republican Sen. Jeff Flake to give his best wishes to those targeted in the Virginia shooting, and also recorded a speech honoring musician Jay Z's induction into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former President Barack Obama was silent on a shooting that targeted Republican congressmen but praised a former drug dealer.

title: Is This Beyonce and Jay-Z Holding Their Twin Babies?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the couple holding their new twin babies was digitally altered.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Jay-Z and Beyonce holding their twin babies in June 2017.

title: Did a Retired MI5 Agent Confess to Killing Princess Diana?
subtitle: Even real deathbed confessions are questionable enough.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A retired MI5 agent confessed on his death bed to having assassinated Princess Diana.

title: Should You Call #77 or 112 to Contact the Police in an Emergency?
subtitle: Those numbers work sometimes, but calling #77 or 112 on your cell phone will not necessarily connect you to emergency services no matter where you are.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Calling #77 or 112 on your cell phone will connect you to emergency services no matter where you are.

title: Is This a Road Rage Incident in Russia?
subtitle: What was mistaken by some for a snippet from a real video was actually a viral promotion for television show "Mafiosa".
author: Dan Evon
statement: A dashcam video shows a road rage incident in Russia in which a woman knocks out a much larger man with a roundhouse kick.

title: Did Adolf Hitler Say That Nazis Are 'Mortal Enemies of the Present Capitalist Economic System'?
subtitle: While attributed to Hitler, this
quote actually came from one of Hitler's political rivals.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Adolf Hitler was a
who stated that Nazis

title: Barron Trump Wins National Academic Award?
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that the President's youngest child had won a national academic award.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump's son Barron won a national academic award in June 2017.

title: Was a Human Sacrifice Captured at CERN?
subtitle: A "leaked" video is said to depicts a human sacrifice conducted by researchers at CERN, home of the Large Hadron Collider.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A leaked video depicts a human sacrifice conducted by researchers at the CERN nuclear research facility.

title: Sean Hannity's 'Minor' Bike Accident Today Ends Up Being a Death Sentence?
subtitle: Reports that the Fox News host was about to die after a bicycling accident were fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Fox News host Sean Hannity has died after a bicycling accident

title: Road Runner Tunnel Crash
subtitle: A viral story about a car crashing into a Road Runner cartoon-style painted tunnel seemed too humorous to ruin with fact-checking.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A driver drove into a wall painted to look like a tunnel in a manner similar to Looney Tunes' Road Runner cartoons.

title: Andrew Lincoln Death Hoax
subtitle: A prank news site tricked social media users into believing "Walking Dead" actor Andrew Lincoln had died.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Actor Andrew Lincoln died in a car crash in February 2017.

title: Do 'Breatharians' Survive Without Food or Water?
subtitle: Claims about "breatharians," people purportedly living on light alone, do not offer proof that they survive this way.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Californian and Ecuadorian couple proved it is possible to live on nothing but air.

title: Did Alexandria Shooter James Hodgkinson Hold a Sign With a Rand Paul Tweet?
subtitle: A doctored image appears to show Hodgkinson holding a sign with a tweet about the Second Amendment.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Alexandria shooter James Hodgkinson protested with a sign featuring a Rand Paul tweet.

title: Is SPLC a 'Left-Wing Smear Group' That Encourages Violent Attacks?
subtitle: Partisan web sites have attempted to link Scalise shooter James Hodgkinson to the civil rights watchdog group Southern Poverty Law Center.
author: David Emery
statement: The Southern Poverty Law Center is a "left-wing smear group" that incites hatred and violence against conservatives.

title: Was a Man Accused of Ejaculating in His Boss' Coffee Daily for Four Years?
subtitle: A hoax news site used an unrelated mug shot for a falsehood about a man who added unwanted extra material to his supervisor's beverages.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man was arrested after it was discovered he ejaculated into his boss' coffee on a daily basis for four years.

title: Does a Vox Infographic Claim Killing GOP Members Could Prevent 'Ten 9/11s'?
subtitle: After Rep. Steve Scalise was shot on 14 June 2017, an infographic purportedly from Vox weighed Republican lawmaker lives against healthcare-related deaths.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Vox infographic calculated Republican lawmaker deaths against lives potentially saved by their effects on healthcare policy.

title: Calgary Man Slices Off Penis After Attaching Razor Blade to Fidget Spinner?
subtitle: A fake news article was the latest in a series of claims about mishaps with the popular toy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Calgary man cut off his penis after attaching razor blades to a fidget spinner.

title: 'Star Wars' Filming Soon in Your Town, USA
subtitle: Rumors that new 'Star Wars' movies would be filmed in various small cities in the United States came from a set of cloned hoax sites.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: "Star Wars" movies will be filmed in several small, off-the-beaten-path towns across America.

title: Is This Picture of the Sun and Full Moon Between Two Trees Real?
subtitle: An image showing a full moon above a setting sun and framed between two trees is not a genuine photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photographer used sixteen cameras and waited 62 days to capture an image of the full moon above a sunset.

title: Was Nancy Pelosi 'Miss Lube Rack of 1959'?
subtitle: Does this title rank among the achievements of the long-serving member of the U.S. House of Representatives?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a young Nancy Pelosi as "Miss Lube Rack" of 1959.

title: Is the Common Household Plant 'Dieffenbachia' Deadly?
subtitle: Viral web sites massively exaggerate the risk posed by these plants, even if that risk is rooted in a modicum of reality.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The household plant Dieffenbachia, one of the most common indoor plants, is so poisonous it can kill a child in one minute and an adult in 15 minutes.

title: Did a Woman Require Surgery After a Fidget Spinner Became Stuck in Her Vagina?
subtitle: Two nearly-identical articles report the same false incident in two far-flung cities.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman was hospitalized after a fidget spinner became lodged in her vagina.

title: Atheist Iceland Issues a Travel Ban Against White Southern Baptists?
subtitle: A satirical article contains some clues that the claim is false.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Iceland issued a travel ban against white Southern Baptists.

title: Did President Trump Ride in a Penis-Shaped Motorcade?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly shows vehicles in President Trump's motorcade positioned in an unusual formation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows President Trump's motorcade riding in a penis formation.

title: The Golden State Warriors Voted Not to Visit the White House?
subtitle: Reports that the Golden State Warriors voted unanimously to skip a visit to the White House after winning the NBA Championship are based on a single unconfirmed tweet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Golden State Warriors basketball team announced on 13 June 2017 that they had unanimously voted to skip a visit to the White House after winning the NBA Championship.

title: Did a UFO Disappear Into a 'Portal' Above Colorado?
subtitle: A video of a UFO that has been viewed millions of times on social media did not coincide with any alien visitation.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A UFO was seen disappearing into a portal over Colorado.

title: Charles Manson Granted Parole?
subtitle: Reports that the notorious criminal is being let out of prison are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Charles Manson has been granted parole and will soon be released from prison.

title: 'Joe the Plumber' Dies in Freak Accident After Announcing Bid for Congress?
subtitle: Reports that the minor celebrity from the 2008 U.S. presidential campaign was killed in a freak accident are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joe the Plumber was killed in an accident after announcing he was seeking a seat in the U.S. Senate.

title: Did the Man Who Discovered the HIV Virus Confess to 'Inventing' It?
subtitle: A bizarre, entirely false story originated on a web site notorious for bizarre, entirely false stories.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Dr. Robert Gallo admitted to "inventing" the HIV virus in a plot to "depopulate humanity."

title: Did NBA Refs Earn a $10 Million Bonus After Series Went to Game 5?
subtitle: An article that appeared to report that referees were bribed to poorly officiate a playoff game was a piece of satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NBA referees earned a $10 million bonus after the finals went to game 5.

title: Was Chelsea Clinton 'Thrown to the Floor' and Handcuffed?
subtitle: A fake news site spread a claim that a "furious" Chelsea Clinton was roughly detained on corruption charges after a confession by a nonexistent senator.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "A furious Chelsea Clinton" was handcuffed and dragged away after Sen. Hal Lindsay exposed Clinton corruption.

title: Was a Family Cited for a Viking Funeral on a California Lake?
subtitle: Reports that a family got ticketed for burning a boat with a body in it originated from a hoax news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A California family was ticketed after holding a Viking funeral at a local lake.

title: Is the 'Liar in Chief' Time Magazine Cover Real?
subtitle: A supposed TIME magazine cover pictures President Trump with the headline "Liar in Chief."
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a real Time Magazine cover featuring a picture of President Trump and the words "Liar in Chief."

title: Was the Sandy Hook Elementary School Shooting a Hoax?
subtitle: A video supposedly documenting that the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School were a staged hoax is full of misinformation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video documents that the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School were a staged hoax.

title: Terrorist Who Hid Grenades in Anus Dies of Internal Bleeding at Iraqi Airport?
subtitle: Reports of a terrorist who accidentally killed himself while attempting to smuggle hand grenades at an airport are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An Iraqi terrorist was killed when hand grenades he was attempting to smuggle by hiding them in his rectum accidentally detonated.

title: Richmond Begins Mass Relocation of Low Income Blacks to Decrease City Poverty Rate?
subtitle: Reports that the city of Richmond is evicting low-income residents to decrease the municipal poverty rate are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The city of Richmond is evicting low-income residents to decrease the municipal poverty rate.

title: The DEA Just Raided a United States Senator - Dems in a Panic?
subtitle: Reports that the DEA raided the vacation ranch of U.S. Senator Hal Lindsay of New Jersey and seized large quantities of illegal drugs are fake news
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The DEA raided the vacation ranch of U.S. Senator Hal Lindsay of New Jersey and seized large quantities of illegal drugs.

title: Maxine Waters Has Shown Up to Only a Tenth of Congressional Meetings for 35 Years?
subtitle: A self-debunking Reddit claim that Maxine Waters missed 90 percent of "Congressional meetings" was repeated by a blog as a credible statistic.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Maxine Waters attended only ten percent of Congressional meetings in more than three decades holding office.

title: Did a Group of Muslims Attack Welsh Bar Patrons for Drinking Beer?
subtitle: Several web sites grossly misrepresented the truth about videos showing disturbances at a 2014 pro-Palestine rally in Wales.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A video shows a group of Muslims attacking bar patrons in Cardiff, Wales, for drinking beer.

title: Imelda Marcos Dead?
subtitle: Imelda Marcos has not died, despite a long-circulating (and undated) article about her purported collapse.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Former First Lady of the Philippines Imelda Marcos died of a cardiac arrest in June 2017.

title: Did 58 Scientific Papers Published in 2017 Say Global Warming is a Myth?
subtitle: An article on Breitbart News used flawed interpretations from a climate skeptic blog to amplify a grossly inaccurate understanding of climatological research.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A total of 58 peer-reviewed papers published in the first half of 2017 conclude that global warming is a myth.

title: Did Virginia Police Kill a Three-Year-Old Child During a Shootout?
subtitle: A 'prank' web site published a fake story using a real picture of police shooting and killing an undocumented immigrant.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Police in Richmond, Virginia killed a young child during a shootout with two suspects.

title: Is This Marilyn Monroe Posing With a Cat?
subtitle: A doctored image appears to show Monroe holding a cat to her face.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image showing Marilyn Monroe with a cat is a genuine photograph.

title: Did Sean Spicer Claim Trump Has the Authority to Change Spellings Like 'Covfefe'?
subtitle: Although Spicer's actual reaction to the tweet drew widespread media attention, he did not claim that the President has the authority to change words.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said President Trump had authority to add words like "covfefe" to the language.

title: Did Kellyanne Conway Say Liberal Women Hate Her Because of Her 'Striking Beauty and Intellect'?
subtitle: A quote attributed to the senior adviser to President Donald Trump is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kellyanne Conway said that liberal women hate her because of her "striking beauty and intellect."

title: Does Footage Show Tornadoes in Cape Town?
subtitle: After the South African city was hit with a major storm, doctored videos purportedly showing tornadoes in the area were circulated on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Videos show tornadoes in Cape Town, South Africa.

title: Did President Trump Tour a Chemtrail Plane?
subtitle: A photograph showing the chief executive on an airplane had nothing to do with chemtrails.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Trump touring a chemtrail plane.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict That President Trump Would Touch a Glowing Orb?
subtitle: Memes represented that the animated series showed Trump touching a glowing orb fifteen years before the actual incident took place.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "The Simpsons" depicted that President Donald Trump would touch a glowing orb fifteen years before he actually did so during a trip to the Middle East.

title: Did Ted Cruz Say Southern States Should Build Nuclear Weapons to Protect Their Beliefs?
subtitle: A site with a disclaimer warning that its quotes are "total baloney" published the false story.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sen. Ted Cruz said Southern states should build a nuclear arsenal to "protect their beliefs."

title: Obama's Burial Plot is a Massive Waste of Taxpayer Money?
subtitle: Claims that President Obama has a planned a lavish burial plot are false and originated with a well-known fake news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama submitted plans for an opulent, taxpayer-funded burial site.

title: Has Facebook Reversed Their 'Nipple Ban'?
subtitle: Several Facebook users posted claims that the social network had reversed their ban on images of bare-chested women, but these were simply rumors.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook revised its position on to female toplessness or nipple exposure in imagery as of May 2017.

title: Did Whoopi Goldberg Wear a Violent Anti-Trump Shirt?
subtitle: Doctored images of Goldberg purportedly wearing a shirt depicting violence against the President resurfaced after a controversy involving comedian Kathy Griffin.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Whoopi Goldberg wore a shirt depicting violence against President Trump.

title: Did Fox News Use a Reality Winner Parody Twitter Account During a Live Broadcast?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a screenshot of a Fox News broadcast featuring a parody Twitter account for Reality Winner is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News showed a parody account for Reality Winner during a live broadcast.

title: Balloon-Breasted Trump?
subtitle: An image appearing to show Donald Trump with balloons stuffed into his shirt is actually a composite of at least two different photographs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Trump with balloons stuffed into his shirt.

title: Is this President Trump with a Scantily Clad Woman?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing President Trump with a stripper has been doctored.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows President Trump partying with a stripper.

title: Did London Mayor Sadiq Khan Defend 9/11 Terrorists?
subtitle: Rumors that Sadiq Khan defended 11 September 2001 terrorists were spread alongside an unrelated video following June 2017 attacks in London.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video depicts London Mayor Sadiq Khan defending September 11th terrorists, either verbally and ideologically or as their lawyer.

title: Is this Donald Trump Sitting with Liberace?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing Trump with flamboyant performer Liberace was faked.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Donald Trump sitting with Liberace.

title: Did Maxine Waters Blame the London Attack on Climate and Healthcare 'Inaction'?
subtitle: A parody Twitter account succeeds again in tricking users into taking a fake tweet seriously.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Representative Maxine Waters said Muslims were being "pushed" into terrorism by "inaction" on climate change and healthcare.

title: CNN Staged Muslim Protests After London Attack?
subtitle: Pundits and conspiracy theorists claimed that CNN staged a demonstration in London involving Muslims after a June 2017 attack.
author: David Emery
statement: CNN created "fake news" and staged protests in which Muslim residents purportedly protested a 3 June 2017 attack in London.

title: Trump Just Raided His Own EPA?
subtitle: Reports that executive branch agents raided and shut down the EPA and documented that climate change is a hoax are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Executive branch agents raided and shut down the EPA.

title: Is This Donald Trump in a Diaper?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Trump nearly nude and surrounded by bondage accoutrements is not real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump in a diaper.

title: Did Emmanuel Macron Give U.S. Liberals 'Refugee Status' in France?
subtitle: A conservative web site twisted the French President's invitation to American researchers to work in France.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Emmanuel Macron offered American liberals refugee status in France

title: Did CNN Delete an Article Defending Bill Maher's Use of a Racial Slur?
subtitle: An article reporting that CNN published, then deleted the story is just more fake news from a repeat offender.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN posted and then deleted an article which defended Bill Maher's use of the n-word.

title: Does This Video Capture a Man Miraculously Saving a Baby from Train Tracks?
subtitle: Do you know what your shadow is up to?  You should.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a man narrowly rescuing a baby from getting hit by an oncoming train.

title: Supreme Court Rules on Travel Ban?
subtitle: Reports of a Supreme Court decision holding that President Trump's travel bans are "well within his constitutional rights to impose" are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.S. Supreme Court has ruled that President Trump's travel bans are "well within his constitutional rights to impose."

title: 'Interschools' WhatsApp Group Warning
subtitle: A warning about a WhatsApp group called 'Interschools' and its connection to ISIS is a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: ISIS/Daesh created a WhatsApp group called "Interschools," and once users join it they cannot leave.

title: Monica Lewinsky Found Dead?
subtitle: Monica Lewinsky was not found murdered after a robbery at a friend's house.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Monica Lewinsky was found dead after a robbery.

title: Melania Trump Bans Monsanto Products from the White House?
subtitle: Reports that the first lady ordered Monsanto products removed from the White House after reading about genetically modified foods are fake news.
author: David Emery
statement: First Lady Melania Trump banned all Monsanto products from the White House after reading about the dangers of genetically modified foods.

title: Cannibals Arrested in Florida Claim Eating Human Flesh Cures Diabetes and Depression?
subtitle: Reports of the arrest of three cannibalistic Floridians who feasted on human remains for medical reasons are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Three Florida men were arrested for eating human flesh, a practice they claimed cures depression and diabetes.

title: Are You Exempt from Paying Sold-Off Debt?
subtitle: A popular social media item wrongly claims that consumers are not obligated to pay back debt that creditors have written off and sold to debt collectors.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Consumers are not obligated to pay back debt that creditors have written off and sold.

title: Did the Ku Klux Klan Start a Petition to 'Purge' Black People in the United States?
subtitle: Rumors about a petition started by the KKK to "purge" the United States of black people every year originated on a hoax news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The KKK started a petition to "purge' black people in the United States.

title: Is 'Covfefe' a Word in Arabic? Yiddish? 'Antediluvian'?
subtitle: After President Donald Trump mistyped (then deleted) a tweet, some hurried to ascribe meanings to the mistyped word "covfefe."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: "Covfefe" means something, anything.

title: Did Maxine Waters Use a Picture of the Tide Receding as Proof of Climate Change?
subtitle: An account parodying the Congresswoman sent the tweet in response to President Donald Trump's decision to pull out of the Paris climate accord.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Maxine Waters used a picture of the tide receding as proof of climate change.

title: Was Kathy Griffin Shot and Killed Trying to Escape Custody?
subtitle: Griffin's controversial photo shoot featuring a likeness of Donald Trump's severed head prompted a web site to falsely claim that the comedian had died.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Comedian Kathy Griffin was shot and killed while trying to escape custody.

title: Was a Singaporean Woman Injured While Photocopying Her Breasts?
subtitle: A dubious new web site published a fabricated story that lacked proper sourcing.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A woman was hospitalized with burns after photocopying her breasts in Bishan, Singapore.

title: 22 Dead Bodies Discovered in Flint River Found to Be the Source of Water Contamination?
subtitle: Reports that the source of Michigan's water pollution problems was the presence of numerous dead bodies in the Flint River were fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Police found 22 dead bodies in Michigan's Flint River in April 2016.

title: Did a Bombing Take Place in Vatican City?
subtitle: A fear-mongering article falsely claiming a bombing had taken place in Vatican City used images of smoke caused by a junkyard fire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph show the aftermath of a bombing in Vatican City.

title: '22 Christian Missionaries Sentenced to Death' Prayer Request
subtitle: A prayer request for 22 missionaries about to be executed in Afghanistan is spurious and outdated.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Twenty-two missionaries (or missionary families) are about to be executed in Afghanistan.

title: Hillary Clinton Found Dead?
subtitle: A distasteful prank article spreads misinformation about the former Secretary of State.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Hillary Clinton was found dead in May 2017.

title: Does This Video Show a Pigeon Saluting Vladimir Putin?
subtitle: A video of a pigeon that appeared to salute Russian president Vladimir Putin was merely a sly joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a pigeon 'saluting' Russian president Vladimir Putin.

title: Did President Trump's USDA Pick Say Scientists Are 'Dumb' for Believing Dinosaurs Existed?
subtitle: Although Sam Clovis is believed to be in line for a Department of Agriculture appointment, he did not say that scientists are "stupid" and that dinosaurs are "a hoax".
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Did Sam Clovis (a President Trump pick for a U.S. Department of Agriculture science position) called scientists "dumb" and claimed that dinosaurs never existed.

title: Does Donald Trump Sit Through Meetings of World Leaders Without Notes?
subtitle: A meme cherry-picked one snapshot from a longer meeting where the United States president did use notes.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Donald Trump did not have notes or note-taking paraphernalia at a G7 leaders' summit.

title: Did a Texas Man Discover a Hired Escort Was His Wife?
subtitle: A hoax article appeared to report that a man from Katy, Texas hired a prostitute and was subsequently shocked to learn the woman was his wife.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man hired an escort, only to discover that it was his wife.

title: Did a New York Mosque Burn an American Flag to Protest President Trump?
subtitle: Incendiary claims that appear to be calculated to create hostility were created from whole cloth and illustrated with old photographs unrelated to the Trump administration.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Muslims from a New York mosque burning an American flag in protest of President Donald Trump.

title: Trump Wants Executive Order Abolishing Impeachment?
subtitle: A satirical web site used the claim to poke fun at Trump's executive orders.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Leaked conversations revealed that President Trump planned on signing an executive order to abolish impeachment.

title: Miley Cyrus Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that singer Miley Cyrus' lifeless body was found by her entourage in a bathtub after she drowned from a prescription drug overdose are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Singer Miley Cyrus drowned in a bathtub due to a prescription drug overdose.

title: Google Earth Discovers Woman Trapped on Desert Island for Years?
subtitle: Reports that Google Earth images helped locate a castaway are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Google Earth helped locate a woman who had been stranded on an island for years.

title: Did Saudi Arabia Give Ivanka Trump a $100 Million Donation?
subtitle: A partisan web site grossly misrepresented the nature of Ivanka Trump's involvement in a World Bank project to help female entrepreneurs.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ivanka Trump, by way of a female entrepreneurship fund, received a $100 million donation from Saudi Arabia.

title: Was a Child Named Chloe Jones Abducted by a 'Creepy School Bus'?
subtitle: A YouTube channel posts weekly horror stories, one of which was mistaken for a real event.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video tells the true story of a little girl named Chloe Jones who was abducted after getting on the wrong school bus.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Meet With the Manchester Bomber's Father?
subtitle: A real picture with a false caption is being used to spread misinformation about the former Secretary of State on social media.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A photograph shows Hillary Clinton shaking hands with Ramadan Abedi, the father of Manchester bomber Salman Abedi.

title: Was Scott Baio Killed in a Small Plane Crash?
subtitle: Fake news sites reported that the former "Happy Days" actor died in a plane crash on his way to visit President Trump at Mar-a-Lago.
author: David Emery
statement: Actor Scott Baio died in a small plane crash on his way to play golf with President Trump at Mar-a-Lago.

title: Did Furries Win the Right to Use Dog Parks Like Real Dogs in Portland?
subtitle: The city council reportedly voted to give people with animal alter egos the right to defecate and mate in the parks.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Portland City Council voted to allow 'Furries' to use dog parks in the same way that dogs do.

title: Was Nancy Pelosi's Son Arrested for Murder?
subtitle: Fake news web sites promulgated the claim that the House minority leader's son murdered his daughter's boyfriend's stepfather.
author: David Emery
statement: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi's son was arrested for murder.

title: President Trump Left Online Reviews for the Middle East?
subtitle: An article appearing to report that Trump wrote reviews after a brief trip to the region was intended as satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump left reviews for locations such as Yad Vashem on TripAdvisor during his trip of the Middle East.

title: Did New Year's Fireworks 'Compete' with a Volcanic Eruption in Naples, Italy?
subtitle: An animated image appears to show a volcano erupting during a New Year's firework celebration in Naples, Italy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An animated image shows Mount Vesuvius erupting during a firework celebration in Naples, Italy.

title: Did President Obama Decline to Lay Wreaths on Memorial Day?
subtitle: Critics falsely claimed that Barack Obama was the only U.S. president not to lay a wreath at Arlington National Cemetery on Memorial Day.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Barack Obama was the only U.S. president not to lay a wreath at Arlington National Cemetery on Memorial Day.

title: Did a Man Claim a Unicorn Frappuccino 'Made Him Gay'?
subtitle: A 'satire' site published the claim that a Queens man said a Unicorn Frappuccino 'made him gay'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man claimed drinking Starbucks' Unicorn Frappuccino "made him gay."

title: Crisis Actors Uncovered?
subtitle: Social media rumors claim the same girl, a "crisis actor," was seen crying at tragedies in Boston, Aurora, Oregon, Sandy Hook, and Manchester.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The same crying woman appears in photos taken at the scenes of massacres in Sandy Hook, Aurora, Boston, Oregon, Paris, and Manchester.

title: Fisherman Captures 3,000-Pound Great White Shark in Great Lakes?
subtitle: You didn't see a news report about a fisherman's capture of a great white shark in Lake Michigan because it didn't happen.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A fisherman captured a 3,000 lb. great white shark in the Great Lakes.

title: Volkswagen Polo 'Terrorist' Commercial
subtitle: A viral ad featuring the Volkswagen Polo automobile and a suicide bomber was not created at the behest of the automobile manufacturer.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A commercial produced by Volkswagen employs suicide bomber imagery.

title: Is This 'Monster Bullfrog' Real?
subtitle: A photograph of a "monster bullfrog" is real, but forced perspective makes it look larger than it actually is.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man holding a 13-pound bullfrog.

title: Did President Trump 'Reinstate' a Memorial Day for Police Officers, Cancelled by Obama?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan web sites published the false claim that Barack Obama had cancelled Peace Officers Memorial Day.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Donald Trump reinstated a day of commemoration for fallen police, which had been cancelled by Barack Obama

title: Did Pope Francis Slap Away President Trump's Hand?
subtitle: A papal video clip mocked President Trump's perceived icy relationship with his wife, Melania.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Pope Francis slapping away President Trump's hand.

title: Did President Trump's Lawyers Send Berkeley Breathed a Cease and Desist Letter?
subtitle: A satirical letter shared on the cartoonist's Facebook page was widely believed to be legitimate on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump's lawyers sent a cease and desist letter to a cartoonist for using doctored images of the Trump family.

title: Bill Murray and Hunter S. Thompson Wore Vulgar T-Shirts?
subtitle: An image showing Bill Murray and Hunter S. Thompson on a boat was doctored for a viral marketing campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Murray and Hunter S. Thompson were photographed wearing shirts reading "Buy Me Brunch" and "Polite as Fuck."

title: Did a Man in Montana Catch a Three-Foot Long Grasshopper?
subtitle: In the 1930s, doctored postcards featuring giant grasshoppers sold "like hotcakes."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man holding a 3-foot grasshopper.

title: Miley Cyrus Would 'Rather Get Nuked' by North Korea Than Have Donald Trump as President?
subtitle: Several hyperpartisan web sites falsely attributed an invented quote to the singer.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Miley Cyrus said she would prefer a North Korean nuclear attack on the US to the presidency of Donald Trump.

title: Did a Ship Reappear in the Bermuda Triangle 90 Years After Going Missing?
subtitle: Reports that the SS Cotopaxi was discovered by the Cuban Coast Guard decades after it vanished in the Bermuda Triangle were fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The SS Cotopaxi was discovered by the Cuban Coast Guard 90 years after it vanished in the Bermuda Triangle.

title: Was the Manchester Terror Attack a 'False Flag'?
subtitle: A viral conspiracy video has emerged spreading a false rumor that a suicide bombing attack at an Ariana Grande concert was a hoax.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The suicide bombing attack at the Ariana Grande concert in Manchester, England was a hoax.

title: Will Dangerous Cosmic Rays Pass Close to Earth 'Tonight'?
subtitle: This claim has been around for years and makes no scientific sense whatsoever.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Dangerous cosmic rays will pass near Earth tonight, causing bodily harm if you keep personal electronics near you.

title: Woman Found on Clinton Estate Dead, Tortured, and Malnourished?
subtitle: A "satirical" web site published a fake story of questionable taste.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The remains of a woman who went missing in 1985 were found on the property of Bill and Hillary Clinton.

title: Did Samsung Pay a $1 Billion Judgment to Apple in Nickels?
subtitle: Reports that Samsung paid off a $1.05 billion judgment awarded to Apple in a patent infringement lawsuit entirely in nickels are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Samsung paid off a $1.05 billion judgment awarded to Apple in a patent infringement lawsuit entirely in nickels.

title: Famous Baby Giraffe Passes Away Only a Month After Birth?
subtitle: A Facebook post created using a "prank" web site fooled many into believing that internet star April the Giraffe's calf had died.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A baby giraffe that earned viral fame in April 2017 passed away a month after birth.

title: Did Trump Offer Asylum to 'Lord Nazi Ruso'?
subtitle: A Mexican news site posted a satirical story saying that the U.S. President had offered asylum to a Russian white supremacist living in Cancun.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump offered asylum to Aleksei Makeev, who was attacked in Mexico.

title: Did Ariana Grande Defile the American Flag?
subtitle: Following a 22 May 2017 tragedy in Manchester, a photoshopped image of Ariana Grande defiling an American flag circulated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts Ariana Grande defiling the American flag.

title: Is There a New, Rare Tick That Burrows Under Your Skin Undetected?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post with pictures lifted from various sources doesn't provide any specifics about a supposed new type of tick.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A new, rare tick burrows under your skin and moves about undetected.

title: Physicist Warns That Fidget Spinners Could Affect Earth's Center of Gravity?
subtitle: Reports that "one of the nation's most respected physicists" has warned that fidget spinners could have a harmful effect on the Earth's center of gravity are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A respected physicist has warned that fidget spinners could have a harmful effect on the Earth's center of gravity.

title: Does Sheriff David Clarke Wear 'Fake' Military Medals?
subtitle: It's not "stolen valor" - the notorious Milwaukee sheriff never claimed to have served in the military and says he wears a number of pins that have personal significance to him.
author: Bethania Palma
