statement: Milwaukee Sheriff David Clarke wears fake military medals.

title: Chuck Schumer Resigns 'in Disgrace'?
subtitle: A satirical web site published an entirely fabricated story about the Senate Minority Leader.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer has resigned in the face of compromising material held by the White House.

title: Is This a New Killer Insect?
subtitle: A warning about a
that is able to spread a skin-altering virus when touched is just a prank.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a
that is able to spread a skin-altering virus when touched.

title: Trump 'Humiliates' Obama After White House Cleaning Staff Finds 'Secret Stash' of Drugs?
subtitle: Multiple fake news sites shared a fabricated claim that President Trump's new head of housekeeping found President Obama's drug stash.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump's personal housekeeper found President Obama's drug stash during a deep cleaning of the White House.

title: Pat Robertson: 'Gay People Should Wear Specially-Colored Clothes to Warn Straight People'?
subtitle: Reports that televangelist Pat Robertson said gay people should wear colors by which heterosexual people might easily identify them are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Televangelist Pat Robertson said gay people should wear specific colors so they can be easily identified by straight people.

title: Is 'Paint Thinner' Trisodium Phosphate Found in Cereals?
subtitle: Trisodium phosphate is a common and safe additive used in small amounts in various foods, not a form of "paint thinner".
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Popular cereals (including Lucky Charms and Cheerios) contain "paint thinner" and pose a danger to children.

title: Seth Rich's Parents 'Thank' Internet for Spreading Rumor He Leaked Thousands of E-Mails to WikiLeaks?
subtitle: The murdered DNC staffer's parents posted a video to the family's GoFundMe page a month ago thanking people who donated - not those who spread the baseless rumor.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The parents of murdered DNC staffer Seth Rich thanked "the Internet" for spreading a debunked claim he had leaked thousands of e-mails to WikiLeaks.

title: Donald Trump Praises Colonel Sanders for His Service in the Civil War?
subtitle: A satirical web site reported that Trump called KFC founder Colonel Harland Sanders "a tremendous Civil War hero."
author: David Emery
statement: President Trump praised KFC founder Colonel Sanders, who wasn't born until 1890, for his service during the Civil War.

title: George Soros Indicted for Election Hacking?
subtitle: A doctored image was used to spread the false claim that George Soros was indicted for election tampering.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts George Soros in handcuffs before a judge, facing charges of tampering with voting equipment.

title: Was Trey Gowdy's Son Found Dead in a Dumpster?
subtitle: The latest in an ongoing series of hoaxes targeting Rep. Trey Gowdy involved a false claim his son was found dead in a Washington, D.C. dumpster.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Rep. Trey Gowdy's son was found dead in a Washington, D.C. dumpster.

title: Bill O'Reilly Found Dead at His Long Island Home?
subtitle: Reports on the death of former Fox News host Bill O'Reilly were nothing more than fake news.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Former Fox News host Bill O'Reilly was found dead on Long Island.

title: Willie Nelson Death Hoax
subtitle: Country music legend Willie Nelson is not dead; he's just the target of a recirculated celebrity death hoax.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Country star Willie Nelson has died.

title: 'Leaked Image' Depicts President Obama in Handcuffs?
subtitle: An image of President Obama handcuffed before a judge and charged with wiretapping President Trump is fake.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A "leaked" photograph depicts President Obama in handcuffs, facing charges of wiretapping President Trump.

title: Did the Supreme Court Side with Trump on Schools Teaching 'Sharia Law'?
subtitle: Conservative-leaning websites fabricated several stories about the high court's weighing in on teaching Islamic religious rules in U.S. schools.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Supreme Court ruled 5-3 that schools may not teach Sharia law to students.

title: Nicky Hayden Death Hoax
subtitle: A tasteless fake news story included the claim that World Superbike star Nicky Hayden passed away.
author: Dan Evon
statement: World Superbike star Nicky Hayden passed away on 19 May 2017.

title: Did James Comey Cover Up a Murdered DNC Staffer's Purported Links to WikiLeaks?
subtitle: A thinly-sourced article relies on questionable reports to make a claim about the former FBI director.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Former FBI director James Comey covered up Seth Rich's purported links to WikiLeaks in order to protect Hillary Clinton and the DNC.

title: Amy Schumer to Star in an All-Female Remake of Saving Private Ryan?
subtitle: A joke on Twitter has been fleshed out into a full-fledged hoax by two satirical web sites.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Amy Schumer will lead an all-female cast in a remake of Saving Private Ryan

title: Did a 1977 'Time' Story Offer Tips on 'How to Survive the Coming Ice Age'?
subtitle: While a number of media outlets reported on some briefly-lived scientific fears over global cooling in the 1970s, viral images purporting to show a cover story on the topic are doctored.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: 'Time' ran a cover story titled "How to Survive the Coming Ice Age" in 1977.

title: Did Fox News Just Hire 'Filthy, Lying Liberal' Whoopi Goldberg?
subtitle: A fake news web site leveraged shakeups at Fox News to push a falsehood about the network's hiring the actress and talk show host.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Fox News has hired Whoopi Goldberg.

title: Bruce Lee and Elvis Presley in a Dojo?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the martial artist and singer together is actually a composite of at least two different images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Elvis Presley posing with Bruce Lee.

title: Does the FBI Have Evidence That 62 Million Trump Voters Are Russian Agents?
subtitle: A fake, satirical story originally published by a white supremacist web site has been republished several times as fact.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has uncovered evidence that everyone who voted for President Donald Trump is a Russian spy

title: Did Bill Clinton File for Divorce 'This Morning'?
subtitle: An article reporting that Bill Clinton filed for divorce from Hillary Clinton in May 2017 is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former president Bill Clinton filed for divorce from former presidential candidate Hillary Clinton in May 2017.

title: Did an Ohio Schoolteacher Lose an Eye in a Fidget Spinner Accident?
subtitle: An article about a high school teacher's being "seriously injured" after a classroom game with the popular toy is fake.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A Columbus, Ohio English teacher lost his eye in a fidget spinner accident.

title: Is the Human Body Like a Battery With a Finite Amount of Energy?
subtitle: Biographers say President Trump gave up exercise in college so as not to expend his finite energy too quickly.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Exercising is counterproductive because it expends more quickly the finite amount of energy a human has.

title: Is a Jefferson Davis Statue to be Replaced with Obama Likeness?
subtitle: A satire site posing as a Fox News affiliate falsely claimed a statue of the Confederate leader would be replaced with one honoring Barack Obama.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A recently removed statue of Jefferson Davis is being replaced with a large bronze tribute to Barack Obama.

title: Was a Man Claiming to Be Vladimir Putin's Lover Found Dead in Zurich?
subtitle: Several web sites have revived an old, fake story about the Russian President's fictional former assistant.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A Russian man claiming to be Vladimir Putin's lover was found dead in Switzerland

title: Did President Trump Plagiarize His Commencement Speech from 'Legally Blonde'?
subtitle: Snippets of a commencement address delivered by Trump have been compared to snippets of a scene in the Reese Witherspoon film.
author: David Emery
statement: A commencement speech delivered by President Trump at Liberty University in May 2017 bore remarkable similarities to one given by Reese Witherspoon's character in the 2001 film "Legally Blonde."

title: Is Paula White Selling Prayer Flags Blessed by Donald Trump?
subtitle: A hoax article reported that televangelist Paula White was selling American flags that had been personally blessed by the United States President.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Televangelist Paula White sold American flags that were personally blessed by President Donald Trump.

title: Does This Cat Have an Unusually Deep Voice?
subtitle: A video purportedly shows a feline with an extremely deep meow.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video captures a cat with an extremely deep meow.

title: Did DNC Staffer Seth Rich Send 'Thousands of E-Mails' to WikiLeaks Before He Was Murdered?
subtitle: A man claiming to be a private investigator is making uncorroborated claims about the deceased staffer.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: DNC staffer Seth Rich sent 'thousands of leaked e-mails' to WikiLeaks before he was murdered.

title: Did Monica Lewinsky Have a Son Who Was Found Dead in New York City?
subtitle: Articles reporting that Lewinsky's son "David" had been reported missing and was subsequently found dead in Central Park are fake.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Monica Lewinsky's son "David" was found dead in Central Park.

title: Did a Biplane Buzz a Los Angeles Beach in 1911?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a biplane flying low over a California beach is actually an early example of photographic manipulation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a biplane buzzing a Los Angeles beach in 1911.

title: Was a Pregnant Woman Raped by a Muslim Refugee in Michigan?
subtitle: A false story used photographs of an Argentinian domestic abuse survivor to advance a claim with no basis in fact.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a pregnant woman named Paola Lynn who was raped by a Muslim refugee in Michigan.

title: Did a Hunter Claim He Was Sexually Assaulted by a Sasquatch?
subtitle: Rumors that a man claimed he was set upon by Bigfoot while on a hunting trip are just fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Colorado hunter claimed he was sexually assaulted by a Sasquatch.

title: Was a Man Hospitalized to Remove a Lodged Fidget Spinner?
subtitle: An amusing story about a man who got a popular toy lodged in his anus is fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man was hospitalized after a fidget spinner became lodged in his anus.

title: Would Breaking a Vaccine Vial Necessitate Evacuating a Building?
subtitle: This claim, made by Robert F. Kennedy Jr., is a solid illustration of why scale and context matter when making health-related statements.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: If the vial to a mercury-containing vaccine is broken, the building must be evacuated.

title: Did J.D. Salinger Write in the Nude?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the famously reclusive author wearing nothing but a pair of sandals actually shows a different writer, Jayson Loam.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows author J.D. Salinger writing at a nudist retreat.

title: Is This President Trump at the Golf Course?
subtitle: An unflattering image that sparked discussion over Trump's relative health and fitness was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An unflattering photograph shows President Trump playing a round of golf.

title: Was a Pastor Eaten by Crocodiles While Trying to Walk on Water?
subtitle: Multiple tabloids repeated an unsubstantiated claim that a pastor was eaten by crocodiles in an attempt to demonstrate how Jesus walked on water.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A pastor was eaten by crocodiles in front of horrified parishioners during his attempt to walk on water.

title: Was a Whale Spotted Under the Mackinac Bridge?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a "freshwater sturgeon whale" between Lake Huron and Lake Michigan is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a fresh water sturgeon whale under the Mackinac Bridge in Lake Huron.

title: Clint Eastwood Death Hoax
subtitle: The actor and director did not die of a heart attack while filming a commercial in August 2019.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Clint Eastwood died of a heart attack while filming a commercial in August 2019.

title: Is Fox News Host Tucker Carlson in Critical Condition After Head-On Collision?
subtitle: Reports that the Fox News Channel host succumbed to injuries from an automobile accident are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Fox News Channel host Tucker Carlson succumbed to injuries from an automobile accident.

title: Is Chick-fil-A Offering Free Food for Mother's Day?
subtitle: An image spread online promoting a Mother Day's lunch special from the restaurant chain is a hoax.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Chick-fil-A is offering free Mother's Day lunches on 14 May 2017.

title: Was Winston-Salem Student Kendra Shanice Reid Murdered on Video?
subtitle: A disturbing video purportedly showing two men lynching a black woman was not related to the death of Kendra Shanice Reid.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows two men lynching Kendra Shanice Reid.

title: Is Ulta Closing After a Sephora Buyout?
subtitle: A shady advertisement posed as a magazine article seeming to report that the beauty supplier had been bought out by a competing chain.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ulta Beauty will close its doors following a buyout by competitor Sephora.

title: Does Japan Have a '7D' Hologram Animal Park?
subtitle: A viral video appearing to show a park in which visitors can touch, feel, and even smell virtual animals is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 7D hologram park in Japan features virtual animals that can be touched by visitors.

title: Did a Muslim Man Rape a 13-Year-Old Girl and Get Beaten by Trump Supporters?
subtitle: A fake news web site stole an image from a 2013 incident in Egypt, then used it to claim that it showed a Muslim man who had raped a girl in Ohio.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An American Muslim man raped a 13-year-old girl in Ohio, and then was beaten by Trump supporters.

title: Clinton Foundation Cargo Ship Raided at Port of Baltimore Reveals 'Sick Secret'?
subtitle: Articles alleging that a cargo ship owned by the Clinton Foundation was found to contain foreign refugees and illegal substances are fake news.
author: David Emery
statement: A Clinton Foundation cargo ship arriving from Africa was raided and found to contain "illegal contraband" in the form of foreign refugees, narcotics, weapons, and illegal fruits.

title: Is Country Duo 'Florida Georgia Line' to Marry?
subtitle: Reports that Brian Kelley and Tyler Hubbard from the band Florida Georgia Line were getting married come from a hoax news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Brian Kelley and Tyler Hubbard from the band Florida Georgia Line have announced that they are getting married.

title: Taco Bell Announcing Bankruptcy, All Stores Closing by 2018?
subtitle: A prank news article generator tricked many social media users into believing the Taco Bell chain was closing their doors forever.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Taco Bell fast food chain is closing all of their locations.

title: Was Bill Clinton's 'Love Child' Found Dead?
subtitle: Unreliable web sites falsely reported that Danney Williams, who has claimed to be President Bill Clinton's illegitimate son, is dead.
author: David Emery
statement: Danney Williams, a 31-year-old man from Little Rock, Arkansas who has claimed to be President Bill Clinton's illegitimate son, has died.

title: Did a KGB Agent Confirm That the Sex Pistols Were Backed by the USSR to Destabilize the West?
subtitle: A Facebook page for punk fans recirculated an old (and fake) story that the Sex Pistols were a KGB plot to foment dissent in the West.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A KGB agent admitted that the Sex Pistols were financed by the USSR to destabilize Western democracy.

title: Did Matthew McConaughey 'Come Out of the Closet'?
subtitle: A misleading headline reporting that the actor had "come out" had nothing to do with his sexuality.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mathew McConaughey "came out of the closet" during an interview with a magazine.

title: Did Pastor Scarborough Blame Women's Impure Thoughts for Breast Cancer?
subtitle: The Witty Liberal Facebook page resurrected a fake news story from early 2016 about the pastor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pastor Rick Scarborough asserted that breast cancer is caused by women's "dirty" thoughts.

title: Did James Comey Tweet About 'the Pee Tape' After Getting Fired?
subtitle: A purported screenshot of a tweet sent by former FBI director James Comey is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former FBI Director James Comey sent a tweet about the "pee tape" shortly after getting fired.

title: Colored Stickers Target Homes of Dog Owners?
subtitle: Rumors that criminals are marking homes with colored stickers or bags in trees in order to steal dogs for use in dogfighting events are unfounded.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Criminals are marking homes with bags tied to trees or colored stickers in order to steal dogs for use in dogfighting events.

title: Is California Governor Jerry Brown 'Caught in the Middle' of a Corruption Investigation?
subtitle: A conservative-leaning website strained to connect Brown to a probe he personally ordered.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: California's governor is under investigation for possible corruption.

title: Did a Trump Campaign Web Site URL Reveal a Contempt for the Poor?
subtitle: Online users exploited a bug on the President's campaign website to create fake URLs.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump's website contains a release about a plan to 'fuck the poor.'

title: Was an Atlanta Man Assaulted and Raped by Gay Gang the 'Sweet Bloods'?
subtitle: A number of sketchy sites posted an item about a "gay gang" called the "Sweet Bloods" and a purported attack in Atlanta.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man was attacked and raped in Atlanta by a gay gang known as the "Sweet Bloods."

title: Did a Pink Volcano Erupt in New Zealand?
subtitle: Video purportedly showing oddly-colored smoke and steam rising from a eruption was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a pink volcano erupting in New Zealand.

title: Bill O'Reilly in Critical Condition After Being Attacked by 'Tolerant' Liberals?
subtitle: Reports that the former Fox News host was beaten in a New York City bagel shop by a group of liberals originated with a fake news site.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former Fox News host Bill O'Reilly was hospitalized in New York after being beaten by a group of "liberals."

title: President Trump Signs Executive Order Allowing the Hunting of Bald Eagles?
subtitle: A hoax article reported that U.S. President Trump signed legislation allowing people to hunt the national bird.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump signed an executive order permitting people to hunt the national bird.

title: Did Sarah Palin Say People with Lyme Disease Should Stop Eating Limes?
subtitle: Proposed changes to health care laws revived an old meme attributing a phony quote about Lyme disease to Sarah Palin.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sarah Palin said Obamacare made people irresponsible, and that people with Lyme disease should quit eating limes.

title: Did Police Make Disturbing Find of 'Obama's Muslim Refugees' in a Minnesota Olive Garden?
subtitle: A blog with a misleading headline falsely reported that Rochester, Minnesota police found Muslim refugees doing something "disturbing" after raiding an Olive Garden restaurant.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Police raided an Olive Garden and made a "disturbing find" thanks to Obama's Muslim refugees.

title: Do Leaked Photographs Show 'Muslim Symbols' in Obama's White House?
subtitle: A series of images purportedly showing Islamic writing, a sink, and a prayer room in President Obama's White House actually come from different and unrelated locations.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Leaked photographs show various Muslim symbols and apparatus in President Obama's White House.

title: Did a Little Girl Call President Trump a 'Disgrace to the World'?
subtitle: "That little girl was brave, funny and smart. Also, she said that of her own volition."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a little girl calling President Trump 'a disgrace to the world.'

title: Was Stephen Colbert Fired After One Phone Call from President Trump?
subtitle: Although the FCC is looking into obscenity complaints against the late night host, Colbert was not fired because President Trump called and complained.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Stephen Colbert was fired by CBS after President Trump called and ordered his termination.

title: Trump Purchases Ex-Rockefeller Estate?
subtitle: Reports about President Trump's purchasing a former Rockefeller estate in Maine for use as a "summer White House" originated with a "prank news" site.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump has purchased the Mount Desert Island estate of David Rockefeller.

title: Cast of 'Friends' to Reunite for a New Season?
subtitle: A rumor that the actors from the hit '90s sitcom 'Friends' are reuniting to shoot another season of the series is a hoax.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The actors from the hit '90s sitcom 'Friends' are reuniting to shoot another season of the series.

title: Did Bill Nye Say Parents Should Be Penalized for Having 'Extra Kids'?
subtitle: American television's "Science Guy" was criticized for allegedly advocating penalties on large families in the interests of population control.
author: David Emery
statement: Bill Nye proposed penalizing families with too many children to reduce population growth and slow climate change.

title: Was a Pregnant Woman Beaten by a 'Muslim Refugee' in Oklahoma?
subtitle: Not life imitating art, but life misrepresenting art.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A heavily pregnant woman was beaten by a Muslim refugee in Oklahoma.

title: Popeyes Manager Arrested for Dipping Chicken in Cocaine?
subtitle: Reports that a Popeyes manager was busted for lacing chicken breading with cocaine to increase sales are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Popeye's manager in Brunswick, Georgia was caught lacing chicken with cocaine to drive business.

title: Did Martin Luther King Jr. 'Flip the Bird' at a Photographer?
subtitle: A photograph appearing to show the civil rights leader eloquently gesturing at a camera is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Martin Luther King Jr. flipping the bird at a photographer.

title: Did Astronauts Remove Their Helmets on the 'Moon'?
subtitle: That doesn't seem like a good idea.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph showing a group of astronauts without their helmets on indicates that the moon landing was staged.

title: Babysitter Transported to Hospital After Inserting a Baby in Her Vagina?
subtitle: The story is another fake scoop from the always-unreliable World News Daily Report.
author: David Emery
statement: A 31-year-old Cincinnati woman was taken to the hospital after the 14-month-old toddler she was babysitting got stuck in her vaginal cavity.

title: Native Americans Shot Down an Airplane with Arrows?
subtitle: A photograph showing an airplane pierced with dozens of wooden arrows is frequently circulated with fabricated backstories.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photograph shows an airplane shot down by Native Americans using wooden arrows.

title: Did Mike Pence Say Americans Need More 'Jesus Care,' Not Health Care?
subtitle: A quote attributed to the Vice President of the United States claims that churches heal more people than doctors.
author: David Emery
statement: Vice President Mike Pence said, "What the American people need is not more health care. What we need is more Jesus care."

title: Was Angela Merkel's Hair Censored on Saudi Arabia State Television?
subtitle: An image purporting to be a screenshot of a news story showing Germany's leader with pixelated hair is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A screenshot of a Saudi news story showing Germany's leader with pixelated hair is a hoax.

title: Did Raleigh Restaurant Employees Sing an Offensive Song at a Group of Police Officers?
subtitle: Surveillance video disproved the story, but the restaurant's reputation has not yet recovered.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Restaurant workers at Smithfield's Chicken & Barbeque Jones Sausage in Raleigh sang "fuck the police" at visiting officers.

title: Did a Canadian Woman Wear a 'My Legs Are Open for Refugees' Sign?
subtitle: An image of a woman at a march welcoming refugees was doctored.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a woman wearing a sign reading 'My Legs Are Open for Refugees.'

title: Have Sixty Holistic Doctors Died Suspicious Deaths In the Past Year?
subtitle: This claim, inelegantly formulated on an alternative health website, is remarkable for both its incoherence and its lack of substantiating evidence.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In just over a year, more than sixty holistic health practitioners have died suspicious deaths, and the media refuses to acknowledge that these deaths might be linked.

title: Did a Missouri Teacher Staple Her Student's Lips Shut?
subtitle: A disreputable web site fabricated a story about an instructor's attacking a disrespectful student.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A teacher in Missouri stapled a student's lips closed.

title: Did a Man Stuck 71 Hours in an Elevator Kill and Eat His Wife to Survive?
subtitle: Desperate situations sometimes call for horrifically desperate measures.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man killed and ate his wife after being stuck in an elevator with her for 71 hours.

title: Did 'Nazis' Tape an Antifa Member to a Utility Box?
subtitle: Which is rarer: unicorns, or duct-taped antifa protesters?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an anti-fascist protester duct-taped to an electrical box by neo-Nazis.

title: Is Samantha Bee's Husband Fighting to Keep Poor People Out of His Child's School?
subtitle: Reports that Jason Jones campaigned against moving the school used outdated and incomplete quotes from the former Comedy Central star to bolster their claims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Samantha Bee's husband, Jason Jones, is fighting to keep poor people out of the school his children attend.

title: Did Trump Warn Russia Over Jehovah's Witnesses Ban and Urge Members to Seek Asylum in the U.S.?
subtitle: A series of fake news articles portrayed Trump defending Jehovah's Witnesses after a Russian court labeled the group extremist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump offered asylum to Russian Jehovah's Witnesses.

title: Did Clint Eastwood Get 'Terribly Tragic News' Over His Latest Movie?
subtitle: A dubious web site claimed that the director received 'heavy insults" over the film, but failed to provide any evidence.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Clint Eastwood received "tragic news" and was subjected to "heavy insults" because of his new movie.

title: Did a Woman Make Her Cheating Husband Eat His Own Genitals?
subtitle: Multiple regional fake news sites falsely claimed a woman in that area forced her cheating husband to eat his own genitals.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 43-year-old woman forced her unfaithful husband to eat his own genitals.

title: Tornado Carries Mobile Home 130 Miles, Family Inside Unharmed?
subtitle: Reports that a tornado carried a mobile home for 130 miles and left the residents inside unharmed are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A tornado carried a mobile home for 130 miles  and left its occupants unharmed.

title: Sarah Palin in a Coma After Hit and Run?
subtitle: Reports that the former Alaska governor was critically injured in an automobile accident are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former Alaska governor was critically injured in an automobile accident.

title: 'Sonia Disowns Rahul' Virus Hoax
subtitle: Warnings that cell phone users should not accept the video "Sonia Disowns Rahul" because it contains a malicious virus are a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Cell phone users should not accept a video entitled "Sonia Disowns Rahul" because it contains a malicious virus.

title: Denzel Washington Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that the Academy Award-winning actor was killed in a drive-by shooting in New York are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Denzel Washington was killed in a drive-by shooting in New York.

title: Ted Nugent Death Hoax
subtitle: Despite rumors that the rocker was killed in a hunting accident in Montana, he remains alive and well.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident.

title: Did a Death Row Inmate Eat an Entire Bible as His Last Meal?
subtitle: Condemned prisoners sometimes make unusual choices for their final meals, but generally they stick with items that are actually edible.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A death row inmate named Jeremy Morris ate a Bible as his last meal.

title: Water Fluoridation Reduces IQ?
subtitle: Studies suggesting a link between public water fluoridation and reduced intelligence rely on unsubstantiated leaps made possible by studies of
that were conducted to address entirely different questions.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Scientific studies demonstrate that the process of adding fluoride to public water reduces the IQ of the individuals in those areas.

title: Did a Cornell Student Cut 37 Pounds Using Apple Cider Vinegar and Supplements?
subtitle: Stories promoting a "diet hack" involving apple cider vinegar are based on unrelated photographs and false claims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN aired a story about a university student who discovered a "diet hack" involving apple cider vinegar.

title: Did Bill Nye Say Gender is Determined 'by Your Chromosomes?'
subtitle: An image purportedly shows a still from an old episode of "Bill Nye the Science Guy" about gender being "determined by your chromosomes."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Nye said that gender is determined "by your chromosomes" during an episode of "Bill Nye the Science Guy."

title: Is Bill Clinton on His Death Bed in Arkansas?
subtitle: An unreliable web site's claim ignores the fact that Clinton is New York, making numerous public appearances.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Bill Clinton is on his deathbed in Arkansas.

title: Is the 'Water Bending' Squirrel Real?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a squirrel appearing to magically avoid a stream of water is a composite of at least two different images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 'water bending' squirrel.

title: Trump Caught Tweeting at Mar-a-Lago?
subtitle: An unflattering image purportedly showing President Donald Trump sending a tweet from his Florida estate is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a disheveled President Trump texting at Mar-A-Lago.

title: Did Evacuation Alarms Go Off in Pyongyang, North Korea Amid 'Nuke Fears'?
subtitle: Disreputable web sites are falsely reporting that a 2015 video of a nighttime tsunami alert in Chile was a mass evacuation in North Korea.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hundreds of thousands of residents in North Korea's capital Pyongyang were evacuated due to "nuke" fears.

title: 'Muslim Refugee' Shoots 15 People In Ohio Nightclub?
subtitle: A partisan web site published false and contradictory information about the origins and religious beliefs of a suspect in a fatal shooting.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A 'Muslim refugee' shot fifteen people inside an Ohio nightclub.

title: Was an Irish Tourist 'Savagely Raped' by a Huge Orangutan?
subtitle: Reports that a man was assaulted by a 400-pound primate originated on a hoax news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An orangutan raped an Irish tourist in Indonesia.

title: Have Researchers Discovered a New 'Superfuel' 1,693 Times More Powerful Than Gasoline?
subtitle: A viral marketing campaign called a resource used in lithium batteries a secret superfuel - all with the intent of selling investment tips in an expensive e-book.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Scientists have discovered a fuel thousands of times more powerful than gasoline and just one company is positioned to own a vast majority of its market share.

title: Was Trey Gowdy Forced Into Protective Custody After Two Investigators Went Missing?
subtitle: A fake news web site published a series of inaccurate articles concerning Trey Gowdy, Hillary Clinton, and mysterious deaths in April 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Trey Gowdy was forced into protective custody after two people investigating Hillary Clinton went missing.

title: Chelsea Clinton Was Arrested for Having Sex With a 13 Year-Old Boy?
subtitle: A fake news headline claiming that Chelsea Clinton was arrested for having sexual relations with a minor was circulated in April 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chelsea Clinton was arrested in April 2017 for having sex with a minor.

title: Was a Search Warrant Just Executed at the Obama Residence?
subtitle: A fake news site used an unrelated picture to claim a search warrant was executed at the home of former U.S. President Barack Obama.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama was served with a search warrant on or around 23 April 2017.

title: Holocaust Teaching Ban in the UK?
subtitle: It is not true that schools in the UK no longer teach about the Holocaust for fear of offending Muslim students.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Schools in the UK no longer teach about the Holocaust for fear of offending Muslim students.

title: Was Hillary Clinton's Assistant J.W. McGill Found Dead?
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Hillary Clinton's assistant died under mysterious circumstances.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton's assistant J.W. McGill was found dead after suffering an apparent heart attack.

title: Was Pot Planted in Potholes in Portland?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing marijuana plants growing in potholes is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows marijuana plants growing in potholes in Portland, Oregon.

title: Parents' Nightmare
subtitle: An issue of 'Parents' magazine displaying unfortunate cover placement is just an illustrative mockup, not the real thing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The April 2005 issue of

title: Were Power Outages in Los Angeles, San Francisco and New York Caused by Cyberattacks?
subtitle: The power outages did not take place simultaneously, and they appear to have been caused by physical mechanical failures.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Three power outages that coincided in Los Angeles, San Francisco and New York were caused by Russian hacking.

title: Is This a Real 'Sea Roach'?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a sea roach actually shows an animatronic sea mite from the movie "Pacific Rim."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a real sea roach.

title: Did It Rain Black Stones on Turkey?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing black stones raining from the sky in Turkey actually depicts an ordinary hailstorm.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows black stones raining from the sky in Sinop, Turkey.

title: Is This a Photograph of a 'Hammerhead Salamander'?
subtitle: The diplocaulus was indeed a real animal that lived during the Permian period 250 million years ago.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a real hammerhead salamander.

title: Was Mia Khalifa Diagnosed with HIV?
subtitle: Rumors that the porn star is HIV-positive originated on a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mia Khalifa was diagnosed with human immunodeficiency virus, or HIV.

title: Did a New York Restaurant Refuse to Serve a United States Soldier?
subtitle: Social media posts claimed Villaggio's in Massapequa, New York, shunned a military member because he visited the restaurant with a service dog.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Massapequa, New York pizza restaurant Villaggio's refused to serve a soldier named John Welch because he visited with a service dog.

title: Was Paul Walker's Ghost Spotted on a 'Fast and Furious' Movie Set?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing the ghost of Paul Walker is actually an altered photograph of the actor's brother.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows the ghost of Paul Walker on the set of the eighth movie in "The Fast and the Furious" franchise.

title: Was Julian Assange Found Dead in a London Alley?
subtitle: A fake news item appeared to report that Wikileaks' founder was kidnapped from the Ecuadorean embassy in London and his body was dumped in an alley.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Julian Assange was kidnapped from the Ecuadorean embassy in London and murdered in April 2017.

title: Florida Man, High on Meth, Cuts Off Genitals and Feeds Them to Alligator?
subtitle: Fake news sources reported that a man from Nassau County was found writhing in pain after amputating his own genitals.
author: David Emery
statement: A man in Florida cut off his own genitals and fed them to an alligator while high on methamphetamine.

title: Did a Teen Boy Die After Pleasuring Himself 46 Times?
subtitle: Images from a fatal shooting in Detroit were used to accompany a report that a teenaged boy died of "orgasmic shock."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A teen boy died of "orgasmic shock" after masturbating 46 times in a row.

title: Did Doctors Discover a Live Cockroach in a Patient's Chest in Zimbabwe?
subtitle: A chest X-ray purportedly showing a cockroach is actually a doctored version of Marilyn Monroe's.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An x-ray image shows a live cockroach in a patient's chest in Zimbabwe.

title: Trump 'Bullies' Boy by Tossing Hat at Easter Egg Roll?
subtitle: A second video from a different angle shows that the president tossed the hat back to the boy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Did President Trump bully a boy by signing his hat and tossing it away at the Easter Egg Roll?

title: Why Is Earth Day on April 22?
subtitle: Since the very first Earth Day, rumors have been floated linking the date to the birthday of Vladimir Ilich Lenin
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The date of Earth Day was chosen as April 22 by the Unicorn Killer to coincide with Vladimir Lenin's birthday.

title: Did Marilyn Monroe and Elizabeth Taylor Pose Together?
subtitle: Two long-buried photographs were doctored to show the two icons leaning against a tree together.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Marilyn Monroe and Elizabeth Taylor leaning against a tree.

title: Woman Gives Birth to Puppies After Having Sex with Family Dog?
subtitle: Fake news web sites reported that a woman in South Africa gave birth to a litter of puppies after having a tryst with the family dog.
author: David Emery
statement: A South African woman gave birth to puppies after having sex with the family dog.

title: Was the White House Easter Bunny Sponsored by Paas for the First Time in 2017?
subtitle: This wasn't the first year the Paas bunny made an appearance at the White House.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The White House Easter Bunny was sponsored by Paas for the first time in 2017.

title: Will a 'Green Moon' Appear in April 2018?
subtitle: A 'green moon' hoax has been updated to incorporate humorous references to marijuana.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: On 20 April 2018, a Green Moon will appear in the sky, a rare event that only occurs every 420 years.

title: Did Marla Maples Die in a Plane Crash?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump's ex-wife Marla Maples died in an airline accident are fake news that reused 1997 images of a downed cargo jet.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump's second wife, Marla Maples, died in a plane crash in April 2017.

title: First Full Supreme Court Ruling in Over a Year Has Obama Furious?
subtitle: Reports that the U.S. Supreme Court issued a decision about the teaching of Islam in public schools are fake news.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled that " the only Islam taught to our children in public schools will be the history of Radical Islam and what they can do to help stop it."

title: Three Times a Liar?
subtitle: Donald Trump did not write that if "you tell people a lie three times, they will believe anything."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump wrote in "The Art of the Deal" that if you tell people a lie three times, they will believe it.

title: Is the 'Human Nacho Spa Treatment' Real?
subtitle: A video purporting to show a new spa treatment is actually repurposed footage from a comedy video.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a new health trend called the "human nacho spa treatment."

title: United Airlines Flight Attendant Slaps Crying Baby During Flight?
subtitle: Reports that United Airlines flight attendant assaulted a 7 month-old baby for crying during a flight are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A United Airlines flight attendant slapped a 7 month-old baby in the face for crying during a flight.

title: Did Eric Trump Say His Father Would Cancel Taxes for Wealthy People?
subtitle: A fake news article that fabricated statements by Eric Trump got picked up by hyper-partisan web site Democratic Moms.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Eric Trump said his father planned to "cancel" taxes on wealthy people.

title: Did a Cleveland Fox Affiliate Label a Black Murder Suspect 'Dark White'?
subtitle: WJW-TV called a doctored screenshot of their news broadcast a "distraction."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Cleveland-area Fox affiliate described local murder suspect Steve Stephens as "dark white."

title: Nabisco Announces 'Graeter's Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip Oreos'?
subtitle: Yet another seeming announcement of a new Oreo flavor was just someone's expression of a wish-list item.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nabisco has announced the release of a 'Graeter's Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip' flavor of Oreo Cookies.

title: Donald Trump Signs Executive Order Cancelling Saturday Night Live?
subtitle: Reports that the chief executive has banned airings of NBC's long-running comedy sketch show are fake news.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: President Trump has issued an order banning the 'Saturday Night Live' television show.

title: Plane Accidentally Empties Toilet Tank Over Cruise Ship, 23 Injured?
subtitle: Reports that a Taiwanese airliner dumped human waste onto the top deck of a cruise ship are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Taiwanese airliner dumped human waste onto the top deck of a cruise ship.

title: Did a Babysitter Discover a 'Clown Doll' in a Child's Room Was a Real Person?
subtitle: Reports that a convicted pedophile rapist was caught using a clown costume to hide in a child's room were fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A convicted pedophile rapist was caught using a clown costume to hide in a child's room.

title: Did a Couple Find Out They Were Biological Twins During IVF Treatment?
subtitle: Reports that a couple seeking to conceive via IVF discovered  through DNA testing that they were fraternal twins are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A couple seeking to conceive via IVF discovered through DNA testing that they were fraternal twins.

title: Did Police Find Bodies in Freezers with 'Black Lives Matter' Carved into Their Skin?
subtitle: Reports that a Chicago man named Rasheed Thompson was arrested in connection with dead bodies found in his basement freezer were not real.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police in Los Angeles discovered 12 or 19 bodies in a freezer with "Black Lives Matter" carved into the victims' skin.

title: Are United Airlines Passengers Wearing Crash Helmets?
subtitle: A photograph used to spur heckling of the embattled airline actually chronicles a training course hosted by a German airline.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Photograph captures United Airlines passengers wearing protective crash helmets.

title: Are Gays Lacing Easter Eggs with Homosexual-Inducing Food Colorings?
subtitle: Another entry in a long-running series of spoofs about holiday traditions being used to convert unsuspecting celebrants into homosexuals.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An increased number of men have contracted homosexuality after eating 'pastel colored Easter eggs.'

title: Origins of the Guillotine
subtitle: Dr. Joseph Guillotin neither invented the guillotine nor was executed with one of those machines.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Dr. Joseph Guillotin invented the guillotine and was later executed with one of those machines.

title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg Taken to Hospital Unresponsive?
subtitle: Reports that the Supreme Court justice has been urgently hospitalized are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Supereme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has been rushed to a hospital in an unresponsive state.

title: Was This Huge Explosion Caused by the 'MOAB' in Afghanistan?
subtitle: A video purporting to show the Massive Ordnance Air Blast bomb exploding in Afghanistan in April 2017 was actually an unrelated incident.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a huge detonation in Afghanistan in April 2017.

title: Did Canadian Fishermen Catch a 320-Pound Shrimp?
subtitle: A doctored photograph replaced a giant catfish with an image of a "record-breaking" shrimp.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a record-breaking 320-pound shrimp caught by Canadian fisherman.

title: Marijuana Legalized in Texas?
subtitle: A claim that the Lone Star State has legalized recreational pot use came from a web site that allows users to create their own fake news articles.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The state of Texas has legalized recreational use of marijuana.

title: Plane with Landing Gear Failure Saved by Truck?
subtitle: A video of an airliner saved by a pickup truck after its landing gear malfunctioned doesn't depict a real event; it was created for a commercial.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An airliner was saved by a pickup truck after its landing gear malfunctioned.

title: Restaurant Shut Down for Serving Human Meat?
subtitle: Rumors that various restaurants around the world were shuttered for serving "the most dangerous game" were fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Various restaurants around the world were shut down for serving  for serving human meat.

title: Was a Texas County Deputy Killed by Muslim Refugees?
subtitle: A 'Southern'-oriented news site seized on the fatal shooting of an officer, adding in some irrelevant and flagrantly untrue details.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A law enforcement officer in Texas was shot and killed by '3 Muslim refugee' [sic]

title: Did Donald Trump Sign an Executive Order to Buy Ivanka's Chametz?
subtitle: A photograph of President Trump signing an executive order was doctored to include a fake message.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to buy all of his daughter Ivanka's chametz.

title: Did a Tourist from New Zealand Die Taking an 'Alligator Selfie'?
subtitle: A fake news item about a woman's death while taking an "alligator selfie" was mistaken for legitimate reporting.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A New Zealand Woman died in Pensacola in an attempt to take an "alligator selfie."

title: Did Chuck Schumer Say Judicial Nominees with 'Deeply Held Christian Beliefs' Are Unfit to Serve?
subtitle: The misquote appears to have originated with Schumer's comments during the confirmation hearing for one of George W. Bush's federal court appointments.
author: David Emery
statement: Sen. Chuck Schumer is on record saying, "Candidates with deeply held Christian beliefs are unfit and disqualified from serving as a federal judge."

title: Two Burglars Sodomized for Five Straight Days?
subtitle: Reports that a 'gay sex predator' repeatedly assaulted two intruders who broke into his home are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A "gay sex predator" sodomized two burglars after they broke into his home.

title: Did the White House Cancel the 2017 Easter Egg Roll?
subtitle: The White House reportedly struggled to stage the annual holiday event, but it will indeed take place.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The White House cancelled the 2017 Easter Egg roll.

title: Did President Trump Sign Visa-Free Travel Policies for Various Countries?
subtitle: Fake news sites pumped out false stories about President Trump's signing visa-free travel policies for residents of a number of different countries.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Trump has signed visa-free travel policies for residents of a number of different countries.

title: John Lennon Plays Guitar for Spock?
subtitle: A photograph was doctored to show John Lennon playing the guitar for both Leonard Nimoy and Elvis Presley.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows John Lennon playing the guitar on the hood of a truck with "Star Trek" actor Leonard Nimoy.

title: Did Southwest Airlines Change Their Slogan After United Airlines Controversy?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a new Southwest Airlines slogan was created as a convincing joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Southwest Airlines changed their slogan to capitalize on the public relations misfortunes of competitor United Airlines.

title: Did Jeff Sessions Refer to Immigrants as 'Filth'?
subtitle: Prepared remarks by the Attorney General during an appearance in Arizona were misinterpreted online.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Attorney General Jeff Sessions described immigrants as 'filth' during a speech in Arizona.

title: Did Sean Spicer Say Hitler Didn't Use Chemical Weapons on 'Fellow Germans'?
subtitle: A supposed "clarification" by Sean Spicer regarding his remarks about Hitler and chemical weapons was posted on a hoax Facebook page.
author: David Emery
statement: In a botched attempt to clarify his previous statements about Adolf Hitler and chemical weapons, Trump press secretary Sean Spicer said he meant Hitler never used them on "fellow Germans."

title: Adolf Hitler Never Used Chemical Weapons?
subtitle: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer was roundly criticized after contrasting Hitler with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Adolf Hitler never used chemical weapons (against his own people).

title: Does the 'Blood of Jesus' Flower Only Bloom During Holy Week?
subtitle: That would be one coordinated flower.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a 'Blood of Jesus on the Cross' flower that only blooms during Holy Week.

title: Does United Airlines Have an Armed 'Seating and Apparel' Division?
subtitle: A doctored photo mocked the airline's recent public relations disasters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows the heavily armed officers of United Airlines' Special Seating and Apparel Division.

title: What Are 'Refried Beans'?
subtitle: What Americans call 'refried beans' are not really beans that have been fried more than once.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: "Refried beans" are beans that have been fried more than once.

title: Are Robbers Subduing Victims with Perfume?
subtitle: Long-standing crime warning holds that thieves are trolling parking lots and rendering their victims unconscious with perfume samples.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Robbers in shopping mall parking lots are using ether-filled perfume bottles to render their victims unconscious.

title: Fake News: Deadly Crash Kills Two Moms, Five Kids
subtitle: The same fake news of a vehicular tragedy has been spread via multiple domains to target varying locales throughout the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A recent fiery automobile accident claim the lives of two mothers and five children as two fathers tried desperately to save them.

title: Did Sean Spicer Say 'We're Absolutely Ready for WWIII' Under Trump?
subtitle: A quote supposedly from White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer about the start of World War III originated with a hoax news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said that the United States was "absolutely ready for World War III" under President Donald Trump's strong leadership.

title: Trump Calls United Airlines 'My Kinda People'?
subtitle: A satirical site published a report that Trump approved of airport police dragging a man off an airplane to make room for United employees flying standby.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump voiced his support for United Airlines following the release of a video showing the a passenger being forcibly from a flight.

title: Pentagon Awards Contract to United Airlines to Forcibly Remove Assad?
subtitle: A bit of military satire involving involving United Airlines and Syria was mistaken for real news on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Pentagon awarded United Airlines a contract to forcibly remove Bashar al-Assad from Syria.

title: Is President Trump Making a White House Reality Show?
subtitle: A satirical post about the First Family had readers doing a double-take.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump and his family will be the subjects of an upcoming reality show.

title: Did the Trump Organization Win a Lucrative Contract to Rebuild a Syrian Airport?
subtitle: A fake news article reported that the private real estate company had won a lucrative contract to rebuild a military airfield that had been bombed by the United States.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Trump Organization won a contract to rebuild the Syrian airport destroyed in a United States missile attack.

title: Did President Trump Experience Diarrhea on a Golf Course?
subtitle: A widely circulated photograph was a stain on the presidential image.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump with a diarrhea stain on his golf pants.

title: Malia Obama Expelled from Harvard?
subtitle: Reports that the former  First Daughter was booted from Harvard for a drug violation are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Malia Obama was expelled from Harvard for a drug violation.

title: Did Donald Trump Advocate
subtitle: "New Mexico. Mexico. It's all the same. The word Mexico is in the name of both places, isn't it?"
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that the United States should build a fence around New Mexico.

title: Etymology of Sirloin
subtitle: The cut of steak known as "sirloin" is not so named because an English king once knighted a piece of beef.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The cut of steak known as "sirloin" is so named because an English king once knighted a piece of beef.

title: 'Gates of Heaven' Photograph
subtitle: A manipulated photograph of the Swan Nebula was passed around as an image of "The Gates of Heaven" that has supposedly befuddled astronomers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Scientists are stumped by a photograph taken by the Hubble Telescope, and some believe it shows "the gates of heaven."

title: Does a Toaster Dial Set Minutes Rather Than 'Level of Toasty-ness'?
subtitle: A long-circulating image claims that toaster owners are misinformed about the purpose of a dial that sets minutes, not darkness.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The numbers on a toaster indicate duration of toasting in minutes, and not a "degree of toastiness."

title: Are Blue Strawberries Real?
subtitle: Images that purport to show "blue strawberries" were digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a rare strain of blue strawberries.

title: Do Women with Natural Hair Have Low Self-Esteem?
subtitle: "Natural hair being viewed as a messy look is causing many women to feel inadequate and less desirable."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Research by a cosmetics company found that women with natural hair have lower self-esteem than women with treated hair.

title: White House Admits Syria Missile Attack Was a Publicity Stunt to Make Trump Look Good?
subtitle: Unreliable web sites spread the false claim that senior White House officials openly admitted that the missile strike against Syria had no actual purpose.
author: David Emery
statement: In the wake of a missile strike ordered by President Trump on Syria in April 2017, senior White House officials admitted that it served no actual purpose.

title: Trump: 'We're Bringing Back the Draft'?
subtitle: Reports that Donald Trump said that he plans to reinstate a military draft in the U.S. originated with a fake news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump has vowed to reinstate the draft.

title: Was Barack Obama Arrested in a Japanese Drug Bust?
subtitle: Rumors that the former U.S. president was arrested in connection with the seizure of massive amounts of cocaine on his yacht are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama was arrested in Japan in connection with the seizure of massive amounts of cocaine on his yacht.

title: Did an Evangelical Leader Say Trump Opposers Might be Punished With a Gay Child?
subtitle: Reports that Kenneth Copeland threatened Trump opponents with gay children were actually hoax news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Evangelical leader Kenneth Copeland said opponents of President Trump could be "punished" with gay children.

title: Did President Obama 'Stiff' the Wrong Waiter?
subtitle: A fake news item claimed President Obama failed to tip a prominent Chicago businessman filling in as a waiter at Lawry's.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama failed to tip a steakhouse waiter who was actually a prominent restauranteur.

title: Are Discolored Bananas Infected with HIV?
subtitle: Discolored bananas that have fallen prey to a fungus may be visually unappealing, but they do not harbor HIV and pose no threat to human health.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bananas that display a red discoloration inside are dangerous to human health if eaten.

title: Is Ground Glass a Deadly Poison?
subtitle: Contrary to what mystery and crime dramas might portray, ingesting ground glass isn't inherently fatal.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hiding finely-ground glass in food is an effective method for killing a person.

title: Were Three Liberal Celebrities Arrested for a Conspiracy to Assassinate President Trump?
subtitle: Reports that  three celebrities were caught by the Secret Service plotting to kill President Trump are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Miley Cyrus, James Franco, and Seth Rogan were arrested for conspiring to assassinate President Trump.

title: Did a Janitor Collect $20 Million in Life Insurance on Dead Chicago Teens?
subtitle: An old fake news item appeared to play off stereotypes about Chicago and controversial "dead peasant" insurance.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Illinois janitor collected $20 million in life insurance benefits on policies placed on teenagers who were then murdered.

title: Dragon Skeleton Discovered in Iceland?
subtitle: Reports that the remains of a mythical beast were found in the Nordic island nation were just an April Fool's Day hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A dragon skeleton was discovered in northern Iceland.

title: You Should Never Put Toilet Paper on a Toilet Seat?
subtitle: Viral posts suggesting an increased risks of bathroom-borne pathogens by putting toilet paper on a toilet seat ignore both conventional logic and published scientific research.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Using toilet paper as a barrier between your derriere and a toilet seat poses more health risks than just sitting down without a barrier.

title: A Celebrity Had This to Say About Your Town!
subtitle: Fake newsmongers have spread claims about famous people praising local residents after encountering vehicular troubles in numerous towns.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An A-list celebrity had car trouble in your town and afterwards praised the locals for being awesomely helpful.

title: Did Senator Tom Cotton Announce He Is 'Ex-Gay'?
subtitle: A pro-LGBTQ site ran the story on April Fool's Day 2017, but actually first published it the year before.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Sen. Tom Cotton said during an interview that he received "gay conversion therapy."

title: Was a Centuries-Old Underground City Discovered Beneath Cades Cove?
subtitle: An April Fool's Day joke about a mysterious city discovered beneath the Smoky Mountains was mistaken for a genuine news item.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An ancient underground city was discovered beneath Cades Cove.

title: Woman Arrested for Training Squirrels to Attack Her Ex-Boyfriend?
subtitle: Reports that a woman was arrested for training squirrels to attack her ex-boyfriend are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman was arrested for training squirrels to attack her ex-boyfriend.

title: Disney Casts Justin Bieber as Young Han Solo?
subtitle: Reports that Justin Bieber has been cast in an upcoming 'Star Wars' movie as a young Han Solo are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Justin Bieber has been cast as a young Han Solo in an upcomming

title: Did Arizona's Drug Testing Program for Welfare Recipients Catch Just One Person?
subtitle: Reports overstate how many people were tested under a state program for TANF recipients.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Only one person out of 87,000 tested positive for drugs under Arizona's $3.6 million drug-testing program for welfare recipients.

title: Will Simba the Lion Be Gay in 'The Lion King' Remake?
subtitle: An April Fool's Day joke led to controversy about Simba's sexual identity in a new version of Disney's 'The Lion King.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Disney announced that the Simba character would be portrayed as gay in their remake of 'The Lion King.'

title: How to Create a Hybrid Kiwi-Banana Fruit
subtitle: A video showing how gardeners can create hybrid kiwi-banana fruits is an old April Fool's Day joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Gardeners can create a hybrid kiwi banana fruit by planting a piece of a banana and a piece of a kiwi in the same pot.

title: Vince Gilligan Announces 'Breaking Bad' Season 6?
subtitle: Reports that the creator of 'Breaking Bad' has announced the series will return for a sixth season are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The creator of

title: Does This Video Show a Plane Landing Safely After Losing a Wing?
subtitle: A video clip that shows an airplane making a safe landing after losing a wing was a promotional gimmick.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Video clip shows an airplane making a safe landing after losing a wing.

title: Did This Man Shoot and Kill a Hibernating Bear?
subtitle: A photograph showing a man posing with a bear carcass has been shared with an unfounded backstory.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man posing with a bear that he killed while it was hibernating, an act made legal by the passage of a new law.

title: Did Judge Roy John McNatt Write a Racist Memo About Black People?
subtitle: A memorandum attributed to an Arkansas judge is a long-circulating hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Miller County Judge Roy John McNatt wrote a racist memo about black people.

title: Crime in Sweden, Part III: Does Sweden Have 'No-Go Zones' Where the Police Can't Enter?
subtitle: Swedish police have identified
but say there is no such thing as a
author: Bethania Palma
statement: There are "no-go zones" in Sweden where the police can't enter.

title: Did 244 Inmates Escape From a Fijian Prison?
subtitle: A dubious news site fabricated a story about a mass escape - but it couldn't even keep its details straight.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: 85 (or 244) inmates have escaped from a Fijian prison.

title: Great White Sharks Spotted in Mississippi River?
subtitle: A photograph purporting to show two great white sharks swimming in the Mississippi River depicts bull sharks, not great whites, and was taken in Costa Rica.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two great white sharks swimming in the Mississippi River.

title: U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions Disbarred for Misconduct?
subtitle: Hyperpartisan web sites spread the false claim that Attorney General Jeff Sessions will be disbarred thanks to a letter of complaint signed by 2,000 U.S. lawyers.
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions is to be disbarred from the Alabama State Bar Association due to a letter of complaint filed by 2,000 attorneys from across the U.S.

title: Crime In Sweden, Part I: Is Sweden the 'Rape Capital' of Europe?
subtitle: Claims that Sweden leads the world in sexual assault and rape are not supported by data.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Sweden has the highest rate of rape among European countries.

title: Did the IRS 'Fast Track' Tax-Exempt Status for 'After School Satan' Clubs?
subtitle: The Internal Revenue Service granted nonprofit status in 2014 to an organization that now sponsors "After School Satan" clubs, two years before they were created.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The IRS gave preferential "fast tracking" for tax exempt status to After School Satan clubs run by the Satanic Temple.

title: Did Pastor John Hagee Say that God Made Lesbians 'Flat'?
subtitle: A quote from the founder of Cornerstone Church about the relative bust size of gay women was fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pastor John Hagee said that "God made all lesbians flat" so they can be identified by "normal people".

title: Was a Morgue Worker Arrested After Giving Birth to a Dead Man's Baby?
subtitle: Reports that a female mortuary worker was arrested after becoming pregnant by one of the corpses she was preparing for burial are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A female mortuary worker was arrested after becoming pregnant by one of the corpses she was preparing for burial.

title: Were the Words 'Hail Satan' Hidden on the U.S. $10,000 Bill?
subtitle: According to longstanding rumors, subliminal messages appear in certain banknotes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The phrase "Hail Satan" was embossed on the U.S. $10,000 bill.

title: Did the State Department Ban the Vice President of the Philippines from the U.S.?
subtitle: Reports that Leni Robredo was sanctioned by the U.S. for "destabilizing" her country's government are fake news.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The State Department has imposed sanctions against Phillippines Vice President Leni Robredo, banning her from the U.S.

title: Did Timberland's CEO Say 'I'd Rather Not See Blacks in My Boots'?
subtitle: Several legends posit CEOs saying derogatory things about black customers using their companies' products.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Timberland's CEO said he doesn't want black people to wear Timberland boots.

title: Three Sheets to the Wind: The Rum-Soaked Voyage of the USS Constitution
subtitle: Naval lore has it that the crew of the USS Constitution ("Old Ironsides") consumed more than 250,000 gallons of liquor and not a single drop of water during a six-month voyage in the late 1700s.
author: David Emery
statement: The crew of the USS Constitution ("Old Ironsides") consumed more than 250,000 gallons of liquor and no water at all during a six-month voyage in 1798.

title: Trey Gowdy Just Had a Federal Judge Issue an Order to Exhume a Body?
subtitle: Reports that the South Carolina Congressman ordered the disinterment of Vince Foster (a Clinton associate who died in 1993) are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Rep. Trey Gowdy ordered the exhumation of the body of Clinton associate Vince Foster.

title: Will Entering Your PIN in Reverse at an ATM Summon the Police?
subtitle: Entering your PIN in reverse at any ATM will not automatically send an alarm to local police.  The idea is nothing more than an unimplemented concept.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Entering your PIN in reverse at any ATM will automatically summon the police.

title: Man on Crystal Meth Kills 12 Neighbors, Thinking They're Zombies?
subtitle: Reports of a Georgia man high on meth who went on a killing frenzy after binge-watching too many 'Walking Dead' episodes are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Georgia man went on a killing frenzy and murdered 31 people after binge-watching

title: Did Jeff Sessions Say Marijuana Use Leads to Abortions?
subtitle: A report that the U.S. Attorney General said that marijuana caused more unwanted pregnancies was a hoax from a "hybrid" news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Attorney General Jeff Sessions said using marijuana leads to more sex, thus causing more unwanted pregnancies and more abortions.

title: Rev. Al Sharpton Murdered - 2 Suspects in Custody Belong to Terrorist Group?
subtitle: Reports that the controversial American civil rights activist was gunned down in Chicago are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Rev. Al Sharpton was shot to death in Chicago by members of a "domestic terrorist group."

title: Obama Orders Life-Sized Bronze Statue of Himself to Be Permanently Installed in White House?
subtitle: Reports about President Obama's placement of a hubristic statue in the Oval Office are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama ordered a life-sized bronze statue of himself to be permanently installed at the White House.

title: Do
Juices and Smoothies Contain Formaldehyde?
subtitle: Claims regarding the presence of formaldehyde in
products rely on the assumption that chemicals modified through reactions with other chemicals are still, somehow, the same chemical.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The
line of juices and smoothies contain the toxic preservative formaldehyde.

title: Anthony Weiner Placed in Protective Custody - Will Turn State's Evidence Against Hillary?
subtitle: Reports that the former politician had been taken to a secure location after saying that he had evidence against Hillary Clinton were just fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Anthony Weiner was placed in protective custody until he can testify against Hillary Clinton.

title: Hillary Clinton Appointed to Replace Disgraced US Senator?
subtitle: Reports that Hillary Clinton would be filling an open U.S. Senate seat in New York, vacated by a senator who resigned after being indicted for fraud, are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton was named to fill an open U.S. Senate seat in New York, vacated by a senator who resigned after being indicted for fraud.

title: George Soros Killed While Visiting His Home Country?
subtitle: Reports that billionaire business magnate George Soros was killed while traveling to Hungary in March 2017 are fake news.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: George Soros was killed in a plane crash while visiting Hungary in March 2017.

title: Rothschild Family Wealth
subtitle: The Rothschild family is rich, but claims that they have a net worth of $500 trillion and own 80% of the world's wealth are grossly exaggerated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Rothschild Family owns 80% of the world's wealth, with a net worth of $500 trillion.

title: Did a Woman Win a Billion-Dollar 'Matrix' Lawsuit Over Copyright Infringement?
subtitle: A zombie lawsuit that was dismissed in 2004 continues to be touted as an ongoing court case or an underdog victory.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Sophia Stewart won a large judgment in a copyright infringement suit over authorship of the film

title: Topiary Cats
subtitle: Images of "real" topiary cat sculptures are actually digital artworks created by Richard Saunders.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Images show several large topiary cats created by a retiree and artist named John Brooker.

title: Did This Dutch Politician Put a Grilled Cheese Sandwich in His Pocket Before an Interview?
subtitle: Some people have trouble distinguishing iSandwiches from the real thing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Dutch politician Tunahan Kuzu putting a grilled cheese in his pocket before an interview.

title: Rowan Atkinson Death Hoax
subtitle: A frequently recirculated Facebook hoax has convinced many people that actor Rowan Atkinson ("Mr. Bean") either committed suicide or died in a car accident, but he is alive and well.
author: David Emery
statement: British actor Rowan Atkinson, best known as 'Mr. Bean,' has died.

title: Did Tom Price Say It Is 'Better for Our Budget If Cancer Patients Die More Quickly'?
subtitle: A statement attributed to U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price about the budget benefits of cancer patients' dying quickly is apocryphal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tom Price said that it was 'better for our budget if cancer patients die more quickly.'

title: Does a Video Show an Abused Monkey at a L'Oreal Animal Testing Facility?
subtitle: A video showing an injured monkey was shared along with the false claim that the animal was injured at a cosmetic testing facility.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a monkey that was severely injured at a L'Oreal cosmetics testing facility.

title: Winston Churchill on the Arts
subtitle: Although a statement defending the importance of the arts is frequently attributed to Winston Churchill, the legendary British prime minister never uttered this phrase.
author: Dan Evon
statement: When Winston Churchill was asked to cut arts funding to support the war effort, he replied:

title: Snoop Dogg Arrested for Conspiracy After Talking About 'Murder Trump' Video?
subtitle: Fake news sites spread the false claim that rapper Snoop Dogg was arrested for inciting violence against President Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: After releasing a music video in which he fires a prank "Bang!" flag gun at a clown resembling Donald Trump, rapper Snoop Dogg was arrested for conspiracy by the Secret Service for suggesting that "someone should do what I did with a real gun."

title: Ohio's Cedar Point Amusement Park Won't Reopen in 2017?
subtitle: A Facebook prank spread a rumor holding that the Cedar Point amusement park would not open in 2017 due to safety concerns.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ohio's Cedar Point amusement park  announced they would not be open for the 2017 season.

title: Do the Confederate Battle Flag's Colors Have Religious Significance?
subtitle: An image circulated online claims, among other things, that the use of red represents "the blood of Christ."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Each of the Confederate battle flag's colors was intended to symbollize a religious concept.

title: Was the Pacer Test Banned for Child Cruelty?
subtitle: The FitnessGram Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The FitnessGram Pacer Test was banned from schools after it was deemed too cruel for children.

title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Announce His Resignation from Facebook?
subtitle: Reports that the social media maven is stepping down were fiction created to sell a skin care product -- or an April Fool's Day joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mark Zuckerberg said that he was "disgusted with social media" and that he was leaving Facebook as a result.

title: Mike Pence and His 23 Staff Members Die After Airline Accident?
subtitle: Reports that Mike Pence and his staffers died in an airline accident are fake news that reused a video of 2015 fatal plane crash in Taiwan.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mike Pence and 23 staff members were killed in a plane crash.

title: Was This Man Mugged While Delivering Comic Books to His Sick Daughter?
subtitle: A photograph of actor Hugh Jackman from a film set was shared online with a joking explanation of what it depicted.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man who was mugged while delivering comic books to his sick daughter.

title: Did a Study Find Men's Beards Are Full of Fecal Matter?
subtitle: A small news experiment involving microbes in men's facial hair started rumors that a study had deemed beards are "full of poop."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A study discovered men's beards are alarmingly riddled with fecal microbes.

title: Will Netflix be Discontinued Because of Rampant Account Sharing?
subtitle: Reports that Netflix would be closing in June 2017 because too many people share their accounts with friends originated with a prank news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Netflix is shutting down in June 2017 because too many people share their accounts with their friends.

title: Are Disney's Turkey Legs Really Emu Legs?
subtitle: Long-standing rumors that turkey legs sold in Disney parks are actually emu legs spiked after a 'Conan' TV segment.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Turkey legs sold in Disney's theme are actually emu legs.

title: Trump Cuts Veteran Suicide Hotline Funding?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump eliminated funding for a veterans' suicide hotline are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump cut funding for the veteran suicide hotline.

title: Obamas Being Sued by Malia and Sasha's Biological Father?
subtitle: Reports that a man named Ezekiel Wilekenmeyer Williams filed a lawsuit claiming that he was the biological father of the Malia and Sasha Obama are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ezekiel Wilekenmeyer Williams, the biological father of Malia and Sasha Obama, has filed a lawsuit against Barack and Michelle Obama.

title: Did Jeff Guice Say 'Sick Children Should Die If Their Parents Can't Afford Medical Supplies'?
subtitle: Reports that a Mississippi legislator said children whose parents cannot afford medical care should be allowed to die are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mississippi State Representative Jeff Guice said that 'sick children should die if their parents can't afford medical supplies.'

title: William H. Macy Death Hoax
subtitle: A prank news site falsely claimed 'Shameless' star William H. Macy died of a heart attack 'last night.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In March 2017, actor William H. Macy died of a heart attack at the age of 66.

title: Nancy Pelosi Was Just Taken from Her Office in Handcuffs?
subtitle: Reports that the House Minority Leader was taken from her office in handcuffs for plotting to overthrow the president are fake news.
author: David Emery
statement: Rep. Nancy Pelosi was arrested by the Secret Service for plotting a coup to overthrow the president.

title: Sean Spicer Handed Mid-Briefing Note Saying,
subtitle: Reports about White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer's being given an ominous note in the middle of a press briefing originated in satire.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An aide handed Sean Spicer a note that read
in the middle of a press briefing.

title: Did Bill Gates 'Admit' Vaccinations Are Designed So Governments Can 'Depopulate' the World?
subtitle: The computer magnate believes that vaccines can be used to reduce childhood mortality and ultimately reduce population growth through associated social changes, not as an agent of death.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Bill Gates has openly admitted that vaccinations are designed so that governments can depopulate the world.

title: Ben Carson and the 'Nut of the Mind'
subtitle: A statement ostensibly uttered by Ben Carson about the 'nut of the mind' holding our 'most hated memories' is fake.
author: Dan Evon
