statement: Ben Carson spoke of a 'nut of the mind' where hated memories are stored.

title: Obama Evicted from His DC Mansion for Breaking One Major Clause in His Lease?
subtitle: Reports that President Obama was evicted from his "mansion" in Washington, D.C., because he trashed the place are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama was evicted from a Washington, D.C., mansion for damaging the building.

title: Was Megyn Kelly Fired from NBC?
subtitle: The claim that the former Fox News host was fired before even starting at her new post was just another round of completely fake news.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former Fox News host Megyn Kelly was fired from NBC before even starting on air there.

title: Was Shepard Smith Fired from Fox News?
subtitle: 2017 reports that Fox News anchor Shep Smith had been fired by chairman Rupert Murdoch for being "too controversial" were junk news.
author: David Emery
statement: Longtime Fox News anchor Shepard Smith has been fired for being "too controversial."

title: Gitmo Detainees and the LARK Program
subtitle: A letter describing a LARK program under which Gitmo detainees will be housed with liberals who object to the current treatment of those prisoners is a piece of satire.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Under the LARK program, Gitmo detainees are being housed with liberals who disagree with the U.S. government's treatment of those prisoners.

title: Did the New York Times Contradict Their 20 January 2017 Report About Wiretapping?
subtitle: An image showing a New York Times front page was circulated on social media along with statements accusing the publication of contradictory reporting about wiretaps.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The New York Times contradicted their 20 January 2017 report about wire tapping in an article entitled "Trump, Offering No Evidence, Says Obama Tapped His Phones."

title: Do Left-Handed People Die Younger Than Right-Handed People?
subtitle: This popular myth has its roots in a series of flawed papers published in the late 1980s and early 1990s.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Left-handed people, on average, die younger than right-handed people.

title: Did Betsy DeVos Say History Textbooks Should Be Based on the Bible?
subtitle: A report stating that Trump's Secretary of Education wants to exclude all information not found in the Bible from history textbooks is satire, not fact.
author: David Emery
statement: Newly installed U.S. Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos stipulated that "all history books will contain only the information that can also be found in the Christian Bible."

title: Did Paul Ryan Say Women Who Use Birth Control Are Committing Murder?
subtitle: A statement supposedly made by House speaker Paul Ryan on CNN in which he asserted that women who use birth control are committing murder originated with a "hybrid" satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: House speaker Paul Ryan asserted that women who use birth control are committing murder.

title: Robert Redford and Meryl Streep: Not a Couple
subtitle: Film icons Robert Redford and Meryl Streep aren't married, engaged, or even dating, despite what a skin care product pitch might claim.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actors Robert Redford and Meryl Streep are married to each other (or planning to be).

title: Did Barack Obama Meet with Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr.?
subtitle: A photograph showing an adult Barack Obama with Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr. is chronologically impossible.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Barack Obama sitting with Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr.

title: Buju Banton Death Hoax
subtitle: An unreliable entertainment site falsely reported that reggae musician Buju Banton had killed himself in prison.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Reggae musician Buju Banton killed himself in prison.

title: Is Paracetamol Contaminated with the Deadly 'Machupo' Virus?
subtitle: Hoax warnings claimed that paracetamol (or acetaminophen) is contaminated with a dangerous virus, and its use should therefore be avoided.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Over-the-counter painkiller paracetamol is contaminated with the Machupo virus and should be avoided.

title: FBI Issues Warrant for Obama's Arrest After Confirming Illegal Trump Tower Wiretap?
subtitle: Reports that former president Barack Obama was about to be arrested over charges of illegal wiretapping were fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The FBI has issued an arrest warrant for Barack Obama over charges of illegal wiretapping.

title: Was a Japanese Man Crushed to Death by a Pile of Pornography?
subtitle: Spurious articles reported that a man was crushed by a pile of pornography; he actually died of a heart attack.
author: Megan Alpert
statement: A Japanese man was found dead months after being crushed by huge pile of pornography.

title: Trump Wants to Deport American Indians to India?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump said he was going to deport Native Americans back to India are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump tweeted that Native Americans should be deported back to India.

title: Is Ruth Bader Ginsburg Retiring and Moving to New Zealand?
subtitle: Ruth Bader Ginsburg joked about moving to New Zealand in the event of a Donald Trump presidency.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ruth Bader Ginsburg has resigned her U.S. Supreme Court seat and moved to New Zealand.

title: Man Pardoned by Obama Arrested for Murder?
subtitle: Reports that a Florida drug trafficker pardoned by President Obama was re-arrested for the murder of his girlfriend are junk news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Florida drug trafficker pardoned by President Obama was re-arrested three months later for the murder of his girlfriend.

title: Does a Photograph Show a Dementor-Like Figure in the Sky?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a gliding, wraith-like dark creature in the skies over Zambia was a digitally manipulated one.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 'Harry Potter Dementor' figure was photographed above a shopping center in Zambia.

title: Signs Designate Lots Reserved for Future Internment Camps?
subtitle: Photographs of an artist's "Future Internment Camp" sign at various sites appeared on social media without context, unnerving some viewers.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photographs depict signs marking the sites of "future internment camps" authorized by President Trump's executive order.

title: Saturday Night Live Cancelled After Lowest Ratings Ever?
subtitle: Reports that NBC's long-running 'Saturday Night Live' has been cancelled due to low ratings are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NBC's long-running 'Saturday Night Live' has been cancelled due to low ratings.

title: Did Einstein Say He Feared Technology Would Create a 'Generation of Idiots'?
subtitle: More than one cautionary statement about the dangers technology may pose to humanity has been falsely attributed to renowned physicist Albert Einstein.
author: David Emery
statement: Albert Einstein said "I fear the day that technology will surpass our human interaction. The world will have a generation of idiots."

title: Tommy Chong Death Hoax
subtitle: A death hoax about comedian Tommy Chong has been republished several times, but the Cheech and Chong partner is still alive.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Comedian Tommy Chong of 'Cheech and Chong' fame passed away in February 2017.

title: Did Ex-Wife Ivana Claim Donald Trump Is Addicted to Penis Enlargement Pills?
subtitle: A fake news site used a screenshot of Ivana Trump to prop up a false claim she said her famous former husband is "addicted" to penile enhancement drugs.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ivana Trump claimed her famous ex-husband Donald is addicted to penile enhancement pills.

title: Does a Female Praying Mantis Always Eat Her Mate's Head?
subtitle: It's far from guaranteed to happen, but the risk of decapitation for copulating male mantids would be considered alarmingly high in human circles.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Female praying mantises always eat the heads of their mates after copulating.

title: Mike Pence Promises to Create the Department of Anti-Witchcraft?
subtitle: Reports that the vice president is seeking to 'safeguard US Judeo-Christian interests' by battling witchcraft are satirical in origin.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Vice President Mike Pence is creating a 'Department of Anti-Witchcraft' to safeguard religious liberty.

title: Mysterious Staircase at Loretto Chapel
subtitle: Does a stairway at Santa Fe's Loretto Chapel miraculously stand despite having no discernable means of support?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The spiral stairway at Santa Fe's Loretto Chapel miraculously stands despite having no discernable means of support.

title: Is President Trump Sending $4,106 to Everyone Over Age 65?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump is sending thousands of dollars to individuals as compensation for hardship endured during the Obama administration are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In March 2017, President Trump signed an executive order allocating payments of more than $4,000 to everyone over 65.

title: Liberal Hero Amy Schumer Goes from Red Carpet to Jail After Threatening Trump on Live TV?
subtitle: Comedian Amy Schumer did not threaten President Trump on live television at the Academy Awards ceremony, nor was she arrested at that event.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Comedian Amy Schumer was arrested at the 2017 Academy Awards for threatening during the live television broadcast to harm President Trump.

title: Have Obama Divorce Rumors Been Confirmed?
subtitle: And is Malia really a talented dulcimer musician?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Barack and Michelle Obama have filed for divorce in Illinois.

title: Saudi Arabia: Panel of Scientists Admits Women Are Mammals, Yet 'Not Human'?
subtitle: Reports that a group of Saudi scientists had made an unusual declaration about the biological classification of women originated as satire.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Saudi scientists announced that theyhad determined women were mammals but not humans.

title: Time Warner Cable Declines to Renew CNN's Contract?
subtitle: Reports that cable television giant  Time Warner declined to renew a contract to carry CNN programming are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Media giant Time Warner declined to renew CNN's contract.

title: Did Whoopi Goldberg Say 'Military Widows Love Their 15 Minutes in the Spotlight?'
subtitle: Reports that the 'The View' host disparaged Gold Star widows as publicity seekers originated as fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Whoopi Goldberg said that "military widows love their 15 minutes in the spotlight."

title: Trump's Unsecured Android Device Source of Recent White House Leaks?
subtitle: Reports that two intelligence agencies 'suspected' the President's cell phone had been the source of recently leaked information originated as satire.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Two intelligence agencies suspect that President Donald Trump's cell phone is the source of recently leaked information.

title: Did Target's Stock 'Crash' Due to Their Transgender Bathroom Policy?
subtitle: The big box retailer gave investors lower-than-expected forecasts due to increasing online sales, news that affected the company's stock price.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Target's stock crashed because of its transgender bathroom policy.

title: Is Marijuana Legalization Linked to Increased Violent Crime?
subtitle: Although this claim appears to be making its way into political talking points regarding recreational marijuana, no credible evidence has been provided to support it.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: There is a demonstrable link between marijuana legalization and an increase in violent crime.

title: Were Several Brands of Baby Wipes Recalled in 2017?
subtitle: A web site falsely claimed that a recall of baby wipes affected several retailers and brands.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Several brands of baby wipes available in the U.S. were recalled in 2017 because they pose a risk of serious infection.

title: Were President Donald Trump's Sons Detained at Vancouver Airport over Ties with a Fascist Dictator?
subtitle: An article about Trump's sons being detained by Canada over their ties with a fascist regime originated from a satire web site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump's sons were detained at a Canadian airport due to their alleged ties to a "fascist dictator."

title: Did a Seven-Year-Old Girl Get Breast Implants?
subtitle: A story about a mother's acquiescing to her young daughter's demand for cosmetic surgery was just a bit of satire.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A 7-year-old girl was flown to China to receive breast implants for her birthday.

title: Did Democrats Refuse to Stand for a Navy SEAL's Widow?
subtitle: An unrelated image of Keith Ellison and Debbie Wasserman Schultz was apparently used to claim Democrats refused to honor a Navy SEAL's widow during a presidential speech.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Democrats Bernie Sanders, Keith Ellison, Debbie Wasserman Schultz, and Nancy Pelosi refused to stand and clap for Navy SEAL widow Carryn Owens during a presidential speech.

title: Trump Signs Law to Lower the Age of Consensual Sex to 13?
subtitle: Reports about President Trump's lowering the age of sexual consent in the U.S. are recycled fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump has signed a bill lowering the age of sexual consent to 13.

title: Does Iceland Pay $5,000 Per Month to Immigrants Who Marry Icelandic Women?
subtitle: Unreliable online sources claimed that that due to a shortage of men, Iceland was offering to pay immigrants to take Icelandic women as their brides.
author: David Emery
statement: Due to a shortage of men, Iceland will pay $5,000 per month to immigrants who marry Icelandic women.

title: Stephen Bannon: 'Nobody Can Blame You for Beating Your Wife If It's Out of Love'?
subtitle: A fake news web site put words in Trump strategist Stephen Bannon's mouth to the effect that he defended spousal abuse as an act of "love."
author: David Emery
statement: Trump strategist Stephen Bannon defended spousal abuse with the statement, "Nobody can blame you for beating your wife if it's out of love."

title: Was Sweden 'Rocked' by a 'Massive Terror Attack' in February 2017?
subtitle: An unknown man possibly discharged pepper spray or tear gas into a train car in Stockholm, but the incident did not constitute a "massive terror attack," and no one was seriously hurt.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Sweden was "rocked" by a massive terrorist attack in February 2017.

title: Does Peppa Pig Cause Autism?
subtitle: Talk of a Harvard study linking the popular British children's show
to autism went viral, but neither the study nor the scientist who allegedly published it exists.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Children who watch at least 30 minutes of
per day have a 56 percent higher probability of developing autism.

title: NRA President Jim Porter: 'It's Only a Matter of Time Before We Can Own Colored People Again'?
subtitle: An inflammatory statement about race attributed to a National Rifle Association official originated as satire.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: NRA president Jim Porter declared that 'it's only a matter of time before we can own colored people again.'

title: Did Chick-fil-A President Dan Cathy Say 'We Don't Like the Blacks Either'?
subtitle: A satirical attempt to equate one type of discrimination with another.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Chick-fil-A president Dan Cathy announced that the chain would oppose blacks as a marketing ploy.

title: Were Seven Hollywood 'Liberal Heroes' Arrested During an Oscar Party Drug Raid?
subtitle: Reports that Seth Rogen, Bette Midler, Justin Timberlake, and four other celebrities were taken into custody are just more fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Seth Rogen, Bette Midler, and other Hollywood "liberal heroes" were arrested during an Oscar party drug raid.

title: Finger Chop Challenge
subtitle: A gory-sounding protest against President Donald Trump is not a real social media trend.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new "finger chop" challenge is spreading on social media in protest of President Trump.

title: Was George Soros Arrested for 'Hate Crimes Against America'?
subtitle: Reports that billionaire George Soros was arrested and charged with hate crimes against America are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: George Soros was arrested and charged with hate crimes against America.

title: Does John Hagee Want to Prosecute Women Who Say God's Name During Intercourse?
subtitle: A silly rumor about the founder of the Cornerstone Church is just more fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: John Hagee, founder of the Cornerstone Church, wants to prosecute women for saying God's name during intercourse.

title: Did a Study Prove That Airport Scanners 'Rip Apart' Your DNA?
subtitle: To paraphrase the actual scientists involved with the research: "No."
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A study performed at the Los Alamos National Laboratory found that millimeter wave body scanners commonly used by airport security can alter your DNA.

title: Were Democratic Congressmen Busted for Planning to Assassinate Trump?
subtitle: A fake news site concocted a story blaming two non-existent lawmakers for a plan to attack the president.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Two Democratic Party congressmen were arrested for "plotting to murder the president."

title: Was the 'Catch Me Outside Girl' Arrested for Prostitution?
subtitle: Reports that "Catch Me Outside Girl" Danielle Bregoli was arrested for prostitution were fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A teenager known as the "Catch Me Outside Girl" due to an appearance on the 'Dr Phil Show' was arrested for prostitution.

title: Did Thousands of Marines Apply for White House Detail After Trump Became President?
subtitle: An oddly specific image claimed that 13,506 Marines had applied to work the White House detail in a single week.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Thousands of Marines applied for White House detail after Trump became president, and none applied during President Obama's 8 years in office.

title: Did Jake Tapper Go on a Racist Tirade?
subtitle: A piece of audio, supposedly of the CNN anchor screaming racial epithets, is actually recycled tape of reality show character Dog the Bounty Hunter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An audio recording features CNN anchor Jake Tapper using racial slurs.

title: Did Bill Murray Recommend Eating Children's Ice Cream to Teach About Taxes?
subtitle: A quote attributed to the actor is being shared on social media, but it originated from a parody Twitter account.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Actor Bill Murray said in order to teach children about taxes, eat their ice cream.

title: Did Tucker Carlson Hire an Actor When He Couldn't Book Protest Organizers?
subtitle: The Fox News host did interview a man who has worked as an actor, but he did not hire an actor to play a protest organizer.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Tucker Carlson hired an actor to play a protest organizer on his Fox News program.

title: Did President Trump Sign an Order Barring Undocumented Immigrants from Receiving Welfare?
subtitle: Claims that welfare recipients without documentation would be "sent home" came from hoax news stories.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump signed an executive order that bars undocumented people from receiving welfare.

title: Are Carjackers Using Discarded Shirts as Bait to Lure Victims?
subtitle: News reports conflated a genuine incident of human trafficking with a completely unrelated claim that traffickers used shirts on windshields as bait.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new tactic used by abductors and carjackers is to leave a shirt on a windshield to lure women out of their cars.

title: Did Stephen Miller Throw a White Power Sign?
subtitle: A photograph showing Stephen Miller with his hands in an odd configuration is real, but is not proof that the White House advisor was using a "white power" hand symbol.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows White House advisor Stephen Miller using a hand gesture that means "white power."

title: Does a Photograph Show Ivanka Trump with Vladimir Putin and Wendi Murdoch?
subtitle: A picture showing First Daughter Ivanka Trump posing with Vladimir Putin and Wendi Murdoch was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph show Ivanka Trump with Vladimir Putin and Wendi Murdoch.

title: Did President Trump Sign a Law Restricting Welfare for 'Deadbeats'?
subtitle: President Trump did not sign an executive order cutting off welfare to "deadbeats, drug addicts and scam artists."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump signed an executive order cutting off welfare to "deadbeats, drug addicts and scam artists."

title: Did Pat Robertson Say 'Staring' at Melania Trump 'Can Heal Gays'?
subtitle: A 'hybrid' fake news site built on real comments made by Pat Robertson to assert the televangelist  said looking at Melania Trump could 'cure gays.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Televangelist Pat Robertson said "staring" at First Lady Melania Trump could "cure gays."

title: Did George Washington Have Wooden Teeth?
subtitle: We cannot tell a lie: George Washington's false teeth weren't made out of wood, though the materials actually used weren't all that appealing, either.
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. President George Washington had wooden teeth.

title: 'Violin Island' in Costa Rica?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a 'Violin Island' off Costa Rica is actually a digitally created optical illusion.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an island that is shaped like a violin in Costa Rica.

title: Is This Magic Johnson's Celebrity Crew Arriving at NBA Playoffs?
subtitle: A photograph showing a star-studded group arriving at the NBA playoffs is a composite of several photographs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph showing Magic Johnson with Jack Nicholson, Michael Jackson, Madonna, and several other celebrities walking into the NBA Playoffs.

title: Did Starbucks Place Trump's Photo on the Floor So Every Customer Has to Step on It?
subtitle: An image showing a President Trump welcome mat on the floor of a Starbucks was doctored.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Starbucks with an welcome mat featuring a picture of President Trump on its floor.

title: Video Captures Acesha Bright Committing Murder?
subtitle: A woman named Acesha Bright was arrested for murder in February 2017, but a video purportedly showing someone by that name killing her boyfriend was staged.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video captures a woman named Acesha Bright committing murder.

title: What Is Presidents Day?
subtitle: What are we celebrating on the holiday known as 'Presidents Day'?  Is it really a holiday at all?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The federal holiday observed in the United States on the third Monday of February is officially designated as "Presidents' Day."

title: Were Dasani Products Recalled Due to a 'Clear Parasite'?
subtitle: Reports that Coca-Cola is recalling Dasani water products after a "clear parasite" was found in bottles in the United States are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Coca-Cola issued a recall of Dasani water products after a clear parasite was found in bottles across the United States.

title: Ungrateful Elephant Kills Man
subtitle: A legendary but false story about a man killed by an elephant he mistook for one he had aided years earlier.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A man was killed by an elephant he mistook for one he had aided years earlier.

title: Is President Trump Billing Michelle Obama For $11 Billion?
subtitle: A hoax news story reported that the former First Lady spent $11 million alone on "new furniture."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump is billing Michelle Obama for buying yachts, furniture, and other items while she was First Lady.

title: Is Obama 'Commanding' an Army of 30,000 Anti-Trump Activists from His Home?
subtitle: We found no credible evidence of an "army" or "shadow government" being formed by the former president.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former President Barack Obama is "commanding" an army of anti-Trump protesters from his home near the White House.

title: Did President Nixon Say Watergate Details Were 'Illegally' Leaked by Deep Throat?
subtitle: A meme hinting at parallels between President Donald Trump and the Watergate scandal was based on a quote that does not appear to be real.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: During the Watergate scandal, President Nixon blamed all of the controversy on the illegality of the actions of leaker "Deep Throat."

title: Did President Trump Send Federal Troops, Armored Vehicles to Chicago?
subtitle: A video shows a Chicago Police Department SWAT vehicle along with the claim that Trump sent federal troops in armored vehicles to the city.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows federal troops in armored vehicles patrolling the streets of Chicago on President Trump's orders.

title: Reginald VelJohnson Death Hoax
subtitle: 'Family Matters' star Reginald VelJohnson is alive and tweeting.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 'Family Matters' star Reginald VelJohnson died of a heart attack in February 2017.

title: Are Pharmaceutical Companies Hiding the Presence of Peanut Oil in Vaccines?
subtitle: Despite arguments that vaccines are to blame for rising peanut allergies, the claim that peanut oil is present in inoculations rests almost entirely on a misreading of newspaper articles from the 1960s.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Peanut oil is secretly present in childhood vaccines and flu shots.

title: Are Schools Banning Valentine's Day Because it Offends Muslims?
subtitle: Outrage-generating web sites latched on to old news about one school's Valentine's Day policy revision to suggest that offended Muslims demanded widespread cancellation of the celebration.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: At least one state banned Valentine's Day at schools because it is offensive to Muslims.

title: Nordstrom Files for Chapter 11 After Scott Baio Boycott?
subtitle: A piece in the Huffington Post that reports that the retail chain is filing for bankruptcy protection is satire.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Retail chain Nordstrom filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy after Scott Baio boycotts.

title: Did Ben & Jerry's Create an 'ImPeachMint' Flavored Ice Cream for President Donald Trump?
subtitle: The politically flavored frozen treat is a mockup - not an official product from the ice cream company.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ben & Jerry's created an "ImPeachMint" flavored ice cream for President Donald Trump.

title: Did the Process to Impeach President Donald Trump Begin in 2017?
subtitle: A California businessman who wanted to run for a Congress seat established a committee calling for Trump's impeachment.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The process to impeach President Trump began in 2017.

title: Was Katy Perry Taken from the Grammys in Handcuffs?
subtitle: Reports that the singer, a Hillary Clinton supporter, threatened President Trump after performing are satire.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Katy Perry was taken from the Grammys in handcuffs after threatening President Trump.

title: Did Donald Trump Insult Minorities, Students with Disabilities on Twitter?
subtitle: A rude tweet attributed to President Trump that appeared to disparage minority students and disabled schoolchildren was fabricated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump tweeted on 14 February 2017 that Betsy DeVos was correct in suggesting disabled students are disruptive in the classroom.

title: President Trump Announced a $612 Credit for 'Deserving Americans'?
subtitle: News about free money is always a hit, as exemplified by the popularity of a satirical item claiming President Trump has allocated a $612 credit for all "deserving" Americans.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump announced a "stimulus bonus of $612" for every "deserving" American adult and child.

title: Do Facebook 'Copy and Paste, Don't Share' Posts Make Your Account Hackable?
subtitle: A popular video claims that sharing "copy and paste" Facebook status updates leaves social media users vulnerable to hacking.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Publishing "copy and paste" and "don't share" status messages on Facebook leave users vulnerable to hacking.

title: Did Trump Just End Obama's 'Vacation Scam'?
subtitle: President Donald Trump supposedly sent former President Barack Obama a bill for all the vacations the latter took before leaving office.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump sent former President Obama a bill for vacations he took with taxpayer money.

title: Did President Donald Trump Ban 'Full Face' Veils?
subtitle: An online clickbait "poll" asked readers if they supported President Trump's non-existent ban on "full face" veils.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump announced intent to ban "full face" veils in public places, an act presumably targeting Muslim women.

title: Did Trump Call Trudeau 'Leader of the Igloo People?'
subtitle: An article appearing to report that U.S. President Donald Trump called Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau by a creative epithet was actually satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump was overheard referring to Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as the "leader of the igloo people."

title: Was Lady Gaga's Super Bowl Halftime Show Satanic?
subtitle: Some observers claimed they saw elements of a 'Satanic ritual' in Lady Gaga's halftime performance at the 2017 Super Bowl. Do they even know what a Satanic ritual looks like?
author: David Emery
statement: Lady Gaga's halftime performance at the 2017 Super Bowl took the form of a Satanic ritual.

title: Was Donald Trump Seen at a Swiss Resort with Vladimir Putin Before the Election?
subtitle: Reports that Donald Trump was spotted at a Swiss resort with Vladimir Putin before the 2016 election are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump was spotted at a Swiss resort with Vladimir Putin before the 2016 election.

title: Did President Trump Refuse to Give Federal Aid to California Because of the State's Sanctuary Cities?
subtitle: Reports of President Donald Trump refusing federal disaster aid to California over a sanctuary city dispute are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump refused to give federal support to California due to state's sanctuary cities.

title: Reggie, the Adopted Lab
subtitle: The heart-tugging tale of an adopted dog whose former owner turned out to be a soldier killed in Iraq.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An adopted dog's former owner turned out to be a soldier who was killed in Iraq.

title: Seniors Beware
subtitle: Obamacare does not mandate that no one over 75 be given major medical procedures unless approved by an ethics panel.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: "Obamacare" mandates that no one over 75 will be given major medical procedures unless approved by an ethics panel.

title: New Punishment for Reading the Bible in Saudi Arabia?
subtitle: A gruesome photograph of a shredded hand doesn't depict a "new punishment for reading the Bible" in Saudi Arabia.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A gruesome photograph of a shredded hand depicts a "new punishment for reading the Bible" in Saudi Arabia.

title: Did Bruce Springsteen Pen a Letter Apologizing for Letting Trump Win the Presidency?
subtitle: An open letter about President Trump allegedly from Bruce Springsteen was not actually written by the musician.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bruce Springsteen wrote an open letter apologizing for letting Donald Trump become president.

title: Did Fred Trump Run a Campaign Advertisement Called 'Dope Man' in 1969?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a 1969 mayoral campaign ad for Fred Trump called "Dope Man" was created as a spoof in 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's father, Fred Trump, ran a mayoral campaign advertisement called 'Dope Man' in 1969.

title: Would Decorated Vermont State Trooper Arcot Ramathorn Be Affected by U.S. Entry Restrictions?
subtitle: Vermont state trooper Arcot Ramathorn is a fictional character and thus unaffected by U.S. entry restrictions.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Decorated Vermont state trooper Arcot Ramathorn, an Iraqi Muslim, would be denied entry under proposed U.S. travel restrictions.

title: Did President Trump Make English the U.S. Official Language?
subtitle: Clickbait articles claiming President Trump had designated English as the official language of the U.S. documented no such thing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump has established English as the official language of the United States.

title: Did President Trump Ban 'Sharia Law' in the U.S.?
subtitle: Web sites reposted and misinterpreted a television report about one of the president's early campaign promises.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Donald Trump banned "Sharia Law" in the United States.

title: Did President Trump Fire White House Butler Cecil Gaines?
subtitle: A report that President Trump had fired White House butler Cecil Gaines for disobedience was satirical in origin.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump fired longtime White House butler Cecil Gaines for disobedience.

title: U.S. Murder Rate Highest in 47 Years?
subtitle: President Trump incorrectly told a group of county sheriffs in February 2017 that the U.S. murder rate was the highest it had been in 47 years.
author: David Emery
statement: As of February 2017, the U.S. murder rate was the highest it had been in 47 years.

title: Does a New Arkansas Law Allow Rapists to Sue Their Victims?
subtitle: A new Arkansas law makes providing a common procedure for a second-trimester abortion a felony, but it doesn't allow rapists to sue their victims.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A new Arkansas law allows rapists to sue their victims to stop an abortion.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict President Trump's Death?
subtitle: An image showing a cartoon Donald Trump in a coffin was purportedly featured on 'The Simpsons' animated TV series.
author: Dan Evon
statement: 'The Simpsons' predicted President Donald Trump's death and showed him lying in a coffin.

title: The History of the Middle Finger
subtitle: The 'middle finger salute' did not derive from the defiant gestures of English archers whose fingers had been severed at the Battle of Agincourt.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The 'middle finger salute' is derived from the defiant gestures of English archers whose fingers had been severed by the French at the Battle of Agincourt.

title: Did President Trump Enact a 90-Day Ban on Childhood Vaccinations?
subtitle: Reports that President Trump had temporary banned vaccinations via executive order came from a fake news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump signed an Executive Order banning childhood vaccinations for 90 days.

title: Are Evolution Fresh Drinks 'Poison'?
subtitle: A hoax shared on Facebook claimed that Evolution Fresh brand cold-pressed juices and smoothies were 'poison.'
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Evolution Fresh brand cold-pressed juices and smoothies are 'poison.'

title: Did John Lennon Anticipate the Election of Donald Trump?
subtitle: A dubious quote plays on the unlikely idea of rock stars foretelling the political rise of Donald Trump.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: John Lennon said in 1981 that the "only way out of the messes we've created" is to elect a businessman.

title: Did Patriots QB Tom Brady Flip Off the NFL Commissioner?
subtitle: A photograph of 2017 Super Bowl MVP Tom Brady subtly "flipping the bird" at NFL commissioner Roger Goodell is fake.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Tom Brady flashed his middle finger while being presented with the 2017 Super Bowl MVP trophy.

title: Is a Damaged Fukushima Nuclear Reactor About to Fall Into the Ocean?
subtitle: Tepco, the company responsible for clean-up after 2011 Fukushima disaster, found high levels of radiation inside one of the crippled reactors, but no reactor is about to collapse into the ocean.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A damaged nuclear reactor at Fukushima Daiichi is about to fall into the ocean.

title: Is Anderson Cooper Laughing at Kellyanne Conway?
subtitle: A video showing CNN host Anderson Cooper laughing uncontrollably at Trump adviser Kellyanne Conway is a spoof.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Anderson Cooper laughing uncontrollably after Kellyanne Conway used the phrase "alternative facts."

title: Are Abortions Linked to an Increased Risk of Breast Cancer?
subtitle: Despite early uncertainty, the weight of scientific evidence and medical consensus is that abortions do not lead to an increased risk of developing breast cancer.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Studies have proved that having an abortion increases a woman's risk of developing breast cancer.

title: Is 'The Rock' Running for President?
subtitle: A pop culture web site posted a fake announcement by the film and WWE star, touted as 'the only way' to escape the current political situation.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has announced a presidential bid.

title: Was a Large Disc-Shaped UFO Spotted in Malaysia?
subtitle: Video of a supposed UFO sighting in Malaysia in 2016 was actually taken from a CGI creation posted to YouTube in 2007.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A massive disc-shaped UFO was spotted in Malaysia.

title: Does a Vintage Advertisement Show Boy Eating a Stick of Butter?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a vintage advertisement for butter was created as a joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A vintage advertisement features a young boy eating a stick of butter.

title: Did President Trump Sign an Executive Order Naming Himself the Popular Vote Winner?
subtitle: A story reporting that President Trump ordered he be deemed the winner of the popular vote in 2016 was satire.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: President Trump signed an executive order naming himself winner of the popular vote.

title: Did Neil Gorsuch Push for the 'Separation of the White and Black Races'?
subtitle: A Twitter account falsely attributed an ex-Ku Klux Klan leader's remarks to the Supreme Court nominee.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Neil Gorsuch called for the "advancement of the white race" and segregation in a 2012 statement.

title: Did Neil Gorsuch Found a High School 'Fascism Forever' Club?
subtitle: Tabloid claims that Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch had founded a "Fascism Forever" club in high school proved false.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch founded a 'Fascism Forever' club at Georgetown Prep and made white separatist/anti-Semitic statements.

title: Did a Pizza Hut Manager Disparage U.S. Servicemembers?
subtitle: Pizza Hut confirmed that a man named 'Caleb Lee' fabricated a story about a rude store manager's decrying servicemen and first responders.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man named Caleb Lee asked for a military discount and was berated by a Pizza Hut manager for his purported sense of entitlement.

title: Media Blackout of Video Showing Muslims Chanting 'Death to America'?
subtitle: The footage in question comes from a 2014 protest in Chicago and  at no point includes the phrase "death to America."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The mainstream media suppressed video of a massive march in which Muslims chanted "death to America."

title: Did Police Raid and Burn a Standing Rock Protest Camp?
subtitle: A popular report claiming police raided and burned a Standing Rock camp was dubbed 'fake news' by a movement leader.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts burning tents at a Dakota Access Pipeline protest camp at Standing Rock.

title: Did President Donald Trump Sign an Executive Order on Climate Change?
subtitle: A story appearing to report that Trump planned a 20 percent cut in U.S. carbon emissions by 2022 was completely fabricated.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Donald Trump signed an executive order naming climate change as a threat "both to the economy and national security."

title: Did a Study Show That Hillary Clinton Received More Than 800,000 Votes from Non-Citizens in the 2016 Election?
subtitle: Trump supporters claim an academic study shows proof of hundreds of thousands of illegitimate votes for Hillary Clinton in the 2016 election.
author: David Emery
statement: An academic study cited by conservative news organizations and the Trump administration proved that Hillary Clinton received more than 800,000 non-citizen votes in the 2016 presidential election.

title: President Trump Filed for Re-Election Early to Stop Political Speech of Nonprofits?
subtitle: Legal experts don't believe President Trump's filing for re-election early will have a noticeable effect on the activities of nonprofit and nongovernmental organizations.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: President Trump filed for re-election early, which means non-profits can't criticize him without losing their tax-exempt status.

title: Did the President Sign an Order Prohibiting Emergency Room Visits for Colds?
subtitle: President Trump signed a large number of executive orders during the first weeks of his administration - but not this one.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump signed an Executive Order prohibiting ER visits for patients complaining solely of a cold.

title: Did President Trump Replace Washington Portrait with Vigo the Carpathian?
subtitle: Reports that the president was swapping out portraits on the White House walls with images of "Ghostbusters II" characters come from a relatively obscure purveyor of satire and hoax news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump replaced a White House portrait of George Washington with a painting of Vigo the Carpathian.

title: Was a Small Child Handcuffed at Dulles Airport Due to Entry Restrictions?
subtitle: A photograph from a separate viral outrage was recaptioned with the claim that it shows a small child in handcuffs at Dulles Airport in January 2017.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph shows a small boy who was handcuffed at Dulles Airport due to temporary immigration restrictions implemented in January 2017.

title: Is Facebook Forwarding Standing Rock Protester Profiles to DHS, FBI?
subtitle: According to rumors, a Facebook popup window is warning Standing Rock protesters that their account histories are being intercepted by the federal government.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook pop-up windows are warning that the Department of Homeland Security (acting under a bill known as CISPA) is forwarding entire Facebook histories of Standing Rock protesters to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Can the Queen Legally Kill President Trump with a Sword?
subtitle: "Palace staff have assured the Queen that, according to English law, Trump is a subject of the Crown and can, if judged to be damaging the monarchy, be dispatched without repercussion."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Queen Elizabeth asserted she has the legal authority to kill President Trump with a sword should he enter Buckingham Palace.

title: Starbucks #WelcomeRefugees Promotion
subtitle: An image showing a promotion at Starbucks that exhorts customers to provide the name "Aloha Snackbar" is not genuine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Starbucks offered free drink upgrades to customers who provided the name "Aloha Snackbar" to their baristas.

title: Melania Trump's Grandmother was a Soviet Soldier?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Melania Trump's grandmother is actually actress Janet Leigh in the 1957 movie "Jet Pilot".
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Melania Trump's grandmother, Olga Orlif, who was a Soviet Soldier in World War II.

title: Did President Trump's Immigration Executive Order Lead to the Capture of an Islamic State Leader?
subtitle: No, President Trump's immigration order did not result in the capture of "Rasheed Muhammed" at John F. Kennedy Airport.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: As a result of President Trump's January 2017 executive order on immigration, an Islamic State leader was captured at a New York airport.

title: Does President Donald Trump Plan to Make it Illegal to be Transgender?
subtitle: Reports that Trump has put transgender people "on notice" come from a fake news web site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump plans to make it illegal to be transgender.

title: Did President Trump Criticize Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's Social Media Use?
subtitle: Reports of an international dispute over social media usage among world leaders are complete fabrications.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Donald Trump criticized Prime Minister Justin Trudeau for excessive Facebook usage.

title: Did a NASA Study Conclude That Burning Fossil Fuels Cools the Planet?
subtitle: This claim is rooted in the willfully negligent reading of a NASA press release by a U.K. tabloid's
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: NASA now says that burning fossil fuels cools the planet.

title: Did KellyAnne Conway Say Being Labeled Racist is 'a Small Price to Pay' for Making America Great Again?
subtitle: A purported quote from a White House senior adviser came from a web site that blends factual stories with satire, and is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: KellyAnne Conway said that being labelled racist is a small price to pay for making the country "great again."

title: Did a Study Determine 25 Million Fraudulent Votes Were Cast for Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: No study proved that 25 million fraudulent votes were counted or cast for Hillary Clinton in 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An NPR study determined that 25 million fraudulent votes had been cast for Hillary Clinton in the 2016 presidential election.

title: Is This Justin Trudeau Watering a Tree in the Rain?
subtitle: Newly planted trees require watering even if they are planted during a time of rain.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau watering a tree in the rain.

title: Trump Photoshopped His Hands to Look Bigger in White House Photograph?
subtitle: Despite some convincing photographs on the internet, Donald Trump did not doctor a White House photograph to make his hands look bigger.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump doctored a White House photograph to make his hands appear larger.

title: Did Rachel Maddow Tweet That Donald Trump Needs to be 'Taken Out?'
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a threatening tweet from MSNBC commentator Rachel Maddow is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rachel Maddow tweeted that Donald Trump needs to be "taken out" before he destroys America.

title: Women Carry Anti-Baby Signs at the Women's March on Washington?
subtitle: The photographs have been on the Internet since before the 21 January 2017 march.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Demonstrators at the Women's March on Washington carried signs that said "babies are useless."

title: Will a Doomsday Asteroid Destroy Earth in February 2017?
subtitle: There may well be plenty of things to worry about, but a civilization-destroying asteroid is not one of them.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: NASA is lying about the path of a recently discovered asteroid, and it will actually cause widespread destruction when it hits Earth in February 2017.

title: Did Kellyanne Conway's Inaugural Dress Copy a 1970s Simplicity Pattern?
subtitle: An image suggesting Trump counselor Kellyanne Conway's inaugural ensemble resembled a 1970's 'Simplicity' pattern was doctored.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Gucci ensemble worn by Trump counselor Kellyanne Conway to the inauguration closely resembled a 1970s 'Simplicity' pattern.

title: Did President Trump Insult Navajos on Twitter?
subtitle: President Trump neither made nor deleted disparaging remarks about Navajo native Americans via Twitter.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump disparaged Navajos on Twitter on 20 January 2017.

title: Did Female Lawmakers Unveil a Bill Governing 'Unused Semen'?
subtitle: A commentary about recent executive action on abortion was mistaken for a genuine news about an 'unused semen' bill.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Female lawmakers unveiled a bill prohibiting the disposal of "unused semen."

title: Did U.S. President Donald Trump Declare Canadian Women the Biggest Threat After ISIS?
subtitle: A satirical article on a hoax site riffed on a news cycle controversy.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Donald Trump posited that Canadian women were the second biggest threat to America following ISIS.

title: Does Putting a Raw Cut Onion in Your Sock Cure Medical Ailments?
subtitle: Sleeping with onion slices in your socks might give you more space in bed, but it's certainly not fixing anything medically.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Placing a raw, cut onion in contact with your foot overnight
, removes
, and heals your body.

title: Did Mike Pence Say Trump Supporters Made Up 'More Than Half' of Womens' March?
subtitle: A fake Facebook account overstated the amount of conservatives who attended demonstrations worldwide on 21 January 2017.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Vice President Mike Pence claimed that "well over half" of the people at the Womens' March on Washington supported President Donald Trump.

title: Was Bowe Bergdahl Promoted by President Obama?
subtitle: A report that President Obama had promoted former Taliban captive Bowe Bergdahl to staff sergeant was fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama promoted former Taliban captive Bowe Bergdahl to staff sergeant.

title: Did the FBI Raid the CDC for Data on Vaccines and Autism?
subtitle: A known hoax purveyor spread false claims that the FBI "raided" the CDC in the middle of the night for data on vaccines and autism on the order of President Trump.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The FBI raided the CDC in the middle of the night to seize data on a link between vaccines and autism.

title: Did Trump Tweet That Drug Testing Will Be Mandatory for Public Benefit Recipients?
subtitle: A fake tweet attributed to President Trump suggested mandatory drug testing would be imposed on recipients of public assistance.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Trump tweeted that drug testing would soon be mandatory for all recipients of government assistance.

title: 'Slutwalk' Image Repurposed as Women's March Photograph
subtitle: An image from Chicago's 2013 'Slutwalk' was circulated with false claims that it was taken at a 2017 Women's March event.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Images depict scantily clad women taking part in a January 2017 Women's March event.

title: Did Dr. Phil's 'Cash Me Outside' Girl Commit Suicide?
subtitle: A fake news site leveraged the "Cash Me Outside" meme to fabricate a story about a young teen's suicide.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The 'Dr. Phil Show' guest known as the "Cash Me Outside" girl committed suicide.

title: Is 'Snowflake' a Nazi Term for the Remains of Cremated Victims?
subtitle: A persistent rumor holds that the term "snowflake" originated during the Holocaust, but no evidence backs up this claim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "Snowflake" was a Nazi term used to describe the remains of those who were incinerated during the Holocaust.

title: Did Barack Obama Put His Hand on Melania Trump's Backside?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing the former president touching First Lady Melania Trump's buttocks is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Barack Obama put his hand on Melania Trump's buttocks during her husband's 20 January 2017 inauguration.

title: Were Barack Obama's Daughters Arrested in Hawaii?
subtitle: Reports that Malia and Sasha Obama were arrested for vandalism in Hawaii originated with a satirical web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former President Obama's daughters Malia and Sasha were arrested for vandalism in Hawaii.

title: Did Trump Remove a MLK Bust from the Oval Office?
subtitle: A Time magazine reporter erroneously tweeted that a bust of civil rights icon Martin Luther King, Jr. was removed from display in the Oval Office by Donald Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump had a bust of Marin Luther King, Jr. removed from display in the Oval Office on his first day in the White House.

title: Did Trump Plagiarize His Inaugural Address from 'Bee Movie' and 'Avatar?'
subtitle: Claims about President Trump's lifting lines from various films for his inaugural address were unfounded.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump plagiarized portions of 'Bee Movie' and 'Avatar' for his inaugural address.

title: The Truth About Slenderman
subtitle: In 2014, two 12-year-old girls arrested for stabbing a schoolmate in Waukesha, Wisconsin told police they did it to appease a towering supernatural being with tentacles for arms named "Slenderman."
author: David Emery
statement: There is a faceless, semi-human monster called Slenderman who stands eight feet tall, has tentacles for arms, stalks and eats small children, and communicates telepathically with his human servants, called "proxies."

title: Did Canada Plant a 'Privacy Hedge' Along the U.S. Border?
subtitle: Readers misinterpreted as news a spoof political story that was clearly intended to be satirical in nature.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Canadian officials planted a "privacy hedge" along that country's border with the U.S.

title: Does a Photograph Show Joe Biden Putting a Gun in a Woman's Mouth?
subtitle: An old photograph of Joe Biden chatting with a woman at a town hall meeting was digitally manipulated to look sinister.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph captured Joe Biden posing menacingly with an elderly woman and a gun.

title: Pilot Refused to Let President Obama Board Helicopter Until He Saluted Marine?
subtitle: A video showing President Obama boarding a helicopter without saluting a nearby Marine has been shared with the unfounded claim that the pilot refused to let him stay onboard.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A pilot refused to let President Obama onboard a helicopter after he failed to salute a Marine.

title: Highway Sign Urged Drivers to 'Consider Canada' Due to Inauguration Traffic?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a Maryland highway sign exhorting motorists to avoid Inauguration Day traffic and "Consider Canada" was fabricated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A highway sign in Maryland told drivers to "Consider Canada" due to inauguration traffic.

title: Did President Obama Use the Quran to Take His Oath of Office?
subtitle: Only in the fake news universe could two historical Bibles be confused with a copy of the Quran.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Obama taking the oath of office with his hand on a Quran.

title: Do These Twitter Images Depict Trump Inauguration Crowds?
subtitle: Early on Inauguration Day 2017, some older unrelated images of crowds were passed off as depictions of the Trump inauguration.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Early images depict massive crowds at the 20 January 2017 inauguration of Donald Trump.

title: Does This Photograph Show Donald Trump at a KKK Cross Burning?
subtitle: Yet another of the multiple images posted online surrounding the 2016 election in an attempt to portray a connection between Donald Trump and the KKK.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump was pictured at a cross burning with the KKK.

title: Did Donald Trump Use a Receptionist's Desk and Notepad to Stage a Speechwriting Picture?
subtitle: No, Donald Trump didn't visit an auction house to stage an inaugural speechwriting photograph at a receptionist's desk.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump posed for a fake speechwriting photograph at an auction house's receptionist's desk.

title: Did Hampton United Methodist Church Mock Trump on its Sign?
subtitle: A photograph that purportedly shows a church sign bearing a joke calling Donald Trump a "pervert" and a "fascist" is a fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Hampton United Methodist Church called Donald Trump a pervert, a con artist, and a fascist on their church sign.

title: Was President Obama Caught Making Offensive Comments on a 'Hot Mic'?
subtitle: A story about President Obama, a hot mic, and offensive comments at a Martin Luther King Day event was fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama was captured on a "hot mic" making offensive comments to Al Sharpton at a Martin Luther King, Jr. Day event.

title: Was Vanilla Ice Cream Originally Black?
subtitle: A photograph of Morgenstern's Black Ash Coconut was used to illustrate a falsehood about the "original" color of vanilla ice cream.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Vanilla ice cream was originally a deep, dark black color before white people demanded it be changed in 1912.

title: Were Nazi Remains Found in the Stomach of a Giant Catfish?
subtitle: Large fish are not a practical substitute for museums.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The remains of a Nazi soldier were found in the belly of a giant catfish.

title: Did a 'Quick-Thinking' Mom Save Her Family by Performing a Sex Act on a Robber?
subtitle: "He was armed and dangerous, but so is my mouth.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A "quick-thinking mom" distracted a robber by performing a sex act on him in order to allow her family to safely escape.

title: Is 'Demand Protest' Paying People to Protest at Donald Trump's Inauguration?
subtitle: Demand Protest placed several ads seeking paid protesters in January 2017, but the "company" was not a legitimate one.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The group Demand Protest LLC is paying $2500 for people to protest Donald Trump's inauguration.

title: Are California College Students Cutting Off Their Genitals Over Trump's 'Wall' Plan?
subtitle: A dubious web site fabricated an account of a student protest over President Trump's plans for a U.S.-Mexico border wall.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Two college students have vowed to remove their own penises to protest a planned U.S.-Mexico border wall.

title: Did the Soviet Union Ban Microwaves Due to Health Concerns?
subtitle: This claim has its roots in an unsourced article from a man who likely does not exist, and whose only stated expertise came from working at an alternative bookstore and natural food shop in the 1970s.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Microwave ovens were banned in the USSR in 1976 to protect its citizens from harmful health effects.

title: Large Motorcycle Group Heading to Trump Inauguration?
subtitle: A photograph showing a large group of motorcyclists riding on a highway is not related to Donald Trump's inauguration.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a large group of bikers on their way to Donald Trump's inauguration.

title: Did a Russian Prostitute Say Donald Trump Was Poorly Endowed?
subtitle: A fake news site built upon rumors about Donald Trump and Russian sex workers to falsely claim a prostitute said he had a small penis.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Russian sex worker said Donald Trump was one of her clients and that he has a small penis.

title: Did Rep. John Lewis Skip Any Previous Inaugurations?
subtitle: Rep. John Lewis proclaimed that Donald Trump's inauguration would the first he declined to attend, but he also skipped the 2001 inauguration of George W. Bush.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration will be the first presidential inauguration that Rep. John Lewis has skipped.

title: Chris Collins Says John Lewis Is 'Like a Spoiled Chimp That Got Too Many Bananas'?
subtitle: A racist jibe purportedly directed at civil rights icon Rep. John Lewis by Trump transition team member Rep. Chris Collins was fabricated by a fake news web site.
author: David Emery
statement: Rep. Chris Collins, a member of President-elect Donald Trump's transition team, compared civil rights icon Rep. John Lewis to "a spoiled chimp who got too many bananas and rights."

title: Did Harrison Ford Compare Donald Trump to Indiana Jones and Han Solo?
subtitle: A quote ostensibly uttered by actor Harrison Ford comparing President-elect Donald Trump to "patriots" such as Indiana Jones is a fabrication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Harrison Ford compared Donald Trump to "patriots" such as Indiana Jones, Han Solo, and Jack Ryan.

title: Did Donald Trump Advocate a 'No-Wash' Bathroom Trick in 'The Art of the Deal'?
subtitle: A passage purportedly taken from Donald Trump's 1987 book
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump  advocated not washing hands after using the restroom as a "power play" in his 1987 book

title: Does Nutella Contain a Known Carcinogen?
subtitle: A number of sensational headlines inaccurately claimed that the popular hazelnut cocoa spread contains a known carcinogen.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A study has determined that Nutella brand spread includes a known carcinogen among its ingredients.

title: Did President Obama Make Millions from 'Obamacare' Royalties?
subtitle: Reports that President Obama made millions off of royalties from trademarking the word 'Obamacare' are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama trademarked the name 'Obamacare' and receives royalties every time the term is used.

title: Did Michelle Obama Get Ditched by Secret Service?
subtitle: Reports that Michelle Obama's Secret Service detail abruptly quit and left her on the street in Hawaii are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michelle Obama's Secret Service detail abruptly quit during her Hawaii vacation and left her on the street.

title: Did Donald Trump Revoke Press Credentials for Six News Outlets?
subtitle: Reports that the President-elect had begun cancelling press credentials for major news outlets originated from a hoax news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump revoked the press credentials of six major news outlets.

title: Elongated Skulls Found in Peru Could Be Aliens?
subtitle: Coneheaded human skulls found in Latin America are not from aliens, but from an ancient culture that practiced artificial cranial deformation.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Cone-shaped skulls found in Latin America are of alien, not human, origin.

title: Did El Chapo Donate Millions to Clinton Foundation?
subtitle: "Julian Assange launched an attack on the integrity of the Clinton Foundation with the latest intelligence report that says the organization had ties with Mexican drug cartel leader, Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman"
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman donated millions of dollars to Clinton Foundation.

title: Adam Sandler Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that actor Adam Sandler has been found dead of an apparent suicide are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Adam Sandler was found dead of an apparent suicide in January 2017.

title: Sarah Palin Blames 'Mexican Muslim' Immigration for Fort Lauderdale Shooting?
subtitle: A quote about 'Mexican Muslims' attributed to former Alaska governor Sarah Palin was fabricated by a satirical site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Sarah Palin blamed the Fort Lauderdale shooting on "Mexican Muslim" immigrants.

title: Was Rajon Rondo Traded for Anthony Davis in a Five-Team Deal?
subtitle: An NBA trade report involving Rajon Rondo and Anthony Davis was nothing more than repetition of rumor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chicago Bulls Rajon Rondo and New Orleans Pelicans Anthony Davis were traded in a five player deal in January 2017.

title: Was Musician Kodak Black Shot in Florida?
subtitle: An article from a dubious source reported that musician Kodak Black was shot in December 2016, but the story was a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Kodak Black was shot outside of a nightclub in Florida in December 2016.

title: Did a Former Army Sniper Shoot Three Intruders in an Adjacent Home?
subtitle: The report came out of a hoax news site that was mocked up to look like an official news outlet and was entirely fabricated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A former Army sniper shot three violent home intruders in the course of their victimizing a neighbor's household.

title: Southern Illinois University at Carbondale Closing Down Thanks to 'Social Justice Warriors'?
subtitle: A story that SIU-C  will be shuttering its doors originated from a hoax news web site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Southern Illinois University is closing down its Carbondale campus thanks to "social justice warrior" activity.

title: Does a Picture Depict Groomsmen Supporting a Paralyzed Man at His Wedding?
subtitle: After attaining Instagram popularity, a wedding photograph developed a fabricated backstory about a paralyzed groom and his loyal groomsmen.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A picture depicts a paralyzed man's groomsmen holding him up so he could marry his bride.

title: Did Twitter Delete Donald Trump's Account over 'Racism'?
subtitle: Twitter hasn't announced they are deleting the account of President-elect Donald Trump over allegations of 'racist rhetoric' (or for any other reason).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: CNN reported that Twitter is deleting Donald Trump's account over its use of 'racist rhetoric.'

title: Is Hollywood Going on Strike Until Donald Trump Resigns?
subtitle: Reports that entertainment celebrities are going on an all-out strike until Donald Trump resigns the presidency are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hollywood is going on strike until Donald Trump resigns from the presidency.

title: Did Elizabeth Warren Say Women Should Be Raped by Muslims to 'Prove Our Tolerance'?
subtitle: A bizarre and offensive quote about rape, Muslims, and Planned Parenthood attributed to Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts is a fabricated one.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Senator Elizabeth Warren said that women being raped was an acceptable cost for the tolerance of Muslims and praised Planned Parenthood.

title: Did Meryl Streep Mock a Disabled Person on a Late Night Talk Show?
subtitle: An animated image purportedly showing Meryl Streep mocking a disabled person during an appearance on a late night talk show is not what it seems.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An animated image shows Meryl Streep mocking a disabled person on a late night talk show.

title: Meryl Streep Fired from Major Project for Lying About Trump?
subtitle: A fake news article posted on several unreliable web sites claimed actress Meryl Streep was fired from a major television project for lying about Donald Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: Meryl Streep was fired by director Ron Howard from a from a "Happy Days" reboot project for lying about Donald Trump mocking a disabled reporter.

title: The People Versus the Rotating Bar
subtitle: A video purportedly showing hundreds of people being knocked over by a large rotating bar was created with a computer program.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows hundreds of people getting knocked over by a giant rotating bar.

title: Celebrity Death Hoax: Sherri Shepherd
subtitle: A fake news web site falsely claimed that actress-comedian Sherri Shepherd passed away of a heart attack at age 49.
author: David Emery
statement: Actress and comedian Sherri Shepherd has died of a heart attack.

title: 'Harry Potter' Author JK Rowling Reveals Daniel Radcliffe Is Chinese?
subtitle: The claim that J.K. Rowling said "Harry Potter" actor Daniel Radcliffe is of Chinese heritage originated with the satirical web site ClickHole.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: "Harry Potter" creator J.K. Rowling revealed that lead film actor Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Trash Michelle Obama in a Leaked E-Mail?
subtitle: An online image falsely claimed Hillary Clinton insulted the First Lady in an e-mail message purportedly published by WikiLeaks.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton said several insulting things about Michelle Obama in a leaked 20 October 2016 e-mail.

title: Is 'Blue Monday' the Most Depressing Day of the Year?
subtitle: Scientists have not really identified a particular date in January as being statistically the most depressing day of the year.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Scientists have determined a date in January is statistically the most depressing day of the year.

title: Was a Woman Arrested for Making Fur Coats with the Neighbor's Cats?
subtitle: Reports of a real-life Cruella de Vil scenario involving a Texas woman and cats are just fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A woman was arrested after police discovered she was killing her neighbors' cats to make fur coats from them.

title: Are People Identifying as 'Clovergender'?
subtitle: The term was evidently created by pranksters in order to mock individuals of non-binary gender.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Individuals are legitimately identifying as and calling for acceptance of a new identity known as "clovergender."

title: Did a Man Lock His Daughter in a Cage for Overusing a Snapchat Filter?
subtitle: Numerous fake news sites published a yarn about a man locking his daughter in a cage to punish her for using Snapchat's dog filter.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man locked his daughter in a cage because she used Snapchat's "dog filter" too frequently.

title: Did Twitter and Facebook Ban a Norwegian Cartoon About Trump?
subtitle: Rumors that a political cartoon featuring Donald Trump was banned from social media sites were likely started in an attempt to spread the image to a wider audience.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A cartoon from Norway depicting Donald Trump in a diaper was banned from social media.

title: Did CNN Alter Esteban Santiago's Photograph?
subtitle: A disreputable web site accused the network of lightening the skin of the suspected shooter in a photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN altered a photograph of Esteban Santiago to make his skin appear lighter.

title: Does Donald Trump Have Klinefelter Syndrome?
subtitle: Based on a 'YXX' notation on his Selective Service record, the Internet has theorized that Donald Trump suffers from Klinefelter Syndrome - a genetic condition in which a male is born with an extra X chromosome.
author: David Emery
statement: A "YXX" notation on Donald Trump's Selective Service record indicates he suffers from the genetic condition Klinefelter syndrome.

title: Canada Gives Polygamist Immigrants Thousands in 'Start-Up Money'?
subtitle: An anti-immigrant image makes a host of false accusations about benefits available to Muslim refugees in Canada.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Canadian immigrants with "two wives" receive a host of government benefits upon their their arrival.

title: Bob Denver Dead (Again)
subtitle: The
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bob Denver died in January 2017.

title: Jesse Owens and Hitler Shook Hands at the 1936 Summer Olympics?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing Olympic track and field champion Jesse Owens shaking hands with Adolf Hitler is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Jesse Owens and Hitler shaking hands at the 1936 Olympics.

title: Did DeRay Mckesson Tweet and Delete Disregard for 'Facebook Live' Incident in Chicago?
subtitle: A less than credible Twitter account spread a fake tweet attributed to  civil rights activist DeRay Mckesson, suggesting he said he had "no problem" with a violent act in Chicago.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Civil rights activist DeRay Mckesson made and quickly deleted a tweet in which he said he had "no problem" with a contemporaneous viral Facebook Live crime in Chicago.

title: Were Six Anti-Trump Protesters Killed by a Truck While Blocking a Freeway?
subtitle: Reports that a group of "Dump Trump" protesters was fatally struck by a truck while blocking a Seattle freeway came from a known hoax purveyor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Six anti-Trump protesters were killed by a truck in the course of demonstrating on a freeway.

title: Does This X-Ray Show a Snake Inside a Woman's Body?
subtitle: An x-ray image showing a slender creature inside a woman's pelvic area has been shared with a variety of backstories attached to it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An x-ray image shows a snake that entered a woman's stomach by crawling through her vagina.

title: Were 20 Koalas Rescued from an Animal Brothel in Australia?
subtitle: Reports that koalas and other animals are being sex trafficked in Australia are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Australian authorities saved 20 koalas from what is believed to be one of several underground animal brothels in the area.

title: Did Joel Osteen Offer to Reveal God's Plan in Exchange for $5,000?
subtitle: A fake tweet attributed to the televangelist says anyone who gives his ministry $5,000 will receive a personal message from on high.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Joel Osteen offered to reveal "God's plan" to anyone who donated $5,000 to his ministry.

title: Are Thieves Handing Out Key Rings at Gas Stations to Track Victims?
subtitle: Reports that criminals are handing out key rings with transmitters embedded in them in order to keep tabs on potential victims are an old hoax.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Criminals at gas stations are handing out key rings with transmitters that enable them to track potential burglary or carjacking victims.

title: Did the ADA Say Semen Reduces Plaque and Tartar by 77%?
subtitle: Despite claims to the contrary, the ADA has not issued any guidance on the use of semen as either a dental cleaning aid or as a dental supplement.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The American Dental Association said semen cuts plaque and tartar by 77%.

title: Do Oreo Cookies Carry a Secret Message?
subtitle: The meaning of the ornate design stamped on every Oreo cookie is a riddle wrapped in an enigma between two chocolate wafers and a luscious cream filling.
author: David Emery
statement: Symbols embossed on the exterior surfaces of Oreo cookies link the product to the alleged conspiratorial activities of the Knights Templar and Freemasons.

title: Did Donald Trump Tweet and Delete New Year's Eve Regrets Over Winning?
subtitle: An image of a supposed deleted tweet from Donald Trump expressed feelings of regret and inadequacy over winning the presidency.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Donald Trump tweeted and deleted a candid, regretful statement in the early hours of New Year's Day.

title: 'Hairy Spider Monkey' Found on Mars?
subtitle: Unless 'hairy spider monkey' is your name for 'run-of-the-mill Mars rock', this report is something of a letdown.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Close examination of a photograph taken by NASA's Mars Curiosity Rover shows the presence of a hairy, spider-monkey like creature.

title: Malia Obama Highest-Paid Heir in the World?
subtitle: False rumors that First Daughter Malia Obama was named the "Highest-Paid Heir" were started by a "satire" publication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Presidential daughter Malia Obama was named the highest-paid heir in 2017.

title: Is the Modern Face of Jesus Modeled on a 'Gangster's Son'?
subtitle: Common depictions of Jesus as possessing blonde hair and blue eyes are a rather ahistorical curiosity.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The modern image of Jesus is modeled on Cesare Borgia, a gangster's son.

title: Ronda Rousey Death Hoax
subtitle: A fake news site appropriated the name of a popular newspaper to claim MMA fighter Ronda Rousey was found dead in her bathtub.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: MMA fighter Ronda Rousey has been found dead in her bathtub.

title: Did Several Musicians Die with White BIC Lighters in Their Pockets?
subtitle: An unsubstantiated pop culture rumor holds that Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison, Janis Joplin, and Kurt Cobain all passed away with white BIC lighters in their pockets.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison, Janis Joplin, and Kurt Cobain all died with white Bic lighters in their pockets.

title: Is the Former Clinton Foundation CEO Missing?
subtitle: Eric Braverman announced he had been hired to join a new foundation.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former Clinton Foundation CEO Eric Braverman has gone "missing."

title: Did Donald Trump Appoint Sarah Palin as a Science Advisor?
subtitle: A report that President-elect Trump appointed the former governor of Alaska as a Science and Technology Advisor is a fake news tidbit.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President-Elect Donald Trump appointed Sarah Palin Science and Technology Advisor.

title: Are You Shopping at One of Target's Sharia-Compliant Stores?
subtitle: A photograph depicting a sign at Target informing customers purchasing pork or alcohol to choose another lane to accommodate Muslim employees is not real.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A photograph depicts a sign at Target informing customers purchasing pork or alcohol to choose another lane to accommodate Muslim employees.

title: President Obama Pardoned Rapper C-Murder?
subtitle: An article from "Gummy Post" incorrectly stated that convicted rapper C-Murder was pardoned by President Obama on 7 December 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama issued a full pardon for rapper C-Murder.

title: Are Oprah Winfrey and Tyler Perry Holding Giveaways?
subtitle: Despite the insistence of numerous scams on social media, Oprah Winfrey and Tyler Perry are not giving away cars, houses, money, or anything else on Facebook.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Oprah Winfrey and/or Tyler Perry are offering big-ticket Facebook giveaways.

title: Did Bristol Palin Say Artists Won't Play Inauguration for Fear of Falling in Love with Trump?
subtitle: Bristol Palin's comments about performers declining to appear at Trump's inauguration were padded by a fake news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bristol Palin said performers were afraid performing a his inauguration would cause them to "fall in love" with Donald Trump.

title: Is an Experimental Nazi Missile Aimed at the U.S.?
subtitle: A missile was not launched into space by Nazis in 1944, and is not headed for the midwestern United States.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An experimental Nazi missile launched in 1944 is expected to enter orbit, and threatens the midwestern United States.

title: Are Two Handfuls of Cashews Equivalent to a Dose of Prozac for Depression?
subtitle: There is no evidence "two handfuls" of cashews are as effective as a dose of Prozac, despite a meme stating otherwise.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Two handfuls of cashews are equivalent to one dose of Prozac in treating depression, and can be safely substituted for prescribed drugs.

title: Stevie Wonder Death Hoax
subtitle: A report that musician Stevie Wonder was killed in a car crash in December 2016 is fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Stevie Wonder was killed in a car crash in December 2016

title: Electoral College Elector Commits Suicide to Avoid Voting for Donald Trump?
subtitle: A report that a reluctant member of the Electoral College took his own life to avoid voting for Donald Trump is fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A member of the Electoral College committed suicide to avoid casting a vote for Donald Trump.

title: Did a Drunken Sailor Use a Raccoon to Bypass an Ignition Interlock?
subtitle: A humorous viral police report claimed a drunk Navy petty officer used a raccoon to bypass an ignition interlock system installed in his vehicle.
