author: Dan Evon
statement: A Navy officer was arrested for "abuse of public animal" and "drunken or reckless driving" after he used a raccoon to bypass an ignition interlock system.

title: Did Sinclair Lewis Say This About Fascism in America?
subtitle: Nobel Prize-winning author Sinclair Lewis allegedly warned that when fascism comes to America it will be "wrapped in the flag and carrying a cross."
author: David Emery
statement: Sinclair Lewis said "When fascism comes to America it will be wrapped in the flag and carrying a cross."

title: Was a Chinese Restaurant in Florida Shuttered for Serving Dog Meat?
subtitle: A fake news site recycled an ancient urban legend about Chinese restaurants secretly serving dog meat.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Chinese restaurant in Coral Springs, Florida was busted serving dog meat.

title: Warning Issued by Thailand About HIV in Canned Food?
subtitle: Age-old rumors about viral contamination of food evolved into a claim that HIV is present in canned food from Thailand.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The government of Thailand issued a warning about canned food contaminated with HIV.

title: Is John Amos Dead?
subtitle: Reports from December 2016 claiming that actor John Amos had passed away from a heart attack were fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor John Amos died from a heart attack on 28 December 2016.

title: Did Carrie Fisher Do Her Own Rewrites for 'The Empire Strikes Back'?
subtitle: An image circulating online falsely attributed some dialogue changes to the Hollywood icon.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Carrie Fisher contributed script revisions during the filming of "The Empire Strikes Back"

title: Was a Man Charged with Driving Under the Influence of Caffeine?
subtitle: Solano County prosecutors said they believe the man was under the influence of a substance that did not show up in lab results.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A man was charged with a DUI for drinking too much caffeine.

title: Are Walmart Holiday Rawhide Bones Toxic to Dogs?
subtitle: Despite rumors, Walmart has not recalled holiday rawhide bones due to formaldehyde contamination.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Walmart has recalled holiday rawhide bones for dogs because they are laced with formaldehyde and have already killed at least one dog.

title: Did Sinbad Play a Genie in the 1990s Movie 'Shazaam'?
subtitle: Although many viewers claim to clearly recall comedian Sinbad's playing a genie in a movie called "Shazaam," those memories appear to be yet another example of the "Mandela Effect."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The 1990s movie "Shazaam" starred comedian Sinbad as a genie.

title: Russia Has Reached Saturn?
subtitle: No country has yet succeeded in sending a manned vessel to Mars, let alone Saturn.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Russians have sent a manned space craft to Saturn and it's being hidden from the public.

title: Are Meryl Streep and Morgan Freeman Future's Parents?
subtitle: The claim that the musician Future is the "love child" of Streep and Freeman originated from an Internet meme.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Morgan Freeman and Meryl Streep are the biological parents of rap artist Future.

title: Trump Threatened Military Action Against Mexico?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a tweet in which Donald Trump threatened military action against Mexico is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump threatened military action against Mexico in a tweet sent on Christmas Eve.

title: Are Former Presidents Snubbing Donald Trump's Inauguration?
subtitle: At least three former Presidents will reportedly be attending the 20 January 2017 ceremony.
author: Dan Evon
statement: All living former presidents have refused to attend Donald Trump's inauguration.

title: DeGrasse Tyson Robbed 'a Dope Dealer in Harlem'
subtitle: Astrophysicist Neil DeGrasse Tyson did not convey a bizarre tale of robbing a drug dealer of LSD when explaining the impetus for his career.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Neil DeGrasse Tyson said his interest in "astrological [physics]" stemmed from his experience stealing and consuming large quantities of LSD as a young teen in Harlem.

title: Charleston Church Shooter Dylann Roof Was Raped in His Cell
subtitle: A rumor that convicted Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof was raped in prison was spread by a fake news site and has no basis in fact.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Convicted Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof was raped in prison.

title: Celebrity Death Hoax: WWE's 'Big Show'
subtitle: A fake wrestling news web site claimed Big Show was killed in a car accident.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Wrestler 'Big Show' was killed in a car accident.

title: The Origins of Boxing Day
subtitle: Does the name of Boxing Day come from the need to rid the house of empty boxes on the day after Christmas?
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The name of Boxing Day comes from the need to rid the house of empty boxes the day after Christmas

title: Did Coca-Cola Invent the Modern Image of Santa Claus?
subtitle: The image of Santa Claus as a jolly large man in a red-and-white suit was the standard long before Coca-Cola co-opted it for their advertising.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The modern image of Santa Claus was created by the Coca-Cola Company.

title: Are Thieves Stealing License Plates in a Carjacking Scheme?
subtitle: No, carjackers are not lying in wait to steal your license plates before stealing your car.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new trend in carjacking involves the theft of your license plates by robbers who later lure you into a carjacking by pretending they "found" your tags.

title: Obama Launches First Salvo in War on Christmas?
subtitle: The Obama administration has not issued a ban on sending Christmas cards to U.S. military members serving overseas.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Obama administration issued a ban on sending Christmas cards to U.S. military members serving overseas.

title: Does U.S. Law Require Alcohol to Be Radioactive?
subtitle: If such a law existed - which it does not - the scientific rationale would be valid.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Liquor and wine are illegal in the U.S. unless they are radioactive.

title: Did the Crew of Air Force One Refuse to Fly Obama 6000 Miles 'Just to Play Golf'?
subtitle: Rumors holding that the crew of Air Force One refused to fly President Obama for non-business purposes originated with a junk news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The flight crew of Air Force One refused to fly President Obama 6,000 miles to play a round of golf.

title: Do Salt Lamps Provide Multiple Health Benefits?
subtitle: Salt lamps cure everything -- if by
you mean a lack of cozy mood lighting.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Salt lamps, because they emit negatively charged ions, impart myriad health benefits including reduced anxiety, improved sleep, increased energy, and protection from an

title: Obama-Led U.N. Has Just Made It Official, U.S. to Immediately Pay Blacks 'Reparations'
subtitle: Untrustworthy web sites reported that at President Obama's behest, the United Nations ordered the U.S. to pay reparations to African Americans for slavery.
author: David Emery
statement: Led by President Obama, the United Nations ordered the U.S. to pay reparations to African Americans for slavery.

title: Drunk Man has Sex with Snowman, Loses Genitals to Frostbite
subtitle: Fake news sites cannibalized a 2013 tabloid fabrication about a man who lost his genitals to frostbite after a sexual encounter with a snowman.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An habitual alcohol abuser lost his penis to frostbite after a drunken sexual encounter with a snowman.

title: Nickelback to Play at Inauguration
subtitle: A message allegedly sent by Donald Trump on Twitter stating that Nickelback would play at his inauguration was fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump posted a message on Twitter stating that Nickelback would play at his inauguration.

title: Do Coil Mattresses Cause Cancer by Amplifying Radio Waves?
subtitle: The misconception that coil mattresses promote cancer came from a 'Scientific American' blog post that interpreted the results of an already wildly speculative paper incorrectly.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Coiled mattresses cause cancer by amplifying radio waves.

title: Delta Ejects Passenger for Speaking Arabic
subtitle: Adam Saleh, who shared a video of what he claimed was his removal from a Delta flight for speaking Arabic, is a known prankster.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Adam Saleh was ejected from a Delta flight for speaking Arabic.

title: Will Tonight Be the Darkest Night in 500 Years?
subtitle: A 2010 article about the imminent occurrence of the "darkest night in 500 years" and a lunar eclipse circulated as new in 2014 and again in 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The "darkest night in 500 years" will take place on 20 December 2016 due to a lunar eclipse.

title: Did Donald Trump Threaten to Arrest Alec Baldwin?
subtitle: A tweet in which the U.S. President threatened to arrest the actor who has famously portrayed him on 'Saturday Night Live' is a fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump threatened via Twitter to arrest actor Alec Baldwin for sedition.

title: Putin Quote Criticizes Obama
subtitle: A quote ostensibly uttered by Russian president Vladimir Putin criticizing President Obama is a fabricated one.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Vladimir Putin said that 'ISIS will regret' assassinating a Russian ambassador since he is 'not Obama' and this is 'not Benghazi.'

title: 'Rudy Giuliani' Banned From Twitter for Pizzagate Tweets
subtitle: The @RudolphGiuliani Twitter account (not affiliated with the former New York City mayor) was suspended after sending messages about the #Pizzagate conspiracy theory.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani was suspended from Twitter after sending messages about Pizzagate.

title: Trump Takes Victory Tour of Moscow's Red Square
subtitle: A report that Donald Trump would travel to Russia's famed Red Square as part of his "victory tour" originated with a fake news web site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump will include Moscow's Red Square in the stops along his "victory tour."

title: Restaurant Staff Walks Out When Obamas Walk In
subtitle: An article reporting that the staff at a restaurant in Hawaii walked out in protest over President Obama's visit was fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The staff at a restaurant in Hawaii walked out in protest over President Obama's visit.

title: Podesta Emails Show 3 PROMINENT Republicans on Clinton Payroll
subtitle: Reports that three prominent Republicans were bribed by Hillary Clinton to speak out against Donald Trump originated with a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An e-mail published by WikiLeaks revealed that three prominent Republicans were on Hillary Clinton's payroll.

title: Pussy Quipped
subtitle: A purported quip by 'Tonight Show' host Johnny Carson regarding Zsa Zsa Gabor and her cat has become one of the most infamous of broadcast legends.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Johnny Carson made a risque remark to a starlet who appeared on the

title: National Security Agencies on High Alert After Trump Caught Telling Dangerous Lie
subtitle: A clickbait item falsely suggested new information about Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin caused U.S. national security agencies to go on "high alert."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: U.S. national security agencies went on "high alert" after President-Elect Donald Trump was caught telling "a dangerous lie."

title: Minnesota Vikings Open Their Stadium to Shelter the Homeless
subtitle: Several news outlets filed reports incorrectly stating that the Minnesota Vikings had opened their stadium to shelter the homeless on a cold winter night.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Minnesota Vikings opened Bank Stadium to shelter the homeless on a frigid night in December 2016.

title: Bandits Posing as Gas Company Workers
subtitle: Some social media users may have been too young to get a somewhat obvious joke about "bandits" attempting home entries by posing as gas company workers.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts two men known to be posing as gas company workers in an attempt to gain access to homes and rob them.

title: Social Security Numbers Assigned by Race
subtitle: Rumor claims the U.S. government assigns Social Security numbers on the basis of race, a practice that permits employers to screen applicants and weed out those of color.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.S. government assigns Social Security numbers on the basis of race.

title: Video Shows Phone Exploding in CeeLo Green's Face?
subtitle: Undated and unverified surveillance video supposedly showed former 'The Voice' star CeeLo Green falling to the ground when a mobile phone exploded in his face. It was actually a clip from a music video he was shooting.
author: David Emery
statement: Singer and former "The Voice" star CeeLo Green was injured in a mobile phone explosion captured on video.

title: Did Congress Pass a Bill Allowing the Government to Microchip Citizens with 'Mental Disabilities'?
subtitle: Unreliable web sites claimed that H.R. 4919, a House bill passed in December 2016, would allow the microchipping of American citizens for tracking purposes.
author: David Emery
statement: H.R. 4919, passed on 8 December 2016, allows the microchipping of "mentally disabled" citizens such as patients with autism and Alzheimer's disease.

title: Convicted Charleston Shooter Dylann Roof Is Child Actor John Christian Graas
subtitle: The conviction of Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof led to the recirculation of rumors he is actually a former child star and crisis actor named John Christian Graas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof is actually a former child star and crisis actor named John Christian Graas.

title: Make-a-Wish Touchdown
subtitle: A comedy video showing a football player tackling a child running for a touchdown was mistaken by some as genuine footage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A "Make-A-Wish" experience was ruined when a high school football player tackled a sick child running for a touchdown.

title: John Kasich Said We Can't Entrust 'Abortion Decision' to Women?
subtitle: A fake news site attributed fabricated, controversial remarks to Ohio Governor John Kasich.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: John Kasich said if women can't be trusted to "keep their legs closed," then they are unfit to choose abortion.

title: Russian Reality Show 'Game2: Winter' Allows Rape, Murder?
subtitle: Misleading headlines falsely stated that a Russian reality television show allows violent crimes during the course of its taping.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A forthcoming Russian reality show called "Game2: Winter" will permit contestants to commit crimes, including rape and murder.

title: Are the Syrian 'White Helmets' Rescue Organization Terrorists?
subtitle: A nongovernmental search-and-rescue organization on the ground in Syria has drawn a lot of attention, but claims they are linked to terrorists are unfounded.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The search-and-rescue organization in Syria, the White Helmets, is linked to terrorists.

title: 'Muslim Migrants' Tore Down a Christmas Tree in Italy?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing Muslim pulling down a Christmas tree actually shows a group of Italian teenagers (religion unknown).
author: Dan Evon
statement: A group of Muslims tore down a Christmas tree in Italy.

title: Donald Trump Appoints Kanye West to Cabinet Position?
subtitle: A number of satirical or outright fake news articles reported that the President-elect had appointed Kanye West to a cabinet position.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President-Elect Donald Trump appointed Kanye West to a cabinet position.

title: Syrian War Victims Are Being 'Recycled' and Al Quds Hospital Was Never Bombed?
subtitle: The idea that victims of mass tragedies are "recycled" is a common theme among conspiracy theorists, but there are international reports and footage of the Al Quds Hospital attack.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Victims of atrocities in Syria are being "recycled" by anti-government activists.

title: Florida Moves for Full Recount of State Votes Over Massive Voter Fraud
subtitle: Despite reports, the state of Florida has not uncovered voter fraud, nor has it moved for a full recount.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The state of Florida is "moving" to undertake a "full recount" of all 2016 general election votes after "massive voter fraud" was uncovered.

title: First Recorded Marijuana Overdose Occurs Hours After Massachusetts Legalization?
subtitle: Just after recreational marijuana was officially legalized in Massachusetts, hoax reports appeared about the first recorded cannabis overdose.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hours after Massachusetts legalized recreational marijuana, the state had its first cannabis overdose.

title: Did a Mall Santa Beat Up a Child Molester?
subtitle: A mall Santa reportedly assaulted a pedophile after a child confided that her stepfather was molesting her.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man working as Santa Claus in a Wisconsin mall beat up a child molester after a child confided that her stepfather had been "touching" her.

title: Were Several Men Arrested for Sexually Assaulting a Crocodile?
subtitle: South African men did not revenge themselves on a crocodile that was eating their livestock by raping it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Brothers in Limpopo, South Africa, were arrested for raping a crocodile.

title: Did McDonald's 2016 Holiday Cups Include a Risque Image?
subtitle: A McDonald's holiday cup featuring a picture of two mittens was altered to make a risque image that did not appear on the original packaging.
author: Dan Evon
statement: McDonald's released a holiday cup that unintentionally featured a risque image.

title: Is This Santa's Phone Number?
subtitle: A Facebook page advertising a phone number to supposedly allow children to talk to "Santa Claus" actually leads unsuspecting callers somewhere unexpected.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A number advertised on a Facebook page lets callers "leave messages" for Santa Claus.

title: Does Everyone with Cancer Have a pH That Is Too Acidic?
subtitle: This premise is rooted in a cherry-picked reading of science, based on information that has not been updated since the Eisenhower administration.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Everyone with cancer has a pH that is too acidic.

title: The Pizzagate Survivor
subtitle: A video of a 15-year-old recounting her story of abuse was taken in 1989, and has nothing to do with 2016's "Pizzagate" conspiracy theory.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a "Pizzagate" survivor recounting her story of sexual abuse.

title: Did Donald Trump Say the Earth Is Flat?
subtitle: Rumors that the President-elect believes the world is flat originated from a hoax and satire web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that he believes that the Earth is flat.

title: Did Donald Trump Say the Earth Is Flat?
subtitle: Rumors that the President-elect believes the world is flat originated from a hoax and satire web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that he believes that the Earth is flat.

title: Secret Pancakes On $5 Bill
subtitle: An image that purports to show a stack of pancakes revealed by a properly folded bill is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Folding a $5 bill in a specific pattern will reveal a secret image of a stack of pancakes.

title: Buzz Aldrin Tweeted 'We are all in Danger, it is Evil Itself'?
subtitle: A conspiracy site claimed that the astronaut tweeted - then deleted - a dire warning that humanity was in "danger" from "evil itself" in Antarctica.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Astronaut Buzz Aldrin sent a tweet claiming that humanity was in danger, and that a mysterious "it" was "evil itself."

title: Did Candy Canes Originate as Religious Symbols?
subtitle: Despite modern religious legends, candy canes were not created as Christian symbols representing the blood and purity of Jesus.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Candy canes were created as Christian symbols representing the blood and purity of Jesus.

title: House Democrats Strike to Implement Sharia Law
subtitle: Unreliable news sources reported that Democrats tried to implement Sharia law in the U.S. via legislation condemning violence and hate speech toward Muslims.
author: David Emery
statement: Congressional Democrats attempted to implement Sharia law by enacting House Resolution 569, a condemnation of violence and bigotry against Muslims.

title: Soccer Team Chapecoense Fined for Forfeiting Final Match
subtitle: While Brazil does fine soccer teams for forfeiting games, reports that Chapecoense had to pay up after a devastating plane crash were premature.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chapecoense, the soccer team which lost 19 players in a plane crash, was fined for forfeiting their final match.

title: Trump Says Africans Are Poor Because They Think of Sex Instead of Farming?
subtitle: The quote originated on questionable blogs in 2015.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: President-elect Donald Trump said Africans are poor because "when it rains they think of sex instead of farming."

title: California Bill Enables Government to Seize Children?
subtitle: An "alternative health" site slammed state Sen. Richard Pan over a bill it says would endanger families.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A California Senate bill gives the state the right to seize children from their families

title: Muslim Man Slaps Christian Woman
subtitle: A video showing a controversial Russian teacher smacking one of his students was recirculated with a claim that it shows a Muslim man slapping a Christian woman.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a Muslim man slapping a Christian woman.

title: Is This a Real Boston Bruins Fan Sign?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly shows two female fans holding up a risque  sign at a hockey game.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two Boston Bruins fan holding a sign stating that they performed a sex act with player Tyler Seguin.

title: Democrats File Treason Charges Against Trump
subtitle: Although a Democratic super PAC claimed they were filing a complaint against Donald Trump and others for treason, no actual legal charges have been brought.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Democrats have filed treason charges against President-elect Donald Trump, the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and Rudy Giuliani.

title: Will Landlines Eventually Dial 911 or Emergency Services if Left Off the Hook?
subtitle: Long-circulating rumors hold that phones left off the hook will eventually dial emergency services to ensure that nothing bad has happened to the caller.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A landline disengaged from its cradle will eventually self-dial 911.

title: Did Donald Trump Say He Will Cut Social Security?
subtitle: The unveiling of a Republican plan to "permanently save Social Security" by cutting some benefits has some wondering what will happen next.
author: David Emery
statement: President-elect Donald Trump has said he plans to cut Social Security benefits.

title: Did a 'Star Wars' Film Include an Anti-Trump Scene?
subtitle: Writers for the film "Star Wars: Rogue One" posted tweets about Donald Trump, but claims that the movie was altered to add an anti-Trump scene were unfounded.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "Star Wars: Rogue One" was re-shot to add an anti-Trump scene.

title: Black Homeless Woman Says Trump Allowed Her to Live in Trump Tower Rent Free
subtitle: A woman claimed that she was allowed to stay at Trump Tower in New York City for free for eight years, but no evidence has been provided to confirm her story.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump let a homeless woman stay at his hotel in New York City rent-free for eight years.

title: Bacon Sandwich Reported as Offensive on Facebook
subtitle: A social media post claimed that a bacon sandwich image was deemed "offensive" by Facebook in an attempt to farm engagement.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook users should share a photo of a bacon sandwich because Facebook deemed it "offensive."

title: Is This Donald Trump's Intelligence Quotient?
subtitle: A chart purportedly showing Donald Trump's IQ ranking compared to that of other presidents is based on incomplete and inaccurate information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's IQ, at 156, is comparable to that of the smartest U.S. presidents.

title: Has Newport Introduced Marijuana Cigarettes on Sale Worldwide?
subtitle: Rumor holds that Newport will soon be selling mass-produced joints under the brand name "Newport Nirvana."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Newport developed marijuana cigarettes which will be available for purchase "next year."

title: Ben Carson: 'Abortions Create Baby Ghosts that Haunt Hospitals'
subtitle: Rumors that Carson said that abortion created "baby ghosts" which haunted hospitals, stealing medical supplies and causing healthcare costs to skyrocket, are false.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ben Carson said abortions led to baby ghosts haunting hospitals, stealing medical supplies, and increasing healthcare costs.

title: Fisher Price Happy Hour Playset
subtitle: Despite social media outrage, the "Fisher Price Happy Hour Playset" is not real.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Fisher Price sells a "happy hour playset" including a bar, bar stools, and beer bottles.

title: Morton County Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier's Twitter Account
subtitle: A parody Twitter account attributed to Morton County Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier contained a number of satirical (and outrageous) tweets about the Dakota Access pipeline protests.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Morton County Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier published pro-Dakota Access Pipeline and anti-Native American content via Twitter.

title: Does Donald Trump Own Carrier or Its Stock?
subtitle: After a high-profile negotiation with Carrier, rumors appeared that President-elect Trump owned a stake in (or all of) the company.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump owns Carrier, or a significant stake in its parent company, United Technologies.

title: Did Native American Scouts' Long Hair Provide
Tracking Abilities During the Vietnam War?
subtitle: Native American trackers were supposedly recruited by the U.S. military for service during the Vietnam War.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The United States military recruited Native Americans as scouts in the Vietnam War and - in the course of their training - the military discovered that long hair actually helps give people 'almost supernatural' tracking abilities.

title: Did President Trump Cancel Obama's Muslim 'Ritual'?
subtitle: A "satirical" site reported that President Obama stormed out of the White House because of a move by Trump to cancel all "Islamic prayers" in the building.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Donald Trump canceled various White House measures accommodating Islamic prayers in the building, upsetting President Obama.

title: Lord of the Rings Donut
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a donut with "Muslim writing" on it actually depicts a pastry with Orkish writing in frosting.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a donut with "Muslim writing" on it.

title: Did the Obama White House Ban Nativity Scenes?
subtitle: According to social media chatter, the "War on Christmas" extended all the way to the White House.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The White House decided not to display a Christmas Nativity scene in 2016 (or any other year).

title: Father Mourns Wife, Children Killed in Car Crash?
subtitle: A genuine image of three murder victims has been reappropriated for a "type amen" scam.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A somber image shows a man whose wife and two children were killed in a car accident.

title: Is This National Geographic's 'Photograph of the Year'?
subtitle: An image of a shark leaping out of the water was digitally manipulated and did not win an award from National Geographic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of a shark leaping out of the water is real and won an award from National Geographic.

title: Giants in Japan
subtitle: A video purportedly showing suppressed footage of an actual giant in Japan is actually from a 2007 movie called "Big Man Japan."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Top-secret footage shows a giant walking in Japan.

title: Sarah Palin Calls to Boycott Mall of America Because 'Santa Was Always White in the Bible'
subtitle: A story that the former Alaska governor called for the boycott after discovering that the mall had hired its first black Santa Claus is a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sarah Palin called for a Mall of America boycott over its hiring a black man to play Santa Claus.

title: Wisconsin Recount Observers Find Voting Machines with Broken Seals?
subtitle: Rumors holding Wisconsin "recount observers" discovered tampered state voting machines conflated warranty labels with security seals.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Recount observers in Wisconsin discovered voting machines seals had been compromised after the 2016 general election.

title: Muslim Beats Boy for Having Blue Eyes?
subtitle: A story about a Muslim beating up a little boy for having blue eyes is frequently shared with a photograph of a dog bite victim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young blue-eyed boy who was beaten up by a Muslim because of his eye color.

title: Did Trump Win 3,084 of 3,141 Counties in 2016, While Clinton Won Only 57?
subtitle: Many conservative pundits misconstrued a statistic about population density vs. voting patterns.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump won 3,084 of America's 3,141 counties in the 2016 presidential election; Hillary Clinton won just 57.

title: Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump Wearing Transparent Shirts
subtitle: Photographs purporting to show the wife and daughter of President-elect Donald Trump wearing shirts exposing their breasts have been digitally altered.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows Melania Trump and Ivanka Trump wearing see-through shirts.

title: 'Army-Style Muslim Migrants' Marching to Fight in Germany?
subtitle: A video of a group of people marching down the street was shared with the baseless claim that it showed "army-style Muslim migrants" showing their "willingness to fight."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an "army-style Muslim migrants" marching in Germany to show their "willingness to fight."

title: Trump to Ban All Television Shows That Promote 'Gay Activity'
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that President-elect Donald Trump planned on banning homosexuality from being depicted on television shows.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump announced that he will ban "gay activity" from appearing on television shows.

title: Christian-Owned Airlines Change Wing Light Colors to Celebrate Christmas?
subtitle: A meme about "Christian-owned airlines" changing wing lights to red and green is just a spoof.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Christian-owned airlines change the lights on the wings of airliners to "celebrate Christmas" (and passengers can request other colors).

title: Was a Giant Squid Found Beached in New Zealand?
subtitle: A video purporting to show a 50-foot-long squid beached in Punakaiki, New Zealand, was a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a 50-foot-long giant squid that washed up on a beach in New Zealand in 2015.

title: Have Standing Rock Protesters Been Sprayed with Chemicals From Crop Duster Planes?
subtitle: A Standing Rock spokesperson denied claims that the government has been dumping chemicals on people protesting the Dakota Access pipeline.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dakota Access pipeline protesters at Standing Rock have been sprayed with chemicals by crop duster planes.

title: Is Justin Trudeau Fidel Castro's Love Child?
subtitle: Claims that Fidel Castro and Margaret Trudeau had an affair that produced the current Canadian prime minister are impossible on both biological and historical grounds.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau is Fidel Castro's son.

title: Obama Was Going to Castro's Funeral Until Trump Told Him This
subtitle: A fake news site reported that President Obama canceled plans to attend the funeral of Fidel Castro due to the intervention of Donald Trump.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama planned to attend Fidel Castro's funeral, but was forced to "stand down" by President-elect Donald Trump.

title: In Wake of Election, Obama Passes Executive Order Banning All Fake News Outlets
subtitle: A story that the President is banning all fake news came from - you guessed it - a fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Barack Obama signed an executive order banning all fake news outlets.

title: Did a Woman Stab Her Boyfriend for Penetrating a Turkey?
subtitle: A report that a woman tried to kill her boyfriend for attempting to copulate with an uncooked turkey is, unsurprisingly, a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman stabbed her boyfriend because he attempted to sexually gratify himself using a raw turkey.

title: Ivanka Trump Will Move Into White House 'to Fill Melania's Vacancy'
subtitle: Despite rumors, Ivanka Trump isn't moving into the White House with her father because his wife plans to remain in New York City.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ivanka Trump will move into the White House because Melania Trump is not immediately planning to do so.

title: Jill Stein Caught Embezzling Recount Funds for Marijuana Dinner Party
subtitle: An old photograph of Jill Stein was used to claim that the Green Party presidential candidate had been arrested for using "recount funds" to host a "marijuana dinner party."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Jill Stein was arrested and charged with embezzling money raised for 2016 recount efforts in order to throw a "marijuana dinner party."

title: Trump Promises to Pardon Dylann Roof
subtitle: An image purporting to show a tweet sent by Donald Trump, in which he promised to pardon accused mass shooter Dylann Roof, was a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump promised on Twitter that his first act as president would be to pardon Dylann Roof.

title: Backless Booster Seats Banned in United States?
subtitle: A social media meme shared outdated information about the use of backless booster seats (also known as booster cushions).
author: Dan Evon
statement: Backless boosters will be banned in the United States starting in December 2016.

title: Three Wisconsin Counties 'Admit' They Padded Votes for Trump?
subtitle: An irregularity that showed more ballots cast than votes counted was corrected when the official results were submitted.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Three Wisconsin counties admit to fixing the vote in favor of Donald Trump.

title: Edward Snowden Said Russia Successfully Rigged U.S. Elections In Favor Of Trump
subtitle: A report that the high-profile whistleblower had announced that Moscow had fixed the 2016 presidential election so that Donald Trump would win is a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Edward Snowden claimed that Russia fixed the 2016 general election so Donald Trump would win.

title: Fidel Castro Said He 'Won't Die Until America is Destroyed'?
subtitle: A fairly obvious joke attributing a prophetic quote to Fidel Castro after his death was mistaken for an authentic remark on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Cuban leader Fidel Castro once said he wouldn't die until the United States was destroyed.

title: Ben Carson Thinks the Earth Would Have Exploded During Big Bang
subtitle: While Carson does not buy into the theory of the Big Bang origin of our cosmos, a viral meme misrepresents Carson's view on the topic.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Ben Carson once said

title: Public Assistance Barbie
subtitle: An old fake news item about a holiday release of "Public Assistance Barbie" made the rounds yet again in 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mattel is introducing "Public Assistance Barbie" for the holidays.

title: Did the Corona Founder Make Every Person in His Village a Millionaire?
subtitle: An erroneous report about the death of Antonino Fernandez was shared by several media outlets.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Corona beer founder Antonino Fernandez made everyone in his village a millionaire after his death.

title: Did CNN Air Half an Hour of Pornographic Content?
subtitle: Reports that the news network accidentally aired thirty minutes of porn originated with a single image from an unverified Twitter user.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN accidentally aired thirty minutes of porn during an episode of Anthony Bourdain's "Parts Unknown."

title: Ivanka Trump Said If Donald Trump Wasn't Her Father, She Would 'Mace' Him?
subtitle: A quote purportedly from Donald Trump's daughter actually seems to have originated in a comedy bit.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ivanka Trump said that she would "mace" her "father" during an appearance on a talk show.

title: Did Trump Appoint Bill Cosby as Secretary for Women's Rights?
subtitle: A story that Donald Trump had named the former sitcom star the U.S. Secretary for Women's Rights was intended as satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Cosby was appointed the Secretary for Women's Rights by president-elect Donald Trump.

title: Was a Nigerian Baby Born with a Message of Christ's Second Coming?
subtitle: A fake story about an infant born in Nigeria with a message written on her hands that Jesus is coming back has been around for several years.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Nigerian infant was born with message written on her hands saying Jesus is coming back.

title: Did Clint Eastwood Refuse the Presidential Medal of Freedom?
subtitle: A rumor that Clint Eastwood was offered - and refused - the Presidential Medal of Freedom was made up out of whole cloth.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Clint Eastwood refused to accept the Presidential Medal of Freedom from President Obama.

title: Audit the Vote
subtitle: A popular 'Audit the Vote' message asserts that the Justice Department is actively investigating the 2016 election and urges users to call and request further action.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Department of Justice (DOJ)'s switchboard is tallying "Audit the Vote" calls and if enough people call, 2016 election results can be overturned.

title: 'Student Loan Forgiveness' Scam
subtitle: We called "EDU Loan Servicing" after it was featured on a "consumer watchdog" page; it appears to be one of many scams.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A phone number posted on a "consumer watchdog" site belongs to a college loan servicer.

title: Is Comet Ping Pong Pizzeria Home to a Child Abuse Ring Led by Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: A detailed conspiracy theory known as "Pizzagate" holds that a pedophile ring is operating out of a Clinton-linked pizzeria called Comet Ping Pong.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The 'Podesta e-mails' revealed the existence of a secret society of pedophiles operating through a pizza place loosely connected to Clinton associate David Brock.

title: Woman Develops IQ of 220 After Drinking Sperm Every Day for a Year
subtitle: A stolen screenshot was attached to a fake story about the amazing cognitive benefits of "drinking sperm."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman's IQ skyrocketed to an historic 220 after she drank sperm or semen for a year.

title: Melania Trump and the Dakota Access Pipeline Protests
subtitle: A statement attributed to Melania Trump saying that Native Americans who are protesting the Dakota Access Pipeline should "go back to India," is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump said that Native Americans upset about the Dakota Access Pipeline should "go back to India".

title: Does This Photograph Document Mike Pence's 'Gay Past'?
subtitle: What's with all this stuff that opposition research keeps missing during campaigns?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young Mike Pence with his chest exposed.

title: Liberalism Summed Up in 10 Seconds
subtitle: A video showing an inconsolable protester wailing because a policeman popped her balloon is not what it seems.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video showing an inconsolable protester wailing because a policeman popped her balloon.

title: Our Days Feel Shorter Because Time Is Literally Speeding Up
subtitle: Metaphysical websites misuse a real scientific phenomenon to argue that time is changing.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Time itself is speeding up and we actually perceive a 24-hour day as a 16-hour day.

title: Donald Trump Says He'll Legalize Weed In Every State
subtitle: A disreputable web site claimed that the president-elect promised to legalize marijuana everywhere, but we found no record of that comment.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump will legalize marijuana in all 50 states.

title: European Union Gag Order On Revealing Muslim Terrorists' Religion
subtitle: A group headed by John Bolton said an anti-racism task force blamed the press for anti-Islam violence.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The European Union ordered reporters to not reporting whether a terrorist is Muslim.

title: Kid Rock Wears 'Dumbf*ckistan' T-Shirt
subtitle: We are obliged to report that the photo of Kid Rock wearing a profanity-laced electoral map T-shirt is fake, though apparel resembling this does exist.
author: David Emery
statement: Kid Rock was photographed wearing a t-shirt featuring an electoral map in which blue states are labeled "Dumbfuckistan."

title: The King of Denmark Wore a Yellow Star
subtitle: The legend of non-Jewish Danes donning yellow stars in solidarity with Jews during the Nazi occupation of Denmark is a touching story but not historically accurate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: When the Germans ordered Jews in occupied Denmark to identify themselves by wearing armbands with yellow stars during World War II, King Christian X of Denmark and non-Jewish Danes thwarted the order by donning the armbands themselves.

title: Was Monica Petersen Killed for Investigating Clinton-Related Sex Trafficking in Haiti?
subtitle: The death of Monica Petersen, an assistant director at the Human Trafficking Center, sparked conspiracy theories involving the Clinton Foundation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Monica Petersen was killed after she discovered that the Clinton Foundation was involved in a child sex trafficking ring in Haiti.

title: Liberal College Millennials Are Less Biologically Fit Than 'Real Americans'?
subtitle: A claim that "liberal millennials" are "not likely to survive the next natural selection event
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The characteristics of stereotypical millennial liberals make them less competitive, because they are in discord with the natural world.

title: Did the Communist Party of the USA Endorse Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: The Communist Party of the USA did not endorse Hillary Clinton, but did encourage members to vote against her rival, Donald Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Communist Party of the USA endorsed Hillary Clinton.

title: Trump to Repurpose USS Enterprise Into Floating Hotel and Casino
subtitle: A story  that Donald Trump was planning to "repurpose" the USS Enterprise was just another piece of military satire.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump announced plans to convert the USS Enterprise into a "floating hotel and casino."

title: Mexican Supermarket Taking 'Donations' for Trump Border Wall
subtitle: A faked photograph led to accusations that Soriana markets were making customers foot the bill for one of Donald Trump's campaign promises.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A Mexican supermarket chain is adding "donations" for a U.S.-Mexico border wall to its charges.

title: Republican Senate Candidate Tells Melania Trump to 'Sterilize' the White House
subtitle: Carlos Beruff, who ran for Marco Rubio's U.S. Senate seat, called President Barack Obama an "animal" months before Trump won the election.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Republican Senate candidate called on Melania Trump to "sterilize" the White House after the "animals" leave.

title: Woman Runs Husband Down with SUV Because He Voted for Trump
subtitle: No, a Hillary Clinton supporter didn't run her husband over with her vehicle because he voted for the Republican presidential candidate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A fervent Hillary Clinton supporter ran her husband down with an SUV because she found out he voted for Donald Trump.

title: Is Monsanto Suppressing Evidence of a Cancerous Herbicide in Food?
subtitle: A laboratory test performed by food activists went viral, but its results and the allegations drawn from them were not reliable.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A new analysis of the residue on common American foods showed high levels of the herbicide glyphosate and Monsanto, the EPA, and the FDA are in cahoots to silence word of the chemical's harmful effects and its high concentration in foods.

title: Hunter Nearly Killed by Brutal Sexual Assault From Moose
subtitle: A story that a hunter nearly died after a massive moose knocked him down and tried to have sex with him is, unsurprisingly, a hoax.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A hunter from Michigan was nearly killed by a sexually voracious moose.

title: Did Putin Issue an Arrest Warrant for George Soros?
subtitle: Articles reporting that the Russian president issued an international arrest order for the billionaire philanthropist are fake news.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Russian President Vladimir Putin issued an arrest warrant for George Soros.

title: Lady Gaga Arrested for Twitter Attack on Melania Trump
subtitle: A report that Lady Gaga was arrested for tweeting a negative comment about Melania Trump is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Lady Gaga being placed in a squad car after she tweeted a negative comment about Melania Trump.

title: Bill Clinton in the Nude
subtitle: An image purporting to show Bill Clinton sitting naked on a bed while a woman rubs his back doesn't actually feature the former president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows former president Bill Clinton sitting naked on a hotel bed.

title: Was Donald Trump Born in Pakistan?
subtitle: A spoof conspiracy theory holds that Donald Trump was born in the country of Pakistan and not in the United States.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump was born 'Dawood Ibrahim Khan' in Pakistan.

title: David Brooks: 'Trump Needs to Decide If He Prefers to Resign, Be Impeached or Get Assassinated'
subtitle: An article reporting that a prominent New York Times columnist floated the idea of assassinating Donald Trump is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New York Times columnist David Brooks said that Donald Trump needed to decide if he'd rather 'resign, be impeached, or get assassinated.'

title: Military Absentee Ballots Delivered One Day Late Would Have Swung Election for Clinton
subtitle: Social media users were confused by a satirical site's claim that delayed military absentee ballots would have swung the election to Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Delayed military absentee ballots would have "swung" the presidential election for Hillary Clinton if they had been counted on time.

title: Mike Pence: Gay Conversion Therapy Saved My Marriage
subtitle: Reports that VP-Elect Mike Pence said 'gay conversion therapy saved his marriage' are fake news.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Mike Pence credited 'gay conversion therapy' with saving his marriage.

title: Melania Trump Files for Divorce
subtitle: Reports that Mrs. Trump has voiced concerns over her role as the First Lady of the United States, claiming that she
are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Melania Trump has filed for divorce over  her role as the First Lady of the United States.

title: No Sanction for BBC's Carol Kirkwood Over 'Cold as F*ck' Weather Forecast
subtitle: Reports that that BBC's Carol Kirkwood used a curse word to describe the weather are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: BBC's Carol Kirkwood used a curse word to describe the weather.

title: BLM 'Thug' Shoots Himself Taking Selfie with Gun in Protest of Trump
subtitle: The picture of a man holding a gun to his face while taking a selfie has been around much longer than Donald Trump's election to the presidency.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A member of the Black Lives Matter movement shot himself in the face while protesting Donald Trump's election with a selfie.

title: Do Maps Show High Crime Rates Where Democrats Vote?
subtitle: A few misleading maps were circulated after the 2016 presidential election insinuating that areas with a high population of democratic voters also had higher rates of crime.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Maps shows that areas with high democratic populations also have high crime rates.

title: Protesters Beat Homeless Veteran to Death in Philadelphia
subtitle: A video allegedly showing anti-Trump protesters beating a man to death in Philadelphia was actually filmed in 2015 and is unrelated to the protests.
author: David Emery
statement: Anti-Trump protesters beat a homeless veteran to death in Philadelphia.

title: President Obama to Issue Hillary a 'Blanket Pardon' to Avoid Future Prosecution
subtitle: Reports that President Obama will issue a
for Hillary Clinton to cover any undiscovered past crimes are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama will issue a
for Hillary Clinton to cover any undiscovered past crimes.

title: Hillary Clinton Supporter Defecated on Trump Sign?
subtitle: An old video of a woman defecating on a sign was shared in November 2016 with the false claim that it featured a Hillary Clinton supporter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Hillary Clinton supporter defecated on a sign in protest of Donald Trump.

title: Abortion Rates Fall During Democratic Administrations and Rise During Republican Ones
subtitle: Abortion rates have risen and fallen throughout presidencies of both parties, making drawing a direct correlation between the two untenable.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Abortion rates drop during Democratic presidencies and rise during Republican administrations.

title: Maryland Refusing Electoral College, Hillary Given Presidency As More States Follow?
subtitle: An article from 2007 about proposed electoral changes was misinterpreted and shared as genuine news about the results of the 2016 presidential election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Maryland's electors ignored the statewide vote and gave the presidency to Hillary Clinton.

title: African Billionaire Will Give $1 Million to Anyone Who Wants to Leave America If Donald Trump Is Elected President
subtitle: Fake news sites are pushing the claim that "Femi Adenugame" is offering a large sum of money to African-Americans who wish to leave the U.S. due to Donald Trump's election.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A South African billionaire is offering a large sum of money to African-Americans who leave the country due to Trump's election.

title: Anti-Trump Protesters Bused Into Austin, Chicago
subtitle: Photographs showing long lines of buses were shared with the untrue claim that they were used to ship paid anti-Trump protesters to various cities.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of buses that were used to ship in paid anti-Trump protesters to Austin, Texas.

title: Trumpets and a Circle in the Sky Above Israel
subtitle: A video purportedly showing strange clouds forming over Israel shortly after the conclusion of the 2016 U.S. presidential election is actually a digital creation that originated long before Donald Trump's election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Strange circular clouds formed over Israel shortly after Donald Trump won the 2016 presidential election.

title: Anti-Trump Protesters Destroy America
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a violent anti-Trump protest in the U.S. was actually taken in Greece in 2012.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a violent anti-Trump protest in the United States in November 2016.

title: Muslim Woman Told to 'Hang Herself' with Hijab at Walmart
subtitle: A woman's uncorroborated Facebook post describing the alleged incident was shared thousands of times.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A woman pulled a Muslim woman's hijab inside a Walmart and told her, "Go hang yourself with it around your neck."

title: Donald Trump Said: 'Kiss your Section 8, Welfare and Medicaid Goodbye'?
subtitle: Racially-charged reports that Donald Trump said that he wanted to get rid of specific social programs originated from a hoax news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump said that he planns to eradicate Section 8 housing, welfare, and Medicaid.

title: Hillary Clinton Files for Divorce in New York Courts
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that Hillary Clinton filed for divorce from Bill Clinton just after the 2016 presidential election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton filed for divorce from Bill Clinton in November 2016.

title: Fake Cigarettes are Being Sold and Killing People
subtitle: Reports of deadly fake cigarettes in counterfeit packs  circulating in Detroit are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Counterfeit packs of fake cigarettes found in Detroit are lethal.

title: Donald Trump Removed 'Pro-Life' from His Policies 12 Hours After Election?
subtitle: A since-retracted article on the "Steel Magnificat" blog claimed that Trump scrubbed every mention of "pro-life" from the policy section of his campaign web site 12 hours after the election.
author: David Emery
statement: All mentions of "pro-life" were scrubbed from the Donald J. Trump campaign web site 12 hours after he was elected president.

title: Obama Signs Executive Order Declaring Investigation Into Election Results
subtitle: Reports that President Obama has overruled Donald Trump's presidential victory and ordered a revote for December 15 are fake news.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: President Obama has overruled Donald Trump's victory in the 2016 presidential election and ordered a revote.

title: Canada Receives 10 Million Immigration Applications
subtitle: The Canadian prime minister did not announce that his country had received millions of immigration requests from Americans immediately after the 2016 presidential election.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said his country had received more than 10 million immigration applications from Americans immediately after the 2016 presidential election.

title: Obamaphones to Be Cut Off
subtitle: Viral election night jokes about "Obama phones" immediately getting "cut off" confused social media users in the wake of the 2016 presidential election outcome.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: All "Obama phones" will be cut off after 31 December 2016.

title: Janet Reno Said 'Donald Trump Will Never Be President in My Lifetime'
subtitle: A too-prescient-to-be-true quote attributed to recently-deceased former U.S. Attorney General Janet Reno was fabricated.
author: David Emery
statement: Former Attorney General Janet Reno said "Donald Trump will never be president in my lifetime."

title: 'We Hate Muslims, We Hate Blacks' Chanted at Trump Rally
subtitle: Unsubstantiated post-election rumor claimed that supporters chanted "We hate Muslims, we hate Blacks, we want our great country back" during a Trump victory rally.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump supporters chanted "we hate muslims, we hate blacks, we want our great country back" during a rally on election night.

title: Klan Marches in North Carolina to Celebrate Trump Victory
subtitle: A misleading picture circulating on social media claims to depict the KKK marching on a bridge to celebrate Trump's victory, but those depicted never claimed to be the Klan.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The KKK marched on a bridge in North Carolina to celebrate Donald Trump's presidential victory.

title: Harambe, A Dead Gorilla, Got Over 15,000 Votes for President of the United States
subtitle: Reports that Harambe the deceased gorilla received thousands of votes in the 2016 U.S. presidential election were fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A dead gorilla named Harambe received 15,000 votes in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict a Donald Trump Presidency?
subtitle: Images from the 'The Simpsons' showing Donald Trump's announcement of his presidential candidacy are from 2015, not 2000.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video documents that

title: Rare Supermoon Is Going to Unleash Tidal Waves and Massive Earthquakes
subtitle: Scientists have been debating a connection between lunar cycles and earthquakes for decades, but not one of them has suggested that next week's supermoon is going to be an apocalyptic harbinger of mayhem.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Scientists say that largest the supermoon since 1948, occurring on 14 November 2016, will trigger tidal waves and catastrophic earthquakes, wreaking havoc across the planet.

title: Voting Split Across Two Days
subtitle: Old political jape holds that Election Day is being split across two separate days.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Election Day is being split across two separate days this year.

title: Cubs Win, the Woman's In!
subtitle: A quote ostensibly uttered by notorious gangster Al Capone about electing a woman president when the Chicago Cubs win the World Series is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Al Capone said that the United States wouldn't elect a woman president until the Chicago Cubs won the World Series.

title: Jay Z Rapped the Words 'Middle Finger to the Lord' at Hillary Clinton Rally
subtitle: An election eve social media rumor held that guest artist Jay Z rapped the words "Middle finger to the Lord, n***a grip, I'm a boss" at a Hillary Clinton rally.
author: David Emery
statement: Jay Z rapped the words "Middle finger to the Lord, n***ga grip I'm a boss" at a Hillary Clinton rally.

title: Van Full of 'Illegals' Shows up to Vote Clinton at Six Polling Places
subtitle: Fake "voter fraud" stories showed up early and often during 2016's general election.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A van full of "illegals" traveled from voting booth to voting booth in Arizona in order to vote (illegally) for Hillary Clinton.

title: Ivanka Trump Disavows Her Father
subtitle: Reports that Ivanka Trump disavowed her father just before the 2016 presidential election are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ivanka Trump disavowed her father Donald Trump during a press conference just before the 2016 presidential election.

title: Clinton Campaign Paid Beyonce and Jay Z $62 Million for Cleveland Concert to Secure Black Votes
subtitle: Reports that the Clinton campaign paid Beyonce and Jay Z $62 million to perform a concert in Cleveland are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Clinton campaign paid Beyonce and Jay Z $62 million to perform a concert in Cleveland.

title: Did Georgia Become the First State to Ban Muslim Culture?
subtitle: Georgia state representative Jason Spencer withdrew a bill banning head and face coverings two days after he filed it.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Georgia recently became the first U.S. state to "ban Muslim culture."

title: Huma Abedin Admits in E-mail to Brother That She Is a Muslim Infiltrator?
subtitle: A look at a homespun effort to discredit the candidacy of Hillary Clinton by making it appear that her top aide admitted to being a radical Muslim plant.
author: David Emery
statement: An e-mail written by Hillary Clinton aide Huma Abedin to her brother reveals that she is a radical Muslim plant waiting to take over the country after Clinton is elected.

title: Obama Encouraged 'Illegal Aliens' to Vote
subtitle: In an interview aimed at a millennial audience, President Obama encouraged Latino citizens to vote. He did not urge undocumented immigrants to vote.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: President Obama encouraged "illegal aliens" to vote and said there would be no consequences if they do.

title: FBI Agent Suspected in Hillary Email Leaks Found Dead in Apparent Murder-Suicide
subtitle: Reports that an FBI agent investigating Hillary Clinton's use of a private e-mail server killed himself after murdering his wife are just fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An FBI agent investigating Hillary Clinton's use of a private e-mail server killed himself after murdering his wife.

title: Hillary Caught on Hot Mic Trashing Beyonce with Racial Slurs
subtitle: A viral article purporting to quote Hillary Clinton describing Beyonce's music using racial slurs is a work of fiction.
author: David Emery
statement: Hillary Clinton trashed Beyonce using racial slurs at a November 2016 campaign event.

title: Were 16 Girls Impregnated After a Teenager Ejaculated in a Pool?
subtitle: The story of a girl becoming pregnant in a shared swimming pool is an old urban legend, but this particular version of it originated with a fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sixteen girls were impregnated after a boy ejaculated in a swimming pool.

title: Was Clinton Campaign Chairman John Podesta Involved in Satanic 'Spirit Cooking'?
subtitle: An e-mail published by WikiLeaks mentioned "spirit cooking," but claims that Hillary Clinton or John Podesta practice satanic rituals are grossly exaggerated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton and John Podesta practice a satanic ritual known as "spirit cooking."

title: Department of Homeland Security Chairman Officially Indicts Hillary Clinton of Treason
subtitle: An inaccurate claim that Hillary Clinton was indicted for treason followed in the wake of a report that her e-mail server was hacked by multiple foreign intelligence agencies.
author: David Emery
statement: The Department of Homeland Security chairman has officially indicted Hillary Clinton on charges of treason.

title: Dunkin' Donuts Holiday Cup Is Richard Dawkins Giving the Finger
subtitle: A humorous article reporting that Dunkin Donuts' new holiday cup featured Richard Dawkins giving the finger was mistaken for legitimate news by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dunkin Donuts' new holiday cup features an image of Richard Dawkins giving the finger.

title: Trump to Deport Lin-Manuel Miranda, Doesn't Realize Puerto Rico is US Territory?
subtitle: Reports that Donald Trump had threatened to deport Broadway star Lin-Manuel Miranda were just fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump threatened to deport Puerto Rican Broadway star Lin-Manuel Miranda.

title: 'Facebook Analytics' Electoral Map Shows Trump Sweep
subtitle: An image purportedly showing an electoral map based on "Facebook analytics" is not supported by data.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An electoral map based on Facebook analytics shows Donald Trump winning the 2016 presidential election in a "clean sweep."

title: Clinton: Russians Hacked My Crowd!
subtitle: An image purporting to show Hillary Clinton addressing a sparsely attended campaign rally actually doesn't picture Clinton at all.
author: David Emery
statement: An image shows Hillary Clinton addressing a campaign rally attended by fewer than 25 people.

title: Life Expectancy in the United States Declining, Thanks to Obamacare
subtitle: Some outlets have implied a connection between an annually-released actuarial study lowering a prediction of future increases to U.S. life expectancy and the implementation of the Affordable Care Act, but this logic is specious at best.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Life expectancy in the United States is now lower because of Obamacare.

title: Did Matthew McConaughey Endorse Donald Trump?
subtitle: A parody video showing Matthew McConaughey endorsing Donald Trump was shared as legitimate news in October 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Matthew McConaughey made a video endorsing Donald Trump.

title: Starbucks CEO Admits Plot to Lure Customers Into Satanism
subtitle: A spoof of the Starbucks "holiday cups" controversy held that CEO Howard Schultz admitted he is using the new cup design to lure customers to the dark side.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz admitted that he was using the chain's "holiday cup" design to lure customers to Satanism.

title: Hillary Clinton 'Accidentally' Gave ISIS $400 Million
subtitle: A nonsensical claim conflates a $400 million Obama administration payment to Iran with a non-existent "accidental" payment to ISIS.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hillary Clinton accidentally paid ISIS $400 million.

title: Did a Study Confirm Humans Can Literally Feed Off Each Other's Energy?
subtitle: Viral claims about humans' ability to sense and feed off of one another's emotional energy are the result of a comically tortured reading of a groundbreaking study about algae.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A groundbreaking study showing that algae can draw an alternative source of energy from other plants suggests that humans might be able to draw energy from each other in a similar way.

title: Clinton Cancels Rally Due to 'Lock Her Up' Chants
subtitle: A Facebook post claiming that Hillary Clinton had cancelled a campaign event due to chants of "lock her up" was shared as genuine news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton refused to exit her vehicle at an event in Florida after the crowd started chanting "lock her up."

title: Ginger Baker Beats Burglars Senseless, Sodomizes One With Walking Stick?
subtitle: A story that drummer Ginger Baker sodomized a hapless burglar with his cane came from a satirical web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Drummer Ginger Baker sodomized a burglar with his cane after catching him in his house.

title: New York Police Raid Hillary Clinton's Property
subtitle: Clickbait web sites posted misleading headlines claiming Hillary Clinton's property had been raided by the NYPD.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The NYPD raided Clinton's property as part of the Anthony Weiner investigation.

title: NYPD Looking to Press Charges Against Bill Clinton for Underage Sex Ring
subtitle: A fake news site seized upon news of an FBI investigation to falsely claim Bill Clinton was implicated in an underage sex ring.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The NYPD is investigating and building a case against Bill Clinton pertaining to an underage sex ring.

title: Chris Matthews Endorses Donald Trump
subtitle: A clip from the MSNBC show "Hardball" was deceptively edited to make it appear as if host Chris Matthews had offered his endorsement to Donald Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: MSNBC host Chris Matthews endorsed Donald Trump during a segment on the show "Hardball."

title: Government Targeted Black Women with 'Epidural Vaccine'
subtitle: Reports that a "secret operation" spread a birth defect-inducing vaccine in black communities between 2010 and 2014 are fake news.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The government "knowingly" injected a birth defect-inducing vaccine into epidurals between 2010 and 2014 to hurt Black women

title: Michelle Obama Scrubbed Hillary Clinton from Her Twitter Accounts
subtitle: A disreputable web site falsely accused First Lady Michelle Obama of "scrubbing" her Twitter accounts of all mentions of Hillary Clinton.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michelle Obama deleted all mentions of Hillary Clinton from her Twitter accounts.

title: 'Donald Trump Arrested' Virus Warning
subtitle: A warning about a computer virus being spread via social media with pictures of Donald Trump being arrested appears to be a hoax.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A computer virus is being spread via social media using pictures of Donald Trump being arrested.

title: Did Podesta Say Clinton Has Cabbage Odor, Used Pejorative Term for Developmentally Disabled?
subtitle: A fabricated document purportedly from WikiLeaks' 'The Podesta Emails' describes Hillary Clinton as behaving foolishly and having a cabbage-like odor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: WikiLeaks documents revealed campaign head John Podesta unflatteringly described Hillary Clinton's personal hygiene and intellect.

title: Is Clinton Paying Halfway House Residents $300 Per Vote?
subtitle: Conservatives pointed to a brief online video as "proof" that Clinton was paying California residents to vote for her.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A California halfway house resident was promised $300 if he voted for Hillary Clinton.

title: Girl Shot by Police Sniper at Standing Rock Protest
subtitle: A since-deleted YouTube video falsely claimed an 11-year-old girl at Standing Rock was shot and killed by a police sniper.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An 11-year-old girl was shot and killed by a police sniper at the Standing Rock pipeline protest site but the media covered up news of it.

title: Recording Captures Tim Kaine Yelling at His Mistress
subtitle: Audio of actor Mel Gibson yelling at Oksana Girgorieva was shared in as if it captured VP candidate Tim Kaine shouting  at his mistress.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An audio tape captures VP candidate Tim Kaine yelling at his mistress.

title: Manipulated Photograph of Bill Clinton Crowd
subtitle: A photograph showing the size of a crowd during Bill Clinton's appearance at Cleveland State University was manipulated, but it didn't originate with the Clinton campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton's campaign manipulated a photograph to increase the crowd size at one of Bill Clinton's appearances.

title: Hillary Clinton Bought $137 Million Worth of Illegal Arms
subtitle: Reports that the Clinton Foundation purchased over $137 million of illegal arms and ammunition are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Clinton Foundation has purchased over $137 million of illegal arms and ammunition

title: Did WHO Define Being Single as a Disability?
subtitle: News accounts reported that the World Health Organization had revised their definition of infertility to include single men and women.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The World Health Organization has listed being single as a disability under their definition of infertility.

title: White House Cancels All Obama Appearances at Hillary Campaign Events
subtitle: A disreputable web site falsely claimed that President Obama had cancelled all appearances at Hillary Clinton campaign events.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama has cancelled all upcming appearances at campaign events for Hillary Clinton in October 2016.

title: North Carolina Hillary Supporter Votes Multiple Times
subtitle: Claims of voter fraud in North Carolina turned out to be merely a Facebook joke.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Hillary Clinton supporter in North Carolina voted multiple times using his friends' identities.

title: 'Spooked' Clinton Campaign Manager Deleted Tweets
subtitle: A disreputable web site spread a baseless rumor holding that Hillary Clinton's campaign manager Robby Mook deleted all of of his tweets because he was "spooked" by an FBI investigation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton's campaign manager Robby Mook deleted most of his tweets due to an FBI investigation.

title: The Amish Don't Get Autism?
subtitle: Anti-vaccine advocates have long used the Amish as evidence that vaccines cause autism, a conclusion based on two demonstrably false claims.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The Amish don't get autism because they do not vaccinate their children.

title: Fox News Said the Benghazi Probe Was a Hoax
subtitle: A slanted "news" site used a brief Fox News report to make a leap regarding the Benghazi investigation.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Fox News admitted the investigation into the Benghazi deaths was a "complete hoax."

title: Did Germany 'Fold' to Sharia Law and Allow Child Marriages?
subtitle: There is no proof an image showing a white-clad little girl is a "child bride," or that Germany is allowing children to marry in accordance with supposed Sharia law.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An image shows a Muslim child bride in Germany, proving Germany is submitting to "Sharia law."

title: Hillary Clinton and #DraftOurDaughters
subtitle: Fabricated tweets suggested Hillary Clinton praised wars, using the hashtag #DraftOurDaughters.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton tweeted that we should #DraftOurDaughters, encouraging women to go to war.

title: Dad Posted Picture of Baby Holding Gun on Facebook Just Before She Shot Herself?
subtitle: An image floating around the Internet purportedly depicting the moments before a baby killed herself (followed by a photograph of a funeral) is a hoax.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A father posted a picture of his baby with a gun on Facebook just before he posted that he needed 911 because she shot herself.

title: Hillary Clinton Went Topless in the 1960s?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Hillary Clinton and her college roommate is actually of two unidentified women in San Francisco.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Hillary Clinton and her college roommate walking topless in the 1960s.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Say 'I Would Like to See People Like Donald Trump Run for Office'?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton suggested during a 2013 speech that she would like to see Donald Trump run for President.

title: Fake Anti-Marijuana Picture Rips Off 'Walking Dead' Producer
subtitle: A picture circulating online uses a picture of actor Steven Yeun while advising, "Say no to drugs, people."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A picture of a man with his head split open documents the effect of marijuana use.

title: Sweden Bans Christmas Lights to Avoid Angering Muslim Refugees
subtitle: Unreliable web sites spun a news story about the Swedish Transport Administration nixing Christmas lights on street poles into a fictional tale about kowtowing to Muslim immigrants.
author: David Emery
statement: Sweden has discontinued the tradition of adorning street poles with Christmas lights to avoid angering Muslim refugees.

title: Amish in America Commit Vote to Donald Trump, Mathematically Guaranteeing Him a Presidential Victory
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that "millions" of Amish people were throwing their support behind Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Amish Brotherhood have endorsed Donald Trump for president.

title: Biden Blames 'Lazy American Women' for the Economy?
subtitle: An article that quotes Vice President Joe Biden saying "lazy American women are to blame for the economy" is a work of satire.
author: David Emery
statement: Vice President Joe Biden said in a speech that "lazy American women" brought about the downfall of the economy because they "sit around on their behinds, doing nothing."

title: Is Chelsea Clinton Married to George Soros' Nephew?
subtitle: Actor Scott Baio promulgated an untrue rumor about Chelsea Clinton's husband, Marc Mezvinsky.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chelsea Clinton is married to George Soros' nephew.

title: Grandparents to 'Get All Their Grandchildren Every Weekend'
subtitle: Reports that President Obama had passed a law requiring grandparents to "pick up" their grandchildren every weekend came from a site that generates user-created hoax news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama passed a law requiring grandparents to pick up pick up their grandchildren every weekend.

title: Risque Anderson Cooper Photograph
subtitle: An image purporting to show Anderson Cooper posing on a bench in a pair of briefs was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows CNN reporter Anderson Cooper seductively posing in his underwear.

title: Video Shows Democrats Committing Voter Fraud in 2016 Primary
subtitle: A video passed off as "voter fraud" committed by Democrats during the 2016 primary was filmed in Russia - and misrepresented.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Video depicts Democrats committing fraud during the 2016 primary.

title: Plastic Rice from China
subtitle: Reports hold that plastic rice made in China has flooded Western markets, but you'd probably notice if your dinner tasted like the bag in which you carried it home.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Consumers should be aware of plastic rice from China that is difficult to discern from "real rice."

title: Hillary Clinton Describes Her Major Accomplishments as Secretary of State
subtitle: A statement reproducing Hillary Clinton's response when asked to identify her major accomplishments as Secretary of State is fabricated,
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A statement reproduces Hillary Clinton's response when asked to identify her major accomplishments as Secretary of State.

title: Michael Moore Endorsed Donald Trump?
subtitle: Audio purportedly capturing director Michael Moore endorsing Donald Trump was taken out of context from Moore's latest film.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Moore has endorsed Donald Trump for president.

title: Pat Buchanan Said Things Were Better in the `50s, When Everyone 'Knew Their Place'
subtitle: A "satirical" news site quoted a fake interview between Buchanan and a real conservative site.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Pat Buchanan said America was better when everybody "knew their place."

title: Cubs Fan Steve Bartman Wins $3.7 Million from 9-Year-Old Bet on Cubs
subtitle: Reports that the notorious Steve Bartman won $3.7 million when the Cubs made it to the World Series for the first time since 1945 are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Infamous Chicago Cubs fan Steve Bartman won $3.7 million after betting that the team would be in the 2016 World Series.

title: Kremlin in Turmoil After Clinton Foundation CEO Requests 'Urgent and Immediate' Asylum
subtitle: Claims former Clinton Foundation CEO Eric Braverman sought asylum in Russia originated with a fake news conspiracy site, he is not "missing."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Former Clinton Foundation CEO Eric Braverman sought asylum in Russia after Wikileaks documents unmasked him as a mole.

title: Wisconsin Clerk Blocks Campus Voting Because Students Lean Democratic?
subtitle: An e-mail obtained by The Nation purports to show a Green Bay city clerk trying to stop students from voting because they're Democrats -- but she may have actually been concerned about ethics.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An e-mail proves that a Wisconsin city clerk was trying to prevent students from voting because they are Democrats.

title: Michael Kors 'Dog Fur' Petition
subtitle: A since-deleted petition falsely accused the Michael Kors  brand of making items out of fur from dogs that were "skinned alive."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Michael Kors uses fur from dogs that were skinned alive in manufacturing the brand's products.

title: Is 'Trump' Tattooed on This Man's Forehead?
subtitle: A photograph of a man with the word "Trump" tattooed on his forehead was hard to believe.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man with the word "Trump" tattooed across his forehead.

title: Scientists Finally Solve the Mystery of the Bermuda Triangle?
subtitle: A perfect storm of sensationalist, ratings-driven science TV, and extremely lazy click-driven journalism resulted in a viral story that explains literally nothing about the
author: Alex Kasprak
