statement: Satellite images of hexagon-shaped holes in clouds above the Bermuda Triangle prove that large blasts of sinking air are the cause of mysterious shipwrecks and plane crashes in the area.

title: Putin Gives Obama Ultimatum
subtitle: A disreputable web site reported - falsely  - that Vladimir Putin gave President Barack Obama 24 hours to stop smearing Russia, or he would start World War III.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Putin issued an ultimatum to President Obama to stop "smearing" Russia, or risk starting World War III.

title: Spanish Dancer Jellyfish
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a "Spanish Dancer Jellyfish" is actually a piece of digital artwork.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 'Spanish Dancer Jellyfish.'

title: Hillary Clinton's 'Sudden Move' of $1.8 Billion to Qatar Central Bank Stuns Financial World
subtitle: Reports that the Clinton Foundation suddenly moved $1.8 billion to Qatar originated with a fake news and conspiracy web site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Clinton Foundation suddenly transferred $1.8 billion to a bank in Qatar.

title: WikiLeaks: Clintons Purchase $200 Million Maldives Estate
subtitle: Reports that the Clintons bought an expensive estate in the Maldives came from a web site that only publishes hoax and satire news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: WikiLeaks revealed that the Clintons spent $200 million on an estate in the Maldives.

title: Cheryl Mills Called Benghazi Dead 'Idiot Soldiers' in Leaked E-Mail
subtitle: There is no leaked e-mail in which longtime Clinton aide Cheryl Mills called the Benghazi dead "idiot soldiers" and expressed that she was glad they were tortured.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A leaked e-mail revealed Clinton aide Cheryl Mills calling the men who died in Benghazi "idiot soldiers" and saying she was glad they were tortured.

title: Brad Pitt Endorses Donald Trump, Slams Money-Hungry Liberals
subtitle: Actor Brad Pitt has not "blamed liberals" for taking his money, nor has he endorsed Donald Trump for President.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Brad Pitt recently slammed liberals for "taking [his] money" and has endorsed Donald Trump for President.

title: Statue of Liberty Made from Aleppo Rubble
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a recreation of the Statue of Liberty made from the rubble of war-torn Aleppo is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Syrian artist created a "Statue of Liberty" made from the rubble collected in war-torn Aleppo.

title: 'Back to the Future II' Correctly Predicted Cubs World Series Win in 2015?
subtitle: The 1989 film 'Back to the Future II' did not correctly predict Chicago would be the winner of a 2015 Cubs-Marlins World Series match-up.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The 1987 film

title: Hillary Clinton: 'I Will Get the NRA Shut Down for Good'
subtitle: Hillary Clinton's supposed statement to the Des Moines Register about her planning to shut down the NRA and ban handguns is a total fabrication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton vowed that she would shut down the NRA and ban handguns if she were elected President.

title: Did Donald Trump Transport Stranded Troops on His Own Airplane?
subtitle: A story that Donald Trump personally sent out an airplane to transport hundreds of stranded U.S. Marines home is based on inaccurate information.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump personally sent out an airplane to bring home U.S. military members stranded in Florida.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Throw a Tantrum with Matt Lauer?
subtitle: An unfounded rumor held that Hillary Clinton threw a tantrum, and a water glass, after NBC's "Commander-in-Chief" Forum in September 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton threw a tantrum, and a water glass, after NBC's "Commander-in-Chief" Forum in September 2016.

title: Cook County Voting Machines Rigged to Change Votes?
subtitle: Claims from 2014 holding that Cook County voting machines were rigged to change Republican votes to Democratic votes were based on a single miscalibrated machine.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Voting machines in Cook County were rigged in 2014 to change votes cast for Republican candidates to votes for Democratic candidates.

title: Reporter Displays Trump/Pence Sticker at Al Smith Dinner
subtitle: An image of reporter Maria Bartiromo holding a phone decorated with a "Trump/Pence" sticker at the Alfred E. Smith Memorial Foundation Dinner is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows Maria Bartiromo holding a phone decorated with a "Trump/Pence" sticker at the annual Al Smith Dinner.

title: Oregon Ballot Omits Donald Trump
subtitle: An image of an Oregon ballot listing Democratic presidential candidates twice but no Republican candidates is a hoax.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: An Oregon ballot lists Democratic presidential candidates twice but no Republican candidates.

title: ISIS Leader Calls for American Muslim Voters to Support Hillary Clinton
subtitle: A fake news item reported that ISIS' second-in-command had urged Muslim-Americans to vote for Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The second-highest ranking ISIS member urged Muslim-Americans to vote for Hillary Clinton.

title: Did the Pope Forbid Catholics from Voting for Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: Neither Pope Francis nor any other pope decreed that Catholics cannot vote for Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pope Francis decreed that Catholics cannot vote for Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton.

title: Donald Trump Buys Children
subtitle: A comedy sketch featuring Donald Trump "buying" two children was shared as a real news story from CNN.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video report from CNN shows Donald Trump purchasing a car and two children.

title: Are 16 States Using Voting Machines from a 'Soros-Controlled Company'?
subtitle: The Daily Caller lied and falsely reported that 16 states would be using voting machines controlled by a company with "deep links to George Soros."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: George Soros-controlled Smartmatic manufactures the voting machines used in 16 crucial states, and those states will be rigged in favor of Hillary Clinton.

title: Chris Wallace Receives Cease-and-Desist Letter from Trump Organization
subtitle: A report that moderator Chris Wallace received a legal warning from Trump not to mention groping incidents in the midst of the third presidential debate was satire.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Moderator Chris Wallace received a "cease and desist" letter from Trump about groping allegations in the midst of a presidential debate.

title: President Obama Allows Hot Food to be Purchased with Food Stamps
subtitle: President Obama has not passed a law removing a restriction that bars food stamp recipients from purchasing hot food items with SNAP benefits.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama passed a law enabling food stamp recipients to use their benefits to purchase hot food.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Leak a Classified 'Four-Minute' Nuclear Response Window?
subtitle: During a presidential debate Hillary Clinton mentioned a four-minute response window for launching missiles during a nuclear attack, but that information wasn't secret.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton revealed a classified response window of "four minutes" for a U.S. president to launch nuclear weapons.

title: San Francisco Tech Company CEO Framed Julian Assange?
subtitle: A software start-up has been accused of framing the WikiLeaks founder, but the CEO says confusion stemmed from an address mix-up.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A San Francisco tech company is a front for the web site that accused Julian Assange of pedophilia.

title: Small Indiana Town to Change Name to Avoid Clinton Reference
subtitle: Reports that the small Indiana town wants to avoid being associated with the Democratic candidate are fake news.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The town of Clinton, IN, is changing its name to avoid being associated with Hillary Clinton.

title: Bob Dylan Rejects Nobel Laureate's Accolade
subtitle: Reports that singer-songwriter Bob Dylan has rejected his Nobel Prize Award for Literature are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer-songwriter Bob Dylan has rejected his Nobel Prize Award for Literature.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Promises $1,000 to Facebook Users If They Don't Share Hoaxes
subtitle: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's offering money to Facebook users who don't share social media hoaxes is itself a parody of social media  hoaxes.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mark Zuckerberg is giving $1,000 away to Facebook users who refrain from sharing hoaxes.

title: President Obama 'Demands' Monument to Himself
subtitle: A conservative site falsely claimed President Obama demanded a monument to himself because "there's plenty of monuments dedicated to racist white people."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: President Obama demanded a monument to himself because "there's plenty of monuments dedicated to racist white people."

title: Russian TV Host Reports on Plot to Kill Trump
subtitle: Infowars says Putin's "chief propagandist" exposed a plan to take out the GOP presidential nominee, but the report actually cited an op-ed questioning whether Trump was in danger.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Russian television host Dmitry Kiselyov exposed a plot to kill Donald Trump

title: Dalai Lama Says Trump Is 'Worse Than Hitler'
subtitle: His Holiness has offered only superficial commentary about Donald Trump and has not denounced the GOP candidate as "worse than Hitler" or a "threat to humanity."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Dalai Lama described Donald Trump as "worse than Hitler" and a "threat to humanity."

title: Billy Ocean Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that singer Billy Ocean passed away in October 2016 during a visit to South Africa are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer Billy Ocean passed away in October 2016.

title: Does Michelle Obama's Mother Receive a Lifetime $160K/Year Government Pension?
subtitle: Nice work, if you can get it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Marian Robinson, First Lady Michelle Obama's mother, will receive a lifetime pension of $160,000 per year from the U.S. government.

title: Did RuPaul Claim Trump Touched Him Inappropriately in the 1990s?
subtitle: Reports that the famous drag queen said he was groped by Donald Trump at a party in 1995 are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Famous drag queen RuPaul claimed he was groped by Donald Trump at a party in 1995.

title: Postal Worker Caught Destroying Absentee Trump Ballots in Major Swing State
subtitle: A Twitter user claimed to be a postal worker who regularly destroys mailed-in Trump votes in Ohio, but the issue appeared to be a joke taken taken too seriously.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A postal worker was caught destroying absentee ballots with Trump votes in the swing state of Ohio.

title: Can You Vote Online with a Hashtag?
subtitle: Social media users claimed Trump supporters attempted to suppress the vote in Pennsylvania by falsely telling Clinton supporters they could vote online via a hashtag.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pennsylvanians can vote online via social media by using the hashtag #PresidentialElection.

title: Recalled Tampons Result in Bloody Exodus of Ants from Body
subtitle: A chilling account of a gruesome illness caused by recalled tampons is merely a work of horror fiction.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A woman who used a recalled brand of tampons saw herself become infested with ants and had to be treated with a grotesque fungus that turned those ants into zombies.

title: Last Words
subtitle: A photograph showing a teenaged girl killed in an accident was actually taken from a scene staged to demonstrate the perils of drunk driving to students.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a girl killed in a drunk-driving accident, with accompanying text recording her last words.

title: Did Scientists Recreate a Tyrannosaurus Rex Embryo from Chicken DNA?
subtitle: The purported cloning of dinosaurs has been a popular online topic in recent years.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Researchers in North Carolina have created "the first fully living dinosaur embryo in millions of years" using DNA from chicken skin.

title: Daughter Fertilizes Own Eggs with Sperm of Deceased Father
subtitle: Reports of a Danish woman allowed to fertilize her own eggs with the frozen sperm of her deceased father are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Danish woman fertilized her own eggs with the frozen sperm of her deceased father.

title: Man Dressed as Clown Arrested After Police Find 11 Bodies Stuffed in Freezers at His Home
subtitle: Gruesome reports of a killer clown in Memphis murdering people and stuffing their bodies into a freezer are fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A clown was arrested after police found eleven human bodies stuffed in a freezer at his residence.

title: Video Showing Bill Clinton Rape of 13-Year-Old Girl Plunges Presidential Race Into Chaos
subtitle: A "secretly made Israeli intelligence video recording" supposedly showing "former President Bill Clinton raping a 13-year-old girl" is just more fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A "secretly made Israeli intelligence video recording" captures "Bill Clinton raping a 13-year-old girl."

title: DEFCON Warning Level Escalated to 3
subtitle: Conspiracy-oriented web sites claimed that the U.S.  defense readiness alert level was quietly raised to "DEFCON 3" in mid-June 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S.  defense readiness alert level was quietly raised to "DEFCON 3" in mid-June 2016.

title: Maryland Doctor Who Treated Hillary Clinton for Blood Clot on Brain Mysteriously Dies
subtitle: Fabricated conspiracy theory holds that Hillary Clinton underwent secret brain surgery, followed by the sudden mysterious death of her anesthesiologist.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Maryland doctor who participated in a secret surgery to remove a blood clot from Hillary Clinton's brain died suddenly under mysterious circumstances.

title: Pence: 'Michelle Obama Is the Most Vulgar First Lady We've Ever Had'
subtitle: A fake news story overstated Republican VP candidate Mike Pence's disagreement with the First Lady's criticism of Donald Trump.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Mike Pence said Michelle Obama "is the most vulgar First Lady we've ever had."

title: Reverse Cavities and Heal Tooth Decay with Vitamin D
subtitle: Alternative health websites tout the idea that a diet rich in vitamin D can help regrow material lost to cavities, but this claim rests on the misinterpretation of a paper published in 1932, and of science in general.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A diet rich in vitamin D can reverse tooth decay and regrow portions of teeth lost to cavities.

title: Sarah Palin: 'Real Men Talk Dirty'
subtitle: A statement from Sarah Palin about the lewd comments made by Donald Trump in 2005 is just a spoof.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sarah Palin excused Donald Trump's lewd comments by saying 'real men talk dirty.'

title: WikiLeaks Exposes Fake Trump Groping Plot
subtitle: Contrary to partisan reports, a leaked May 2016 e-mail exchange between DNC staffers does not reveal a plot to contrive fake "groping" accusations against Donald Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: Leaked DNC e-mails from May 2016 reveal a plot to contrive fake stories about Donald Trump groping women.

title: Tim Kaine: 'The Catholic Church Will Change Its Same-Sex Marriage Stance or It Will Be Banned from the U.S.'
subtitle: A report that Democratic VP candidate Tim Kaine threatened to ban the Catholic Church from the U.S. if they didn't change their stance on gay marriage was fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tim Kaine threatened to ban the Catholic Church from the United States if they didn't change their stance on gay marriage.

title: WikiLeaks Releases Candid Photos of Hillary Clinton Grabbing a Man's Crotch
subtitle: A photograph purportedly capturing Hillary Clinton grabbing a man's crotch  actually shows actress Florence Henderson.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Hillary Clinton grabbing a man's crotch.

title: WikiLeaks Exposes Clinton Assassination of Antonin Scalia?
subtitle: An e-mail published by WikiLeaks referenced not the literal assassination of Antonin Scalia, but what appeared to be a coordinated smear of Bernie Sanders.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: E-mail published by WikiLeaks revealed Clinton operatives assassinated Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia.

title: Hillary Clinton Has Run No Positive Political Ads?
subtitle: A Facebook image incorrectly claims that Hillary Clinton has never issued a political ad touting her own accomplishments.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton has never issued a political advertisement touting her own accomplishments.

title: Scientists Pronounce Great Barrier Reef 'Dead'
subtitle: While the Great Barrier Reef is far from healthy, reports of its death are greatly exaggerated.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Scientists have officially declared the Great Barrier Reef to be dead.

title: Clown Purge on Halloween
subtitle: The social media clown panic has inevitably merged with "purge" rumors, just in time for Halloween.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Clowns are planning a "purge night" on Halloween (or the night before).

title: Is Jessica Leeds' Phone Number Tied to the Clinton Foundation?
subtitle: The phone number of a woman who accused Donald Trump of sexually aggressive behavior does not match that of a Clinton Foundation staffer.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The phone number of a woman who accused Donald Trump of sexually aggressive behavior matches that of a Clinton Foundation staffer.

title: Jason Pierre-Paul Blows Off Other Hand After His Samsung Galaxy Note 7 Explodes
subtitle: A report that New York Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul lost a hand when his cell phone exploded is fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New York Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul lost a hand when his cell phone exploded.

title: Tim Kaine Yells at His Daughter
subtitle: An audio recording purportedly capturing Democratic VP candidate Tim Kaine yelling at his daughter actually features the voice of actor Alec Baldwin.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An audio recording captures Democratic VP candidate Tim Kaine yelling at his young daughter.

title: Did Jill Stein Endorse Donald Trump?
subtitle: Green Party candidate Jill Stein did not endorse Donald Trump, and she expressed wariness of either Trump's or Clinton's winning the presidency.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Jill Stein endorsed Donald Trump for President.

title: Did Police Shoot a White Coal Miner, Thinking He Was Black?
subtitle: A report that police shot a white coal miner in Kentucky after mistaking him for a black man is fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Kentucky police shot a white coal miner after mistaking him for a black man.

title: Hillary Calls for the End of the U.S. and One 'Hemispheric' Government
subtitle: In an e-mail published by WikiLeaks, Hillary Clinton said she dreamed of a "hemispheric common market," not the abolition of the United States government.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hillary Clinton wants to bring an end to the United States as we know it in favor of a 'hemispheric government.'

title: Leaked Videos Show Widespread Voter Fraud, 'Ballot Stuffing' in Democratic Primary
subtitle: A report that widespread voter fraud was carried out by Hillary Clinton supporters during the primary election in at least three key states is fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Surveillance video captured widespread voter fraud carried out by Hillary Clinton supporters during primary elections.

title: Newsweek Proves That WikiLeaks Is Leaking Phony 'Hillary Clinton Emails'
subtitle: A speculative game of telephone led to the false assertion WikiLeaks had published forged anti-Clinton documents in their October 2016 e-mail dump.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: WikiLeaks was caught by Newsweek fabricating e-mails with the intent of damaging the campaign of Hillary Clinton.

title: A Bad Lie
subtitle: A political golf joke involving Arnold Palmer and Hillary Clinton was mistaken for real news by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The PGA officially has changed the golf term "a bad lie" to "a Hillary" in honor of Arnold Palmer.

title: Airplane Forced to Make Emergency Landing Because Woman's V@gina Smelled So Bad
subtitle: A fake news site spread an offensive story about a plane forced to make an emergency landing due to the odor of a passenger's private parts.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A passenger plane was forced to make an emergency landing because one passenger's vagina had an offensive odor.

title: Leaked 2013 Trump Tax Return Shows He Paid Over 40 Million in Taxes
subtitle: Fake news reports WNBC received leaked documents proving Donald Trump paid $40 million in federal income tax in 2013.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: WNBC received documents proving Donald Trump paid $40 million in federal income tax  in 2013.

title: Clinton Camp Demands 'Compliant Citizenry' for Master Plan
subtitle: Former National Endowment for the Arts chairman Bill Ivey says a leaked e-mail to Clinton deputy John Podesta did not reveal a "master plan" for maintaining political power via "an unaware and compliant citizenry."
author: David Emery
statement: A leaked e-mail from former National Endowment for the Arts chairman Bill Ivey to Clinton campaign manager John Podesta revealed a Democratic "master plan" to "create an 'unaware' and 'compliant' citizenry."

title: Michelle Wants YOU to Monitor Your Own Family Members
subtitle: The First Lady gave a 2014 speech in Topeka commemorating Brown v. Board of Education but did not urge students engage in "KGB-style" enforcement of racial tolerance.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Michelle Obama urged Kansas schoolchildren to "monitor their grandparents for racial intolerance."

title: Does Hillary Clinton Still Secretly Oppose Marriage Equality?
subtitle: An e-mail chain revealed by WikiLeaks purportedly documents that Hillary Clinton privately maintains an anti-marriage equality stance while publicly stating otherwise.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An e-mail chain revealed by WikiLeaks documents that Hillary Clinton privately maintains an anti-marriage equality stance while publicly stating otherwise.

title: Hillary Clinton: Supreme Court Exists to 'Change and Shape the Law'
subtitle: A quote purportedly from Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton about the role of the Supreme Court is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton said that the Supreme Court's purpose was not about "checks and balances" but to "change and shape the law."

title: U.S. Caught Repainting Fighter Jets to Russian Colors?
subtitle: A rumor circulating among conspiracy theorists holds that the U.S. repainted some of its fighter jets to look like Russian planes in preparation for a "false flag" attack on Syria.
author: David Emery
statement: The United States was caught repainting some of their fighter jets in Russian air force colors for a false flag bombing.

title: Monica Lewinsky Says She Is Voting for Hillary Clinton
subtitle: The former White House intern hasn't publicly expressed a presidential preference outside of fake news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Monica Lewinsky has announced she's voting for Hillary Clinton.

title: Melania Trump Copied Statement from Hillary Clinton
subtitle: A Facebook image falsely suggested that Melania Trump had copied her statement regarding her husband's offensive statements about women from Hillary Clinton.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Melania Trump had copied her statement regarding her husband's offensive statements about women from Hillary Clinton.

title: Did an Alabama Man Create a 'Real-Life Human Centipede'?
subtitle: In keeping with the fake news trend of regional newspaper impostors, once such site falsely reported that a fugitive had created a 'real life human centipede.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Alabama man suspected of creating a "real life human centipede" remains at large.

title: Did a European Scientific Journal Conclude 9/11 Was a Controlled Demolition?
subtitle: Viral news stories misattributed an article written by "9/11 Truth" advocates as one published in the European Scientific Journal; it was actually published in Europhysics News, which is not peer-reviewed.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The European Scientific Journal, a peer-reviewed academic publication, concluded that the collapse of the Twin Towers and World Trade Center Building 7 on 11 September 2001 was the result of a controlled demolition.

title: Ben and Jerry's 'Hate Cops'?
subtitle: An image showing the founders of Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream holding a "We Hate Cops" sign has been photoshopped.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the founders of Ben & Jerry's holding a sign that reads "We Hate Cops."

title: Usain Bolt, Shakira Donated Millions to Haiti After Hurricane Matthew
subtitle: Fake news articles inaccurately credited Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt and Colombian singer Shakira with millions of dollars in donations to the hurricane-ravaged nation of Haiti.
author: David Emery
statement: Usain Bolt donated $10 million and Shakira donated $15 million to help rebuild Haiti after Hurricane Matthew.

title: Cell Phone Use at Night Causes Eye Cancer
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a man with eye cancer caused by using his cell phone at night actually captures a case of pinkeye.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man who was diagnosed with eye cancer due to using his cell phone at night.

title: Hillary Calls Voters 'Bucket of Losers' in Leaked Goldman Sachs Speech
subtitle: After Wikileaks published 'The Podesta Emails,' a  hoax claimed Hillary Clinton had called progressive voters a 'bucket of losers.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Leaked transcripts from Goldman Sachs speeches document that Hillary Clinton described progressive voters as a "bucket of losers."

title: Florida Business Owners Engage In Shootout with Looters; 31 Confirmed Dead
subtitle: A fake news site exacerbated Hurricane Matthew fears by claiming that looters were involved in a massive deadly shootout in Daytona Beach.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Florida store owners engaged in a massive shootout with looters during Hurricane Matthew, leaving 31 dead.

title: Should You Avoid Getting a Flu Shot?
subtitle: It's flu season, and that means a whole new wave of recycled anti-vaccine fearmongering.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: The flu shot is dangerous and full of risks the pharmaceutical companies don't want you to know about.

title: After Grotesque Trump Audio Revealed, Melania Announces She's Backing Hillary
subtitle: Fake news reports Donald Trump's wife has switched her allegiance to Democratic rival Hillary Clinton.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Melania Trump has announced she's endorsing Hillary Clinton.

title: Leaked E-mail Shows Clinton Foundation 'Collusion' with TV Host John Oliver
subtitle: Based on a single leaked e-mail, conspiracy theory web sites concocted an entire story about the Clinton Foundation "currying favor" with media personality John Oliver.
author: David Emery
statement: A leaked Clinton Foundation e-mail demonstrates collusion between the organization and media personality John Oliver.

title: 23 States Agree to Implement Gun Control Law Banning Hollow Point Ammunition
subtitle: Fake news reports of a fake hollow point ammunition ban in 23 states are fake.  Fakey fake.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Twenty-three states have agreed to enact a total ban on all forms of hollow point ammunition.

title: Clown Masks Banned in United States, Carries $50,000 Fine
subtitle: Among the fake news items published during a nationwide clown panic were claims that clown masks were banned and wearing them could lead to fines of $50,000.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Clown masks have been banned in the United States, and wearing one can result in a $50,000 fine.

title: Joyce Meyer Dead at 73
subtitle: A rumor that Christian author and inspirational speaker Joyce Meyer died on 6 October 2016 is yet another death hoax.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Joyce Meyer died "shortly after taking ill" in October 2016.

title: Betty White Death Hoax
subtitle: Long-lived actress Betty White has long been the target of celebrity death hoaxes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actress Betty White has died.

title: Kanye West Wanted for Jewelry Insurance Scam
subtitle: A misleading article claimed that Kanye West was wanted by police in connection to the robbery of his wife Kim Kardashian.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Kanye West is wanted by police for a jewelry "insurance scam."

title: Fowl Play
subtitle: Long-standing "unwinnable bet" legend holds that it's impossible to eat a quail a day for 30 days.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Eating a quail a day for 30 days is an impossible-to-win bet.

title: Killer Clown Leaves Warning Note to Cancel Halloween or Kids Will Die
subtitle: The story of a "killer clown" leaving a threatening note at a school was published by a self-described "satire" news site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A "killer clown" left a note at an elementary school threatening that "kids will die" if Halloween is not cancelled.

title: Was Jodi Arias Released from Prison After 'Incident' with Correctional Officers?
subtitle: Reports that convicted killer Jodi Arias was granted early release from prison due to a vague 'incident' involving correctional officers are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Jodi Arias was granted an early release from prison after an incident with correctional officers

title: Tim Kaine Fired 5 State Police Chaplains for Praying in Jesus' Name?
subtitle: Several Virginia state troopers resigned as volunteer chaplains in 2008 because of a departmental rule requiring that prayers at public events be nondenominational, but no one was fired.
author: David Emery
statement: As Governor of Virginia, Tim Kaine fired five state police chaplains for praying in Jesus' name.

title: Authorities Authorize the Public to Legally Shoot and Kill Suspicious Clowns
subtitle: A fake news web site falsely claimed that Congress passed a law authorizing ordinary citizens to legally shoot and kill "suspicious clowns."
author: David Emery
statement: Congress passed a law authorizing citizens to shoot and kill "suspicious clowns."

title: Hiker Finds Creepy 'Shrine' to Missing Persons in New York Woods
subtitle: An alarmed hiker believed he had stumbled on evidence of nefarious activity in Long Island.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A hiker stumbled across a scary "shrine" made out of missing persons posters.

title: 50-Foot Megalodon Captured on Video
subtitle: A video of a large sleeper shark in Japan is frequently shared with the false claim that it shows an extinct megalodon.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a Megaladon Shark at the bottom of the Mariana Trench.

title: Did Donald Trump Die of a Heart Attack?
subtitle: What has possibly died is any last sense of decency in the clickbaiting world of junk news.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has died of a "violent heart attack."

title: African Union Issues 'Travel Advisory' for U.S.
subtitle: A political cartoon was misreported online as being a real warning for African travelers regarding "continued instability" in the U.S.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: An African Union Travel Advisory warned Africans heading for the U.S. about "continued instability" in America.

title: Did Jodie Foster Say 'Attacking the Rich Is Self-Defense'?
subtitle: A quote concerning the disparities between wealth and poverty is frequently and incorrectly attributed to actress Jodie Foster.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Jodie Foster said that attacking the rich is not envy, it's self-defense.

title: Justin Trudeau:
subtitle: The Canadian prime minister isn't threatening to address a "Canadian clown crisis" by throwing clowns in jail and heavily fining them.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau announced a new law to arrest and fine anyone wearing clown costumes.

title: Halloween 'Blood Rave' Uses Real Blood
subtitle: An old story recirculated in October 2016 claims that a club an Amsterdam is hosting a "Blood Rave" with real blood on Halloween.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A nightclub in Amsterdam is hosting a "Blood Rave" event with real blood.

title: Woman Mistaken for Clown Shot and Killed in Walmart Parking Lot
subtitle: Nationwide clown rumors have not led to the brutal attack or murder of a Walmart shopper wearing heavy makeup.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Amidst "clown sightings" rumors, Walmart shoppers attacked or killed a woman "wearing too much makeup."

title: Man Hit by Inflatable Raft in Department Store
subtitle: A clip from the movie 'Grown Ups 2' featuring a shopper being struck by an inflatable raft inside a department store is frequently circulated as genuine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a shopper being struck by an inflatable raft inside a department store.

title: Angelina Jolie to Send All Six Children Back to an Orphanage
subtitle: A fake news site reported Angelina Jolie was returning her adopted children to orphanages following her breakup with Brad Pitt.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: After breaking up with Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie decided to return her adopted children to orphanages in order to focus on her career.

title: Has SpongeBob SquarePants Been Cancelled?
subtitle: An inaccurate viral image led to rampant rumors that the popular animated TV show 'SpongeBob SquarePants' had been canceled.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The animated TV show 'SpongeBob SquarePants' has been canceled.

title: Did a Mother Sue a Hospital Because Her Son Turned Gay from Flu Shot?
subtitle: she told reporters.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A mother sued a hospital and claimed that a flu shot had "turned" her son gay.

title: Scary Clowns Kill 23 People in Canada
subtitle: Fake news reported that weapons-wielding clowns from the U.S. invaded Canada and murdered 23 victims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Weapons-wielding clowns from the U.S. invaded Canada and murdered 23 victims.

title: Meteorologists Predict Record-Shattering Snowfall Coming Soon
subtitle: Reports that a snowfall for the ages will hit most of the U.S. this winter are fake news from 2014.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An incoming "record-breaking snowfall" will blanket most of the U.S. this winter.

title: Australia Becomes First Country to Begin Microchipping Its Public?
subtitle: A misleading Internet report spread the false impression that Australia has instituted a policy of microchipping its citizens.
author: David Emery
statement: Australia is the first country to begin microchipping its citizens.

title: McDonald's Employee Accused of Smuggling 80 Lbs of McNuggets
subtitle: Fake news reports that a McDonald's employee was arrested for smuggling home 80 lbs. of Chicken McNuggets  in a bodily orifice.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A McDonald's worker was arrested for theft after smuggling home 80 lbs. of chicken nuggets in his anal cavity.

title: Man Dressed as Clown Shot; Condition Critical
subtitle: A fake news story reported that a man in a clown suit was shot in Fort Wayne, Indiana.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man wearing a clown costume was shot in Fort Wayne, Indiana.

title: Clinton, Kerry Nominated for Nobel Peace Prize for Iran Deal
subtitle: Fake news reports the former secretaries of state won a prestigious award for their part in negotiating a nuclear deal with Iran.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton and John Kerry were nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize for negotiating a nuclear deal with Iran.

title: Pat Robertson Says Husbands Must Boycott Sex with Wives Voting Hillary
subtitle: Former Southern Baptist minister Pat Robertson did not propose that Christian men should boycott sex with wives who are planning to vote for Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pat Robertson advised men whose wives are voting for Hillary Clinton to "boycott sex" until they changed their minds.

title: Did a Woman Stab Her Baby to Get Revenge on Her Boyfriend?
subtitle: A video showing a mother stabbing her baby in order to get revenge on her boyfriend was a prank purportedly intended to "raise awareness" of something.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a woman stabbing her baby to death to gain revenge on her boyfriend.

title: Hillary Clinton Cut Her Tax Bill by 'Donating' $1 Million to Herself via the Clinton Foundation?
subtitle: Accusations that Hillary Clinton padded her own pockets by deducting charitable donations to the Clinton Foundation appear to be baseless.
author: David Emery
statement: Of the $1,042,000 in charitable donations Hillary Clinton deducted on her 2015 tax return, $1 million went into her own pocket via donations to the Clinton Foundation.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Endorses Trump?
subtitle: A tweet purportedly showing Leonardo DiCaprio pledging his vote to Donald Trump was yet another hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Leonardo DiCaprio endorsed Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump on Twitter.

title: Tens of Thousands of Fraudulent Clinton Votes Found in Ohio Warehouse
subtitle: A disingenuous article falsely claimed that "tens of thousands" of fraudulent ballots were discovered in a warehouse in Ohio.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Thousands of pre-marked ballots for Hillary Clinton and other Democratic candidates were found in a warehouse in Ohio.

title: Donald Trump's Self-Aggrandizing Wedding Toast to His Daughter
subtitle: A transcript of Donald Trump's self-aggrandizing toast at his daughter Ivanka's wedding is a satirical work.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A transcript documents that Donald Trump gave a self-aggrandizing toast at his daughter Ivanka's wedding.

title: Obamas at a White House Ball
subtitle: A supposed photograph of Barack and Michelle Obama dressed as a pimp and ho at White House event is a fake.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Barack and Michelle Obama dressed as a pimp and ho at a White House event.

title: Hillary Clinton Used a Teleprompter During the Presidential Debate?
subtitle: Another conspiracy theory attempting to show how Hillary Clinton rigged the first presidential debate held that the Democratic candidate had a teleprompter hidden on her podium.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton had a teleprompter hidden on her lectern during the first presidential debate.

title: Man Sees Dead People, Speaks to God After Being Deprived of His Senses
subtitle: A piece of horror fiction about a government experiment is frequently shared on social media as a true story.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man saw dead people and talked to God after he was deprived of his senses during a government experiment.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Removing Clinton, Trump Pages for Facebook Likes
subtitle: A like-farming scam claims that Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg will delete Donald Trump's and Hillary Clinton's Facebook pages in exchange for 500,000 likes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mark Zuckerberg will delete Donald Trump's or Hillary Clinton's Facebook pages for 500,000 likes.

title: Bruce Springsteen Attacks Donald Trump on Twitter
subtitle: Bruce Springsteen did not insult Donald Trump on Twitter, then sign off with the pro-Clinton hashtag #ImWithHer.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bruce Springsteen called Donald Trump an "asshole" on Twitter, signing off with the pro-Clinton hashtag #ImWithHer.

title: Hillary Clinton Used Hand Signals to Rig Debate?
subtitle: Conspiracy theory holds that Hillary Clinton and moderator Lester Holt rigged the first presidential debate by communicating via hand signals.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton and moderator Lester Holt rigged the first presidential debate by communicating via secret hand signals.

title: Was Trump Against the Iraq War from the Beginning?
subtitle: Donald Trump repeatedly stated that he opposed the invasion of Iraq before it took place in 2003. Here's what the public record shows.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump expressed strong opposition to the war in Iraq before it began in 2003.

title: Hillary Clinton Wore Secret Earpiece During First Presidential Debate?
subtitle: Images purportedly showing a wire running down Hillary Clinton's back were offered as proof that the Democratic nominee wore a secret earpiece during the first presidential debate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton wore a secret earpiece during the first presidential debate of 2016.

title: Did the Royal British Legion Stop Selling Poppies to Avoid Offending Minorities?
subtitle: The Remembrance Day tradition of distributing poppies to honor fallen service members continues unimpeded.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The Royal British Legion won't be selling Remembrance Day poppies in "certain areas" this year because they offend some minorities.

title: Clinton Received Debate Questions Week Before Debate
subtitle: A fake news story reported that Hillary Clinton was given her questions for the first presidential debate of 2016 a week in advance.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton received her questions for the first presidential debate of 2016 a week in advance.

title: Trump Deletes 'Global Warning' Claim?
subtitle: The Republican presidential nominee tweeted in 2012 that China invented the concept of global warming, but he didn't delete the statement during the debate.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Donald Trump deleted a years-old claim that China invented the concept of global warming from his Twitter account.

title: 'I Kiss His Balls for Luck'
subtitle: Old broadcast legend holds that the wife of a famous golfer blurted out on the air that she kisses her husband's balls for luck.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The wife of famous golfer blurted out on the air that she kisses her husband's balls for luck.

title: 70% of Arrested Charlotte Protesters Are Out-of-State Criminals
subtitle: An erroneous report about Charlotte protesters brought to that city from other states stemmed from one police spokesman's speculative estimate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 70 per cent of the persons arrested during protests in Charlotte had out-of-state IDs.

title: Fukushima Radiation Causes 100% Infant Mortality Among Orca Whales
subtitle: A fear-mongering article based on speculation and out-of-context quotes falsely claimed that radiation from the Fukushima disaster had caused 100% infant mortality among orca whales.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Radiation from the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster has caused 100% infant mortality among orca whales.

title: Ford Motors Funds Black Lives Matter
subtitle: Multiple online outlets falsely reported that the Ford Motor Company had donated $100 million to the Black Lives Matter movement.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Ford Motor Company donated $100 million to the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Black Lives Matter Protesters Beat Homeless Veteran
subtitle: A video purportedly depicting Black Lives Matter protesters beating a homeless veteran in Charlotte in fact was filmed in London and unrelated to BLM protests.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video shows Black Lives Matter protesters in Charlotte attacking and beating a homeless vet.

title: Woman with Concealed Carry Permit Saves Multiple Lives After Stopping Department Store Shooter
subtitle: Fake news reports a woman saved multiple lives by using her concealed carry pistol to take down a department store shooter in Virginia.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A woman saved multiple lives by using her concealed carry pistol to take down a department store shooter in Virginia.

title: Boston Police Officer Kills Black Man Over Marijuana Cigarette
subtitle: Fake news reports that an African American man living in the Boston area was shot by police officers following a dispute regarding a marijuana cigarette.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An African American man living in the Boston area was shot by police officers following a dispute regarding a marijuana cigarette.

title: Obama Purging Military for Not Shooting Citizens
subtitle: President Obama is not purging U.S. military leaders who refuse to fire on U.S. citizens.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama is purging military leaders who refuse to fire on U.S. citizens.

title: Donald Trump's Parents Wore Ku Klux Klan Attire?
subtitle: A photograph that purports to show Donald Trump's parents wearing Klan robes is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump posing with his parents in Ku Klux Klan robes.

title: President Obama Takes a Knee During National Anthem
subtitle: An article reporting that the president kneeled in protest while "The Star-Spangled Banner" played was a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama took a knee during the national anthem.

title: Wisconsin to Eliminate All Food Assistance Programs Through 2019
subtitle: An existing hoax news site used a new domain to spread a false rumor about a freeze on government assistance in Wisconsin.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The state of Wisconsin banned all FoodShare/EBT programs through 2019 due to budgetary concerns.

title: Did Obama Give George W. Bush 'Bunny Ears'?
subtitle: Possibly this is the longest-running common prank of modern times.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of current and former U.S. presidents shows President Obama giving former President George W. Bush "bunny ears."

title: Did Michael Bloomberg Say Donald Trump Is a 'Con Artist' and a 'Cheat'?
subtitle: Michael Bloomberg did call Donald Trump's candidacy a "con," but he didn't refer to Trump as a "con artist" and a "cheat."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Bloomberg said that Donald Trump was known among millionaires as a 'con artist,' and among business owners as a 'cheat.'

title: Charlotte Tells Rioters Anyone Caught Looting Will Lose Welfare and Food Stamps Permanently
subtitle: A fake news site played to racially charged rhetoric by claiming that Keith Lamont Scott protest 'rioters' in Charlotte would lose all government benefits if caught looting.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Charlotte "rioters" will lose all government benefits if caught "looting" during protests after the death of Keith Lamont Scott.

title: Police Union Cancels Trump Endorsement
subtitle: Although the Fraternal Order of Police's executive director did chide Donald Trump, the union did not retract their endorsement of the GOP candidate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Fraternal Order of Police have retracted their endorsement of Donald Trump.

title: Was Donald Trump Born in the Philippines?
subtitle: A satirical poem by Garrison Keillor mocking conspiracy theories led some readers to believe that Donald Trump was born in the Philippines.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump was born in the Philippines, and not Queens, New York, as he claims.

title: Brock Turner Beaten with Sex Toys by Flash Mob
subtitle: A satirical item claiming Brock Turner was beaten with sex toys following his release from prison was mistaken for real news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: After his release from prison, Brock Turner was beaten by a dildo-wielding flash mob.

title: Hillary Clinton Cancels Event After 'Bizarre Eye Movements'
subtitle: Hillary Clinton cancelled a North Carolina event due to "changes" to her schedule, but not because of reported "bizarre eye movements."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hillary Clinton cancelled a campaign event because of "bizarre eye movements."

title: Brad Pitt Death Hoax
subtitle: Actor Brad Pitt, whose split from wife Angelina Jolie was announced in September 2016, did not die in a shooting range suicide.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Brad Pitt died of suicide shortly after Angelina Jolie filed for divorce from him in September 2016.

title: Man Loses Testicles While Trying to 'Fill Scuba Tank with Weed Smoke'
subtitle: A fake news article reported that the unfortunate man had knocked over the tank, causing it to explode.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man lost his testicles while attempting to fill a scuba tank with marijuana smoke.

title: Liberals Want to Change the Name of 'Cracker Barrel' to 'Caucasian Barrel'?
subtitle: A Change.org petition demanding the restaurant and gift shop chain "Cracker Barrel" be renamed "Caucasian Barrel" began, and remains, satirical.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: "Liberals" want to change the name of Cracker Barrel to "Caucasian Barrel" because otherwise it's racist.

title: A Secret of Love - Brad Pitt
subtitle: Actor Brad Pitt did not author 'A Secret of Love,' a romantic tale about a man caring for his unwell wife.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Actor Brad Pitt authored "A Secret of Love" about his wife.

title: New Federal Gun Law Prevents Open Carry in All 50 States
subtitle: A fake news article reported that the ATF is implementing a new law banning the practice of "open carry" throughout the U.S.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A federal gun law was passed in September 2016 which will prevent people from practicing "open carry" in all 50 states.

title: Jennifer Aniston Delivers Angry Response to 'Brangelina' Breakup
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Jennifer Aniston made a curse-filled remark on the 'Today Show' about Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie's divorce.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jennifer Aniston went on an angry tirade  on the 'Today Show' after she was asked about Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie's divorce.

title: African 'Reconnection' Ritual
subtitle: A photograph showing a group of young men in Ghana is frequently shared with misinformation about its background.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an African tribe performing a ritual to reconnect a misbehaving person with his good nature.

title: Spider Bursts Out of Overripe Banana?
subtitle: A viral video of a spider breaking out of a banana skin is an animation created by a talented CGI artist.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A video captures a large spider that survived inside a banana until it burst out of the peel by its own power.

title: Did a Woman Have a Dead Kitten Removed from Her Vagina?
subtitle: The patient reportedly inserted the unfortunate creature to simulate the feeling of being pregnant.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman had a dead kitten surgically removed from her vagina after inserting it to simulate the feeling of being pregnant.

title: St. Cloud Stabbing Victim
subtitle: A gruesome photograph from a decade ago does not show injuries sustained by a victim of the September 2016 St. Cloud mall stabbing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show injuries sustained by a victim of the September 2016 St. Cloud stabbing

title: DNC Called Pennsylvania and Ohio Voters 'White Trash'?
subtitle: Fake news reported  a WikiLeaks' DNC e-mail dump captured Democratic staffers referring to voters in Pennsylvania and Ohio as "white trash" and "stupid."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A WikiLeaks' DNC e-mail dump captured Democratic staffers referring to voters in Pennsylvania and Ohio as "white trash" and "stupid."

title: Diabetes Vaccine Announced?
subtitle: An organization claiming to have invented a vaccine against diabetes that also reverses the effects of the disease was swiftly shut down by the Mexican government for making fraudulent health claims.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The discovery of a vaccine for the autoimmune disease diabetes has been announced.

title: Obama Raises the Retirement Age to 73
subtitle: A disreputable web site started a false rumor holding that President Obama was raising the Social Security retirement age to 73 in order to assist refugees.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama has raised the Social Security retirement age to 73 in order to help refugees.

title: NASA Admits It Is in Contact with Alien Species and Just Forgot to Mention It
subtitle: A conspiracy site republished a satirical claim that NASA admitted alien contact but failed to disclose that information, presuming everyone already knew about it.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: NASA admitted that they were in contact with aliens but failed to officially disclose that information, presuming everyone already knew about it.

title: Was the Body of an Elderly Homeless Man Identified as Elvis Presley?
subtitle: Many homeless transients have been found living under freeway overpasses in San Diego, but was one of them really Elvis?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The body of a homeless man found in San Diego has been identified as that of Elvis Presley.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Seriously Injured in a Secret Plane Crash?
subtitle: A game of conspiracy telephone resulted in the false claim that Hillary Clinton was seriously in a plane crash in 2012 while on a secret mission to Iran.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Wikileaks documents reveal Hillary Clinton was gravely injured in a plane crash during a secret mission to Iran in 2012.

title: Does Coca-Cola Coax Worms Out of Pork?
subtitle: Pouring Coca-Cola onto a piece of raw pork will not cause worms to come crawling out of the meat.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pouring Coca-Cola onto a piece of raw pork will cause worms to come crawling out of the meat.

title: Mike Pence Opposes Word 'Vice' on Religious Grounds, Doesn't Want to Be Called Vice Presidential Candidate
subtitle: A report that Republican VP candidate Mike Pence doesn't want to be referred to as the vice president because he opposes use of the word "vice" on religious grounds originated with a satirical article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Republican VP candidate Mike Pence doesn't want to be referred to as the vice president because he opposes use of the word "vice" on religious grounds.

title: Jeff Foxworthy Gets Attacked by Liberals After Publicly SLAMMING Hillary Clinton
subtitle: Popular comedian Jeff Foxworthy was not "attacked by liberals," nor did he "publicly slam Hillary Clinton."
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Comedian Jeff Foxworthy slammed Hillary Clinton and was attacked by liberals.

title: Did Clinton Supporters Start the 'Birther' Movement?
subtitle: We investigate Donald Trump's claim that the conspiracy theory about Barack Obama not being born in the U.S. originated inside Hillary Clinton's 2008 presidential campaign.
author: David Emery
statement: Hillary Clinton and/or members of her 2008 presidential campaign started the "birther" movement questioning whether Barack Obama was born in the U.S.

title: Hillary Clinton Is Actually Dead and Has Been Cloned
subtitle: One of the stranger claims about the Democratic candidate for president is that she was "eliminated" in 1998 and has since been replaced by a clone.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The real Hillary Clinton has been dead since 1998 and was replaced with a clone.

title: Chelsea Clinton's Apartment Houses a Secret Hospital
subtitle: After Hillary Clinton went to visit her daughter after appearing to fall during an 11 September 2016 event, rumors swirled that Chelsea Clinton's home is actually a medical facility.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Chelsea Clinton's home is actually a medical care facility for Hillary Clinton in order to more effectively hide and treat her health problems.

title: American Legislator Wants Canadians Banned from Driving in USA
subtitle: A satirical article reporting that an American legislator wanted to ban Canadian drivers from U.S. roads was mistaken for real news by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: American legislator John Grumpart wants to ban Canadians from driving on U.S. roads.

title: 11 States Agree to Implement and Enforce Truck Curfew
subtitle: The U.S Department of Transportation is not working with eleven states to keep trucks off the road between 11PM and 6AM.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Eleven states are introducing a truck curfew from 11PM until 6AM.

title: Is This Barack Obama's Kenyan Certified Registration of Birth?
subtitle: "It's definitely a copy of my certificate. It's so laughable it's ridiculous."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Certified Registration of Birth issued in Kenya documents that Barack Obama was born in that country.

title: Russia Has Amassed Troops to Surround the U.S. Borders
subtitle: A fake news story from a conspiracy-flogging site reported that tens of thousands of Russian troops were poised along the borders of the U.S.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Tens of thousands of Russian troops are surrounding U.S. borders.

title: Suppressed North Dakota Pipeline Protest Photo
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a pipeline protest in North Dakota is actually a picture of the crowd at the 1969 Woodstock Festival.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a large group of people protesting against the construction of an oil pipeline in North Dakota.

title: WhatsApp Will Share Personal User Information with Facebook and Make It Public?
subtitle: Facebook purchased the texting app in 2014, but WhatsApp says personal user information won't be shared on that platform, and users can opt out of other data sharing.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: WhatsApp will share personal user information with Facebook, who will make it  publicly available.

title: Ted Nugent: 'I Don't Get How a Chimp Gets to Invoke Human Rights'
subtitle: Ted Nugent recently made comments about President Obama's support for NFL player Colin Kaepernick's protests,  but he didn't call the athlete a "chimp."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ted Nugent called Colin Kaepernick a "chimp" when discussing the President's support for the athlete's protest.

title: Young Protester Stares Down Police
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a young woman protesting pipeline construction in North Dakota was actually taken in Chile.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young woman staring down a police officer during a pipeline protest in North Dakota.

title: Ted Cruz Said 'If Something Happens to Hillary' He'll 'Run as a Democrat Against Trump'
subtitle: Ted Cruz did not say that he'd run as a Democrat to defeat Donald Trump if Hillary Clinton dropped out of the 2016 presidential race.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ted Cruz said he'd run as a Democrat against Donald Trump if Hillary Clinton had to drop out of the 2016 presidential race.

title: Hillary Clinton Was Responsible for the Waco Massacre?
subtitle: Clinton was not in any position that would have given her authority to order or escalate the siege that ended with the deaths of 76 religious cult members in 1993.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Hillary Clinton was responsible for the siege on the Branch Davidian compound in Waco, Texas, that ended with 76 civilian deaths.

title: Shipment of Samsung Smartphones Explodes During Transport, 3 Dead
subtitle: A fake news site used news about Samsung smartphone batteries' overheating to spin a false story about a fatal truck explosion.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A truck carrying a shipment of Samsung smartphones exploded, killing three people.

title: 'Rain Falling in One Spot'
subtitle: A video purportedly showing "mysterious rain" all falling in "one spot" doesn't show rain at all.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a "mysterious rain" all falling in "one spot."

title: Sheep Walking Through Gate
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a group of sheep passing through a gate - despite the absence of a fence - is frequently shared as an example of "the trap of thinking."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of sheep squeezing through a gate, despite no fence hemming them in.

title: Does Charmin make Pumpkin Spice Bathroom Tissue?
subtitle: The Charmin brand has not released a festive Pumpkin Spice variety of bathroom tissue for the upcoming Fall season.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Charmin had introduced a Pumpkin Spice variety of toilet paper.

title: China's Jinhua Zoo Names Baby Gorilla Harambe McHarambeface?
subtitle: A hoax news article blended several memes when it reported that a zoo named a baby gorilla Harambe McHarambeface.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A zoo in China named a baby gorilla Harambe McHarambeface.

title: New Regulation Bans Children from Riding on Motorcycles
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a new federal law would bar persons under the age of 18-years old from riding as passengers on motorcycles.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A new federal law will bar persons under the age of 18-years old from riding as passengers on motorcycles.

title: Hillary Clinton Diagnosed with Vascular Dementia, Has One Year to Live?
subtitle: A viral video uses forged and misrepresented evidence in an attempt to prove that Hillary Clinton is suffering from subcortical vascular dementia and has  only  a year to live.
author: David Emery
statement: Leaked medical records, combined with viral images and videos, prove that Hillary Clinton is suffering from subcortical vascular dementia and has only one year to live.

title: Did the Steelers' James Harrison Threaten His Teammates?
subtitle: Pittsburgh Steelers linebacker James Harrison didn't issue a tweet threatening teammates who were considering kneeling during the national anthem.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pittsburgh Steelers linebacker James Harrison issued a tweet threatening teammates who were considering kneeling during the national anthem.

title: Hillary Clinton Death Hoax
subtitle: Conspiracy theory holds that Hillary Clinton was reported dead on 11 September 2016,  but the news was subsequently covered up and she was replaced by a body double.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton was reported dead on 11 September 2016, but the news was subsequently covered up and she was replaced by a body double.

title: Did President Obama Say We Deserved 9/11?
subtitle: Reports that President Obama said the United States 'deserved 9/11' for not respecting Islam originated with a junk news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama said that the United States deserved being attacked by terrorists on 9/11 because we didn't respect Islam.

title: Finding the 'Hidden' iPhone 7 Headphone Jack
subtitle: Drilling a small hole into the shell of an iPhone 7 won't help you find the device's "hidden" headphone jack.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Drilling into the shell of an iPhone 7 will reveal the device's missing headphone jack.

title: Hillary 'Body Double' Teresa Barnwell Appeared in NYC After Clinton's 9/11 Medical Incident?
subtitle: #HillarysBodyDouble took over Twitter with claims that lookalike Teresa Barnwell had appeared in New York to impersonate Hillary Clinton after the candidate left a 9/11 event following a medical incident.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman who appeared in New York after Hillary Clinton left a 9/11 memorial service for medical reasons was body double Teresa Barnwell, not Clinton herself.

title: Due to Religious Intolerance, Facebook Bans All Christian-Themed Content
subtitle: A fake news site reported that Facebook was banning the posting of Christian-themed content while allowing all other religions free rein on the social network.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook is banning all Christian-themed content but will allow every other religion to share faith-based material on their social network.

title: Did a Physician Confirm Hillary Clinton Has Parkinson's Disease?
subtitle: A montage of photos and video clips of Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton purportedly demonstrates she has symptoms of Parkinson's disease.
author: David Emery
statement: Photos and video clips narrated by a medical doctor demonstrate that Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton likely has Parkinson's disease.

title: Hillary Clinton Told 'Seventeen' Magazine She Didn't Want Her Daughter Marrying a Black Man?
subtitle: There's no evidence (beyond a meme) that Hillary Clinton said she would be disappointed if her daughter married a black man during an interview with "Seventeen" magazine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton said that she would be 'disappointed' if her daughter Chelsea married a black man.

title: Julian Assange Said Bernie Sanders Won Race, Was Threatened
subtitle: Claims that Bernie Sanders was threatened to drop out of the presidential race originated with a fabricated Julian Assange interview.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange said Bernie Sanders was threatened to drop out of the presidential race.

title: Brock Turner's Father: 'The Girl Got No Punishment for Being a Slut'
subtitle: Brock Turner's father did not lament that the victim in his son's sexual assault case received no punishment.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Brock Turner's father lamented that that the victim in his son's sexual assault case received no punishment.

title: Hillary Clinton Wore 'Secret Earpiece' During Commander-in-Chief Forum
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Hillary Clinton wearing a 'secret earpiece' during NBC's 'Commander-In-Chief' candidate forum reveals nothing unusual.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton wore a 'secret earpiece' at NBC's Commander-In-Chief forum.

title: Durex to Produce Eggplant-Flavored Condoms
subtitle: Durex jokingly suggested they were producing an eggplant-flavored prophylactic while campaigning for a new condom emoji.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Prophylactic maker Durex is producing an eggplant-flavored condom.

title: President Obama Confirms He Will Refuse to Leave Office If Trump Is Elected
subtitle: A fake news site cranked out an election year fairy tale guaranteed to tickle the fancy of every conspiracy theorist.
author: David Emery
statement: President Obama has announced he'll refuse to leave office if Donald Trump is elected President.

title: 5 Million Uncounted Sanders Ballots Found on Clinton's Email Server
subtitle: Some amusing fake news holds that nearly 5 million uncounted California electronic ballots were found on Hillary Clinton's private email server by the F.B.I.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Nearly 5 million uncounted California ballots cast for Bernie Sanders were found on Hillary Clinton's private email server by the F.B.I.

title: Crazed Woman Cuts Off Man's Penis for Not Making Eye Contact During Sex
subtitle: A fake news article reported that an Arizona woman named Shania Jones was arrested for cutting off the tip of her partner's penis.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A fake news article reported that a cross-eyed woman cut off her partner's penis after he refused to look her in the eye during sex.

title: Did Soros Say 'I'm Going to Bring Down the U.S. by Funding Black Hate Groups'?
subtitle: This doesn't sound like the kind of plan someone would openly announce.
author: Dan Evon
statement: George Soros said that he funded the Black Lives Matter movement because he wanted to 'bring down the United States' and 'the black community is the easiest to manipulate.'

title: Hurricane Hermine Waterspout in North Carolina
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a waterspout produced in North Carolina by Hurricane Hermine is actually a composite of multiple images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a large waterspout produced by Hurricane Hermine off the coast of North Carolina.

title: Phyllis Schlafly Said, 'There Will Be a Woman President Over My Dead Body'?
subtitle: The late Phyllis Schlafly, an outspoken, anti-feminist conservative, said a great many controversial things in her lifetime, but not that there would be a female president over her dead body.
author: David Emery
statement: Phyllis Schlafly once said, "There will be a woman president over my dead body."

title: Obama Asks Americans Not to Hold 9/11 Victim Tribute Because of Muslim Protesters Being 'Offended'
subtitle: A fake news article reported that President Obama asked Americans not to hold 9/11 victim tributes because they are offensive to Muslims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama asked Americans not to hold 9/11 victim tributes because they are offensive to Muslims.

title: Bill Murray Said 'Religion Is the Worst Enemy of Mankind'
subtitle: Rumors that popular comedian Bill Murray proclaimed 'Religion is the worst enemy of mankind' originated with a fake news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Comedian Bill Murray is running for president and proclaimed religion to be "the worst enemy of mankind."

title: Fireman Suspended and Jailed by Atheist Mayor for Praying at Scene of Fire
subtitle: There is not a grain of truth to a report about an atheist mayor in Louisiana's firing a praying firefighter.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The atheist mayor of DeQuincy, Louisiana, fired a firefighter for praying at the scene of a fire.

title: Was the Empire State Building Lit Green on 9/11 for a Muslim Holiday?
subtitle: Anti-Islam articles falsely reported that the Empire State Building would be illuminated green on September 11 in honor of the Muslim festival of Eid-al-Adha.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama is planning on lighting the Empire State Building green to celebrate the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Fitr on 11 September 2016.

title: Did a Houston Store Close on September 11 to Honor a 9/11 Hijacker?
subtitle: A store in a Houston shopping mall closed on September 11 to honor a 7th century religious figure, not  one of the 9/11 hijackers.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A store in a Houston shopping closed on September 11 to honor one of the 9/11 hijackers.

title: Has Phillip Morris Introduced 'Marlboro M' Marijuana Cigarettes?
subtitle: Reports that Phillip Morris is bringing 'Marlboro M' brand marijuana cigarettes to market started as an old April Fool's joke.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Phillip Morris has announced the introduction of Marlboro M brand marijuana cigarettes.

title: Idaho Mother Sentenced to Prison After Multiple Citations for Breastfeeding in Public
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that a woman was sentenced to seven years in prison for breastfeeding her baby.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman in Idaho was sentenced to seven years in prison for breastfeeding in public.

title: Tweet Claims Clinton to Drop Out of Presidential Race
subtitle: A tweet purporting to be from a CBS reporter claiming that Hillary Clinton was dropping out of the presidential race is a poorly executed hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CBS reporter Hannah Chanpong tweeted that Hillary Clinton was dropping out of the 2016 presidential race.

title: Chemotherapy Doesn't Work, Doctor Blows the Whistle
subtitle: A compendium of misrepresentations led to a Facebook rumor claiming a long-dead doctor had recently revealed that chemotherapy doesn't work.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dr. Hardin B. Jones recently revealed that chemotherapy doesn't work 97% of the time, and doctors only recommend it to get kickbacks.

title: Fisherman Survives Inside Whale for Three Days
subtitle: The faux-spirituality web site Spirit Science posted a spoof story of a Spanish fisherman supposedly swallowed by a whale, who lived to tell the story.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Spanish fisherman survived in a whale's belly for three days before being "flushed out" alive.

title: 'Boombox' Cartoon Pulled from Newspaper for Criticizing Clinton, Obama?
subtitle: The Los Angeles Times did not stop publishing a cartoon called "Boombox" by Dixon Diaz because of its political views.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Los Angeles Times stopped publishing work by cartoonist Dixon Diaz because he criticized Hillary Clinton.

title: CDC Announces Plan to Detain Americans for Forced Vaccinations?
subtitle: An alarmist rumor misleadingly claimed the CDC was planning to apprehend and detain Americans to administer forced vaccinations.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The CDC has proposed a new rule enabling the agency to "apprehend and detain anyone, anywhere, at any time, without Due Process or any right of appeal" and "administer forced vaccinations."

title: Where the World's Unsold Cars Go to Die
subtitle: Photographs do not show thousands and thousands of unsold new cars deteriorating in storage lots.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show thousands and thousands of unsold new cars deteriorating in storage lots until they are scrapped.

title: George Soros: Trump Will Win Popular Vote by a Landslide but Clinton Victory a 'Done Deal'
subtitle: An altered video twists the words of billionaire Democrat George Soros to create the impression he made a conspiratorial prediction about the 2016 presidential election.
author: David Emery
statement: Billionaire George Soros predicted Donald Trump will win the popular vote by a landslide but lose to Hillary Clinton because the election is rigged.

title: What If Only Taxpayers Voted?
subtitle: A map doesn't show the results of the 2012 election if only people who pay taxes had voted, but instead was stolen from an article about what voting would have looked like without universal suffrage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A map shows the results of the 2012 election if "only taxpayers voted."

title: Donald Trump Called President Obama a 'Lying N****r'?
subtitle: While Trump has made no shortage of controversial comments, he did not publicly call the president the "N-word."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Republican nominee Donald Trump called President Barack Obama a "lying n*****r" during a confrontation.

title: Mexico-Guatemala Border Wall
subtitle: Multiple photographs purporting to show a border wall between Mexico and Guatemala actually picture barriers in other parts of the world.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a border fence between the countries of Mexico and Guatemala.

title: Chinese 'Synthetic' Cabbages
subtitle: A video of a man making wax display vegetables has been used out of context to suggest China is dumping "synthetic cabbages" on unwitting consumers.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video depicts a Chinese vendor making "synthetic cabbages" for sale in American restaurants and supermarkets.

title: Sylvester Stallone Death Hoax
subtitle: A Facebook message falsely reported that the 'Rocky' actor had passed away from prostate cancer.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Sylvester Stallone has passed away from prostate cancer.

title: Was a Snake Dropped on a Family Barbecue By a Hawk?
subtitle: A viral video purportedly shows a hawk dropping a snake on a family barbecue.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a hawk snatching up a snake and dropping it amidst a family's barbecue.

title: Does This Video Show Disney's Magical 'Color-Changing' Dress?
subtitle: The enchanted dress seemingly changes color
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a Disney Princess in Tokyo with a dress that changes color at will.

title: Did U.S. Special Forces Kill a Giant in Kandahar?
subtitle: Several conspiracy theory-oriented web sites are claiming a Biblical giant with flaming red hair was killed by U.S. soldiers in Afghanistan.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: United States Special Forces killed a giant in Kandahar in 2002, and the government is trying to cover it up.

title: Hillary Clinton Used Green Screen to Make a Fake Crowd in Nevada
subtitle: A conspiracy theory video falsely reported that Hillary Clinton used a green screen to fake a crowd during her speech in Nevada in August 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton used a green screen to add fake audience members during her August 2016 speech in Nevada.

title: Did Bill Maher and Michael Moore Snatch Donald Trump's Tax Returns?
subtitle: Joking tweets sent by comedian Bill Maher and filmmaker Michael Moore about a heist involving Donald Trump's tax returns confused some social media users.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bill Maher and Michael Moore sneaked onto Donald Trump's plane and stole his tax returns.

title: Colin Kaepernick Reportedly Found Dead in San Francisco Home
subtitle: A predictable death hoax claimed that embattled NFL star Colin Kaepernick died during a national controversy over patriotism in August 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Colin Kaepernick was found dead in a San Francisco home during a controversy over his refusal to stand during the national anthem.

title: Did Minneapolis Muslims 'Force' the Government to Provide Halal Food?
subtitle: A halal food pantry in Minneapolis is not funded by any government sources.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Taxpayers are picking up the tab for food shelves in Minneapolis to provide halal food to Muslims on welfare.

title: Shocking Video Shows Shark Attacking Surfer
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a man being attacked by a shark actually comes from a movie called 'The Shallows.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a shark attacking a surfer.

title: Food Lion $90 Coupon
subtitle: The Food Lion grocery chain is not offering $90 coupons to Facebook users who click and share links.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An online coupon offers shoppers $90 off any purchase in a Food Lion grocery store.

title: Does the Red Cross Ban Prayer at Shelters, Even in Churches?
subtitle: After catastrophic floods in Louisiana, rumors held that the Red Cross had banned prayer in all shelters (even those located in churches).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Red Cross banned prayer in all disaster shelters, even those in churches.

title: 'Smiling' Sun with 'Smiling' Birds
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing three birds flying in a 'smile' formation near a 'smiling' sun is a composite of at least two different photographs.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows three 'smiling' birds next to a 'smiling' sun.

title: 11 States Ban the Use of Electronic Cigarettes in Vehicles?
subtitle: A fake news site stirred up concern among vapers with a false claim that eleven states had banned the use of e-cigarettes inside automobiles.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Eleven states have banned the use of electronic cigarettes inside cars.

title: Was JFK Jr. a U.S. Senate Frontrunner Before His 'Suspicious' Plane Crash?
subtitle: John F. Kennedy Jr. was not a candidate in New York's U.S. Senate race before dying in a July 1999 plane crash, clearing the way for Hillary Clinton to win the seat.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: John F. Kennedy Jr. was a frontrunner for a U.S. Senate seat from New York just before he was killed in a suspicious plane crash in 1999.

title: U.S. Announces Plans to Ban Pokemon Go Permanently
subtitle: The United States government has neither announced nor suggested they plan to permanently "ban" the popular Pokemon Go app.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. government has announced  they are planning to permanently ban Pokemon Go.

title: Did Neil deGrasse Tyson Address Gender Inequality in Science on Twitter?
subtitle: A rant on Twitter attributed to the astrophysicist actually came from a parody account.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Neil deGrasse Tyson addressed gender inequality on Twitter by tearing apart a joke about women in science.

title: Mike Pence Calls for a Ban on Condoms Because 'They Lead to Abortions'
