subtitle: A fake news article claiming Mike Pence called for a condom ban led to images decoupling the falsehood from its source.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mike Pence called for a condom ban because he said their use leads to abortions.

title: Did Colin Kaepernick Convert to Islam?
subtitle: Rumors that the controversial NFL quarterback had converted to Islam were circulated along with doctored photographs of him.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick shortly after he converted to Islam.

title: Oregon Elementary School Bans Pledge of Allegiance
subtitle: A fake news story claims the nonexistent principal of a nonexistent Oregon school is banning recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance for the remainder of the 2016-17 school year.
author: David Emery
statement: The principal of Mountain Dell Elementary School in Oregon sent a letter to parents informing them that the Pledge of Allegiance will be banned for the remainder of the school year.

title: Is This a Photograph of a Rare Marbled Fuark?
subtitle: This elusive creature is said to inhabit the sparse woodlands of Eastern Cambodia.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A rare 'marbled fuark' was captured on camera in Eastern Cambodia.

title: North Dakota Gives the Green Light to Shoot Indigenous Tribes on Sight
subtitle: North Dakota's governor declared a state of emergency over ongoing protests of the Dakota Access Pipeline, but he didn't authorize the shooting of protesters "on sight."
author: Dan Evon
statement: North Dakota Governor Jack Dalrymple gave the "green light" to shoot indigenous people on sight.

title: Was a High School Teen Shot After Police Mistook a Saxophone for a Machine Gun?
subtitle: Reports of Alabama law enforcement shooting a saxophone-wielding teenager came from a fake news web site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A high school boy was shot by a police officer who mistook his saxophone for a gun.

title: Did President Obama Enforce an Islamic Prayer Opening in the U.S. House?
subtitle: The House opening prayer led by imam Hamad Chebli was no different than those of the other six Islamic religious leaders who have done so since 2000 - including three during the Bush administration.
author: David Emery
statement: President Obama "enforced" an Islamic opening prayer in the U.S. House of Representatives.

title: Heather Bresch Attacked by Bee Swarm After Raising EpiPen Price?
subtitle: A satirical article written by "God" reported that Mylan CEO Heather Bresch was swarmed by bees and suffered an allergic reaction.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mylan CEO Heather Bresch as attacked by a bee swarm whilst strolling in a park and no one nearby had an EpiPen on hand to assist her because they're too expensive.

title: Usain Bolt Donates All His $20 Million Olympic Earnings to His Former School
subtitle: Fake news articles reported that Usain Bolt was donating his entire Olympics earnings to various causes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Usain Bolt donated his entire $20 million earnings from the Olympic Games to his Jamaican high school.

title: Does Kinking a Live Electrical Wire Stop Electricity and Make it Safe?
subtitle: An image represents that you can safely work on live electrical wires by simply kinking them "like a garden hose."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Kinking an electrical wire stops electricity from flowing through it like kinking a garden hose stops water from flowing.

title: Did Trump Say He'd Be 'More Popular Than Fried Chicken, Watermelon in the Black Community'?
subtitle: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump didn't resort to an old racist stereotype when predicting how popular he'll be with the black community.
author: David Emery
statement: Presidential candidate Donald Trump said he'll be "more popular than fried chicken and watermelon" in the black community.

title: Motorcyclists Protest Burkini Ban
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing two motorcyclists protesting a 2016 burkini ban incident in France was actually taken several years earlier.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two motorcyclists on a beach protesting a 2016 burkini ban in France.

title: Were Tennessee Schoolchildren Forced to Bow Down to Allah?
subtitle: A photograph of children kneeling  has been attributed to many locations and does not capture Tennessee public school students being forced to pray in a mosque.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows Tennessee public school students being forced to pray in a mosque.

title: Creflo Dollar Endorses Donald Trump
subtitle: A fake news report that pastor Creflo Dollar was told by God to endorse Donald Trump was picked up by other sites.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pastor Creflo Dollar was told by God to endorse Donald Trump.

title: 'Barney' Was Based on a 1930s Serial Killer
subtitle: A rumor that the children's TV show 'Barney & Friends'  was based on a 1930s serial killer is just a bit of fiction.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The children's TV show 'Barney & Friends'  was based on a 1930s serial killer.

title: Michele Bachmann: 'White People Suffered More Under Obama Than Blacks During Slavery'
subtitle: A fake news site prompted rumors Michele Bachmann said that the Obama administration was worse for white people than slavery was for black people.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Michele Bachmann said that white people suffered more under the Obama administration than black people did during slavery.

title: Neil DeGrasse Tyson 'Completely Shuts Down' Girl Who Wants to Live on Jupiter
subtitle: Celebrity astrophysicist Neil DeGrasse Tyson did not admonish a young girl who stated she wished to live on the planet Jupiter.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Astrophysicist Neil DeGrasse Tyson admonished a little girl who said she wanted to live on the planet Jupiter.

title: Peotone High School Bans U.S. Flags
subtitle: Peotone High School in Illinois has not banned American flags nor decreed them to be offensive.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Peotone High School in Illinois banned American flags because they offend people and called an assembly to inform students U.S. flags would not be "tolerated" in any "shape or form."

title: Trump Attacks God in Tweetstorm
subtitle: No, Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump did not really lash out at God in a series of blasphemous tweets. It's a satire.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump issued a series of angry tweets calling God a "dope," a "clown," and a "loser."

title: Young Woman Struggles to Open Can of Spaghetti-Os
subtitle: A video depicting a young woman's laborious efforts to open a can of Spaghetti-Os, cheered on by a crowd, is actually an excerpt from a performance art piece.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video depicts a young woman's struggling to open a can of Spaghetti-Os as a crowd watches and cheers her eventual hard-won victory.

title: 'My Daddy's Life Matters'
subtitle: A photograph showing a police officer's daughter holding a 'My Daddy's Life Matters' sign has been altered into something more politically controversial.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of a 'My Daddy's Life Matters' sign included text explaining why its OK for police officers to shoot black men.

title: Clouds Over Geneva Show CERN Opening a Portal to a New Dimension?
subtitle: Conspiracy theorists speculated that pictures of a storm over Switzerland were proof that the Large Hadron Collider had opened a portal to another dimension.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Eerie clouds over Geneva were caused by the particle collider at CERN opening a portal to a new dimension.

title: Did a Woman Give Birth to a Human-Goat Hybrid?
subtitle: "She continues to insist that Nibbles was her only hope of having a family and a future."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A woman who was impregnated by a goat has given birth to a goat-child.

title: President Obama: 'Even Terrorists Have Rights and We Should Respect Them'
subtitle: A clickbait web site is sucking in users by peddling a fake Obama quote stating that even terrorists have rights, and we should respect them.
author: David Emery
statement: President Obama said, "Even terrorists have rights and we should respect them."

title: Is a Lesbian 'Brokeback Mountain' Remake Confirmed for 2017?
subtitle: Reports that the 2005 film 'Brokeback Mountain' is to be remade with Margot Robbie and Emma Watson in the lead roles are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The movie 'Brokeback Mountain' is being remade with with Margot Robbie and Emma Watson in the lead roles.

title: Is Mark Zuckerberg David Rockefeller's Grandson?
subtitle: We look into the conspiracy theory that Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg's real name is Jacob Greenberg and he's the grandson of billionaire banker David Rockefeller.
author: David Emery
statement: Mark Zuckerberg's real name is Jacob Michael Greenberg and he is the grandson of billionaire David Rockefeller.

title: Does This Video Show a Dragon That Fell from the Sky in Tibet?
subtitle: No matter how the dragon got there, it's still not a real dragon.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a real dragon that fell from the sky in Tibet.

title: U.S. Army Memo Announces Preparations for Martial Law
subtitle: U.S. Army officials say a memo announcing that martial law training exercises and preparation will begin at Fort Carson, Colorado is a 'complete fabrication.'
author: David Emery
statement: An Army memorandum announces martial law training and preparation to begin at Fort Carson, Colorado, in September 2016.

title: 'Stranger Things' Season Two to be Written by Stephen King?
subtitle: An article that reported Stephen King would be writing the second season of the popular television show came from a satire news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The second season of 'Stranger Things' will be written by Stephen King.

title: Do Energy Drinks Contain Bull Semen?
subtitle: Red Bull and other brands of energy drinks employ various stimulating ingredients, but none of them is bull semen.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Red Bull and other brands of energy drinks contain bull semen.

title: Did Iranian Olympic Coverage Censor Images of Female Athletes?
subtitle: Censorship in Iran was purportedly demonstrated by footage from a state-run sports network.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video showing highly censored female athletes competing in the 2016 Olympics was broadcast by the Iranian Sports Channel.

title: After Colonoscopy Reveals Brain Tumor, Donald Trump Drops from Race
subtitle: Fake news reported that Donald Trump was dropping out of the presidential race due to a brain tumor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump dropped out of the presidential race in August 2016 due to a brain tumor.

title: Mysterious Creature Filmed in Portuguese Desert
subtitle: A viral video supposedly shot in Portugal seemingly shows a strange alien entity that looks like a cross between Bigfoot and a chupacabra.
author: David Emery
statement: Video shows a humanoid creature of unknown species ambling through a Portuguese desert.

title: Donald Trump Says Harriet Tubman Face Belongs on Foodstamps
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Donald Trump said abolitionist Harriet Tubman's likeness belongs on food stamps, not the $20 bill.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that Harriet Tubman's face belongs on food stamps, not the $20 bill.

title: Rainbow Grilled Cheese
subtitle: A humorous video about the "Rainbow Creamery" is part of a series that spoofs popular Pinterest recipes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a real farm that gets rainbow cheese from rainbow cows.

title: Donald Trump's Harvard Rejection Letter
subtitle: An image purportedly showing the rejection letter Donald Trump received from Harvard University is not real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows the rejection letter Donald Trump received from Harvard University.

title: Did a Walmart Customer Find a Dead Baby in a Discount DVD Bin?
subtitle: "Diane Jessop told local reporters that Walmart management provided her with a $50 gift card to make up for her troubling experience."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A customer discovered a deceased and discarded baby in a Kentucky Walmart's discount DVD bin.

title: Tim Kaine: 'Whites Must Become a Minority'
subtitle: A statement by Democratic VP nominee Tim Kaine about the need for white people to understand what life is like for minorities was recast by pundits as a call for Caucasians to become the minority to atone for racism.
author: David Emery
statement: Tim Kaine said Caucasians must become a minority to atone for racism and oppression suffered by blacks.

title: Mike Pence Blames Media for Trump Controversies?
subtitle: Republican VP candidate Mike Pence didn't proclaim that "the things Donald Trump says wouldn't hurt our campaign half as much if the press didn't report it."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Republican VP candidate Mike Pence  proclaimedthat "the things Donald Trump says wouldn't hurt our campaign half as much if the press didn't report it."

title: Mutation Response Vehicle
subtitle: Ominous-looking "Mutation Response Vehicles" spotted near Longwood, Florida, amplified Zika fears, but the automobiles were just part of the Burning Man festival.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: "Mutation Response Vehicle" vehicles spotted near Longwood, Florida, are related to outbreaks of the Zika virus.

title: Netflix Cancels 'Orange Is the New Black'?
subtitle: A fake news article falsely reported that Netflix had cancelled the upcoming season of the popular prison drama 'Orange Is the New Black.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix has cancelled season 5 of the popular prison drama 'Orange Is the New Black.'

title: U.S. Gymnastics Coaches Bela and Marta Karolyi Were Illegal Immigrants?
subtitle: Rumor claims U.S. Gymnastics coaches Bela and Marta Karolyi were "illegal immigrants" to America, but historical accounts don't corroborate that descriptor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: U.S. Gymnastics coaches Bela and Marta Karolyi were illegal immigrants.

title: Olympic Goofs
subtitle: Dubious list of old jokes and double entrendres purportedly collects "the top nine comments made by NBC sports commentators during the Summer Olympics."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: List of double entrendres collects "the top nine comments made by NBC sports commentators during the Summer Olympics."

title: Lunar Footprint Mystery
subtitle: Does a photograph of Neil Armstrong's spacesuit show that the tread of his boots didn't match the "footprints" he supposedly left on the moon?
author: Dan Evon
statement: The boots on Neil Armstrong's spacesuit don't match up with the "footprints" supposedly he left on the moon.

title: Hillary Clinton Wears a Defibrillator?
subtitle: A photograph of Hillary Clinton speaking at a campaign event was circulated as proof that the presidential nominee wears a defibrillator.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Hillary Clinton wearing a defibrillator under her clothes at a campaign event.

title: Obama Signs Executive Order Banning the Pledge of Allegiance in Schools Nationwide
subtitle: Umimaginative fake news publishers have recycled an old hoax about President Obama's banning the Pledge of Allegiance.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: President Obama has issued an executive order banning the Pledge of Allegiance in U.S. schools.

title: Police Shoot Department Store Mannequin 67 Times After Mistaking it for Gunman
subtitle: Police in Scranton, Pennsylvania, did not gun down a store mannequin that "failed to comply" with their orders.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police opened fire on a store mannequin after it failed to follow their orders.

title: Johnson's Winking Glue
subtitle: 'Johnson's Winking Glue' is not a real thing, nor is an advertisement touting its virtues.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows an advertisement for a real product called Johnson's Winking Glue.

title: Alabama Legislator Angry That
Allowed in Olympics
subtitle: A fake news article reported an Alabama legislator complained that the 'state of Georgia' was allowed to compete at the Olympics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An Alabama state senator published an open letter saying that the state of Georgia shouldn't have been allowed to compete in the Olympics.

title: Did a Grandmother with AK-47 Save Cops Being Attacked by a Street Gang?
subtitle: Reports detailed an incident wherein a 79-year-old grandma armed with an AK-47 saved the lives of two LAPD officers attacked by gang members.
author: David Emery
statement: 79-year-old Wendy Robinson of Los Angeles came to the rescue of two LAPD officers with her AK-47 assault rifle when they were attacked by gang members.

title: ABC News Poll Shows Trump with Wide Lead on Clinton
subtitle: A "live poll" purportedly conducted by ABC News showing Donald Trump with a large lead over Hillary Clinton is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A live poll conducted by ABC News in August 2016 shows Donald Trump, Jill Stein, and Gary Johnson all well ahead of Hillary Clinton.

title: Media Ignore Kim Rhode's Sixth Olympic Medal
subtitle: After U.S. shooter Kim Rhode won her 6th medal in as many Olympiads, a rumor asserted that the media were ignoring her accomplishments due to her politics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The media ignored Kim Rhode's bronze medal-winning performance in the 2016 Summer Olympics due to her stance on gun rights.

title: Did a Washington School District Ban Pork Due to a Muslim Outcry?
subtitle: Schools in Kent, Washington, have long since reduced the amount of pork offered on school menus for reasons unrelated to recent complaints by Muslims.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Schools in Kent, Washington, have removed pork from school menus because Muslim families were offended.

title: Forever 21 Swastika Rings
subtitle: A photograph of purported Forever 21 swastika rings has gone viral, but the company denies they sell any such product.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Retailer Forever 21 is selling rings and other jewelry that include swastikas.

title: Was Sharia Law Established in Texas?
subtitle: The existence of voluntary religious tribunals for conflict resolution is not the equivalent of imposing "Sharia law."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Sharia law has been established in a jurisdiction in Texas.

title: Roger Ailes: 'The Truth Is Whatever People Will Believe'
subtitle: A quote about  "truth" frequently attributed to former Fox News Channel CEO Roger Ailes did not originate with him.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News Channel CEO Roger Ailes said that 'the truth is whatever people will believe.'

title: 4-Year-Old Boy Accused of Hacking FBI Database
subtitle: After a series of news stories about politically motivated e-mail hacks emerged in 2016, an old fake news story about a four-year-old boy hacking the FBI's database was recirculated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 4-year-old boy was accused of hacking the FBI's databases.

title: Donald Trump: Utah Is a 'Boring, Small State' with 'Strange People'
subtitle: A tweet purportedly issued by Donald Trump making disparaging comments about Utah is a fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump issued a tweet making disparaging comments about Utah.

title: Person Who Leaked Hillary Clinton's Medical Records Found Dead
subtitle: A fake news article played on a hoax involving Hillary Clinton's "leaked" medical records to craft a tale about the CIA finding a "dead man's switch" on the computer of a deceased doctor's father.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The CIA found a "dead man's switch" on the computer of the deceased father of a doctor treating Hillary Clinton for dementia.

title: 106 Dead In California Music Festival Bombing
subtitle: Fake news articles reported that 106 people were killed at an ISIS-related California music festival bombing.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 106 people were killed at an ISIS-related California music festival bombing.

title: Early Morning Explosion in DC Allegedly Leaves Yet Another DNC Staffer Dead
subtitle: A fake news site leveraged recent tragedies to promulgate a falsehood about a DNC staffer killed in a "mysterious explosion."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A DNC staffer was killed in a "mysterious explosion" following the unsolved murder of a young man in Washington, D.C.

title: Hiroshima vs. Detroit
subtitle: Circulating images purport to compare the effects of urban decay in Detroit with the destruction of Hiroshima, Japan by an atomic bomb during World War II.
author: David Emery
statement: A set of photos draws a realistic comparison between the rebuilt city of Hiroshima 65 years after it was destroyed by an atomic bomb and the present-day urban decay of Detroit after 65 years of governance by the Democratic Party.

title: Plane Crash-Lands on Beach
subtitle: A mobile phone video purportedly showing a plane crash-landing on a beach is actually a commercial for a Dutch travel agency.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a plan  a plane crash-landing on a beach.

title: Nothing Compares to the Iowa State Fair ... Logo
subtitle: No, that phallic silo is not the official logo of the 2016 Iowa State Fair.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Iowa State Fair logo is rendered as a silo and two hay bales that strongly resemble a penis.

title: Angelina Jolie Death Hoax
subtitle: A scammy web site has perpetrated a false rumor that Actress Angelina Jolie committed suicide.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Angelina Jolie committed suicide in August 2016.

title: #SaveTwitter? Social Media Network Not Shutting Down in 2017
subtitle: A spurious rumor holds that the Twitter social media platform will be shutting down in 2017 due to cyberbullying.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Twitter is shutting down in 2017 due to cyberbullying.

title: Are Bees Born Fully Grown?
subtitle: A Snapple "fun fact" and commercial created the misleading impression that bees are born fully grown.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bees are born fully grown.

title: Gary Sinise Tweets Hillary Clinton About Guns
subtitle: An image showing a Twitter conversation between Hillary Clinton and Gary Sinise about guns is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Gary Sinise posted a witty retort  after Hillary Clinton tweeted a message about gun control.

title: Jesus Statue 'Miraculously' Opens Eyes
subtitle: A viral video showing a statue of Jesus Christ in a Mexican church 'miraculously' opening and closing its eyes also shows signs of tampering.
author: David Emery
statement: Camera phone video taken in a Mexican church shows a statue of Jesus Christ "miraculously" opening and closing its eyes.

title: Did Ronald Reagan Predict a Trump Presidency?
subtitle: "When I met that young man, I felt like I was the one shaking hands with a president," Reagan reportedly said.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ronald Reagan said he felt like he was shaking the President's hand when he met Donald Trump.

title: Iran Blurs Photograph Showing Olympics Volleyball Player
subtitle: A photograph showing a blurred-out woman's volleyball player did not originate from an Iranian news agency.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Iran's Tasnim News Agency blurred a woman volleyball player out of a photograph because she was in a bikini.

title: Hillary Clinton Medical Records 'Leaked'
subtitle: Right after the name of Hillary Clinton's physician appeared in the news,  suspect medical records attributed to that doctor were "leaked" online.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Leaked medical records document that Hillary Clinton exhibits signs of dementia and serious illness.

title: 'Weed Dealers' Using Pokemon GO to Hook Children on Drugs
subtitle: The claim that marijuana dealers are using the game to sell "weed needles" comes from a satire page.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Marijuana dealers are using the popular game app Pokemon GO to hook children on drugs.

title: Snowden Pronounced Dead by His Girlfriend in Russia
subtitle: A fake news web site's claim that Edward Snowden was "pronounced dead by his girlfriend" has been aggregated by other low-credibility sites but remains false.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Edward Snowden was "pronounced dead" by his girlfriend in Russia in August 2016.

title: Is This a Live Panda Flown from China to U.S. in Business Class?
subtitle: A viral image purportedly shows a live panda cub seated next to a human being on a China Airlines.
author: David Emery
statement: Viral image shows a real panda seated next to a human being in the business class section of a jetliner.

title: Donald Trump Made Donations to NAMBLA?
subtitle: The claim that Trump is a member of the North American Man/Boy Love Association is the result of a bot programmed by Reddit pranksters.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump won't release his tax returns because they reveal that he has donated millions of dollars to the North American Man/Boy Love Association.

title: Tim Kaine Admits to Open Marriage on Twitter
subtitle: A tweet ostensibly posted by vice presidential candidate Tim Kaine allegedly acknowledges that he has an open marriage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Democratic vice presidential candidate Tim Kaine admitted on Twitter to having an open marriage.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Say Christians in America Must Deny Their Faith?
subtitle: A Hillary Clinton speech on improving the plight of women and girls worldwide has been cited as a demand that American Christians deny their faith
author: David Emery
statement: Hillary Clinton said in a speech that Christians in America must deny their faith in Christianity.

title: 'Superman Is Coming in Supergirl' Poster
subtitle: A promotional poster with what looked like an unfortunate typo was actually a joke made from a piece of fan art.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A poster reading "Superman is coming in Supergirl" was an official promotion by the CW network.

title: Does a Viral Photo Show a Real Baby Platypus?
subtitle: Don't you just hate it when people post your embarrassing baby pictures on the internet?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a real baby platypus.

title: Islamic Justice - Boy Punished for Stealing Bread
subtitle: Photographs document a roadside stunt, not a Muslim boy having his arm crushed under a truck as a punishment for stealing bread.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a boy having his arm crushed under a truck as a punishment for stealing bread.

title: The Narilatha Flower
subtitle: Viral images purport to show examples of a 'Narilatha Flower' or 'Nareepol Tree' with blossoms in the shape of a woman's body.
author: David Emery
statement: Viral images show specimens of a plant with flowers in the shape of the female body.

title: Darboy Walmart Abduction Warning
subtitle: Darboy, Wisconsin, is the latest location where human traffickers are purportedly engaging in complicated schemes to snatch random Walmart shoppers.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Darboy Walmart shopper encountered human traffickers using an unexpected menstrual period as a ruse, and a nearby police officer confirmed the interaction was a "new trick" used to abduct women.

title: Loretta Lynch: 'Confederate Flag Tattoos Must All Be Removed IMMEDIATELY'
subtitle: Attorney General Loretta Lynch hasn't demanded that all Confederate flag tattoos be "removed" -- nor could she.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Attorney General Loretta Lynch declared that all Confederate flag tattoos must be removed immediately.

title: Obama Declares His Family Will Move to Canada If Trump Is Elected
subtitle: A fake news story reporting that President Obama stated he was considering moving to Canada if Donald Trump were elected was aggregated by at least one non-satire publication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama declared that he would move his family to Canada if Donald Trump were elected president.

title: Donald Trump Kicked a Crying Baby Out of a Political Rally
subtitle: Misleading headlines reported that GOP candidate Donald Trump ordered a squalling infant removed from the room at a political rally.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump kicked a crying baby out of a political rally.

title: Trump Donates 50k to Charleston Shooter Family to Move Him to Safer Prison
subtitle: A fake news site leveraged news about the beating of an incarcerated Dylann Roof to spread a falsehood about Donald Trump's donating money to facilitate a prison transfer.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump donated $50,000 to ensure suspected Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof was transferred to a "safer" prison.

title: Trump: You People Really Believed Me?
subtitle: A satirical article published by the Charlotte Observer fooled many readers into believing that Donald Trump had dropped out of the 2016 presidential race.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump has dropped out of the 2016 presidential race and endorsed Hillary Clinton.

title: Navy SEALs Ordered to Remove 'Don't Tread on Me' Patches
subtitle: Navy SEALs were not ordered to discontinue wearing the 'Don't Tread on Me' uniform patch because it is too closely associated with 'radical groups.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Navy SEALs were ordered to discontinue wearing the "Don't Tread on Me" uniform patch because it is too closely associated with "radical groups."

title: Khizr Khan Received $375,000 from the Clinton Foundation
subtitle: Dubious images purport to show a bank statement proving that Khizr Khan was paid $375,000 by the Clinton Foundation after speaking at the Democratic National Convention.
author: David Emery
statement: Khizr Kahn's law firm received a $375,000 wire transfer from the Clinton Foundation after he spoke at the Democratic National Convention.

title: Wisconsin Girl Dies as a Result of Receiving Gardasil HPV Vaccine
subtitle: An online article claiming that a 12-year-old girl in Waukesha, Wisconsin, died as a result of receiving the Gardasil HPV vaccine is based on misinformation.
author: David Emery
statement: A 12-year-old Wisconsin girl in died as a result of receiving the Gardasil HPV vaccine.

title: John Kerry Insults Ronald Reagan's Memory
subtitle: John Kerry did not make disparaging remarks after viewing Ronald Reagan's casket as the former president's body lay in repose at his presidential library.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: John Kerry made disparaging remarks after viewing Ronald Reagan's casket as the former president's body lay in repose at his presidential library.

title: The Young Family
subtitle: Photographs of a rare, recently discovered trans-species of human-dog hybrid are actually pictures of an art exhibit.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a rare, recently discovered trans-species of human-dog hybrid.

title: Casey Anthony Obtains License for Home Daycare Business in Florida
subtitle: A hoax news site invented a claim that Casey Anthony, who was acquitted of her daughter's murder, was opening a daycare center.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Casey Anthony is opening a home daycare center in Florida.

title: UN Backs Secret Obama Takeover of Police
subtitle: No, the Obama administration isn't secretly pursuing a plan for the federal takeover of all local police forces.
author: David Emery
statement: There is a secret Obama administration plan for a federal takeover of local police forces via Justice Department consent decrees.

title: Customer Liability for Chipped Card (EMV) Fraud
subtitle: The introduction of the EMV "chip card" has led to misinformation that swiping chipped credit or debit cards leaves consumers liable for fraud.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: If you swipe a chipped card debit/credit at a point-of-sale terminal instead of inserting it into the reader, you become liable for any fraudulent transactions.

title: 'Mike & Molly' Cancelled Due to Melissa McCarthy's Weight Loss?
subtitle: A junk news story about the cancellation of  the 'Mike & Molly' sitcom over Melissa McCarthy's weight loss was created to sell diet pills.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actress Melissa McCarthy admitted that the TV sitcom

title: Deceased FBI Agent Found at Trump Tower with Silenced Pistol
subtitle: A supposedly deceased FBI agent was not caught breaking into Trump Tower with an illegally silenced pistol.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The NYPD captured a supposedly deceased FBI agent breaking into Trump Tower with a silenced pistol.

title: Obama Bribed Iran $400 Million to Release U.S. Prisoners?
subtitle: Rumors and accusations flew about a January 2016 payout to Iran, which coincided with a carefully negotiated prisoner exchange.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The Obama administration secretly bribed Iran to release four prisoners in January 2016.

title: Denzel Washington Switches to Trump
subtitle: Actor Denzel Washington did not announce that he's switching his allegiance to Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election.
author: David Emery
statement: Actor Denzel Washington announced he is switching his support to Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election.

title: Black Lives Matter Co-Founder Poops on Ice Rink
subtitle: Multiple blog posts falsely claimed purported Black Lives Matter activist Kayla McKelvey defecated on an ice rink because "only white people" ice skate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Black Lives Matter co-founder Kayla McKelvey defected on an ice rink because "only white people ice skate."

title: 'Muslim Prayer Curtain' in the White House?
subtitle: President Obama did not remove red, white, and blue decor from the Oval Office and install a "Muslim prayer curtain" in the White House.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President removed red, white, and blue decor from the Oval Office and installed a 'Muslim prayer curtain' in the White House.

title: Did Pat Robertson Say 'Melania's Nude Pics Are Pure Art'?
subtitle: "They are a true work of art precisely because they emphasize the beauty of women," the televangelist supposedly declared.
author: David Emery
statement: TV evangelist Pat Robertson described nude photographs of Melania Trump as "pure art that shows the beauty of God's work."

title: Ghazala Khan's Hijab Was a Political Stunt
subtitle: A viral photograph of a Gold Star Mother without a hijab does not depict Ghazala Khan.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ghazala Khan wore a hijab at the DNC as a political stunt and was depicted alongside President Obama without one in an earlier photograph.

title: Did Kurt Cobain Predict a Donald Trump Presidency in 1993?
subtitle: A viral image suggests that the late Nirvana singer Kurt Cobain hinted at a future Donald Trump presidency over 20 years before it happened.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kurt Cobain predicted or endorsed a Donald Trump presidency in 1993.

title: Captain Khan's Epitaph: 'Beware of Dying as an Apostate'
subtitle: Rumors claiming the epitaph on Capt. Humayun Khan's  headstone refers to him as an "apostate" are rooted in ISIS propaganda.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The headstone of the late U.S. Army Capt. Humayun Khan (son of DNC speaker Khizr Khan) references his "dying as an apostate."

title: Does This List Prove Voter Fraud in 2012?
subtitle: A list of instances supposedly proving voter fraud in the 2012 U.S. presidential election only demonstrates that some people are really bad at math.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A list cites instances proving voter fraud in the 2012 U.S. presidential election.

title: Hillary Clinton Touts Sharia Law as 'Powerful New Direction' for Women
subtitle: A viral quote attributing pro-Sharia sentiments to Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton is a fabrication.
author: David Emery
statement: Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton once said, "I think Sharia Law will be a powerful new direction of freedom and democracy for the women of Libya."

title: New Regulation Requires Motorcycle Owners to Install 75 MPH Governors by January 2017
subtitle: A fake news site started rumors that all American motorcyclists would be required to employ 75 MPH speed governors on their bikes by January 2017.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. government is instituting a regulation mandating all motorcycles be outfitted with 75 MPH governors by January 2017.

title: Tim Kaine Wears Communist Flag Pin at DNC
subtitle: Tim Kaine's "Communist flag pin" actually symbolizes that his son is serving in the U.S. Marines.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tim Kaine wore a communist flag pin during the Democratic National Convention.

title: Trump Leaks Classified Info After Intelligence Briefing
subtitle: The Internet uproar about Donald Trump's supposed leak of classified information after receiving a national security intelligence briefing is baseless.
author: David Emery
statement: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump leaked classified information about a U.S. military base in Saudi Arabia after receiving his first national security intelligence briefing.

title: Trump Claims America Should Never Have Given Canada Its Independence
subtitle: A satirical site reported that Donald Trump had tweeted about America's giving Canada their independence, and many viewers believed the report was accurate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump tweeted an opinion that America never should have "given Canada its independence."

title: Celebrity Summoned to Jury Duty in Your Town!
subtitle: Fake news articles claim various celebrities have been summoned for jury duty in towns and cities they don't reside in.
author: David Emery
statement: [Name of celebrity] has been summoned for jury duty in [name of town] because he or she supposedly owns property there.

title: Tom Hanks Backs Donald Trump for President
subtitle: Online reports that actor Tom Hanks said in a television interview that he backs Donald Trump for president are false.
author: David Emery
statement: Tom Hanks said in a television interview that he backs Donald Trump for president.

title: Kid Rock Sneaks Into Hillary Clinton Event to Shout 'Vote Donald Trump' During Rally
subtitle: A report that musician Kid Rock interrupted a Hillary Clinton event at the 2016 DNC by shouting "Vote Donald Trump" was just a fake news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kid Rock interrupted a Hillary Clinton event at the Democratic National Convention by shouting "Vote Donald Trump."

title: Uniformed Police Officers Banned From the Democratic National Convention
subtitle: Rumors that law enforcement agents in uniform were not allowed on the floor at the Democratic National Convention are untrue.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Uniformed police officers were not allowed on the floor at the Democratic National Convention.

title: Is Green Party Candidate Jill Stein 'Anti-Vaccine'?
subtitle: Dr. Jill Stein's popularity surge during the Democratic National Convention led to rumors that she opposes the use of vaccines.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Green Party presidential candidate Dr. Jill Stein has stated that she opposes the use of vaccines.

title: Is a Testicular Blow Exponentially More Painful Than Childbirth?
subtitle: There are no real winners in this contest.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Getting hit in the testicles is hundreds of times more painful than labor or childbirth.

title: Bill Clinton Said Hillary Suffered More Than 'Those Guys in Benghazi'
subtitle: President Clinton's remark about being "amazed" at what his wife was "put through" during the Benghazi hearings was spun into something he didn't say.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bill Clinton said that testifying at congressional hearings meant that "Hillary suffered more than those guys in Benghazi."

title: Michael Jordan Says 'I Won't Release Another Shoe Until Black People Unite'
subtitle: A fake news article reported that the former NBA superstar criticized blacks because "You will stand in line for my shows but you won't stand up for yourself."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Jordan said that he wasn't going to sell any more shoes "until black people unite."

title: Jaden Smith Commits Suicide
subtitle: A hoax article reported that the actor (and teenaged son of Jada Pinkett Smith and Will Smith) had killed himself.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Jaden Smith committed suicide in July 2016.

title: Mike Rowe 'Unleashes Hell On Hillary'
subtitle: While Mike Rowe posed a charitable challenge to Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton, he did not "unleash hell" on the Democratic nominee due to a lack of donations.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mike Rowe "unleashed hell" on Hillary Clinton after she refused to donate to his charity.

title: Jesus Is Not Coming Back, Vatican Says
subtitle: Reports that a cardinal announced that the Catholic Church no longer believes that Jesus will return came from a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A cardinal announced that the Catholic Church no longer believes that Jesus will return.

title: Joel Osteen Endorses Donald Trump
subtitle: While Joel Osteen complimented Donald Trump during a radio interview, he did not endorse him for president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Televangelist Joel Osteen endorsed Donald Trump.

title: Did Bill Clinton Hold Up LAX Air Traffic for a Haircut?
subtitle: A decades-old, false story about President Bill Clinton's holding up air traffic at the Los Angeles International Airport to get a $200 haircut on Air Force One will probably never go away.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Bill Clinton held up air traffic at Los Angeles International Airport in 1993 to get a $200 haircut on Air Force One.

title: Samsung's Dog-Skinning Machine
subtitle: A graphic calling for a boycott of Samsung products over allegations of animal abuse is based on faulty information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A machine used to skin dogs is manufactured and sold by Samsung.

title: 'When You Need to Get Her Drunk'
subtitle: An image showing a "vintage" Budweiser beer ad bearing the tagline "when you need to get her drunk" is just a Photoshop contest entry.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a vintage Budweiser beer ad bearing the tagline "when you need to get her drunk."

title: Suicide Bomber Explodes After Falling Off Skateboard
subtitle: A video showing a man haplessly wiping out on a hoverboard has been altered to portray him as an exploding suicide bomber.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a suicide bomber exploding after falling off a skateboard.

title: No American Flags Present at the Democratic National Convention
subtitle: Several right-wing web sites offered the misleading claim that American flags had been banned and were absent from display at the 2016 Democratic National Convention.
author: Dan Evon
statement: American flags were banned from display at the 2016 Democratic National Convention.

title: Ted Cruz Will Speak at Democratic National Convention
subtitle: A report that Republican senator Ted Cruz was scheduled to speak at the Democratic National Convention originated with a fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator Ted Cruz is scheduled to speak at the 2016 Democratic National Convention.

title: Pretoria Chinese Restaurants Granted Permission to Sell Dog Meat
subtitle: A story about restaurants in South Africa serving dog generated a lot of outrage, but it was completely fabricated - and plagiarized from previous fictional articles.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Chinese restaurants in one of South Africa's capital cities are now allowed to sell dog meat.

title: Graham Says Christians Must Support Trump or Face Death Camps
subtitle: A fake news article reported that evangelist Franklin Graham warned Christians they would face death camps if they didn't support Donald Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Evangelist Franklin Graham warned Christians that they would face death camps if they didn't support Donald Trump.

title: Pope Francis Shocks World, Endorses Hillary Clinton for President
subtitle: Yet another retread of the same fake news story has Pope Francis offering his endorsement to a third U.S. presidential candidate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pope Francis has endorsed Hillary Clinton for President.

title: Cicero's View of Life
subtitle: A list ascribed to Roman statesman Cicero describing "the situation during his lifetime" is apocryphal.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A list authored by Roman statesman Cicero describes "the situation during his lifetime."

title: Was the Identity of a Baseball-Stealing Woman Revealed?
subtitle: A report that a woman who grabbed a baseball away from a child at an Astros game had been identified as child psychologist Grennele Brashkowitz was just fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman who grabbed a baseball away from a child at an Astros game was identified as child psychologist Grennele Brashkowitz.

title: Doe Run Lead Plant Shut Down to Effect 'Back Door Gun Control'
subtitle: Rumors about a mass ammunition shortage supposedly caused by a forced closure of the Doe Run Lead Plant are old and inaccurate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A mass ammunition shortage is expected because President Obama and the EPA shut down the Doe Run lead smelting plant

title: France Announces It Will Use Guillotines on Terrorists
subtitle: A fake news article reported that France has announced they are bringing back the guillotine for use on terrorists.
author: Dan Evon
statement: France has announced they are bringing back the guillotine for use on terrorists.

title: Obama and Clinton Have Iranian Advisers?
subtitle: Neither Barack Obama's nor Hillary Clinton's top adviser is Iranian: they're both American citizens by birth.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama have "Iranian advisers by their sides at all times."

title: Mysterious Unidentified Flying Object Over Airport in Turkey
subtitle: A video purporting to show a UFO over Turkey actually shows a rocket launch in Florida.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a mysterious UFO over an airport in Turkey.

title: Stanley Kubrick's 'Don't F*** with Me' Letter
subtitle: The famed film director supposedly wrote a profanity-laced letter to MGM executive James Aubrey over the studio's plans for a '2001' sequel..
author: David Emery
statement: Director Stanley Kubrick wrote a profanity-laced letter to MGM executive James T. Aubrey warning him not to make a sequel to '2001: A Space Odyssey.'

title: Trump's RNC Speech Plagiarized Hitler
subtitle: The claim that Donald Trump plagiarized his RNC speech from Hitler's 1933 inaugural address originated with a satirical publication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump plagiarized his speech at the Republican National Convention from Adolf Hitler's inaugural address in 1933.

title: Were Islamic Symbols Added to the White House Fence?
subtitle: Viral rumors of 'Islamic symbolism' added to the White House fence during a 2015 security upgrade are baseless.
author: David Emery
statement: Security improvements to the White House fence in 2015 included the introduction of Islamic symbolism to the design.

title: Trump Ghostwriter Meredith McIver Doesn't Exist?
subtitle: When Donald Trump campaign ghostwriter Meredith McIver emerged to take the fall for Melania Trump's purported plagiarism, some onlookers questioned her existence.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump's campaign invented a fictional speechwriter named Meredith McIver to take the heat after Melania Trump was criticized for purportedly plagiarizing Michelle Obama's 2008 convention speech.

title: Melania Trump Wore Seinfeld's 'Pirate Shirt' to the RNC
subtitle: A photograph showing Melania Trump wearing the 'pirate shirt' featured in a memorable episode of the TV sitcom 'Seinfeld' at the RNC is not real.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Melania Trump wearing the 'pirate shirt' featured in a memorable episode of the TV sitcom 'Seinfeld.'

title: First Lady Michelle Obama Requires More Than Twenty Attendants
subtitle: Michelle Obama does not have an 'unprecedented' number of staffers working for her; her staff is about the same size as that of her predecessor and other First Ladies.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: First Lady Michelle Obama has an unprecedented number of staffers working for her.

title: Donald Trump: 'Abraham Lincoln Was a Dishonest Traitor'
subtitle: An audio clip of Donald Trump calling Abraham Lincoln a dishonest traitor is a fabricated compilation of sound snippets from a campaign speech.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump called Abraham Lincoln a traitor.

title: Obama to Ban Trucks After Nice Attack
subtitle: A satirical blog post suggesting President Obama planned to ban trucks following the terror attack in Nice quickly crossed over from humor to rumor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama plans to ban trucks to avoid a repetition of the  July 2016 Nice terror attack.

title: Obama Signs Executive Order to Pay Partial Reparations to African-Americans
subtitle: A satirical article reported  that President Obama had signed an executive order mandating that African-Americans in the U.S. be compensated for slavery.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama signed an executive order to pay reparations to African-Americans.

title: Michelle Obama Plagiarized Her 2008 DNC Speech from Stephen R. Covey
subtitle: After Melania Trump was accused of plagiarizing Michelle Obama's 2008 DNC speech, a claim circulated via social media that Obama's speech was plagiarized from author Stephen R. Covey.
author: David Emery
statement: Michelle Obama plagiarized parts of her 2008 Democratic National Convention speech from 'The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People' author Stephen R. Covey.

title: Michelle Obama Stole Her Speech from Melania Trump
subtitle: A quote from Eric Trump defending the originality of Melania Trump's Republican National Convention speech is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Eric Trump defended his stepmother's speech at the Republican National Convention by saying it was actually Michelle Obama who stole from Melania.

title: Pokemon Global Offensive
subtitle: The widely popular game Pokemon Go is not being used by Japan's military to plan future bombing attacks on the U.S.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pokemon Go stands for 'Pokemon Global Offensive,' and the app is being used by the Japanese military to map the U.S. for future bombing attacks.

title: Illegal Alien Denied Cops Service, 'We Don't Serve Pigs'
subtitle: A fabricated article claimed an "illegal alien" employed at McDonald's was fired for telling cops the chain doesn't "serve pigs."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Undocumented McDonald's worker Maria Englesia was fired for telling police officers "we don't serve pigs."

title: Hillary Clinton Supporter Stands on American Flag
subtitle: A clearly doctored image does not depict a woman standing on an American flag while waving a "Hillary for President 2016" banner.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts a Hillary Clinton supporter standing on an American flag while waving a "Hillary for President 2016" banner.

title: How to 'Make Peace with the Blacks'
subtitle: Melania Trump did not suggest her husband could "make peace with the blacks" by increasing their food stamp payments.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Melania Trump suggested her husband could "make peace with the blacks" by increasing their food stamp payments.

title: Trump Copies Obama's Congratulatory Tweet
subtitle: Donald Trump's tweet congratulating his wife Melania on her speech at the Republican Convention wasn't stolen from Barack Obama.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's tweet congratulating his wife Melania on her speech at the Republican Convention was identical to the message Barack Obama sent Michelle in 2012.

title: Pokemon Go Uploads Your Data to Google Maps
subtitle: Just as Pokemon Go's popularity spread like wildfire on social media, so too did a rumor the app collects data for Google Maps and the NSA.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Pokemon Go app is covertly passing information to Google Maps as well as the National Security Agency (NSA).

title: Is Disney/Pixar's 'Monsters, Inc.' Sequel Set for a July 2020 Release?
subtitle: A fan-made poster quickly crossed from Instagram to Facebook and led fans to believe Pixar was releasing the 'Monsters, Inc.' sequel 'Boo' in 2020.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Disney/Pixar announced the upcoming release of 'Boo' (a sequel to 'Monsters, Inc.') in July 2020.

title: Justin Trudeau to Pardon All Prisoners Convicted of a Marijuana Offence
subtitle: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has not freed from prison and expunged the record of every convicted marijuana user in Canada.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Justin Trudeau has freed from prison and expunged the record of every convicted marijuana user in Canada.

title: Chelsea Clinton Made $900,000 Working for Her Parents
subtitle: Chelsea Clinton landed a lucrative job at NBC after graduating college, but her salary wasn't $900,000, and she wasn't working for her parents.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chelsea Clinton was paid $900,000 to work for her parents after she finished college.

title: Trump/Pence Logo Taken from 'T Laying P Ranch'
subtitle: Donald Trump and Mike Pence did not steal their campaign logo from the Nevada brothel "T Laying P Ranch."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump and Mike Pence did not steal their campaign logo from a Nevada brothel.

title: Black Lives Matter Protesters Chant for 'Dead Cops Now'  in Baton Rouge
subtitle: A perpetually recirculating video of Black Lives Matter protesters chanting for "dead cops" dates to December 2014 and is unrelated to BLM protest events occurring in July 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Black Lives Matter protesters in Baton Rouge chanted calls for "dead cops ... now" shortly before three officers were killed in that city.

title: Officer Who Shot Alton Sterling Pictured at KKK Rally
subtitle: A photograph showing a police officer at a KKK rally is frequently shared with misinformation identifying him as the officer who shot and killed Alton Sterling.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The officer who shot and killed Alton Sterling was photographed at a KKK rally.

title: Did Mike Pence Say 'Allowing Rape Victims to Have Abortions Will Lead to Women Trying to Get Raped'?
subtitle: Mike Pence did not say that if abortion were allowed in cases of rape, then women would try to get raped in order to have abortions.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mike Pence said that if abortion were allowed in cases of rape, then women would try to get raped in order to have abortions.

title: Fresno Terrorism Threat: Women in Burqas Buying Cell Phones
subtitle: Grossly exaggerated version of an anti-terrorism presentation warns about women in burqas buying up cell phones.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Anti-terrorism presentation warns about women in burqas buying up cell phones.

title: Obama Calls for Black Lives Matter Memorial
subtitle: A fake news article stated that President Obama issued an executive order calling for a memorial to be built honoring the black victims of police violence.
author: David Emery
statement: President Obama issued an executive order calling for the creation of a Black Lives Matter memorial wall in Washington, DC.

title: Betty White on 'Grow Some Balls'
subtitle: A popular joke about the wisdom of the saying 'Grow some balls' is falsely attributed to actress Betty White.
author: David Emery
statement: Actress Betty White uttered a witty rejoinder to the oft-used phrase 'Grow some balls.'

title: Image of Donald Trump with No Wig or Makeup
subtitle: Who knows what GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump's head looks like in its unprepped state?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows Donald Trump with "no wig or makeup."

title: Ted Cruz: I Will Endorse Donald Trump for President If He Makes Masturbation Illegal
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Ted Cruz said he would endorse Donald Trump if the latter promised to make masturbation illegal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz said that he would endorse Donald Trump if the latter promised to make masturbation illegal.

title: France Covered Up Torture and Mutilation of Bataclan Victims
subtitle: After the Bastille Day attack in Nice, news outlets rehashed debunked claims that France actively covered up horrifying details of torture at the Bataclan in November 2015 attacks.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: France deliberately suppressed information about torture and mutilation at the Bataclan in November 2015 to avoid upsetting Muslims.

title: How 10cc Got Their Name
subtitle: It's an amusing story, but the art rock band 10cc was not named for the amount of semen in the average male ejaculation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The band 10cc was so named because the term represents the amount of semen in an average male ejaculation (or a little bit more).

title: 21 Dead, Many Injured in Ontario
subtitle: A 'Mad Libs'-style fake news item claimed 21 people were killed in a mass shooting in Ontario (or elsewhere).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Twenty-one people were killed in a mass shooting in Ontario (or other locations).

title: Eiffel Tower Set Ablaze by Terrorists
subtitle: Conspiracy web sites mistook an accidental fireworks explosion near the Eiffel Tower for a terrorist attack on Paris.
author: David Emery
statement: Fire and smoke billowing from the vicinity of the Eiffel Tower were evidence of a Bastille Day terrorist attack in Paris.

title: Was DNC Worker Seth Conrad Rich Gunned Down on His Way to Meet the FBI?
subtitle: A conspiracy site latched on to the tragic murder of young DNC staffer Seth Rich to spread false information about his killing.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: DNC staffer Seth Rich was gunned down to prevent him from meeting with the FBI over plans to testify against Hillary Clinton.

title: 'Chilling' Photograph of Fatal Crash Shows Spirit Leaving Victim's Body
subtitle: The 'spirit' seen in a photograph of a fatal crash scene bears a startling resemblance to a fleck of dust.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A photograph of a fatal motorcycle crash shows either an angel or the victim's ghost.

title: Will Jesus Be Portrayed as Homosexual in an Upcoming Film?
subtitle: Long-standing false rumor holds that Jesus and His disciples will be portrayed as homosexual in a soon-to-be-released movie.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Jesus and His disciples are going to be portrayed as homosexual in a soon-to-be-released film.

title: Amish Dobergoat Fighting Ring Busted!
subtitle: Police in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, have not broken up an Amish "dobergoat fighting ring," nor do "dobergoats" even exist.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, busted an Amish dobergoat fighting ring.

title: Obama Signs Executive Order Allowing Military to Fight US Citizens
subtitle: An executive order signed by President Obama in July 2016 was misinterpreted by fringe political web sites as authorizing the use of the U.S. military against American citizens.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama signed an executive order allowing the use of the U.S. military against American citizens.

title: Donald Trump Hires 'Clueless' Star for Outreach Program
subtitle: An article reporting that actress Stacey Dash had been hired for the Republican presidential candidate's "Negro Outreach Program" came from a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Stacey Dash was hired by Donald Trump for his "Negro Outreach Program."

title: White Billionaire Offers $1 Billion to Breed Lebron and Serena
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a white billionaire had offered $1 billion to 'breed' superstar athletes Lebron James and Serena Williams.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A billionaire has offered $1 billion to "breed" Lebron James and Serena Williams.

title: Russia Put Black Lives Matter on Official Terror List
subtitle: A conspiracy theory web site propagated the false rumor that Russia had placed Black Lives Matter on an official terrorist list.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Russia placed Black Lives Matter on an official "terror list" in July 2016.

title: 15-Year-Old Killed Trespassing While Playing Pokemon Go
subtitle: Fake news reports that a homeowner fatally shot a trespassing Pokemon Go player.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A homeowner shot and killed a teenaged boy trespassing during a round of Pokemon Go.

title: Woman Dies from Maggot Infested Weave
subtitle: Reports that a New Jersey woman died after having a maggot-infested weave sewn into her scalp were fake news.
author: David Emery
statement: Sharonda Banks, 28, of Newark, New Jersey died after a maggot-infested weave was sewn into her scalp.

title: Photograph of Elijah Wood with Identical Twin Brother
subtitle: An image purportedly showing Elijah Wood and his identical twin brother is actually a composite of two photographs of Elijah Wood.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows actor Elijah Wood with his identical twin brother.

title: Pokemon Was Originally Designed for Satanists
subtitle: A satirical 2012 interview with Pokemon's creator has reappeared thanks to the popularity of Pokemon GO.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The creator of Pokemon said in an interview that the game is anti-Christian, and was developed with Satanists in mind.

title: Did Chick-fil-A Just 'Drop a Bomb' on Black Lives Matter?
subtitle: Employees at a single Chick-fil-A location wore "Back the Blue" shirts long before the July 2016 "Black Lives Matter" protests.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Chick-fil-A distributed "Back the Blue" shirts in the wake of July 2016 "Black Lives Matter" protests.

title: Scientists Say Giant Asteroid Could Hit Earth Next Week, Causing Mass Devastation
subtitle: An article attempting to prove that most people only read headlines was published with a clickbait title about an incoming, massive asteroid.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A giant asteroid is expected to hit the earth in July 2016.

title: Seahawks' Richard Sherman Condemns 'Black Lives Matter' Movement
subtitle: A post condemning the Black Lives Matter Movement is frequently attributed to Richard Sherman, but the NFL player denied authoring it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Seattle Seahawks cornerback Richard Sherman authored an essay criticizing the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Australian Police Targeting Pokemon Go Players
subtitle: A fake photograph purportedly shows a warning sign in Australia indicating that Pokemon Go players are being targeted by police.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a sign in Australia indicating that Pokemon Go players are being targeted by police.

title: Donald Trump Congratulates Serena Williams
subtitle: A fake Twitter conversation between Donald Trump and Serena Williams circulated after the tennis star won her 7th Wimbledon title.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump called Serena Williams his 'Black American woman friend' on Twitter after the tennis star won her 7th Wimbledon title.

title: Did Burger King Admit Their Burgers Contain Horsemeat?
subtitle: A disreputable web site distorted a years-old story and falsely asserted that the Burger King fast food chain "admitted it has been selling burgers that contain horsemeat."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Burger King fast food chain "admitted it has been selling burgers that contain horsemeat."

title: Rochester/Silver Lake Park Abduction Warning
subtitle: Police in Rochester, Minnesota, say no reports were received of attempted kidnappings during a fireworks event at Silver Lake Park.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police in Rochester, Minnesota, assessed that an encounter with three Middle-Eastern men at Silver Lake Park was an attempted human trafficking incident.

title: President Obama: Americans Are Better Off Under Martial Law
subtitle: President Obama did not give an interview to the Washington Post during which he opined that Americans would be better off under martial law.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: During an interview with the Washington Post, President Obama stated that Americans would be better off under martial law.

title: Black Lives Matter Protests Kill Girl Waiting for Transplant in Memphis
subtitle: The heartbreaking tale of a young heart transplant patient fatally obstructed by Black Lives Matter protests in Memphis was a total falsehood.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Black Lives Matter protest in Memphis obstructed I-40, leading to the death of a critically ill child transplant patient.

title: Teen Kills Younger Brother Because He Thought He Deleted His Pokemon
subtitle: Fake news reports a 15-year-old boy stabbed his brother to death because he thought the younger boy had deleted his Pokemon.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 15-year-old boy stabbed his brother to death because he thought the younger boy had deleted his Pokemon,

title: Iranian Negotiator Discusses Nuclear Deal
subtitle: A falsely-captioned video supposedly shows the chief Iranian negotiator on television candidly reflecting on the negotiating process with the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows the chief Iranian nuclear negotiator appearing on television and candidly reflecting on the negotiating process with the U.S.

title: Pope Francis Shocks World, Endorses Donald Trump for President
subtitle: Reports that His Holiness has endorsed Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump originated with a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pope Francis endorsed Donald Trump for president.

title: Nicolas Cage Death Hoax
subtitle: A false rumor holding that actor Nicolas Cage passed away in a motorcycle accident circulated in July 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Nicolas Cage died in a motorcycle accident in July 2016.

title: John Cena Death Hoax
subtitle: A Facebook-driven celebrity death hoax held that wrestler John Cena had died in a car accident.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Wrestler John Cena died in a car accident in July 2016.

title: Ruth Ginsburg Threatens to 'Resign from SCOTUS' If Trump Is Elected President
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that Ruth Bader Ginsburg had threatened to leave the Supreme Court if Donald Trump became president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ruth Bader Ginsburg threatened to leave the Supreme Court if Donald Trump gets elected president.

title: Einstein Bicycles as A-Bomb Explodes
subtitle: An altered image purports to show Albert Einstein racing away from an atomic bomb explosion on a bicycle.
author: David Emery
statement: A photograph shows Albert Einstein riding a bike while an atomic explosion takes place in the background.

title: Major Highway Accident After Man Stops in Middle of Highway to Catch Pikachu!
subtitle: Fake news reports a man absorbed in playing the new Pokemon Go app caused a major traffic accident.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A man absorbed in playing the new Pokemon Go app caused a major traffic accident.

title: 'The Simpsons' Predicted Pokemon Go
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing that 'The Simpsons' animated television series predicted the advent of the Pokemon Go app is a fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: 'The Simpsons' animated television series predicted the advent of the Pokemon Go game.

title: Pride of Lions Kills Five Poachers and Injures Three Others in Zimbabwe
subtitle: Reports that a pride of lions had killed a group of poachers in Zimbabwe came from a hoax news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A pride of lions killed a group of poachers in Zimbabwe.

title: DeRay Mckesson and the Summer of Chaos
subtitle: Fabricated Twitter messages claiming activist DeRay Mckesson was plotting a "summer of chaos" with Attorney General Loretta Lynch resurfaced after the Dallas police shootings.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hacked Twitter DMs reveal that activist DeRay Mckesson planned a "summer of chaos" involving protests and riots with Attorney General Loretta Lynch.

title: Obama Commissions Gender Neutral Bible
subtitle: A satirical article reporting President Obama had commissioned pastor Rob Bell to write a gender neutral Bible was predictably shared as straight news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama signed an executive order commissioning pastor Rob Bell to write a "gender neutral Bible."

title: Dallas Shooter Not Identified as Neo-Nazi Jeffrey Harris
subtitle: A troll Twitter account started a false rumor that a neo-Nazi named Jeffrey Harris was responsible for the protest shooting of police in Dallas.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Neo-Nazi Jeffrey Harris was identified as the man who shot and killed several police officers at a protest in Dallas.

title: Monsanto Buys Whole Foods
subtitle: A number of blog posts objecting to the Whole Foods CEO's comments about GMO labeling rejuvenated an old rumor that Monsanto bought the grocery chain.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Monsanto has purchased or merged with the Whole Foods Market grocery chain.

title: Cop Shoots 2-Year-Old Black Baby After Mistaking Pacifier for Gun
subtitle: A 2015 fake news item claiming a Baltimore officer shot and killed toddler Malik Gibson after mistaking a pacifier for a gun resurfaced in July 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Baltimore police officer shot and killed two-year-old Malik Gibson after mistaking his pacifier for a gun.

title: Teen Playing 'Pokemon Go' Stabbed and Mugged for His iPhone
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a teenager was stabbed after accidentally wandering into a bad neighborhood while playing the new 'Pokemon Go' app.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A teenager was stabbed after accidentally wandering into a bad neighborhood while playing the new 'Pokemon Go' app.

title: Omar Mateen's Final Text to Wife Released:
subtitle: Fake news reports that Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen's final text to his wife admitted he was gay.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen's final text to his wife admitted he was gay.

title: Chris Christie Vetoes Equal Pay for Women as 'Against Religious Freedom'
subtitle: New Jersey governor Chris Christie vetoed a pay parity bill, but not over any reasons relating to religious freedom.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: New Jersey governor Chris Christie vetoed a parity bill because it violated religious freedom protections.

title: Alton Sterling Killed by Trump Supporter Robert Kinnison
subtitle: Shortly after Alton Sterling was killed by Baton Rouge police, a rumor appeared on social media that the officer responsible was a Donald Trump supporter whose name is circulated after every high-profile shooting.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Alton Sterling was shot and killed by Louisiana police officer (and Donald Trump supporter) Robert Kinnison.

title: Obama to Remove Statue of Liberty Because It Offends Muslims
subtitle: Reports that President Obama is dismantling the Statue of Liberty come from hoax web sites.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama plans to remove the Statue of Liberty because it is offensive to Muslims.

title: Fireworks Explode in Woman During Shoplifting Attempt
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that a woman was injured while attempting to smuggle fireworks out of Walmart in her vagina.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman was injured while trying to steal fireworks from Walmart by hiding them in her vagina.

title: 'Arab Guy' Renounces Faith on Egyptian Television?
subtitle: A video showing activist Ihab al-Khouli reacting angrily to a speech by former Egyptian President Mohamed Morsi is frequently shared with misleading captions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a man angrily renouncing his faith on Egyptian national television.

title: Tim Hortons Adding Marijuana to Their Menu
subtitle: A hoax news article reported that Canadian restaurant and coffee chain Tim Hortons will start selling marijuana in 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Tim Hortons will add marijuana to its menu in 2017.

title: 'Guccifer' Is Not Missing or Dead
subtitle: Hacker Marcel Lazar Lehel, also known as "Guccifer," is neither missing from his jail cell nor dead.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hacker Guccifer (Marcel Lazar Lehel) is missing from his jail cell.

title: 'Welcome to Mingo County'
subtitle: A fake photograph shows a 'Welcome Sign' outside of Mingo County, West Virginia, warning visitors that armed citizens will "kill you back."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 'Welcome Sign' outside of Mingo Country warning visitors that its citizens were armed and would "kill you back."

title: Dwayne Johnson Arrested
subtitle: Actor Dwayne ("The Rock") Johnson has not been arrested for importing banned medical substances into Australia.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dwayne Johnson was arrested for illegally importing human growth hormone (HGH) into Australia.

title: Do Color Codes on Toothpaste Tubes Identify Their Ingredients?
subtitle: The colored squares on toothpaste tubes supposedly identify the composition of the toothpaste enclosed therein.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The colored squares on toothpaste tubes identify the composition of the toothpaste enclosed therein.

title: Did the White House Watch the Benghazi Attack and Do Nothing?
subtitle: Claims that top Obama administration officials watched the Benghazi attack unfold in real-time but did nothing to intervene have been proved false.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Top Obama administration officials watched the Benghazi attack unfold in real-time but did nothing to intervene.

title: Photographs Show Carcass of Loch Ness Monster
subtitle: Images purportedly showing the skeletal remains of the Loch Ness Monster were actually taken from the set-up of a television show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the skeletal remains of the Loch Ness Monster.

title: Was the Bitter Almond Tree Banned in 1995 Because B17 Fights Cancer?
subtitle: The FDA has only cracked down on people peddling bitter almond derivatives as a cancer cure.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The bitter almond tree was banned in America in 1995 because it treats and prevents cancer.

title: Did the UN Say Taking Kids to Church Violates Their Human Rights?
subtitle: A misleading article about religious worship at public schools in the UK claimed the U.N. had declared that taking children to church violates their human rights.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The UN stated that taking children to church is a violation of their human rights.

title: Muslim Community Donates $87,000 to Family of Orlando Shooter
subtitle: A fake news article reported that several Islamic Cultural Centers gave a large amount of money to the family of Omar Mateen.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Muslim community donated $87,000 to the family of the man responsible for the shooting at Pulse Nightclub in Orlando.

title: Mexican Family Names Newborn After 'Brexit'
subtitle: A viral story in Spanish-language media about a family naming their daughter "Breksit," after the UK's decision to leave the EU, is a hoax.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A family in Mexico named their baby daughter "Breksit," after the results of Britain's EU referendum.

title: What Obama Just Did to the White House Logo
subtitle: President Obama hasn't altered the White House logo to replace the Stars and Stripes with a white flag; that logo element was modified during the George W. Bush administration.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama altered the White House logo to replace the U.S flag with a white flag (commonly associated with surrender).

title: Mother Arrested After Tattooing Her Son and Attempting to Trade Him for Drugs
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a woman allowed her boyfriend to etch a full-chest tattoo on her two-year-old son and then traded the boy for crack cocaine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A mother was arrested for tattooing her 2-year-old boy and trading him for drugs.

title: Did Texas Rule Kids Don't Need to Be Schooled If They Believe in the Rapture?
subtitle: Texas did not declare that all children whose families believe the Rapture is imminent are exempt from schooling, nor did a family argue anything of the sort in a recent court case.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: School is no longer compulsory for Texas students whose parents believe in the religious concept of Rapture.

title: Trump Vows to 'Get Rid of the Library of Congress'
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump had promised to shut down the Library of Congress as a cost-saving measure.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump has vowed to get rid of the Library of Congress if elected President.

title: King Abdullah II Kills Queen Rania in Rome
subtitle: A shocking, internationally-flavored story came straight from a site that peddles hoaxes and conspiracy theories.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Jordan's King Abdullah II murdered his wife, Queen Rania.

title: Cormac McCarthy Death Hoax
subtitle: A hoax Twitter account propagated a false rumor that acclaimed author Cormac McCarthy had died of a stroke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Author Cormac McCarthy passed away in June 2016.

title: Ellen DeGeneres Is Leaving Her Show to Sell Skincare Products
subtitle: Advertisements that mimic magazine articles falsely report that Ellen DeGeneres is leaving her talk show to sell skin care products.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ellen DeGeneres has announced that she was leaving her talk show to sell skin care products.

title: President Obama is Giving $1,000 per Month to Food Stamp Recipients
subtitle: A baseless Facebook rumor held that President Obama was giving food stamp recipients an extra $1,000 per month for three months.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama is giving food stamp recipients a bonus $1,000 per month for three months.

title: UN Vehicles and Trucks Spotted in Southern States
subtitle: UN vehicles and trucks spotted in the U.S. weren't purchased to address imminent economic collapse in America; they were built in Virginia for UN operations abroad.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: UN vehicles have been quietly positioned for action in Virginia and Kentucky as a preemptive response to imminent economic collapse.

title: Does This Map Show Mad Cow Disease Prevalence vs. Brexit Voters?
subtitle: A map purportedly showing that areas affected by mad cow disease in 1992 ended up voting "leave" in 2016 is satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Areas that voted to leave the European Union in the 2016 'Brexit' vote were the same areas affected by Mad Cow Disease in 1992.

title: Anti-Gun Senator Shoots Intruder
subtitle: A state legislator who shot an intruder in defense of his property was not a 'long-time anti-gun' opponent.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A longtime anti-gun state legislator shot a home intruder in defense of his property.

title: BREAKING: Feds Cancel ALL July 4th Fireworks Due to Terror Fears
subtitle: A fake news article reported that all 4th of July fireworks shows in the U.S. have been cancelled due to terrorism fears.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The US government cancelled all 4th of July fireworks due to terror fears.

title: Muslims Rally Around Image of Jesus' Decapitated Head
subtitle: A misleading and fear-mongering video purportedly showing 'radical' Muslims rallying around an image of Jesus' decapitated head was shared on Facebook by preacher Michael Chitwood.
author: Dan Evon
