statement: A video shows a group of 'radical' Muslims rallying around a painting of Jesus' decapitated head in Dearborn, Michigan.

title: Obama Declares November National Muslim Appreciation Month
subtitle: Fake news reports President Obama has announced a nationwide Muslim outreach program for children grades K-12.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama has announced a nationwide Muslim outreach program for children from grades K-12.

title: 'British Refugees Welcome' Sign on Madrid Building
subtitle: An image showing a "British Refugees Welcome" sign on the Palacio Cibeles in Spain was digitally manipulated for satirical purposes.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a sign hanging from the Palacio Cibeles in Madrid, Spain, welcoming British refugees.

title: Nine-Year-Old Murders Parents After They Turn Off Wi-Fi for Punishment
subtitle: An article reporting that a child killed his parents because they wouldn't let him access the Internet came from a "satire" web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 9-year-old killed his parents after they turned off wi-fi in their home.

title: European Union Flag to Lose a Star After Brexit Vote
subtitle: Many social media users incorrectly claimed that the European Union flag was going to lose a star after the Brexit vote.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The European Union flag will lose a star after the Brexit vote.

title: Rubio: 'God Killed Gays in Orlando to Signal He Needs Me Back in the Senate'
subtitle: Marco Rubio did not say that the Orlando nightclub mass shooting was a sign from God that he was needed in the Senate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Marco Rubio said the Orlando shooting was a clear signal that God wanted him to serve in the Senate.

title: Las Vegas Parents Facing Charges for Modifying 8-Month-Old Baby's Ears
subtitle: Fake news reports a Las Vegas couple was arrested for modifying their baby's ears to make them pointed like a Vulcan's.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Las Vegas couple was arrested for modifying their baby's ears to make them pointed like a Vulcan's.

title: 'Share the Safety' Web Site Not Affiliated with the NRA
subtitle: A web site asking people to "buy a gun, give a gun" to families living in at-risk neighborhoods is not affiliated with the National Rifle Association.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The National Rifle Association launched a "Share the Safety" campaign, enabling people to donate guns to those who live in at-risk neighborhoods.

title: Is This a Cheetah at a Dog Race?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a cheetah at a greyhound race was created for an automobile advertisement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a sleepy cheetah at a greyhound race.

title: Republican Party Declares Their Convention a 'Gun-Free Zone'
subtitle: The Republican Party has not declared their national convention to be a "gun-free zone"; rather, the venue hosting the event has a "no weapons" policy.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Republican Party has hypocritically declared their national convention to be a "gun-free zone."

title: Hank Williams, Jr. Endorses Hillary Clinton
subtitle: A fake news item reported  that famously conservative musician Hank Williams Jr. had endorsed Hillary Clinton for President.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Hank Williams Jr. has endorsed Hillary Clinton for president.

title: Yellowstone Evacuated Due to Volcanic Eruption
subtitle: An old and inaccurate report claiming that Yellowstone National Park has been evacuated due to volcanic activity is recirculating.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Yellowstone was evacuated in June 2016 after experts warned of an imminent volcanic eruption.

title: Thomas Jefferson on Gun Rights
subtitle: A real Thomas Jefferson statement about bearing arms is frequently shared along with a sentence never written by the former president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Thomas Jefferson wrote that "the strongest reason for the people to retain the right to keep and bear arms" is to "protect themselves against tyranny in government."

title: Man Loses Genitals While Assaulting Woman Thanks to 'Anti-Rape Device'
subtitle: A salacious story about a rapist getting his penis cut off by razor blades originated from a fake news site posing as Los Angeles-area television station KTLA.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: false

title: Michigan Right to Farm Act Repealed
subtitle: A misleading blog post recycled inaccurate claims from 2014 about changes to Michigan's "Right to Farm" Act.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In June 2016, Michigan residents lost the "right to farm," keep chickens, or maintain bee hives due to a change in existing law.

title: Donald Trump Called Canadians 'Snow Mexicans'
subtitle: A satirical image led many Twitter users to believe Donald Trump had referred to Canadians as "snow Mexicans."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump referred to Canadians as "snow Mexicans" in a 22 February 2016 tweet.

title: Rape Victim Performs 'Self-Abortion' with AR-15
subtitle: A satirical news article reporting that a rape victim performed her own abortion with a special "U-Abort It TM" attachment for her AR-15 was taken as legitimate by some readers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman performed her own abortion with a "U-Abort It TM" attachment for her AR-15.

title: 'Finding Nemo' Sequel Features a Transgender Stingray
subtitle: While "Finding Dory" voice star Ellen DeGeneres joked about the movie's featuring a transgender character, there is no "StingRhonda" character in the film.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The movie "Finding Dory" features a transgender stingray named StingRhonda.

title: Does This Photograph Show Whales Breaching Near a Small Boat?
subtitle: A whale of a picture, impressive at any scale.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows several large whales feeding near a tiny boat.

title: Marijuana Is Moving to Schedule 2
subtitle: A purportedly credible source reported that the DEA would be reclassifying marijuana as a Schedule 2 drug in August 2016, but the DEA has denied petitions to that effect.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA) will be reclassifying marijuana as a Schedule 2 drug in August 2016.

title: Paul Ryan Confesses on National TV
subtitle: Speaker Paul Ryan did not literally say that he doesn't care if Donald "Trump destroys the United States and that he is a liar and a fraud."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Speaker Paul Ryan said that he doesn't care if Donald "Trump destroys the United States and that he is a liar and a fraud."

title: DHS Quietly Moving, Releasing 'Vanloads' of 'Illegal Aliens' Away from Border
subtitle: An alarmist article about what the United States is purportedly doing with people showing up at its southern border bears little resemblance to the facts.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The Department of Homeland Security is secretly moving and releasing crowds of undocumented people into the United States.

title: Baby Moose Holds Rainbow Flag
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a baby moose holding a gay pride flag is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a baby moose holding a rainbow flag.

title: Sea Monster Spotted Near Antarctica
subtitle: Reports of  the possible spotting of a kraken near Antarctica actually show a very large rock.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A sea monster of giant size was spotted near Antarctica.

title: President Obama Signs Executive Order Banning the Sale of Assault Weapons
subtitle: Fake news reports that President Obama banned  assault weapons and promised "large scale Homeland Security raids" to confiscate them.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama has signed an executive order banning the sale of assault weapons.

title: Google News Reported Orlando Pulse Shooting Hours in Advance
subtitle: A false flag conspiracy about the Orlando shooting held that Google News carried word of the incident several hours before it actually took place.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Google News carried an Atlanta Sun Times article about the Orlando shooting several hours prior to the incident.

title: Steph Curry Suspended from NBA Finals
subtitle: Fake tweets and bad reporting left many NBA fans worried that Golden State Warriors star Steph Curry had been suspended from Game 7 of the NBA Finals.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Steph Curry was suspended from game 7 of the 2016 NBA Finals.

title: Jimmy Carter on the First Woman President
subtitle: A purported Jimmy Carter quote about the election of the United States' first woman president appears to be fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jimmy Carter said that the novelty of electing a woman president should not outweigh the duty of electing an honest president.

title: Facebook to Ban 'Amen Posts'
subtitle: There's no truth to a rumor that Facebook is banning "amen posts" (in which social media users are exhorted to type "amen").
author: Dan Evon
statement: Facebook is banning "amen" posts.

title: New Implant Will Alert Your Cell Phone When 'Your Man' Is Cheating
subtitle: A fake news article reports that a genital implant notifies spouses via cell phone alert when their husbands are cheating on them.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A new penile implant notifies spouses via cell phone alerts when their husbands are cheating on them.

title: 'Islamic Refugee' with Gas Pipeline Plans Arrested in New Mexico Border County
subtitle: Rumors swirled that an "Islamic Refugee" was apprehended in Luna County in possession of plans to a gas pipeline.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An "Islamic refugee" was apprehended in Luna County, New Mexico and found to be in possession of plans to a gas pipeline.

title: Patience Carter Is a Victim, Not a Crisis Actor
subtitle: A baseless claim asserting that Orlando shooting victim Patience Carter was a "crisis actor" was propagated on YouTube.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Orlando shooting victim Patience Carter is actually a "crisis actor."

title: Jeff Bezos Revokes Donald Trump's Amazon Shopping Privileges
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Amazon.com founder and CEO Jeff Bezos had revoked Donald Trump's online shopping privileges.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Amazon.com CEO and founder Jeff Bezos has revoked Donald Trump's shopping privileges.

title: Denny's Waitress Assaulted by Muslims for Serving Bacon During Ramadan
subtitle: Junk news reports that Muslims targeted an 18-year-old Denny's restaurant server for taking orders for bacon during the holy month of Ramadan.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Muslims assaulted a Denny's waitress for serving bacon during the holy month of Ramadan.

title: World's Largest Tortoise?
subtitle: A prop from a Japanese monster movie is frequently shared as a photograph of the "world's largest tortoise."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The world's largest tortoise was 59 feet tall and weighed more than 800 pounds.

title: Canadian Prime Minister and Opposition Leader Share Kiss to Denounce Orlando Massacre
subtitle: A fake news web site published a fabricated photograph of Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau and opposition leader Thomas Mulcair kissing to denounce the Orlando nightclub mass shooting.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Canadian Prime Minster Justin Trudeau kissing opposition leader Thomas Mulcair.

title: Pablo Reyes' Facebook Prediction
subtitle: Facebook user Pablo Reyes' eerily accurate predictions for 2016 were a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Facebook user Pablo Reyes made eerily accurate predictions about 2016.

title: Orlando Mass Shooting Math Doesn't Add Up
subtitle: A viral social media post about perceived inconsistencies in the "math" of the June 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting uses all the wrong numbers.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: It was not physically possible for a single gunman at the Orlando nightclub shooting to have fired as many rounds in the time allotted as reported.

title: Sean Hannity to be Fired for Comments About Muslims
subtitle: A 2014 claim that Fox News host Sean Hannity was getting fired began to make the rounds again in June 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Fox News host was about to be fired in June 2016 over comments he made about Muslims.

title: Futuristic Audi Truck
subtitle: A purported photograph of a futuristic Audi truck is just a conceptual illustration.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a futuristic new Audi truck.

title: Mexico to Close Border if Trump is Elected
subtitle: A fake news item claiming Mexico intended to close its borders if Donald Trump was elected president gained traction several months after it initially appeared.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mexico pledged to close the country's borders with the United States if Donald Trump is elected president.

title: Kevin Hart Beaten at Miami Club
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing actor Kevin Hart with facial injuries suffered during a mugging at a Miami nightclub was actually taken on the set of a television show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photograph shows Kevin Hart after he was mugged at a Miami nightclub.

title: Ralph Macchio Death Hoax
subtitle: Rumors of 'Karate Kid' actor Ralph Macchio's sudden death in June 2016 were just another celebrity death hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Ralph Macchio of 'Karate Kid' fame passed away in June 2016.

title: Abandoned Military Base's 'Experimentation Room'
subtitle: A photograph supposedly showing a control room at an abandoned military base is frequently miscaptioned as something more sinister.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an abandoned military base that was abandoned after "something" escaped from the facility's "experimentation room."

title: 'Multiple Shooters' at Orlando Nightclub
subtitle: An irresponsible Facebook post claimed that multiple gunmen were involved in the mass shooting at Orlando Pulse, and that two of them were still at large.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The media is covering up that "multiple shooters" were involved in the mass killing at an Orlando nightclub.

title: Pat Robertson:
subtitle: Fake news reports that former Southern Baptist minister Pat Robertson asserted the Orlando nightclub shooting was God's punishment for legalizing same-sex marriage.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pat Robertson asserted the Orlando nightclub shooting was God's punishment for legalizing same-sex marriage.

title: Barney Frank Criticizes Bernie Sanders
subtitle: A quote about the Democratic party has been incorrectly attributed to Barney Frank.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A viral quote criticizing Bernie Sanders for saying that the Democratic party was not "progressive" enough originated with Barney Frank.

title: Does This Video Document Google Manipulating Searches for Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: A viral video accused the search engine of manipulating results in favor of Hillary Clinton.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video documents search engine Google manipulating results in favor of Hillary Clinton.

title: Jail Installs New Olympic-Sized Swimming Pool for Stanford Rapist
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a jail installed an Olympic pool for Stanford swimmer and convicted rapist Brock Turner.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An Olympic pool was installed at a prison for Stanford swimmer Brock Turner.

title: Did Elizabeth Warren Say 'We Shall Disarm Republicans Ourselves'?
subtitle: We found no evidence Warren ever said that if "the Republicans" refused to surrender their guns, "we shall disarm them ourselves."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Elizabeth Warren said that if "the Republicans" refused to surrender their weapons, "we" would "disarm them ourselves."

title: Did a Lion Take Revenge on a Trophy Hunter?
subtitle: A video that purportedly shows a lion attacking a big game hunter was likely intended as part of an anti-hunting campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a hunter getting attacked by a lion while posing with a recent kill.

title: Judge Curiel a Member of 'Latino KKK Hate Group' Called 'La Raza'
subtitle: Judge Curiel is a member of the San Diego La Raza Lawyers Association, not a "Latino KKK" hate group.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. District Judge Gonzalo Curiel is a member of the "Latino KKK" group La Raza.

title: Senator Robert Byrd in Ku Klux Klan Garb?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing former Senator Robert Byrd in Klan robes has been digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows former Senator Robert Byrd wearing Ku Klux Klan robes.

title: Dick Smith Statement About Halal Certifications as 'Extortion'
subtitle: A viral email purportedly relaying Australian grocer Dick Smith's views on halal certification contains mostly misinformation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dick Smith penned an email to customers denigrating the Muslim religion.

title: Photograph of 'Incontinent' Hillary Clinton
subtitle: An image purportedly proving that the Democratic presidential candidate is incontinent was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image serves as photographic proof that Hillary Clinton is incontinent.

title: Donald Trump Protester Speaks Out:
subtitle: Fake news reports that a man came forward and claimed he had been paid to protest at a Donald Trump rally.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A man came forward and claimed he had been paid $3,500 to protest at a Donald Trump rally.

title: Tragically Hip Cancels Tour After Band Members Unable to Acquire Tickets
subtitle: A satirical article reported that the group Tragically Hip cancelled their tour because band members couldn't get tickets to their own shows.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The band Tragically Hip has cancelled their tour after members failed to get tickets to their own shows.

title: NFL Banning the National Anthem in 2017
subtitle: A false social media rumor holds that the NFL will be  banning the playing of the U.S. national anthem in 2017.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The NFL is banning the playing of the U.S. national anthem beginning in 2017.

title: Teenager Beaten by Anti-Trump Protester
subtitle: An image purporting to show a young woman who was beaten by people protesting a Donald Trump rally is actually a still from a Mexican telenovela.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a young woman who was beaten up by anti-Trump demonstrators at a rally in San Jose.

title: Jack Black Death Hoax
subtitle: A rumor circulated that Jack Black had suddenly died in June 2016 after the actor's Twitter account was hacked.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Jack Black passed away in June 2016.

title: Human/Gorilla Hybrid Infant Born in India
subtitle: A fake news article reports that scientists have created a human-gorilla hybrid named Hurilla.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Scientists have created a human-gorilla hybrid called Hurilla.

title: UCLA Students Rally Behind Isis
subtitle: A photograph supposedly showing 5,000 UCLA students holding "a candlelight vigil for fallen ISIS soldiers" depicts nothing of the sort.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows 5,000 UCLA students holding "a candlelight vigil for fallen ISIS soldiers."

title: Teddy Roosevelt on Conservatives vs. Liberals
subtitle: To anger everyone, put quotations in the mouths of people who never said them.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Teddy Roosevelt said that "to anger a conservative, lie to him; to anger a liberal, tell him the truth."

title: Hillary Clinton Blames Racism for Cincinnati Gorilla's Death
subtitle: Hillary Clinton did not proclaim that the gorilla shot in a Cincinnati zoo was a victim of "racism."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton blamed racism for the death of a gorilla in a Cincinnati zoo.

title: The 'Merrylin Cryptid Museum'
subtitle: A 'Cryptid Museum' supposedly showcasing specimens discovered by a mysterious cryptozoologist named Thomas Merrylin is actually the work of artist Alex CF.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Real skeletons of mythical creatures are on display at the Merrylin Cryptid Museum.

title: Muslim Men Auctioning off Women in England
subtitle: A video that purports to show "Muslim men" selling women at auction in England actually documents a protest.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Muslim men auctioning off women on the streets of England.

title: Swedish Girl Refugee Assault
subtitle: A meme claimed that a 14-year-old Swedish girl was raped by refugees, but the story didn't check out.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts a Swedish girl brutally abducted and raped by three refugees.

title: Couple Buys Limited Edition Beanie Baby Worth Thousands for 10
subtitle: A viral story about a couple who got rich quick finding a limited edition collector's item in a "boot sale" didn't stand up to scrutiny.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A couple bought a "Princess" Beanie Baby worth 62,500 for just 10.

title: 'WhatsApp Gold' Virus
subtitle: A message advertising an unauthorized premium WhatsApp service tricked users into installing malware.
author: Dan Evon
statement: WhatsApp Gold is a premium service offered by WhatsApp.

title: Mysterious '4-Metre Long Sea Creature' Washes Ashore
subtitle: A "shocking" and "mysterious" massive "sea creature" is yet another beast from the island of Photoshop.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph depicts a mysterious and large sea creature that washed ashore in Mexico in June 2016.

title: Hillary Clinton Paid Actor to Impersonate Military Member
subtitle: Accusations that Hillary Clinton paid an actor to dress up in Navy attire for the 2016 Memorial Day parade do not come from reliable sources.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton paid an actor to dress up in Navy attire for a Memorial Day parade.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Misaligned Bridge?
subtitle: 'Survey-scale inaccuracy or positioning errors can lead to costly construction mistakes such as bridge misalignment.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a misaligned bridge.

title: Doctor Finds Boys Missing Hamster Wedged Into 700 Pound Mom's Back Fat
subtitle: No, a doctor didn't discover a long-dead hamster rotting between folds of a morbidly obese mother's fat.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A doctor discovered a boy's missing hamster decomposing between folds of his mother's back fat.

title: Yosemite Sam Banned
subtitle: A Facebook meme falsely claims the Looney Tunes character Yosemite Sam has been banned from television due to his use of guns and violence.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Yosemite Sam has been banned from television because his use of guns is offensive and a poor influence on children.

title: Sarah Palin on Slavery
subtitle: A quote purportedly from Sarah Palin saying that slavery wasn't the fault of the United States is fake.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sarah Palin said that America was not to blame for slavery, and that "the negroes" liked it.

title: Police Going to Pubs and Banning England Football Jerseys
subtitle: A tabloid reported that police in the UK were banning England football jerseys from pubs and clubs, but the rumor is several years old and unsupported.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police in the UK are going to pubs and clubs to ban England jerseys because they're offensive to immigrants.

title: Hillary Clinton to Be Indicted on Federal Racketeering Charges
subtitle: A broken Huffington Post link circulated on social media suggested that Hillary Clinton would soon face an indictment, but the article was unvetted and did not list any credible sources.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton will soon be indicted on racketeering charges.

title: Trump Haters and Trump Supporters
subtitle: Photographs that purportedly show the difference between "Trump haters" and "Trump supporters" are misleading.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a group of Trump haters waving only foreign flags, and a group of Trump supporters waving American flags.

title: Does This Photograph Show Eight Rainbows?
subtitle: Those searching for eight pots of gold here are bound to be octo-disappointed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows eight rainbows over Lehigh, Pennsylvania.

title: Did Obama Apologize for Dropping the Atomic Bomb on Japan?
subtitle: While President Obama offered his sympathies during a visit to Hiroshima, he did not apologize for the United States' 1945 actions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama apologized for dropping bombs on Japan at the end of World War II.

title: Kim Kardashian to Replace Cookie on 'Empire'
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Kim Kardashian was replacing Tarji P. Henson in the role of Cookie on the television drama 'Empire.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kim Kardashian is replacing Tarji P. Henson in the role of Cookie on the television drama 'Empire.'

title: Anonymous Hacks IRS Database - Publishes Trump's Tax Returns
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Donald Trump's tax returns were posted online after Anonymous hacked the IRS database.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's tax returns were posted online after the IRS database was hacked.

title: 'Rare Black Rose' Only Grows in a Village in Turkey
subtitle: A video shows a "rare black rose" that only seems to grow in one small village on the Anatolian Peninsula.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A rare black rose grows naturally in Turkey.

title: Paris Under Muslim Siege
subtitle: An article reporting that Paris was "under siege by Muslims" came from a fearmongering site that only publishes misinformation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Muslims rampaging through Paris.

title: National Geographic Camerman Eaten Alive During Shooting
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a National Geographic cameraman was eaten alive by a giant ocean sunfish.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A National Geographic cameraman was eaten alive by a giant ocean sunfish.

title: Donald Trump Just Admitted He Was a Hillary Clinton Plant the Whole Time
subtitle: A fake Donald Trump tweet claiming that he's been a plant for Hillary Clinton all along wasn't actually sent by the Republican presidential candidate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump admitted on Twitter that he was a political plant for Hillary Clinton.

title: Oprah Endorses Donald Trump
subtitle: A rumor that Oprah Winfrey had endorsed Donald Trump for President of the United States circulated on social media in May 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Oprah Winfrey endorsed Donald Trump for president.

title: Hillary Clinton Used Model from Syphilis PSA?
subtitle: A purported Hillary Clinton ad hashtagged #ManEnough4Hillary wasn't created or distributed by her campaign.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton's campaign created a #ManEnough4Hillary ad featuring a male model also associated with a syphilis PSA.

title: Little-Known Norman Rockwell Painting: 'Cat Prevents House Fire'
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a little-known Norman Rockwell painting entitled "Cat Prevents House Fire" wasn't created by the famed American illustrator.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A little-known painting entitled "Cat Prevents House Fire" was created by Norman Rockwell.

title: Anti-Trump Protesters Break Horse's Leg
subtitle: Rumors swept social media that a police mount was pushed over during anti-Trump demonstrations, fracturing its leg.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A mounted policeman's horse had its leg broken by protesters during anti-Trump demonstrations.

title: American Immunity to the Zika Virus
subtitle: A false - and dangerous - claim that Americans are immune to the Zika virus is circulating on Twitter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Americans are immune to the Zika virus.

title: Photograph 'Taken Without a Telescope' Shows Andromeda Galaxy Next to the Moon
subtitle: A purported photograph that shows the galaxy next to (and much larger than) the moon is actually a composite of two separate images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of the Andromeda Galaxy next to the moon was taken without a telescope in Finland.

title: Lead in Flint Bottled Water
subtitle: Videos of home testing of bottled water handed out in Flint do not demonstrate the existence of dangerous levels of lead.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Videos of home testing of bottled water handed out in Flint demonstrate the existence of dangerous levels of lead.

title: Did the FBI Reveal the 'Most Dangerous' Zodiac Signs?
subtitle: A number of sketchy sales sites created a rumor that the FBI had released a study ranking zodiac signs by propensity for criminal action.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The FBI released a study ranking the connection between likelihood of criminal behavior and zodiac signs.

title: Eric Trump: 'Hispanics Are Afraid of My Father Because He'll Send Them Back to Asia'
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Eric Trump said that his father Donald Trump should send Hispanics back to Asia.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's son Eric said that Hispanic people should be sent back to Asia.

title: Donald Trump Plans to Declare War on Americans?
subtitle: A Fox News segment involving Donald Trump sparked rumors that the GOP frontrunner planned to declare war on Americans.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump stated he would declare war on Americans or people inside the U.S. if elected President.

title: Rick Warren Changes Name to 'Muhammad Hussein Warren'
subtitle: An article reporting that Pastor Rick Warren changed his name to "Muhammad Hussein Warren" came from a Christian-focused fake news site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pastor Rick Warren of Saddleback Church changed his name to "Muhammad Hussein Warren."

title: Is Smoking in Cars with Children Illegal as of January 30, 2018?
subtitle: Inaccurate warnings about an imminent ban on smoking in vehicles when minors are present have been circulating online since 2016.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A ban on smoking in cars when children are present took effect on 30 January 2018.

title: Artwork Shows Man with Noose Around Neck to Represent Multiculturalism
subtitle: A piece of art depicting a man watering a tree so that he could hang himself from it supposedly won a contest for depicting the state of multiculturalism in Europe.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A piece of art depicting a man watering a tree in an attempt to hang himself won a contest for depicting the current era of multiculturalism in Europe.

title: Hidden Sex Drawing in 'Monsters, Inc.' Scene
subtitle: A viral video purports to show a sexual act depicted in a scene from the popular children's movie "Monsters, Inc."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A drawing of a sex act can be spotted in the closing scenes of the movie "Monsters, Inc."

title: Miami-Dade to Create Freeway 'Texting Lane' to Accommodate Millenial Drivers
subtitle: An article that reported that Florida highways would be getting special lanes to accommodate people sending text messages originated from an entertainment and satire web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Miami-Dade County announced plans to create "texting lanes" on its highways.

title: White Teen Girl Identifies as Indian Chief, Demands Tribal Benefits
subtitle: No, a white teen girl didn't demand tribal benefits because she "identifies" as a Native American elder.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A white teen girl claimed she was entitled to tribal benefits because she identifies as a Native American elder.

title: NSA Toilet Cameras Sign
subtitle: A fake NSA "toilet cameras" notice directed complaints to the customer service line for Pizza Hut.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The National Security Agency puts  toilet cameras in restrooms for "research purposes," and fines those who tamper with them.

title: That's One Way to Stop Road Rage
subtitle: An animated image purportedly showing a road rage incident was actually taken from an episode of a Russian television series.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An animated image captures a real-life road rage incident.

title: Mr. T Death Hoax
subtitle: A false rumor reported that 'A-Team' actor Mr. T passed away in May 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: 'A-Team' actor Mr. T passed away in May 2016.

title: Lamb of God Accepts Award from Pastor Joel Osteen, Who Didn't Know They're Not a Christian Band
subtitle: A fake news article reported that the heavy metal band Lamb of God was given an
award by televangelist pastor Joel Osteen.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The band Lamb of God was given an award for "excellence in faith outreach" by televangelist pastor Joel Osteen.

title: Obama Declares Islam as America's Religion
subtitle: An unreliable web site claimed that President Obama declared Islam is the U.S.'s "official religion."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama declared Islam as America's "official religion."

title: Sunny Oaks Elementary Forces Kids to Cross Dress for LGBT Week
subtitle: A social media rumor about forced cross-dressing at Sunny Oaks Elementary School appears to have been created from whole cloth.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Students of Sunny Oaks Elementary School in California were forced to cross dress for LGBT week.

title: Do FBI Files Prove Adolf Hitler Escaped to Argentina?
subtitle: A treasure trove of documents released by the FBI includes hundreds of unsubstantiated reports claiming that Adolf Hitler faked suicide and escaped to South America.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Files released by the FBI prove that Adolf Hitler escaped Germany for Argentina.

title: Hillary's Recovered E-Mails Reveal Republican Gun Grab Plan
subtitle: An article about recovered e-mails belonging to Hillary Clinton revealing plans for a government "gun grab" was a thinly-disguised joke about Republican voter turnout on Election Day.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Recovered e-mails belonging to former secretary of state Hillary Clinton have revealed plans to seize guns from Republicans on 8 November 2016.

title: Is This a Real Albert Einstein Rejection Letter?
subtitle: Even the best of us see our efforts rejected for not being good enough sometimes, this wants to say.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a rejection letter Albert Einstein received from the University of Bern in 1907.

title: Did Sanders Supporters Throw Chairs at Nevada Democratic Convention?
subtitle: A Las Vegas reporter's second-hand claim Bernie Sanders supporters threw chairs at a Nevada convention was widely reproduced by other news outlets.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Angry Bernie Sanders supporters threw chairs during an adversarial Nevada Democrat convention in May 2016.

title: Does This Photo Show 'Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse' in the Clouds?
subtitle: The events that follow the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse are described as the Great Tribulation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the "Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse" riding out of the clouds.

title: Target to Discontinue Sales of American Flag
subtitle: An article reporting that Target stopped selling American flags came from a web site that only publishes hoax news and satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Target will no longer sell American flags in its stores.

title: Video Shows 'Fireball' in the Sky As EgyptAir Flight Disappears from Radar
subtitle: A purported video of a fireball streaking across the sky at the same time an EgyptAir flight went missing actually shows Russian rocket debris from 2015.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a ball of fire streaking across the sky at the same moment an Air Egypt flight went missing.

title: Tony Romo Arrested in North Carolina for Using Men's Bathroom
subtitle: An article reporting that the Cowboys' quarterback was arrested for using a men's bathroom in North Carolina was a spoof.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo was arrested for using a men's bathroom in North Carolina.

title: Was Donald Trump Never Accused of Racism Before Running Against Democrats?
subtitle: Plenty of race-related complaints and issues were attached to Donald Trump well before he began his 2016 presidential campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump was never accused of racism before he ran for president in 2016.

title: Fake CHI Products at T.J. Maxx and Marshall's
subtitle: A number of images circulating on social media accompanied rumors that retailers T.J. Maxx and Marshall's carried inauthentic salon products.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Retailers T.J. Maxx and Marshall's sell counterfeit salon products.

title: Target to Discontinue Sale of Holy Bible
subtitle: A report that Target had stopped selling the Bible due to recent protests against its transgender bathroom policies came from a satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Target has stopped selling the Bible.

title: Image of 'Lightest and Darkest Skin Colors'
subtitle: A photograph of two models is frequently shared with the misleading claim that it shows the "lightest and darkest skin colors."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two people with the darkest and lightest skin colors in the world.

title: Donald Trump 'Portuguese People' Quote
subtitle: A fake quote from Donald Trump about Portuguese people was started by a Facebook "prank" web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that "Portuguese people are the same as Spanish, but with worse wine."

title: Woman Gives Birth to Twins in Casket After Husband Buries Her Alive
subtitle: A fake news report that a woman gave birth after she was buried alive was widely reproduced across social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman gave birth to twins in a casket after her husband buried her alive.

title: Ann Coulter Arrested for Using Women's Bathroom
subtitle: An article reporting that the pundit had been arrested for using the women's bathroom came from a fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ann Coulter was arrested for using the women's bathroom.

title: Is This an Unaltered Photograph of North Korean Officers with Medals?
subtitle: "North Korea officers .... could easily be defeated with a magnet."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of North Korean generals wearing medals on their shirtsleeves and pants.

title: Transgender Woman Shot to Death in Department Store Restroom
subtitle: A fake news site's phony claim about a transgender woman shot and killed in a bathroom duped many social media users.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A transgender woman was shot to death in the bathroom of a Colorado department store.

title: Kendrick Lamar Secretly Purchases, Destroys Zimmerman's Gun Live on Stage
subtitle: A story reporting that the musician destroyed the gun used by George Zimmerman to kill Trayvon Martin came from a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kendrick Lamar bought and publicly destroyed the gun used by George Zimmerman to kill Trayvon Martin.

title: #Boycott36: Do Clinton and Sanders Support Late-Term Abortions?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post claimed Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton sought to make "the cutoff date" for abortion 36 weeks, but we were unable to substantiate that.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton both seek an abortion "cutoff date" of 36 weeks, and both claim that late-stage fetuses feel no pain and have no rights.

title: Do Red Lights Outside Homes Indicate Anti-Gun Solidarity?
subtitle: A story about activists lighting their homes with red bulbs to show opposition to guns is a hoax.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Activists are lighting their homes red to show solidarity for the anti-gun movement.

title: Image Shows President Obama with
Sign
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing President Obama posing with a "Bernie 2016" sign has been digitally doctored.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Obama pointing to a "Bernie 2016" sign.

title: Big Lots Closing?
subtitle: A prank-generating web site led many social media users to falsely believe Big Lots was closing all its stores.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Big Lots is closing all locations immediately.

title: Anthony Hopkins Death Hoax
subtitle: In May 2016, multiple hoaxsters claimed Anthony Hopkins had died.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Actor Anthony Hopkins has died.

title: Michael Jordan to North Carolina: 'HB2 Goes or the Charlotte Hornets Go'
subtitle: An article reporting that Michael Jordan threatened to move the Charlotte Hornets came from a site that specializes in fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Jordan threatened to move the Charlotte Hornets out of North Carolina over the state's HB2 bathroom law.

title: 'You Might be a Moron' Quote
subtitle: Comedian Jeff Foxworthy did not write a "you might be a moron" joke about the United States taking in Syrian refugees.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jeff Foxworthy said that you "might be a moron" if you allow refugees to enter the United States.

title: Jared Fogle Released Due to Overcrowding?
subtitle: The former Subway spokesman has not been placed on house arrest due to prison overcrowding.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Former Subway spokesman Jared Fogle was released from prison and placed on house arrest due to overcrowding.

title: Pro-Lifers Declare Every Sperm Is Sacred
subtitle: No anti-abortion groups have moved to declare every sperm cell "a life."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Anti-abortion groups are claiming every sperm cell is "a life."

title: Edward Snowden Said Osama bin Laden is Alive
subtitle: Edward Snowden did not claim Osama bin Laden was alive and living lavishly in the Bahamas on the CIA's payroll.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Edward Snowden claimed Osama bin Laden was alive in the Bahamas, funded by the CIA.

title: Is China Producing Corned Beef from Dead Bodies?
subtitle: Unverified, unvetted postings on social media used photographs from video game promotions to advance tropes about China's food industry.
author: Dan Evon
statement: China is making corned beef with dead bodies, then selling the products to Africa.

title: 'Bernie Sanders Glowstick' Instructions Make Bombs, Not Glow Sticks
subtitle: A meme offering instructions on how to make "Bernie Sanders glow sticks" actually provides a recipe for a chlorine bomb.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A meme offers instructions for creating harmless homemade glow sticks.

title: New York ICE Agent Suicide Note
subtitle: A habitual purveyor of misinformation leveraged the tragic suicide of an ICE agent to make outlandish and false claims about his death.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent left a suicide note warning of looming mass disarmament and collapse in the United States.

title: Did President Obama Order Mother's Day Be Used to Celebrate Abortions?
subtitle: "Obama signed the 'Patriot Freedom of Womb Liberty Act' which would add a new holiday, the 'National Abortion Freedom Day' to the already established Mother's Day holiday."
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama issued an order for abortions to be celebrated on Mother's Day.

title: States Agreed to Implement a 'Two Pet Maximum' Ordinance
subtitle: Reports that three states have implemented a two pet maximum law originated from a site that routinely spreads hoax stories.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Three states implemented a two pet maximum ordinance, forcing residents to choose which pets they must surrender.

title: Is This a Photograph of Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell in Donald Trump Campaign Shirts?
subtitle: Two of the least likely celebrities to be spotted sporting Donald Trump campaign shirts.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell were spotted wearing Donald Trump campaign shirts.

title: Sarah Palin Wants 'Arabic Numerals' Banned From America's Schools
subtitle: A story that the former Alaska governor wants "Arabic numbers" out of schools originated from a fake news web site.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Sarah Palin wants to ban "Arabic numerals" from American schools.

title: College Student In Coma After Drinking Challenge
subtitle: No, a college student did not wind up in a coma after attempting to drink two gallons of semen for a social media challenge.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A college student wound up in a coma after ingesting two gallons of semen as part of a social media challenge.

title: Ted Cruz Blames God for Defeat in Epic Twitter Meltdown
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Ted Cruz blamed God for his failed presidential campaign, and had a "meltdown" on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz blamed God for his failed presidential campaign on Twitter.

title: Woman Causes Pileup After Seeing Jesus in Her Candy Bar
subtitle: Dozens of web sites reproduced a fabricated story about a ten-car pileup caused by a woman who saw Jesus in a KitKat.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman caused a ten-car pileup after she believed she saw Jesus' image in her Kit Kat bar.

title: Trump to Nuke Mexico if They Don't Build Border Wall
subtitle: No, Donald Trump didn't suggest dropping nuclear bombs on Mexico if they refused to build the wall.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump suggested he'd use nuclear weapons against Mexico if they refused to build and pay for a wall.

title: Elsa to Have Female Love Interest in 'Frozen' Sequel
subtitle: A cropped screenshot from a news item led social media users to believe 'Frozen' character Elsa would have a "female love interest" in the sequel.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Elsa will have a female love interest in the sequel to "Frozen."

title: Teen Dies After 60 Minute Challenge?
subtitle: A fake news item falsely claimed a teen boy died during a risque 60-minute social media challenge.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A teen boy died after participating in a 60-minute masturbation challenge.

title: Kyle Carpenter's Medal of Honor Rescinded?
subtitle: Medal of Honor recipient Kyle Carpenter was not stripped of his award for failing to complete a minor driving course while on active duty.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Medal of Honor recipient Kyle Carpenter was stripped of his award for failing to complete a minor driving course while on active duty.

title: Obama Orders Bison to Replace Bald Eagle as National Symbol
subtitle: While the bison is set to become the United States' national mammal, this will have no effect on the status of the bald eagle.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama is set to replace the bald eagle as the U.S.'s national animal.

title: Newark Woman Arrested for Assaulting, Killing Son with Toy?
subtitle: A fake news site fabricated a horrifying and humorless claim about a Newark mother assaulting and killing her toddler with a sex toy.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Newark woman was arrested for raping and killing her toddler son.

title: Image of 'Vietnam Vets' Is a Still From a Movie
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a group of underappreciated Vietnam veterans is actually a frame from the comedy "Tropic Thunder."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of underappreciated Vietnam veterans.

title: Kings Island Closing Down Due to Dangerous Rides
subtitle: A prank generator site led many social media users to believe Kings Island was closing due to "dangerous rides."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ohio amusement park Kings Island will close through 2020 because of "dangerous rides."

title: CIA Agents Arrested Crossing Mexican Border with Cocaine
subtitle: An old fake news article reported that two CIA agents were arrested at the Mexican border with a large quantity of cocaine.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Minutemen caught two CIA agents smuggling a sizable quantity of cocaine across the Mexican border.

title: Disappointing Prince Vaults Found to Contain 37,000 Hours of Billy Joel Covers
subtitle: An article reporting that Prince's music vault contained nothing but Billy Joel cover songs came from humor and satire site "The Onion."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Prince's music vault contains 37,000 hours of Bill Joel cover songs.

title: Image of 'Spiral Sky' is a Digital Creation
subtitle: An image showing an impressive spiral cloud formation encircling a tower was rendered by an artist, not photographed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a spiral cloud formation encircling a tower.

title: Marine Corps' Pearl Harbor Memorial Flags Removed at President Obama's Request
subtitle: A story about a flagpole that was removed from a Pearl Harbor memorial was blamed on President Obama nearly ten years later.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama ordered the removal of an American flag at a Pearl Harbor memorial.

title: Woman Arrested for Pleasuring Herself with Happy Meal Toy
subtitle: A story that a woman was arrested for pleasuring herself with a Happy Meal toy in a McDonald's ball pit came from a site that only publishes hoax news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman was arrested for masturbating with a Happy Meal toy inside a McDonald's play area ball pit.

title: Tim Hortons Removes Pork to Appease Muslims
subtitle: An unverified claim that Tim Hortons was removing pork from its menu to appease Muslims was later labeled as "satire."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Canadian chain Tim Hortons is removing pork from its menu to appease offended Muslim customers.

title: Google's Self-Driving Bike
subtitle: A Google April Fools' Day video showing a "self-driving bicycle" continues to confuse viewers long after the event.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a 'self-driving bicycle' created by Google.

title: Jim Carrey Death Hoax (2016)
subtitle: A fake news article reported that actor Jim Carrey had died in a snowboarding accident.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Jim Carrey has died in a snowboarding accident.

title: Does This Video Capture a Time Traveler at a 1995 Mike Tyson Fight?
subtitle: A viral video purportedly shows a spectator using a not-yet-available camera phone to take photographs of a Mike Tyson fight back in 1995.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a time-traveling spectator using a camera phone to take photographs at a Mike Tyson fight back in 1995.

title: The Dalai Lama Converts to Atheism, Will Step Down to Pursue Sitcom Career
subtitle: An article reporting that the Dalai Lama was renouncing religion and pursuing a career as a sitcom writer was intended as a humor piece.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Dalai Lama is has renounced religion and is pursuing a career as a sitcom writer.

title: American Psychiatric Association Condones Pedophilia
subtitle: Blogs dug up an old and misleading article to falsely report that the American Psychiatric Association now condones pedophilia.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The American Psychiatric Association condones pedophilia and says it is normal to be sexually attracted to children.

title: Indiana Governor Bans Boys from Wearing Clothes with 'Gay' Colors
subtitle: An article reporting that Indiana governor Mike Pence signed a law banning boys from wearing "gay" colors came from the "satire" section of the Huffington Post.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Indiana Governor Mike Pence signed a law banning boys from wearing "gay" colors.

title: Nike Doesn't Make Elephant Skin Shoes
subtitle: An unsourced meme on Facebook accused Nike of making their sneakers with the hides of elephants.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nike makes their sneakers with elephant skins.

title: Young Harriet Tubman Photograph
subtitle: A viral image is not a photograph of African-American abolitionist Harriet Tubman as a young woman.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts a glamorous "young Harriet Tubman."

title: Benjamin Netanyahu Confronts Hillary Clinton
subtitle: A video showing an encounter between Hillary Clinton and Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu is actually an old satirical clip.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu telling Hillary Clinton that he wants to maximize civilian casualties.

title: Jewish Mother Hugs Toddler Before Holocaust Murders?
subtitle: A purported photograph of a Jewish mother hugging her daughter before Nazis murdered them both is actually a screenshot from a 1988 miniseries.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph depicts a Jewish mother hugging her toddler daughter before both were shot to death by Nazis.

title: Fake Target Customer Service Account Responds to People Angry About Transgender Bathroom Policy
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a curt response from a Target customer service representative on Twitter originated with a parody account.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a curt response from a Target customer service representative.

title: North Carolina No Longer Accepts $20 Bills
subtitle: An article reported that the $20 was no longer considered legal tender in North Carolina, but it was from a hoax news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: North Carolina no longer considers the $20 bill to be legal tender.

title: Italian Doctor Finds Surprisingly Simple Cure for Multiple Sclerosis?
subtitle: Long-debunked claims from 2009 about a novel approach to Multiple Sclerosis were misleadingly presented as news in 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Italian doctor uncovered a surprisingly simple cure for multiple sclerosis in April 2016.

title: Saturn 'Close to Earth' Meme
subtitle: A meme played on social media's fascination with astronomy by claiming that Saturn would appear to be impossibly close to Earth in May 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: On 1 May 2016, Saturn will be prominently visible in both the day and night sky.

title: John Madden Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that the former NFL coach had passed away came from an article originally published on a satirical and fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hall of Fame coach John Madden passed away in 2014 at age 78.

title: Transgender Woman Arrested for Taking Pictures of Underage Girls at Target
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a transgender woman was arrested for taking pictures of underage girls in a Target bathroom.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A transgender woman was arrested to taking pictures of underage girls at a Target in Dallas.

title: Was a Woman Arrested for Defecating on Supervisor's Desk After Winning Lottery?
subtitle: A story reported a woman's leaving a rude "goodbye gift" on her boss's desk after winning the lottery.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman defecated on her boss' desk after she won a lottery.

title: NASA Reports Magnetosphere Collapse
subtitle: A conspiracy-oriented web site claimed that that Earth's magnetosphere "COLLAPSED" for two hours, but NASA confirmed the incident was a software glitch - and that such fluctuations aren't doomsday events.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Earth's magnetosphere collapsed for two hours on 23 April 2016.

title: Mormon Church Wants to Limit Sale of Tissue to Curb Onanism
subtitle: Stories about the Mormon Church's attempt to limit the sales of tissues and emollients in an effort to curb masturbation came from a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Mormon church wants to limit sales of Vaseline and Kleenex in order to curb masturbation.

title: Cher and Robert Plant Aren't Getting Married
subtitle: Articles that reported that musicians Cher and Robert Plant were getting married originated from a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musicians Robert Plant and Cher plan to wed at Westminster Abbey in July 2016.

title: Prince Was Not Haywood Nelson's Brother
subtitle: A viral meme claimed that musician Prince and actor Haywood Nelson were half-brothers, but that misinformation was based on a misunderstanding.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Musician Prince Rogers Nelson and actor Haywood Nelson are half brothers.

title: Obama Took $2.6B from Veterans for Syrian Refugees
subtitle: President Obama did not cut $2.6 billion from programs for veterans and instead give a like amount to support Syrian refugees in the U.S.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama cut $2.6 billion from programs for veterans and instead give a like amount to support Syrian refugees.

title: Target Puts Urinals in Women's Bathrooms
subtitle: A photograph of urinals was not taken in the women's bathroom of a Target store, nor has the chain announced plans for such installations.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Target retail chain has installed urinals in their women's bathrooms.

title: Was Prince Integral in the Development of Air Jordan Sneakers?
subtitle: An online item suggested that Prince played a vital role in basketball star Michael Jordan's commercial success with Nike.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Prince invested in Nike in 1971, recruited NBA star Michael Jordan to the company in 1983, and designed the first Air Jordan shoe.

title: Swipe Driver's License for Free Gas
subtitle: A hoax video claims that you can get $10 worth of free gas from "leftover campaign funds" simply by swiping your driver's license.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Leftover campaign funds are being used to give out $10 worth of free gas when you swipe your driver's license at the pump.

title: Was Harriet Tubman a Gun-Toting Republican?
subtitle: A macro presenting Harriet Tubman as a "gun-toting Republican" features a photograph of Mary Fields, not Harriet Tubman.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph captures Harriet Tubman as a "Gun-Toting, Democrat-Shooting" Republican.

title: Moose Enjoy Wading Pool, Watch Car Fire
subtitle: A photograph showing moose sitting in a kiddie pool watching as a car burns is a composite of multiple images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows moose enjoying a wading pool while watching a car burn.

title: KKK Members Commit Mass Suicide Over New Currency
subtitle: A story that Klan members committed suicide after announcements that Harriet Tubman's image would be placed on $20 bills came from a hoax news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sixty Klan members committed suicide after it was announced that Harriet Tubman's image would be placed on the $20 bill.

title: Eric Clapton's Prince
subtitle: An old chestnut of musical praise, once attributed to Jimi Hendrix, was repurposed to involve Eric Clapton and Prince.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: When someone asked Eric Clapton what it was like to be the greatest guitar player in the world, he responded: "I don't know, ask Prince."

title: Prince on Politics
subtitle: A meme asserts that musician Prince said he voted Republican because that political party knows the value of hard work.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Prince said that he voted Republican because that political party knows the value of hard work.

title: Plan Launches to Make Obama Addition to Mount Rushmore
subtitle: After Harriet Tubman's addition to the $20 bill was announced, a spurious old rumor recirculated claiming that President Obama's likeness is being added to Mount Rushmore.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The likeness of President Obama will be added to Mount Rushmore.

title: Man Commits Suicide Over Harriet Tubman Replacing Andrew Jackson on the $20 Bill
subtitle: A fake news item reported that a man killed himself over the Treasury's decision to add an African-American abolitionist's portrait to the $20 bill.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man killed himself over the Treasury's decision to add an African-American abolitionist's portrait to the $20 bill.

title: Did Harriet Tubman Say 'I Freed a Thousand Slaves'?
subtitle: There's no evidence a famous quote often attributed to the African-American abolitionist was actually spoken by her.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Harriet Tubman said: "I freed a thousand slaves. I could have freed a thousand more if only they knew they were slaves."

title: NASA Lithium Chemtrails Conspiracy
subtitle: Conspiracy web sites discovered an old recorded phone call between a NASA scientist and a conspiracy theorist, and concluded the agency was dosing Americans with lithium.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: NASA admitted to dosing Americans with airborne lithium.

title: Orchestra Music Brings Whales to the Surface
subtitle: A 2009 television spot featuring an orchestra playing music to a digital whale is being shared on Facebook as genuine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of whales coming to the surface after hearing an orchestra playing music.

title: Did Sgt. Gregory Hayes Kill Two Syrian Refugees for Raping His Daughter?
subtitle: A popular meme describes a purported act of vengeance for which we found no evidence whatsoever.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ret. Sgt. Gregory Hayes beat two Syrian refugees to death after they raped his daughter, and now faces life in prison.

title: Is This a Trump Supporter Wearing a
Shirt?
subtitle: Confused by mixed messages?  There's good reason to be.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a woman holding a Trump campaign sign and wearing a "Bernie Sanders Is a Communist" shirt.

title: The Fix Is In: Sanders Supporters in New York See Votes Switched to Hillary
subtitle: A Huffington Post impostor site falsely reported that New York primary voters witnessed their votes changing from Bernie Sanders to Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Multiple news outlets reported that primary voters in New York claimed their votes were switched from Bernie Sanders to Hillary Clinton.

title: South Africa's 'HIV Genital Tattoo' Law
subtitle: A fake news article reported that a new law in South Africa would require people with HIV to indelibly mark their genitals.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A new law in South Africa requires people with HIV to mark their genitals.

title: Paul Teutul Death Hoax
subtitle: A hoax article falsely reported that "American Chopper" star Paul Teutul, Sr. had been killed in a motorcycle accident.
author: Dan Evon
statement: "American Chopper" star Paul Teutul, Sr. was killed in a motorcycle accident in April 2016.

title: Disney Replacing Tower of Terror with Elsa's Ice Castle?
subtitle: Disney Parks isn't replacing the "Tower of Terror" attraction with "Elsa's Ice Castle."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Disney is replacing its popular "Tower of Terror" attraction with "Elsa's Ice Castle."

title: Red-Haired Teen Sues His Parents for $2M for Being Born
subtitle: Fake news reports a redheaded teenage boy has launched a controversial 'wrongful life' lawsuit against his parents.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A boy is suing his parents for allowing him to be born with red hair.

title: What the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Must Tell the Nation
subtitle: An article reporting the fiery resignation speech of  Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Joseph Dunford was just someone's fanciful political invention.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Joseph Dunford announced his retirement with a fiery political resignation speech.

title: McDonald's Employee Admits to Ejaculating in Big Mac 'Secret Sauce' for Nearly 2 Years
subtitle: Fake news reports that a McDonald's employee has been arrested for masturbating into hamburger ingredients.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A McDonald's employee was arrested for masturbating into the restaurant's condiments.

title: The Farm Below the Mountain
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a lush green farm in the shadow of a snow-covered mountain is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a lush green farm in the shadow of a looming, snow-covered mountain.

title: Woman Kicked Out of Ladies' Bathroom by Police After Being Mistaken for Transgender
subtitle: Fake news reports that NC police tased and "brutally ejected" a woman from a ladies' restroom because they thought she was transgender.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NC police tased and "brutally ejected" a woman from a ladies' restroom because they thought she was transgender.

title: 'Welcome to Australia'
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a "Welcome to Australia" sign was digitally altered.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a "Wecome to Australia" sign informing immigrants that they have to work to earn money.

title: Man Deletes Entire Company with One Line of Code
subtitle: The original story, says its creator, was a viral marketing scheme to promote his server management company.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A man deleted his entire company with one line of code.

title: Dr Pepper Bought by Coca-Cola, to Be Discontinued
subtitle: An online hoax held that Coca-Cola had bought up rival soda brand Dr Pepper and would be shutting down production of the popular soft drink.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Coca-Cola has bought the rights to Dr Pepper and will be discontinuing production of the latter soft drink.

title: World's First 'Modular Life Form'
subtitle: A viral video showing a fleshy, lab-grown "modular body" is part of a science fiction web series.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Oscar, the world's first modular life form.

title: Scientists Create Kale and Cannabis Hybrid
subtitle: An April Fool's Day joke claimed that scientists had created "kaleabis," a cross between kale and marijuana.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Scientists have created "kaleabis," a cross of kale and marijuana.

title: Fat Cat
subtitle: A photograph showing an obese tiger is actually an entry from a Photoshop "Obeastity" contest.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an obese tiger.

title: Texas Voter ID
subtitle: A meme claimed that a 92-year-old Texas woman named Pam Nelson was unable to vote in her state's primary due to voter ID laws, but that wasn't the case.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 92-year-old Pam Nelson of Victoria, Texas, was unable to vote because of new laws requiring voters to present ID.

title: Photograph of Paul McCartney Wearing 'Adopt' Shirt
subtitle: A photograph showing the former Beatle wearing a shirt that reads "Adopt" with an image of a dog on it was digitally altered.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Paul McCartney wearing a t-shirt with the word "adopt" written across the chest.

title: Wearing Anonymous Masks in Public Is Illegal
subtitle: A sensationalized story falsely claimed that it is now illegal to wear "Anonymous" masks in public.
author: Dan Evon
statement: It is illegal to wear Anonymous (i.e., Guy Fawkes) masks in public in the United States.

title: Grandma Eats Her Daughter's New Born Baby After Smoking Bath Salts
subtitle: Fake news stories report that a woman ate her grandchild while high on bath salts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman ate her grandchild after smoking bath salts.

title: Entire Goldman Sachs Executive Board Arrested by FBI
subtitle: Fake news reports that the whole Goldman Sachs board was arrested by the FBI for defrauding millions of people and causing the 2008 financial collapse.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The entire Goldman Sachs executive board was arrested by the FBI.

title: Mebane Travel Center Ladies' Room Urinals?
subtitle: A Facebook user incorrectly claimed that urinals were installed in the ladies' restroom at a Pilot Travel Center in Mebane, North Carolina.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pilot Travel Center in Mebane, North Carolina installed urinals in the ladies' room.

title: Obama Encouraging Schools to Teach Quran for Extra Credit
subtitle: A number of social media posters claimed President Obama was "encouraging" schools to teach the Quran for "extra credit," but further information was rarely included.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama encouraged schools to teach the Quran for extra credit.

title: United Nations Troops to Kill Americans Who Won't Turn in Guns?
subtitle: An old, thinly sourced 2012 video led to rumors that the UN planned to disarm Americans by force.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The United Nations will kill all Americans who refuse to turn over their guns.

title: New York State Gun Travel Ban
subtitle: A fake news item claiming New York State Gov. Andrew Cuomo issued a multi-state "travel ban" over lax gun laws was repeated across social media as truth.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: New York State Gov. Andrew Cuomo issued a multi-state "travel ban" involving states with "lax gun laws."

title: 'Dear Scrotty Students' Letter to Oxford University Students
subtitle: A letter purportedly from Oxford University's chancellor to students protesting a statue of Cecil Rhodes did not originate with the university.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A letter criticizing students at Oxford University for their desire to remove a statue of Cecil Rhodes was penned by a school official.

title: Did Socrates Say Slander Is 'The Tool of the Losers
subtitle: Some quotes are documented in history and textbooks, while others appear nowhere but the internet.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Socrates said 'When the debate is lost, slander becomes the tool of the losers.'

title: 'Scarcity' Image of Woman in Shopping Aisle Not Taken in Venezuela
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a woman walking down a deserted shopping aisle in Venezuela was actually taken in New York in 2011.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph showing a woman walking down a nearly empty supermarket aisle was taken in Venezuela.

title: Ted Cruz Is Married to His Cousin
subtitle: An article that reported Ted Cruz and his wife Heidi were cousins originated with  a fake news web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz and his wife are cousins.

title: Does This Video Show 'Snowboarder Girl' Being Chased by a Bear?
subtitle: A snowboarder purportedly discovered from watching video of herself that she was being chased by a bear.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a snowboarder being chased by a bear.

title: Sajid Muhammed Sets Woman on Fire
subtitle: A satirical meme mocking anti-Muslim Facebook content was mistaken as factual by some social media users.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A meme claimed that a British Muslim man named Sajid Muhammed set a woman on fire for eating a bacon sandwich, and was jailed for only two years.

title: Mother Admits to Affair, Pregnancy by 15-Year-Old Son
subtitle: Several fake news articles reported on a fabricated Facebook confession from a mother purportedly pregnant by her teenaged son.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A mother admitted on Facebook to sleeping with and becoming pregnant by her 15-year-old son.

title: Merle Haggard Leaves Estate to Bakersfield LGBT Group
subtitle: Fake news reports that recently-deceased country music legend Merle Haggard left his entire estate to an LGBT group.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Country music singer Merle Haggard left his entire estate to an LGBT group.

title: Newly Discovered Planet Could Destroy Earth Any Day Now
subtitle: A sensational tabloid article built upon benign statements from a retired astrophysicist to surmise that a "newly discovered" planet could imminently destroy all life on Earth.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An astrophysicist warned that a "newly discovered Planet X" could wipe out all life on Earth as early as April 2016.

title: 'One Day After I Am Long Gone'
subtitle: A quote attributed to John F. Kennedy warned of what would happen "one day" after he was "long gone," but there's no record of his having said such a thing.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: John F. Kennedy warned of what would happen "one day" after he was "long gone" in an eerily predictive manner.

title: Was a Florida Zoo Employee Killed While Attempting to Rape an Alligator?
subtitle: "The young man was caught by the throat by the alligator, who dragged him underwater and drowned him."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Florida zoo employee was killed while attempting to sexually assault a 12-foot alligator.

title: Woman Slices Off Rapist's Genitals, Forces Him to Eat It at Gunpoint
subtitle: A fake news site posing as Los Angeles-area television station KTLA spread a fabricated but juicy tale of a woman's revenge on her assaulter.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman sliced a rapist's genitals off and forced him to eat them.

title: Seven People 'Dead by ISIS' in Local Attack
subtitle: A new fake news generator capitalized on fabricated local stories by creating false rumors of deadly ISIS attacks in multiple locations.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An ISIS attack claimed seven lives in a U.S. town.

title: Are U.S. Schools Buying Prayer Rugs for Muslim Students?
subtitle: A popular article on social media incorrectly claimed that St. Cloud schools bought prayer rugs for Muslim students at taxpayer expense.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Taxpayers footed the bill for prayer rugs at a St. Cloud school district after a lawsuit was brought by CAIR.

title: Photograph Doesn't Show Texas Students Protesting College Debt
subtitle: A photo purportedly showing a group of college students with the amount of debt they're in written on their graduation caps is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of Texas college students protesting the rising cost of education by writing their debts on their graduation caps.

title: 'Wolf' on Horse's Coat
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a horse with wolf-like markings on its coat is a digital creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a horse with markings on its coat depicting an image of a wolf.

title: Is This William Harley and Arthur Davidson Unveiling Their First Motorcycle?
subtitle: A vintage photograph of two men sitting on Harley-Davidson motorcycles is said to picture the company's founders.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows William Harley and Arthur Davidson unveiling their first motorcycle in 1914.

title: HUD Tiny Homes Ban
subtitle: A lot of anxious bloggers incorrectly surmised HUD was moving to make "tiny homes" illegal.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: HUD is attempting to pass a law banning tiny houses and RV living.

title: Boyfriend Murdered After April Fool's Prank Proposal?
subtitle: A report that a woman shot and killed her boyfriend over a prank April Fool's Day marriage proposal was itself a prank.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A woman shot and killed her boyfriend after an April Fool's Day marriage proposal prank.

title: Was a 736-Pound Catfish Caught in the Mississippi River?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a 736-pound catch adds to the collection of urban legends about monstrously large catfish.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 736-pound catfish caught in the Mississippi River.

title: Are People Pooping on Donald Trump's Hollywood Star?
subtitle: Several blogs have cited "reports" that visitors to Hollywood's Walk of Fame have taken to defecating on Donald Trump's star.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Visitors to Hollywood's Walk of Fame regularly defecate on Donald Trump's star.

title: Did Disney Ban Tattoos in Their Theme Parks?
subtitle: "We don't think that tattoos fit into the image of a wholesome Disney family."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Disney is banning customers bearing tattoos from all their theme parks.

title: Mother Sues Tampon Company for 'Stealing' Daughter's Virginity
subtitle: Fake news reports an Idaho woman is suing  Kotex for $1.4 million dollars because she claims one of her daughters lost her virginity while using a tampon.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A woman is suing a tampon manufacturer for 'stealing' her daughter's virginity.

title: Bernie Sanders Plans to Tax Churches?
subtitle: A fake news piece led some social media users to believe that Bernie Sanders planned to tax churches at a rate of 90 percent.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders wants to tax churches at a rate of 90 percent.

title: Hillary Clinton Arrested by FBI
subtitle: Several "too good to be true" fake news articles published on April Fools' Day reported that Hillary Clinton had been arrested by the feds.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton was arrested by the FBI on 1 April 2016.

title: Bernie Sanders Said United States Would 'Embrace Socialism'?
subtitle: A quote from a fake news article is frequently circulated as a genuine quote from the Democratic presidential candidate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bernie Sanders said that "the heritage of Castro will be felt for generations to come" during a 1985 radio interview.

title: Redbox Kiosk Ambassadors
subtitle: Redbox pranked users on April Fools' Day with a recruitment offer for "kiosk ambassadors" to man their red booths.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Redbox is hiring "kiosk ambassadors" to man their red booths.

title: Weather Channel Switching to Celsius-Only
subtitle: The Weather Channel played an April Fool's Day joke on their viewers with the announcement that they would be dropping use of the Fahrenheit temperature scale.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Weather Channel announced that it will only use the Celsius temperature scale.

title: Pimm's Signs Sponsorship Deal to Display Logo on Big Ben
subtitle: London's famous clock has not gone unabashedly commercial.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pimm's signed a sponsorship deal to display its logo on Big Ben.

title: Donald Trump Announces His Campaign Is a Joke
subtitle: A video purportedly showing the presidential candidate saying that his campaign had been an April Fool's Day prank all along was actually created for a comedy TV show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump announced that his 2016 Presidential campaign was an April Fool's Day joke.

title: Trader Joe's to Close All Stores by 2017, Plans to Discontinue Products
subtitle: An article reporting that the Trader Joe's grocery chain would be closing all of their stores by 2017 was an early April Fool's Day joke.
author: Dan Evon
statement: All Trader Joe's grocery stores will be closed by 2017.

title: Ron Howard Didn't Say That the 1969 Moon Landing Was Fake
subtitle: A YouTube conspiracy theory video claims that a clip from "Arrested Development" proves that the 1969 moon landing was staged.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A clip from the show 'Arrested Development' featuring Ron Howard is proof that the 1969 moon landing was fake.

title: Congresswoman Proposes Breastfeeding Ban for Women with Large Breasts
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Rep. Debbie Riddle proposed a breastfeeding ban on busty women.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rep. Debbie Riddle proposed a breastfeeding ban on women with large breasts.

title: Kohl's Bankrupt, Closing 818 Stores?
subtitle: Kohl's isn't closing all locations.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Kohl's declared bankruptcy and is closing all its stores.

title: Donald Trump's Ex-Wives Speak Out on 'Forced Abortions'
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Donald Trump's ex-wives had disclosed he pressured them into undergoing unwanted abortions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump ex-wives admitted that the Republican Presidential candidate forced them to have abortions.

title: Donald Trump Blames Muslims for Death of Jesus
subtitle: A news article that reported that Donald Trump said he didn't like Muslims because they killed Jesus originated from a site that solely prints satire.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that he doesn't like Muslims because they killed Jesus.

title: Veal Crates
subtitle: A photograph supposedly showing inhumane "veal crates" is actually a picture of hutches used for the protection of newborn dairy calves.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows crates in which calves are kept immobilized for six weeks before they are slaughtered for veal.

title: Facebook 'Bernie Blackout'?
