subtitle: Facebook is not censoring content about Bernie Sanders or the hashtag #FeelTheBern.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook is censoring posts about Bernie Sanders and the hashtag #FeelTheBern.

title: Video Shows Amy Winehouse Singing at Age 10?
subtitle: A video of 8-year-old Angelina Jordan singing "What a Diff'rence a Day Makes" is frequently shared with the false claim that it shows a young Amy Winehouse.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a 10-year-old Amy Winehouse singing "What A Difference A Day Makes."

title: Frank Bruni 'College Admissions Shocker' Satire
subtitle: A satirical New York Times item reporting that Stanford rejected all applicants in 2016 was mistaken as real by some social media users.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Stanford University rejected all applicants for the Class of 2020, cementing their status as an upper-crust institution.

title: Did a 101-Year-Old Woman Give Birth After an Ovarian Transplant?
subtitle: A Reddit user's personal photo was used in a fabricated claim about a 101-year-old mother who gave birth at an advanced age thanks to an ovarian transplant.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 101-year-old Italian woman gave birth after an ovarian transplant.

title: Did Bernie Sanders Buy a $172,000 Car with Campaign Donations?
subtitle: A set of photographs accompanied a suggestion that the Vermont senator had purchased an Audi R8 luxury automobile with campaign funds.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bernie Sanders purchased a $172,000 luxury car with presidential campaign donations.

title: Muslims Open Fire on California Hikers?
subtitle: A few disreputable web sites falsely claimed that Muslims in San Bernardino County fired on hikers while shouting "Allahu Akbar."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The media covered up an incident in San Bernardino during which several Muslim men fired upon a number of Californian hikers.

title: 'Best Volleyball Blocks Ever'
subtitle: A video showing a man repeatedly getting hit  in the face during a volleyball match is from the sketch comedy show 'Studio C.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video featuring the "Best Volleyball Blocks Ever" uses footage of a real volleyball game.

title: Aaron Rodgers and Olivia Munn Make Surprise Appearance at Bernie Sanders Event
subtitle: Fake news reports that Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers and actress Olivia Munn appeared together at a political rally in Wisconsin.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Aaron Rodgers and Olivia Munn endorsed Bernie Sanders at a rally in Wisconsin.

title: Whataburger 'Dollar Burger Day' Promotion
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a coupon for a Whataburger "Dollar Burger Day" promotion is a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Whataburger is holding a "Dollar Burger Day" promotion on 29 March 2016.

title: Singer Kehlani Found Dead in Home Bathroom; Apparent Suicide
subtitle: A fake news article reported that singer Kehlani had been found dead in her home as rumors of a suicide attempt circulated online.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer Kehlani was found dead in her home of an apparent suicide on 28 March 2016.

title: Alaska, Hawaii, Washington State Overwhelmingly 'White, Rural'?
subtitle: Voters took umbrage with coverage of Alaska, Hawaii, Washington Democratic caucuses characterizing voters as ethnically homogenous.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Alaska, Hawaii, Washington states are overwhelmingly "white" and "rural."

title: Gabourey Sidibe Death Hoax
subtitle: Gabourey Sidibe took to Twitter to refute a fake news site's celebrity death hoax about her.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Actor Gabourey Sidibe has died of an "apparent asthma attack."

title: Is 'Beetlejuice 2' Coming Soon?
subtitle: 'Beetlejuice 2' will not be showing at a theater near you anytime soon, as there are no plans for a sequel.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 'Beetlejuice 2,' a sequel to the 1988 comedy horror film, is coming to theaters soon.

title: Is This Snoop Dogg in an Easter Bunny Costume?
subtitle: A basket of marijuana is not the usual springtime fare dispensed to children at Easter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows musician Snoop Dogg in an Easter Bunny costume.

title: What's Good About Good Friday?
subtitle: The origin of the name of one of the most significant days in the Christian calendar is not quite so obvious.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The name of the Christian holy day known as "Good Friday" derives from the term "God's Friday."

title: Milk-Bone Facebook Warning
subtitle: A viral video made unsubstantiated claims that Milk-Bone could cause cancer in dogs due to the presence of BHA.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Milk-Bone dog treats cause cancer in one of every two dogs that eat them.

title: Maricopa County Recorder Has a Personal Clinton Connection?
subtitle: A rumor claiming that Maricopa County Recorder Helen Purcell has connections to the Clinton campaign through her late husband, Joe Purcell, is false.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Maricopa County Recorder Helen Purcell was married to Joe Purcell, a former Lieutenant Governor of Arkansas who served under Bill Clinton.

title: Ronald Reagan Went Golfing After 1983 Beirut Attack
subtitle: A meme falsely claims that Ronald Reagan continued his vacation after the 1983 terrorist attack on a U.S. Marines barrack in Beirut.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ronald Reagan went golfing after the 1983 terrorist bombing of a U.S. Marines barrack in Beirut.

title: The FDA Classified Walnuts as Drugs?
subtitle: The Food and Drug Administration hasn't decided walnuts are drugs - just that companies can't make specific, unauthorized health claims about them.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The FDA classified walnuts as drugs.

title: Is Nutella Toxic?
subtitle: Social media users have spread articles claiming Nutella is "toxic" due to its use of vanillin and MSG.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Nutella is "toxic" and contains the "harmful" ingredients vanillin and MSG.

title: Did Cadbury Candies Eliminate the Word 'Easter'?
subtitle: Although some Cadbury chocolates did not feature the word "Easter" on their packaging, the company didn't eliminate references to that holiday.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Cadbury has entirely eliminated use of the word "Easter" on the packaging of their chocolate candy products.

title: Family Drowns After Leaving Sunroof Open in Automated Carwash
subtitle: The story about a family drowning in a carwash because they forgot to close their car's sunroof comes from a satire news site.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A family of three drowned when they neglected to close their car's sunroof before going through a carwash.

title: Donald Trump Bombshell: Ted Cruz's Wife Former Call Girl
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Donald Trump had 'spilled the beans' and outed Heidi Cruz as a former call girl.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump "spilled the beans" on Heidi Cruz, saying that she used to work as a call girl.

title: Donald Trump: Build a Wall on the Canadian Border
subtitle: A doctored video seemingly shows Donald Trump saying that as president he would build a wall along the U.S.-Canadian border.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that as president he would build a wall along the U.S.-Canadian border.

title: The Claw of Troodon
subtitle: A photograph of a moa foot has been misrepresented as depicting a dinosaur claw.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the preserved claw of a dinosaur called troodon.

title: FDA Outlaws CBD Oils
subtitle: The FDA hasn't banned the sale of cannabidiol oils because a drug company is interested in marketing them.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) banned the sale of cannabidiol (CBD) oils because a drug company is interested in marketing them.

title: Pantene Hair Products Causing Highlight Foils to Catch Fire?
subtitle: A Facebook post claims Pantene shampoo and conditioner caused highlight foils to heat up and melt due to a unique waxy buildup.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pantene shampoo and conditioner leave a build-up on hair that causes it to heat up and "smoke" when combined with highlight foils.

title: Colorado Rockies Baseball Team to Sell Marijuana Brownies at Their Concession Stands?
subtitle: Reports that the Colorado Rockies baseball team have opted to add pot brownies to the treats available at Coors Field concession stands are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Colorado Rockies will be selling pot brownies at Coors Field concession stands .

title: Photograph Shows President Obama Holding Che Guevara T-Shirt
subtitle: An image showing President Obama in Havana holding a t-shirt picturing Cuban revolutionary Che Guevara is a digital fabrication.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Obama holding a Che Guevara t-shirt.

title: Does This Video Show Walmart Water Turning Into a Dangerous Gelatin Substance?
subtitle: A video showing super-cooled water turning instantly to ice was shared with the implication that Walmart-brand water is dangerous.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Walmart-brand water turning to a dangerous gelatin substance.

title: Is Autism Now Disclosed as a DTaP Vaccine Side Effect?
subtitle: Autism has not just been listed as a known side effect of the DTaP vaccine; it's a remnant of decade-old, unverified user self-reporting.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Autism has now been included among the known side effects of the  DTaP (Diphtheria, Tetanus, and acellular Pertussis) vaccine.

title: 'Step Brothers 2' Rumors Are False
subtitle: Articles reporting that a 'Step Brothers 2' sequel was in the works were just fake news items.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Plans to make a sequel to the movie 'Step Brothers' were announced in March 2016.

title: Misidentified Footage Circulated as 'Brussels Attack Video'
subtitle: A video from the 2011 Minsk Metro bombing was shared on Twitter as legitimate footage of the March 2016 terrorist attack on Brussels.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the "moment the explosion" of a terrorist attack occurred in the Brussels airport on 22 March 2016. .

title: President Obama to Reduce the Size of Navajo Reservation
subtitle: A letter stating that President Obama is planning to cut the size of the Navajo Reservation by 4 million acres did not originate from an official government source.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The U.S. Department of Interior sent out an official news release stating that President Obama was reducing the size of the Navajo Reservation.

title: No Nudes Is Good Nudes
subtitle: An image of President Obama pointing at a nude portrait of Donald Trump was faked on multiple levels.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph captures President Obama pointing at a nude painting of Donald Trump.

title: Hillary Clinton Disbarred
subtitle: Hillary Clinton's license to practice law lapsed in 2002, but not because she was disbarred or otherwise sanctioned for professional misconduct.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton was disbarred and stripped of her license to practice law.

title: Purple Ladybugs
subtitle: A viral photograph of purple ladybugs native to Hawaii is just a creative digital coloring fabrication.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts rare purple ladybugs found only in Hawaii.

title: Alien Mummy Found, Scientists Baffled
subtitle: A mysterious alien mummy hasn't baffled scientists: the image of a human child mummy was embellished with Photoshop.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An "alien mummy" was recently unearthed in a pyramid, and scientists cannot explain its origins.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Pilot Taking a Selfie Out a Plane Window?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a pilot taking a selfie out his cockpit window is actually a composite of multiple images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a pilot taking a selfie out of a plane window.

title: Did Bumblebee Recall Tuna Contaminated with Human Remains?
subtitle: Claims that cans of Bumble Bee tuna are being recalled due to the discovery of human remains in the product are fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A recall was issued for Bumble Bee Tuna after human remains were found in the product.

title: Jim Morrison Found Alive in Paris Assisted Living Facility
subtitle: Fake news reports that the Doors singer, who passed away in 1971, has been found alive in a Paris retirement home.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Doors singer Jim Morrison has been found alive in a Paris retirement home.

title: Cruz and Rubio Tweet That They Will Not Support Donald Trump
subtitle: A screenshot purportedly showing anti-Trump tweets from Republicans Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio urged people to vote for a Democrat if Donald Trump wins the 2016 Republican presidential nomination.

title: Will Alabama Take Away Your Food Stamps If You Own a Car?
subtitle: An Alabama newspaper's assertion that a proposed bill would bar food stamp recipients from owning cars was widely repeated on blogs (but later corrected).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Republicans in Alabama filed a bill which (if passed) would prohibit people who owned cars from receiving food stamps.

title: 'Walking Dead' Star Andrew Lincoln's Father Wasn't a Survivor of the 1972 Andes Flight Disaster
subtitle: A meme falsely claims that "The Walking Dead" star's father was in a 1972 plane crash in the Andes mountains, and survived by eating the other passengers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Andrew Lincoln's father was in a 1972 plane crash in the Andes mountain and survived by eating the other passengers.

title: Floyd Mayweather Wore Hijab to Donald Trump Rally
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Mayweather wore a Muslim headscarf to a Trump rally and challenged people to fight.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Floyd Mayweather wore a Muslim headscarf to a Donald Trump rally.

title: Lawsuit from Uber Shooter Seeking $10M in Damages?
subtitle: The handwritten complaint was a hoax, according to local law enforcement officials.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Jason Brian Dalton, who as accused of killing six people during a shooting spree in February 2016, is suing Uber for $10 million in damages.

title: Harrison Ford Holding a Trump Sign?
subtitle: That photograph of Harrison Ford holding a Trump sign is fake.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Harrison Ford endorsed Donald Trump via a photograph in which he held up a campaign sign.

title: Texas Residents Forced to Pay Slavery Reparations?
subtitle: An unreliable web site falsely claimed that Texans were being forced to pay slavery reparations to black Americans.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A resolution passed in March 2016 forces residents of a Texas county to pay reparations to black citizens.

title: (Takes) Forever Stamps
subtitle: Letters using USPS "Forever Stamps" are not processed more slowly than mail with "regular" postage.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: USPS  "Forever Stamps" are considered "second-class mail," and items sent with those stamps are processed more slowly.

title: Citing Evangelical Faith, Ted Cruz Calls to Ban
Tritone
subtitle: A satirical article reported that Ted Cruz wants to ban the tritone interval in music due to its association with the devil.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz wants to ban the tritone interval in music due to its association with the devil.

title: Was Hillary Clinton Bribed for Her Iraq War Vote?
subtitle: During a March 2016 MSNBC Town Hall appearance, Hillary Clinton discussed her Iraq War vote, but she didn't suggest her vote was part of a political bribe.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton admitted her Iraq War vote was elicited in exchange for money provided by the Bush administration to help rebuild New York City after the 9/11 attacks.

title: FDA Banning E-Juice
subtitle: A fake news site claimed that the Food and Drug Administration banned nicotine-based "e-juice", sending vapers into a panic.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The FDA has banned all e-juice for electronic cigarettes, effective July 2016.

title: Charles Manson Endorses Trump
subtitle: Notorious criminal Charles Manson didn't endorse Donald Trump from his prison cell.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Notorious criminal Charles Manson has endorsed Donald Trump for president.

title: Bernie Sanders Responds to Critical Trump Tweet
subtitle: Bernie Sanders didn't tweet a scathing retort to Donald Trump after Trump insinuated Sanders' supporters were responsible for violence at Trump's rallies.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders tweeted a scathing retort to Donald Trump after the latter accused the former's supporters of inciting violence at Trump rallies.

title: Did UNESCO Declare India's 'Jana Gana Mana' the World's Best National Anthem?
subtitle: Reports that India's national anthem has been declared the "world's best" by UNESCO are an old hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: UNESCO declared India's national anthem, 'Jana Gana Mana,' to be the world's best.

title: Taco Cabana Sign Banning Trump Supporters Was a Prank
subtitle: A sign banning Donald Trump supporters was put up at a Taco Cabana restaurant, but this is not an official restaurant policy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Taco Cabana Restaurants have banned Donald Trump supporters

title: Donald Trump Protester Was Not ISIS Member
subtitle: A video claiming that a protester arrested at a Donald Trump rally was a member of ISIS is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video provides evidence that a protester who was arrested at a Donald Trump rally was a member of ISIS.

title: Black Trump Supporter Shot and Killed by Chicago Protesters
subtitle: Fake news reports that an African-American supporter of Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump  died after being shot at a chaotic Chicago rally.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A black supporter of Donald Trump was shot and killed by protesters in Chicago.

title: The United States Revokes Scientology's Tax-Exempt Status
subtitle: An article reporting that the Church of Scientology lost its tax-exempt status in March 2016 originated with fake news sites.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The Supreme Court revoked the Church of Scientology's tax-exempt status in March 2016.

title: Meg White Isn't the New Drummer for Rush
subtitle: The band says their drummer is retiring from touring, but rumors that White is replacing him came from a satire site.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Meg White is replacing Rush's drummer Neil Peart.

title: Vladimir Putin Did Not Endorse Bernie Sanders
subtitle: An old fake news item claiming Vladimir Putin endorsed Bernie Sanders circulated on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Russian President Vladimir Putin endorsed Sen. Bernie Sanders for President.

title: Bernie Sanders Gives Bank of America Speeches?
subtitle: A misleading web rumor claimed Bernie Sanders gave the same sort of highly-compensated speeches to Wall Street for which he criticized Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders has not released the transcripts for speeches he gave to major financial institutions, despite calling on Hillary Clinton to do so.

title: Did a Wendy's Employee Admit to
in Chili for Over 2 Years?
subtitle: "The fact that this happened was a shock to everybody at the restaurant."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Wendy's employee admitted that was putting his feces into the restaurant's chili.

title: Does This Video Show Secret Service Agents Training for 'Advanced Reverse Escapes'?
subtitle: A clip purportedly showing Secret Service agents training for "advanced reverse escapes" was actually taken from a video game.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Secret Service agents practicing for advanced reverse escapes at a racetrack.

title: Death Hoax: Adele Didn't Die in Car Crash
subtitle: A rumor (mostly pushed by YouTube commenters) claiming that the pop singer had died in a car crash circulated in March 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer Adele died in a car crash in March 2016.

title: A Woman Wasn't Murdered Over Candy Crush Requests
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that a woman murdered her roommate over requests to play Candy Crush.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman murdered her college roommate over too many Candy Crush requests.

title: Is This Ronald Reagan Meeting with Taliban Leaders at the White House?
subtitle: A photograph showing President Reagan with a group of men at the White House is frequently miscaptioned.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Ronald Reagan meeting with Taliban leaders in 1985 and comparing them to the founding fathers of the United States.

title: Bernie Sanders Not on Chicago Primary Ballot?
subtitle: A piece of campaign literature was mistaken for a proper ballot, propelling a rumor that Bernie Sanders was not listed as a presidential candidate in Chicago.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders was omitted from the Chicago primary ballot.

title: Metallica Singer James Hetfield Isn't 'Going Country'
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Metallica singer James Hetfield had left the band to pursue a career in country music.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer James Hetfield left the band Metallica and has announced a new country music album.

title: 'Make America White Again'
subtitle: A photograph of Donald Trump supporters wearing  "Make America White Again" shirts at a rally is an altered version of a less controversial picture.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph shows Donald Trump supporters wearing "Make America White Again" shirts at a rally.

title: 'The Notebook' Sequel Isn't in Production
subtitle: A series of hoax articles reported that "The Notebook 2" had started filming in various cities in the United States.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The movie 'The Notebook 2' has started filming in various US cities.

title: Is This Surfer Being Towed by a Shark?
subtitle: A video purportedly shows a surfer being towed by a great white shark.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a surfer being towed by a great white shark.

title: Obama Lowered Flags for Whitney Houston But Not Nancy Reagan
subtitle: President Obama didn't order flags lowered to half-staff to mark the death of singer Whitney Houston while declining to extend that honor to former first lady Nancy Reagan.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama ordered flags be flown at half-staff to mark the death of singer Whitney Houston, but he did not extend that honor to former first lady Nancy Reagan.

title: Chicken Nugget Murder Recall?
subtitle: There is no recall of chicken nuggets underway due to the discovery of human remains in a processing facility.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A massive recall of chicken nuggets is underway after authorities in Iowa found human remains in a meat processing facility.

title: Photo Doesn't Show Crowd Giving Obama the Nazi Salute
subtitle: A photograph of a crowd with their hands raised in front of Obama was circulated with misleading information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a crowd with their hands raised pledging allegiance to President Obama.

title: Bernie Sanders on Chemtrails?
subtitle: Bernie Sanders did not call for "chemtrail reform" during a campaign stop in Nevada.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders called for "chemtrail reform" during a campaign stop in Nevada.

title: Keanu Reeves 'Prostitutes' Quote
subtitle: A quote widely attributed to Keanu Reeves appeared to be from someone else entirely.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Keanu Reeves lamented the objectification of women in an uncharacteristic way.

title: Promo for New Netflix Series 'Home Improvementer' Is Fake
subtitle: A fake promotional image for a new Netflix original series called "Home Improvementer" was circulated online, but there are no plans to reboot the show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix released a promotional image for its upcoming series "Home Improvementer".

title: Donald Trump Tweets a Photo of His Private Parts?
subtitle: Despite rumors, Trump did not tweet out a photo of his genitals.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump tweeted an image of his genitals following penis-related banter at a Republican debate.

title: Collin County Serial Kidnapping Warning
subtitle: Police in Collin County, Texas were unaware of any "serial kidnappings" at Walmarts or Targets.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police in Collin County, Texas have quietly warned of serial kidnappings at local Target and Walmart locations.

title: Martin Shkreli Shot Dead?
subtitle: Martin Shkreli hasn't been shot and killed - the story came from fake news sites.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Contoversial pharmaceuticals trader Martin Shkreli was shot and killed.

title: Motorcycle Curfew in 11 States?
subtitle: A multi-state motorcycle curfew hasn't been signed into law effective in April 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Eleven states are implementing motorcycle curfews with stiff penalties for violators.

title: Photo Shows Ted Cruz With Fidel Castro?
subtitle: A photograph supposedly showing Ted Cruz hugging  former Cuban leader Fidel Castro was digitally manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz hugging Fidel Castro.

title: Fetuses Found in Chinese Restaurant Freezers?
subtitle: An old urban legend about Chinese food made from aborted fetuses or unwanted babies resurfaced, this time alongside a gruesome picture.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph depicts fetuses found in a Chinese food restaurant's freezer.

title: Fake Brady Campaign Ad Goes Viral on Facebook
subtitle: A fake ad purportedly from The Brady Campaign - a group working to end gun violence - was widely circulated on Facebook.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a real ad from The Brady Campaign urging citizens not to fight back against home intruders.

title: Did a Billionaire Use His Car as Collateral to Get Cheap Parking from a Bank?
subtitle: An old legend about a customer's getting cheap parking for his car by using it as bank collateral was shared as a "real" story about Vijay Mallya.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Billionaire Vijay Mallya found cheap parking in New York by using his expensive car as collateral for a loan.

title: That Super-Famous Celebrity Isn't Moving to Your Town
subtitle: A number of hoax posts on Facebook claimed renowned celebrities were moving to various small towns across America.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A well-known celebrity is moving to your town after briefly visiting and discovering "people were people," "whose sincerity you didn't have to question."

title: Is This a Newly Hatched Dragon?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing a baby dragon was circulated online.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a newly hatched baby dragon.

title: Is This a Waterslide Over Dubai?
subtitle: "Who would you slide with?"
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a waterslide in Dubai.

title: No, Copperhead Snakes Aren't Living Inside Fish Mouths
subtitle: An old photo showing a snake inside the mouth of a fish is being recirculated, this time with a fake message about copperhead snakes biting anglers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An official statement warns anglers about copperhead snakes living inside of fish.

title: FALSE: Photos of a 'Trampoline Bridge' Don't Show a Real Structure
subtitle: Photos of a "trampoline bridge" in Paris show a concept, not a real architectural structure.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a real trampoline bridge in Paris.

title: No, Cameron Diaz Wasn't Cast to Play Maya Angelou in a Biopic
subtitle: Reports that Cameron Diaz was cast to play Maya Angelou in an upcoming biopic originated from a satire article.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Cameron Diaz was cast to portray Maya Angelou in a new biographical film.

title: Bristol Palin Said All Black Actors Look Alike?
subtitle: Bristol Palin did not say that the Oscars lack diversity because all black actors look alike.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bristol Palin said all black actors look alike, making Oscar nominees difficult to diversify.

title: Coca-Cola Isn't Selling a 'Share a Coke with the KKK' Bottle
subtitle: Artwork from an online protest asking Coca-Cola not to sponsor the 2016 Republican National Convention led some to believe that the company actually sold a "KKK" bottle.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Coca-Cola's "Share A Coke" campaign includes a bottle for the KKK.

title: No, Donald Trump Didn't Tell Phil Donahue He Was an Atheist in 1989
subtitle: A meme that Trump told Phil Donahue that his high IQ makes it impossible for him to believe in God is based on a fake quote.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump told Phil Donahue that he was an atheist in 1989.

title: Did Donald Trump Transport Stranded Troops on His Own Airline?
subtitle: Donald Trump was never involved with Tower Air, nor could we find any evidence he ever transported stranded Gulf War soldiers.
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump personally sent out an airplane to bring home U.S. military members stranded in Florida.

title: No, Leonardo DiCaprio Isn't Moving to Woodstock, Illinois
subtitle: A viral article that claimed that Oscar winner Leonardo DiCaprio was moving to a suburban community in Illinois actually came from a fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Leonardo DiCaprio is moving to Woodstock, Illinois.

title: No, New York State Hasn't Legalized Heroin
subtitle: An article that reported that New York state had legalized heroin came from a satire site, but a proposal to allow addicts to use the drug under medical supervision may have confused the issue.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New York state has legalized heroin.

title: Donald Trump Pledged to Rename New Mexico?
subtitle: No, Donald Trump didn't say he would rename "New Mexico" in his first act as President.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump planned to rename New Mexico in his first act as President.

title: No, Rob Zombie Wasn't Kicked Out of the Oscars
subtitle: An article claimed that Rob Zombie was kicked out of the Academy Awards, but it originated from a satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rob Zombie was kicked out of the 88th Academy Awards.

title: Did the Nevada Gaming Commission Deny Trump a Casino License?
subtitle: We were unable to substantiate a claim that Donald Trump was denied a license by the Nevada Gaming Commission because he was not "trustworthy."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump's Las Vegas property is not a casino because the Nevada Gaming Commission refused Trump a gaming license and deemed him insufficiently "trustworthy."

title: Hillary Clinton Said Children Should Be Raised by the State?
subtitle: A fabricated quote from Hillary Clinton saying children should be "raised and trained" by the state originated with one of many sites dedicated to spreading misinformation about presidential candidates.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton said children should be raised and trained by the state, and parents should have only a secondary role.

title: Did a Retired Postman Father Over 1,300 Illegitimate Children?
subtitle: he told local reporters in his defense.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A DNA test proved that a retired postman fathered more than 1300 illegitimate children.

title: Video Shows Person Who Climbed Chicago's Bean?
subtitle: The video, which showed the "first person to climb the Bean," was almost convincing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows the first person to climb "the Bean" in Chicago.

title: Transcript for Hillary Clinton's Speech to Goldman Sachs Leaked?
subtitle: A circulating purported transcript of Hillary Clinton's first speech to Goldman Sachs was originally written as a satire piece.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The transcript of Hillary Clinton's speech to finance giant Goldman Sachs was leaked and published online.

title: Down to Lunch Human Trafficking Rumors
subtitle: A meetup app called "Down to Lunch" was described as linked to human trafficking by an unvetted and unverified review.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The app Down to Lunch is a covert tool for human trafficking.

title: Did Trump Say He'll Revoke U.S. Citizenship of All Puerto Ricans?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that he would revoke U.S. citizenship from all Puerto Ricans if elected president.

title: Did Ted Cruz Blame Gay People for Mass Shootings?
subtitle: The Texas senator supposedly asserted that no mass shootings took place when "gays stayed hidden."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz said no mass shootings took place when "gays stayed hidden."

title: Katy Perry Is JonBenet Ramsey?
subtitle: Internet conspiracy theorists claim that pop star Katy Perry is actually the murdered six-year-old, but their evidence doesn't hold up.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pop singer Katy Perry is actually JonBenet Ramsey, whose death was faked.

title: No, Sony Hasn't Announced Plans to Remake 'Mrs. Doubtfire' Starring Jonah Hill
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Sony Pictures was remaking the movie "Mrs. Doubtfire" with Jonah Hill.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sony Pictures has announced plans to remake the movie "Mrs. Doubtfire" with Jonah Hill.

title: Nancy Reagan Endorsed Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: A story that claimed that the former First Lady had endorsed Clinton as President originated from a "satire" news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former first lady Nancy Reagan has endorsed Hillary Clinton.

title: Sandra Day O'Connor Calls GOP 'Vile Obstructionists'?
subtitle: A poorly punctuated Facebook post led many people to believe that Sandra Day O'Connor had some extra-harsh words for the Republican party.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sandra Day O'Connor said that Republicans were a "vile, petulant, hateful, passel of obstructionists."

title: Does This Video Shows Giraffes Jumping Off a High Dive?
subtitle: Giraffe-diving is not yet an Olympic sport.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of giraffes trained to jump from a high dive.

title: Are There Worms in Lipton Tea Bags?
subtitle: The substance seen in a viral Facebook video in Lipton tea bags isn't worm-based, it's lemon flavoring.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: There are small worms in bags of Lipton tea.

title: Obama Signs Executive Order to Replace Supreme Court Justice Scalia?
subtitle: A story that President Obama had chosen Rashad Hussain to replace Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court came from a clickbait fake news site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama signed an executive order to replace Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia with Rashad Hussain.

title: Photograph Shows Endangered Fennec Hare?
subtitle: The "fennec hare," while adorable, isn't endangered - because it doesn't exist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photo shows an endangered fennec hare.

title: The SPLC Has Not Labeled the Republican Party a Hate Group
subtitle: The anti-discrimination group does caution that polarization and extremism is on the rise, in some cases due to political rhetoric.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Southern Poverty Law Center has officially labeled the Republican party a hate group.

title: Marco Rubio on Zika and Abortion?
subtitle: Marco Rubio did not state that Zika-linked birth defects were a punishment from God, nor that abortion was an attempt to evade that judgment.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Marco Rubio described Zika-linked birth defects as God's punishment of a mother, and abortion as an unacceptable evasion of that judgment.

title: Internet Celebrity Daniel Lara Wasn't Mugged for His Shoes
subtitle: A fake news article claimed Lara, who goes by "Damn Daniel" on Vine, had been robbed for his signature Vans.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Internet celebrity "Damn Daniel" was mugged and robbed of his shoes.

title: Trump Tower Chicago 'No' Pic
subtitle: A photograph that appeared to show the residents of Chicago's Trump Tower objecting to his campaign was digitally altered.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Residents of Trump Tower Chicago demonstrated their disdain for Donald Trump via a clever display of lights.

title: Bernie Sanders Supporters Chant 'English Only' at Dolores Huerta in Nevada?
subtitle: Activist Dolores Huerta sent a tweet claiming Bernie Sanders supporters shouted 'English only' at her, but witnesses gave conflicting accounts.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Supporters of Bernie Sanders shouted "English only" at civil rights activist Dolores Huerta during one Nevada caucus event, ostensibly objecting to a translation of remarks into Spanish.

title: Was a Nazi Submarine Found in the Great Lakes?
subtitle: Who knows just what's lurking at the bottom of Lake Ontario?
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A Nazi submarine mysteriously surfaced in Lake Ontario.

title: Sharpie Anniversary Giveaway Scam
subtitle: Sharpie isn't giving away a giant set of markers to celebrate their anniversary -- the offer is another online survey scam.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sharpie is giving a giant set of markers to all Facebook users who follow a short series of steps.

title: Papa John's Won't Share 'Excessive Profits' with Employees?
subtitle: A fictitious quote about the pizza chain's earnings was attributed to Papa John's CEO John Schnatter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Papa John's CEO John Schnatter said that he has no obligation to share "excessive profits" with his employees.

title: 80 Percent of Black Men in Atlanta are Gay?
subtitle: A fake news item claimed a study indicated 80 percent of black men in Atlanta were homosexual.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A study found that 80 percent of black men in Georgia were homosexual.

title: Ted Cruz to Replace Constitution with Bible?
subtitle: An article reported that Ted Cruz would replace the Constitution with the Bible if he gets elected President, but it originated from a satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz will replace the Constitution with the Bible if he's elected President.

title: Earth in a 'Cradle of Clouds'
subtitle: A supposed Hubble Telescope photograph of Earth within a "cradle of clouds" is actually an artwork.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photo taken by the Hubble Telescope shows the earth in a "cradle of clouds."

title: Did a Woman Set a World Record with 14 Kids from 14 Fathers?
subtitle: The story of a woman who had 14 children from 14 fathers originated with clickbait sites that specialize in fake news, and was illustrated with stolen photos.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman set a Guinness World Record for having 14 kids with 14 different fathers.

title: 'Lame Duck' Supreme Court Clause
subtitle: There is no Article III, Section 4 "lame duck" Constitutional clause prohibiting President Obama from appointing a Scalia replacement.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Article III, Section 4 of the Constitution holds a "lame duck ... candidate" cannot seek to fill a Supreme Court vacancy.

title: Did 'Django Unchained' Feature a Real Onscreen Death?
subtitle: A Facebook meme claimed that actor Ato Essandoh was really killed by dogs while cameras rolled for authenticity's sake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Ato Essandoh was killed during the filming of 'Django Unchained.'

title: USPS Did Not Issue Bernie Sanders Forever Stamps
subtitle: While there is an envelope featuring the likeness of Bernie Sanders, the United States Postal Service has not issued a forever stamp endorsing the Democratic candidate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The United States Postal Service issued a "forever stamp" featuring Bernie Sanders.

title: Donald Trump Bashes Jesus, Says He Can Save America?
subtitle: An article reporting that Donald Trump had badmouthed Jesus originated from a satire site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump bashed Jesus, saying that he could save America without some "silly cross."

title: '7D' Whale Hologram
subtitle: A video purportedly shows a "7D hologram" virtual whale splashing through a school gym floor, but it's a promotional video showcasing Magic Leap technology.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a "7D Hologram" of a whale inside a school gymnasium.

title: Mitch McConnell Will Only Consider a White, Christian, Conservative, and Male Supreme Court Judge?
subtitle: A fake news story claimed that Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell will only consider approving a Supreme Court Justice who is white, Christian, conservative, and male.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mitch McConnell will only consider approving Supreme Court Justice who is white, Christian, conservative, and male.

title: Vladimir Putin Didn't Call Obama an Idiot for Socialist Policies
subtitle: A years-old fake quote from Vladimir Putin started recirculating on the internet for some reason in February 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Vladimir Putin called President Obama an idiot for touting socialist policies.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Give 20% of United States' Uranium to Russia in Exchange for Clinton Foundation Donations?
subtitle: Allegations of a "quid pro quo" deal giving Russia ownership of one-fifth of U.S. uranium deposits in exchange for $145 million in donations to the Clinton Foundation are unsubstantiated.
author: David Emery
statement: Sec. of State Hillary Clinton's approval of a deal to transfer control of 20% of U.S. uranium deposits to a Russian company was a quid pro quo exchange for donations to the Clinton Foundation.

title: Alabama Lawmaker Wants Food Stamp 'Hunger Tests'?
subtitle: No, a Republican politician didn't propose saliva-based "hunger tests" prior to issuing food stamps.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Republican lawmaker proposed introducing "hunger tests" before issuing food stamps.

title: Kim Kardashian Didn't Wear a Dog Fur Coat
subtitle: A Facebook user claimed that the reality star wore a coat made out of dog fur to Kanye West's fashion show, but later admitted they had made it up.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kim Kardashian wore a coat made from "South Russian Ovcharka dogs" to Kanye West's fashion show.

title: Was a Man Kicked Out of Golden Corral After Eating More Than 50 Lbs. of Food?
subtitle: 'Despite the fact that the restaurant advertised the buffet as
, the manager of the establishment seems to have  lost patience at some point.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An obese man is suing Golden Corral because he was kicked out after spending seven hours at their buffet.

title: 8 Mile Sequel Confirmed for December 2016?
subtitle: A fake news site caused a stir by claiming that '8 Mile 2' would be released in December 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Eminem biopic '8 Mile' will return with a sequel in late 2016.

title: No, Ted Cruz Did Not Threaten to Deport Beyonce
subtitle: An image of a tweet ostensibly sent by Ted Cruz about deporting the singer over her Super Bowl performance was shared on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz threatened on Twitter to deport Beyonce due to her performance at Super Bowl 50.

title: Did Bernie Sanders Dodge the Draft?
subtitle: Bernie Sanders applied for conscientious objector status during the Vietnam War draft, but he was too old to be drafted when his number came up.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders dodged the draft during the Vietnam War era.

title: No, Will Smith Hasn't Bought BET
subtitle: A "satire" news article reported that Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith had purchased the BET channel.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith have purchased the BET channel.

title: Ted Cruz Didn't Say He Was Skeptical About the Timing of Scalia's Death
subtitle: While the Supreme Court Justice's death has prompted discussions and conspiracy theories, this story came from a site that specializes in fake news.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz said that he was skeptical about the timing of Justice Scalia's death.

title: Did Canada 'Ban Beyonce' Over Her Super Bowl Performance?
subtitle: Singer Beyonce has not been banned from entering or performing in Canada based on her 2016 Super Bowl halftime performance.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Beyonce has not been banned from performing in Canada based on her 2016 Super Bowl halftime performance.

title: Is the Russian Army Using Exosuits?
subtitle: A viral image purportedly shows two Russian soldiers wearing "exosuits" in Syria.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Russian soldiers wearing "exosuits" in Syria.

title: Mark Cuban Said Fact-Checking Millennials Will Vote for Democrats?
subtitle: A meme incorrectly attributing a quote to Mark Cuban went viral on Facebook.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mark Cuban said that Millennials will probably vote for a Democrat in 2016, "because they fact-check everything."

title: Did Joe Biden Say 'No Ordinary American Cares About Their Constitutional Rights'?
subtitle: An absurd claim  about a Joe Biden statement features a distorted version of his actual words.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Vice President Joe Biden said that 'no ordinary American cares about their constitutional rights.'

title: Apple's Blast from the Past?
subtitle: Setting your iPhone's date to 1 January 1970 won't bring up a cool new theme; it'll just potentially break your device.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Setting your Apple device's date to 1 January 1970 will reveal a retro-themed Easter egg.

title: Solar Panels Don't Drain the Sun of Energy
subtitle: An intendedly humorous meme claims that the use of solar panels drains the sun of energy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The user of solar panels drains the sun of energy.

title: Smithsonian Employee Arrested for Mummy Sex Act?
subtitle: No, a Smithsonian employee wasn't arrested for "raping" a 2,500 year old mummy.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Smithsonian employee was arrested for "raping" a mummy.

title: Did Police Find a Satanic Ritual Dungeon in Chuck E. Cheese Basement?
subtitle: Chuck E. Cheese basements hold nothing but old pizza boxes, really.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police discovered human remains in a Satanic dungeon under a Chuck E. Cheese.

title: Can You Unlock Your Car Door with a Tennis Ball?
subtitle: If opening locked cars were this easy, no vehicle would be secure.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can unlock your car door using a tennis ball.

title: Heavy Metal Legends Megadeth to Play for Bernie Sanders?
subtitle: A spoof news article reported that the thrash metal group Megadeth was set to play at a Bernie Sanders rally.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The band Megadeth is set to play a rally for Bernie Sanders.

title: Did Bernie Sanders Supporters Get SS Tattoos?
subtitle: A Vermont parlor provided free tattoos to Bernie Sanders supporters, but those tattoos did not include the Nazi "SS" symbol.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Backers of Bernie Sanders have obtained Nazi SS "lightning bolt" tattoos to show support for the Democratic presidential candidate.

title: Did an MH370 Pilot Mysteriously Resurface Two Years Later?
subtitle: The pilot of long-missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is also still missing, not a patient in a Taiwanese hospital.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The pilot of missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 reappeared in Taiwan two years after the plane disappeared.

title: Is the Levi's Logo Racist?
subtitle: A social media post claimed Levi's jeans' "two horse" logo was a racist symbol representing a slave's being killed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Levi's jeans' famous "two horse" logo represents a slave's being killed.

title: McDonald's 'New Policy' Bans Customers from Buying Food for the Homeless?
subtitle: Two incidents at one McDonald's were spun into a claim that the chain has implemented a new policy barring customers from buying food for the homeless.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The McDonald's fast food chain has implemented a policy barring their customers from buying food for homeless people.

title: Is This a Military Pilot's Selfie Taken During a Stadium Flyover?
subtitle: A claimant for the title of "greatest selfie ever taken."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a pilot taking a selfie over a football stadium.

title: Cam Newton Arrested for Fixing Super Bowl?
subtitle: Fake news reports the QB of the Carolina Panthers was arrested for "fixing" a Super Bowl game and betting against his team.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Carolina Panthers quarterbacl Cam Newton was arrested for "fixing" Super Bowl 50.

title: Hillary Clinton Sat on the Monsanto Board?
subtitle: Hillary Clinton never sat on Monsanto's board of directors, nor does she maintain any known fundraising ties with the agribusiness giant.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton is (or was) a member of Monsanto's board of directors.

title: Ted Cruz: 'Businesses Should Turn Away Gay Customers'?
subtitle: Another fake quote, this one about businesses having a 'right' to turn away gay customers, has been attributed to Senator Ted Cruz.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator Ted Cruz said that businesses should exercise their right to turn away gay customers.

title: Mother Teresa at 18
subtitle: A viral photograph does not actually show famous Roman Catholic missionary Mother Teresa at age 18.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Mother Teresa at age 18.

title: Photograph Doesn't Show Bernie and Jane Sanders at an LGBT March
subtitle: An image from the movie 'The Rocky Horror Picture Show' is being shared as a photograph Bernie and Jane Sanders at a 1975 LGBT march.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Bernie and Jane Sanders at an LGBT march in 1975.

title: Is This Donald Trump's Cousin's Obituary?
subtitle: A purported obituary from Donald Trump's recently-deceased cousin implored the public not to vote for the GOP presidential contender.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's recently-deceased cousin implored the public in his obituary not to vote for the GOP presidential contender.

title: Siberian Tigers Stalk Firefighter in Washington Cascades
subtitle: A satirical Facebook group shared a photograph purportedly showing a pair of Siberian tigers stalking a firefighter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two Siberian tigers stalking a firefighter in the Washington Cascades.

title: U.S. Constitution: Article 1, Section 8, Clause 17
subtitle: The U.S. Constitution doesn't prevent the federal government from holding the title "to any real property" without state consent.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution holds that "the Federal Government shall never own title to any real property which is not specifically authorized by this Constitution such as parks, forests, dams, waterways, and grazing areas without the consent of the State where same is located."

title: Iceland Forgives Entire Population of Its Debt?
subtitle: An old and misleading report about how Iceland supposedly eliminated its entire population's mortgage debt recirculated in 2016.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Iceland forgave the entire mortgage debt of its population, and a "media blackout" prevented Americans from learning about it.

title: President Obama Removes 'God' from Pledge of Allegiance?
subtitle: A fake news article reported that President Obama had removed the phrase 'under God' from the Pledge of Allegiance and banned its use in all government buildings.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama has ordered the phrase "under God" to be removed from the Pledge of Allegiance.

title: Trump Calls for Deportation of All Women with Blonde Hair, Blue Eyes?
subtitle: Spoof news reported GOP candidate Donald Trump's supposed initiative to
by deporting all women who have blonde hair and blue eyes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump has proposed the deportation of all women who have blonde hair and blue eyes.

title: Obama Demanded This Admiral Stop Giving Out Bibles?
subtitle: President Obama didn't demand an admiral stop giving out Bibles; such claims are based on a 2013 controversy unrelated to the Commander-in-Chief.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: President Obama demanded that an admiral stop distributing Bibles.

title: Couple High on Meth Eats Homeless Man?
subtitle: A story about meth-addled cannibals came from a site that specializes in secondhand fake news.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A couple on crystal meth ate parts of a homeless person.

title: Bill Murray Didn't Say You Can Always Trust a Dog but Not a Human
subtitle: A fake quote attributed to Bill Murray about trusting dogs instead of humans is frequently shared on the internet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Murray said that you can always trust a dog but not a human.

title: Bernie Sanders Wants to 'Dethrone God' and Destroy Capitalism?
subtitle: A fake image purportedly showing a tweet from Senator Bernie Sanders claims that the senator wants to "dethrone God."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Senator Bernie Sanders wrote on Twitter that he wanted to destroy capitalism and "dethrone God."

title: 'Brady Bunch' Actor Barry Williams Was Not Shot Dead By Police
subtitle: A fake news item claimed that actor Barry Williams was shot dead during a manhunt for a serial killer.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Barry Williams, who played Greg Brady on 'The Brady Bunch,' was shot and killed by police officers in California.

title: Black Student Only Dorm at UConn?
subtitle: The University of Connecticut isn't building a new dorm for black students only.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The University of Connecticut (UConn) is constructing a dormitory solely to house black students.

title: Drug Kingpin Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman Escapes Mexican Prison Once Again
subtitle: Fake news article reports that drug lord Joaquin Guzman has escaped from a Mexican prison for the third time.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Drug lord Joaquin Guzman escaped from a Mexican prison for the third time.

title: Donald Trump Didn't Pay Sarah Palin for Her Endorsement
subtitle: An online rumor claimed that presidential candidate Donald Trump paid Sarah Palin $10 million for her endorsement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump paid Sarah Palin $10 million for her endorsement.

title: FALSE: Ted Cruz Said There Is 'No Place for Gays' in America
subtitle: Ted Cruz never said that there is "no place for gays or atheists in my America."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz said that there was 'no place for gays in my America.'

title: President Obama Signs Executive Order Limiting US Gun Owners to Three Guns
subtitle: Fake news article reports that President Obama implemented an unconstitutional gun control measure by executive order.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama has signed as executive order limiting Americans to ownership of three guns each.

title: Delta First Class Gift Boxes Scam
subtitle: Facebook-based scam claims Delta Air Lines is giving away free boxes with first-class air travel tickets and $10,000 in cash to those who follow online links.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Delta Air Lines Delta is giving away free boxes with first-class air travel tickets and $10,000 in cash to those who follow online links.

title: FALSE: Steven Avery, 53, Found Unresponsive in His Prison Cell
subtitle: Fake news reports that the subject  of the Netflix documentary 'Making a Murderer' has suffered a severe medical setback.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 'Making a Murderer' subject Steven Avery was found unresponsive in his prison cell.

title: Were Muslims Banned from the U.S. in 1952?
subtitle: Muslims are not barred from entering or immigrating to the United States under the provisions of the 1952 Immigration and Nationality Act, or U.S. Code  1182.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Muslims were banned from immigrating to the United States in 1952 under the provisions of the Immigration and Nationality Act.

title: Teletubby Lake Is Not Real
subtitle: A purported image of 'Teletubby Lake' is a digital manipulation created for a Photoshop contest, not a real photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a lake that resembles a Teletubby character.

title: FALSE: Pediatricians' Association Admits HPV Vaccine-Cancer Link
subtitle: A misleading article claimed that an association of pediatricians had "admitted" a link between the human papillomavirus vaccine Gardasil and ovarian "failure" or cancer.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An association of pediatricians "admitted" that HPV vaccine Gardasil causes ovarian "failure" or cancer.

title: FALSE: Eritrean Men Are Being Forced to Marry Multiple Women
subtitle: A news article reporting that men in Eritrea were being forced into polygamy to raise the country's birthrate was a hoax.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Due to a shortage or men, the Eritrean government has made it mandatory for men to take at least two wives.

title: Is This Donald Trump's Father with Mao Zedong?
subtitle: Politics does sometimes make for strange bedfellows.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump's father posing with Chinese revolutionary Mao Zedong.

title: Must Citizens Who Want to Receive Government Benefits Agree to Be Microchipped?
subtitle: RFID microchips have many uses, but requiring their surgical implantation for receipt of government benefits is not on the horizon.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: U.S. citizens who receive government benefits will soon be required to have microchips surgically implanted in them.

title: 'Be Like Bill' Spreads Malware?
subtitle: The "Be Like Bill" Facebook trend has annoyed some social media users, but there are no credible reports of its behaving maliciously.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The "Be Like Bill" Facebook craze exposes users to malware and/or was borne of nefarious intent.

title: Did a New York Artist Create Invisible 'Art'?
subtitle: A report about a New York artist named Lana Newstrom who creates "invisible art" was a CBC public radio spoof.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A New York artist named Lana Newstrom creates and sells "invisible art."

title: FALSE: Illegal for Flint Residents to Sell Homes
subtitle: The Flint water crisis led to a number of rumors, but claims that selling homes in Flint was illegal weren't substantiated by anything other than anecdotes.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Residents of Flint, Michigan, are legally prohibited from selling their homes and moving away due to the ongoing water crisis.

title: FALSE: Saudi Billionaire Begins Construction of 'Western Mecca' in Wyoming
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that the billionaire had purchased the tiny town of Buford.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Saudi billionaire purchased Buford, Wyoming and is planning on constructing a western Mecca.

title: FALSE: Donald Trump Announces Sheriff Joe Arpaio As His VP Running Mate
subtitle: A fake news article reported that Donald Trump had named Sheriff Joe Arpaio his running mate for the 2016 election.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sheriff Joe Arpaio has been named as Donald Trump's running mate.

title: Are Left-Handed People Now Eligible for Disability?
subtitle: Reports that left-handed handed people are eligible to collect disability benefits due to the "Justice for Dexterously Challenged Act" are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Left-handed people are now eligible for disability benefits under the "Justice for Dexterously Challenged Act."

title: Flint Residents Told That Their Children Could Be Taken Away If They Don't Pay for City's Poison Water?
subtitle: An article claims that CPS threatened to remove children affected by the Flint water crisis from their homes if families refused to pay for lead-contaminated water.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Residents of Flint, Michigan have been threatened by CPS with removal of their children if they refuse to pay for contaminated water.

title: FALSE: Justin Trudeau Bans Donald Trump from Entering Canada
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Canadian prime minister justin Trudeau had banned Donald Trump from entering Canada.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump has been banned from entering Canada.

title: Knock and Slash Car Warning
subtitle: Car thieves seeking directions from unsuspecting motorists have not effected a rash of face-slashings using name cards.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Drivers should be on the lookout for face-slashing car thieves posing as individuals seeking directions.

title: Were U.S. Students Forced to Praise Allah?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing U.S. students praying at a mosque as part of the Common Core curriculum was actually taken in the Netherlands.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of American students being forced to pray to Allah at a mosque as part of their Common Core curriculum.

title: FALSE: Cosplay to Be Outlawed in Five States
subtitle: An entertainment satire site's claim that cosplay was to be made illegal in five states was mistaken by many enthusiasts for genuine news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Cosplay has been made illegal in five states.

title: Does the Nagapushpa Flower Bloom Every 36 Years?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a rare blooming "Nagapushpa flower" actually depicts a type of marine invertebrate known as a sea pen.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a rare Nagapushpa flower that blooms only once every 36 years.

title: FALSE: Trump Supporters Misspelled His Name with Shirts
subtitle: A photograph showing Trump supporters spelling out "T-R-M-U-P" on their shirts is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A group of Trump supporters misspelled the candidate's name on their shirts.

title: FALSE: Lifetime Passes for Free Fast Food
subtitle: Popular fast food outlets aren't giving away free lifetime passes to celebrate their anniversaries.  Such offers are survey scams.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: KFC and McDonald's are giving away free lifetime passes to Facebook users who like and share a post.

title: FALSE: Photograph Shows Amy Winehouse with Lana Del Rey
subtitle: A photograph showing Amy Winehouse and Lana Del Rey together is a composite of two separate images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Amy Winehouse and Lana Del Rey hanging out together.

title: FALSE: George Zimmerman Found Dead
subtitle: George Zimmerman was not found dead after he posted images of Trayvon Martin's body on Twitter.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: George Zimmerman was found dead in January 2016, several months after a Twitter controversy involving photographs of Trayvon Martin's body.

title: 'Pretty Woman' Sequel a Hoax
subtitle: Richard Gere is not connected to a Facebook fan page that promises a "Pretty Woman" sequel is in the works if it receives an appropriate number of "likes."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Richard Gere will make a sequel to "Pretty Woman" if his Facebook photo gets more than 1 million likes.

title: Did a Teenaged Customer Argue with a Muslim Cashier Over His Cross Necklace?
subtitle: A viral story related a cross-related confrontation involving a 17-year-old boy in St. Cloud, Minnesota.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 17-year-old St. Cloud boy argued with a Muslim woman over his cross necklace at a Walmart or Scheels store.

title: 'Darkwing Duck' April Fool's Day Joke Recirculates
subtitle: The animated show 'Darkwing Duck' will not be returning to television as of January 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The animated show Darkwing Duck will return to television in 2018.

title: Bernie Sanders Marched with MLK at Selma?
subtitle: A photograph doesn't show Bernie Sanders marching from Selma to Montgomery in 1965 with Martin Luther King, Jr.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Bernie Sanders at a 1965 civil rights march with Martin Luther King, Jr.

title: Rock Legend Animal Is Not Dead
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that rock legend (and Muppet) Animal had passed away.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Muppet drummer Animal passed away at 66.

title: Do Girl Scout Cookie Proceeds Fund Planned Parenthood?
subtitle: The claim that Girl Scout Cookie sales fund Planned Parenthood became popular in mid-2015 and early 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The proceeds of Girl Scout Cookies are used to support Planned Parenthood.

title: Did Abraham Lincoln Meet Edgar Allan Poe?
subtitle: A photograph showing Abraham Lincoln with author Edgar Allan Poe imagines a fascinating rendezvous.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Abraham posing with author Edgar Allan Poe.

title: FALSE: McDonald's Parasitic Worm Outbreak Linked Back to Ground
in Patties
subtitle: Fake news sites utilized an old urban legend for a story linking an outbreak of parasitic worms to the use of "worm filler" in McDonald's hamburger meat.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The CDC linked a parasitic worm outbreak to the use of "worm filler" in McDonald's beef patties.

title: Super Moon, Perfectly Timed
subtitle: Take a closer look at this ethereal photograph showing a "super moon" perched atop a radio telescope.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a "super moon" resting atop a radio telescope.

title: A Red Fox Doesn't Scream When It Finds Its Soulmate
subtitle: A Tumblr meme incorrectly suggests that the red fox screams when it finds its perfect mate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The red fox will scream when it finds its perfect mate.

title: 'First Letter of the Alphabet' Question Didn't Appear on 'Millionaire'
subtitle: A popular photograph purportedly showing a hapless 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire' contestant is actually from a sketch comedy show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photograph shows a 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire' contestant being asked to identify the first letter of the alphabet.

title: No, Keith Richards Is Not Dead
subtitle: A confusing title from a fake news article led some people to believe that Keith Richards had passed away.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richards passed away in January 2016.

title: FALSE: Donald Trump Said He Would Deport All Nigerians
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Donald Trump would deport all Nigerians if he were elected president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that he will deport all Nigerians if he gets elected president.

title: FALSE: Metallica Sues 8th Grader Over Hand-Drawn Logo on Notebook
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that the band Metallica filed a lawsuit against an 8th-grader  for drawing the band's logo on his notebook.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Metallica sued an 8th-grade student for drawing the band's logo on his notebook.

title: FALSE: Military Widow Comes Forward with Winning Powerball Ticket in Florida
subtitle: We don't know who the Florida Powerball winner is yet, but it's not a 32-year-old military widow named  Candice Withers.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Florida Powerball winner is a 32-year-old military widow named  Candice Withers.

title: FALSE: Winner of 1.5B Powerball Jackpot Dies of Cocaine Overdose
subtitle: Another Powerball-related fake news story claims one "lucky" winner was found dead with a kilo of cocaine.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: One of the winners who shared the $1.5 billion Powerball jackpot succumbed within days to a cocaine overdose.

title: John and Lisa Robinson Powerball Giveaway Hoax
subtitle: A new Facebook hoax claims that Powerball winners John and Lisa Robinson are giving away their money on Facebook.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Powerball winners John and Lisa are giving away money on Facebook.

title: Scarface Remake Starring Leonardo DiCaprio?
subtitle: No, 'Scarface' is not being remade with Leonardo DiCaprio cast as Tony Montana.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 'Scarface' is being remade with Leonardo DiCaprio cast as Tony Montana.

title: Pat Robertson Says David Bowie Isn't Dead?
subtitle: Pat Robertson didn't suggest David Bowie wasn't really dead, or that "demons kidnapped him to entertain them in Hell."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pat Robertson claimed David Bowie wasn't dead, but instead that "demons kidnapped him to entertain them in Hell."

title: Did Hillary Clinton Wear Blackface at a Costume Party?
subtitle: A photograph showing a woman in blackface and a man dressed as a hillbilly is not a picture of Bill and Hillary Clinton.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Hillary Clinton in blackface and Bill Clinton dressed as a hillbilly.

title: Joint Chiefs of Staff Flip Obama Off During SOTU?
subtitle: No, this photo doesn't depict the Joint Chiefs of Staff giving President Obama the finger during the State of the Union address.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photo depicts the Joint Chiefs of Staff giving President Obama the finger during the State of the Union address.

title: FALSE: 79-Year-Old Bird Watcher Takes Down Oregon Militant
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that an elderly birdwatcher had a physical confrontation with an Oregon militant at the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An elderly birdwatcher had a physical altercation with an Oregon militant at the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge.

title: Photo Does Not Show Baby Great White Shark
subtitle: A photograph showing a "baby great white shark" actually shows a salmon shark.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a baby great white shark.

title: The Lying Game
subtitle: Numerous people on social media are falsely claiming that they won the $1.6 Powerball lottery jackpot.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The three winners of the $1.6 Powerball lottery have identified themselves on social media.

title: Alan Rickman Rocking Chair Meme
subtitle: A quote falsely attributed to Alan Rickman about the Harry Potter series became popular on social media after his death.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Alan Rickman stated he envisioned sitting in a rocking chair at 80, reading 'Harry Potter' books to his grandchildren.

title: FALSE: Hedge Fund Manager Jared Price Won $1.6 Billion Powerball
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that a hedge fund manager named Jared Price won the $1.6 billion Powerball.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A hedge fund manager named Jared Price won the $1.6 billion Powerball lottery.

title: The Queen of England Promises to 'Take Back' America If Trump Is Elected
subtitle: The Queen of England has not issued a promise to her subjects that she will invade the United States of America if Donald J. Trump is elected President.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Queen Elizabeth said that she would "take America back" if Donald Trump gets elected president.

title: Was a Florida Man Emasculated During a Pit Bull Sex Assault?
subtitle: Teports that a pit bull tore off a man's genitals when he attempted to engage in sex with the canine are fake news.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Florida man was emasculated during an attempt to engage in sexual relations with a pit bull.

title: FALSE: Photograph Shows Bowie and Lemmy
subtitle: An image featuring David Bowie and Lemmy is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows musicians David Bowie and Lemmy Kilmister together at a party.

title: Kim Davis Seated Next to Gay Couples at SOTU?
subtitle: No, President Obama didn't seat Kim Davis next to several same-sex couples at the State of the Union address.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Kentucky county clerk Kim Davis was seated amongst several same-sex couples at 2016's "State of the Union" address.

title: FALSE: Sean Penn Found Dead
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that the actor had been murdered, possibly by El Chapo henchmen.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Actor Sean Penn was killed in January 2016.

title: Pentagon Spends $10 Million on Powerball Tickets?
subtitle: The humor in a satirical item about the Pentagon's purchase of five million Powerball tickets confused some readers unfamiliar with 'Duffel Blog.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Pentagon purchased five million Powerball tickets at a cost of $10 million so they could buy more F-35s if they won.

title: Former 'Full House' Star Ashley Olsen Is Not Dead
subtitle: Many assumed that "Full House" star Ashley Olsen had died after hearing that another woman named Ashley Olsen was murdered in Italy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former "Full House" star Ashley Olsen was murdered.

title: FALSE: The Lottery Has Been Cancelled
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that officials had rigged the $1.5 billion Powerball Lottery and that the game had been cancelled.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A $1.5 billion powerball lottery drawing scheduled for 13 January 2016 has been cancelled.

title: No, Cargo Ships Have Not Stopped Traveling in the Atlantic Ocean
subtitle: A misunderstanding of an AIS map led many people to believe that cargo ships had stopped traveling in the Atlantic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: For the first time in history the North Atlantic is empty of cargo ships in-transit.

title: Fabian Suarez #WasteHisTime Murder
subtitle: No, a man didn't murder a woman who tormented him because she was inspired by the #WasteHisTime2016 Twitter hashtag.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Denver man murdered a woman whose behavior was inspired by the #WasteHisTime hashtag on Twitter.

title: FALSE: 'Booty Tickler' Arrested in Texas
subtitle: A fake news story claimed that a "booty tickler" was arrested in Texas, but of course nothing about the story is true.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man known as "the booty tickler" was arrested in Texas.

title: Does a Billboard in Finland Promote Rape by Refugees?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a billboard in Finland that condones rape is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A billboard in Finland states that it is legal for refugees to rape women.

title: Powerball Wealth Sharing Meme
subtitle: If a $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot were shared with every American, we'd all get about four bucks each.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: If a $1.3 billion dollar Powerball jackpot were shared with every American, we'd all get $4 million each.

title: Adolf Hitler on How to 'Take Control Over a People'
subtitle: The German dictator didn't say that the best way to control a people is to "take a little of their freedom at a time."  He didn't even practice that advice himself.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Adolf Hitler said that the best way to control a people is to "take a little of their freedom at a time."

title: FALSE: Admiral Fired for Exposing Obama's Dubai Mansion Purchase
subtitle: In January 2016, Rear Admiral Rick Williams was relieved of command; however, that action had nothing to do with any presidential real estate scouting in Dubai.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama fired Rear Admiral Rick Williams for "questioning" the President's purported recent purchase of a mansion in Dubai.

title: FALSE: CNN Host Fareed Zakaria calls for Jihad Rape of White Women
subtitle: Fake news reports that CNN host Fareed Zakaria posted a blog entry calling for white women to be raped by Islamic minority groups.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: CNN host Fareed Zakaria posted a blog entry calling for white women to be raped by Islamic minority groups.

title: Delaware Child Support Card
subtitle: A fake news story about a new Delaware "Child Support Card" hit the online world in January 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Delaware has issued a new "child support card" that cannot be used to purchase items such as alcohol or cigarettes.

title: FALSE: UFO Over CERN
subtitle: A fake video purportedly shows a UFO portal opening above CERN.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A UFO portal was filmed over the Large Hadron Collider.

title: Did Janet Reno Advocate the Prohibition of Private Firearms?
subtitle: Although Janet Reno spoke at length about guns in December 1993, a controversial quote attributed to her on the subject was fabricated.
author: Kim LaCapria

title: FALSE: Bill Clinton Told Tony Blair He Likes to Punch Slabs of Ham
subtitle: A comedian created a fake transcript of a conversation between Tony Blair and Bill Clinton.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Clinton told Tony Blair that he likes to punch slabs of ham.

title: Great Lakes Crossing Human Trafficking Rumor
subtitle: Police in Auburn Hills, Michigan investigated claims that human traffickers were targeting young girls near a Michigan movie theater and found them to be "completely false."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Human traffickers are targeting young girls near the Great Lakes Crossing theater with a powdered drug that incapacitates them.

title: Doctors Kill More People Than Guns?
subtitle: No, a study didn't prove doctors are more deadly than guns.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A study proved you're thousands of times more likely to be killed by a doctor than a gun in the United States.

title: Did George Washington Want Citizens Armed Against the Government?
subtitle: Founding Father George Washington supposedly said that a free people need "sufficient arms and ammunition to maintain a status of independence" from their own government.
author: Dan Evon
statement: George Washington said that a free people need "sufficient arms and ammunition to maintain a status of independence" from their own government.

title: Obama Crying Like a Psychopath Meme
subtitle: Body language expert Lillian Glass said a popular meme misconstrued one of her quotes and made assertions that aren't credible or ethical.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: According to a body language expert, a photograph of President Obama crying reveals he is a psychopath.

title: FALSE: Submarine Abandoned in Desert
subtitle: A photograph showing an abandoned submarine in a desert is a composite of two images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an abandoned submarine in a desert.

title: What Does Koko the Gorilla Know About Climate Change?
subtitle: A PSA featuring a gorilla signing a warning to humans about climate change is essentially nothing more than a staged commercial.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows Koko the gorilla spontaneously using sign language to issue a warning about climate change.

title: FALSE: Michele Bachmann on Solar Power
subtitle: Michele Bachmann did not say that solar energy drains the sun of heat.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michele Bachmann said that solar power drains the sun of heat.

title: Is Hippopotamus Milk Pink?
subtitle: Hippopotamus milk, along with flamingo eggs, is on the list of natural things claimed to be pink.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hippopotamuses are the only animals that produce naturally pink milk.

title: FALSE: Ammon Bundy Compared Himself To Rosa Parks
subtitle: A Twitter user claiming to be Ammon Bundy posted a message comparing the takeover of a government building in Oregon with the civil rights movement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ammon Bundy posted a message on Twitter comparing himself to Rosa Parks.

title: Did Officers in Georgia Kill Over 250 People?
subtitle: The humor in a parody post on Facebook was lost on many who don't watch a popular zombie-themed television series.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Two police officers in Georgia cumulatively killed more than 250 people and remain at large.

title: New Year's Eve Vodka Butt Shots Riot
subtitle: No, a woman didn't cause a New Year's Eve riot due to an unfortunate discharge during a series of "vodka butt shots."
author: Kim LaCapria
