statement: A riot broke out after a woman accidentally defecated while administering "vodka butt shots" on New Year's Eve.

title: FALSE: President Obama Pardons Bill Cosby
subtitle: No, Bill Cosby has not received a pardon for "all current and future charges."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill Cosby has received a pardon from President Obama for all "current and future" sexual assault charges.

title: False: Obama Said Gun Laws Will Eliminate Crime
subtitle: Contrary to a circulating rumor, President Obama never said that more gun laws will eliminate crime.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama said that "if we pass more gun laws, crime will go away."

title: Coins in Car Door Theft Warning
subtitle: There has been no rash of car or property thefts due to nickels or pennies jammed in door handles, and car experts say that warnings about them are implausible.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Criminals are furtively wedging coins into car door handles in order to more easily break into vehicles.

title: Chevy Chase Death Hoax
subtitle: Actor/comedian Chevy Chase did not die of a heart attack in January 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chevy Chase died of a heart attack on 4 January 2016.

title: FALSE: Michael Jordan Lowers Price of Air Jordan Shoes to $19.99
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Michael Jordan was dropping the price of all Air Jordan shoes to $19.99.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Jordan will drop the price of all Air Jordan shoes to $19.99 in 2017.

title: Bill Cosby Suicide Hoax
subtitle: Bill Cosby did not kill himself in response to being criminally convicted of sexual assault.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Comedian Bill Cosby committed suicide after he was charged and convicted of sexual assault.

title: Did Archaeologists Dig Up an 800-Year-Old Alien Cellphone?
subtitle: A picture of an ancient cellphone supposedly unearthed by archaeologists was just a photograph of a modern replica.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Archaeologists dug up an 800-year-old alien cellphone in Austria.

title: Fake Clint Eastwood Quote
subtitle: A fake quote attributed to Clint Eastwod started circulating around the internet in November 2015.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Clint Eastwood said that Americans should be less concerned about offending each other and more concerned about offending god.

title: Was Bill Cosby's Hollywood Walk of Fame Star Removed?
subtitle: A photograph of maintenance on Bill Cosby's Hollywood 'Walk of Fame' star led to rumors that the plaque was to be removed.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph depicts the removal of Bill Cosby's Hollywood "Walk of Fame" Star.

title: Did a Shark Attack on a Missouri Highway?
subtitle: A creative photograph depicting a shark attacking a motorist on a Missouri highway went viral in December 2015.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a shark attacking a car on a flooded highway in Missouri.

title: Deleted Tamir Rice Photo
subtitle: A circulating photograph of a young man holding what appeared to be two guns did not depict Tamir Rice.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph depicts 12-year-old shooting victim Tamir Rice brandishing what appears to be two guns.

title: Is This Man Surfing with a Whale?
subtitle: Photobombing is seemingly an activity not limited to terrestrial mammals.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man surfing with a whale.

title: Muslims Stealing Propane at Home Depot?
subtitle: A photograph of indeterminate origin doesn't depict Muslims "buying or stealing" propane tanks in Miami.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts Muslim men buying or stealing propane tanks at a Miami Home Depot.

title: Obama Begins Confiscating Guns by Force
subtitle: A vague, viral blog post claimed that President Obama had begun "confiscating guns by force," then went on to describe nothing of the sort.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama has started confiscating guns "by force."

title: Did Ted Yoho Say African-Americans Should Get Only 3/5ths of a Vote?
subtitle: Yoho's "radical ideas about voting" do not include this one, fortunately.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Congressman Ted Yoho said that African-Americans should get only 3/5ths of a vote.

title: Ted Cruz Doesn't Want to 'Netflix and Chill' with You
subtitle: A fake promotion to "Netflix and Chill" with Ted Cruz has been circulated via Twitter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: GOP presidential candidate Ted Cruz ran a "Netflix and Chill" contest on his campaign web site.

title: FALSE: Jalal Brother Shot While Filming Prank
subtitle: A fake news story claimed that one of the YouTube pranksters was shot while filming.
author: Dan Evon
statement: One of the Jalal Brothers was shot while filming a prank video.

title: FALSE: Donald Trump Removed From Primary Ballots
subtitle: A fake news article claimed that Donald Trump was removed from GOP primary ballots in five states.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump was removed from GOP primary ballots in five states.

title: You're a Racist, Charlie Brown?
subtitle: A closer look at some allegations of racism supposedly displayed in the comic strip 'Peanuts.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph of Franklin, the one black character on 'Peanuts,' sitting alone on Thanksgiving documents that the creator of 'Peanuts' was racist.

title: An Asteroid Will Not
on Christmas Eve
subtitle: Irresponsible headlines suggested that Asteroid 2003 SD220 might either hit Earth or cause major earthquakes in December 2015.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An asteroid will hit earth on Christmas Eve.

title: Donald Trump Drops White House Bid?
subtitle: Satirical news, but not real news, reported that Donald Trump dropped out of the presidential race.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump suspended his presidential campaign in December 2015.

title: Lindsey Graham Didn't Badmouth Republicans
subtitle: Lindsey Graham did not badmouth the Republican Party after dropping out of the 2016 presidential race.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Lindsey Graham badmouthed the Republican Party after suspending his 2016 presidential campaign.

title: A Fake Tweet from Donald Trump
subtitle: A viral anti-immigration tweet purportedly issued by Donald Trump is a fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump tweeted that his "grandparents didn't come to America" to see the country taken over by immigrants.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Say Democratic Voters Are Stupid?
subtitle: A quote from Hillary Clinton about Democratic voters' being 'stupid' and 'easy to manipulate' is a fabricated one.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hillary Clinton said that Democratic voters are 'stupid' and  'easy to manipulate.'

title: FALSE: Teen Hector Cruz Contracts Herpes from Condom Challenge
subtitle: No, a teenager didn't contract the herpes virus by filling a used condom with water and then dropping it on his head.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A teenager named Hector Cruz contracted herpes by participating in the "condom challenge" social media trend.

title: Are Refugees Spreading Disease in the U.S.?
subtitle: No, Syrian refugees aren't bringing a flesh-eating disease into the United States.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Syrian refugees are bringing a communicable flesh-eating disease into the United States.

title: Was Barack Obama a Black Panther?
subtitle: "Wow! Obama's roots of destabilizing this country go back pretty far ... I didn't realize this."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 1998 photograph shows a young  Barack Obama as a member of the Black Panther Party.

title: Did a Female Killer in Las Vegas Shout 'Allahu Akbar'?
subtitle: A female driver accused of intentionally running down multiple pedestrians in Las Vegas did not shout "Allahu Akbar" during the incident.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A driver in Las Vegas shouted "Allahu Akbar" as she deliberately struck multiple pedestrians with her vehicle, and police have been instructed to suppress that detail of the story.

title: Miss Colombia Didn't Commit Suicide
subtitle: Miss Colombia didn't commit suicide after  the mistake that accidentally crowned her Miss Universe was rectified.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Miss Colombia committed suicide after she the mistaken that accidentally crowned her Miss Universe was rectified.

title: FALSE: Idaho Governor C.L. Otter Calls Poor People Genetically Inferior
subtitle: Idaho Governor Clement Leroy "Butch" Otter did not say that poor people are genetically inferior.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Idaho Governor Clement Leroy "Butch" Otter said that poor people were genetically inferior to rich people.

title: FALSE: Obama Gives San Bernardino Terrorists Islamic Funeral
subtitle: The federal government may have provided some security at the burials of the San Bernardino shooters, but President Obama didn't "scramble" to make their funeral arrangements.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama "scrambled" to ensure a proper Islamic burial for the San Bernardino shooters.

title: FALSE: Star Wars Fan Beaten For Sharing Spoilers
subtitle: A Star Wars fan was not beaten up for spoiling the new movie at a theater.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A fan was beaten up by moviegoers after spoiling the new Star Wars movie.

title: FALSE: Piglet Removed from Disney Stores
subtitle: A fake news article claims that Disney removed  items featuring Piglet from their stores due to pressure from the Muslim community.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Disney has removed  items featuring Piglet from their stores due to pressure from the Muslim community.

title: What Are the Toughest Splits in Bowling?
subtitle: Statistically speaking, the infamous 7-10 split is not bowling's toughest.
author: Stephanie Larsen
statement: The 7-10 split is the toughest split in bowling.

title: FALSE: Paul LePage Quote on Homeless People
subtitle: Governor Paul LePage did not say that the "worst possible thing" you can do for the homeless is to offer them food and shelter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Governor Paul LePage said that the "worst possible thing" you can do for the homeless is to offer them food and shelter.

title: Newt Gingrich Tweeted About San Bernardino Attack in November
subtitle: Newt Gingrich almost certainly wasn't referencing the San Bernardino shooting in a 13 November 2015 tweet.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Newt Gingrich tweeted about the 2 December 2015 San Bernardino shooting on 13 November 2015.

title: Ted Cruz Literally Talks to God?
subtitle: Ted Cruz never said that he "literally" talks to God.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz said that he literally talks to God.

title: IKEA Is Selling a Swastika-Shaped Table
subtitle: A photograph of a swastika-shaped table actually captures the work a Berlin-based artist and not an actual IKEA furniture product.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The IKEA furniture chain is selling a swastika-shaped table.

title: FALSE: Muslims Declare December 24th an Islamic Holiday
subtitle: No, Muslims didn't recently decide to reschedule their celebration of the birth of the Prophet Mohammed in order to disrupt Christmas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Muslims recently decided to celebrate the birth of the Prophet Mohammed on 24 December (Christmas Eve) in order to preempt Christmas.

title: Is This the Darkest Baby in the World?
subtitle: This infant is a real doll.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows "the darkest baby in the world."

title: Does a Single Volcanic Eruption Release as Much CO2 As All of Humanity Has to Date?
subtitle: No matter how you look at it, the amount of carbon dioxide emitted by volcanoes is significantly lower than the amount emitted by anthropogenic sources on human timescales.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A single eruption from a volcano puts 10,000 times more carbon dioxide into the atmosphere than all of human activity has throughout history.

title: Missouri Propane Tank Bomb Terror Warning
subtitle: An FBI agent has not quietly warned a Missouri sheriff's department that a propane bomb attack is expected around Christmas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An FBI field agent quietly warned a Missouri sheriff's department that a propane bomb attack is expected around Christmas.

title: Cookie Dough Explodes During Shoplifting Incident
subtitle: Fake news site rips off a hoary urban legend to create a clickbait fake news story.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A can of cookie dough exploded inside a woman's vagina during a shoplifting incident at Walmart.

title: Chemtrails Switch Photo
subtitle: A photograph of a chemtrails switch is fake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a chemtrail switch on a plane.

title: Charlie Brown Christmas 'Christian Content' Warnings
subtitle: No, the Charlie Brown Christmas special didn't air with "Christian content warnings."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: ABC Family aired "Christian content warnings" before "A Charlie Brown Christmas."

title: FALSE: Pope Francis Shares Instagram Selfie
subtitle: No, Pope Francis did not upload a selfie to Instagram.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pope Francis uploaded a selfie to the Vatican's Instagram account.

title: Has the NFL Fined Cam Newton $253,552 for Giving Away Footballs?
subtitle: Rumor holds that Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton is penalized thousands of dollars by the NFL every time he hands a football to a fan in the stands.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton has been fined a total of $253, 552 for giving away footballs to fans.

title: Has ISIS Issued a Fatwa to Kill Puppies?
subtitle: No, ISIS has not issued a fatwa vowing to kill American puppies.
author: Dan Evon
statement: ISIS has issued a fatwa to kill American puppies.

title: FALSE: President Obama Scores 102 on IQ Test, Lowest in Presidential History
subtitle: Fake news reports that President Obama achieved the lowest IQ score among all U.S. presidents of the last 100 years.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama achieved the lowest IQ score among all U.S. presidents of the last 100 years.

title: FALSE: Judge Calls U.S. Marshals, FBI to Arrest the President and Congress
subtitle: No, an Alaskan judge hasn't called upon U.S. Marshals and the FBI to arrest Congress and the President.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A judge has called for the FBI and U.S. Marshals to arrest the President.

title: Crosseyed Man Strangles Girlfriend
subtitle: No, a visually impaired man didn't strangle his girlfriend for failing to make eye contact with him.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A visually impaired man strangled his girlfriend because she was unable to make eye contact with him.

title: Did Stanley Kubrick Fake the Moon Landings?
subtitle: Various edits of this infamous 'interview' have been circulating for years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Stanley Kubrick admitted in an interview that he helped NASA fake the U.S. moon landings.

title: Has California Banned .45 ACP Ammunition?
subtitle: No, California has not banned a popular type of ammunition.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: California has banned a popular type of ammunition, the .45 ACP.

title: FALSE: El Chapo Threatens ISIS
subtitle: Contrary to multiple news reports, Mexican drug cartel leader El Chapo has not threatened to wage war against ISIS.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Mexican drug cartel leader Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman has threatened to wage war against ISIS.

title: Image Problem
subtitle: Rumors claimed lawyers for Tashfeen Malik (and an MSNBC host) discouraged publishing images of her face because doing so was offensive to Muslims.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A lawyer for Tashfeen Malik asked the media not to show photographs of her face because doing so was offensive to Muslims, and MSNBC host Melissa Harris-Perry criticized the New York Times for publishing such pictures.

title: FALSE: Oprah Winfrey Pregnant with First Child at 61
subtitle: Talk show host Oprah Winfrey did not announce that she was pregnant with her first child at age 61.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Talk show host Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61.

title: President Obama with ISIS Leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi
subtitle: President Obama was not photographed holding a rocket launcher in a car with ISIS leader Abu Bakr Al-Baghdadi.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Obama holding a rocket launcher in a car with Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

title: Has the Legal Drinking Age Been Raised to 23?
subtitle: The legal drinking age has not been raised to 23.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The legal drinking age has been raised to 23.

title: Is Donald Trump Related to Adolf Hitler?
subtitle: Not everything and everyone having to do with Germany is meaningfully connected to Hitler.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump is directly related to Adolf Hitler.

title: Jimmy Carter's Cancer Cured by Marijuana?
subtitle: Former president Jimmy Carter did not say that his cancer was cured by medical marijuana.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jimmy Carter said that medical marijuana cured his cancer.

title: Trump Disqualified from Being President?
subtitle: Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified from running for President due to his comments about Muslims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump has been disqualified from running for President due to his comments about Muslims.

title: Will quoting the Bible be made illegal in Cincinnati?
subtitle: Quoting the Bible will not soon become illegal in Cincinnati.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Quoting the Bible will become illegal in Cincinnati as of 9 December 2015.

title: Did More Mass Shootings Take Place Under Obama Than Any Other President?
subtitle: The claim that vastly more mass shootings have taken place during President Obama's administration than that of any other recent President is a false one based on a double standard.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Vastly more mass shootings have taken place during President Obama's administration than that of any other recent President.

title: Was a Homeless Couple Found Living in a Walmart Attic?
subtitle: Be wary of memes with unsourced mug shots.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Two homeless people were found living in the attic of a Walmart in Tennessee.

title: CDC Warns Hair Bands from China Made of Used Condoms
subtitle: The Centers for Disease Control did not issue a warning concerning used condoms being repurposed as hairbands.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Centers for Disease Control have issued a warning concerning used condoms being repurposed as hairbands.

title: Obama Fines ABC for Charlie Brown Christmas?
subtitle: Neither President Obama nor the FCC fined ABC for airing "A Charlie Brown Christmas" because it was offensive to non-Christians.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama and the FCC fined ABC for airing A Charlie Brown Christmas because it was offensive to non-Christians.

title: Did Michelle Obama Say 'White Folks Are What's Wrong with America'?
subtitle: "If black folks and white folks could fight together, and fly together, then surely they could eat at a lunch counter together."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michelle Obama said that "white folks are what's wrong with America" during a commencement speech at Tuskegee University.

title: Did Donald Trump's Campaign Unveil a Swastika-Like Logo?
subtitle: Not quite the "best, most luxurious, and most expensive logo that any campaign could have."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's presidential campaign unveiled a new logo resembling a swastika.

title: Is This a Picture of a Fisherman and a 102-Pound Shrimp?
subtitle: Once again, a hoax on the Internet came to be taken as credible as if it had been proved true with rigor and professionalism.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph captures a 102-lb. shrimp caught near Homosassa, Florida.

title: Farting Burns 67 Calories?
subtitle: Contrary to Internet search engine wisdom, farting does not burn 67 calories and is not a practical weight loss mechanism.
author: Dan Evon
statement: One fart burns 67 calories.

title: 41-Lb. Rat Caught in New York City?
subtitle: A photograph of a "41-lb. rat caught in New York City" probably features an ordinary rat made to seem larger through forced perspective.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a 41-lb caught in New York City.

title: Did Campbell's Soup Insult a Customer Who Complained About a Commercial?
subtitle: A customer on the company's Facebook page expressed her views on same-sex unions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The official Campbell's customer service Facebook account insulted a customer after she complained about the brand's commercial featuring two dads.

title: Racist Abe
subtitle: A photograph showing a protester holding a sign reading "Lincoln Was Racist" is fake.
author: Dan Evon

title: Does This Video Show Women Drinking Helium-Infused Wine?
subtitle: Proper serving etiquette requires that it first be decanted into a balloon.
author: Dan Evon

title: Japan Keeps Islam at Bay?
subtitle: Contrary to a popular meme, Japan has not "kept Islam at bay" by enforcing strict laws on Muslims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Japan has kept Islam at bay by enforcing strict laws on Muslims.

title: War on Christmas Stamps
subtitle: Religious-themed Christmas stamps are still available for purchase from the United States Postal Service.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The United States Postal Service will stop selling religion-based Christmas stamps in 2016.

title: Did President Obama Ban the Military from Using the Word 'Christmas'?
subtitle: A 2013 issue over a U.S. Army "Christmas football tournament" mutated into the false claim that President Obama had banned the military from using the word "Christmas."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Obama issued an order banning U.S. military personnel from using the word "Christmas."

title: Christian Anti-Masturbation's Mascot
Arrested for Public Masturbation?
subtitle: Fappy the Anti-Masturbation Dolphin was not arrested for swimming naked at SeaWorld, because such a mascot does not exist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An anti-masturbation mascot named Fappy the Dolphin was arrested for swimming naked with dolphins at a SeaWorld park.

title: Will the Rumblr App Help You Find Street-Fighting Opponents?
subtitle: Once again the Daily Mail was duped by publicity grifters, this time ones hawking Rumblr, a purported Tinder-like street fighting app.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Rumblr mobile app enables users to find locals with whom they may arrange street fights.

title: Did the History Channel Document the Capture of a Bigfoot?
subtitle: The History Channel did capture the audience's appetite for fake 'documentaries.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: The History Channel aired a documentary that showed a Bigfoot creature being captured.

title: Jennifer Aniston Reunites Homeless 15-Year-old with Her Parents
subtitle: A viral Facebook post claiming that actress Jennifer Aniston once reunited a homeless teenage mother with her parents is misattributed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jennifer Aniston once reconnected a homeless 15-year-old single mother with her parents.

title: Are These Real Female Bodybuilders?
subtitle: Two extremely muscle-bound women in skimpy swimsuits.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two extremely muscular female bodybuilders.

title: Is the Earth's Rotation Changing Zodiac Signs?
subtitle: Whether or not you believe horoscopes are worthwhile, Ophiuchus won't be disrupting our astrological zodiac any time soon.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The zodiac is about to change to include a "new" star sign, Ophiuchus.

title: Are These Photographs of a 'Hunter's Moon'?
subtitle: A Hunter's Moon doesn't create the illusion of two suns, isn't a miracle, and occurs annually.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Photographs depict a rare "Hunter's Moon," a phenomenon that creates the appearance of two suns in the sky.

title: Steve Jobs Deathbed Speech
subtitle: Apple co-founder Steve Jobs did not leave behind a deathbed warning about how the "non-stop pursuit of wealth will only turn a person into a twisted being, just like me."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Apple co-founder Steve Jobs left behind a deathbed essay about how the "non-stop pursuit of wealth will only turn a person into a twisted being, just like me."

title: Conspiracy Weary
subtitle: A bizarre theory claiming that singer Avril Lavigne was replaced by a doppelganger after she killed herself was started as a joke on a Brazilian web site.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Singer Avril Lavigne died and was replaced by a doppelganger.

title: Was Belakwa, New York, Abandoned Due to Hydrofracking?
subtitle: There is no town of Belakwa, New York, and a sign lamenting its abandonment due to fracking was part of an art installation.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A sign marks the location of the now-abandoned town of Belakwa, New York, rendered uninhabitable due to hydrofracking.

title: The War on Christmas Cups
subtitle: While the 2015 Starbucks Holiday Cups feature a plain red design and no Christmas symbols, this is not proof that the coffee chain has an anti-Christian attitude.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The coffee chain Starbucks removed all mentions of Christmas from their red holiday cups because "they hate Jesus."

title: Labor Pains
subtitle: Wisconsin governor Scott Walker did not say that Labor Day should be replaced with Patriots Day.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Wisconsin governor Scott Walker said that Labor Day should be replaced with Patriots Day.

title: Was a UFO Photographed Over Memphis?
subtitle: A UFO supposedly photographed over Memphis, Tennessee, by several different people was actually sci-fi fan art.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of photographs show a UFO photographed over Memphis by several different people.

title: Triton 'Tankless' Scuba Mask - Real or Vaporware?
subtitle: A fund-raising campaign for the Triton mask that will supposedly allow divers to breathe underwater without the use of air tanks was withdrawn.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Triton Scuba Mask allows people to breathe underwater without the use of air tanks.

title: Does This Cow Have an 'Optical Illusion' on Its Face?
subtitle: An image appearing to show the profile view of two human faces on a cow's face has its origins all the way back to the year 2007.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an "optical illusion" with markings on a cow's face that resemble two people in profile.

title: Secret Sisters Gift Exchange
subtitle: A "Secret Sister" gift exchange scheme spread via social media promises windfalls it can't deliver.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: By participating in a Facebook "secret sister" gift exchange, you'll receive 36 gifts, books, or bottles of wine in exchange for one $10-15 contribution.

title: Was 'Little Timmy Salutes the Flag' Banned by Facebook?
subtitle: Facebook  supposedly removed a photograph of "little Timmy" saluting the U.S. flag due to complaints from non-Americans.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Facebook removed an image of "Little Timmy" saluting the United States flag because "non-Americans" found it offensive.

title: Do In-N-Out Cups Contain 'Hail Satan' Messages?
subtitle: A digitally manipulated photograph purportedly shows that the In-N-Out Burger chain printed "Hail Satan" on their beverage cups.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the phrase "Hail Satan" printed on the bottom of a cup from the In-N-Out Burger chain.

title: Did Trump Say Africans Are
subtitle: Several African web sites claimed Donald Trump had described black people as lazy and prone to crime.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump said Africans are "lazy fools only good at eating, lovemaking and thuggery."

title: Pope Francis Endorses Bernie Sanders for President
subtitle: The pontifical Academy of Social Sciences invited Bernie Sanders to a conference at the Vatican, but he hasn't publicly endorsed Sanders for president.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pope Francis has endorsed Bernie Sanders for President.

title: Do NASA Photographs Show Deforestation in North America?
subtitle: Popular NASA photographs purportedly highlighting the dramatic effects of deforestation in North America actually show the Earth in different seasons.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Two photographs of the earth taken by NASA in 1978 and 2012 document the dramatic effects of deforestation in North America.

title: 'Jake from State Farm' Death Hoax
subtitle: Reports that "Jake from State Farm" of insurance commercial fame had been murdered by his wife were fake news.
author: Dan Evon

title: Woman Arrested for Masturbating with Jimmy Dean Sausage in Walmart Bathroom
subtitle: Fake news reports a woman was busted for pleasuring herself in a Walmart restroom with a meat product.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman was arrested at a WalMart store for masturbating with a sausage.

title: Are Johnny Bravo and Powerpuff Girls Films on the Way?

statement: The body of a homeless man found behind a Jamaica fast food restaurant was identified as that of Bob Marley.

title: Responsible Drinking in Ireland
subtitle: Does a photograph show a sign in Ireland that promotes drinking and driving?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 1972 sign warned Irish motorists not to drive after having five pints of beer.

title: Did a 'Gun-Toting Granny' Shoot Two Rapists' Testicles Off?
subtitle: Reports that an Australian grandmother blew the testicles off the two men who raped her granddaughter are fake news.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A gun-toting Australian granny blew the testicles off the two men who raped her granddaughter.

title: Scientist Missing for Over 20 Years Found Living Inside Secret LSD Drug Lab Hidden in Basement
subtitle: Fake news reports that a scientist missing for over 20 years was found living in a secret drug lab in a Minnesota couple's basement.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A scientist missing for over 20 years was found living in a secret drug lab in a Minnesota couple's basement.

title: Is Ice Water Dangerous for Dogs?
subtitle: Giving your dog ice or ice water on a hot day is not likely to cause your pet to die from bloating and spasms.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Giving your dog ice or ice water on a hot day is likely to cause your pet to die from bloating and spasms.

title: Man Catches Furry Trout in Wisconsin?
subtitle: Neither furry trout nor photographs of them are real phenomena.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photograph shows a fisherman in Wisconsin holding a furry trout he'd caught.

title: Are Crabs Imported from China Injected with Formalin?
subtitle: "When buying crabs in the market look for injection marks such as these when buying crabs imported from China."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs document crabs imported from China that have been injected with formalin.

title: Did a Tentacled Creature Appear in a Tornado?
subtitle: A photograph snapped during a tornado seemingly shows a Cthulhu-like tentacled figure in the sky.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A photograph snapped during a tornado shows a Cthulhu-like tentacled figure in the sky.

title: Are These Giant Human Skulls Real?
subtitle: A photograph reportedly shows giant humanoid skulls exposed by an earthquake or torrential rains.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows giant humanoid skulls exposed by an earthquake or torrential rains.

title: Social Security as 'Federal Benefit Payments'

author: David Mikkelson
statement: Social Security retirement disbursements have recently been reclassified as 'federal benefit payments.'

title: Was a 15 Year Old Who 'SWATTED' Gamer Convicted of Domestic Terrorism?
subtitle: Fake news reports that a teenager was given a 25-year prison sentence for a prank known as 'swatting.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A teenager was given a 25-year prison sentence for a prank known as "swatting."

statement: Yoko Ono confirmed that she had an affair with Hillary Clinton in the 1970s.

title: Dianne Feinstein 'Gunman' Quote

author: David Mikkelson
statement: Senator Dianne Feinstein said "when the gunman realizes that nobody else is armed, he will lay down his weapons and turn himself in, that's human nature."

title: Mother's Day Facebook Warning
subtitle: Crime alert warns that mothers who post their children's names, birth dates, and birth weights on Facebook for Mother's Day are exposing their children to scammers and criminals.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Mothers who post their children's names, birth dates, and birth weights on Facebook for Mother's Day are exposing their children to scammers and criminals.

title: FDA Approves Tranquilizer Dart Guns That Puts Kids to Sleep
subtitle: Fake news site reports the FDA has approved the sale of a new tranquilizer dart gun intended to put children to sleep.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A new tranquilizer dart gun on the market is designed to put children to sleep.

title: Was a Couple Arrested for Selling Golden Tickets to Heaven?

author: Dan Evon
statement: Two people in Florida were arrested for selling golden tickets to heaven.

title: Is a Couple Having Sex in Front of Their Kids to Teach Them Where Babies Come From?
subtitle: A couple supposedly announced they have sex in front of their children to teach their existing kids how babies are born.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A couple announced they have sex in front of their children to show them where babies come from.

title: Is a Vintage Pearl Harbor Color Photograph Real?
subtitle: A 'vintage color photograph' from 1941 showing the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor was actually taken from a Hollywood film made several decades later.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Vintage color photograph from 1941 shows the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

title: Can a Bug Crawl in Your Ear and into Your Brain?

author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bugs crawl into a person's ear, make their home there, then slowly eat their way through the brain.

title: Did President Obama Cancel the National Day of Prayer?

author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama has cancelled the National Day of Prayer.

statement: A Disney cartoon shows Mickey Mouse using an unusual method to make Swiss cheese.

statement: Actor Michael J. Fox chose the middle name 'Jello' for himself when he was a child.

statement: An official scorecard from the Mayweather-Pacquiao prizefight documents that the real outcome was reversed.

author: David Mikkelson

title: Bette Davis Landed Her Biggest Role After Posting an Ad in a Newspaper?
subtitle: Bette Davis is rumored to have landed her role in 'What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?' through placing an ad in a Hollywood publication seeking employment as an actress.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bette Davis landed her role in

author: Snopes Staff

author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video depicts Mike Brown assaulting an elderly man over a stolen backpack.

author: David Mikkelson
statement: ISIS members are operating a camp near El Paso and have been arrested trying to cross the U.S.-Mexico border.

statement: The FDA recently discovered that the Arizona Beverage Company uses human urine in many of their products.

statement: Alex Malarkey, protagonist of the book

statement: A photograph shows a Southeast African monkey from Madagascar.

author: David Mikkelson
statement: An unusually high percentage of the child actors who starred in the

title: Hoaxes and Misinformation About Snopes.com

author: David Mikkelson
statement: The CEO of Snopes.com has been arrested, amidst other "scandals" involving the fact-checking site.

statement: Photograph shows a long-exposure shot of lightning striking a tree.

author: David Mikkelson

comes from cats being sold as pigs or sailors being whipped for transgressions.
